kmjjhecXZQ50JgYtiiZ1Ag.text: We been wanting to try this place for awhile and finally got the opportunity to on Friday night after the show. The wait wasn't horrible. Thanks to the player card. However, the wait for the waiter to take our drink order was about 15 minutes. He did recommended us to order an appetizer because the wait for the entrees will be a while. So we did order a sweet corn dip. The dip was good but the popcorn topping was so stale. Did mention it to the waiter. And all he say was I'm sorry you didn't like it and took it away. Our entrees did arrived about 20 minutes later. I got the hell kitchen burger and my husband got an ultimate burger and truffle fries. The fries was big enough to share. Unfortunately, it was cold. You can see that the fries was made ahead of time and just sitting under the heat lamp for way too long. Would not recommend ordering the fries unless you really want cold hard fries and paying between $8-$12 for it. The burger was really good. So if you are looking for a good thick patty burger. I would recommend you trying this place. But remember to have at least 2 hours or so to spare. You can't just walk in and out in 30 minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet corn dip.

aB5yZwGQ7AURn7NljCicwQ.text: The burgers and shakes here are always dope. I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger. The meat was cooked how I requested it (med-rare). The fries sauces were great. Some of my fries came out a little soggy but it's alright since it was only a couple of them, nothing I would cry about. I also ordered the Brown Butter Caramel Pecan Shake. I always order one to-go so I can sip on it while wandering the Strip since the drink is pretty chilled and the weather is hot. Every time I go to Vegas, I always make it a point to eat here, I never miss out on the great burger.  I am not a professional food critic or chef but I do enjoy good burgers. This is always on the top of my list as #1 burger. I highly recommend you also reserve a table in advance since it's always crowded in here. If you are coming solo, lunch time you can probably find a bar spot without reserving (up to around 2pm) but afternoon, evening, and night times require a reservation to get in quickly.

jmixmAaHYmiz1zVmrtNz3A.text: The food was great. The service once we in was also great. The Hostess plays games, which almost kept me from posting how great the food was. The Forest burger with truffle fries, share it, you can't go wrong.

y81zOl8VBH5hfK0mFBwCJA.text: As someone who's tried Shake Shack, In N Out, other family/private owned burger joints and restaurants, hands down I can say Ramsay burger is definitely worth trying more so than Shake Shack.  My breakdown for the 5 star and the suggestion to get it over Shake Shack is as follows:  Service (4.5) Its a dine in with server style so of course you dont have to self serve like you would at Shake Shack. The server I had was pretty friendly and attentive during the whole time.   Drinks (4.5) While Shake Shack does serve beer, Ramsay Burger has a lot more options and varieties including cock tails and wines. I tried their Irish Mule which was apparently the most popular drink on the cock tails selection. It was as how the server described it, not too sweet but not too overwhelmingly strong. I believe she told me it was composed of jameson, some beer, probably syrup and lime.   Burger (4.5) I tried the Hell's Kitchen which seemed to be composed of provolone, patty, avocado, jalapeno and tomato. Yes the burger was on the pricey side of $15 without fries but shake Shacks burgers all average around $9-11 as well. For the quality of the beef patty and the structure of the burger, I d say this was worth it.   Fries (4.5) Ordered the parmesan truffle fries which came with two sauce. One reminded me of honey mustard flavor and the other close to marinara sauce like taste. But it was surprisingly very good as the parmesan grits and the fries texture blended very well together. It was around $9-10 which once again like the burger, is on the pricey side but its big enough to share between two people. So its not a bad deal at the end of it.   Overall, my friend and I were both pleased with Ramsays burger and did not regret not going to Shake Shack.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZAvGaTet1CivPIVrTNZ-tQ.text: Probably top 3 burgers I've ever had in my life. Yes they're gourmet, no they aren't fast food prices, yes it's on the Las Vegas strip meaning it's busy so you will wait a bit. It's definitely worth the line. If you get the chance to visit Vegas (or live here), treat yourself to a burger here. It's truly one of the best ever!

Efix97DhTOl9BnQyO7KveA.text: Looked forward in trying Gordon's burger restaurant. Was it the best burger I have ever had? Nope. It was perfectly cooked (medium well) and very juicy. Cheese was fresh and a nice bun. Homemade ketchup was a nice touch. Onion rings were excellent. We left still feeling a little hungry as the burger size was on the smaller side. Service was outstanding!!!  Two burgers, onion rings and an ice tea came to $60 including tip. If you do want the best burger The Burger Bar at Mandalay Bay is the best anywhere and at half the price.

8jMaYiAYx9HaSncA8uA3IQ.text: YES YES YES!!!!!  We had one of the best restaurant experiences that we have ever had in Vegas! We loved it so much, we ate here for majority of our vacation.   Just about everything you need to know:  Gordon Ramsay Burger is located in the Planet Hollywood Hotel & Casino Resort. He has several restaurants in multiple hotels so don't get confused! When you arrive to Burger, you have to wait in a line to get in. We got lucky with the times that we went and didn't have to wait in line very long but it does get packed so be prepared to wait! The hostesses were so nice and friendly and made us feel so welcome. It was really cool that one of the hostesses remembered us and welcomed us back.   The restaurant is a nice size and the atmosphere is really cool. They do not tolerate drunk and obnoxious guests which was really refreshing!  Service: On both occasions that we went, we had TERRIFIC service! Both of our servers were very knowledgeable of the menu and checked up on us multiple times during our dinner. One employee who really stood out to us was the busser Caleb. Caleb was absolutely a joy to see on both of our trips to Burger. He was one of the kindest employees at a restaurant that we have ever encountered. He deserves a promotion, raise, or something. Just watching him take pride in his job and smile at every table was so refreshing.   Food: YUM!!! Over the course of 2 visits, I had the "Hell's Kitchen Burger", the "Backyard Burger", "Beer Battered Onion Rings", "Kettle Chip Nachos", and "Truffle Parmesan Fries". Everything was PHENOMENAL, except the Fries. They were not as great as I think they could have been but everything else made up for it. Make sure you request your burger to be cooked the way you like it. They normally make it "Medium" which is a bit too pink for me.   Prices: I think the prices are spot on. The price is definitely worth the food.  Overall, This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. I highly recommend it and we will definitely be making it a tradition to come here at least once when we come to Vegas.  I hope this review helps you decide on where to get a delicious "Burger" when you come to Vegas!!!! :)

tg5xK4A5VrQ68DZTQihl6A.text: First, you give the hostess your number and they will text you when you're up. You have 10 minutes to get back. Great idea!  I got a turkey burger with fries and onion rings.  Burger patty was delicious but the bread was so forgettable. The patty itself had that smoky over flames on the grill flavor and was quite moist. Fries were subpar; I've definitely had better.  Onion rings were a dream. They are thick, juicy, flavorful, and addicting. Covered in parmesan cheese, I couldn't get enough. The ranch was amazing too as it is made with little bits of cheese that compliment the onion rings perfectly.  Service was good. Our waiter actually suggested that instead of us each getting our own fries, we share as there quite large. He was right. Thanks for the tip!

When I arrived (around 12:45 PM on a Monday) there was only 1 couple ahead of me in line. Still, it took them over 20 minutes to seat me. Then, when the waitress arrived at my table, I ordered both my burger and beverage together. It took about 30 minutes for the food to arrive. The waitress did a good job keeping an eye on me as I waited. The food was good, but I didn't feel it was phenomenal or exceptional. For me, not a strong reason to return.

Who knew something as simple as a burger could could have so many flavors just inside the meat. The burger was cooked perfectly and raised my standards to what a good burger is!

I never met a person other than chef who knows the food science like Ryan, he understood very well what choice of ingredients will bring out the best taste in burger.

X49s5oX63zTQ8abZ0NkTdQ.text: Waited in line for almost 2 hours and ultimately it was not worth the wait.  Wasted 3 hours and 200.00+ dollars. Waiter was fabulous. Food and drinks were not. Lobster and shrimp burger was fishy and mushy and not good. Did not eat any of my pork burger as it was like eating a piece of rubber. Fries were just ok, nothing special. Drinks were weak. The cheddar ale soup was awesome. Wished we had just gotten soup and nothing else. We are fans of Gordon Ramsey, but will not be visiting this restaurant again. The Gordon Ramsey name is why people flock to his restaurants; we were disappointed that this restaurant did not live up to his name and reputation. We will not be back.

ZCSXK6Orh2MT74h3ok7-zQ.text: This is the second time I have been here. The burgers are SO good! They are totally worth going to the strip for. The first time we went, we ordered a bunch of items to try and we were too full to enjoy our burgers. So this time we only ordered burgers. We REALLY enjoyed the burgers. Juicy and delicious!

dc8hyy1COx-iYSt2vl85MA.text: Mmmmmm talk about tantalizing your taste buds! This place has it all. Fast service and very professional . I enjoyed the  cuisine . The food was so good. I will be back as often as possible. I have lived in Vegas 40 years.

Tcrkgz9TuF0_0f21HDvqVQ.text: We come to Gordon Ramsay Burger every time we're in Vegas because it is dependably good!  The wait can be on the longer end sometimes, but it always worth it because they cook a mean burger.  On my most recent trip, I had the Crown Burger and it was amazing.  I also really love their fries.  The sweet potato come with a delicious honey jalapeno mayo and the regular fries are thick-cut (the best!) and served with curry ketchup (my favorite!).  My one criticism is that their draft beer list is pretty weak.  Otherwise, this place is great.

snJDjlrTyUlAFOg2fx5Cgw.text: Gordon Ramsay gets so much hype that I had to at least try one of his chains. There is the Gordon Ramsay Burger at Planet Hollywood (there's also a Steakhouse, which is super expensive). I walked in thinking I would need to pay $50 for a burger, but it was surprisingly affordable at $16 for my Blue Cheeseburger. I really like the sweet taste to it (not overwhelming, but a tint) and remember you will need to order fries with it if you want. I think the burger itself was enough for me.  After trying the burger, I cannot tell if it's a special GR burger or just a regular homemade burger. Nothing too special but with a GR stamp.   Also, you get to take the menus for souvenirs in case you want it (which I left).

478kcyZHg7CRtLoVyq5qUQ.text: My chicken salad was horrible it had old greasy crunchy things on the four corners.. Tracys hamburger was dry and bad flavor. The water was shit... They could at least filter Vegas water. Truffle fries were the only thing good. The only reason they don't get bad reviews because of the name and it's a tourist spot. Never would suggest or come back.They took the salad off which we asked them not to. 50.00 bucks for a horrible experience. Food took forever and the big question is: Are people really happy to work here or is it just a job?

qfoceb8AZyOJ5qjlNT5EFg.text: My wife and I ordered the Fish Burger... presentation looked great, super friendly staff.. but the fish on BOTH of our burgers smelled of ammonia!  Having never encountered this before we were reluctant to say anything but finally when we just couldn't eat our food we discreetly told the waitress..  and asked for the check..  the manager relayed that "they had never heard of that before"...  and we paid and left.   We didn't make a big deal of it, but we will not be going back.  Researching now it seems that this can happen when fish gets too old to use!  We are big fans of Gordon Ramsey but I wish they would have taken our complaint more seriously..

XzHEaizeidIzfypqWoV35g.text: I'm not a burger fan normally but the burger I got was delicious and the hot wings were delicious and intuitive.  I've never had an easier time eating wings than at Gordan Ramsay's Burger. Service was great and the wait wasn't that long, granted it was lunch time on a Thursday but I would have gladly waited for the chance to eat here.

ozO0FKsHY8LuwXdqbGsy3g.text: The first time I came here a few years ago, I fell in love with their creme brulee shake with chocolate. Then I come here again and try the same shake, but with an oreo base.   My. God.  The burgers here are pretty good, but not really life changing. I remember waiting in line with a group of 8 here awhile ago and it took 1.5 hrs to be seated. I seriously only waited in line because half the group really wanted to try it out. Now I'm older, wiser, and would only wait 30 mins max to dine here. Mostly for that creme brulee milkshake.

fVqe5NipF_b9lJGnHDd3fw.text: Get ready to wait! We started at 5:30 on a Saturday night. It took 30 minutes to be seated. 40 min after ordering we got some warm fries. Another 90 minutes (7:30) we got our burgers.   I had the Curry chicken burger.   The wife has the Hog burger.   During the long wait I counted over 60 staff (that I could see) for around 150 customers. No wonder an order of fries is $12. I would think (based on other establishments) you could produce a burger and fries for your guests in 10-15 minuets. 30 minutes if you made everything to order.   Perhaps Gordon likes to make his customers wait and wait and wait.  I know he has a lot of patience.   I will not be coming back.

b424_yX8MNfX-eMgx3AHSQ.text: I'm a fan of Gordon Ramsay, but I felt like there is a lot of hype surrounding the restaurant. Yes, I understand that he is a world-renowned chef and that he has put time into creating these fancy, unique burger recipes. However, I personally thought my burger was good, but nothing spectacular.  Seating took a while (as expected), which is okay. However, it took us almost 30-40 minutes to receive the food after ordering. I ordered the Hog Burger - mangalitsa pork, mangalitsa bacon, bbq pork, white cheddar, pickles, crispy onion & slaw. The ingredients were fancy and the burger was flavorful. However, the pork was a little too dry for my taste and wasn't really juicy at all. I'd want to order something else next time before deciding if I like/dislike this place.  On the other hand, the Burnt Ends Poutine was good - fries, burnt ends, black pepper gravy, cheddar cheese curds & pickled onions. Incredibly savory and the black pepper gravy was perfect. I enjoyed this much more than my burger..

zFsYfovM2NTtvXSJ-PivsQ.text: When I found out they had a Gordon Ramsay place, I was excited and wanted to check it out no matter what. There are 2 other Gordon Ramsay places in Vegas as well, but they were hard to get in last minute without a reservation. We really wanted to go to the Hell Kitchen one, but we had to settle for the Burger joint. The wait time was huge. ~1.5 to 2 hours. There was a Casino nearby and so we did some gambling after we checked in. You get a message 5 minutes before your table is ready and if you don't report to the front desk within 10 minutes your checkin is None and you have to start all over again. The food was really great and no short of expectation. Everything was clean and the waiter was friendly. We got the wings to share and the wings were totally finger-licking good. I ordered the Ramsay-special burger and it was amazing as well. Overall, the experience was great and the hype wasn't underrated.

FoPLsJNeXhCJ-ouQ5X8ILA.text: I had the time and patience to eat here.  The wait was very well worth it.  The quality was nothing less than perfect.  Gordon Ramsay has set a very high standard that most others won't even try to replicate.   I tried two different burgers,  and they were wonderful.  Very different from each other.  The starters we had were excellent as well.  I wish I had the words to give you a sense of how good it was but I don't.  You've got to try it yourself top know.  It's worth a trip to Vegas. Now I've got to try his other restaurant's.

Qkj5fO3Yxb4j4PhR0Fwmfg.text: This being a Gordon Ramsay place, I held the food to a higher standard than I would ordinarily. I know of the guy, and I know he demands quality and precision. Would he have been in the kitchen that evening, I wouldn't have heard a barrage of profanity, but I would not exclude a bit of yelling.   First, the server I had, Alex I think was his name was awesome. He definitely knew his stuff, and not from a handbook or manual, no, this dude has tried literally everything. The fact that the food took a little longer than I would expect to come out he let me know ahead of time, which was much more appreciated than the "It'll be right out" when guests start to get antsy.   I had ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, cooked medium. Let's start with the good, so it doesn't seem like bashing this place is all I came to do: the flavor from the combination of ingredients was good! The burger wasn't overloaded to the point where you couldn't bite, but everything still came together nicely... or was supposed to.  Now, the not-so-good. If this were some little pub, I would give them more slack. In this case, I expected the same level of precision and quality Mr. Ramsay seems to demand of his chefs.   The meat in the burger was overcooked for what I ordered. Per the server, medium is supposed to have lots of pink. In my case, they had overcooked it, as I got a medium-well, with tiny hidden areas of pink in places. I also found the meat slightly underseasoned, a pinch more salt and pepper would have done this place quite a bit of good.   Then there was the overall execution which I found quite lacking. To me, when I bite into a burger, I'd like to get the same experience with the first bite, last bite, and each one in between. The avocado was more or less evenly dispersed, yet the roasted tomato(es) were very unevenly dispersed. Only a handful of bites got this taste, hence the quotes. As for the jalapeno aioli, it suffers the same problem... it was as if it was slapped on without regard. There was so little of this stuff, I don't even recall tasting it.  I'm hoping the photo I've attached from my meal will at least somewhat corroborate this point.   One of the final points I'd like to make is regarding the fries. If you are here with someone, the portions are great for splitting with a friend or two. However, if you come here alone as I did, the portion of fries it too big for one person. That said, it would be awesome if they had smaller, individual sized portions for those not wanting to eat for two.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen

oWtp54qRq0Ncx4mqEpz72Q.text: What happened????????????  I've been to Burgr (now spelled Burger) twice before my most recent visit and I loved it! Now, Burger is nothing more than a glorified Applebee's!!!  Let me go through my reasoning here....  Arrived with my best friend at 10:30pm (well before closing time). We were seated at a table facing the kitchen. We waited 3 minutes before our waitress came over to let us know she was sorry for the wait and would get us waters. We both were a bit baffled by the wait as we both love GR's restaurants and never had to wait more than 30-60 seconds before someone came over to give us water.  Next, we noticed several tables were not bussed and had dirty dishes and food scraps all over them. This is definitely not GR standards.   As we waited for our food, I watched two cooks drink from personal cups and set the cups right out in view of the customers. Furthermore, both chefs started EATING behind the line WHILE making food!!! In plain view of customers!!   The servers were just as unprofessional. They were laughing and joking with one another, leaning against each other, playing with stuff, goofing off. What we thought was the manager was also being pretty unprofessional for a manager.   We ordered onion rings as a starter and they were very good so we were happy with that. Next, we ordered burgers--the Bleu Cheeseburger. My friend ordered hers medium and I ordered mine Medium-Rare. I took two bites of my burger and stopped. The bun was soaked red from the meat and looked like it hadn't been cooked enough! I put my plate with un-eaten burger to the side and started back in on the onion rings. While conversing with my friend, a busser came and took my burger plate AND the onion rings I was still eating away! No question about how the food was or if there was something wrong with it!  By this point we both had enough and wanted to go. We waited and waited for our waitress to come back with the bill. We waited so long I ended up holding my credit card in the air to signal we were done and wanted the check.   To pour salt in an already open and angry wound, she returned with our check with the total amount UNDERLINED and then again UNDERLINED the words 'gratuity not added to check'. Are you kidding me?? Absolutely poor taste, so tacky! Not up to GR standards at all!!!!!! GR should do Kitchen Nightmares on his own restaurant!!!

8u201Afe_CSDSoSHQTB_8Q.text: Half hour wait in line to get seated at 5pm. Very noisy and crowded. I got the ultimate cheeseburger and it was very good. The beer battered onion rings were also good. The little cups of ranch salad dressing and so-called house ketchup for dipping are nothing special. Caesar salad was just ok, not enough crunch. Not much flavor from the black garlic dressing. Iced tea to drink. The bill came to $50. You have to decide for yourself if it's worth it. I'm not sure.

pxvHWfsJmdu8bLfO3p6vSw.text: My friends and I stopped by here for my birthday and it was better than what I expected. I was told a 45 minute wait but ended up waiting only 20. The staff was so nice and attentive when it came to being there for the first time they showed me around the menu.  I order the lobster and shrimp burger along with the truffle fries! Loved it ! The waiter suggested the onion rings and they were so good and I'm not even an onion person. After dinner the waiter brought me a homemade creamsicle and it was delicious.   Traveling from Texas to Vegas was completely worth it along with trying one of my favorite chefs restaurants.

HhFT_m9IBVd7rx4KpMVp9g.text: I was excited to try Gordon Ramsey Burger. I understood that there was going to be some wait time as I always saw a line. We waited anywhere from 30-45 min in line. We had looked at the menu prior to sitting down so we can order as soon as we sat down. So as soon as the server took our order we were informed that it was going to be awhile about 20 minutes longer than usual before the burgers would come out as they are backed up in the kitchen. However, he said can bring our fries as our appetizers. We agreed, we got our fries maybe 20 minutes later.   I understood that there was going to be a wait time, the restaurant was full.   However, I was disappointed in my food. I ordered my hamburger medium, there was no pink at all. It was more like a medium well. My hamburger was bland there was no flavor. I was truly disappointed in my food. I would not recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It looks yummy, but it had no flavor :/

FEUrXEWKTMzFi_dtszDFpw.text: I am a fan of Gordon Ramsay and enjoy what he does...but we were disappointed..VERY disappointed. After a 1 HOUR wait we ordered the Mediterranean burger, Blue cheeseburger, and the Farmhouse. They FORGOT to put the figgy jam in mine...which is one of the key ingredients that caught my interest. The server gave me a side of jam and I had to spread on the jam MYSELF....They failed to cook my mothers lamb patty properly...(my mother wanted fully done) which had to be remade and took another 15/20mins for my poor mother!!!! Last but not least the customer service was LACKLUSTRE. I get better service at MCDONALDS!! The server just said I was probably wrong and that the cooks did in fact put the jam but it was hard to see. I fully dissected my burger to show that the buns were in fact plain. The manager...wasn't helpful at all. None of the staff apologized for the inconvenience their staff/cooks have caused.   Common, if Gordon Ramsay, a TOP CHEF WITH MICHELIN STAR RESTAURANTS is going to slap his name on this restaurant...I EXPECT GREATER SERVICE. This will be the FIRST AND LAST TIME I step foot in this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Discount for the poor food quality
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Free dessert (As an apology) None of the staff including the manager, apologized!

aYmljBUfX7ZONGe1LefhSg.text: Does this even need another review? The line was long, but if you're platinum or above you have priority seating, so don't wait in the line. It was busy so the food took awhile to come, but it was worth the wait.  I like many LOVE GR. The blue cheese burger was phenomenal. The crisp lettuce, figgy jam, and True Bleu cheese flavor merried so well.  We also got the nachos. Have you everbeaten nachos and had left over cheese on the plate? Well here you do! They were delicious and totally shareable.  Just go here. You won't be sad.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

a6nKHyS44SNGpXv-6blhUA.text: The line was long but went by so quick! The staff are all awesome and always check if we need more drinks and if we are liking everything. The food was obviously awesome! I got the Hell's Kitchen burger and truffle fries and both were so good! Such a nice experience, definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pQt-c4W7tGapuRdnVRrOpA.text: The hamburger here at Gordon Ramsay Burger deserve 5 stars but the extremely slow service and the attitude problem of one waiter full of TATOO's ruined our meal by his lies and his claimed to the manager that I insulted him when I asked him why after 90 minutes waiting online and once inside for 20 minutes he passed by our table many times without taking our order !!! Thanks to the manager that he didn't believed his lies and we had to change the table to another waitress much nicer But honestly all this wait and mistreatment and attitude problem it is created by the place itself since half of the tables are empty while more than 50 people are waiting outside starving !!!!! It's not fair and it's not right and we will not comeback until they fix their game of making people waiting to get the attention and publicity

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ch9eBlczkV8JAArV0a5nWg.text: The food at Gordon Ramsay burger was really good. Only drawbacks honestly were there's a long wait in the smoke filled casino waiting area then the food takes a long time to get your table. The truffle fries were some of the best I ever had. To booth they're served with a truffle aioli & an extremely flavorful ketchup that was more akin to cocktail sauce. The lobster & shrimp burger was good & although most of the ingredients were fresh I felt like there was a "filler" component to the seafood of the burger. The Turducken burger was also far from your typical burger & there was a sweet element to it. My wife had a Prosecco & I had a cocktail that was an extremely fruity rendition of a Manhattan. The drink was delicious but the alcohol content was slim to none. The Oreo creme brulee shake was also good even though I got it to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z31LTflHfGq94EXzt8XTXg.text: My second time here. Ordered Shrimp and lobster burger and it was delicious.There was a small line but i decided to do a takeout and still had to wait for about 30 minutes.Probably the best shrimp and lobster burger i ever ate.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and lobster burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lavSF3xbzjk45-sWcmHcQA.text: The wait for this restaurant is SUPER long but the service is really good and there is a great selection of food options :)! I don't think you can go wrong with anything here but be prepared for a wait. My dad was a diamond member and we still waited about 30 minutes. Be prepared for a delicious meal!

Z92_PBcFIGy3IcbsD52W5w.text: If you want mediocre service, food and a horrible wait time, then this is your place. The burgers were meh with too much going on, the fries were stale or overly fried in oil, and everything was overpriced. Our server was nowhere to be found, and condescendingly explained my food to me while calling me "sweetie". Expected much better from Gordon Ramsay's restaurant, but unfortunately it's just another mediocre chain. Don't get the hog burger - it's an atrocity with layers of different types of pork that do not go well together - it just makes you feel queasy and gross.

8y2i2atec9jKnpW9bt-Ndg.text: Great atmosphere, well staffed, we went at 5 pm in Mid Jan, didn't wait long for a table, ordered a Caesar Kale Apple Salad, Hog Burger & Hell Kitchen Burger, foods come very fast.  We really like these 2 burgers, soft buns, patties are very juicy, I personally found the Hog burger is so creative, has pull pork, bacon wrapped the pork patty.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HloTFocFDDelr_uIV7My4Q.text: Very solid burger spot inside Planet Hollywood Hotel.  Kids loved their burgers and wife and I split the Lobster and Crab burger.  Had both fries and sweet potato fries.  Service was great and quality of food was awesome.    The bill did come out to over $100 for 3 burgers, 2 fries and 4 drinks.  So just fair warning that it's not cheap.

pLnreQBLy_m6jPRATr6lYg.text: This place is a SCAM. They charge you $35 for a simple burger that tastes like it was made in school canteen. They even didn't cut the avocado, just put whole 1/2 of it.

j-2xaXVnp9nGuprxaYbi6A.text: 5 Stars Hands Down..! Showed up for a table for two without reservation on a Saturday night. Long wait but extremely worth it. The Hell's Kitchen Burger was absolutely outstanding, the Truffle Parmesan Fries were unreal, and the Hellsfire Chicken Wings were truly a real treat! I had high expectations for a Ramsay restaurant and they were absolutely met. The staff were all professional and attentive. We had a chef-side table with a amazing view of each cook preparing every dish with excellence! Doing their best to smash perfect burgers out of the kitchen. Very exciting and wonderful environment - If you're in Planet Hollywood be sure to stop by I highly recommend this to each one of you.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger... Asadero Cheese, Roasted Jalapeños, Avocado, Roasted Tomatoes, Jalapeño Aïoli
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hellfire Chicken Wings With Tangy Hellfire Blue Cheese. Phenomenal!

F8aJpWbKQHC41Acvb9HoKg.text: I got a seat at the bar table near the kitchen. It took around 5-8 min for the server to even greet me and ask for the drink menu or any questions that I might have. Then once I gave my order, it took another 7 mins for the server to even get me water. No one even said hi to me and I was looking around and not on my phone. Didn't expect this kind of service from this place. I do agree that this place gets crowded crazy, but still I got a feeling like no one cares that you eat here and they don't mind at all.   Got a feeling that you are not welcomed here. This is because I was sitting at a bar table and saw lot of the employees and none didn't give an eye contact or say even hi.  This is the main reason why I am giving this ratings. The food is really good but service is bad.  I have been to other Gordon's restaurants and they had phenomenal service and also the food was great.

0WyhRFTfJFuizqyc4TtnVA.text: I must say.. this place was pretty good.. came here for my father's birthday who was visiting from Cali in Feb.. I love how flavorful the burgers was.. n yes.. please, no tomatoes/lettuce on a good burger.. it's a gourmet burger place!   All and all, we had a great night there!!!

zR8Rexg3_L3R-iTTCTn7nA.text: Don't come here for a quick bite. It's won't be quick, especially if you're getting a burger. All the burgers are cooked to order and they can only cook about 30 burgers at a time so it takes about 30 min for each burger. We waited 30 min to be seated then another 30 for the burger. We were in no rush.   Our server Brandon was EXCELLENT!!! He knew the menu and its items inside and out. He's the type of server Gordon Ramsay would approve of. The beer recommendations Brandon suggested were perfect, and just to be sure, he brought the sample of the original beer  we were considering and his recommendation was definitely better.   The food was delicious! The onion rings are to die for. Honestly, skip the fries and go for the onion rings instead. The beer batter, cheddar ranch, and chipotle ketchup are made in house and you can taste it. The truffle fries and regular fries were not for me, but they were good.   I got the farmhouse burger with a fried egg and bacon. It was delicious. Despite the fact that I was nursing a huge hangover, it hit the spot. My caramel pecan milk shake was so creamy and delicious but not overly sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caramel pecan milk shake
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. DELICIOUS onion rings with chipotle ketchup and cheddar ranch dipping sauces. Get extra chipotle ketchup!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farm house burger with truffle fries.

dXzTNTSWBpbBYp5zSII3VA.text: I wanted to give this restaurant 5 stars but I wasn't completely situation with the service due to lack of know of the food. I also wasn't satisfied with the after-taste of the Vegetarian Impossible patty for an extra $6. It tasted like a powdered pea protein soy burger. However, the Hell's Kitchen burger was very delicious. And the Truffle Parmesan Fries with the "aioli"  sauce was very flavorful great combination. 'I love a good aioli!'

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian Impossible Hell&#39;s Kitchen
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vegetarian Impossible Hell&#39;s Kitchen
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Fries

F62fCD35SCl5toOT8tdcfA.text: Amazing food! I'm a huge Gordon Ramsay fan and I can see his influence in the flavors and different variations of food here!  We had the Hell's Kitchen burger, nachos and sweet potato fries.  The burger was loaded with avocado and the burger was juicy!  The sweet potato fries are dusted with powder sugar which was interesting but the taste exploded in my mouth!!!  The different sweet and savory sauces were on point.  The manager talked story with us and the staff was friendly. We did have to wait awhile for our food but it was so tasty!

UvwsUgtrCzkz_WVQjFn4_A.text: A must when I come to Vegas. Every visit I try a different burger.  Burgr is located in Planet Hollywood. There may be a wait, but IMO it's worth it! If you have a Total Rewards card then you'll get a discount. I believe if you're a diamond or platinum, then you'll get first priority when waiting in line.  They have a variety of beer, cocktails, shakes, and non-alcoholic beverages. I ordered the Oreo Creme Brulee... broke da mout! (translation: out of this world!) This was the first time I bought a shake and I was in LOVE. We had the chicken wings - not too spicy with bleu cheese chunks sprinkled. The sweet potato fries are delicious - extra sugar is provided on the side!!  The menu is a souvenir and you can take it home! I showed anyone interested which foods or drinks to order.  The servers, hostess, and food runners were helpful and prompt. Their uniforms look very comfortable. Jeans can be worn and the tops look dri-fit type material.  Love this place. It's not fancy. Very casual and relaxing environment. Kids are welcomed too!

OR-Wprw6JZe2Yazv_I88oQ.text: This is definitely the greatest burger I've had in Las Vegas. The entire experience ended too quickly. When I sleep tonight, I'll be dreaming of how perfect the meat was seasoned and cooked. Outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger

IjZOurT5138dwZZ55cdSTQ.text: Yes, yes, and yes. I know I'm #basic, but the plain old "back yard burger" is awesome. Perfect seasonings and tender brisket meat. I don't like when burgers have a ton of ingredients so it's a good one to start with. The fries are large enough to share with two people so keep that in mind. The shakes are also really great.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ACSeGCmBEbAf3XT2u-Tgqw.text: The logic behind my three stars is as follows: 5 star for the burger 1 star for the service. I realize it's a busy restaurant but I'm not sure how it could take 40 minutes to make our burgers. It was also discouraging when our neighboring table sat down after us and they got their food before us and left before we got our burger...  Maybe because we ordered some beer is why they took so long but we wanted cold beer with a good burger. By the time our burger came out beer has warmed a bit... I'm not sure if our order just got lost or entered wrong but for a high class restaurant it sure sucked.   Onto the food: (once it arrived) the truffle fries are out of the world! They come with their house ketchup and maybe truffle mayo? It wasn't too crisp but it wasn't soggy either! We ordered one order and it was plenty for the three of us mainly because the burger was big! I recommend the first burger I think it was hell burger? It's the one with roasted jalapenos. Hands down that has to be one of the best burgers I've ever had. The meat was cooked perfectly medium and the roasted jalapenos with the avocado was such a good texture! Add fries and ketchup and it was an excellent meal.  However I value service as well and while I would like to come back.. I doubt it.

6e2GBVEmexzed6zKlVlZjQ.text: Spent our son's 21st Birthday here at Gordon Ramsay Burger at this has been his request forever!  Was Weds after Christmas. Wait wasn't bad. We had a party of 7 so we got to put our name in with the hostess and not wait in line and was called in an hour.   Was busy but the staff was very attentive!  Questions answered. Recommendations made.   Ordered apps that were WOW. Recommend all of the selections we made. Hummus, Kettle Chip Nachos, and Fries. You will not be sorry.   The burgers were probably the best burgers we've ever had. Between Turkey Burgers, Backyard Cheeseburgers, even the spicy burger (name escapes me) they were perfection. The Hot Dog was the biggest hot dog ever and was scrumptious!  We also ordered fries, truffle fries, and sweet potato fries. O M G!!!  We had no room for dessert which was sad but we will definitely be back!!  Plan on special occasions though because the bill can get hefty.   Enjoy!!

XS37qtMwth8CXMeTi8L_0Q.text: The burgers were served cold. And the salad was served after the burgerd which was 30 minutes after. There's a clear sign of miscommunication between the kitchen and the servers. Fortunately, the manager did a good job resolving the issue. Overall, not a good experience but the food is acceptable.

R118K_hpdv1vd0UKoI6thg.text: Hey me if the best burgers in my life.  Great atmosphere and service. Good beer list. Make sure you get there an hour before you want to eat, line for us on a wed evening was 30 min to put name in list and another 49 min wait. A great experience and a must do if n my next trip.

XnWJuuoJzjZXOPHpa0gvgw.text: There's always a small line to wait before you enter. Food to table time was fairly quick so the is due to being busy.  Wait staff was attentive, knowledgeable and helpful with the food choices. Burgers were a little pricey but worth it.

cholp3PGYQOlI_SASqEglg.text: Backyard burger- simple, plain and absolutely the beat burger I've ever had! The burger mix is about 7oz of 3 meats, and it was moist and delicious. The line was about 30 minute to be seated as it's first come, first serve. The staff was great- very attentive. The fries were okay. I wouldn't order them again.

EWL8wO-zhenZ2YCjyvbi9g.text: My wife got the lobster burger and loved it! The onion rings and truffle fries were also amazing. Not overly expensive for Vegas. Definitely worth eating at.

_O1AbS0aMfuOPHswJNpbsQ.text: If you come to Vegas and want a burger, come here and only here. Came here as a vegetarian and got the impossible burger. Cannot get that where I live. Wait was short to be seated but after putting the order in it took a while for the food easily about 25 minutes. The burger was so good, the texture, flavor and taste were so good. It was by far the best meatless burger I have had ever. Worth the wait and every penny.

YdIbSEokONXsHuQ8IAioHw.text: Packed, packed, packed. I ended up sitting at the bar to enjoy my burger. Good food and very friendly bar staff.

-hfp7hqp-6baYZ7w7O7ZRA.text: Love him as a chef. I ordered the lobster and shrimp burger and it was delicious. I also had the truffle Parmesan fries it was good but a bit too salty. My daughter ordered the creme brulee chocolate milk shake, YUM! She also had the Ahi tuna sliders which were delectable. We also had the beer battered onion rings, which were good but a touch salty as well. Overall, I had a great experience. The wait staff were super nice and helpful. Will come back for sure

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna slider
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer battered onion rings and truffle Parmesan fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and shrimp burger

poWpRjh-TgxUHXUe1B2M2w.text: My gf and I had about an hour before our show was going to start so we wanted to grab something to eat. We walked over to Planet Hollywood and we saw there was no line here at 6pm. My gf was craving a burger and had always wanted to eat here, soooooo off we went. There was a wait of 5 minutes to which we avoided by sitting at the chef's table. Normally we love to sit at the chef's table, but this table was different. We sat right next to where the servers roll the silverware. So the staff would dump the silverware into the bucket and it was like nails on a chalkboard over and over again. We did our best to ignore it, but it was tough for sure. We looked back outside and there was now a line of 20 people!   The benefit of sitting at the chef's table is you get to see all the food as it comes out. In addition there is plenty of staff there to help if you need more drinks, items or just have questions. When our server greeted us, he immediately let us know there was a 30-40 minute wait for food. We decided to chance it and order food possibly missing a few minutes of the show. Plus at most places they over estimate those times to cover themselves, usually it's half that time.   We decided to go w/ their specialty burger of the day, to which they only make a certain amount of. I'm not sharing what that is due to not knowing if they only serve it particular days of the week, certain months or if it's a one time thing. I wouldn't want to get your hopes up. In addition to that burger we ordered the 'Hells Kitchen' burger - asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes, jalapeno aioli  We kept watching food come out and hoping it was ours. It was starting to close in on that 30-40 minute mark. We hadn't see our server since dropping off our drinks and taking our order. Like magic he appeared when the food arrived. To which I quickly asked for the check. The manger on duty came to us to apologize for the wait and ask if we needed anything else. I informed her of the lack of attention our server gave as we sat there and how our waters weren't refilled during the time we got them until the time we got our burgers.  Once we started digging into these burgers, we realized it was worth the wait. Typically it can be hard to wow me w/ a burger at a particular price, but maaaaaaaaaaan were these burgers good! The specialty was $25 and the Hells Kitchen burger was $16. Both well worth the wait and price.   If you are craving a burger on the strip, def check this place out! Just make sure you get a table and not the chef's table.

rpERSRgKamDRuB1ELZOWXw.text: Was really curious as to what Gordon Ramsay's restaurant can deliver when I happened to be in Las Vegas. I think it is really great that larger parties are able to put their name down and get a text message to come back when a table is available. Although the servers are very nice, the service was so slow. My water was never refilled and the food took over 30 minutes to come out. It was not even that busy but it seems that multitasking is something that the workers were lacking in. The food was good, a tad dry, but still tasted very good. 4 star for food. 3 for service.

hhXQAD6O9T50wZGSOBKtBA.text: Been trying to come here my last few Vegas trips and the wait is always pretty long. 1hr plus! I like the casino Planet Hollywood so the wait wasn't bad.   The burger is actually really good and fairly priced at about $15-$20 (Vegas prices of course). The quality and flavor of the patty was good and cooked just how I asked Medium Rare.

5Yz-VtnlbIDl6Qwe7-iOQA.text: We visited Vegas and had lunch at Gordon Ramsay Burger on January 2nd.  The line to get in was not too bad when we got there.  However, since we have 6 people, we would have to wait for another hour or so to get a table.  So we decided to split the table for 4 and 2 people separately.  I ordered the Hell Kitchen burger, my husband ordered the Portebello burger (vegetarian), and my brother-in-law ordered the Farmhouse burger.  We also got a side-order of fries as well.  Services were good and the server was attentive.  Wished that we could be seated next to each other but I understood that the restaurant is very busy.  For the food: - Hell Kitchen burger:  was delicious for my taste bud.  It got a kick from the jalapeno and the sauce.  The burger was juicy and the buns were perfectly toasted.  If you like a bit of spice for your food, this is the one to order. -  Farmhouse burger:  I did not like it as much.  The patty was dry, the bacon did not have a crunch, and the whole thing tasted salty.  I would not order it personally.  However, my brother-in-law enjoyed it. -  Portebello burger:  it had 2 patties of the portebello, which was a plus, as many other portebello burger I tasted in the past only had one patty.  It was more citrus for my taste but when you took a bite of everything (quite difficult to do because it was big and messy lol), the flavor balanced out perfectly.  My husband enjoyed the burger. -  the fries :  the Parmesan and the herb in it were great.  But I wish the fries to be more crispy.  I enjoyed the extra dipping sauce.  I forgot what the sauce is called.  Overall, it's a good place to try as the food and service did not disappoint me.  However, I still prefer In & Out burger over these anytime lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vORrUAtXbyYAVtSnNDP_2A.text: This is my favorite burger spot so far. The burgers and other food options seem expensive for what they are, but they are worth every penny. The texture on the burgers does not seem cheap like a standard burger joint, the fries and poutine is wonderfully seasoned. Don't bother getting an appetizer, burger and side, the portions are generous.

7_UWJkRH6bY75WBo_zCeaA.text: Great service but food leaves a lot to be desired. All I could taste from my burger was salt. The waitress explained they add salt on top of the burger and she would have it remade with no salt. Burgers are NOT worth the price. Poor ambience for a Gordon Ramsey restaurant. If you are a foodie avoid eating here.

SL-PaGpszofLHvpm2I3j_A.text: Came here to celebrate a monthiversary with the bf & had such a good time!  THE WAIT: - there was a 20 foot line of people around 1PM on a Saturday but we only ended up waiting around 20 minutes!  THE FOOD: - Sweet potato fries +4/5 They sprinkle powdered sugar over the fries, giving the plate a unique, yummy taste. Feel free to ask for extra condiments (chipotle aioli, ketchup, etc..) on the side too!  - Hell's Kitchen Burger +4/5 This was my first time trying this burger & wow - it was good. I'm not a burger person so this says a lot too. The jalapeno added the perfect spicy kick to it & trust me - add an egg to your burger to reward your tastebuds. The only downside was that the burger was pretty salty.  - Hogg Burger +4.5/5 The bf ordered this and we both didn't expect how big the burger was going to be. He couldn't finish all of it but devoured as much as he could. If you've already had the Hell's Kitchen burger, definitely try this one next!  SERVICE: - was amazing. Despite the restaurant was super busy, Daniel - our server - made sure that we got our drinks/food/check in a timely matter. Thanks, Daniel!  If you're visiting Vegas, definitely make an effort to come visit this spot - you won't be disappointed. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger: +4/5
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog burger: yum!!!!! +5/5

sNFW9SwVry5yiwtr4CMOCg.text: Pricey but probably one of the best hamburgers I've ever had. Taking off one star because the fries sucked so hard. And typically I will eat just about any fries. These were pretty lame. Hopefully it was just a bad night. There is usually a wait but it wasn't too bad.

aeagdCDFXcLKeCCuhR-w7g.text: It pretty much lived up to the hype! Huge line for lunch but we were able to give our name & phone number so we could wander around or gamble. We did split up to do that & the wait was shorter than the 40 min. It was about a half hour but felt a lot faster.   Walking by, there were a bunch of empty tables. And we were seated at one of them later. I never understand why places do that, is there not enough staff or does it take that long to seat people?   Anyways on to the food:  Chicken wings (5+)- Prob the best damn chicken wings I've had in my life. The sauce was perfect. It was not a normal chicken wing but like a lollipop style where it's cut differently and the meat literally just falls off the bone. The blue cheese sauce is a must with it, my cousin wanted to opt out since he's not a blue cheese fan but he's so glad we got it on the side so he could try it & he was a fan.   Blue Cheese Burger (4 stars)- This was my favorite out of the 3 that we had. I love blue cheese & ah fig jam brings the sweet & salty aspect of it. I've had better burgers so it's not quite 5 stars but def satisfied the craving.   Hells Kitchen Burger (4 stars)- my second fav and others first. So I guess it's also all personal preference. This was a tasty burger though.   Forest Burger (3.5 stars)- I found this one to be a bit dry. Thank goodness for the duck bacon which made the burger have flavor but as a whole nothing to write home about.   Truffle Parmesan Fries (5+)- god damn these were good. You know how you order these and all the Parmesan eventually just falls to the bottom? Well this place knows how to do it right. Perfect seasoning on each fry & homemade dipping sauces (truffle aioli & homemade ketchup) were excellent!! A must order!   Overall if I were craving burgers in Vegas I may come back or try another place. It was surprising to me that the things I enjoyed most weren't the burgers though. So maybe I need to try different appetizers, sides & dessert next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings with blue cheese on the side

3fE9rhcKIPTcZ72TJ8dxTw.text: This is one of Gordon Ramsay's most affordable options on the strip and it does not disappoint! I got the blue cheese burger medium and it was absolutely the best burger I have ever eaten. It has this amazing figgy jam on it. We got the street corn dip as an app. My boyfriend is a very picky eater and even he scarfed it down. The only thing I didn't like is the fancy ketchups that came with the French fries. One was curry which I don't like in any dish and the other was a chipotle which was too spicy for my liking. The waitress bought me a cheddar ranch that they make in house and it was bomb. Only cost about $60 (with only coffee and soda) which is a steal on the strip!

fklAxpvvPZwxvl_YKN091g.text: Gordooooon! Where you at Sir Ramsay who hailed from the great lands of Scotland! According to Wikipedia, sir Ramsay was born in Scotland. I learned something new writing this review.   I wasn't a huge fan of this place which i don't think is a reflection of Gordon Ramsay's capacity to construct a wonderful meal. It must have been an off night for the head chef who ran the kitchen or something of that nature.   We got to the Burger at 10pm but was greeted with a 40 minute waits that only served to increase my anticipation as it was clearly popping. The ambiance is reminiscent of a standard diner. I was kind of expecting  it to be of finer dining. I particularly liked the silverware and the weight I had to them.  We ordered the poutine fries, hog burger and the Hell's Kitchen burger.  The poutine fries were probably our favorite of the night. The pickled vegetables were the highlight as it served to brighten and elevate the dish to another level with its acidity. It counteracted the fries and the heavy gravy perfectly.  The Hell's Kitchen burger was ordered medium rare but came closer to a medium well. The flavor profiles seemed okay but it was just incredibly dry. I didn't discover this till later on because my wife was such a good sport about it.  The hog burger was, in my humble opinion, preferable to the Hell's Kitchen burger. It had a mild sweetness that permeated my palate elegantly. It balanced well with the saltiness of the bacon. It was still a bit dry though.   Overall, the food wasn't bad. It just was a far cry's worth away from the money that had to be spent for it.  The water and ice used was really good. It seemed like good quality ice!

ybFz8nAUd5M-4KvbVMGdrg.text: I am big fan of Gordon's restaurants. He always has good quality food, a friendly and attentive staff and most importantly a clean kitchen. I was not a fan of the parmesan truffle fries, too much of everything on there. The onion rings were way too greasy. The fish and crisps burger was delish, I would get again. Hell's burger was fantastic. I would go again for a burger, but would pass on the sides.

PCq7-9LcKiSjedCwTCHc8Q.text: Yes! This place is delicious! We checked out this restaurant on our first day in Vegas, as we were looking for a good hamburger place. We ended up going in between lunch and dinner, so thankfully we did not have to stand in line too long. We did walk by other times, and the line was pretty long. We have learned that in Vegas, that's a good sign! If people are waiting in line outside your restaurant, it must be pretty good.    To be honest, the restaurant sold us in name only. We knew that Gordon Ramsay was featured on his own television show, so we knew we had to go check it out. We ended up splitting two hamburgers among the three of us, as well as just one side of fries... It was plenty. We thought this would be an in between meal and that we would have room for dinner a couple hours later, but we actually ended up being stuffed.  Know that the choice of burgers do you not come with fries, those are extra. They are definitely a good addition to any burger, so I would definitely recommend getting some even if that means splitting them. The people next to us got a salad, and it was humongous! I think she could've definitely split that with her family.  Great restaurant, delicious burgers! The entrance to this restaurant is right on the strip, so it's easily accessible from the street and walking distance from our hotel at Caesars Palace. Check it out!

0ELKUPu5TOCQewvC05yATw.text: THE BEST BURGER EVER!!!!  Thank you Gordon for the unforgettable memory. I still feel the taste in my mouth. They have a great variety of burgers on the menu. Freshest ingredients made with love! We spent 4 days in Vegas and we ate at many places, but this was the best for sure! Everyone must try it!

Aqo88CV2_Go5NWy4zGYlSw.text: My boyfriend and I came to check out the restaurant and we loved it!! There was a 30 minutes wait for Saturday 9:30ish pm which wasn't bad and it went by fast. We ordered wings as appetizers and let me tell you they were the best I've had they were so good. My boyfriend ordered the hell's kitchen burger and a UK burger. I got a hell's kitchen burger too! Omg the burgers were delicious I recommend you order the Hell's Kitchen burger you won't be disappointed. We got regular fries and sweet potato fries and they were so yummy with their special sauce. I really enjoyed my meal. The waitress barely checked on us but it was okay because we had everything we needed so no biggie. I am definitely coming back when we come visit Vegas again.  Their prices are fair. $18 a burger and fries are separate $8 and  drinks $4

Vv7wpx2pWsHfvUV2ccYZ4w.text: Waited in line for 30 minutes and it has been 45 minutes in addition to sitting down at the table. Still no food, only water. What the heck?

lxEOCOJWSgongr2iBNK6ng.text: This burger was delicious! The burger has a fried chicken egg and duck confit stacked on top of a turkey patty. I added caramelized onions on it too due to my preference and had a side of pickles too because I love it! I had a side of onion rings, but I think I would have enjoyed the truffle Parmesan fries more since I enjoyed my friend's serving of it lol. The burger was juicy and the service was on point as well! Would definitely come back to try the other burgers as well!

0jnsq6vrVJHqwyNFp6VvDA.text: Been here twice and the food is DELICIOUS. The only bad things about it are the wait times and the display with all the flames is kinda hot to stand next to after walking in the sun and heat to get there. Both times we had to wait over 30-60 min for a table but you do get a beeper you can take and go gamble for a while. The restaurant always seems to be packed.   As for the food--I've gotten the Foie gras duck bacon burger both times and I have zero regrets. Everything on it complements each other wonderfully. We prefer to share a thing of fries because it comes with so much food. There's a dip of truffle aioli that would probably be even better if you just put it on your sandwich.   The chairs are super wide and cushie, I absolutely love the regular dining chairs and I don't normally comment on those. They're definitely made to accommodate an American bottom.   Come here for lunch, just don't come starving because you will be waiting for a long time. Plan accordingly and bring a snack to wait.

6-OeyU4ybsU2hz9p0NsIrQ.text: Gordon Ramsay : "What are you??"  "An idiot sandwich  Chef Ramsay!" replies the woman with two slices of bread around her head.  Funniest quote from the skit "Hell's Cafeteria"   Visited Vegas and dropped by one of Gordan Ramsay's restaurants for lunch  Had the HOG BURGER  - Mangalitsa Pork  Mangalitsa Bacon  White Cheddar  Pickles  Crispy Onion  and Slaw.  Amazing explosion of with each bite, so much fatty goodness but it was well worth it, lol  2nd Pic:  AHI TUNA SLIDERS - Ahi Tuna  Sriracha Mayo, Cabbage, Ponzu, Crispy Onion, Jalapeno Aioli.  It's probably a delicious appetizer, but personally for me, squishy fish in between buns didn't meld well together for me  3rd Pic: Fries  for days - Sweet Potato Fries, Truffle Parmesan Fries, Just Fries.  Can't go wrong!  Really liked the ambience here.  Clean, servers were attentive, definitely will be a round two on the next Vegas trip!

gqDuuXyMQXbkeioQacFVOg.text: There's always quite a long line waiting to get into this place. I hate waiting in long lines but I decided to go for it since I'm a fan of good burgers and Gordon Ramsay.  I waiting in line for about thirty minutes. I was almost to the front when the hostess told me since I was by myself I could sit at the bar. My bad, but in my defense, there's a sign that says to check in at the front if you have a party bigger than three, nothing about solo diners. So now you know, if you're alone, go to the hostess desk and get a seat at the bar.  It was freakin' cold at the bar. I wished I had a light jacket with me.   The service at the bar was efficient. The bartender suggested the Gordon Ramsay Burger. $17. I also ordered the beer-battered onion rings, $9, and iced tea, $4.   The bartender said it would take about 25 minutes to cook the burger since it's so thick. I think I got it in less than 20 and it was cooked just right. So were the onion rings. See my pics. As good as it looks!  Darn good burger and onion rings. No doubt about it. It was almost $40 for the burger, rings and soft drink. Pretty pricey, but glad I payed tribute to Ramsay and his burger.

BoxNeeihHG4q7HF0Rku0iQ.text: Burger wasnt as big as i thought it would be when it arrived. But..... when i took my first bite, i didnt care how big it was. The flavor was perfect! The bread was soft (tasted like a croissant) and the meat was thick, juicy, and flavored perfect. I ordered it medium and it was cooked perfect. I also had the truffle fries. mmmm perfect combination. Will definitely come back when I'm in town.

5e3CBqVf1qXVXzb3VCVBig.text: This place is not bad... probably one of the better options in the area. It's definitely not the best burger, but it is fairly good. I've visited a few times, and tried a different burger each time, and have generally been content. My favorite so far is the Curry burger (which is actually chicken, not beef). Had some nice curry spices. Prices are fairly reasonable for the strip.   The sweet potato fries are okay, but they add sugar?!? They are already sweet enough as it is. Price is okay given that one serving is sufficient for 2-3 people.   Fairly good draught beer list.   Line can be long, but moves reasonably fast.

jyK1L57SLOcw9aNlaGw31g.text: Looking around for something to eat and this restaurant came up on yelp and it did not disappoint the food was so delicious  I will definitely be back again next time we're in down  we got the hells burger and kettle nachos           give it a try for yourself you won't regret it

bxDWtk54Hh_QrWYWjsho-A.text: Last night I was finally able to try Gordon Ramsay Burger after hearing all the praise. I recommend looking up the busy times for this restaurant since my group had to wait for 1hr 30min to be seated. If you have a group of more than 3 go to the front desk to give your name and number so they can text you when your table is ready.  The burgers are great as well as the onion rings which were my favorite! Don't let the pictures on yelp decieve you the burgers are not small they are actually bigger than they seem. One order of onion rings/ fries are enough to be shared between 2-3 people. Shout out to our server Adam who was just great as he tended to anything that we needed I can absolutely recommend him!

eybDuyw_aJHUAvGE72O96w.text: I went with a group, and we ordered the burnt ends poutine, duck poppers, regular fries, onion rings, and I ordered the Stout burger. I didnt particularly care for the sweetness of the poutine, but I gotta say everything else was pretty phenomenal, and I really enjoyed my burger.

XdkwpvZP8O0uOYYpxWL0vQ.text: This was a really good dinner! My brother wanted to come here when we were in Vegas and the rest of my family ended up tagging along so I got to try a bunch of food. The wait was close to an hour when we got there, but if you have a Platinum or Diamond card you get preferential seating - luckily my stepmom does so we only waited about 20 mins.   The GREAT:  Beer Battered Onion Rings, Kettle Chip Nachos, Burnt Ends Poutine, Ultimate Cheeseburger, Brown Butter Caramel Pecan Shake   The GOOD:  Farmhouse Burger, Backyard Burger, Creme Brulee Shake  The NOT GOOD:  Chips with Curry Sauce, Lobster and Shrimp Burger  By far the best things I tried were the Onion Rings & the Ultimate Cheeseburger. They were flipping fantastic! I could literally smell all the delicious cheese on the burger when they put it down in front of my niece. I should have ordered that! The worst thing I had was the Lobster and Shrimp Burger, which I split with my stepmom. The consistency was just awful and the flavor was not that great. Neither of us finished our halves. Also the Chips with Curry Sauce, we thought would be a curry ketchup, but it was really just straight Indian Curry and the fries had no flavor on their own.   Service was excellent, we were constantly being checked on and all the food came out really fast. With 6 people dining, multiple appetizers, sides, shakes, and cocktails, the meal was about $190. Not bad at all! I will definitely eat here next time I am in Vegas!

_Tnir3LyFdni0WoBBhEJxw.text: Simple burgers with BIG flavor!  We went straight here after seeing the Opium show (recommended BTW) so it was around 9:30pm. We had a group of 5 and the wait was an hour and a half, but they text you when your table is ready, so we just went to a bar until then.  Finally seated around 11pm! Our group shared kettle chip nachos and truffle Parmesan fries, while for myself, I ordered the crown burger. The nachos were sooo good, super unique and probably way too many calories to think about but oh well. The fries were thick cut and perfectly cooked. Their ketchup is delicious! I liked it a lot more than the truffle aioli. I ordered my burger medium rare and it came out just that. The burger itself was a little smaller than I had imagined but it was still very filling. The crown burger has simple toppings, nothing over the top. But it is done well and the flavors pair great.

i8WuDXDwyRxPDMkuOsDW7w.text: Oh boy. I'm going back for the buffalo wings. I've had my fair share in life but these were delish.  The blue cheese and the little handle they carve out is what puts it over the top.   I had the Hell's kitchen burger with the truffle fries.  So the fries were OK.... the burger was incredible, it's was juicy and the toppings were spot on.   My wife got the lobster shrimp burger.  $26 She loved it, I had a bite and thought it was good, a little salty for my taste.  Just so you know before going. They don't do reservations and there is ALWAYS a line.

DfCk8Kk0Ed7-yTUlVV1uSA.text: So excited to try this place. I love Gordon Ramsey and being a Total Rewards Diamond member made the experience that much better! Luckily if you are a TR member, you can pass the line and be seated almost immediately. The line wasn't too bad when we got there, but it was still nice to get the preferred seating.  Our server made the experience just a bit underwhelming, but the food definitely made up for it! I'm not sure of the server was new, but she did not know the beer menu very well, or even who the chef was?!?!  The fries and homemade ketchup are great, love the extra spice they put in the ketchup. I had to order the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was delicious. It takes a little extra time for the burgers, but it is well worth it. I ordered mine medium rare and it came out perfectly. The other burger we tried was the Backyard burger; your standard burger. It too was good.

Ss-dlBEXGpc0T8ZXpnYJWw.text: I can't speak to the regular burgers but I can speak to the lobster and shrimp burger and the service. First off, I'm as far from a picky eater as you can get. I'm easily satisfied. That said, I would go as far as saying that the $27 lobster and shrimp burger is either the worst or at least top 3 of the worst things I have tasted in my life. I'm not sure if it was not cooked properly or something was done wrong with the preparation but it didn't taste right at all. I took 3 bites total and that was it. I also cut pieces off and passed it to others at my table and they also said it had a weird taste to it. I wouldn't recommend it to anybody.  Second gripe is the service. Our waitress took our order and came back for the check, that was it. I've had better service at McDonalds, seriously. She didn't even bother to ask if anything was wrong with the burger when she saw that it wasn't even half eaten.   Screw this place.

axO9QcfL9Fe2zg6peib6jw.text: Tagline "intense flavor, casual dining" might be cheesy, but it isn't inaccurate either. I got the $17 farmhouse burger and it was perfectly cooked, every bite was scrumptious, and it paired perfectly with the bartender's recommendation of Rince Conchon Belgian wheat beer on draft. Overpriced but the best option for casual sports bar dining if you don't want to consume utter crap. Did not appreciate the fact that they don't put prices for alcohol on the menu (my $14 beer was barely worth it). Delicious.  Accessibility Wheelchair accessible entrance, mix of high top, bar, standalone, and booth seating. Very loud. Good lighting. No captions on the television screens. They have vegetarian and GF options.  Seating & Atmosphere Upscale sports bar vibe(there are TVs everywhere), terrible acoustics, bar has 8 high top seats and 2 wheelchair accessible spots (very spacious bar seating). But like everywhere else in Vegas, You can't make reservations via OpenTable, and even if you're dining alone, you still have to wait on the long line to be seated (unless there is already an open spot at the bar).  Suggestions for Management Add hooks for coats and bags at the bar, along with USB ports to charge phones

MSvXssC1FZYVO_Vo2hJ1rg.text: (4.5/5) A little late on the review but better late then never, this is for having a consistent and great experience at Gordon Ramsey burger every year I visit Vegas.  The solid selection of burgers, with one for every palette preference, is the most outstanding. Always cooked to perfection and presented well every time. I applaud the truffle fries for always fulfilling that craving for rich foods and the selection of drinks, from shakes to alcoholic beverages, for always having something I'm in the mood for.   My reason for the 4.5 stars involves the wait time and the even more strict party policy. While it is consistent (something the restaurant has nailed in every aspect), the average wait time for when I've visited the past 3 times has been over an hour and a half. As with our party, we arrived just 2 minutes after our in person-reservation time which warranted an additional wait time of 20 min. That said, I will continue to visit this restaurant when I return and recommend it to others.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oreo shake

riQhBRXasZCZwzGwwRO5Zg.text: WOWZERS.....   I am a BIG FAN of Gordon, love his shoes and he has changed my perspective of what a food experience should be, ok enough with the brown nosing lol.  I had to try a Gordon Ramsey Restaurant on our stay.  The Wait was about 30mins but they texted us when our table was ready (really like that).  Very busy restaurant.  Our server was friendly and provided us with some suggestions including an Innis ("Gordons favorite")   We started with the Nachos with shredded short rib and English Cheddar Cheese, OMG WOW.  I think I almost started to cry at the first bite.  The Forrest Burger was my choice for the main.  It came out and was Well done when I asked for Medium Rare....  Im not going to lie, I REALLY took pleasure in sending it back, I think I even did the Iconic Ramsy back of hand to palm clap.    When I got my burger at the correct temperature it was AMAZING. I was already full by the time I got halfway into the burger but I kept going at of sheer Ramsey Gluteny.   WOW Great job here

vrK9grr-_p4UfIrEfWD6_Q.text: Well I struggled finding out but the BEEF PATTY IS HALAL so you can pretty much have any burger with beef patty, although signature Hell's Kitchen is best

m_8o4INoAx196Ybx6QSPOg.text: The food was amazing. We had the impossible burgers and onion rings. It's an extra $6 to substitute beef with the impossible burger. My only gripe was with having us stand in line for an hr. but noticing empty tables everywhere once we were seated.

8iuPvb5O7oSFVXyuY5mOiA.text: I'm a big fan of Gordon Ramsay and really wanted to make a trip to his burger restaurant in Planet Hollywood when I started to plan my Vegas trip.  My girlfriend and I came here on a Wednesday evening and we had to wait about 45 minutes to be seated but it could've been closer to an hour because we decided to eat at the bar instead.   We both shared the truffle fries which were so delicious that I could've stopped there without trying a burger and still been satisfied.   Finally our burgers arrived. I had the blue cheese burger which was the best burger I've probably ever had before! Gordon Ramsay is known for his fine dining but his burgers are just as good! A Las Vegas must!

zsQOjnkyN4LxbUKjRcut3g.text: Overrated. The burgers were just ok, the truffle fries was sooooooo dry and wasn't even hot. I don't understand!

edlbM4pk5GiPX2SDBuhy_Q.text: Absolutely love the flavor and everything I've tasted here.  But went there yesterday (May 21, 2019) at 2:30pm and of course it was packed. Service, especially bartenders were lacking, as a former bartender, when people sit at the bar CHAT. Have conversations and check on food. My burger was under cooked and I spent most of the night in the bathroom.  The service really lacks communication and chatting with guests.

Uiyw-s4FLtruATjpl6_l_w.text: The food was awesome. The Backyard Burger was so good. The taste of the butter in the lettuce. Would definitely recommend eating here. The staff was good as well. This is my 2nd time going and I've enjoyed it just as the 1st time
