GvdquIyr2N6j_Qvp-3f6aQ.text: Spectacular burger...I had the bacon blue fig...unbelievable. Fries were outstanding...hot and salty!!

9pmbZUykN5lxYyPgzS1ivg.text: Excellent service and excellent food. What else does one expect from a GR establishment.  Our party raved about the Portabello Burger; the burger with the runny egg (done to perfection), and the creme brulee shake. I had the fish and chip burger which was very good ( can't help myself; I compare fish and chips to McMullen's, 3 miles away, and everyone else comes up short). I'd also like to suggest the white sangria, which is turning into a summer favorite. It's been awhile since I have been to GR Brgr; I'm sure I won't wait since long for my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j-iPS-CMipIX0EyszOuPOA.text: I have wanted to visit this restaurant ever since it opened, and finally had the occasion to do so this year.  I had so much hype filled in my head that I feared it would not live up to it.  Fortunately, everything about this experience was just fantastic.  Is the food expensive?  Sure it is, but then again, you are in Vegas, eating at a place founded by a celebrity chef.    For appetizers, we had the onion rings and the kettle chip nachos.  The onion rings were fried perfectly, with an airy and crunchy batter. The nachos had this amazing cheese sauce on them, and came with big piles of meat.  Both were better than expected.  For the main course, I ordered the farmhouse burger (bacon, egg, fancy cheese).  As per the chef recommendation, I went with medium rare.  The burger literally melted in my mouth as I ate it.  The combination of egg, burger, bacon, and cheese were sublime.  I can honestly say it was one of if not the best burger I have eaten.  Upon finishing it, I immediately thought about how I would order it again the very next day.  Overall, I can't say enough positive things about how delicious and amazing this place is.  Do yourself a favor and eat here, especially if you love burgers.

Tw738ZtdYc13I5l9qWRdcA.text: First and foremost it is rare that a "celebrity chef " owned sport seems to survive let alone thrive in a place like Vegas. There are some exceptions and it seems this Gordon Ramsay location has managed to keep up appearances and keep things rolling.  Lines, lines, everywhere there's lines , do this don't do that can you see those liiii-nnnes! Well yes if you don't time this one right you are facing a decent sized wait for everything including putting your bum down in a seat. They do a hefty lunch time business so better to get there north of 11:45 to avoid the crunch time. The late afternoon into early evening is also fairly well attended.  I have eaten here several times in the past few years or so since they opened. I actually think the food has gotten better and the consistency has also improved with age.  The Hell's Kitchen burger is a special kind of heat but not overpowering.  *Hells' Kitchen Burger isn't cheap at $17 and comes loaded with asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes and a jalapeno aioli. The quality of the ingredients shine through to make this one crave worthy.   The burger will leave you full and it is even big enough to share. The hot tip is to get two diff burgers and share with your dining partner. Offers a nice bit of variety.  Of course they offer a bunch of comfort food sides. The dipping sauces( flavored ketchup's) offer a bit of a twist.  Overall our meal was great if not a bit expensive for a couple of burgers and cokes with a shared order of fries.  Service was decent but they did get very busy towards the end of our lunch so refills, plate clearing and the check were a tad slow. All in all a great burger, central strip location and pretty nice peeps doing the serving.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. *Hells’ Kitchen Burger $17 asadero cheese, roasted jalapeños, avocado, roasted tomatoes, jalapeño aïoli

MlyGUa2sYbK6HZSWAcXRhg.text: I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and a side of fries and my boyfriend and I shared a Caesar salad. The salad was very well dressed and so delicious. The burger was juicy and well seasoned but wasn't as spicy as I was expecting. I didn't need any condiments or anything because it was so tasty on it's own. The fries however were a little dry and not what I was expecting. The dipping sauces were very interesting and one tasted somewhat like curry while the other one was like a ketchup. I really enjoyed my dining experience, however. The wait staff was amazing and very attentive. I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger

Jk3eY17fNdiscNW0rMdrrg.text: So, this review might not be so fair because we had arrived late at night close to closing, but my experience at Burger was lackluster. The restaurant wasn't crowded by any means, but service was a bit slow after we were seated. I ordered my burger medium and it came out medium well if not well done, and it was pretty dry. Our table also shared fries which was equally dry. Overall I think I was expecting much better and that they should cook their burgers as requested. My friends' burgers all came out much juicer than mine so maybe it was a one off. Overall I don't think I'd return here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zwp3g64pr3ZXtUGuJtWr3A.text: First time here and now I understand why there's always a line!    Food:  all of the burgers and dishes are well thought out and flavor execution is as good as it sounds on the menu.  Our favorites:  the chicken saltimbacco sliders are tasty.  Perfectly breaded, thin, fried chicken topped off with arugula salad that is dressed on a crispy toasted seasame brioche bun.  The onion rings were crispy and not oily, served with house made spicy ketchup and mayo. The mangalica pork burger wrapped in mangalica bacon and pulled pork is divine!  The forest burger is also amazing. All the flavors work well together and the meat temp came out exactly as ordered.  Service:  all the service staff was quick, friendly and attentive.  Our drinks were quickly refilled before empty.  Even though the restaurant was full, service was impeccable and food came up quickly.  I'm totally impressed with how well run this restaurant is and the food is deserving of the Gordon Ramsey brand.  Will be back to try some of the other burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n0lT4KWJE0hSBV3fLaotgQ.text: I've been here multiple times but never made a review. In the past I've always enjoyed the food here; this time I found hair in my food after having a bite. The server who was non-attentive finally comes by only because she noticed I was trying to get the Managers attention; when showing her my food she says oh that's small...like wtf!?!? One it's not, two I don't care, it's in my food. So she takes my plate, has them make me a new burger and after that didn't come by to check on us until it was time to give us the check. At no point did the manager come to check on us because I'm sure she didn't say anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stout  (front) Hell&#39;s Kitchen  (back)

IVxL_2-7upQQwcUt-u6hWg.text: Worst food poisoning I have ever experienced. I ate the farm burger, which was a major disappointment; I can do better at home. I ended up in the hospital because the vomiting wouldn't stop. (10/23/17) That was the only thing I ate that whole day. (No, I do not drink alcohol.) After being down for a couple days, I came back to my convention for work and found out a fellow member was sickened by Gordon Ramsay Steak the day after me becoming sick. Never will I ever eat there again!

yuM3NdfbfcmvUM0kWG0L9g.text: This review is for the hostesses and service only.  This is my favorite restaurant and the food is 5 stars, but the rude hostesses make me not want to return.  There were two groups ahead of me in line at 5:45 pm on a Friday night.  Half of the restaurant was empty, yet they were holding the line. I asked how long the wait was.  Without looking to see how long the line was, the hostess did 45 minutes. She must be psychic.  Food is great. Service is shit.  I can't imagine there would not be enough servers working at dinner time on a Friday night.

qJ1aLw-It_VnN6SI9JYLaA.text: First off, we were told it would be roughly a 20-30 minute wait... literally over an hour wait, although they took multiple large parties who got there after us.   Second, the food took quite awhile. The truffle fries came out quick, but the burgers took about 30 minutes.   Third, the burgers were not great. The beef patty is pretty small. And it was kind of dry and didn't taste very good. I got the blue burger and my friend had the farmhouse.   Absolutely not worth the wait or the money.

WB1S89TJ3nKJ8OirDSwI3A.text: The wait is long but I suspect they do it on purpose so the food will be delicious which it was. Had the sweet potato fries, wings, and hell something burger. Yummy but this review is for a worker that my plus one and I couldn't take our eyes off of. Found out his name is Levi. Whoever management is needs to take note of this employee. His heart and enthusiasm was in his work!  If I were local I would try to poach him. :) Half kidding

H6NpikKyt6AcY-wPc_29ug.text: Over a half an hour long line while you stand and look at half empty tables. Once the order was placed it was almost an hour to get the $17 burger that o asked for medium rare only to get a well done dried out burger. Never again. Even Gordon Ramsay should know you don't cook a burger to death. Maybe he should focus some of his yelling at these cooks.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dried out and not worth the wait.skip this tourist trap.

nPW-UvlMhlRKmLspxBKSyA.text: I've been to this amazing restaurant the last time when I visited Vegas and I was looking forward to the visit this time again! My burger was juicy and tasty, however, the server we had had an attitude. Her service made our experience this time pretty awful. I wouldn't consider to come back the next time when I'm in Vegas again!!! My friend and I didn't have a pleasant visit!

J2fGXcjvJyPl3KECjatkBA.text: Amazing. I have eaten here multiple times and will definitely come back again. I recommend the turducken burger.

vArnZb8Y69TL4wdAWHw9LQ.text: Helluva place. The service was amazing. Even after I screwed up my burger order, the staff moved to fix MY mistake like it was their own. I had the "Hells Kitchen" burger and it was awesome. Further more the truffle fries were amazing. My gf had the fish and chips which she loved.  Again the service here was phenomenal and the food great. I would go back just for the truffle fries and friendly atmosphere.

0pEFp6xch-RAiOEk3depMQ.text: Get Hog Burger (I think this is what its called). This review is based upon several month ago. I've been here with my girlfriend. Thank god! there were no waiting in line. We were seated promptly and servers were really attentive and nice. Ordered Hog burger with Goat Cheese burger (I don't know what it is called) and onion rings. Onion rings came out first to start, and it was like heaven in my mouth with their specialty sauce on the side. Burgers were great that time. Price is reasonable too, so I would not say anything bad about this place.  But the only downside is that it usually has such a freaking long line that de-appetite you by just looking at that long line, so be aware of that. If you can handle this long line, great place to go.

J1nLtdlxB6hiUP84WofFDg.text: Was disappointed - felt like we were in his show - cold food that took forever. It was super busy and we were very tired. Our server was very nice and on drink refills during the wait.

jNwbBQIguiM5Vsw3Hwlslg.text: Overrated. I had the truffles fries and the shrimp curried salad, neither was good. The fries tasted old. The shrimp with the salad was cold when served.   The wait to a table was one hour and the wait for food was another hour (even though the waiter told us 30 min).

wbatIx9olF5XQ1CuxZ_9cg.text: It was a great experience.. a wide selection of burgers which are new to me.. however it was very delicious. The service is very good too as well.. pesronaly i enjoyed the lobster and shrimp burger and the Mediterranean burger.. i highly recommend this restaurant

ZBOqE8ctvjCC_sC1eP23ng.text: Food was 5/5, Hilary (our server) was 0/5. First off Id like to say I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay restaurants and in my recent visit to Las Vegas I made an effort to visit every single of his restaurants (Steak, Pub, Hells Kitchen, Fish and Chips, and finally Burger). All the other restaurants were fantastic and I loved the food including this one! So you might wonder why a 2/5.... The service was terrible our server was Hilary and I cannot say one good thing about her, after sitting down we waited about 15 minutes before she made our way to our table after coming to our table she looked like she was not interested in serving us because we looked younger and maybe wont tip as much as the table next to us who she was all over. After asking for a drinks menu it came about 10 minutes after I asked, then took another 20 minutes for our drinks order. Every time she came to our table she was terrible and I saw her going up to other servers laughing and just chatting. She was terrible and if you have her as a server please ask for someone else.

a5slSqxEqxCUXdXw9qFXGw.text: I was thrilled with the food here! Absolutely delicious! I had the truffle fries, poutine fries, the Crown Burger, and a creme brulee milkshake as well as a Chamborita cocktail (I shared with others. Lol) The poutine fries we're by far the best poutine I've ever had! They were devoured in almost no time. The burger was wonderful and did the namesake of the restaurant proud! It was a good size, juicy, and the flavors mixed really well with each other. The drink was delicious and strong and the truffle fries were awesome! All in all, I really enjoyed myself! The price is rather off putting, though. The burger alone was $16. That didn't include any sides. The poutine fries were $14, the truffle fries $12 (you can get regular fries for $9), and the drink was $13. The portion sizes are good, though, so you definitely won't leave hungry! Definitely recommend for a nice night out!

zTUQSmOzY0rxMqoXXDqFhw.text: I'm so disappointed. I love Gordon Ramsey and my intent was to eat at all of his restaurants while in Vegas, but I always seemed to be too full from other meals and this was my only stop. We stood in line to get in mid afternoon and, while the line was long (to the end of the window), it went really fast. I read reviews that parties of two stand in line and larger parties go put their names in. I had a really tasty strawberry drink and we ordered the hellfire chicken wings, expecting them to be spicy, but they weren't at all. My bf, a huge wing fan, didn't like them, but I liked them, especially dipped in the sauce they brought on the side. We both liked this sauce and, when they tried to take it away, we asked them to leave it for our burgers - we were glad we did. My bf got the Hells Kitchen burger and I got an off menu burger that I was never told the name of, but it was topped with brisket, arugula, an aioli and picked shallots. My bf said his burger was just ok - underwhelming. I've never gotten tired of a burger halfway through...maybe it was because there was just so much meat on the patty, but I didn't get any other flavors coming through to give it a kick and it was just too much of the same flavor that I was sick of it. I ended up using some avocado and tomato from my bf's burger AND the sauce from the wings and even then it was just ok. I still didn't finish it. I wish I'd had a better experience - maybe I should have tried the lobster and shrimp burger?

mC2ayRqhZldzDWEjnDc9fQ.text: First off, the place was hard to find.. there are no signs and Yelp location is not accurate. The restaurant looked good but my first impression of the environment was not so good as the bad cigarettes smell of the casino was also in the restaurant. Then there was a slight wait and the hostess were wasting too much time chatting than helping customer. Once we sat down the service was friendly, but a bit too slow.. as it took at least 30 minutes to get our food after we ordered it; on top of that, they got my wife's order wrong. The only reason I gave a 2 star was because the servicer was friendly. Overall, the experience was a disappointment and my wife and I definitely will not be visiting the restaurant again. So sad because I had high expectations from a place that had Gordon Ramsey's name on it and I am a big fan of his shows.

k91DOia5Nrb6SD-wz0UJtw.text: By far the best burger I've ever had. I don't eat red meat and I got a turkey burger. I've eaten a lot of turkey burgers but never one they tasted exactly like a real burger. This one tasted like the real thing!! Ruined for all other burgers. Service was superb as well from the hostesses to waiter.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Aq2vX0veo_C8QZaTgDkliA.text: Came here with my wife for lunch on a Thursday afternoon. There was no line so we were seated right away. I have wanted to try this place for a while. My honest opinion is that yes, the burgers are good. I could taste the quality of the beef used and it was well seasoned. I had the jalapeno burger which was not really spicy, it just had a small kick. The bun is soft and the ingredients are good quality. I did not really enjoy the sweet potato fries as I found it strange that it had powdered sugar spinkled on it. The negative really has to do with the service. The servers are not that welcoming and act like it's a fast food restaurant as opposed to a sit down. No smiles, no welcoming, no "enjoy your meal." The food runner dropped off the food with a slam of the plate and didn't say a word. Also, this is a rather expensive meal for just a burger. If you are coming here, it's because of the name attached, not necessarily because of the quality of the experience or any value.

9VQQKrNLkOLHXjRCVyipDQ.text: I walked for 20 mins down the Las Vegas strip in 104 heat. Waited about 5 mins and had the BEST BURGER I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE! The servers are soo kind and are very good at their jobs! It was all worth it!! So so good.

oNgtffjzVzUrBlRazjcBgw.text: I would just like to thank all of the team members at Ramsay Burger.  Saw Gorden plug on it and took my family a few hours we got in to town.    Later that night I spent a good 10+ with food poisoning. The Dr. Said it could be from not washing there hands, bad food etc.   You have provided the most amazing start to my hard for time off.. Thanks you and your team of donkey!

b-HfDaL9-ZWNLg3Xa47xaA.text: My pregnant wife and I just got sat after waiting in line for over an hour, which I wouldn't have minded so much except that they were taking everyone it would be a 30 minute wait. Then, when we finally got seated and didn't see a waiter in the first 8 minutes, we were told as we ordered that it would be another 40 minutes before we got our food. If I would have know it would be almost exactly 2 hours from getting in line to receiving my food, I seriously would have gone to Panda Express. No overpriced burger is worth this. Las Vegas strip location.

y4AwENkfR0Ef2DhvRRscPg.text: I found this to be the best burger spot ever! They have so many options which is not typical. Who knew a pescatarian could find both a veggie burger and a lobster & shrimp burger! Resturant has a waiting line most of the time Resturant very busy however the staff was very attentive and happy to get anything you needed!  Will defiantly seek out the Ramsay Resturant in NYC next month.  Resturant decor may scare someone off because the presentation would lead you to believe it would be very expensive....... but honestly the menu is priced quite modestly and the quality of food exceeded expectations! Treat yourself

W1ZG05crTDWKv1MSRWvWVQ.text: best burger! truffle fries...omg! so damn good. of course it's pricey and you're going to wait awhile..worth the wait...worth the money..you won't be disappointed:)

hAxJCCOlr0gfaNbXPG07uQ.text: Probably the best burger I've ever eaten! F-word burger and truffle fries were incredible! Can't wait to go back. Delicious Irish Mules as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. F Word Burger

UFbB7vLTrDqs7vBG3ofugQ.text: Service is slow.    The hellfire wings were disappointing. It was a premium price for those wings and what we got was something not far better from Safeway instacart wings with carrot shavings and bits of blue cheese thrown on top.    For the burger, I ordered the special which had a teeny tiny bit of rib meat thrown on top of the patty. Patty was a nice thickness, but the diameter was terribly disappointing.  Cabbage slaw in the burger was typical and nothing special.   This will be the last time I eat on the strip

3tjNFTiqFUbOXmzse5qTQw.text: I hope someone reads this review, and do something about it. The food is delicious, pricey... but good.  The wait time takes away from the experience. We have been waiting for over 45 minutes, while two spots at the bar and two tables were free, I pointed to the hostess the free space at the bar, she responded that the station was not cleaned! No one was available to clean it for 45 minutes!!! Then she said that a server had to be available to wait on us.  I witnessed at least 8 people leaving the waiting lane.  After we sat down, we waited for another 35 minutes for our food, we ordered chicken wings and two burgers, they brought the burgers but forgot the wings! They were cold.  Not happy at all. If you ever go there, make sure to not be hungry, the wait is just ridiculous.

moc33LvXaaVLUXtGW6tWxQ.text: There was a huge line when I came across GRB one night in Vegas. I was alone, so went to the hostess and asked if there was bar seating available -- which there was, at the Kitchen Bar! I immensely enjoyed watching the kitchen staff execute at a pace and with a focus you would expect from a GR kitchen. I had the special burger. Of course it was great. I ate half, and had the other half for breakfast the next morning. Dare I say it was better cold from the fridge the next morning? 4 stars because of price... I had a burger, fries, 2 beers, and I spent $50+. Not a surprise given you are in Vegas, but... the value makes it a one-time visit.  Check it out!

hEUWXE_6UEM2MVGGsSu5QQ.text: + THE FOOD This is the best burger I've ever had!! It was so good that we came back again during our short trip to Vegas before we left. The first burger I tried was the Hell's Kitchen burger. This was absolutely perfect since it had nice spicy flavors to it and huge portions of avocados. The burger was extremely juicy- so much that I spilled it all over myself. The flavors were perfect- not too salty but still good enough to keep you wanting for more. The second burger I had was the Farmhouse Burger. While this one wasn't as the first burger I tried, it was still pretty good. A lot of the flavor came from the egg only. The truffle fries were amazing. There was a lot of truffle flavor to it but the best part came from the dipping sauces! There is a garlic aiola type of sauce and a sweeter ketchup, which might be curry ketchup. Definitely would pay a visit whenever I'm back in Vegas.

MgNfQe3aTJAl1Z7FxjPcgw.text: WOW . . . I mean. . . WOW  Not many places make me say WOW in a review with all caps, but Gordon Ramsay achieved that twice in Las Vegas! This was one of the two amazing meals thanks to Chef Ramsay!  Came by around 6:00pm on a Tuesday, not too busy and did not wait at all. We sat right by the flaming wall which really gave us a Gordon Ramsay Hell's Kitchen experience!   I will start off with the biggest and quite frankly the only downside to the night...our waiter. All the other waitstaff and hostesses seemed so nice, friendly, easy going . . . but ours was an absolute ass. We sit down and don't even open our menu and asks what we want to eat. Really? The rest of the night he kept coming by trying to force us out. We didn't care, we ate and relaxed, left him no tip.  ANYWAYS now for the absolute best part - THE FOOD!  We ordered a few things, I will list them from least favorite to most favorite!  Pork Belly Hot Pockets - little hot pocket like pastries filled with pork belly, bacon marmalade, and topped with tomato jam and herb aioli. The flavors were honestly great. Tender, juicy pork belly, savory sauces, but it was just so little. For $12, the price to portion ratio just gave a lack of True enjoyment! But still good none the less   Farro-Quinoa & Chicken Salad - this was surprisingly great! A HUGE salad that my mom couldn't finish, even splitting with my dad and I, it was so much food! the chicken was juicy and cooked perfectly, the vegetables were all cooked to a delicious soft texture, the lemon vinaigrette was light and fresh, and the cheese added a nice creamy sweetness!   Jalapeno Poppers - These were the. best. jalapeno poppers. I. have. ever. had. WOW!  they bring out a long tray of six poppers, each in their own sauce cup. The poppers are HUGE! no cheapness there. The batter is thin, amazingly crispy, deliciously flavored, and inside ...WOW! jalapenos were soft, fresh, and filled with creamy thick bacon cheddar sauce! Then the sauce each popper was dipped in . . . the cheddar ranch sauce . . .OMG . . . thick, savory, salty, rich, cheesy, ranchy, absolutely amazing combination !   Last but not least, the star of the night and the whole vacation - the Truffle Burger!  Let's start with the bun . .the soft, delicious, toasted, poppy-sesame seed bun . . . excellent! Then the thick, amazingly wood grilled patty, so juicy and tasty, perfectly paired with the following condiments . . . truffle tremor cheese, oh so cheesy, warm, creamy, slightly nutty, coating your mouth in cheesy goodness. Topped with foie gras creme fraiche, continually coating your mouth while mixing with the cheese for a  savory, salty, slightly gamey flavor and creamy texture. All of this topped with truffle aioli . . oh man, this was the softest, juiciest burger I have ever eaten! Adding some fresh crunch with the frisee lettuce, this is seriously one of my top three favorite hamburgers I have ever. ever. EVER. eaten.   Chef Gordon Ramsay has brought Vegas an affordable, delicious, amazing dining experience with some of the best food you will ever have the pleasure to enjoy!

dOyI3A06cUaIMd5vriivvw.text: It's a very good option for gourmet burgers. The F-Burger is not listed in the menu (beef and barbecue pulled pork) and Lobster & shrimps are the best. Include chicken wings as entree. Ask fries with truffle mayonnaise. A drafted beer like New Castle it's a must.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The F-Burger. Not listed in the menu. Beef and barbecue pulled pork.

yWTuGD0kU64NM79nl1zXrg.text: Staff were SUPER friendly. The GM was especially nice to chat with as I sat at the bar area by kitchen. Burger was good, but it was not mind blowing or worth the long wait in the line and for it to arrive. Disappointed with the fries..... a burger paired with bad fries totally brought down my review. On a brighter note, their new cocktail (cannot remember name but it was pink) was on point! Not too sweet and strong!

As8ax9qCf8_2ykK3blRsCQ.text: Craving a burger in Vegas?  Look no further because this might be one of the best burgers in town.    Came here with a group of friends after driving in from LA. Got to the restaurant at 4pm and was seated immediately. When you first look at the menu you might think the burgers are pricey, but each burger comes with a considerable amount of beef.  I ordered the Forest Burger for myself and our table got the Parmesan truffle fries and sweet potato fries to share.  The Forest Burger comes with mushrooms, tremor cheese, arugula, and duck bacon.  This is my definition of a gourmet burger! The combination of all the ingredients was perfect; no item dominated the other.  If you aren't super hungry, sharing a burger is definitely reasonable, but be sure to ask for a knife to split the burger.  The Parmesan truffle fries are a MUST.  They might have changed up the way they serve this because the first time I ate here (maybe a year ago) it came with shoestring French fries, melted parmesan cheese, and truffles on top. My most recent trip, they came out with thicker pieces of fries, truffles, and shredded Parmesan.  Both times the fries were phenomenal and full of flavor.  Make sure to dip your fries in the garlic aioli sauce that comes on the side, you will thank me later.

4G4f6zjiE8zu9ln8Md2YPQ.text: We have been there several times and it always exceeds our expectations. The service is amazing and the food is great.

1ytZ5TjcesipJLvpkH54kQ.text: Goood f***in BURGRs!  After a long day of starving and drinking at a pool party this was the perfect carb and protein boost at 5pm! Tried their tandoori chicken burger, Hell's Kitchen burger and truffle fries! Truffle fries  Hell's Kitchen Burger  Tandoori Chicken Burger   The chicken was really tender! But it didn't do any justice to the name. The taste didn't really hit the spot and it didn't really give the punch of a tandoor! Would say it's something that you can try once to judge it for yourself.  But for a die hard lover of Real Tandoori Chicken, this was a slight let down.

G23xJbtrEN8VWnfYVDzPtg.text: I walked up to the place, inside of planet Hollywood, and there was a giant line. So I saw a couple of single seats open at the bar, so I asked the hostess if they were available, and got instant seating. I got the burger with the egg on it it was fantastic. I also got the truffle Parmesan fries and they were terrific as well.  I will definitely come back here.

uB_7CJH1q-CIXPHO4HCFeA.text: Amazing burger. It is well worth the wait. You can have anything from a traditional burger to a crazy concoction. A must have while in Vegas. I suggest making a dinner reservation at 4. There will still be a wait, but something that is "reasonable." The service is very good. Definitely what I would expect from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.

b-GWXmNwN3hE8H0vaWtxaQ.text: Never say you've had the best burger till you've tried the burgers at gordon ramsay burger. Honestly, there's no joking around here ^^  I tried their Crown burger and it was life changing. Gotta say it kinda sucks cuz they raised the bar so damn high! Definitely get the truffle parmesan fries. It's amazing plus it comes with in house made ketchup and truffle aioli dipping sauces. And their jalapeno poppers were fire. Is it weird I only look forward to eating here when I think about vegas ^^

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m49_u5QSUKye_f9Xbv8KHw.text: Where a burger and fries feels like fine dining!  The chipotle ketchup makes an otherwise average French fry into a taste explosion!  I recommend going off menu for the delicious anniversary burger. Medium rare and it's a party in your mouth!

xQAXFIck7oS-1ls9jWWnAQ.text: The wings are worth trying. They are a good size and have a great flavor. We paid around $75 for a party of two. The food taste good, but it's not the best I have ever had. It's all about the hype. Just a one time thing. Wasn't too impressed. Great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PDIwANviFr-Wuno_CzQcfQ.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had. I had the Hells Kitchen Burger per the servers recommendation and it was bomb.com! I added an egg which was over cooked, I asked for over medium and for the egg to be runny. That was a #fail but the burger was so good that I didn't even care! LOL Also give the burger a solid 25 minutes to cook, I never knew a burger could/would take that long LOL The truffle fries I didn't care for because they were too thick and heavy for my tasted but we got them because they were also highly recommended. My sister loved them. They were just too thick and rich for my taste buds. His ranch and ketchup were so good! If you like a spicy burger full of flavor this is it! I did eat the WHOLE THING in ONE SITTING LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hella kitchen burger was so good!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries. Too rich for my taste but people love it!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved the sign with fire all around it!

VONSLlYUuYzR-3ISKIYoLA.text: Long wait for table, which at least they can text you to head back when it's almost ready. (over 1 hour then waited another 15 min front of the hostess)   Then no food still after 45 minutes of sitting there!! Was told the food takes 25/30 minutes to come out usually after the fact. Shouldn't that warning be given?  Had to make a show which we couldn't continue to wait another 15 minutes the waiter told us it would be. What a waste of time while in Vegas!! Lots to do and see instead of sitting there. So many options around, why was I starving?!?  How can any establishment with Gordon Ramsey's name not produce 3 burgers, a salad, and fries in 45 minutes and counting... Sad and really disappointing.

iuvWbCsjCBegEUlIcYdnxw.text: Dining at Gordon Ramsay burger is a great experience if you are a fan of Gordon Ramsay. If you are all about the burger experience, you may want to approach with caution.   I didn't have a bad dining experience at GRB. The service was exceptional and the food was good. The problem for me was the prices. At the end of the day, it is burger and fries, yet I felt like I paid such a high price for what I was getting. Two burgers, one order of fries and three beers was over $90 after tip, which seems extreme to me. I get that you pay a premium on the strip, but this seemed out of hand. There are other places on the strip that have better burgers and for a lesser price.   Again, if you a Gordon fan, then definitely hit this place up. If you are just looking for a burger, you may want to pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You get to preview the menu while waiting in line.

W2krjq929Sec1mdHLdpD6w.text: We were excited to try a Gordon Ramsay joint in Vegas. We really didn't think it would live I'm to the hype but it did.  It's a Very good burger place. We bought the farm house burgers. Perfectly cooked fried egg. Well done meat patty, the right amount of melty cheese. It was a nice ratio of simple quality ingredients. Think it might be even better with Arugula and tomato.  On the side we ordered the truffle chips which were also very good. I think it's a great place for a lunch burger if you want a quality burger but do t want to go insane with the $. Well worth the 20min wait for a table.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger ($17)

J3-T6GDaSTjbwJZjhFenmw.text: A long line to get a table, but not for the bar seats. Great service the burger was amazing and the waiter gives you a description of your meal. You need to order the fries with toppings and again the waiter will let you know what to expect. Next time I'm in Las Vegas I now where I'm having dinner.

8foQEzA9a1eXhdhKeGgu-Q.text: amazing!!!!!! amazing!!!! best service....best food...best burger....best best sweet potato fries...fabulous decor...#heavenskitchen

sUE0Ev1X1MWVSnWdDt_RTg.text: My friend and I stopped here on a Monday morning right before our flight out of Vegas because we were staying at Planet Hollywood. We were hungry at 10:30am after we checked out and decided to gamble and have a drink at the Extra Lounge adjacent to the bar.   Before we knew it, we turned around and saw that a line was already forming for the restaurant. We were seated quickly and our server was super friendly. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger which was just a little spicy and cooked to a perfect medium. My friend got the farmhouse burger which she enjoyed but she ended up requesting a side of avocado to add because she wanted to add a bit of freshness to her burger bc the beef patty, egg, and bacon was just a lot of fat. She was told there was a $3 charge for it but when we got the checks it was $4. We were in a hurry and didn't mention it. The avocado they add to the burgers (whether it comes with it already or on the side is just one big piece of 1/4-1/3 of an avocado which I wish they'd just slice thinly and fan on top of the burger. I ended up doing this myself.  We also split an order of fries which was plenty between the two of us. They are steak fries and not especially crisp on the outside but tasted fine. It came with what I think was curry ketchup and a house made one so if you're just into Heinz, you might have to bring your own.   Overall a great burger, nice staff, and would stop at again if I were staying or doing something closeby.

ZQkYLc2wdX89X5W-4jO29g.text: We were on our way out to head home and decided to eat here. Almost changed my mind because of the long line out front. It went by surprisingly fast and we sat to eat. Service was exceptional and the food was outstanding as we have become a custom to with Gordon Ramsay restaurants. If your looking for a burger in Las Vegas give it a try!!

g6ZlNllc8wYdtrpmu3Ejmg.text: Service was good.  And the nachos were delicious.  But we came here for burgers and fries, and those were a major letdown.  I think it comes down to fundamentals with a burger:  the preparation and arrangement of the components, the cooking of the burger, the presentation on the plate....those were all failures for 3 of the 4 dishes.  (One eater liked his Hells Kitchen burger).  Burgers were red-to-pink for medium-well!  And the pickles on one burger were all haphazardly centered in the middle so half the pickles had to be pulled off and the burger rearranged.  Minor quibble but we ARE talking about an $18 burger!  Bacon was soft and chewy on two burgers, and hard as a rock on another.  And the fries!  Just terrible.  Oversalted, and some strange ketchup/tabasco(?) combination, we left the fries alone.  Overall, very disappointed in the Brits' re-imagination of an American classic!

WYMJmRgmxF_lR4DGanFr1A.text: I was pretty disappointed. The burger was OK, nothing really special. You could get an equivalent burger at Red Robin for less money. I have been to other famous chefs burger joins, like Bobby Flay's or Spike Mendelsohn, and their burgers are really amazing and worth the price. So I was expecting something similar to theirs and not a normal burger like what I got. I was also annoying to be told that the burgers take 25 mins to cook. I have cooked plenty of burgers in my life and they definitely take less time the 25 mins.

LjYwVM3WIGuImfAoiXsWyw.text: The burgers are good, but damn, get ready to wait in like for like 30 mins and then wait another 45 minutes for a burger. This is what you get to trying to get a burger with Gordon Ramsay's name on it.

JlI1IFdUxRkKpfJEnbYImA.text: Walking The Strip we knew we wanted to eat somewhere special, which is why we came here for dinner. The lineup to get a table had a wait time of 35 minutes but no worries, the staff took down my number and texted when a table was ready.

PLKj73AJqDYPLpPY_0VVvQ.text: Wouldn't want to wait and waist my Time in for a Burger that wasn't so great, very pricy as well. Save your money for some real good restaurants on the strip.

WCS-WHWHNvmUxl3RaS1TSA.text: I'm a huge Gordon Ramsey fan so I was excited to try it, his main restaurant is out of me per diem budget so I thought this was a good alternative. I got the ultimate cheeseburger and liked it a lot. I liked it even more after I put the spicy ketchup that came with my fries on. The fries were good, seemed like pretty standard steak fries but not totally worth $8 price tag.  All together, burger fries and one drink was $45 with tax and tip. Food was good but price tag may be a turnoff to some

Nx2ODThv3KxJSBnlv9p2yg.text: Ate at the Restaurant in planet Hollywood casino. Burger was good but lacked some bacon in it. When we complained to the server he brought us some bacon slices but then charged us $3 for it!  Not good customer service!

Y6w-3XwIJ99Fp58lCs2PaA.text: The hamburger was very dry tasted like my burger had bread crumbs in it maybe all the filler went into my patty one of the worst gourmet burgers I have had disappointed at best.  The waiter just said I will tell the chef :(

8-JZ37Ft7kWdwGQ3W6wm_g.text: Most amazing burger place in the world. Quality of the burger and how all the components of it came together are absolutely amazing. Prices are reasonable, wonderful ambiance. Service is fast and waiters are polite and caring. Definite MUST TRY restaurant !

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LIbnBID7gr32RGSeL8fQtA.text: First of all there is an hour wait on average to get in which is kind of fun since you're in the middle of the casino and you're anticipating Gordon Ramsay's finest Burger. We're greeted very warmly and the staff is very friendly. Our waiter was Matt. He was super attentive and great service. The steak fries and it was really five star good. We had the Mediterranean burger and the blue cheese burger. Honestly the burgers were not great at all. My bad luck. we both ordered medium rare My burger was way over salted and way overcooked and very burnt taste with hardly any veggies in it. we have very high expectation and high respect for mr. Gordon Ramsay. I mentioned all above to our waiter. No discounts was offered or exchange, but I hope they talk to the chef and get this sorted cause the tables next to us were complaining about the same thing. Will try again next time we are in Vegas. Love the atmosphere and all staff friendliness.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zkHDTp1LBu316v2ojdeCpg.text: 1. Amazing truffle fries 2. Sea food burger-shrimp/lobster was amazing - but pricey - 4.5* 3. Hells kitchen burger- pretty good 4.5 * 4.Hogs burger - good

xfQsbhMr5q7z8dJgra8elw.text: Great atmosphere! I got the  Backyard Burger (impossible /vegan). Really tasty. Would come back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JDXT_kDJqZBn6BbWZC7FQg.text: Hell's burger is one to try if you're unsure of which burger to get or this is your first time, as other reviewers mentioned, most of the time medium well cooked more than medium well is supposed to be cooked, beer battered onion rings are also good.

WkqSY4VxfMLdKWp98nCaoQ.text: This is the best burger place in Vegas. I just spent 5 days with the family in Vegas and we visited a number of burger places.    Pros - the service is terrific!!!  They have a very organize waiting process for table which is not the case at most places.  Everyone is friendly.  And food is delicious!!!  No cons  Burgers are great, also try the BBQ sandwich-I loved it.  Truffle fries are great and so are the onion rings.

ey9NMzzF5RMaEzOTVk1D-Q.text: I am happy to be here. it was very delicious. I recommends hog bugger! french fry also was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
