Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5Ip0gt8wdLq-oFJYwPti8A.text: Always entertained by Ramsay's TV shows..so thought we would give one of his restaurants a try.  Disappointed!  Every bite was pure SALT!  Had the mushroom burger, turkey burger and truffle fries.  It all tasted the same...salty!  Giving 2 stars for good service only!

UfsSslpOLLQUQG9t6ff4Tg.text: Best burger I have ever tasted. I had the hog burger. Not a burger fan by the way, however i got dragged into this place by the best in who just had to have a burger

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

U3hplAKW9O-PSUwRw9nBTg.text: Yummy food. Our server did not check on us as often when we needed things. He was in the corner talking with other employees, we had to waive him but otherwise everything else was amazing

wMsMdIScih5hMjFTZM_YDg.text: We sat at the bar and waited for our burgers to be delivered for over an Hour. Sorry. It don't seat us hear after being 5 couples front the front of the line. 45 minutes later we were told  that it takes 35 minutes.

dU1dGWPsN4Ww7h_tjGCzEw.text: WOW.  Let's start with the onion rings. No doubt the best I've ever had and I ordered them as appetizer at the suggestion of my waitress Julia to nibble on while they make my Backyard Burger. Great suggestion. Now it's time to move on to the Backyard Burger. The burger was delicious, sweet pickles were a great addition to the burger. Lettuce, onions and tomatoes were fresh. So with all that being said. Hats off to this amazing burger.  Ok. What about dessert? I had to try the Cream Brulee Oreo Shake.  It sounded good on the menu and was even better on the taste buds. Great food and service makes this an easy  5 Star Review from me.

Gwtpu9XMAhbF43vOYi4X2w.text: Awesome service thank you Michelle , awesome food, make sure to get the Oreo creme brulee Shake.

Ji9z219OdTzEzcbXof2uew.text: The selection of beers and craft cocktails at Burger is awesome. I ordered the Farmhouse 14 Burger, which was incredible. I had prepared medium rare, and it was loaded with dublinar cheese, mangalitsa bacon and a fried egg. Yummy!!!  Highly recommend the food and beers.  Unfortunately, I had to give Gordon Ramsay Burger only 1 star due to the service. It was not good, specifically one person. The actual service was good once a tall bartender named Michelle helped my girlfriend and me. The other bartender named Petey was solid, too.  Eric was a total jerk. He was very condescending and rude. It seemed as if he was unhappy to be at work and it was an inconvenience to serve my us. He was making rude comments about a prior customer to us. Uhhh, it was tacky.  Topping it off, Eric was extremely disrespectful and sexist to the girl bartender. The constant barrage of talking down towards the girl bartender was such a turn off. My girlfriend and I decided to leave after paying our bill, heading over to Heart Bar for drinks instead.  If Eric had a better attitude towards us and his co-workers, we would have stayed. Hopefully this was just a circumstance on which he was having a bad day. It still doesn't excuse the chauvinistic and disrespectful attitude directed at women our entire meal.  I will definitely be back for the food and beers, but not if Eric is working. Well, I could handle it, but no chance my girlfriend would want to be served by him ever again. Glad there were other bartenders available to help out and the food was delicious.

9ZM9DdCvAHevw9j_mKi8uA.text: Waited in line 45 min. Then once we were seated waited another 10min before anyone came to our table. We had a weird thing happen when a second  waiter came up and said our waitress had gone home. We witnessed her the whole time waitressing other tables right next to us. Finally ordered our food and it took 45 min before we were served. Food was good but not worth the wait.  Gordon  Ramsey you need to work on service here.

0ZYSJhjh2-OBXIu7rjsq2A.text: First place we stopped while visiting Las Vegas, it was a great choice! We had the kettle chip nachos and a Hell's Kitchen burger. Everything from the service to the food was excellent.

xJC3QrzjYS9lOKilVE1SBg.text: The burger was good. The service was also very good and friendly. The reason for "just" three stars is the very long waiting time. We had to wait approximately 50 minutes to get a table.

2FdSNrV02vGto3nDFV_A-Q.text: I went with my family and got stuck at the kids table  unfortunately. But nonetheless, server was super nice and accommodating! The fries were the BOMB and the burger was delicious

kUhXvZR_jhVbyI0mSLV8sg.text: We were able to cut the queue and sat at the bar!  The brown butter and pecan shake was amazing!!!  I got sliders and shared poutine.  Both dishes were nice but I was pretty stuffed and couldn't eat it all!  We waited at least half an hour for our food after it was ordered but I guess it was pretty busy!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

F_miWWqKaYYSjTqlyhHKpg.text: 2 stars for service. Place was empty. 3 ladies in the front were friendly. Seated quickly but then nothing. No server. No water. Nothing. We got up and left after 10 minutes waiting to order which is probably a good but overpriced burger. $15.00 and up with no sides from the menu only. As we left the gal said thanks for coming not remembering we had just walked in. Who knows if tbe food would. E good. We are now at PBR Rock Bar. Already better service. Hopefully the  food is good.

2SvbTQVSyw0AuZMHcjTHHA.text: It's just OK. The fries are pretty good though. Not worth standing in line but it is planet Hollywood so what you see is what you get. Stay classy Vegas

p4x75ZOI0bwuvc0Kx0aVEg.text: Excellent service, amazing food, came very quick, vintage Gordon Ramsay. If you ain't a big burger fan my mate had hot dogs he also really liked them. Best food we have had in Las Vegas by miles.

AMYO5gyJFFGXp6Gs58ozyw.text: It was awesome 3 years ago but this time the burger patty was really dry. They dont have the coffee shake anymore either.

OEDmZXwYXJs_Djyqwc4ujg.text: It's not worth it. We waited in line for 40 minutes starting at 3:45 pm. If you're in a party of two, they won't take your phone number and send a text when a table is ready. You just have to stand there.   My knees were aching by the time we finally sat down. The food is good, but it was also expensive ($62 for two burgers including $4 for a tiny bit of avocado, lemonade, and a shared order of fries.   So wait time + expense means I won't go again. If they start using text messages or buzzers for parties of two, maybe. But no way will I stand in a 40 minute line again so I can pay $25 for a burger).

sko7jtTORMZr9el_uXuGww.text: I ordered the Forest burger and it was so good! The burgers don't come with fries, you have to order them separately. The parmesan fries were also good! Definitely recommend this place.

zv4Zez_jPHlApsQiM8v6ng.text: Hands down the best burgers we've had in a long long time! We tried the hell's kitchen burger and it was simply magnificient, so good we came back the day after and had another ! The flavours all came perfectly together with the roasted tomatoes and delicious aioli making the burger! At some point there was meat that came out of the sandwich and just having the meat plain was also delightful, cooked perfectly ! We also had the Crown burger and both of them were so good you can't have them with anything else, i.e fries. You will want to bite in and take your time to allow all the flavours to be enjoyed. I didn't want my burger to end!  Service was also fantastic !

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dZogeOQoDuonLXwyvlO71Q.text: It's a burger place. It's good. But It's a burger. Nothing amazing, nothing special. Would I come again? Maybe if someone insisted. Was this the best burger I ever had? Definitely not.  Food was ok but that's about it.

Pk3YBfFM7MdVrDYMnugOqg.text: Service was fantastic and food was great! Only downside was our order took quite a while, about an hour fifteen from when we were seated. However, our server Jessica took great care of us! Had a great time eating and chatting with my friend during the visit. We ordered the hog burger and the farmhouse burger. Hog burger had great flavor and the farmhouse burger was a great mid-afternoon lunch pick. Truffle fries were tasty, without being too heavy on the flavor as well. Thanks for the food!

AD6_lDzVn0tmtcdqex5h2Q.text: Went there for lunch and ordered to go. The food came out fast! Was still hot when i received it!! It tasted amazing and the customer service was just as good!!!! Definitely recommend the truffle fries. Although they don't have bbq sauce (which i love on my burger) i didn't need it . I didn't even put any condiments because the pickles added soo much flavor .

5Et817tYihFqtZdrS8RKLg.text: ** Good but I'm not sure it's worth $25 and the line!**  Happened across this new burger place located in planet Hollywood. There was a line and someone told us the the wait was 2 hours or 2 people.   We decided to order take out at the front corner and wander around the Casino while we waited  1 hour...  for a burger (yikes)  They have a lobster burger which was intriguing but we ordered the steak cut Truffle fries ($11 amazing) and 2 burgers: Hell's Kitchen (most popular) with jalapenos  and the Patriot (Turkey burger with shoestring frites and cherry compote)   Total cost was around $48 or $25 each ( we shared fries). Serving size is reasonable. all in all a good burger but Vegas is  overpriced, he's a world renown chef, and I'm sure I won't return - there's too many options

yBszlAo6FY2YvzF5y5YCbg.text: As far as Vegas food sites, there are more than someone could cover in a lifetime. This is my second visit in 5 years, and I will continue to come back.  Decor: They just finished up a rebuild, and it looks stunning. The same fireplace entrance is there to give people wanting selfies more than they could ask for. Comfortable seating and bar area.   Service: It's a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, of course it was good. Just be nice and respectful to the servers and they will do the  same to you. I was a little off put when the hostess told me my party could be moved up if I gave her what everyone in Vegas wants...money.    Food: The food has always been spot on. I had a burger with a specialty pork on it. It was super filling, I had to force the fries down too. I can't comment on the drinks, I don't drink alcohol anymore.   Overall: This is a really nice place, great for tourists. It's expensive like all the food there, but worth the wait.

Ki9EudJrXV_v4-QnwLqJNg.text: My favorite burger place OMG!!!! We went for late brunch and when we fall in love. Words can explain how amazing this place

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nljtha_V1MOiPJhudNypZA.text: Perfect burger and service ever. I wish there is a branch in Boston. The Hell's kitchen burger is the best.

uXHbjGxDq4wxOrzwxk2g1g.text: The party, which is arguably the most important part of a burger, is pretty plain and bland. Didn't feel flavorful. I couldn't taste much if it. The bun was ok. I really like egg buns and think it may be a better match. The Bacon was the greatest bacon I have ever tasted in my life. I bacon alone could be worth buying. It has a great portion of fat to meat and has a nice crisp to it where it isn't like a chip and has a perfect blend of crisp and flex to it. The house spicy ketchup is some of the best freaking spicy ketchup I've ever had. You can taste the sweetness of the tomato and the slight kick of the spice. I also got the burnt end poutine which is very excessive for one. The fries themselves are very bland, but the Burt ends were amazing. It isn't your traditional burnt ends like how we do it in Texas, but it's still very tender. It has more of a sweetness to it and very much lacks the smokeiness I'm used to, but never the less still have a very interesting twist of flavor

rtwxSHISJq5Qed1bVURB-g.text: The experience was great.  Food was delicious.  The company outstanding.   The curry dipping sauce was out of the world.    The Carmel Pecan Shake was delicious,  more shake less whipped cream next time.   See you soon Las Vegas.

avdkIoKOIXQTw0YQo3Ck4w.text: We got the hell's kitchen burger and the curry chicken burger. They were both slightly above average and that's what gives this place a 2 star rating. There ends the pros of this place.  There were more than enough tables to get us seated, yet we waited for 15 minutes just to get a table. We ordered a creme brulee shake that we received after I was almost done eating my burger. No apology for the service?   Overall service was horrible. So much for being a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Not going to return to this place.

d677PCghTTBjhXOv1SIXjA.text: Oh boy Gordon would be yelling at these people if he was here when I went. The first flaw is that if there are two or less people you have to wait in line, if there are 3 or more they will text you when your table is ready which meant people after me got seated well before me. So after over 1 hour plus wait got seated at an empty bar which could have been filled sooner, ordered 2 burgers and fries and had to wait 45-50 minutes for our food and the bacon was burnt to a crisp on one. We watched as a male manager played on his phone and stuck his thumb up his ass and did nothing to make things more efficient or to help. The chefs and cooks were busting their butt, but if this place cannot handle the load they should not be open. I hope Gordon Ramsay reads this and makes some changes

96DITUbG5CT5of27vIoVLg.text: We had a midnight dinner here on our last night in Vegas and we're glad that we did. We were considering eating here since the first day of our trip. But every time, we turned back because of the long wait time. This place does not take reservations so there's usually a queue of people waiting to be seated. And on holidays, it can be a while before you can get in. So, we decided to check it out one last time during the trip, and thankfully, there was no queue at the time.   We ordered the Truffle Parmesan Fries, the vegetarian Portobella Burger and the Hell's Kitchen Burger (replaced with a Chicken patty). The fries were good. The mushroom in the Portobella was a tad bit overpowering for me towards the end. But nevertheless, it was delicious. My husband had the Hell's Kitchen Burger. He prefers white meat to red. So, they offered to replace the patty with a Chicken patty. The Hell's Kitchen is a spicy burger. It could be a bit too hot for someone who does not eat a lot of spice. But since my husband does, he loved it.  The atmosphere is great and so is the service. We will definitely go back the next time we're in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portabella Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Fries

zdCBRrdJ54VzWGZRLddlbw.text: Best burger ever.  Best onion rings...EVER.  and the milkshake while it brings all the boys in yard...I wouldn't share because it was too good to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OpcAlje9Mxcp79gyGEmBRw.text: Worth the hype, worth the wait.  THE juiciest burger I've ever had in my life.  The exact flavor you want and need when you're craving "that" kind of burger.  Every mouthful has you pausing to take in the texture, aroma and savory bliss of the bun, meat and all your other toppings.  My mouth is watering all over again.  LOVED IT.  Other stuff: the poutine fries were - eh - for me; the star wasn't the fry, it was the pepper....a bit too much, actually.  There were some cheese curds that the menu said were included, but were not visible and didn't add anything.   The drink recommended and mixed by the bartender was good; I might go with a cold beer next time; it would just fit better.    Ambiance is fun, kids can eat there - it's pretty loud, so even if they have spunk and volume like my daughter, it probably wouldn't be too off-putting.  Loved that they sold regular memorabilia (t-shirts, hats) but also had glassware, coasters, bottle openers and cookbooks.  Cool place - can't wait to go back!

tTPUct0BN2BYiWN23Df-aw.text: Nice check in process for parties of 3 or more. Give em your number and they text an update.  The service was excellent, very personable and prompt.  The food was hardcore meh status. I ordered a chicken burger, it was dry and kinda lame. The rest of my party ordered other various burgers and quite enjoyed them! So avoid the chicken burger and you'll be fine.  Kinda pricey, but nice vibes. Worth a visit.

vpqSpoZeTuYAtOXJmth3dQ.text: Is it weird that I read everything on the menu in Gordon Ramsay voice?  Big dawg was huge and full of flavor. Crown burger cooked just right but feel like it needed more oomph. Still enjoyable. Parmesan truffle fries are amazing.  Wait is a little long so be prepared during prime times.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown burger with a big dawg creepin&#39; behind

-lRO3L_oOtn1xQ88Umo63Q.text: One of the best burgers I've had. Truffle fries were great. There was a wait but they texted us when they were ready to seat us.

_c6Z5cSrlB0_eCnj08MPkQ.text: This place was awesome! We had to wait about 25 minutes to be seated, but it was not a big deal at all. The line moved quickly to be seated, and the wait was definitely worth it! We got the Street Corn Dip as an appetizer, and it was soooooo good! The Hell's Kitchen Burger was awesome too. We had the Sticky Toffee Pudding Ice Cream Sandwich for dessert.... that was one of the best desserts I have ever had. If you go, you absolutely must get it for dessert no matter how full you are. It is soooooo good!!

aQ_aR4w2bxi-oDzdtixqiQ.text: The food is delicious, especially the truffle Parmesan fries, but the pregnant bartender was extremely rude and had a lot of attitude. Normally I'm a 20% tipper, but being rushed to eat and being refused to have a minute to think about what I want to order before ordering I refused to.

oE5AHBFsSC9O1X7uyR5Bfw.text: GIven all the hype, it was just okay.

2yEiRXWEeHoUC13f_dAHHg.text: Gave this place a try since we are locals and have our of town guests visiting and has heard of this guys t.v show. The waitress asked if they wanted fries with their burgers and they said yes.  I saw chips on the menu and didn't know it was also fries I figured actual chips? Either way the food came out cold and boring not what this guy Gordon Ramsey would allow on his tv show so I too wanted to throw a fit like he does on the show but showed way more class. Not worth a $17 burger and $8 cold fries. Normally I'd give a place a second chance but they weren't even busy enough to excuse for the cold food.

9lzuPslJi4kasSkoyHpH6Q.text: Ordered the "Foie" Burger, which the waiter warned was a hit or miss due to the pate on the burger. I thought it was worth the price for the uniqueness of the ingredients. I also ordered truffle parmesan fries along with burned end poutine. Both were very delicious and enough to share with four people.

SP95Rrxd6jgRXYf7VUZ7AQ.text: A premium price for regular taste burger. Expect a long waiting time about 45 min and the service is slow about another 20 min. First and last time.

sKfl71B-teFr3gpWy94VkQ.text: Drive thru took forever, and it was not busy. Food was mediocre and not fully warm. I dont eat at these places usually but I was not impressed.

6Bkzb31vAb7jbUL5pJzREg.text: We moved from a table to the bar after the service was taking a little long. A big burly bartender made amazing drinks. We got the Scottish egg, mini burgers and the chip nachos. All were pretty yummy

FOfmdm2IIxFOgamAZz6TIg.text: Craving a good burger and staying nearby, we decided to give Gordon Ramsay Burger a try on a Monday evening. They do not take reservations but we figured we'd get in line and see how fast it moved. After about 5 minutes a girl came by with a tablet, took our name and number, and said we would get a text when our table was ready. She estimated the wait at about 30 minutes, which turned out to be quite accurate.   Our order taker-I hesitate to call him our server because he basically just took our orders-was clearly not interested in chitchat. His first words to us were "are you ready for me?" I can probably count on two hands how many words he spoke to us after that. We never saw a drink menu, which is apparently tablet-based because we saw other tables around us looking at it. We all ended up ordering iced teas, which was OK but we might have ordered something alcoholic...so basically they lost some of our business.   Anyway, we all ordered burgers of some sort and sweet potato fries to share. To his credit, our order taker warned us that the burgers would take about 30 minutes, which again proved to be pretty accurate. Our burgers were good but the fries were not especially hot. Portion sizes were decent and prices seemed reasonable, at least for a celebrity chef/gourmet burger joint on the Strip. We don't regret going but it probably won't be high on our list of places to visit next time.

14Fbcwglt772sXevBiGMRw.text: My wife and I are finishing off our week vacation in Vegas after traveling the California coast. After a week of amazing food it was time for a burger joint....Cheddar Ale soup was no word of a lie, melted cheese whiz in a bowl haha. The burger was okay but nothing to write home about. Over hyped and under produced. Don't waste your time and money.

ruhQIuttTV_8kl2VwnzdSQ.text: Food is ok... I had no service at all for my table. Appetizers put in last.... I had to flag down food runners to get some service. Then a manager comes and resolves my water refilll. But still you call yourself a Gordon Ramsey restaurant I better receive that type of service... Disappointment for a vacation food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dpPZ4fEdDtKPrZyavoO2rg.text: The burgers are very good and well seasoned. The onion rings were great. Just a little bit too greasy but worth a try. We went at 10 pm and there was about a 30 min. wait to get in. Service was good and the food came out in about 20 minutes. I feel it is a must try when in Vegas.

hLQ1Qo96ZQAXIa66oZOstw.text: On previous trips had always shied away because of the line but this time went for it because the line was 'only' about sixteen people long (not even counting their party members wandering the casino), it actually moved along faster than I would have thought, our party of three was seated in under twenty minutes.  The beer menu had extensive offerings, I was so happy they had a couple selections of Stone Brewing available and would actually enjoy coming here just to have drinks.  We started with the onion rings and truffle parmesan fries, both of which transitioned into excellent sides for the burgers.  The burgers themselves were absolutely awesome, we tried the Hell's Kitchen Burger, which I did not perceive as being spicy in the least, only very, very delicious!  Also had the Blue Cheeseburger, which I was skeptical about because while I like blue cheese I am not a fan of figs nor jam and I assumed "figgy jam" would be something unpleasant to me, but I was surprised how the flavors all worked so perfectly together to make a burger I felt embarrassed about doubting!  I highly, highly recommend not being scared away by lines at this place, I could have been enjoying these burgers so much sooner if I hadn't.

z1VfjtYCkxWfBmL87hJVag.text: What has happened to my favorite burger stop in Las Vegas.  First the jalapeno poppers are off the menu... something I always ordered when I came.  But it took over 60 minutes for them to deliver a medium well burger.  First it was well done, then it was medium well.  They said they would take care of the cost because of the issue in the kitchen.  But starving at the table for an hour is just unacceptable.  Just disappointed in an otherwise great establishment.  I did like the fact I saw a portobello mushroom burger on the menu.  Might try that, if I ever come back.  For now.. I ill try something else

WEjM--ix2KjBe4EhuhJOSQ.text: Would not recommend we got a Ale Dawg and a forest burger so we could try a few things and the really large hot was super salty and the burger itself was good but the cheese and duck bacon was not appealing to the palate at all.  We were starving so we ate a little of each but thank goodness for the truffle fries so we could fill our belly with something.

zMMzkhITTchWvML-3uH67g.text: If you want  to experience something great in Vegas this is not the place to go. The service was disappointing.  Chef Ramsay should do an undercover boss visit.

8Kj1G20rB6IVE_1Q7C5RVw.text: All I can say is this place is the shit! Truffle fries are a must, one is more than enough for 3 people. A classic Ramsay establishment.

0FpnXww0rF53295x4M9oJw.text: Food was okay but staff needs some fine tuning     I just got the feeling that business was good so they really didn't care about your experience.  Burger was good but not good enough to bring me back.   I don't need to be fussed over but a simple greeting isn't too much to ask.    The checkin process was also very chaotic and disorganized.     Food was 4 stars  Service was 2 stars

M6wRpKBhi6UxTQlNDIza_A.text: Never disappoints. I absolutely love their Oreo Creme Brulee shake... it's ridiculously good. The line can get a little long, but they are great at moving people through pretty quick. The decor is pretty cool, especially the fire decorative accent near the entrance.

v_ho1UYo6CKgrcXu51-Mnw.text: Everyone I come to Vegas, I have to stop here. The burgers are beyond amazing.  You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  My favorite it Bell's Kitchen Burger with a fried egg.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;sKitchen Burger with a fried egg
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BQIciMunZ3PI4Yk3Kp6QRA.text: Keep walking if you're hungry! The food is great, the service is average, the wait times are terrible. 1 hour to be seated, then another 40 minutes for the food to arrive. It was good food, but if I had known the wait time inside was so long I would have skipped eating here.

Hybi9_G3d5EnMBCBcCW6vg.text: After waiting about 15 minutes, to get seated due to line outside of the restaurant, I was finally invited to come inside.  I ordered the hells' kitchen burger the wait for the burger and anticipation grew my curiosity why are people talking so much about the famous Gordon Ramsay Burger at Planet Hollywood. I didn't take a photo there are plenty on here anyways.  There it was the ultimate creation in front of me perfectly crafted. I had little doubt how would it taste with sesame seed bun, avocado, jalapenos, roasted tomatos and cheese. After i took that first bite, it was like harmony of different flavors working as one not fighting but working together. I was really happy and enjoying every single bite of this masterpiece  burger. I don't know what else to say try it for yourself, I am definitely coming back for more....

wDS44BBY5nFuFtde1EcskA.text: The wait was long and the food was pricey but everything was so good.  Really enjoyed my visit.

tGqdAz2figOGS7nP0VuiZw.text: Id like to start off by saying im super infatuated by ramsay. Ive been wanting to try his steakhouse for the longest tine, but we wanted to try out the affordable option first....ramsay burger. Because of my infatuation, i had HIGH expectations.  We waited in a 20 minute line. And i was getting nice and toasty by the front glass where the fire display was.  While youre in line, theres a touch screen menu you can scroll at. Pretty economical. There are tvs around, if you wanted to catch a game.   We sat infront of the cooking line. It was amazing to see how efficient everyone was working and how fast food was getting expedited without losing quality.  We both werent super hungry, after eating all day. So we split a burger and app  We ordered the pork special. Pork burger wrapped in bacon for 18$ as recommended by our waiter, his favorite burger. I trusted him....and wish i went with my own intuition. It was good, dont get me wrong. But i felt i would have liked another burger much more.  Mushroom poutine: ive never had poutine and ive always seem ramsay go around the world poutine-ing this and that. So i was excited to try it out. I actually like it better than the burger. Definitely my favorite and most memorable. I went there sunday, and im sorry to say i cant remember the pork. And i love pork. Every single component in the poutine had its own tune. After awhile i started to disect it and try everything on its own(im such a brat foodie like that) and i wasnt disappointed. I could taste all of the ingredients put in. So much love into that poutine! And im sure it was prepped and reheated. Lol  I will definitely return and choose my own burger to my liking. And go for the poutine again. I wish i ordered another one to take home!  I cant wait to try the steakhouse next!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Maitake! So flavorful
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

epXJgPbmsrTE-VyZtI2RxA.text: This was one of the best burgers I have had so far . I loved the ambience of the place . It was amazing , not over prized at all . Burgers ranging from 15-22. Also try there wings and fries in apps.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nQPGam54-XUqIAyXQ9GiNg.text: Being locals it is very rare we dine on the strip, however yesterday we were out for a Sunday morning walk and decided to try this restaurant. We had not dined at any of his restaurants, and were pleasantly surprised at the quality of food and the price was very reasonable. The service was great and the atmosphere was casual and relaxed

JBURkmE8O9WhPCoyXli46Q.text: Devyn is the greatest!! My friends and I don't know what was better, Devyn's service or the fish burger.  If you stop here be sure you ask for Devyn!!

Ovy6LnUS_tZNSHIAsKL9Bw.text: My family wanted to visit and I was a bit nervous since I'm vegan, but I found that the Hell's Kitchen Burger (sub in the Impossible patty, remove cheese & aioli) was delicious!!! It was the best vegan burger that I've ever had. The staff was extremely friendly and constantly checked up on us. We went on Saturday night and it was a 1.5 hour wait so we left, and instead came on Sunday morning at 11am and it was only a 20 minute wait! Come right as they open or expect to be in line for a while. Otherwise a great experience. If I'm in Las Vegas again I'll pay a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Iced Tea
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger made vegan

IeOXkYY9WhkqB_jrdUfEuQ.text: The servers, a seemed little overwhelmed, we had to wait a long time to get the bill then pay. The floors in the dinning room were really dirty food and broken glass and our table was slick with oil. The food was not bad. The Farmhouse Burger was great. The Mediterranean Burger was a disappointment the toppings are great but the lamb patty was dry and really a let down, I ordered it rare but still it was dry and flavorless. I think if they fixed that it would be one of the best burgers on the menu. Our fires were also just passable. The place has atmosphere have a busy restaurant in an airport. It trading on the name without delivering the quality associated with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t look down this place is dirty!

NJYMIrAWOfrSdV-WbSgsdQ.text: This place is definitely worth trying if you're ever in Vegas! It's a tad overpriced but if you think about where you're at, it makes sense. The service here is exceptional! Our waiter made sure to check on us occasionally to refill our water and crack a few jokes.  The Truffle Parmesan Fries ($12) are pretty good. My favorite part is the dipping sauce - I'm pretty sure they make it from scratch (Fresh tomatoes and truffle oil, etc)  Hellfire Chicken Wings ($14) are amazing. Huge pieces, juicy, and an explosion of flavor! I definitely would choose this over their fries.  The Crown Burger ($15) is probably my personal favorite. It's extremely flavorful and the meat is spectacularly cooked - make sure you order no more than medium (I suggest getting medium-rare though).  The Hell's Kitchen Burger ($16) is alright. If you like spicy, this may be a good choice - but I personally don't think it tops the Crown burger in terms of flavor. Again, make sure you don't over medium for the meat!  The Lobster and Shrimp Burger ($26) is delicious. It's something worth trying once if you're a seafood lover. The proteins are cooked nicely. The only thing that makes this a turn-down is well.. The price.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OooOoOoooo Fancy..
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Fries ($12)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown Burger ($15)

Te8WEBgydZWmPbHFfM_mxw.text: Awesome food & excellent service!  What more could you ask for?  Go there!  The burger was big and cooked perfectly.  The onion rings were soooo good.  Loved how attentive the servers were.  Great place!!!

Yc0RPzXkluro97JTyuNWqg.text: True to Vegas style, Gordon Ramsay Burger has an over the top commercial vibe but a pleasant enough atmosphere. Service was pretty good. We started with the kettle chip nachos which had a decadent delicious creamy cheese sauce and tender short rib beef topping, pretty yummy. We also had the truffle Parmesan fries that were thick, crispy, while being soft on the inside, really satisfying. The burger selection was pretty impressive and definitely had something for everyone. I chose the farmhouse burger which I have to say was pretty delicious with a nice large juicy patty, thick chunks of bacon and an oozy egg. My one complaint is that the burger patty was a little under-seasoned for me. I heard no complaints about anyone else's burgers. All in all I would recommend this place if you're a Gordon Ramsey fan and your craving a solid delicious burger and satisfying pub food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle chip nachos
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle chip nachos

F2xYKYZVvOZX81ed7dJ59g.text: Waited maybe like 20-25 min.   $12 for a side of fries ??   The spicy jalapeno burger was delicious! Cooked to perfection! Definitely recommend.   Got the nachos and they surprised me because they were kettle chips. It had meat and a white cheese. Never had nachos like that but my friend really loved it. It wasn't that flavorful in my opinion   The service was A1. She was very knowledgeable and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mTBi92ADqsMluxb512Jjow.text: This is my review of Impossible Burger at Gordon Ramsay Burger. Overall not a super vegan friendly place but my server Justin and the expediter on the line really put in the extra effort.  Ordered the Bleu Burger -cheese -mayo on the lettuce wrap (bun has dairy) and drizzled the cider vinegar reduction over it (assured me the binder is xantham gum - Thank you ) and steered me clear of the truffle fries because apparently there is also some dairy in the truffle salt. So there you have it  The taste came out amazing and I especially enjoyed the figgy onion jam! Overall it was a very friendly vegan experience for a burger place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_ChBSXY-0Y-XuPn_Yfw35g.text: Omg delicious, delicious, delicious. So worth the wait and the price. It is so good my mouth is watering at the memory of the most popular burger. They'll let you play in the casino while you wait to go in, and boy o boy it is worth it.

zPup2GECxIzdvZB-h4MQPQ.text: Amazing hamburger. We stopped on a whim and we were pleasantly surprised. I don't normally eat at celebrity places (over priced and underwhelming) but this really was exceptional. We split the Bleu Cheeseburger with truffle fries. The burger also had manchego cheese and arugula lettuce. The Bleu wasn't over-powering and everything blended together nicely. The fries were a must-do as other reviewers have pointed out. The real star was the meat patty which was done absolutely perfect! I'd like to know how they do it. If you are a burger fan or would like a smaller bite for lunch, I'd recommend it.

awgOkVrWPi9egbtgxVdAvA.text: Service was excellent. Burger was ok at best. Poutine fries were to die for. Next time I go it will only be poutine fries and a shake. Poutine fries is a huge portion.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9LfszQqNgOhZEfH7EbDBMQ.text: This place use to be great for burgers. I've been coming to Vegas for years now and I try to come here at least once during my visit, but quality of the food has gone down over the years. People just come here for the name.

E8_NiSVEPIgJX0d4NvJvTQ.text: Get the Beef Wellington burger! It is $26 for a delicious burger. Order it with a truffle Fries and Onion ring. Wonderful staff. Staff is very nice and provided great service. The staff recognized that I was gulping down the root beer pretty fast and they would refill it right away.

IU2AVhIdnkRYur3eKdDr3A.text: BurGR quietly changed their name to Gordon Ramsay Burger.  There is virtually no change to the restaurant except all the GR branding is gone.  If your making a weekend visit, I recommend coming to the restaurant early or face a line.  I went during the week and I was immediately seated.  We ordered an Oreo cookie shake to start.  It was incredibly decadent.  The bottom was the normal Oreo shake, but the top is filled with Creme Brulee and whipped cream! As for the burgers, they are delicious.  I tried the Blue Cheeseburger.  It had blue cheese, manchego cheese, figgy jam, arugula, cider vinegar reduction, and a spicy mayo.  The flavors really worked well on this burger.  I couldn't stop eating it.  I liked the sweet with the savory.  I've learned my mistake with the fries.  There's enough for 2 people to share, so only order one.    I really like the family of restaurants Gordon Ramsay has been putting out.  If you can, you should make it to his Fish and Chips north of Burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signage
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oreo shake

bOnKjLZfE5SmTBhR36CIsg.text: O.M.G.!! This place is amazing!! The burgers, the fries, the atmosphere! Everything!! Burgers cook to perfection! And oh those fries! Let me wanting more. A definite visit if you are in Vegas. I think price was ok and wait too. But beware, the restaurant opens at 11am and by 11:30 there was a long line outside so plan to get there early.

Kk4mOxd_BT0EvZ849QoRpg.text: First let me preface this by saying I'm not a burger person.  I probably only eat one or two a year but my husband, well it's his favorite food on earth.  The big thing with this place is timing.  If you go in off hours it's no problem.  During a regular dinner or lunch hour it's packed and there are lines out the door.    Since it was an off time, I can't say if the service is always this good but on that day it was perfect.  We sat down with our menus, had the server there in minutes to take our drink orders.  They have lots of appetizers and stuff on the menu but since I never eat a lot I opted to just eat the burger and fries.  Think maybe they make their own buns or source them from some bakery because they didn't come out of a package.  The burgers were juicy and just the right amount of toppings.  Fries seemed like they might have been double fried, crisp on the outside and moist and tender on the inside.    If you're a burger lover, don't miss this place, even though I'm not a fan of Gordon Ramsay

qegPBOQFdOLVsIYoLzgo2A.text: 60 mins for a burger on a Friday at 1:30pm - this is ridiculous- its a  burger  not a entree- all we have gotten was food will be out shortly and two refills.  We had to call the manger "zack" which was very helpful but what happen was our server never put in the order - wow - food will be on the house but just wasted 1.5 hours of our time in Vegas- finally got our food and wifey burger came out over cooked wow def hells kitchen

QGsbDq98F6-3bwepqIzsdQ.text: Appetizers and fries were very good (nachos, onion rings, sweet potato fries and truffle fries). Burger came out medium rare vs the medium I ordered. Not sure if that's common but my table of 8 had the same comments about their orders as well. I advise you to check with your server before ordering. Service was excellent which is why this wasn't a 3 or less. Would go back and try again, making sure that I get the burger cooked to my preference.

Z8CHy8KPgQOjJQzMQQiEGA.text: Ok sucks I have to say this but it sucked! The waiter Sergio ruined my wife's surprise 46th birthday! He was horrible! No respect no courtesy, no professionalism! When the food was served we moved and added three chairs to accommodate my cousins who where un expectedly in Vegas and the waitstaff literally threw a fit over us adding and moving chairs.  Like it was our fault!  The manager on site was informed of his employees service by my best friend of 20 years and the manager said he would handle it! My wife watched as they talked and laughed at us! I respect Gordon's reputation to service and his food but this staff ruined it for us! The manager comped our three orders of fries they forgot to serve with our food, and our server, frustrated, immediately brought out our fries and with no remorse said the chef apologizes! Not the server! Then we were ignored and arrogantly ignored! As a higher level government employee and 20 year navy veteran I have never been disrespected so horribly! The manager is a joke and a failure to Gordon's impeccable reputation! I will shit on this mans grave for the horrible way he handled the whole issue! A simple table side apology and maybe a desert for the kids would have sufficed! Get your act together and represent Hell's Kitchen as your chef so deserves! What a disgrace to me, a veteran, my friend, who thought this was a once in a life time experience, my wife who's 46th birthday is ruined, and my kids who had to watch this bullshit! Two stars only because the food was good and Gordon is my wife's favorite chef! The management is shit and the server needs to learn respect to his clientele.

KD0lvAvWVf-xS7cTFrbXtQ.text: Went here for dinner on our last night and have decided that this is definitely a must eat place for us! The hog burger and the Hell's Kitchen burger were to die for. So many flavors and a decently sized burger. The down side is that your burger does not come with fries you have to order those separately, definitely get the truffle Parmesan fries you won't regret it! Also the "spicy" Hell's Kitchen burger is what this white girl calls white/old people spicy, it does not pack much heat but was still a fantastic burger! The service is amazing as it should be, just ask your waiter what they had to go through to be a waiter there; they'll have quite a story for you!

WESE_ZBkX5mgDjvvlf3pGA.text: I came here with very high expectations. I was very disappointed, I thought it was only me but after we left I asked my husband what her thought he said, "it's alright". The onion rings are good and crunchy. They taste like a Funyun potato chip. So the star of the show should be the Burger, right? Uh, no. It took 45 minutes to get our food. Our waiter apologized because it takes usually "30 minutes" as he said in the beginning. I think 30 minutes is too long so for me, 45 for a forgettable burger is just ridiculous . Our food comes and I'm excited.   My medium burger had zero pink. The grilled tomatoes looked like it was just thrown on there.  I take a bit and it taste whatever. Not bad, not good. Tasted like a dry well done burger. So I'm hungry and definitely not going to wait for a new one. Well I start eating and I realize the Burger becomes extremely hot tasting. Burn your mouth off, all you taste is chili, hot. I open the burger and the end of the chili they didn't take out all the seeds or forgot. It was so hot I could no longer eat it. Thank God it was only at 1 end, about 1/3 of the burger. My husband even said, "WOW that is super hot, no way will I eat that." So I won't be coming back. Our waiter was nice and the staff was on it. The food was not anything to make a special trip over. Definitely not worth the average time of 30 minutes. Mediocre at best. Don't waste your money.

oXwEugBs2ywQNfIeimKnkw.text: Had the wheat berry quinoa salad and it was very bitter. Not to my taste. The mushroom poutine was divine. And the lobster and shrimp burger was not worth $26. Overall for a Gordon restaurant, it didn't live to my standard.

Vz_t4JsWmLdyzh2CHCNa8g.text: One of the best burger in town. Queue was pretty long for about 1 hour, although there are several empty seats inside. Meat is tender and juicy.

I4zvlxOozrX3xy3xA93wIw.text: This place is awesome. Here's my experience: -The hostess was super friendly and sat me right away. -My server (Ashley) was super friendly and did a great job checking in often, but not too often. Service definitely got this place the 5th star because she was a super star. -The manager of the restaurant checked in once to see how everything was and was very friendly. Nice touch. -The Onion Rings were really good. It's easy to take onion rings for granted because they are something that is just so simple and commonly served. You forget how good they can actually be sometimes. - The french fries are good if you like A thick cut french fries. They were nice and crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Perfectly cooked. Seasoned well. - The burger I ordered was rather plain as it just had meat cheese and bacon only. I wanted to see what the burger was like without tons of toppings on it. It was absolutely ridiculous on all levels. The meet was perfectly cooked and tasted amazing, the bacon was cooked perfectly, and the bun that they used that was toasted was absolutely perfect.  With fast and excellent service along with incredible food, I will definitely be coming back again.

APPhHddj6-RCp4iDSgDPAw.text: I'm glad I stopped in but wouldn't go out of my way to do it again. Shared the forest burger and an order of truffle fries. Waiter asked if we wanted the fries as an appetizer. Seems like waiters might recommend that because it takes so damn long to get your food. I think we waited just shy of an hour for a gourmet burger and fries that were both mediocre in relation to price and wait time. The forest burger was nearly devoid of mushrooms (only two little morsels on each half) and the fries were kinda dried out steak fries and came with two sauces. The one sauce was a truffle aioli which was good and the other was a "ketchup" that I am pretty sure was house made and not very good. I could taste the worshi sauce and celery salt and other ingredients independently and it wasn't very well balanced. Heard management dealing with other customers regarding wait time and seemed very service oriented. Perhaps the wait time was a bit more than usual. I would recommend giving this place a try maybe during off hours in between lunch and dinner.

XzinGXB1zrsrIZTySnwLig.text: I was expecting something really good....however it was just OK.  2 of us had the Hog Burger.  It was very dry. We both drank over 3 glasses of water with it.  I'd recommend trying something different...or a different place.  The Parmesan fries were really good, the sweet potato fries were not...just give those a miss.  Service was pretty quick once we got a table.

Ss_7JVRPmRvYhpstDQpvwQ.text: Great first time experience here, came early on a NFL Sunday and got table next to the bar. Server was excellent and told us all about menu and we chatted about Ramsey for a bit. Seems he drops by every couple of months to check up on things. Kinda of nice to know that he's not just selling his name.  I started with the onion ring appetizer which was probably the best I be ever had. The Maui onion lent a sweetness that really popped in my mouth like no other onion I've had. The batter was light and very flavorful and not greasy. My wife and I split the Forest  and Tandoori chicken burger and enjoyed them both, maybe a bit of an edge to the Forest because when I think of burgers I think beef, but can't go wrong with either. The service was a bit slow, but I don't mind when the product is this good. It is a busy restaurant and they want to make sure the experience is good, so just don't go if you're in a rush.  If you want quick service go to McDonald's. The only negative from me is the dining room is a bit bleh, just cafe style. Would have been nice to have been a little more upscale. But overall, I highly recommend and cannot wait to go back and try more items next time I'm in Vegas.

G5MLSAVNM6jVgRjAXB9t7g.text: burger was okay, a bit dry. but sides were amazing. unique flavors and dishes.

hOFoI4KQJOjL7vBN3_6KPw.text: Absolutely worth it. I got the portobello mushroom burger and it was delicious. Best one i've ever had. I'm assuming wait can get long though, so prepare for that. We came on a monday at around 1pm and waited about 45 minutes from waiting to get a table to actually getting the food. Not too bad for vegas at lunch time.

_gp2lAoxcJ02kfHAHpfENQ.text: This place is a hype, the burgers are not with the amount of money you'd be paying for. But the chicken wings are the best I've had. I ordered a set of wings, the crab shrimp burger, lamb burger, and the firehouse burger; all of them were good but just didn't have a punch. They came with sweet potato fries and normal fries; the sweet potato fries were also just okay because they added some white powder to it and it was way too salty and the normal fries were too dry and soft, as I felt like I'm eat mashed potato sticks that were fried. I also ordered their crum Berle Oreo shake and pecan caramel shake, the Oreo shake was phenomenal. But the burgers are whack, so 2 out of 5 because I went there for a burger, the burgers were trash for the hype this place was. The fries were trash and any beginner can do better, the burger was a hype and some franchise restaurants are much better and cheaper(BJ's brewhouse), but the chicken wings are too die for and the Oreo shake was unreal.

omOeLzp2OHSRyebYrKybvA.text: There's constantly a line outside of this place and it usually takes 25 minutes after you order to get your meal but it's well worth the wait. Easily the best tasting burger I've ever had. The Hell's Kitchen burger isn't as spicy as I was expect but the food was great. Sweet potato fries are sprinkled with powdered sugar and I can't get enough! Drinks are pretty pricey.

VsE5u5sdfY1PAKi454uwEw.text: I hate leaving three stars as I am a huge Hell's Kitchen fan. The stars were how long it took to get our food by the time we sat down and hardly any alcohol in our drinks.We sat down at 7:00pm April 26th and received our food at 7:55pm. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger. The flavors were there but mostly bun needed more meat. My mom order a burger with mushrooms and she loved it. The truffle fries were greasy and not my favorite truffle fries. They were on the thick side and just absorbed all the grease. The flavors were there, I think the fries sat too long before coming to our table. I and my mom ordered two cocktails(cannot remember the exact name) pineapple juice, rum and midori sour. What the cocktails were lacking was a balance between alcohol and juice. We paid $12.00 each for nothing but Juice. I already sent one drink back the Moscow Mule because it tasted like medicine. I  had drinks at Gordon Ramsay Steakhouse and I was hoping the same quality. I have ate at all of the LV Gordon's Ramsay restaurants and this will be my last visit here. I did take the survey at the table and when asked to speak with a manager I opted out. The reason I was so irritated with how long it took to get our food that I just wanted to leave.

LuIhQ7M87EGsuOsPqRy9Mg.text: Currently having the best burger of my life here. Blue cheese burger. Highly recommend.

W35017na6HeelYp7lAIu5w.text: For the price, the long lines and all the Hoopla around Ramsey, I'd expect the burgers to be phenomenal. They were decent, but nothing that justifies all the above. I give it 2 stars because about a year ago, I ordered the fish and chips dish (which I believe is no longer on the menu - and thank god for that!) and what I got was appalling. That fish was so greasy, I literally had a POOL of grease on my plate. When picked up there was grease dripping from the fish. I made the mistake of taking a bite and had a real gag reflex. Yes it was THAT BAD. It felt like I got a big tablespoonful of oil in my mouth. I couldn't even swallow it. I had to spit it out into my napkin. For someone who was seen so often yelling at other restaurant owners about greasy fish and chips (on Kitchen Nightmares), the guy should go taste the version his own establishment serves. I think it takes special talent to get the batter that full of grease.  Perhaps it was a fluke, but a dish like that should never leave the kitchen at ANY restaurant. Or maybe that's why the dish is no longer on the menu...?  We were 4 people at our table and nobody really liked their food very much. All other dishes ordered that day got very mediocre responses from our table. Anyway, we never went back after that.

sm5u1dSdz7vFEPy3HLEflw.text: Didn't know a burger could be so good. It was a great experience

JmeCAaM-mHuKvSZzeNnJ3g.text: 5 stars to the burger! The burger was so delicious. Delicious meat. Delicious cheese. The "just fries" were $8 and nothing beyond less than ordinary. I could have made them better at home. The server was an a$$h*** and couldn't even deliver regular ketchup. Only chipotle ketchup that tasted terrible. This is American food. Get some regular ketchup. Server said I'm just not used to it. No salt and pepper within reach. The server was rude to his trainee in front of customers. He had a bully attitude. Server asked me how I want my burger done then tells the customer next to me that the burgers only come one way. Inconsistency. The fries were stale and chewy. The servers name is Robert at the bar. Attitude problem from *ell.  He automatically judged me for being in my 20s and told me if I don't have money walk up and down the strip and do nothing with my time. Very rude and unprofessional. I understand it's Vegas but coming from the perfectionist Gordon Ramsey cmon now. The server is what made the experience beyond terrible. I would've ignored the terrible fries had I had A+ service.

X_EyiDrfSzFyp5J32Q2iOA.text: Always loved this place, great food and atmosphere although noisier than many places. The food here is affordable and exotic while being normal all at the same time.  Higher recommend the farm house burger, the truffle fries and there shakes although if have a shake you may not be able to finish your burger.  Must eat place if coming to Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great selection

mtSabLWuh3CJqvmupgcrPA.text: I really love the burgers here and I loved it even more because I didn't have to wait in that ridiculous line. My player status with total rewards was platinum at the time so we were able to bypass the line. I ordered the backyard burger with the parmesan truffle fries. They also gave us 2 or 3 different ketchups for dipping, they were all tasty. I loved the atmosphere and decor as well and I plan to visit again really soon!

cEskgyAe-yjXLqzR2QP7Ew.text: This place has a huge waiting line, any time of the day! :) For a large party of 6 people, there is a 2.5hour wait time, so plan accordingly. Once we got our table the service was quick.  Oreo Creme Brulee milk shake is a not to miss dessert here! Bluecheese burger is a must try. I also liked Hell's kitchen burger and onion rings. Chicken wings were decent. Not a fan of fries here though.

iYS4ottT0kGxBFlrd6AnUQ.text: It's a simple pub food type menu.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  Overall we were happy and will be back.

CglASFntsouOhwWKQwcE8w.text: We got burgers & fries. I got the backyard burger cut in half, I forget what my bf got but it is pictured below, but we shared the Parmesan truffle fries. Everything was excellent quality cooked to perfection. It's cool to be able to say I ate at Gordon Ramsay's restaurant but it's not really something I'll keep going back for. My boyfriend raves about it tho so our opinions vary. We both agree the French fries were bomb!  Waited in line to eat for about 45min. Ambiance was romantic & dimly lit. Fancy burgers in Vegas but I think I'll just let them stay in Vegas. I'm happy with my in&out burger any day. Lol.

vNaKWoIAHKfiKCEPAYu3RA.text: Delicious! Best burger I've tried!  Food & drinks are great our server was friendly and welcoming. Definitely coming back next time we come to Vegas.

p-o0LPlXDnhb2rgGhPzEsw.text: Really great Valentine's Day destination.  Saw over a dozen cute couples leaning towards each other whispering sweet nothings.  Unique menu with fun stuff to see.

L_WMaQZiQQMsAhf3B4Mg6w.text: The hell's kitchen burger was extraordinary, so was the Parmesan French fries and the amazing dressing it came with.

-Imk4OHf6__Do0lHmhPd8A.text: Gigantic food,but irresistible taste in every bite! Our servers name was Matt,and he was amazing!

pIx47PKmrDkd4jGd5VjRAA.text: Be ready to wait about 30 min if you come on dinner. ( if dont have total rewards dimond status) Burgers were good, I took Ultimate Burger, juicy and taste!  One more dis, they dont have straws, so when you drink the ice from beverage can hurt your teeth :(

MJuq7MwMn950N3_Ahwqnzg.text: We were there on weekend. It's a very popular place so you should except a long waiting. If you have award membership like diamond/platinum, you can skip the line. So go straight to the front.   We sat and drinks order was taken immediately and we got them right away, however it took 45min for foods to arrive so you know how long the waiting is like.   Over all foods are good except my meat medium was kind of medium rare, so my husband ate mine. Oreo Milk Shake was really really good except they topped with very sweet cream brulee and It wasn't really necessary. But I guess it's up-to the person who drinks and some people may like it. But not me. Next time I may ask to omit it.

mZ4IUpYvXQdH54CqetQ_0Q.text: Gordon Ramsey really likes himself, his face and name is plastered on everything here, but he has a lot to be proud off. We came for dinner with a group of six, surprised to learn that large parties are given priority seating. Our waiter was very efficient and skillfully described the menu, including the special off the menu burger for the day. Everybody choose a different burger and everybody loved their selection. I shared with a friend and got to try the fish and chip burger as well as the farmhouse burger. Can't pick a favorite because both were on point and absolutely delicious. No one left anything on their plates.  We even ate all three orders of truffle fries and sweet potato fries.  I am glad I choose a very healthy (lol,not really) cocktail to wash it all down. This dinner felt like a splurge but was very reasonable. Burger prices ranged from $18-$25, which is very inexpensive for this quality and ambiance in Vegas. Thanks, Gordon.

p7wWeaTadJwKvAxoXnoVxg.text: This place is so good. There is a nice variety of burgers. The meat tastes very good. Be sure to ask the server if they are serving the anniversary burger that was great.   Make sure to read the menu and understand everything that comes with the burger. There are all kinds of cheese and spices or sauces so you have to make sure you know what you're getting.   The staff takes care of the huge line and all the people very quickly and efficiently you'll have to wait but it's definitely worth it.

SDrKWbTnaWt9uhUoC7of4Q.text: Hm what to eat first here?  I mean, their burgers are great, but I can have a burger anywhere else....  I tried the shepherd pie instead. Wow !!! Kind of like the moussaka I had at a Greek place a while ago, but the portions here are way more generous. And the bartender, Cristina, was fun and attentive.

7o5oOQeDeFNKM9d0bu1qXA.text: Im not gonna talk about the FOOD . However waiting time& customer service are INSANE. I do understand waiting line before having a table, but I was waiting exactly an hour and 20mins. The servers even do not do eye contact.

aq3cLminjcGJQSWO32j7KQ.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch before heading home from LV. I thought the burger was really good; I had the Ultimate Cheeseburger (3 cheeses, provolone, boursin and cheddar). Mine was med well and it was cooked perfectly.  The bun (the unsung component of the burger experience) was really good and fresh.  The fries were meh - nothing special and it did not measure up to the burgers.  The fries were steak fries, which I'm not a fan of.  It comes with 2 house ketchups; ask for Heinz and they'll bring it to you. They have sweet potato fries, which comes with a shaker of powdered sugar and an aioli.  I'd go back when I'm in the area; it was good and not outrageously priced.

FOvOJjd405rTjFOEYrcHfQ.text: I came here after a long and fun night in Las Vegas.  I wanted a burger and the line wasn't bad at all at 1am.  I had the Hog Burger and it was so full of flavor. The ingredients were fresh and it's a must when coming here.  I also had the truffle fries and they were really good as well.  I'd love to come here again.

WetL46YwnVvq8BeF9Yyhhw.text: Gotta hand it to Gordon, he lives up to the standards he demands of others!   The burgers are succulent (we had the hog burger which was incredibly tender) and all of the sides were delicious - truffle Fries, onion rings and sweet potato fries. Each came with their own yummy dips. Totally worth the wait!  The service was great! My one gripe was the brown butter shake that came highly recommended was just too intensely sweet to drink. Other than that great place and definitely a great Vegas spot to eat!

fXGM-UJqomaOKLm4gXRFGA.text: Complete let down. Waited over 40 minutes.  How is it possible to undercook a burger so rare when your order is medium well? Wanna know? Come here, find out right away. Bacon egg and cheese burger with inedible burger (for me) overcooked egg hard yoke. You're specialty is burgers so you'd think they'd cook it correctly?  Out of town looking forward to trying it. Sorry I did. Don't waste your time or money!

Pricing is comparable to other burger joints.

wxOdoRnSRex7X3jZbzVrgw.text: It's ok... Just a big hype, had the wings with the fries n onion rings. Fries too soggy and the onion rings where just rite. Wings on the other hand was missing some blue cheese. Didn't had a burger this time, was taking to long for it to come out

WuQPL2O5QdnPdynn_Kob4g.text: The chicken burger is one of the best I have ever had - it can be hard to find a chicken burger but this is super good. Juicy, well cooked and delicious! The burger is perfect. Beware - it's very filling!

HCt3tYKViCSmX3eE1bzaXw.text: Talk about WOW!  Our waiter was phenomenal and super attentive. Service was quick and on point. We got the Farmhouse burger - Cooked to perfection, and the hell's kitchen turkey burger - amazing and unlike any turkey burger I've had before.  Onion rings were good too!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s kitchen turkey burger

MUOMOKXyX5vlNqlVBVe5JA.text: So I like Gordon Ramsay, from his television shows - Kitchen Nightmares actually has been my favourite of the bunch.  My wife is more of a Hell's Kitchen devotee as she is addicted to reality TV.  Gordon Ramsay Burger is located along the "miracle mile" at Planet Hollywood Casino.  It was our wedding anniversary and we waltzed in here at 1pm on a Wednesday with no wait.  Our seats kinda sucked though - located between the bar and the greeter's podium  As an appetizers we had the Kettle Chip Nachos.  They were divine, the combo of the shredded beef and sour creme, would make even the Cookie Monster a fan of nachos.  For our main my wife had the Backyard Burger and I had the Stout Burger.  I loved mine - it was probably one of the top three burgers that I can remember eating.  That said my one complaint is that its $16 US for a burger.  You don't get fries or salad with that.   Or in our perspective that's $23 CAD for a burger.  $15 CAD gets me a pretty good Burger, Fries, and Drink at Hero Burger.  Still a good meal was had by both of us.  Tip: you can pick up Sephora's free WiFi here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front entrance.

mo1NFHBXDaB3ATds9NnpGQ.text: I'm only giving it five stars because I've been here several times and have had excellent service. If I was eating just last nights experience I'd give it a 2 stars based on service. The food is incredible and previous experience so ill let our lack of service last night slide.   I've had amazing service and food every time I've been here. I talk about this place all the time and whenever I visit Vegas I make sure this is on the list to eat at. I love gordon Ramsay food so much. It's always cooked perfectly. Drinks are always crisp. And service is usually good.   Last night we had a terrible server. She was awkward and rarely stopped by. Our food and drinks took forever, I think she forgot to ring them in. My burger was cooked rare (as I ordered) so I know it doesn't take long to prepare. She had to have been one of the slowest servers I've had in a long time. She didn't even seem that busy which is what annoys me the most. It felt like the longest meal ever, and we only had a few burgers with drinks. Oh well. Like I previously said, service is always great here so this chick just sucks. Hopefully next time I visit she won't be around.   Anyways, I love Gordon's restaurants. Always great time and food. Tonight I'll be dining at Hells Kitchen and I'm super excited

QIzWRKVuToTdTcmAn3trgA.text: Wanted to try at least 1 of Gordon Ramsey's 3 restaurants on the Las Vegas Strip on this visit to LV.   My husband and I were checking out the shops in the Miracle Mile and saw his Burger restaurant. It's located in Planet Hollywood.   It was around 8 pm on Easter Sunday and we got in line along the outside of the fire window, there were about 5 parties of 2 in front of us, it took around 30 min. before we were seated. The hostess was friendly and smiled yay!  This place was packed and super busy!   Noise level is loud, our waiter Andre said he'd be right with us. So we were admiring the modern decor and the British themed decor with several large pictures of Gordon Ramsey on the walls and video screens while we waited. The decor color was also British themed, Blue, Red, White. Andre returned and gave us an iPad which had the menu for the drinks, desserts and memorabilia.  Everything on the menu is ala cart, burgers are about $15-$20, the patty is 7 oz. My husband ordered the Guinness Stout Burger which he said was delicious! I had the Bleu Cheese Burger which was also delicious! We ordered the Truffle Parmesan Fries. also delicious and was hoping to have room for dessert but were so full.  There were 2 issues that we didn't care for. Our server seemed so rushed, to the point where he seemed irritated when my husband had questions regarding deciding on which cocktail to order and that for 2 burgers, an order of fries, a soft drink and a cocktail or bill was $80! But just to try it I was ok paying for it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar area
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area

kcPiXnTacnxuMWCYMf9Ubg.text: $6 upcharge for a veggie patties instead of  meat? That's absurd. Do better. Good food but no reason a veggie burger should be more than meat.

SJ_syZSRMx9ObX28lj4nIg.text: What an awesome experience!! The first time to one of Gordon's restaurants.  We started with the Street Corn Dip. A beautiful taste of corn, jalapeno,  cheese, lime and other flavors. The chips are very thin and crisp and just the right amount of salt and then the elope, the street corn is amazing, just a touch of lime, just a touch of heat it's my favorite. I'm in love in love with it. To ME it was absolutely fantastic!  Then we ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger. Oh my gosh what a mouth full of flavor. The meat was perfectly spiced. The roasted jalapenos were the perfect addition to an already perfect sandwich. I have read other reviews and dont understand the complaints of such an expensive burger. You are coming here for the experience and something you won't get anywhere else. It is something you have to adapt to. It surely isnt McDonalds. The burger with its roasted tomatoes and jalapenos are the best pairings. We split the burger and the fries. We had plenty of food but yet enougoh room for dessert.   For dessert we ordered the Stickey Toffee Pudding Ice Cream Sandwich. Oh boy, oh boy!! What a taste. Never have I had such flavors in my mouth as this experience.  I have had great steaks, lobster, pork chops, etc., and now I can add great burgers to that list.   Did I mention the fries? Holy cow!! The chipotle ketchup is to die for. I want to learn how to just make that! Again, a mouth full of flavor.   Daniel our waiter was on fire as well. He took great care of us.   If you have never been here, it is a great alternative to the more expensive Hells Kitchen.  GO!! That is all there is to it. You have to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our hamburger

wibCQ9U5taJGzNeNNsF0-A.text: Five full stars for the best meal of my recent Las Vegas trip! Even more enjoyable than the dinner at Gordon Ramsay Steak.  I had some time prior to leaving and stopped by for a quick Sunday lunch. There is a sign outside that says open at 10:30 AM every day (Yelp info says 11). Right at 10:30 there was a line of 6 parties, but I was seated almost immediately without a reservation. Based on other line pictures on Yelp I recommend getting a reservation, especially for prime meal times. Each burger is made fresh to order and will take ~25 minutes to prepare. I selected the UK burger and it was fantastic. It is rather simple, just cheese arugula and a chutney, but the flavors combine so well. The cheese was Dubliner, never had before, comparable to cheddar but with character and a hint of sweetness. This sweetness played with the Major Grey Chutney, sporting mango and red peppers as two dominant flavors. This is topped with arugula, contributing some greens and a distinct bitter taste that contrasted to the sweetness of the cheese and chutney.  Very satisfied, would get the UK burger again, and I also want to try more of the burger menu too.  I finished the meal with the Sticky Toffee Pudding Ice Cream Sandwich, another great menu item. This is a reconstructed Sticky Toffee Pudding by combining the pudding and the ice cream into an ice cream sandwich. First, the two cake ends were sticky toffee pudding, and tasted just like the pudding available at Gordon Ramsay Steak. These were warm and had caramel sauce drizzled in top. The ice cream in between was brown butter ice cream, a must get, and also tasted like that at GR Steak. The ice cream on its own is rich, robust flavor from the brown butter, and then the sticky toffee pudding and caramel drizzle just add even more. I would easily choose this over getting a side of fries with the burger, no comparison and the perfect way to end the meal and savor the lingering taste in your mouth. I do though think the Sticky Pudding at GR Steak is marginally better as a full experience. In the sandwich form the bottom cake gets cold and saturated with melted ice cream. However at GR Steak the two components are separate and are only mixed right before going in your mouth, so the cake is always warm. Not a major difference since all the taste is there, just a texture difference.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Ice Cream Sandwich, excellent and on par with sticky toffee pudding at GR Steak
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. UK Burger, excellent

nV1RbU3MYd9KFtsQv-G34Q.text: Will have to say right here and right now that this actually was the most delicious burger I've ever had. If you're debating coming here just come and get the Hell's Kitchen burger. It was perfection. The meat came out at a perfect juicy medium with a salty crusty sear all around. The burger is the perfect texture of tender crumbles- not mushy or soft just perfectly tender pieces of meat. The toppings were spot on as well -- perfect quality to match the burger. The Hell's Kitchen burger definitely packed a punch so I took out the jalapenos to calm it down a bit. My sister in law loves spicy so she just added my jalapenos into hers! My husband had the turkey burger and it was insane!! Bursting with flavor and uber creative. I would come back to Vegas just to eat this burger again. The cons had nothing to do with the food but they were there--Service was definitely slow slow slow and everybody's fries came out at different times (some after we'd finished the burger) which was kind of a bummer but they were hot and crispy so no complaints. If you're hungry and can't wait 30-45 min then.. make sure to come before you're hungry :)) haha!

j40C8fJqhbFC8L7dgIaCAg.text: I came here for a lunch break while shopping. The location is very convenient to the mall in Planet Hollywood. I am a fan of Hells Kitchen and thought it would be fun to see if the food is cooked to perfection as it is supposed to be on the show. The burger was very good but I have had much better. Living in the south gives me an edge so I will say this is good for Vegas. The onion rings were exceptionally good. The meal was very filling to say the least so you get what you came for. My drink was pretty but just okay. I needed something soft after a long night of partying. It did the job. I would definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spritzer

VA1hW7tVRo1KLtpUR4yuGA.text: On Thursday evening we waited in line for about 20-30 minutes. If you have a group of 3 OR MORE, DON'T WAIT IN LINE, INSTEAD GO TO HOSTESS AND THEY WILL JOT YOUR NAME DOWN (they have a sign out front that also has this information).   Once seated inside , I could smell the cigarette smoke from the casino. This is not an enclosed restaurant and there are casino games in close proximity which allows smoke to end up in eating area.   Not going to lie, when the food came out I was sad at how bare my plate was. Everything is a la carte so our french fries came in their own container... leaving my burger all alone on a big plate. When I took off the bun, the presentation of the burger was also a little "blehh". Thank goodness it tasted AMAZING! Don't judge the burger by it's presentation!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger. Just Fries came with Curry and chipotle ketchup.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of a Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger.... it looks terrible, but tastes great! Don&#39;t let the presentation fool you.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen Burger, Turducken Burger, and Just Fries

xJ0UdsuXNq77-q1Wr6UvJg.text: Many things make me happy and good food and Vegas are in my top 5. I love the scene in Vegas and with all the delicious food it's definitely a second home to me.   I have been waiting to eat a burger here at Gordon Ramsay for a while. Walked past it and saw the lines wondering if it was worth it or just a tourist hype factory.   After about a 10 - 15 min wait, not bad at all, we were seated in the dining area at at table. It was packed and that is always a good sign. I could smell the grilled beef in the air. TV monitors all around with sports and of course larger than life posters of Gordon Ramsay glaring you down to see if you approve of his menu.   With so many choices on the menu for burgers my interest was peaked. Since it was my first time I wanted a baseline item for my palate to start with. The Backyard Burger looked just about right. I ordered it well and wondered if I would get feedback about it being dry from the waiter. Nope he obliged and placed my order. While waiting we had some Truffle Fries. These fries here were good, maybe not the best but very good. I would have preferred them in shoestring for more of a crispy fry.  After about 15 mins our burgers came out in a beautiful display. I cut it open to see the layers of condiments and the beef. It looked and smelled very fresh and savory. Ok time to dig in. I have to say this had to be one of the top 2 burgers I have ever had. The meat was cooked perfectly. Still juicy and had a slight char taste to it like it was grilled over fire at least some of the way. The cheese was very tasty and the flavor was strong enough to compliment the burger and not get lost in it. The veggies were cold and crisp. The bun too stood on its own. Kind of a sweet bread but I was really pleased it had a flavor of its own too. It was a pretty big burger but I had no problem devouring it up.   Drinks were standard. Vodka soda was a good pour. Service was very hospitable and we were checked on frequently. Professional staff. I kind of wanted to see Gordon run in the kitchen and throw a plate against the wall or something - haha. That would be amazing. Like a dinner and a show! Maybe for a special guys, cmon. LOL    Defiantly worth the wait and lived up to the hype of the Gordon Ramsay name in my opinion. Now I do want to try more of the unique burgers next time I am in Vegas.
