4XncwTMhkhP6TyuaSkaFQw.text: AMAZING BURGERS. Probably best quality burgers I've ever had.  We visited around 9:30 pm on a Thursday with a group of 6. Luckily because we had group of more than 3 people we had a much much shorter wait. There was a line for groups of 3 or less, but it wasn't too bad.  Our server had our drinks and food ordered in no time and thoroughly explained the different burgers. He was nice, quick, and very attentive.  Honestly I never watched any of Gordon Ramsay's shows or was really interested, but I just heard about his restaurants in Vegas. So that is how we visited out of curiosity, because like we would settle for an In N Out burger anytime. So it was our first time spending this much for some burgers.  We already had an early but light dinner, so we decided to share burgers and fries. We ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger, Hog burger, and the Backyard Burger with an order of both the Truffle Parmesan Fries and Onion Rings.  The burgers overall were just amazing, patties were really juicy and flavorful. The Hell's Kitchen burger has a slight kick to it but not that spicy. The Hog burger tasted better than I thought and the onion rings were on point! The truffle fries were also really great. Portions were pretty perfect in my opinion, meat patties were 7oz and fries were good enough for two people.  Although prices are a little steep, I think it's worth it. If you ever feel like eating a good gourmet burger at a restaurant, it wouldn't hurt to come once in a while.  Definitely recommend to try at least once! ;)

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog Burger $19
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger $17

D5YvqXl2De5qjhXRBMhKwA.text: Before attending a taping of "Jimmy Kimmel Live in Las Vegas" as part of the showroom television audience, Diane and I opted to dine here for a major midday meal.  To our surprise we were passed ahead of the line when she showed her Platinum Caesars Reward Card given to her by virtue of her 20 years of service in the U.S. Air Force.  This was our second visit to Burger, and we were highly satisfied with the quality of food both times.  For a more robust review we ordered Beer-Battered Onion Rings and two types of French Fries: Just Fries and Truffle Parmesan Fries.  The O' Rings were crinkled, dusted with Parmigiano-Reggiano Cheese, somewhat greasy but very tasty, and served with Chipotle Ketchup and Ranch Dip for dipping.  Just Fries were fairly traditional and supple skin-on lengths of potato, while the Truffle Parmesan Fries were the best, for the thick Truffle Aioli was filled with expensive truffles and simply outstanding.    My Backyard Burger with mushrooms added was barely medium rare as ordered but contained well-melted American Cheese, fresh Butter Lettuce and tomato slices, pickle chips, and White Onions on a soft Sesame & Poppy Seed-dotted Brioche Bun.  And I learned that the 7 oz. meat patty was a great mixture of chuck, brisket, and short rib.  I requested and received mild yellow mustard and house tomato ketchup in small ceramic condiment containers to further enhance the flavor of my burger.  Diane enjoyed a medium rare Ultimate Cheeseburger with slices of Dubliner and Provolone Cheese, sharing the sides of fries.  Service by Katherine was excellent, accommodating, and friendly.  Seating was comfortable, with cushioned seat bottoms.  And, hard-driving piped in background music added to a pleasant ambiance in the brightly lit dining room.  Rating against like establishments, this was a five-star burger experience.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just Fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Fries with Truffle Aioli &amp; House Ketchup

I1RlJaLfHVscmmO_-9Ihyw.text: We went early and were able to seat at the bar without a wait.  The person behind the bar (it would be rude to call her a bartender) was as unfriendly as can be.  She didn't monitor her bar but chatted and even danced with co workers instead. The fries and onion rings were delivered way less than hot.  You know border line great flavor but send them back.  The burgers took more than 20 min, when they arrived I took two bites before I realized my medium burger was cooked raw.  When I asked the person behind the bar if this looked medium to her,  she replied, I don't know I can tell the chef.  Would you like another?  Hell no to Hell's Kitchen Gordon Ramsey's - Burger.  Terrible from start to finish.  PS the person behind the bar did not charge me for the burger.  Grand gesture for a terrible experience.

6rldMRlYaH5iEip5ORYPBA.text: Who knew there was such a thing as a perfect burger? Well there is and it's home is in this restaurant. Now let me be totally transparent that I am a huge GR fan. I'm talking making my husband and I watch anything Ramsay related when we are eating dinner. It must be Ramsay.. That being said, my expectations were incredibly high due to his shows and his passion. I was not disappointed.   At first, we had to wait for maybe 10 minutes outside as there was a line and I was told they didn't take reservations. The line can look a little intimidating but it moved super fast! So make sure you stick the wait out. The atmosphere is very nice. From the burning fire sign of the restaurant to the set up the dining table when you are seated, it's all apart of the experience. Our server was incredibly nice and she was super helpful with menu suggestions. She suggested an option for $20 you get to take home a signature glass if you order certain types of drinks. My husband ended up going with that.   Now to the best part, the food! Since it was my birthday we went big and started off with the kettle chip nachos. Delicious! The beef was so flavourful and the English cheddar cheese sauce was to die for! Heads up, it was so filling! Now on to those perfect burgers. We both ordered the Hells Kitchen burger. Everything was perfectly balanced and It was so filling! I mean I don't like tomatoes and I ate EVERYTHING on this burger. The roasted Jalapenos and tomatoes legit made this burger. By the time I was done, I was so stuffed I felt like I needed to be rolled out of the restaurant. Luckily, we chilled for a bit and were able to walk out ourselves. In short, I loved this place and when I'm back in Vegas- I will be back!

yfrirIEimb4rIymdh-Fnpw.text: 3.5 stars  This place lived up to most of the hype.   We went on a pretty non-busy part of the lunch day. It was a Thursday around 12-ish and we stood in line for about 10 minutes. We heard it gets super packed so we were so happy to be seated rather quickly.   My friend had to try the two staple items, the Hell's Kitchen burger as well as the sweet potato fries. I wanted to try something fresh wheatberry-quinoa salad. The burger was perfect as well as the salad. The portion for the salad was a good amount so the price corresponded well. It was fresh and had enough to share. The burger was tasteful and packed with all the spice and hot flavor if you're looking for a kick in the burger.   The sweet potato fries were a little disappointing. I was sad to see the fries loose it's hold after about 5 minutes and the flavor was just kind of mediocre. They gave us this green sauce -- honey jalapeno?--that wasn't my favorite.   I would have liked to have paid less for the burger as well and the service was okay. I expected a bit better from a top chefs restaurant.

Oj3b1I94DEuTgRm8-oPSHA.text: He's done it again! This restaurant is truly delicious and I mean everything is delicious. The jalapeno aoli could be a soup it was so wonderful. The sweet potato fries tasted like a dessert and all the sauces omg the sauces were wonderful. The burgers were amazing! Perfectly cooked with well thought out ingredients paired to make the perfect burger. The wait wasn't to bad considering how many people they had in the restaurant. They really got people to their table as quickly as possible. Waiting staff was very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. My mom caught the hostess at one point asked her for some sauce and napkins( not even her job) she made sure we got them right away. I completely think this is a must eat in Vegas Gordon has top noch restaurants and it shows even with his burger joint.

NEVxbCyGFXW9dJA23_21bQ.text: Let's start with the two stars. It is not for the burger. The burger is good. The two stars are for the service and the fries.   Skip the Truffle Parmesan Fries. The Just Fries are "just fries."  The Truffle aioli was decent. Order that on the side with the "Whataburgeresque" spicy ketchup. The Truffle Parmesan Fries don't justify their $4 difference.   Our server did not get our order correct, even with the use of the handheld restaurant iPad. My guess is that our order was also delayed given that the people who sat down after us got their food almost immediately after us.   Given chef's affinity for perfection, I was shocked that the service wasn't good, especially using a computer table side.   I think I would just stick to getting the burger to go and trying the onion rings.

U1qUOUpwwT5cCTyTNuU40g.text: If my review were based on flavor alone, I'd give this place 5 stars. My boyfriend and I both said this was one of the best burgers we've ever had. He had the Hell's Kitchen Burger and I had the Crown Burger. We also split the Parm Truffle Fries.  -Fries: Very delicious although they tasted similar to other parm fries I've had before. The two dipping sauces were amazing and you could tell it was made in-house. -Crown Burger: super juicy and thick patty. Did make my bottom bun soggy but this is probably because I ordered it medium-rare. The sauce on this burger was unbelievable. Arugula was a little overpowering (but I'm not a huge arugula fan in the first place)  The reason I marked it down a star is because while most of the staff was helpful/friendly, we were sat at the bar and the male bartender was pretty rude. He dropped the iPad menu of beer selection in front of us without saying a word and generally had an unpleasant tone most of the time. I'd definitely come back, or try another GR restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan Truffle Fries

SyaKisY07BbG9QYWGemZcg.text: An unfortunate experience at a restaurant bearing the name of one of my absolute favorite television chefs.    I was in Vegas celebrating my birthday and was looking forward to trying Chef Ramsay's Fish and Chips "burger" sandwich.  We went inside and there was a bit of a wait for a table so we decided to sit at the bar.  I really liked the ambiance of the place right away and thought the flaming "Gordon Ramsay Burger" sign was stunning. The food, however, was less so.   We got the burnt ends poutine, which was decent, but lacked salt.  We were starving so we were able to get through it, but I was rather disappointed (especially given the bar that had been set after eating at Chef Ramsay's new Hell's Kitchen restaurant).   The real disappointment was the fish n chips sandwich. Chef Ramsay would have no doubt thrown this thing at the chefs.  It was absolutely bland, completely lacking flavor.  I thought maybe I just got a bad bite but tried again from the other side and simply had to send it back.  It lacked even salt. The fish batter tasted like nothing and even the "chips" (which were small shoestring like fried potatoes) tasted of air. Additionally, the batter wasn't crisp but was soggy and thin.   The bartender sent it back and said that he would ask them to batter it more. He suspected maybe they just battered the fish too lightly.  Sadly, the second was just as bad as the first. The manager came out and I asked him to taste it, but he said he was not allowed and asked me if I would like anything else.  I told him I didn't have time to order a third item and needed to leave (we had been there for over an hour and a half at this point).  He apologized and the chef also came out asking for feedback. The chef said since it was the end of the night it was possible that we'd just gotten to the "bottom" of the batter which would lack seasoning (I thought this to be an odd statement).   The management was very genuine and seemed to care, which was nice, but the food quality simply is not up to snuff for a restaurant bearing the name of Chef Ramsay.  Truthfully, I'd rather have eaten a McDonald's filet of fish sandwich.   That said, my friend got the house burger and he said it was pretty good. He told me it was essentially average (not anything to write home about), but said that it wasn't bad.   I'm hoping this place can get it together. Chef Ramsay has some great restaurants and I'd hate for someone to eat here and think that the others are the same.  Truthfully, they should just use the same fish and chips recipe as Gordon Ramsay Fish N Chips does over by Linq.  That's the quality I was hoping for. 2 stars.

DLe6AJbwQhLxVpEVUouhNw.text: This is a must try place! The line can be a little extensive but it's well worth the wait. The service was great and the hamburgers were perfect! I had the blue cheeseburger and the Hell's Kitchen burger(spicy), oh, and can't forget the beer battered onion rings! It's a little pricy but your paying for the name. Give it a try if you find yourself in Las Vegas.

YLPWMdbWvIpUbRpNPkPwWQ.text: We waited 45 mins in line after a show on a Saturday night. It was worth it. We sat at the bar. Service was excellent. I ordered the ultimate cheeseburger and the sweet potato fries were amazing. The regular fries as well.

z4E3xLuBxKahMajattRhbg.text: I want to start off by saying that the quality of the beef patties are great (thick juicy ground meat with a great balance of fat)! BUT...the taste and enjoyment of the blend of flavors differ vastly depending on the type of burger you get, obviously.   It being my first time there, of course I had to try the "Hells' Kitchen Burger". While the meat itself was good, the other flavors were so bland that they might as well not have been there at all. For example, this burger featured roasted jalapenos and jalapeno pesto aioli. The jalapenos had all the seeds removed and I think were soaked in water for such a long period of time that all the spice was removed as well. It tasted like nothing but plain ground meat (it's not like this is a high quality steak; I need something to compliment the patty!). This burger tasted like it was seasoned with the little bit of salt that fell astray from Salt Bae's hands. For $17, I was definitely underwhelmed.   I also had the "Foie Burger" - a medium rare patty layered with some fatty foie gras. Now THIS is a burger worth $22. So creamy and fatty, absolutely perfect after a night of debauchery. I for sure will get this again for my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells&#39; Kitchen Burger

hdRnnb6AZlwtvdG-lFjj5w.text: What We Ordered - Beer Battered Onion Rings - Truffle Parmesan Fries  - Sweet Potato Fries - Lobster and Shrimp Burger - Turducken Burger  - U.K. Burger - Crown Burger  Seriously, the best burger gourmet burger I have ever had. It is well worth the wait. For parties of 6(?) or more, you can put your name down and receive a text when your table is ready. I believe smaller parties have to wait in a line on the side of the restaurant.  Food takes about 30-45 minutes to come out but, boy is it worth the wait! All the burgers I tasted were juicy and full of flavor. My favorites were the Turducken and U.K. Burger. If I could do half of each, it would be perfect. The flavor of the Turducken could get quite boring after a while. I really disliked the Truffle Parmesan Fries. The parmesan was soooo overpowering (smell and taste wise), it kind of made me want to gag. Sweet potatoes and onion rings were a hit. Service was exceptional! Definitely exceeded all my expectations.

0D4_U2pJvTuYpcbgm1l40g.text: AMAZING burger and large portion last. A friend and I split one and a couple of apps. The only downside was the wait. Aside from that, I enjoyed by food.

BpTI6jlNVEOsktqZID54Iw.text: Exacellent food, nice ambience, always crowd but very well organized in getting people seat.  Service was outstanding as well as the burgers. A must try when visiting Vegas!

wt3QLgpkTzKFZe8VX_lkgQ.text: The service here was not what I expected from a famous restaurant. I was severely disappointed by the servers and the hostesses with their lack of care of their customers. They seemed to take our orders and talk to us very unwillingly and made us feel incompetent to eat here because of our age. Although one of the server, Thomas, was very helpful and made up for the lack of service at this place.

JaEfNC8QSPk83zRzE4C7Tg.text: We've walked past GRB many times, and there's usually a long line. We came for a late dinner after the Cher concert, and there was no line. None. Score! We had the blue cheeseburger and forest burger. Both were good and cooked to our liking. We also shared an order of truffle parmesan fries served with sides of aioli and ketchup. The fries were okay. I can't remember anything outstanding about them. I also had the chombolita cocktail which I enjoyed.

BYZr4we-h4UKm0yWQuFC0g.text: Wow what amazing customer service. The food came quickly and hot. I ordered the blue cheese burger with truffle fries. We started with burnt ends poutine and you know what these Canadian girls approve. The depths of flavor were amazing. I wished I could have tried more lol. Our first time trying truffle fries they are dangerously delicious . So if you get the chance do go you will not regret it!

62d7NHLDCtj90kFK8TBC4w.text: I love Gordon Ramsay's restaurants but this wasn't as satisfying as the hype. 2 hour wait in line, only because it's a high volume restaurant inside a casino, but for two people that's a long time especially when bigger groups get to walk up to the front and get seated. $17.00 burger didn't taste as gourmet as $7.00 burger from Wahlburgers. The Turducken burger has a tiny piece of duck, size of the tip of your thumb, on a turkey patty and the Cherry Chicken burger were small and very little taste. Wahlburgers had a ,"Sweeter Sensation"!

06bEJa3PAyOaloZ1lY3_Kw.text: Okay - LOVE Gordon Ramsay and his food does not disappoint.  Honestly, this place could've been a full 5 stars but the service was so extremely slow that I can't even consider it.  Located near a central entrance in Planet Hollywood you can't miss it - it's quite flashy on the outside.  There is almost always a wait but if you have more than 2 people in your party you can put your name down and come back when your table is ready.  For parties of 2 or less you have to actually stand and wait in a line - which seems very odd to me.  The truffle fries - AMAZING.  Seriously a must order, especially if you've never been here and it's a 1 time thing for you.  We also got an order of onion rings because we just had to know how good they were!  Could not finish this as the 3 of us each ordered our own burger as well.  I had the turducken burger - super delish.  If you're not a beef eater this is a great option.  It's definitely a big portion though so make sure you come hungry!  It is a bit pricey for a burger and fries, but it's about the experience and knowing you're eating Gordon's food!  I would actually come back here if I had the choice.  It's pretty much guaranteed your food will be good, even if the service is poor.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffles fries - YES
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turducken burger!

efbU0V2wjRJZlJlFJMZaDw.text: This was our first stop in Vegas and it hit the spot with our burger cravings! Since we were having a late lunch, we shared 2 burgers and a poutine between of us. We got the turducken burger with a turkey patty, fried egg, duck confit, kale and honey mustard spread. All the ingredients went well with each other and the runny egg yolk helped the burger from becoming dry.   The second burger was the Hell's Kitchen burger which had cheese, avocado, jalapeno, tomato and jalapeno aioli. It was little more well done than I liked and it wasn't spicy at all but overall still a good, juicy burger.   My fav dish was the poutine because it was super flavorful, the fries were well cooked and the smoke from the bacon and the pickled onions were on point.   My only complaint is that for the portion you get (which is a pretty tiny burger), it's $$$ but then again, we're in Vegas so i guess it's expected.

TFfgZUo_N98BoQ6kShYPFw.text: Farmhouse Burger (I ordered with side of figgy jam) was a great burger but next time I'd break out of the burger safety zone and get the Hells Kitchen burger or another unusual burger. The farmhouse was very good but too usual.  My sis got the Blue Cheese Burger has lots of flavor pizzazz.  Manchego along with blue cheese, fight ham, cider vinegar reduction, spicy menu.  BEST BUN on the planet. Totally great two day feast. Both of us brought half our burgers back to hotel. Good for late Breakfast and yes, that bun held up overnight!  Maybe we could eat only half our burgers because we stuffed ourselves with a rare treat of Truffle Parmesan Fries and Beer Battered Onion rings, both with sauces To Die For! Loved the chipotle ketchup and I don't like anything chipotle. Worth the calorie splurge.   We got a table immediately. On a Thursday around 6pm.  But there was a line forming when we left.  Service was very attentive, knowledgeable and friendly. Would go there again.

dfAVnS_yzjNiCo-EaMGrkQ.text: You can expect a higher price point here. If you are choosing to dine at Gordon Ramsay Burger then I'm sure you are not looking to budget for this meal. Finances aside this place is top notch. Staff was professional and nice, food was top tier, ambiance was excellent. The only negative was that we didn't see Gordon himself.

h-7buskutEbbA6lmqpbyHA.text: Nice setting.  The food was very good and the service matched.  I will definitely visit here again  I am obese (well, atleast according to my doctor), so clearly I know food.  We enjoyed are time here!  Thank you.

MY6Vug2hV5ODjoTnUcvIJQ.text: The burger was the best burger I've had in years, and the atmosphere was pretty good.  Unfortunately, the service wasn't that good. They emphasized speed, so they didn't check in on us or even clear the plates after we were done. They did drop off the check promptly.  I looked around the restaurant and saw a few other tables that had diners at them, as well as a stack of empty plates waiting to be picked up.  When we left, the restaurant was more than half empty and had a line out the door, so maybe they were understaffed?

Y2lvPRBkRulUu1cnwuwNyg.text: Hell's Kitchen burger is the best burger I've ever had. It definitely meets your expectation, at least for me it was perfect. The jalapeno, tomato and avocado matches perfectly delicious on the medium cooked patty.

Ciq4ALCiASUft2f6OfyQFw.text: It was a pretty damn good burger! Is it worth a 45-minute wait? Maybe not, but perhaps a pro-tip: there was a really long line, but a sign that said for reservations of 3 or more, to check-in at the hostess stand (or something like that). I'm not sure if this is how it works for all reservations, but we were able to leave our name, wander the shopping area and be texted when the table was ready, so that was pretty easy.  Anyway, the burgers were great, loved that they actually had a decent beer selection, the fries were pretty good, and the curry mayo actually tasted like curry!  The real reason for this review though is that our server was incredible. I looked at the bill to try to get her name, but it was super long and unusual and now I'm going to completely butcher it (should have taken a photo for memory's sake). It was something like Piattaporna (slight, Asian lady)... sorry Piattaporna, I should have written down your actual name.  We had a lot of weird needs for 3 people: one burger prepared without butter and dairy, one gluten free, probably more odd stuff I'm forgetting. She nailed everyone and made sure to repeat the requests as she dropped off the burgers. Pretty impressive for how completely swamped she was. When we ordered the fries with the curry mayo, we asked for regular mayo as well, which she brought along with two kinds of ketchup and another dipping sauce just to be nice. Super fast, friendly and professional. Deep down this may be a burger joint, but this lady was bringing first class service all the way.   Piattaporna, or whatever your name was, they better keep you around!

t1l52tAqxS8nJ8FaMvvfHw.text: Stopped by for lunch today. I had the Guinness burger with parm onion rings. Burger was one of the juiciest burgers I have ever had. Fresh bun. Real homemade onion rings! Service was great and attentive. Open kitchen concept was neat. Restaurant was clean and impressive. Would definitely go back again!

lf354z7kbk3kOuclKCu6kw.text: Party of 8 in town for Bachlorette party. The wait is long if you go for dinner. They do not take reservations. Ala Carte ordering. I spent about $25 for burger and onion rings I think. Service could have been better, our waiter was getting off and his replacement took forever to start or come to us. Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farm burger with the egg and bacon! So good

Rkva5KelP6N_lj26c9aEeg.text: Gordon Ramsay definitely knows what he's doing! Been here twice and I really enjoyed it. It's usually busy but I came here at 10pm on a Sunday and didn't have to wait at all. The first time was with a big party and I think we only waited for 20-30 minutes, so not bad.  We got the ahi tuna sliders as an appetizer - it was really good. But heads up, it's only two sliders on the order! I got the Farmhouse Burger, which comes with cheese, bacon and an egg. My boyfriend says you should always get it done Gordon Ramsay style, medium rare. Delicious, juicy and flavorful! My boyfriend got the Hell's Kitchen burger and he said it was alright. We also shared an order of Truffle Parmesan Fries. SO GOOD. Definitely enough to share between a couple.   The menu has many other different kinds of burgers, even hot dogs and milkshakes. I saw a lot of tables order the onion rings too, and it smelled and looked so good!

-CDfr0C9UtLLNwjiSw7QZA.text: This place is awesome. You get your money worth at this place. I ordered the farm house burger. It was delicious. I also ordered the truffle fries which too were delicious.   The waitress was great and speedy. Every time my soda was about half full, she was quick to bring me a fresh drink. AWESOME!!!!  I ordered a burger, fries and drink and left full with fries left over. This is a definite stop place if you're looking for a great burger.

kX8MG77af4ffo3aLL5Ah4Q.text: Alright alright his Hell's kitchen Burger was amazing!! he can continue his trash talk

YVB7aPvSSLrj9V2UQuDLbQ.text: Really good affordable.  I didnt get the fries they looked good I chose beer instead too much for everything

JdCUa8RlHWwB1YhqQe66Eg.text: Go to the restaurant and their was already a line forming. Since we had a party of six we informed the staff and they took my name and phone number and texted us when our table was ready.   Thoroughly enjoyed my meal. Ordered the Farmhouse burger and it was delicious. The fries order is huge so if you are dining with someone it's good to share. The waiter informed us that it will take 30 minutes to make the burgers so we should order some appetizers. Our burgers came in less than fifteen minutes.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

J7bKju2WFEFk52VskZlhvw.text: It's simply the best burger you will have in your life.   I did a review for this restaurant before but I see yelp created another page for it so I will update you guys on this one. This is my second time here and the experience was just as good as the first. It's located inside of Planet Hollywood not too far from PF Chang's. This time, we did have to wait about 15-20 minutes in line before being seated. The last time...we simply walked right in. If you have a group of three or more, you will be seated a lot quicker than those with just two people. The service is fantastic! Not one complaint there.   As per usual, the burger, the fries and the drinks are AMAZING! The flavor is intense and the burgers just melt in your mouth! The fries are big enough to share (try the truffle fries). As expected, it's not expensive but it's not cheap either. A drink gets is $13 and the burgers are between $15-$30.    I would recommend the Crown Burger or the Backyard burger if you are looking for something simple. I'm definitely going to try the lobster and shrimp burger next! I hear great things about it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries

57vuX1MYM6kqSC9yxAOTXw.text: I had such high expectations for this place, and they were met. Gordon Ramsay Burger served me the best burger and fries I've ever had. The wait was atrocious. We probably waited a little over an hour in line and it was by the line of fire, so it got a little warm. Other than that, everything was a dream.  We got seated and our server was very attentive. He kept making sure we didn't have any questions and was very quick. We ordered the Farmhouse burger and the Hell's Kitchen burger. Both were DELICIOUS. The farmhouse burger had a fried egg and savory thick bacon, and the Hell's kitchen had a slices of jalapeno and jalapeno aoli.  I highly recommend the truffle parmesan fries. They were extremely flavorful and comes with ketchup and garlic (?) dipping sauce. I dreamed about it the next day. Come try this place at least once in your life! You won't regret it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T2JfhZGQZe5NHemvr0LOPQ.text: This place was definitely over hyped for us.   I came here with my boyfriend around 11pm but called before to see what time their kitchen closes. The waitress said their kitchen is open until 11:55pm, which is nice since they actually close at 12am and they are willing to still serve you.   Upon arriving, we see the famous Gordan Ramsay sign lit up with fire behind it. We were super excited about trying this place out, especially after reading the reviews.   I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger medium rare along with the truffle fries. Nothing stood out about it. I've honestly had better burgers for a better price. I usually prefer avocado in my burger to be more guac style but here they cut it into slices for you. Also, there is tomato in it and it was cold and stood out (in a bad way) from the burger.   For the name, I expected better food. The price was decent since everything on the Strip is usually around there though.   Would I recommend or come back? No.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mAMW7IIdxLKaW0SJN8ujeg.text: We'll just the best burger I ever had.  Great fresh ingredients and done exactly as it should be. Of course it comes with the price but you get what you paid for here or more.

63eakhyxTkmQi5DV7JUCyQ.text: I had the foie burger and the truffle fries and they were delicious. Everything on there menu was a unique burger I've never seen such a variety for a burger place. Everything here looked good and I want to try it all just not enough space in stomach sadly. I can't wait to come back and eat here again

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie burger

j0m8jLtgz1wCLsReOtEmHQ.text: Too hungry to really go anywhere else, we settled on Gordon Ramsey Burger for lunch on a Thursday. We came in right when they opened and only waited a few minutes. We started with the Kettle Chip Nachos which were amazing. We were so hungry we didn't get a picture. I'm a picky eater and don't really like new things so this was definitely outside my comfort zone but I loved it. The cheese sauce was great and really good with the pickled onions. My husband got the Hells Kitchen burger and it was really really good. It wasn't too spicy and the taste was amazing. I had the Farmhouse burger and while it was really good, it was bland. It could have used some sort of sauce. It didn't even have mayo. If it had whatever sauce was on my husbands burger it would have been a million times better. The people next to us got the onion rings and I was pretty jealous. The looked really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen Burger

LU7fdcagbYRdjdyMH78ogg.text: I'll start by saying that I'm always skeptical when going to a restaurant that has a lot of "hype" around it because of a celebrity chef. Will the restaurant live up to expectations? Is it hyped up because of the name behind it? Are you paying a considerable amount more for something that isn't anything special? I mean this is only a burger joint!  Well, Gordon Ramsey Burger was everything I hoped it to be!   I went in with my husband and a couple of friends on a Saturday around 11:45-noon. There are no reservations, it's first come first serve.  The line moves pretty quickly, it was about a 15-20 minute wait... and we were about the 5th party in line. Not bad!   I love that the menu is fairly simple. There are enough options, but it's not overwhelming! Extensive menus are a bit of a nightmare for any indecisive person like me! Haha!   We ordered beer battered onion rings to share as an appetizer. They came with two dipping sauces; chipotle ketchup and a cheddar ranch. The onion rings were cooked to perfection, flavored well and the cheddar ranch sauce was the perfect compliment to them! It was a great start to the meal!   For my burger, I wnt with one of the more popular options; the Hell's Kitchen Burger. O-M-G! That thing was amazing! It was topped with asadero cheese, avocado, roasted jalapenos, and roasted tomatoes. The patty was so flavorful... it would taste good plain, that's how good it was! Seriously, there was a party in my mouth when I devoured this burger!!! It was tasty, memorable, and something I would crave!   My husband got the hog burger and that thing was MASSIVE! It consisted of a patty made of pork and brisket, wrapped in bacon, topped with pulled pork, crispy onions, white cheddar, pickles, and slaw! What?! He LOVED it!  Our friends had the Crown burger and I think the backyard burger. They enjoyed theirs. We wanted to share a variety of fries, so we ordered the parmesan truffle fries, sweet potato fries, and the chips with curry sauce. The fries' portions are large and can be shared. Having 3 orders between the 4 of us was way toooo much. I would stick with the parmesan truffle or the sweet potato.   We also wanted to indulge in a dessert and shake. I ordered the chocolate caramel tart which was chocolate cream served with hazelnut ice cream, hazelnut crunch, and milk chocolate! Sooooooooo delish!!! I would recommend it. Our friends shared the Oreo creme brulee shake, they loved it.   Ambiance is lively. Service is excellent! And the food is tasty/memorable! If you're a burger fan, check it out...quality meat in the burgers and very tasty!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger!!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger! Yummmy!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate caramel tart with hazelnut ice cream! Soooo good!

AFe5Pi32HpZvXWiFfolqsg.text: We've dined here with my parents many times. Hubby and I both had the Hell's Kitchen burger with asadero cheese, roasted jalapeno peppers, avocado and oven roasted tomato and we shared a Innis & Gunn. Our family shared sides of the beer battered maui onion rings with dips - parmigiano-reggiano, chipotle ketchup and cheddar ranch dip, sweet potato fries with vanilla powdered sugar and honey jalapeno mayo and the hand cut fries with chipotle ketchup and curry ketchup. Our burgers were perfectly medium-well and flavorful, the sides were crispy and it was hard to choose a favorite dip - they were all good. Our daughter had one of their yummy pudding shakes - the coconut pudding + strawberry shake + chocolate cookie - YuMmm!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burgers, fries and pudding shakes.

ZQM7Yy_sEV0yAT5WYES1Hg.text: Always can tell how well a restaurant is run by the expressions of the staff. All of them had smiles and genuinely liked interacting with each other. Staff offered plenty of help and even gave us a to go beverage on the hot day. Would go back!

GLi9wKddYU9QzbAqOxKTEA.text: Great burgers, meh on everything else. For real.   No reservations, so come early and expect to wait a while. I went at 10:30pm and we waited in line for about 30 minutes. I saw lines forming in the morning to eat there at 11am.   I had the Hells Kitchen Burger, and it was damn tasty! Burger was cooked to a perfect medium as I asked, I loved the kick to the burger and the sesame seed bun was nice.   I also tried the truffle fries. They were good, but if you've had truffle fries before, this isn't any different.  The disappointment of the place was the drum menu and cocktail program. All of the cocktails sounded too sweet or too nasty. So many cheap beers too. Even our server commented that the cocktails were "shitty" and I didn't disagree with him based on the two I tried.   I actually recommend this as a place to snack. Get the burger, skip everything else, and eat a meal a couple hours later.

p8-i8WuZcwr1V0uKjw4F4g.text: We started off with drinks of course, and the Truffle Parmesan Fries since they said it takes a half hour to get your burger (I don't know why it should take so long to cook a burger! Especially when Gordon's biggest grips on his tv show Kitchen Nightmares is the speed of service!) The fries were very good though! For the burger, I went with the Ultimate Cheeseburger, and I had them add bacon to it, but when I received my burger there was n bacon added to it! So if you order something like that to your burger CHECK IT FIRST! All they did was give me an option of either having it on the side- ya right! Had them take that part off on the bill! They should have offered something more- oh well. So wasn't impressed there, but the burger and the bread was very good!  My wife went with the Forest Burger with Duck Bacon, which worked real well! Maybe I should have had that one minus the mushrooms!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BIo9qp_aKsg5OD0JbAYndw.text: We waited almost an Hour to be seated, after which it took an even longer time to get our food. --minus 1 star A menu was present near the initial line so we were able to decide our food even before we reached the table.  The FARMHOUSE BURGER was great, though the fried egg could have been a little more runny. The proteins blended together to create a very satisfying taste. The HELL's KITCHEN BURGER was super delicious yet not too heavy midst all that goodness! (Avocado + jalapenos are a great combo)   Both burgers were worth the wait. But not sure I'd come again on a short visit- the entire experience takes up A LOT of time. (Could be due to the popularity and its Vegas after all!)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse Burger (with duck bacon, fried egg &amp; cheese)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Totally eye catching entrance!! Something to look at while waiting in the never ending line!

jrNL4BbjCVGBTKd7P1grRg.text: I'm so impressed... if you are wondering if you should come here...R E A D  T H I S.  *WAIT TIME*  First,  the restaurant is right on the strip. Depending on the day, the wait time can vary. We went on Labor Day for dinner, and they told us it would be a two hour wait. They ask for your phone number, and text you when they are ready to seat you. Instead of 2 hours, we actually only waited one.  This wait time gives you time to walk around the strip, watch the bellagio water shows, or go back to your hotel room to relax.  *SERVICE*  The menu and utensils are nicely set on the table. Like any other restaurant, they have you order drinks then food. You can also order both at the same time. After we got seated, they gave us a few minutes and took our order. The burgers are made after you order, so they take longer, but not so long.  *BURGER;FOOD*  The burger is more expensive than most burgers BUT WAY UNDERPRICED FOR WHAT YOU GET! Wow, the flavors and just everything was amazing.   OVERALL I RECOMMEND :)

HjjFbuX1jyYZ_N0p9R3Nng.text: One of the best burgers around guaranteed and the french fries are super good and the water best purified water ever...excellent service My only knock is why you're not getting five stars ....I hated the chairs they sunk way too low for my taste .... Other than that you would have gotten five stars.

aFPNsWeaZgB6REc3CP24sg.text: I decided to try Gordon Ramsay Burger while in Vegas. Lets say it didn't disappoint!! I decide to get the forest burger as something different. The burger was cooked perfectly! The beer battered onion rings are the best that I have had so far!! I would definitely cone back and try more burgers and get some more onion rings!

_Od9x0-_DJ3N_cNOg6hkHw.text: We were told to wait in line until we made it to the front to be seated... We ordered 2 Crown Burgers, received them about 15-20 minutes later, however they didn't look right... burgers were supposed to be topped with arugula, instead topped with a piece of iceberg lettuce. They told us after the fact that they had run out of arugula. For being a Gordon Ramsay restaurant specializing in burgers, I feel like they should be made correctly or at least notify the customer.  In my opinion, not worth the hype/price/wait.

Asj1wk8nd_rpGAPXqFoA8w.text: I love Gordon Ramsay Burger. I've visited numerous times and always try a different burger. Each burger is delicious and unique. This is the type of place that makes you want to experiment with your own burgers at home. I say this is the best burger in Vegas!

yQUHreCbByGcM4QC2xs33A.text: You won't regret eating a burger here if price is not a issue.  Spent over 50 on burgers and fries for two.  It's a good one time restaurant to try just for the hype of it.  It worth it otherwise.

b4xVOKOeeWQi2Yeya_T8hw.text: We had to try them again just because we had a great burger there once. We ordered three burgers, two mid rare and one rare. They all came out full on medium and under seasoned. The meat itself was no better than most any other burger place. So for 100.00 without drinks I would expect the best burger in my life. What we got was a Guy Firie shitty burger.

otk90H6gQhSUMWirnIBPzA.text: Gordon Ramsay's Burger was great! The food was amazing. The staff was very helpful and friendly even though the restaurant was packed but it's to be expected in Las Vegas.  We had the truffle fries and they were a little overwelming. Over all I would be back as this is the one place that's ever brought the food out and it looked exactly like the picture!

I ate every bite and would have ordered another if I could have. Worth the wait and it's not over- rated. This is a stop I will make every time I go to Vegas.

8Njh1i5glZ1J8OUPtrOOMw.text: Service was good and the wait was not actually that bad and The poutine was great! However one of our burgers came out cold and the other was luke warm.  When our remade burger came out the meat didn't even taste seasoned.  I dont think it is worth the price to come here and I'm a huge Ramsay fanboy.  Go to his steak house instead.

YzrUX9CxsdUqttlzOM7LPw.text: I came here with zero expectations. I had just thrown three jack and cokes at the dome-piece (courtesy of NGINX during Re:Invent), and needless to say I had worked up quite a sweat hiking down from the Venetian. My point is that I was buzzed in a number of ways but I am still confident that my culinary judgement was clear.  I sat at the bar, slammed two pints of Las Vegas's finest tap water, and had my order taken before five minutes had passed by. I ordered the Forest Burger (tremor cheese, seasonal forest mushrooms, arugula, duck bacon). I list those ingredients because they are the only thing that brought life to this burger. I asked for my burger to be cooked medium rare, and received a dry overcooked piece of meat that would have sent Gordon Ramsay himself straight to the kitchen to tell the cook it was "as f***ing dry as a camel's a**hole in a desert storm". Yeah, that's a real quote.   The toppings were stellar but the tasteless patty and sub-par meat quality are going to weigh this down to three stars. Watch out for the $8 up-charge for fries, yoinks!

t0yUiU-tUy8WZBgJTSDWpg.text: I ordered the Hells Kitchen burger. I also ordered the truffle Parmesan fries. The burger took about 30 mins to come out so i waited on the fries.  So much food! I would say share the fries The burger was delicious probably the best Ive ever had. The meat was cooked perfectly and the ingredients paired so well together i was not disappointed. I will be back to try something different.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yvEFq1IFoZ5r0GK_8fhaEA.text: Being a fan of Gordon Ramsay and his goals for expert dining experiences we were not surpised at all with excellent food, service and reasonable prices at his burger restaurant in Planet Hollywood. There was a nice variety of burgers and the server answered all our questions about the toppings with which we were not familiar.  Our burgers were super great. We shared a parfait for dessert which had fruit and two types of chocolate. Service was great as well. The atmosphere was very comfortable.  It was an overall awesome experience.

jdToo58efhNsd8Evo1SexA.text: Yum, yum, yum!   I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger, which includes asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes, and jalapeno pesto aioli. It was awesome! The combination of all the ingredients meshed well together, and the avocado was perfect in the burger.   But the WINGS THO. These were Deeeeeelicious! That buffalo sauce was perfect and not too sour with the perfect acidity, and the blue cheese sprinkles on top of the wings just completed the dish so well. The first time I came here, I ordered just the wings and had a bite of my friend's burger. He had some of the wings as well, but I just wanted to try everything since I love food.  However, the SECOND time I came here, I ordered the shrimp salad (which sucked so don't order salad) and since I wasn't satisfied, I ordered the wings. Since it was a bit much I asked for a box as well as the check since I was in a rush. I put half the wings (4 pieces) in the box, and devoured the other 4. But mannnn, I couldn't help myself and slowly but surely, I ate the wings one at a time from the box I was supposed to take home to my friend. I ate one from the to-go box and I was like, just one more. Then there were two left, and who leaves just two pathetic wings for leftovers? That's just rude giving somebody two wings, so I HAD to eat the rest... xD  Anyway, if you come here, get the wings and the burgers aren't bad too! I believe if you are a diamond or seven star reward card, you get to skip the line.  FYI both times I came here the food does take awhile to come out, so it's not the best place to go if you are in a rush.   Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite part of the meal, the chicken wings!! So bomb
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries - mehhh coulda been better
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger with wings in the back - so good!

K0MS4zN8Dt2SAbMFCylVyw.text: Had to try Golden Ramsay for that one time! Located inside the casino, the line was super long even on a weekday so get here early! I believe if you have 3 or more people, you can bypass the line to the front and check in with the hostess. To be honest, I expected more from a restaurant named after Gordon Ramsay. Waitresses were nice but they were sort of unprofessional, talking about calling in sick and such. Also, the service was slow, I know it's busy, but it shouldn't take 10 minutes or so just to get our order in or to get water. Food took over 45 minutes after it was ordered, which was a bit long. I was looking forward to the chicken burger but they replaced it with some other burger, so I was disappointed. I ended up getting the cheese burger which was pretty good, I wish it came with a side of fries (which has to be ordered separately).

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese chicken wings.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon Ramsey!

RQLvNK_6DKzi_Qx1BlajIg.text: Beat burger ever.   Never a dusappoint eating at one of Chef Ramsay's locations. Yummy

XNuuHoKfTmY_ELzcTM1o6Q.text: This was a decent burger joint in the casino. I liked it. I give it a 3 stars because I'm always hearing Gordon Ramsay say it must be perfect. I tried two burgers (turdunkin and ultimate), truffle fries, and the dark butter caramel shake. Overall the experience was nice, but not unique. Truffle fries were steak fries, perfectly cooked. The burgers were dry and very bland. The turdunkin was better but still dry. No pink in the middle. The shake seemed ordinary but a good touch! The reality is, this was not up to the standards of most Gordon Ramsay restaurants. Wolfgang puck wouldn't open a sub par restaurant, I'm not sure why Gordon Ramsey did. Not writing this review out of anger or anything. I'm happily full and staff was very attentive! However, I do think, kitchen had so many orders it affected quality.

11KPgZW8ZnpNDGIR411KIg.text: 175 for 4 hamburgers. I wasn't impressed with anything but for the sauces provided with the fries. Average. I wouldn't go back for 175 dollars plus tip. I love Gordon but he's not as good At planet Hollywood as he is ok tv.

BNk1W_KXeN9Rke7TMxGpTw.text: I have been to this restaurant and the food is delicious..today was a horrible experience ...i walked in and was place on a waiting list via text message ...i receive the text that states to head over that my table will be ready shortly ... I approach the front desk and the girl said if she can help me ..i told her i receive my text and she asked my name she glance at me for a few seconds and rolled her eyes and with the biggest attitude said we gave up your table ..i told her i just got the text ...well i dont have a table and again rolled her eyes and turn around and told her co worker where is Jessica she is probably in the bathroom ugh ...i ask if i can speak to her manager and the manager said regardless of the way she acted looked me up and down i dont have a table.. I ask him are you judging me because the way i look ..i told him no one should be treated this way.. i left holding back  my tears my children disappointed ..I just told my kids im pretty sure Gordon Ramsay has no idea who is running his restaurant and that customers are being discriminated  and treated so shitty.

mYQCHYjCRwis5V34hhTqfw.text: The burgers are so tastes and juicy. It is a bit on the pricier end but I think it's worth checking out

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MjlbKg_aJ7bKZmzw21NkaA.text: This place has the best burgers hands down!  I have tried other restaurants which do not compare!  Their burgers are full of flavor!!!  The service is amazing!  Staff treat you with courtesy and respect. Though there was a line to get in, it moves fast!  I will definitely be back for more!!

POxUS2waB7cYiU2Iw4Di4A.text: I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay and have watched just about every one of his shows so you best believe I'm hitting all of his restaurants!  Food is a solid 5/5. The kettle chip nachos with short rib was absolutely divine and something that I will be dreaming of. Everyone loved their burgers. I really enjoyed the forest burger. There was a perfect balance between the herby and peppery arugula, the creamy and salty cheese and the meaty mushroom and duck bacon. My patty was perfectly seasoned. The only thing that wasnt a complete success was the hog dawg. On paper it's perfect but the hot dog was too salty and there was just too much bbq sauce. The whole thing was a sodium bomb but personal preferences of course. My.neice in particular loved it.  So why the 3 stars? The service. Dear lord the service. When I first checked in, I had specifically stated that I had 2 kids with me. Later on, my mom also confirmed and reminded the hostess that we had 2 kids. Keep in mind that we had a diamond players card which means we should get priority seating (30mins instead of 1 hr) but still had to wait an hour. When we were finally shown to our tables they gave us a booth that would have not fit the 2 kids. You'd expect them to consider the situation and get us a table immediately right? No. We waited another 15 minutes as people with similar party sizes were led to their tables. We were given high tables and despite us repeatedly asking for high chairs weren't given any until our waiter provided an additional chair instead. At this time I notice other tables that could have easily been combined for my party to sit at. These lower tables would have been much more appropriate for the kids. What was super enfuriating though was that a hostess delivered a high chair to another EMPTY table even after we asked her for a highchair a second time. I was particularly annoyed that despite having us wait they weren't even cleaning up the table that they were about to sit us at until just before they seated us. The waitress literally stood at the side of the table while the plates piled up. I get that sometimes you need a break but you're keeping your customers waiting in plain sight of them. If you're not looking to immediately remedy a mistake at least try to make an effort to please us. Our waiter took forever to get our bill to us. We were trying to flag him down for ages and somehow he never saw us despite us being in his direct line of view. I have never experienced such horrible customer service before.

VGmMBjYUvR_jrwZ1--IzBQ.text: My bf is a huge fan of Gordon, but I personally think the foie gras burger is just great. It's not surprisingly good, but it tastes alright/great. The truffle fries are a lil disappointed tho. But overall it was a great experience  One more thing is that their beer is so expensive

clLR9jkgb0HTRwJiSJkHgw.text: Hells Kitchen burger with Onion rings and chocolate shake!  Then eat burger place in Vegas hands down!   If you are in Planet Hollywood, stop by and eats some burgers, you won't be disappointed.

qDZ52HtW1g7JkuCbGtuiDw.text: Great environment, good food, poor service.  If you're in a party of 4 or more, you can skip the line and go straight to the front to give them your name and number. They'll text you once your table's ready. When my party of 5 came on a Sunday, we checked in at 1:30pm and our table was ready at 2:15pm. By the time we sat down, our waitress - who seemed very unenthusiastic for having to work that day I might add - said the burgers would take half an hour to make. HALF AN HOUR! Our appetizers came out within 15min but our burgers actually didn't come out for another 45min. Imagine how hangry we were.  The Onion Rings and Truffle Fries are great to share with a group of people. The dips that each come with add a lot more flavor. They were both good but not great, I've definitely had better for less.  Forest Burger (mushrooms, arugula, duck bacon) - I loved the combination and it sure was tasty. I was intrigued when I saw the duck bacon but wasn't a fan when I actually tried it. There was no duck flavor and it tasted essentially like salty dried meat. Normal bacon would've made it better. However, the beef patty was delicious - probably the best I've had.  Farmhouse Burger (bacon, fried egg) - I personally liked the Forest Burger better but the 3 others I came with preferred this burger. They used normal bacon here which was a plus.   Bottomline: The food is good, but for a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, I expected more... and better service.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest Burger

q-uje5FnMx8cUUQPseqQyw.text: Second trip to Burger this time around in Vegas, and I was incredibly disappointed. Quality control has obviously gone downhill from our first visit about two years ago.   When we ordered we were encouraged to order an appetizer because "the burgers will take a while". The appetizer didn't get to us until after the burgers arrived (about 10 minutes). We did the ahi tuna sliders - disappointing. Not a ton of flavor and the texture was off-putting.   The burgers were OK. I'd give them 3 stars if I was reviewing them separately. Not terrible, not great, definitely not worth the price.   The sweet potato fries were absolutely disgusting. The fries themselves were prepared well, but who in their right mind takes a sweet product, adds powdered sugar and then serves it with some disgustingly sweet dipping sauce that looks like snot? We didn't eat any of them, complained, and nothing was done about it by the staff.   Overall the staff was friendly, but one of the people we interacted with at the bar (where we sat) was obviously stoned. Have a little professionalism.

Bb3IVJupZTafl8iKC8mb9g.text: The hype is real!  I know that Chef Ramsay was not behind the grill the night we came, but it seems there is a real attention to detail here that has earned the name.    This was our Thanksgiving dinner this year.  My older son and I came here because the younger son was acting up.  This was my son's choice.  I was game.  There was a bit of a wait for two, but not too bad considering it's Vegas, at early dinner time, on Thanksgiving Day.  When we were seated the server came over pretty quickly.  They have a pretty simple menu of burgers and sides, but all of the offerings looked very interesting.    They have a good selection of draught beers on tap.  I started with a Boddington's - delish.    For an appetizer, we ordered their take on nachos - kettle cooked potato chips topped with corned beef and smothered in a cheese sauce.  OMG!  Wow!  This was sooo good.  My son ordered the basic burger and I ordered the Hog Sandwich for our entrees.  My son really liked his burger.  He plowed through it like nothing.  My sando was pretty amazing.  It had a ground pork patty topped with pulled pork, bacon, and onion strings.  Whoa!  Porky heaven.  The only hiccough of the meal was that they ran out of two beers that I tried to order.  I ordered the first off the menu.  The server came back and told me that they were out, but he also brought two tasters.  I really liked one, so I ordered it.  He came back a few minutes later and told me they were out of that one too, but he gave me a free glass of his other recommendation.  I did not expect that at a big name Vegas restaurant, so all worked out fine.  Definitely a great place for a casual meal in Vegas.  Based on this experience, I want to try some other GR restaurants.

4GGz8pK13qNfyI_EBHdV3g.text: Me and my pal went there around 6 waited 20mins and got Gordon Ramsey burger and sweet potato fries. The BEST burger we ever had: I can tell they really care about their burgers and the layers of flavors are just amazing. The sweet potato fries are soo good they made the sauce so unique and complement the fries just right! The stuffs are so nice and welcoming. The service was fast too! Such an amazing experience!!! Go try it yourself!!

A0E55ZIOUqcAtuhnm-qApA.text: Meh  Service was great.. Very loud.  I was expecting a burger to blow me away.  If you love burgers with eggs and jam on them this is your place,  I like to taste the beef.  Their meat blend is very good and cooked to perfection but nothing awesome.  I can get a better burger back home in Chicago.  Make sure you ask for the fries unsalted as there was way too much.  Wouldn't come back...  This is not the best in the world as people say.  $25 for burgers and fries.

A1d5yqXcIIgJFBVQTG3-ow.text: The place looks cool but doesn't live up to the expectation.  The quality is given but not sure it worth the wait.   Nothing to see here... move on.

achsmK-Z0XY3VrVhKXOSeQ.text: I would say the food is decent but the service is iffy. Just takes a really long time in between getting seated, ordering and getting your food. I got the hog burger and when I got it, it was cold. Like it's been sitting for like a half hour. Luckily they offered to make a new one when I mentioned it (like I'm fine with it just being microwaves but whatever). I don't know if I'll go back honestly.  Don't get. Milk shake. Ridiculously expensive and come in y'all skinny glasses that doesn't hold much. We got ours and it was pretty much completely melted. For sure not worth $10.

PKCrMNyBdIQyYOycF5ObuA.text: I wanted to like this place I really did, but the quality of the food did not hold up to the expectation or what you should get considering the excessive wait and price.   Don't get me wrong it is not bad, its just nothing about it stood out as actually being anything more than ok.   The hostesses  could really do a better job in the seating department side of things. I was there alone and the spot at the bar I ended up sitting at was the same spot that had been open for the entire duration of the 45 minutes I had to stand in line waiting for a table.   Overall this is one of those spots you go to so you can say you have eaten there, but once you have won't go back again.  I've eaten at other Ramsay locations before and based on the food taste and quality you would never know this was a Ramsay location.

0_GgbVjO2v75GUiUj0nLkQ.text: My husband and I bonded over Gordon Ramsay trash tv when we were dating, so it felt right coming here. I got the UK burger with the veggie based patty--I couldn't even tell that the party wasn't meat, and the topics were delicious. My husband got the farm house burger and it was bleh deliciousness. It's definitely worth the splurge!

VUeXUNJKtOTMlzSFMkyh-Q.text: Wow. Best burger I have ever had. You must try the onion rings, out of this world. Definitely recommend the Farmhouse burger.

jz4-t34hNUY6cSAFmAFLaw.text: Awesome awesome food. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger and my husband ordered the The Hog Burger. It was phenomenal!! Service was great, and I will definitely be back. (Ask for the cheddar ranch to dip your fries. You won't be disappointed)

MtnF85sIogZfQxcQdPCZCQ.text: Great as always and huge line .. but it always worst to come over here .. most marvelous burgers all over the world

DwBJaeL5VWM5LfKkYUqBLQ.text: They got rid of one of my favorite things on the menu which were the most Devine Jalapeno Poppers. Was not pleased about that. Normally a long line because there's a dearth of eating options of Burger's category (casual but somewhat nice). The burger I ordered was fine. Nothing to write home about. The French fries I ordered were $6 but plentiful and filling. Absolutely not a fan of the ketchup.   Probably won't eat here again as it is somewhat pricy, has a wait, and was not that remarkable for me.

79D-tSfR45faWgAa3C6BxQ.text: I've been really excited to try Gordon Ramsay burger after hearing great things about it (and watching his show!) unfortunately, it was a bit of a flop for me and disappointed.   After reviewing the menu, I decided to get the Hells Kitchen burger, which was supposed to have roasted jalapenos, roasted tomatoes, jalapeno aioli, asadero cheese, and avocado. Sounds spicy right? Not at all actually. I saw the roasted tomatoes and stuff in my burger, but it was not spicy at all. In fact, I couldn't really taste anything except for the avocado. Not even the jalapeno aioli that was supposed to be in the burger. I ended up just dipping my burger in the ketchup and aioli sauces we got from the Parmesan fries because it was so dry. This was really disappointing.   The second thing that was really surprising was what happened with my friend's blue cheese burger. While this burger tasted much better than mine, the kitchen somehow messed up and there was PAPER in the burger! I could not believe that there was actual paper that somehow ended up in it. We complained about it to our server, Elijah, and he was very nice and quickly corrected it for us and replaced it with a new burger. Shoutout and thank you for correcting the situation. I was just really surprised that this type of thing happened at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant.   I'll end the review on a good note with the Parmesan truffle fries - although I was hesitant about the $12 price tag, the fries were really good and you could taste the Parmesan and truffle sprinkled evenly throughout all of the fries. They come in a cone and sometimes because of that the seasoning may not be evenly spread out, but this was not the case at Gordon Ramsay, thankfully. I would have preferred the fries crispier, but they were still good.   Overall, the paper in burger thing was really the biggest surprise at this higher class establishment. That aside, the food was just okay to me and not mind blowing. The service was a saving grace and I appreciate everyone on the team who contributed to that!

6YWKKFv03I19A6fzVS0zxw.text: I had high expectations for this place and was really disappointed with the food. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger well done. The flavor of the burger patty was average. It didn't have as much flavor as I expected it to have. I also ordered the $9 fries and the texture and taste was not to my liking . They were soggy and didn't have flavor. I don't mind paying a high price for food but when that high price doesn't meet your expectations it's really disappointing. If you want the experience to say you've dined at this place I recommend it , but the food taste and quality does not meet the expectations of the burger place owned by a culinary legend.

dn_yPlMvan4_8V9x1kdqpA.text: I came on Sunday night around 10 o'clock pm , the place is pack, I see a lot of African Americans eating here , I keep looking around there's about 50 employees here, but I don't see any black people working here  Why  aren't there any Blacks working here ? Is it because it's an evening shift , or does this place not hire black people??

EY8TBkCpit2ixo9KiVKiWw.text: Burgers are amazing 5/5, but service is slow and sucks! 2/5  The beef burgers are sourced halal from Creek Stone.   We had the Hell's Kitchen burger which was amazing and flavorful!   Now to the service: 1. There is usually a long line outside the place to get in. The hostesses were not very efficient seating people. An open table was empty for 10 mins, which we could see, before they would decide to seat someone. 2. After being seated, we were waiting for a long time just to even get water. I had to ask another server to call someone to our table. 3. We ordered and I asked for water without ice. The server seemed to forget that very simple detail for 2 people. However, it took him another 10 mins to replace the water - just without ice. 4. The managers seemed to be doing nothing about this extremely slow service. They were just hanging out in the corners and chatting away. I guess they don't need good customer service since it has GR's name on it.  The food was great, but customer service is terrible. I would go back for the burgers. But the rating is for the whole experience.

miOhZoE0mjuwrru_YSAPSw.text: Best burger ! Great ambience and quality . Will definitely be back again  Friendly server and fast

gN3_J2700MunQseuPzKtfA.text: Honestly I am very disappointed. This is NOT worth 4 stars. Only rating it two stars because the only tasteful thing i had was my Pepsi drink. I ordered the kettle nachos, corn dip, duck poppers and onions ring to start with and it was shit. We were SO EXCITED to try this restaurant and it was awfully bland. I really did not like the Duck poppers. there was no stuffing. It was only a red bel pepper. The onion rings tasted bland as well. honestly it was all bland. did not taste fresh. The burger was okay. I will admit the quality of the meat was satisfying but i don't know. I feel like it needs maybe some type of sauce, not to drench it but to add more flavor. like crap, adding ketchup will give it more flavor and i don't even like ketchup.  Our server was rude. We asked for a bandaid and she told us she would have to go to security to get one and shook her head and said "so no"   go to shake' shack.

gfryM5haOwd6G_qAFSiY4Q.text: Went in with high expectations after a 30min wait. My fries and brown butter milkshake were delicious. However my chicken sliders were rubbery and if Gordon Ramsay himself was eating them he'd go "f*ck me.. this is ghastly"

PRu9CHrkcZMaMVtjvHg4DA.text: WOOWWW JUST WOW! One of the best burgers I ever had! My boyfriend and I got the Stout Burger and it was incredible. Love love lovvvveeee it!

whDfB3cvv2C_0_uu35rvNQ.text: Very mediocre experience for the following reasons: *We ordered what we thought were Impossible Burgers for a $6 up charge. Turns out it was a Beyond burger but no one told us that until we got the food. For an extra $6, I would expect the courtesy of being told that what was written on the menu wasn't actually correct. We went to the restaurant for Impossible Burgers so really did not appreciate the False advertising. *The burgers were dry after we asked to go with the restaurant's recommendation for how to cook what we thought were Impossible Burgers since we weren't aware they could be cooked to varying degrees. Even more disappointment for $23-24 burgers. *Onion rings were good when they first came out but once they cooled off they were sickeningly greasy. *Truffle aioli with the truffle fries tasted like it has fake truffle flavoring *Service was lackluster

hP_inLc7hREEn_q-soA-Gw.text: Blue cheese burger was excellent. Onion rings very light and crisp with a nice contrast of dipping sauces. Caesar salad was also very tasty- a bit of a ripoff compared to some of the other options, considering there was no protein though. Disappointed that the wine list was incredibly uninspired and overpriced ($14 for a glass of Alamos Malbec which retails for $8/bottle). C'mon!!

CuCgDsUsCHkwSnwEjWscaQ.text: Giving this place a 1 star mainly because of the poor customer service. Ordered a  blue cheese burger that didn't taste right so I asked the bartender politely, with the heavy makeup and long hair (have to describe her like that because she chose not to give me her name I think she's maybe asian) to exchange my order and she had such an attitude about it and gave me a hard time about speaking with management. From the minute I sat down and asked for recommendations she was very rude and condescending. Very disappointing. In the end management later came and gave me the hellz kitchen burger. Not sure if I want to return and pay a premium for this experience again.

-gUAJK0eg0qdjkmIv3_H3Q.text: Was so excited to finally get to try out a Chef Ramsey establishment that I didn't mind waiting an hour and a half to eat hamburgers.  Apparently when you have a party of 3 or more, you can leave them your number and they will text you when you're table is ready vs less then 3 you just wait in this long looking line.  Either way it's a long wait.  When we got the text, we waited another 6 min for them to clean the table and finally we got seated.  Yay!  Most of us ordered the Hells' Kitchen Burger because of our waiter's recommendation for first timers.  We also ordered the truffle parmesan fries and beer battered onion rings to share.  And Creme brulee shake and brown butter caramel pecan shake to wash down the greasy food.  The patty was melt in your mouth delicious!  I ordered medium rare and it came perfectly cooked.  My issue with the burger was that it was INCREDIBLY salty.  I recall a bite where it felt like I was eating salt straight up and could feel the crunchiness of the salt on my teeth.  Maybe the salt was spread on unevenly or extra was spread on after?  Had the same issue with the fries where it was just too salty.  The onion rings were ok but nothing to rave about.  I loved the oreo shake part to my creme brulee shake but it turns out to be overwhelming with creme brulee on top and on the bottom.  It was just too rich for me to finish and felt kind of sick sucking up creme brulee on the bottom.  I'd recommend just order the oreo shake without the creme brulee.  Everyone liked the pecan shake but I prefer something sweeter when it comes to shakes.  I think overall maybe I just had a really high expectation for this place and it really fell short for me: food and service.  I love Gordon Ramsay and I'm a huge fan of his show and it saddens me to write this review but   everything was just okay and no way in hellz am I gonna wait an hour and a half ever again for mediocracy.

HjNrTm8bL6OMkSTGuRFg8Q.text: Big disappointment as his unfortunate Burger restaurant is Nothing like what he portrays on his tv show as far as Service and good quality. From the lack of hospitality that the staff gave and didn't tend to their job and patrons to the average quality fries it's not an establishment that I personally will not be returning.  From the start the bartender says "burgers will take 30 minutes to cook". Umm that should be your 2nd open line to your customers, we were so turned off at the bartender, I wanted to leave!!!!  The three staff at the bar was not busy at all both at the bar and drink orders from the floor, there was 8 patrons at a given time at the bar and the staff did more talking story, hands in their pockets, leaning on the back bar, and watching the game on the tv behind them. They should have been tending to us by refilling drinks, we shouldn't have to ask to have water and ice tea to be refilled when we didn't even get dinner yet?!?!  Very disappointed!!!  Staff need Real Life training and if Gordon Ramsay is going to portray a demanding way from his show then he should first take a look at real life happenings in his own restaurants.   Two stars given due to burger was good and tasty. Other than that I would've given this restaurant only one star.

sg-wqzRHrrc8JBQHBm0ZCQ.text: This is the absolute very best burger restaurant or regular restaurant you will ever eat at. Waitresses are extremely kind, food is beyond delicious, and the price point is perfect for the food and quality. All the attention to detail from the plates, to the menus, to even the cardboard cup holders, it's absolutely amazing. If you sot at the bar, you can see the chefs preparing your food. They added TVs in the diner to play from all sorts of sports channels to view. Music is added to lighten the mood. The busiest time during the day is actually at night or around dinner time. Waits can pile up to 3 hours long, and the waiting lists are overfilled. Super spacious, and the perfect temperature to enjoy your food. Burgers are what the restaurant is known for, but there are also snacks, soups, salads, sandwiches, and deserts a plenty. The drink option is very wide ranged, and they sell bottled waters like Perrier and Fiji. Tables are bug enough for multiple dishes and for sharing. The lighting is also great for pictures, not too bright, and not too dim. And the best part of course, is that if you're lucky, Gordon may come to the restaurant for a usual visit. Five stars for this one. Shoutout to Devin who was our waitress

Tn70nyiUChZsNusDeDSvmQ.text: We waited an hour and a half to be seated. We are locals. We were treated horribly. If you think Gordon Ramsey is a jerk, wait until you meet his hostesses. The staff does not care about good customer service. They are obviously taught to get people in and immediately out.      The food is not worth the wait or the bad service. I would never recommend this place to ANYONE I actually liked.

iWtek-6q7r7mTj5unX98XQ.text: Do you think they have good burgers in the casino at Planet Hollywood?  Do your think you can have good burgers at a place that serves almost 2,000 people on a busy night?  Think YES people!!!  There are places more glamorous, with much better settlings, but if you want to get in and out quickly, have a shockingly good burger, and pay a reasonable amount then this is your place!  We all had different burgers, and we all loved them.  Ok, the chicken burger was undercooked, but the issue was rectified immediately, the item was removed from our bill without asking and the manager was great.  Good food, fast service and awesome fries!

EbJH_v84mmRfcFR4EOjg3g.text: The food was not that great. There was 4 of us and only 1 order was done correctly. We waited about 35 minutes for our food to come out after appetizers. However, where I would have given 1 star, I'm giving 3 because the manager Ryan understood this was not a Gordan Ramsey standard and comped the food.

oojrC37w357wdlgpRqZ1lg.text: Here is a tip:  when the line is long and you can't wait an hour and a half to eat, get it to go. We did that last night because we were short on time and trying to make the Britney concert. You order from the hostess and pick up your food in about 30 minutes.   We sat in the casino sports lounge next door. I would totally do that again!  The tuna sliders had a lot of textures and flavors, I liked it. My favorite was the fries with curry sauce, I would get this again.  I want to try the portabella mushroom sandwich because my friend loved hers, she said it had the perfect flavor combination.
