9fM53gueEOGfQ4V5JQiG2Q.text: To be honest, I don't get why Gordon Ramsay BurGR felt the need to relaunch themselves. A four star average spread over 5,400+ reviews seems like a damn good reason to leave well enough alone! Not that it feels like much has changed. In fact, we wouldn't have even known if our server hadn't mentioned it. At the same time though, as modest as their remake was, the English/grammar nerd in me was pretty happy to see them put the "e" back into "burger" (yes, I get that the "BR" were for his initials...). In all seriousness, the look and feel of the now-named Gordon Ramsay Burger is the same as before. The only real changes I could see were with the menu; prices are $1-$2 higher (they don't have a discount for Total Rewards members anymore) and their burger offerings have been tweaked a bit (some have been altered, others seem to have been added/removed). Thank goodness my friend was down to split a couple of burgers though; getting to try two burgers at the price of one = more bang for your buck! -- TRUFFLE PARMESAN FRIES...$12 (yelp.com/biz_photos/gord...) In terms of taste, this was exactly as good as I remember - a decent amount of parmesan, the perfect amount of truffle oil, and all around delicious. The fries were also just as crispy and flavorful as before, though the fries weren't cut as large this time around, which was fine. -- HOG BURGER with Mangalitsa Pork, Mangalitsa Bacon, BBQ Pork, White Cheddar, Pickles, Crispy Onions, and Slaw...$18 (yelp.com/biz_photos/gord...) With pork on pork on pork, this burger sounded awesome to a pork fan like me! Sadly though, this didn't amaze (good, but not amazing). The pork patty was super juicy and flavorful, and I loved the onion strings and melted cheddar, but I didn't sense much of the bacon or BBQ pork. Not sure though if it's because they were lacking or if everything else just overshadowed them. -- FARMHOUSE BURGER with Dublinar Cheese, Mangalitsa Bacon, and Fried Egg...$16 (yelp.com/biz_photos/gord...) Though the Hog Burger didn't amaze like how I had hoped, this was terrific! Which wasn't surprising, given the classic combination of toppings - soft, lightly toasted buns, a well cooked patty, a runny egg, thick and flavorful bacon (in this case), and gooey cheese. Definitely recommend this! Name change aside, it was great how our experience wasn't far off from the first time around - terrific! The menu options, the food, the service...all just as good, even despite prices being a shade higher (to be expected after four years!). While I still want to check out Burger Bar next door at Paris, and even though I'd still give Holstein's a slight edge by comparison, GR Burger is as solid of a choice as ever.

PHu4gkZZKaYSC0wkBliS8w.text: Order all the burgers and split them between the table.  Crazy? Stupid? Both, maybe?  We ordered the Hog, Hell's Kitchen, special F-Word and the Lobster/Shrimp. Split the burgers four ways between our party of four so we could all try each one.   None of them really stood out...we decided we all liked the hog burger the most, but we could skip this place next time we are in town.  Surprisingly, we ALL really enjoyed the poutine.  It wasn't authentic poutine, but the flavors were awesome.  That mushroom gravy...delish!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster&amp;Shrimp

-stYgvAkClcJwQM_2rSDlA.text: Now this was my first time at any of Ramsay's restaurants and I have always heard good things and boy it's well deserved. I had the foie burger, it was absolutely amazing. The wine reduction made the chopped greens complement the burger perfectly and the foie blended in to make this probably the best burger I have ever had in my life.  Service was also very good.  Highly recommend you go here.

F7QTDH1XGqatM5JSlPD3cg.text: I have been dying to try this place for years! Finally made it and it definitely lived up the hype!  If you have more than 2 people, you can put your name on a waitlist and they'll text you when the table is ready. I loved that so you can take off and come back. Made the wait super easy.  The quality of everything was soo great and I wouldn't expect anything less from a Gordon Ramsay place. Sadly I couldn't give this place 5 stars because our service was definitely not the best. Our waitress was a little delayed. I had asked for the alcohol menu (duh it's Vegas) which was on an iPad. She gave it to me and was missing for quite a while. I had to stop her and ask to order my drink. Then when we came to order, I and my mom, got the stout burger. I asked for the mustard on the side. When they brought it out, there was nothing on the side and a dry burger. Of course, she was missing again. So we asked a bus boy who was kind enough to go investigate. Apparently they were out of it... but had enough for my moms burger. Strange. He offered to bring me a couple sauces to try which I did. Apparently the kitchen was making a new batch. And when it was done they brought it out. At this point out I was mostly done with my burger but I was really glad that I did get to try it with the sandwich because it was sooo good! It definitely needed the mustard. Had I known asking for it on the side was going to create this fiasco, I would've just taken whatever they had left! But I wasn't given that option. My other recommendation would be to slice the mushrooms. There were literal whole mushrooms on the burger which was pretty difficult to eat.  The onion rings and French fries were soo good! And my boyfriend got the seafood burger and he loved it!  I definitely would return because I think my experience was just a fluke but I had high standards for a Gordon Ramsay place!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stout burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings

rRuP56Vv8emlWs3WmrbCxw.text: Nothing special here. Tried three different burgers and somehow, they all kind of blended together and tasted the same, only differentiated because one had jalepenos in it. Dry, bland, unsatisfying and over priced. I didn't eat anything for 12 hours before having the burgers, so I was ravenous when the food came. This level of hunger should bump up any food a few notches and add some bias to its deliciousness but they were bad and couldn't be helped. The truffle fries were okay, and the onion rings were not edible! They were soaking in oil and impossible to eat, and left completely untoucheThree burgers, fries and onion ring came out to about 80$ before tip. This was indeed a sad meal

EeH7SjCuhGuPKIAgUMP64A.text: This is the first time I have been Disrespected at this establishment... or any in Las Vegas.   We have been to several of Gordon Ramsay's locations throughout the years: STEAK at the Paris, pub and grill, and his fish and chips establishment.     We didn't stay to eat this time because of this...  We were received by hostesses that were McDonald's quality.  We stood in line for 44 mins exactly (after speaking to a hostess to see how long the wait would be) when we reached the end of the line (yes, there was a line) the hostess told us we had 45 more mins to wait!!  The hostess blamed us!  She told us it was our fault because we didn't speak to a hostess before standing in line. I told her we did. And an ocean of excuses poured out of her mouth, none were apologetic. I expressed to her that we've been waiting for 44 mins already and my parents are diabetics... she said ok and walked away.  I asked for her name, she walked right passed me, TWICE!   I had to go to the bar to ask for the manager.    I spoke to the manager, Joe Rich, he did not care one bit!  I expressed to him that we have been to several of his [Gordon Ramsey] restaurants and not once have we been treated this way.  He simply said "have you been seated yet?  Are you going to allow us to serve you?"  No apology, nothing!  I told him "well we would be seated regardless...".  He replied, "ma'am you're Getting loud, we need to step outside".   Long story short, if this is a reflection of him [Ramsey] It is poor.  I have seen his show and the hostess and manager were "idiot sandwiches".

mcrw30NI_zPl5XEZZR6yxQ.text: Absolutely fantastic!!!!! The line seemed very long but I only had a 15 minute wait.  The Parmesan truffle fries are a must! I got the farm house burger and it was fantastic! The beef was fresh and very moist! You will not be disappointed!

cLdDh_jyueg0Yq8SI_GPQQ.text: Absolutely horrible. I've had better burgers at McDonald's. You need to come and do a rescue on your own restaurant, Gordon. One burger was under cooked, the other was over cooked. Patties tasted just like the frozen Sysco patties you get at crap restaurants. Mushy, super greasy onion rings. Fries tasted like they were fried in old oil and dropped on the floor. Even after getting one burger taken off the bill, still paid over $70 for crap food and slow service. The waiter did the best he could, but was stretched thin due to the lack of wait staff. To add to this horrible experience, even the glassware was chipped. Very disappointed because your steakhouse was amazing and expected the same from this place.

dgISreFaXkOeIhrKcBCLww.text: This place is usually packed but I was lucky enough to only have waited for 25 mins! This is what I tried here:  Ahi Poke Sliders: if you love sushi, you will love this. The ahi tuna is so good in these sliders. Honestly I could have ordered this for myself and ate it as an entree.   I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and my friends order two other burgers (a pork one and one that had arugula in it). Out of the three burgers, mine was the best because it wasn't dry at all like the other two burgers. It had just the right kick to it as well. The avocado is so good in the burger as well!   The sweet potato fries and truffle Parmesan fries were really good and they are a pretty big portion that can be shared!

hMZOTvgZOEIsF2WmsgSw9A.text: Branding, branding, branding.. thats it.. I would say just get in n out and you will be definitely more satisfied and happy.. Very overrated..  The two stars are for the service and the truffle fries..

oTP4kE6nKnATBPgJEqv2fg.text: We ordered the blue cheeseburger and the farm burger, and the truffle parmesan fries.  Everything was great. The buns made these burgers worth the long wait to get in and the 30 minute cook time. We are from Texas but we come to Vegas 3 or 4 times a year. This will be one of my favorite places from now on.

uxNgBRtr-eEIYClCi84FWw.text: Okay, where do I begin. A few friends of mine were very adamant about having to eat here. So we go and it's a 2 hour wait and I was already starving!!!! We contemplated leaving but it's Vegas and Labor Day weekend, so no matter where we went it would be the same wait time.  We were a party of 13 with a newborn and they were amazing at accommodation. The waiters were very attentive and quick.  I can't remember the burger I had  and I'm not a burger person so I almost just did a side but super glad I didn't! My burger patty was wrapped in bacon with onion rings and so much more! It was so huge I couldn't bite it, had to cut my burger up to enjoy it but so well worth it.  You wouldn't hear me recommend waiting 2 hours for a burger however this place is in exception to the rule, and is worth the wait.

7CPfjbY4vWjPD1DPALCZgw.text: Friendly staff and didn't have to wait to get in at 11:30. They have long lines later in the day.  I enjoyed the Hell's Kitchen Burger. Flavor was good but not hot. Wished it had more spice to it. Burger was juicy and liked the roasted flavors. Tried the garlic parmesian fries and they were ok. Bit too salty for my taste, but the dipping sauce balances it. Overall, it was good but was hoping for better for a restaurant with the namesake.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Wka3JwiHdosrrrOaH484Ng.text: As a huge fan of Mr Ramsay this stop was a 100%% must and requested by our Son.. This site sits in Planet Hollowood very easy to find,...Had a party of 5 and all of us had various Burgers, with French fries/Onion rings no joke this burger was off the chain well seasoned hot fresh the bun was perfect along with the fries, the price per person is around 28$$ minus drink, per, next time in Vegas put this on ur must do list , a great experience..

sEXA5DFs6ZjyCOli4o0L-A.text: It was my first time eating at this place I must say it did not disappoint. Every time I passed by this place there is always a line but it moves pretty quickly. I end ordering the "hells kitchen burger" medium. It's probably one of the best burgers I have ate, the meat was perfect and had a lot of flavor. Burgers do not come when sides so you have to order your own sides. I ended up getting the truffle french fries and onion rings. The fries where really good but what caught me by surprise where the onion rings! Wow the onion rings where really really good must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger

FNEHCKa1bEVK5x5guk8jig.text: I've been twice, once with work colleagues and most recently with my wife.  Both times the food was excellent, burger was cooked to order and fries were crispy.   Most recent visit my wife and I were on a mission for their milk shakes.  Last time I recall there being a larger variety but on the most recent trip there were ultimately 3 but really 2 with a variation on the shake.  Shakes are multi-tiered, bottom part is the ice cream shake, mid level is a pudding and topped with house made whip cream.  They are phenomenal and I'm very glad that they aren't in Dallas or I would be in trouble.   We had the farmhouse burger and regular fries split between us.  Both were great and the house made ketchup with chipotle was superb.   Only downside, burgers were taking 35 minutes to make.  Waiter sat down to advise that typically they are about 15 minutes but they were down a chef and the wait time had more than double.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Regular fries with chipotle ketchup
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left: Chocolate milk shake with creme brûlée.  Right:Brown butter ice cream with fresh cream and salted caramel
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse Burger

ye7swsfGS94WcC8X0JKe8g.text: I have to set the stage for this review. I love Gordon Ramsey. I've watched just about every show he's hosted. I've been dying to try this place for a while. Because of this, my expectations were high going in. Ambiance is awesome, lots of TVs with sports on. Menu had great choices, including different types of meats like pork and chicken. Prices are reasonable especially if you think about where and what you are about to devour lol. Ordered an app, duck poppers, good but for 14 dollars I expected more flavor. Probably wouldn't get those again. Burgers were juicy, well constructed and delicious and exceeded my expectations.  Bun was soft, toasted and airy so it didn't overwhelm the ingredients within the sandwich. Sides included fries, sweet potato fries and onion rings. All very good. The sauce with the sweet potato fries was aaaamazing.  Over all well with the wait to get in (15-20 min) and wait for the food to arrive. Definitely going back, and definitely recommend everyone get a burger from here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries, onion rings and sweet potato fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest burger

Ytsrw1yKKrwztTE-nchIXA.text: Our previous visit was great, and while I understand menus change, we didn't find anything quite as appetizing as our previous visit.  The burger was tasty but greasy. Kettle chip nachos were flavorful but partially soggy.  The staff was wonderful, aside from the lady sweeping the floor right next to our table.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backyard Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just Fries

Swv-9QOMtXxFokEiDN-6pA.text: Amongst the glory and glamour of all the dining ventures sprawling across the strip, each vying for your attention, this was one of the better ones that were open late (We went around 11 pm).  Decor : Fancy ambiance meets English pub vibe! You could see this place is a notch classier than your average burger joint (Well IT IS Gordon Ramsey one so there's that!)  Service : Once you ARE seated, it's pretty nice but the fact that it's Vegas and was a Weekend, there was a waiting queue. Here's where it gets hit down. You see for some reason, they were giving priority to large groups regardless of when they show up, over the Couples or Singles who had been waiting there for more than 20 mins!! I get the business nuance of this approach but it's very customer unfriendly!  Food : Thankfully, the food here is quite good! We ordered a Hog Burger and a Mediterranean Burger.  The Hog burger was a size-able beast! The patty was chunky but very juicy. I loved their crispy onion that gave that crunch to all the meat. Speaking of meat, I wasn't a big fan of their bbq pork and think the burger could have done without it. Still, a very upscale burger for sure!  The Mediterranean one decent at best. The lamb was tasty albeit a bit dry (Lamb burgers are notorious for that!). Feta cheese was a great accompaniment to balance the flavors and off course, lend it that Mediterranean feel! This burger however was a tad smaller than the Hog and could have done with a little more.  Value : For almost $20 a burger, this isn't your average burger joint or even a better one. The Hog was certainly worth the price. I'd say give this place a try atleast once, especially if you dig ala carte versions of Burgers!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mediterranean Burger

pYlBHHt4k2wqfVVOxr-k_Q.text: This was my first time having this. A friend of mine told me it was the best burger he ever had, and I wanted to see what all the hype was about. I was alone, and had to wait in their line with other folks that were parties of 1 or 2. The line was about 20-30 people and took roughly 25-30 mins to get through. I was seated on a table, and immediately knew what I wanted. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger, medium well. I was debating on fries as a side or something else, and I'm so glad I opted for the street corn dip. It was so delicious! The chipotle seasoned chips were a great item to have with the dip. I can't say enough about the burger. I've had soooo many, and this was hands down the best burger I have ever tasted. The meat was cooked perfectly, the melted cheese was the perfect touch, and the avocado and spices gave it that unique kick. I shouldn't be surprised that the wait was quite a while, however I was also trying to get a table with no wait on a Friday night around 10pm which is probably unheard of. I would HIGHLY recommend this spot to friends, and my next trip to Vegas I will try my best to make it back out here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger, medium-well | $17
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Street Corn Dip | $12

mx7BRNDi53LSnjAzvfJifA.text: Delicious. We got the duck poppers, truffle fries, and Hell's Kitchen burger. It was all so good. The portions are big and my husband and I split everything and we were stuffed! The ONLY negative thing I have to say is we ordered an old fashion and it was EXTREMELY watered down. I would not order a cocktail here it's not worth the money. However food was delightful.

CD8nCyEyRSKAPYXTQXKrAw.text: Where do I begin? It took 10 minutes after we were seated for our waitress to ask s what drinks we would like to order. I received my sweet potato fries (which are sold separately of course) and asked for ketchup. I was given a baby size ketchup and immediately needed more except the waitress was so hard to track down when I asked 10 minutes later my fries were cold, soggy and then she forgot the ketchup. My sliders were so disgusting and so was the lobster burger. We didn't eat 1/4 of what we ordered. The draw of the restaurant is Gordon Ramsey's name and the fire display in the outside. Save your money.

_IuQiWBFP8okZ7VKU0vilA.text: Trying For The First Time,And We Loved It! Big Big Fans! The Hog Burger Is Honestly Really Delicious. It's The Best Burger I've Eaten,That's For Sure!

XhnDRpAu10Jnp0K8Dog1dg.text: Best Burger In Las Vegas ! We sat on the bar where you can see the kitchen and was a great experience Will go back to this amazing place !

jdOdAWjfCi7YpTphlxbAhQ.text: WoW went here Excited and was let down .. the service here was bad , everyone in red and grey shirts or blue and grey were more interested with socializing with eat each then getting the food out.. there was constant orders waiting while they stood around and talked . You can see the order up in the kitchen and they just constantly sat there it was so bad and I was really let down. If my name was on this place there would be a big overhaul.

iDq3U16Ryj55fzxUZ_Muug.text: This place was defiantly great, amazing hamburger, beautiful decor. I only had one complaint that makes this a 4 star was the waitress I had. The waitress was Dorota and all she did was talk to her coworkers when they themselves were working and sitting in a corner laughing with the other workers. She never swung by our table unless we asked another waiter to get us something. Polite but she never came by to check up on us. Overall very great experience aside from the waitress!

Am4PdAXEYEQ0z673g87bcQ.text: Service was fine, burgers absolutely flawless and especially the "F-Word" and the "Hells Kitchen" were remarkable

Pcm7wcex4ze1adlub8lGmA.text: Super tasty burgers! Didn't know how big the side of fries were so I didn't end up finishing it. Only reason why I'm giving it 3 stars instead of 5 was because our waiter sucked!! His name was Chase and he seemed to be in another world or just purposely ignored us the whole time. He would help all the tables around us but he wouldn't help us. After we got our food he did not come once to ask if we needed anything. We waited sooo long to get our check even after another waiter told him we were asking for it!! It was ridiculous. Other than that the food was great.

rfKf2F3cht2PouMKfuNmBg.text: The food was great but the service was phenomenal.  Guy was a great "front man" recommending delicious drinks and burger choices. Kurtis and Rick brought the performance with their renditions on Happy Birthday to my friend Katy. Guy was clearly envious of the manager's jaw line and lush beard but he was able to work through that for the sake of good service. We will be back for sure.

UPgCiO5Ziyt7geYKe5CPkw.text: Excellent food! Waited in line for about 30-40 minutes to get in. Ordered the Parmesan truffle fries right away, they were great! Our waiter was very friendly. I had the portobello burger and my boyfriend had the Hell's Kitchen burger. Both were delicious! The only con was that the burgers took a long time to come out.

eHZxpBwpex1v7msyyKrSDQ.text: We ordered the uber cheeseburger. How can a burger be so good that's just meat, cheese and bun? Best thing ever!

KoDDf-0qJrZlY26OewjKyQ.text: This is worth the wait and cost!!! I ordered the special burger and my husband had the ultimate cheese burger. Most delicious burger I have ever tasted!! Service was great!! I'm gluten free and this place is great!!!

oHVpNwTLWFHRF50qLGEbog.text: Tried onion rings for the table, which were great. I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger, absolutely delicious. Save room for dessert too! I tried the Creme Brulee shake and loved it! Great stop if your visiting Planet Hollywood & Miracle Mile Shops.

A_NrFfvqRDiL5S6oTg4LOQ.text: Burger was good but the truffle fries were a shame. It was overfried making it so hard to bite.

EkOLu65m9vsqLD82CedP9w.text: Every year that I come back to Vegas I come here. Burgers are amazing including their chicken burger. Fries are fabulous. They never disappoint.

ZAb4877CvwXoJhZWtug5qg.text: Great quality meat! Burgers are simple as far as not having many toppings. My husbands bacon was floppy. Awesome truffle Parmesan fries! Decent pricing for what I expected. My burger wasn't quite well done but that's ok!

JqDjETPHmkWZ1XYQrhP-3Q.text: If we are in the mood for burger, Ramsey's burger is the place we go. From unique to gourmet burger selections, it will be your ultimate burger experience. I normally like the: Hell's Kitchen burger, farmhouse and the chutney burger. You have to order the sweet potato fries, the powdered sugar and the dipping sauce is so good. The truffle Parmesan fries is also delish

hwtbbvfZN8B-0ftBkoCZ7g.text: I use to love this place they recently changed there menu and took off my favorite the jalapeno poppers and they don't have the farm burger any more. The farmhouse is similar to the farm burger but it's not that great. Every time I go to Vegas I always stop by here it was always one of my fav to go spots but after this memorial weekend trip they disappointed me so much. I love Gordon Ramsey's restaurants from his steak house at the Paris to the pub at the Cesars and to have this spot change so drastically on taste and menu is such a disappointment it really doesn't uphold the Gordon Ramsey name brand

EHYdugbXKPjpohaou4E8bA.text: The burgers were amazing and the truffle fries are definitely worth sharing, a must! My boyfriend and I shared the Hell's Kitchen burger and the Crown burger and I am sorry I did for the burgers back home will never be the same! I am not a fan of hot, spicy food but the Hell's Kitchen burger was great n not too spicy. The truffle fries were absolutely amazing! Sorry but In n Out should not be compared to these, even the best gourmet burger back home can't top these! The 45 min wait wasn't exciting but to me it was worth it to have had tried one of the best burgers! Love Ramsey n as always he does not disappoint.

DCkkJj0TQvU8NLLVCsc0SQ.text: Tourist trap!!  Waiter warned us it takes 35 minutes for the burger.  40 minutes later we got our food and no one in our party of 4 ordered a burger.  Food is just ok.

LqZbiMwMNqZyJwK9oAcVJA.text: Contrary to other reviews our service was excellent. Our fries arrived cold, and old. We received another batch which was just as bad. At the end or server removed them from our check without us even asking. I had a Hells kitchen burger which was good but it was just a burger. After waiting in line for 30 minutes I felt kind of silly.

5-1iJ_8G3PR0s2EmJYkNbg.text: Long wait times to get in, although food was flavorful and delicious. Wine choices and dessert choices were stellar. Honestly saw wear and tear on the bar stools though. The truffle fries were not "snappy" like French fries should be... they weirdly had a stale like consistency. The Hog burger was great, but destroyed my intestines that night. I don't know what ingredient did it; but I'd love to know so I could do an "elimination diet" experiment with the ingredients. Overall, I'd give it four to five stars if it wasn't for loud atmosphere and wear in the restaurant.

7PewWcFGQHSCIeo8cSeDDA.text: WOW. The onion rings. Are. Amazing. In fact, they're so great, I came back a second night in a row just for those rings. The ketchup and other sauce is unique and they make a great pairing.  In terms of the burger, I got the one with an egg in it. It was super juicy, flavorful, and while I have no complaints it was nothing special (unlike the onion rings).  So if I had to recommend this place, I'd say make sure to definitely get the onion rings! The burgers are big enough to split with someone so that's also an option I recommend. I'll be back here no doubt about it.

n_v8k9M7_xrRTBjExxGbDQ.text: We watch all the cooking shows so we were looking forward to trying out some of the GR restaurants while in Vegas.  GRB was right in our hotel so we stopped in.    The venue is wide open with glass as walls so you can see in and out.   We were sat pretty quick which was surprising considering some of the reviews I read.    Menu had all the staples of burgers, 'chips' and apps along with a full bar with a pretty good beer list.  Nice listing of cocktails too!  We started with the Street corn dip.  Pretty tasty but not the best we have had.  In fact I think our homemade is the best!   I had the Hell's Kitchen burger with avocado, toasted tomato and jalapeno with a jalapeno aioli with asadero cheese.  This was really good.  Lots of good flavors.  It was a little under cooked and I should have sent it back but ti was so good I couldn't stop eating it!  Although this was really good I have to say it did not knock my socks off, like Hells Kitchen did.  The burgers are real good don't get me wrong but I have had amazing burgers and these were good but not amazing.

UfYLtV9xa57Z0cNbCUkkQQ.text: Lamb burger Absolutely good. I love lamb meat, So I ordered lamb burger although it was expensive. Yes it was best choice. Full flavor and Roasting what I want and really good tastes bun. I'm going to visit again to eat Lamb burger.   Fried Sweet potato I was wondering what is right choice in Cheese fried potato and Sweet potato. So I ended up choose The Fried sweet potato. Wow, it was great!  Coffee A coffee was little bit early served, So I asked to server 'Can I changed to new one?' The server said, Sure! And I got the new coffee I wanted.

iF_W797g95x_iSEJjd5BmQ.text: For a high profile chef this burger place should have been on top of their game but it was not.  It really is all about the hype when it comes to this restaurant. We had to wait 45 minutes to get seated and there is a line a long line to get seated.  Once the hostess came to get us and as we entered the restaurant we saw there were plenty of empty tables. It's a great strategy to make people wait outside so anyone walking by would think it's really busy and the food is amazing.  Our server Jonathan was on top of his game. I would say he was the only best thing that we experienced in this restaurant. We had Hell's and portabella burger and it was just okay. It looks great but taste was not that great and not worth the 45 minute wait. 5 guys have better burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom burger

7Szdc572HMQ0JHj7gxgyrg.text: I've been here a couple of times now. The duck poppers are a nice snack to start with, however they are extremely greasy and dripping fat off the fancy stand they are served on. This can be a little off-putting.  The Hells' Kitchen Burger is really good. The quality of the beef is definitely what sets this place apart from other burgers. It's cooked and seasoned perfectly, the ingredients are all fresh and it's a solid gourmet burger. It looks a little lonely on the plate all by itself though; I think they do that to make it stand out on it's own but somehow that just doesn't feel right with a burger; every good burger needs a friendly side.   Overall the food is great and worth the wait to try it out if you haven't done so. Definitely not the best burger I've had but right up there among the top ones for sure.

QefM0cnc4BUK2lmgggjXAQ.text: This is inside the Planet Hollywood. Free self parking at PH. Monday lunch at 1130, place was packed. No line though so we got seated right away. But when it was 1230, there was a line outside. Lol.  I had the Hog's Burger ($19) (biggest burger they have). The patty a mix of pork and beef. Some BBQ pulled pork, bacon, crispy string onions, cucumbers, melted cheese. I ate it with tabasco and it was great. The burger was tasty and hearty.   I tried my friend's Hell's Burger ($17) (most popular burger there). It had some avocado, tomatoes, roasted aioli, grilled jalapenos. It wasn't spicy. It had a nice refreshing taste, eating it until the end was a good, fresh experience.  Prices were a bit high IMO. I guess they can sell it based on Gordon Ramsey's name. Yeah the burgers were great, but not worth $17-19 IMO.   Staff was prompt and polite. Will be back to try their Burnt Ends Poutine... but the burgers filled us up already. Also the Truffle Fries are good I heard. Next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog&#39;s Burger from the other side

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Burger ($17). Most popular and prolly their best burger. Roasted aioli, jalapenos, avocados, tomatoes, melted cheese. Refreshing
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog&#39;s Burger ($19). Biggest burger they have. Pork and beef patty, bacon, bbq pulled pork, string onions, melted cheese, cucumbers

kiytynAbQ0D-qVjXpo-7aw.text: We went here on our 2nd night in Las Vegas and Gordon Ramsey Burger is ALL THAT! The wait was only about 20-25 minutes, well worth it. We had a GREAT server, Gregg and hopefully we'll have him the next time we go back. The Hellfire wings were flats without the extra bones and seasoned perfectly. Wings anywhere else seem like fast food now. We also placed an order to go for later on that night. My husband and I both ordered the Backyard Burger with an order of onion rings. The burger meat was exceptionally fresh, well seasoned and cooked perfectly. I think those onion rings are the best that I've had-lightly breaded, cooked in FRESH oil and sprinkled with Parmesan. When we go back to Las Vegas this will definitely be our first stop after check-in!  Fabulous job, Gordon...."Well done"!!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backyard Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hellfire Chicken Wings

L4QvmU8ViIbJHFHH0j_uCg.text: WAY OVERCOOKED, TWICE!   Order your burger rare, unless you want a dried black brick for a burger.   We ordered 3 medium burgers, and all of them came out more than well done.   The waiter even explained the level of pink to be expected and was surprised at how they dropped the ball.   Sent them ALL BACK.  The 2nd round had 2 burgers cooked correctly, and one of them exactly the same! Fail! They even cut it open to check and sent it out, knowingly making the same mistake!   Apparently even with the manager's help your burger is still gonna be way overcooked.   Delicious otherwise, but you've been warned.

3SMVfC58Acco7Wbu5QEWNQ.text: This is the second Gordon Ramsay food chain I've been. First is the Fish & Chips and I love that place. Anyways, this place is busy as heck. It get even busier if you go here on lunch time. There's long lines and service is slow. And servers needs to work on checking everyone not just taking orders. I know it's busy but I don't think it's a good reason for them to not refill my water.  Let's talk about FOOD! Ordered: Hog burger - all I can say WHOAW!! There's pork patty, bacon, bbq pork, and crispy onions. Sooo much meat! After three bites I'm damn full. Thank God my daughter is there I was able to half it with her. Mu daughter had the reaction too. Well, before that we had Burnt Ends Poutine. Burnt Ends Poutine - fries with poutine and gravy. It's really good. Sweet and lil a bit spicy. But the price I don't think it's reasonable because the serving is small.  Beer Butter Onion Rings - you can tell they use real onions. It's $9 price is good and they're good too.  Duck poppers - it think it was okay and it's expensive.The sauce are good tho. Also, the prices for the burgers is about right, they're huge and heavy.  ENJOY!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 7/14/19: poutine
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1efVM4Ro-3mKrU1qhgYNfA.text: So it's a burger place, what else can be said that thousands haven't said already?    It was worth it.   Burgers are really good. Just well crafted. Everything is made in house from the buns to the meat grind. My burger had oven roasted tomatoes that were super tasty, perfect amount of cheese, everything was made exactly as ordered, hot and timely.   The service was excellent, portions generous, price is high for burgers but not crazy- it is Vegas anyway and a brand name - so value is good.   I would imagine that if I came here again it would be spot on again and again. Consistency is what makes or breaks a good restaurant and this is a jeweled Swiss watch.   Only downer, fries were underwhelming, but I think that's just because they were not my fav style. They were big cut steak fries not super crispy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger and Just Fries. More than enough for one person.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly cooked medium rare edge to edge.

pY2JJbI0LR67s4UXhOgn9g.text: I love this place and so does everyone else as made apparent by the line that is always there out front. If you have a party of 3 or more, you will need to tell the hostess and they give you a pager. However, I've always been able to stand in line since I've always been a party of 2. The line itself isn't too bad. I've been several times since Zappos Theater is right there and we need to eat before we listen to great performances right? The wait is generally about 20-30 minutes depending on how long the line is. You cannot bring any outside beverages in though as I was trying to sip on my malibu pineapple from the neighboring bar.  The Kettle Chip Nachos can a bit rich and filling if you start with that which we quickly found out after our burgers came out. The braised beef was tender, but it is definitely on the heavier side with the cheese and sour cream. I've tried the Lobster and Shrimp burger (yes, I know its a burger place) but it was appealing and tasted wonderful which is definitely a "lighter fare" if that's how you want to go. I ended up splitting it with my friend and we shared a salad and onion rings. Onion rings and the cheddar ranch dip...delish...the batter is "fluffier" than other onion rings that you may have ordered and yes, the ranch just has cheddar added to it but ranch and cheese are probably two of my favs. I've also tried the Forest Burger. It was good and of course you can order it however you like it to be cooked. I wasn't a fan of the duck bacon but that was easily fixable.   Overall, service has been up and down for me, but the food is delish. I would definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle chip nachos
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse

DqxaHu_ZMVDKpi-7x5MKJw.text: This was our first stop for food when we arrived in Vegas! My goodness, the lineeee was insane! I guess this place has a line no matter the day or time of day. Our wait was about 30 minutes, which is pretty typical? We sat and our server was very attentive and polite. We sat near the kitchen so I was able to see the chefs in the back whipping up the meals, which is a fave of mine. Food took a little bit but again, they were slammed! The fries were thick and not overly salty. The burgers were amaze! Prob one of the best burgers I've ever had! Flavorful, moist, cooked to order- just so good.   If you can wait for good food, put this one on your list!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gmRenmTdYH4oBpGoJ3ydAA.text: The food is amazing. If you go here bring a heavy appetite. Large portions delicious. We got the poutine fries which were amazing, onion rings, also we got fries, and two burgers and we left with leftovers. Oh and the drinks let's just say they put a good amount of alcohol in there. Delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh hell Bloody Mary
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer battered onion rings
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mozzarella fries

wZXf92nuWx3UK-DQFFS4UQ.text: "COME ON GUYS!!!!" I know just because it says Gordon Ramsay doesn't mean it will be good HOWEVER it's a fact with this place.  There was a line to get in but it moved quickly.  Don't let this discourage you.  If you have a party larger than four call ahead!   Service here was great.  From entrance to exit, staff was smiling and eager to assist.  Our waitress was super nice and didn't mind my barrage of questions about the owner.  Lol.  I know I am not the only one that did that, so don't roll your eyes. It's always nice when the staff speaks so highly of the interaction with the owner when the owner is a celebrity.  She had nothing but glowing things to say. That made me feel good about spending my money here.  I digress.  The food lived up to my expectations! The nachos were delicious! My burger was cooked perfectly with the right amount of condiments to make it ideal.  Fries were hot and fresh with just the right amount of salt.  Come here with the expectations of spending a little money.  Don't think you can come here on a McDonalds budget.  However, the cost is worth the quality.  I'm not disappointed in the least!  That's my $.02 and I hope it helped in your decision making process.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just Fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle Chip Nachos
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backyard Burger

BCzJUa-b2nYvBYuvxbXKwg.text: When you are craving for a great burger, this is the place!!! When in Vegas try out Gordon Ramsay !!!  Wait for this place was long for dinner so we decided to come back for brunch instead....there was no wait time at all.   We came with another family and everyone's orders looked so good! Definitely nice presentation.   Price is a bit pricey for a burger, but worth it after you take a big bite of their juicy burger!  Top it off with some truffle fries and shake!!!! Will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get in my tummy shake!!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anything with Truffle is tasty!!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger with big flavor!!!

0J4OkwXFLNean0KF1r32uQ.text: To be honest, I didn't really have much expectations coming here as I thought it was just a hyped up restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised when the burgers were actually really good. We got Hell's Kitchen Burger and the Turducken Burger. The Hell's Kitchen Burger was cooked well and had really great flavors. There was something about the sauce that was so addicting. The Turkducken burger was pretty good too, but I couldn't really taste the distinction between all the meats (turkey, duck, chicken). This one was not as tender and didn't have much flavor. We also got the poutine, which was pretty good. The gravy had so much flavor and we couldn't stop picking it even when we were full.  Overall, I felt that the burgers were good quality and tasty.

Wgp7fcIPcEvEWR8CrQx3gA.text: Loved Ramsay's Burger! Delicious burger, the truffle fries are a must and grabbed a beer. I suggest sitting at the counter, right infront of the kitchen so you can watch all the cooks in action! Easily one of the best burgers in town, however, it all comes at a price. A burger, fries and a beer will run you close to $45 so I knocked it a star for price. Plenty of other delicious burgers in town for significantly less! Other than that, it's worth a try if you're a Ramsay and burger fan! @theworsttourguide

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef recommended Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger at the counter!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef de Cuisine with Truffle Parmesan Fries!

_Hqs0ZxUUT_5PUwA3OToow.text: First meal in Vegas we had to stop here!!! This place is awesome!!! My wife went with the Back Yard burger, my son picked the stout burger both choose to share side of fries ( it's huge). I went with the Hells Kitchen burger (yummy). This place stays packed!!! I felt rushed during our visit. This is a Military Friendly location.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stout
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen no bun

2PnsUO5khlfolHDdShmdXA.text: You know that joke about how the meat was so raw that Gordon Ramsay could hear it moo? Yeah... unfortunately the opposite happened here. There was a line out the door and so I just swung into the bar and asked if the seats were open. They were. Yay! I had a flight to catch and I really wanted to try this place. like really really really wanted to. I've been a huge fan of Gordon (who hasn't?) for a long time and yeah. So it worked out. I just ordered the Guinness Stout Burger.  I was still so full from lunch but I wanted to squeeze one last meal in before leaving vegas.  I saw a guy next to me with fries and it had powdered sugar on them??? and so naturally I asked what the flip. I realized they were sweet potato fries and he offered some to me. Yay. Dipped it into the honey mustard looking thing but it tasted like custard. It was so good. This tasted straight up like a dessert dish. yummm... It was a honey aioli.   The burger. The bartender said that their rare was extremely rare so I thought medium rare would be good... but it was cooked to maybe more of a medium. It was kinda dry... Basically just tasted like a mushroom burger to me. Nothing amazing... I just liked that it had a ton of mushrooms. Not the best burger I've ever had... not the worst... but for a Gordon Ramsay establishment I expected more.

veCxfhb9ktHVIQg4t7m-fw.text: So so excited to try this place for lunch! When in Vegas have to try one of Gordon Ramsay restaurants. I do love a good burger as well so again super excited.  I got the farm house burger and my friend and I split the truffle fries. Delish burger! The bugger had this delicious cheese, bacon and egg and everything blended together into a delish dish. The truffle fries were also amazing and came with two dipping sauces.   Much better food and dining experience compared to his restaurant I went to in Atlantic City.  My stomach did hurt alittle after I ate the meal but I think it might have been a combination of grease and heat. Still amazing burger and I'm happy we got to try it when we were out in Vegas !

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger and fries

suS0G4Pl6AKaY6tPX0eDmQ.text: The service here out does the food and I must give 5 stars on it alone! If you go try the farmhouse burger! And the hellfire wings!

_lX_CD9d_ICTk_PlwVNk2w.text: This place is hard to write a review for because it's amazing. The burgers were juicy and delicious. The poutine was also delicious, if you don't mind pepper (it's a REALLY peppery gravy, but intended. I did like it). The service is good, nice, not too annoying but also check up to make sure all is well. The price is what you can expect for.... Anything in Vegas. Except here it's totally justified because this wasn't some burger you'd get from your local Denny's (no offense to Denny's) it was definitely on a different level. But still overall not a bad price. The burger we got was 17 dollars, which is basically usually the price of a burger AND fries. Here it's literally just the burger. Highly recommended if you want to experience a good burger.

Iw8nh1rYKrColA2XvOHhpA.text: There are lots of burgers on the strip so we had high expectations from Gordon's place.   He did not disappoint, the whole experience and the food was worth the extra bucks.

MJzLKbVJ7rfs8Sj7hytnmQ.text: Line was out the door so the food must be good...And it was!  Waited 1 hour for table and food was slow coming out but the food quality and our server Alex made it well worth our time. Salads were unique and flavorful. O-rings were Top notch and the Burgers BIG and Tasty! We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farm Burger

W_J7BWFVqUGXL7kVSAHQlA.text: We were a group of 9 and the place was busy as always seems to be.   Cool vibe and happening place. I ordered my Farmburger well-done.  It came medium and egg runny.  I ate around the outside and it was good. Wish it would have been cooked properly so I could enjoy it as I am sure it would have been good.  Too hard to track server down to get it cooked.   French fries were good.  Server was busy however, none of us ever got drink refills including water.  For me I've been there done that, no need to go back.    $36. For burger fries soda and tip.   Loved the vibe, great plates and cool signage.   If you like burger medium this is the place, just order it well and it will arrive medium

uQJCZaMt3epTRESUIZcQ2w.text: Delicious burger cooked to perfection.  Toppings for every culinary desire.  Definitely give the duck bacon a try.  So tasty.  Be prepared to wait 30-45 minutes on a weeknight.  Worth the wait!

YgH0_czm__rp1STltn9nKg.text: The selection of meats was surprisingly varied. They went beyond your cow and pork, offering turkey, lamb, chutney, and the "impossible" vegan burger. There were a lot of fancy cheeses with French names, too. I got the Mediterranean burger, which had lamb and blue cheese. The taste combination was definitely unique and gave the burger a nice savory flavor unlike anything I've had before. The Mediterranean burger is made medium rare as a standard. Though it was too pink for my taste, the kind and attentive server had the cook whip up a new one medium well for me. The truffle parmesan fries and chocolate creme brulee shake were the highlight for me, and that's why I'm giving them 4 stars. A place called BURGER should not leave that impression.

z6Wgy5lyqgkFIcheA8RJQw.text: We were a party of 2 and went for snacks around 4pm. This place is located in Planet Hollywood and since we were staying in the same hotel, it was a no brainer for us. There was hardly any line when we arrived. But after leaving the restaurant I noticed there was a long line of hungry people wanting to eat.  I had always wanted to try a Gordon Ramsay place, and this place is True to his name.   We ordered Portobello burger and Truffle parmesan fries. Each of the fries had the perfect seasoning and right quantity of cheese. It had a perfect crust and was so flavorful. Each of the fries felt just melted in my mouth. Wanted to curl up can use them as my blanket and sleep Loved the burger too.. they perfect just perfection..  Place is definitely worth your money and time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan fries @ $11
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello burger $16. So worth the price

on6uyYwtfICIlBnpHcwmnw.text: Very Good Burger!!! We had a bit of a wait, that was expected but the line moves really fast.  We ordered the Kettle Chip Nachos for an appetizer, very good. The Nachos come with shredded corned beef and short rib meat which is the star of the dish.   We ordered a the special of the day, The F Burger. This ranks up there with one of the best burgers I've ever eaten and the burger patty is the best I've tasted.  It was like eating a perfectly tender piece of steak.   The only reason for the four stars is the cost ratio.  Overall, this is a great place to eat, in a great environment.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

noh-APio4HnI8LyZ5_QuLw.text: Loved it! It was my first time here, we tried to come here last year while we were in Vegas but the line was super long. I would recommend coming here for lunch & arriving a couple minutes before it opens!  Let me just start by saying the ambiance is beautiful in this restaurant. The fire at the entrance lights up the whole room. The staff was friendly & gave service with a smile which is always a plus. Everything from the moment we walked in was amazing.  The food was the best part! We started with appetizers - onion rings & the mushroom poutine. Delicious! The onion rings were light & the flavor was so good. The cheddar ranch dip was the best pairing to dip the onion rings in. The mushroom poutine was savory & delicious one of my favorites. If you love mushrooms you'll love this dish! I ordered the ultimate cheeseburger, the different cheeses gave it such a kick! My husband ordered the hog burger & loved it! We also ordered the lobster & shrimp burger & that one was my favorite! Portions were a good size. Timing didn't take long since we ordered appetizers first.  They don't have a kids menu, but if you ask they offer to make a grilled cheese or a normal hot dog. We ordered our 1 year old daughter a grilled cheese & I can guarantee you I'll never be able to top that.   We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster &amp; shrimp burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate cheeseburger

ud3yB7QlC1ityRzamoUy1Q.text: Surprisingly it wasn't as good as I was hoping...  The wait wasn't too bad, they told us about 2 hours for a table of 8 but it ended up only taking 1 hour.   We got a poutine to split for the table, and I just got one of the burgers and truffle fries... No clue which burger it was, I think the hell's kitchen burger that had avocado in it. It was nothing spectacular though. In the end, service was pretty slow and food was just okay.   I had really high hopes for this place, but I only have myself to blame. I hyped it up for myself, next time, I'll just stick tot he buffets or something.

hJWNjWRH1lzx5l_sWaUfJA.text: Front of the line access for Diamond Members. Very friendly staff.  This was one of many restaurants I wanted to try when in Vegas.   I was lucky to be there during the week.  Ordered the Ahi Sliders, Truffle Fries and Cheeseburger. We were informed the burger would take about 30 minutes, but it was so worth the wait. Fries came out fast and so did the Ahi Sliders. Food was so delish.....

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi Sliders
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Fries

utrzBBrf9_JwYyW1Cy0BSg.text: I'm not much of a burger eater from years back when on choir and band trips we'd stop at McDonald's. These burgers are totally different!!  I had one with blue cheese and vinegar reduction.  It was juicy and delicious. I loved the flavor pairing too.

4F8G5fbhIFA8qKk3xrZ5LQ.text: Definitely coming back here next time I'm in Vegas!! I had the curry burger, which was veryyy delicious! My boyfriend got the hog burger which was waaay tastier than mine but nonetheless I was very happy with my choice. Also great customer service!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2RwIXI_jirt0x426E1sypw.text: First of all, the line doesn't make any sense, so I advice you go to the hostess, check in, and they will text you when the table is ready. This place is definitely worth visiting. The best burger ever, and the price is decent. It doesn't come with fries, but the side order of fries is shareable. I recommend medium burger, it's juicy and soft.  The only reason I didn't give 5 starts - when we watched Master shef, Gordon Ramsay yelled at one of the contestants for making french fries that were not exactly all same shape. He said it was absolutely unprofessional. Well, you should know that in his own burger place all french fries are DIFFERENT, the most different shapes we have ever seen. I wouldn't care, but he was the one to insist on it.  Definitely check this place, enjoy your burger.

NO1FWv-1sG8-Qh2ETesHmA.text: Pretty good burger. They were able to make any burger on the menu into vegetarian (by using Portobello mushroom).   Hells burger was delicious. (Jalapenos are spicy so I had them on the side). Parmesan truffle fries were BOMB and came with truffle mayo (which was okay..).   I appreciated that they split the bill between 6 of us when they brought it in. Made it very easy to pay with a large party.

OKHmvPowS0VsMnsueh9MbA.text: $70 a bit pricey for pub food but it was really good! Enjoyed it! We got the Oreo milkshake, hog burger (great) and basic wings. The fries were also very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

35XGJKDhFvhDOCoYnDoHkQ.text: This is a mixed review.  5 stars for service, excellent staff and speed.  2 stars for the food. I gave a 2 star because the experience left me feeling like I don't want to go back. I love a good burger, this place has big but underwhelming burgers. I've had the Hell's Kitchen Burger, the Hog Burger (separate occasions), the fries, and the onion rings.  The taste blends together too much. It's just a hot mess of meat and bread. They have few sauce selections. The house ketchup is too pungent, and the ranch is a cheese ranch, too much on the cheese flavor. Nothing fresh that cuts through the burger flavor.  There are much better burgers nearby. Don't let the fire display distract you, I think this place has little to offer in terms of special Vegas experiences or in a special dining experience.

j5N2h5nxbovPdZZr9yorww.text: Lots of pretentious (yes, I said it) menu items and the burgers are really rich.  I had the blue cheese burger and the flavor blend was awesome - blue cheese, manchego, arugula, figgy jam, cider vinegar reduction and spicy mayo.  If I was hungrier I would have tried the giant cone of onion rings or the kettle chip nachos with corned beef, short rib and English cheddar sauce.  The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is the somewhat distracted service - don't rush me to order and then ignore me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anyone want a lobster and shrimp burger?
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s Gordon Ramsay - &#39;nuff said.

wwxY2hMHiEB88rU-1GXZ0A.text: I love Gordon Ramsay, however, it is not worth the price and the wait :/ I mean it's in Las Vegas so yes, you have to wait for almost everything but I really don't see myself from going back there even if I were to visit NV again.   The sangria is actually really delicious, but again, kind of pricey.  I wouldn't highly recommend but it wouldn't be the worst thing in the world to try it here once in your life.

u49hZFrt6trqBOqy6E9BSQ.text: Let me start by saying, I was trying to find something wrong with this restaurant. My guilty pleasure is watching Gordon's shows and I was hoping that I could catch a screw up or something but everything went without a hitch.   I recommend getting there early as we waited for about 20-25 min for a table. After being seated we were greeted by a friendly waiter whom introduced us to the concept and recommended a few items. We ultimately chose the following: - hell's kitchen burger - bleu cheese burger (pictured)  - sweet potato fries  Oh man... I am dreaming of those fries, they are amazing! Please please do yourselves a favor and go to this burger joint, you won't be disappointed.   We came in hangry and left overwhelmingly delighted. Damn you, Gordon!! Can you do anything wrong?

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lTUrhGq5Pw_4lshUBkLlMg.text: Exceeded my expectations! Drinks were amazing, and the Crown burger was the best! I work in customer service, so I knew I would get great service. But my server Matt, made sure my boyfriend and I were happy with our meal, and explained his history with the company! I will come here every vacation out to Vegas! Thanks Gordon and your team!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

97Nwayvvm92Lh5jKrONA_w.text: I found the experience underwhelming. Burgers are okay, but not better then burgers I had before. I ordered sweet potatoes (didn't read the small letters on the menu) and they put sugar on them iso salt. Be aware of that because I didn't care for it at all. It felt more like a desert. Also there are not much "healthy" options, so if you are on a weightless program I wouldn't pick this restaurant. The service was also very slow, so don't go if you're in a hurry. I didn't care for the ambulance either but that's a personal taste. Music to loud, couldn't have a proper table conversation. Overall not a great experience. I won't  go again. I expected more because of the name.

q4u5dG7XukrUCrPktmndWQ.text: Not bad at all. I shared the Hells Kitchen burger and it was just right. The meat was medium just like we ordered with light pink center and ohhh so good. You have to get the sweet potatoes fries they are the best! The hype was right..... great place to eat. A must try

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CWIKaHYxaQ2o6Vb1_dJnaQ.text: got the Hell's Kitchen Burger ($17), which was cooked perfectly (medium rare, as requested), an order of their regular fries ($8), and the Wheatberry-Quinoa Salad ($15).   As burger joints go, this one was actually pretty standard (compared to Au Cheval in Chicago, or even Five Guys), and the real taste probably came from the ingredients themselves, not the way they were prepared. That being said, it's pretty hard to go wrong with a burger, and the patty itself was pretty well cooked but didn't really give it the OOMF that separates a good burger from a great one.   Salad was...okay, but looking back I probably should've tried another burger (the wheat berries and all the fruits in there made the taste quite strange)  Of course, I could've had the one "off" burger of the night, as this place is cram packed with at least a 1hr -1.5hr wait during dinner, and they must've been churning out burgers by the dozens. Still, if I gotta be 100% honest, Cheeseburger+Cajun Fries at Five guys for much less money vs the Hell's Kitchen Burger at Gordan Ramsey....taste-wise and value-wise, Five Guys wins xD (insert a Buzzfeed video haha)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hells Kitchen burger

7NETb_C6c06NALqZFn51jA.text: Burgers burger burgers      With burgers being one of may favorite foods.      Gordon Ramsey burger located inside planet Hollywood was my favorite burger that I had while visiting Vegas. The burgers were cooked to perfection and the service was great. We sat at the bar because if you want a great experience at any restaurant sitting at the bar has always been great for us. They had a few bartenders which was great to see because everyone was taken care of even with the huge dinner crowd that came in while we were there.       At 18 dollars a burger it better be good right? Well it was and we weren't disappointed with our choices. I of course picked the spicy jalapeno burger and dh ordered the breakfast style burger. Can't remember the actual names of the burgers but they were delicious. So many fancy names on the menu I though using a description of what was on it would work. We had the chips with pulled pork and those were amazing for an appetizer not to big just the right amount before our burgers came out. No fries with burger but the guy next to us ordered the Parmesan truffle fries and offered us a few because they give you a lot and he was by himself and told us we could have some of his. Those were by far the best French fries I have ever had.       The bar area has about 12 seats across the bar and tables out side of that which has a view of the casino.     I will definitely return to this location on the next Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos

rby4wAk2PNlZXplXR8Up2A.text: I was super excited to try one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants and came to this one! Yes, the serving may take time but there are many tables to be served other than yourself. What I found interesting since the restaurants I've been to doesn't have this was that they would text you when your table is almost ready! The food was amazing in my opinion since I do love trying new food!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan Truffle Fries!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue Cheeseburger!

KFzSLaEkY68nkka2I24DTQ.text: Everything besides the wait is awesome.  Food was perfectly cooked.  Venue was beautiful.  Waiter was great as well.

tXqynKvI0sPLm6YDePZkJQ.text: The burgers are like Gordon Ramsay i.e. overhyped. Below average. Burgers are dry and most of them taste similar. Don't waste money here. There are better and cheaper places in Vegas.

Du3m-2eJq3hliA2mm0-IEg.text: Second time trying this burger place and it was not very impressive again. I've had the truffle parmesan fries and foie burger. I could not taste the foie gras spread. The patty was cooked perfectly but it was quite bland. Our fries were thick cut so it's not really crispy and lack of truffle flavors. I tried my friends onion rings and it was surprisingly good. Sorry but it was not worth over an hour wait..

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

p-ubyoJxl3zMpoQxq6wAdQ.text: Came here for an early dinner.  Dramatic flames at front facade are failing and the glass is very dirty.   Needs a facelift big time.   Have heard many times that if the outside of a restaurant is dirty, then the inside may follow suit.    Staff and facility appears generally disorganized and tired.  Servers and food handlers seem stressed out.   Table seating is uncomfortable, tabletop was sticky- food and drinks are overpriced.  $20 plus for a burger and no side included.  Mine had a stale bun with it, no-bueno.    Truffle fries had very slight hint of truffle oil.   At least half of the cone had small pieces of over toasted potato crumbles.  The dips provided were tasty.    I checked the chair for cleanliness before I sat down, normally don't need to do that.   Vibe I got from the place was simply off.  Took an hour to get our food after we sat down - that ticked me off.  Server was overwhelmed, not his fault the kitchen wasn't pushing food out timely.  Gordon Ramsay you have too many restaurants now, don't let greed get to you at the  expense of your values and businesses.   It's obvious what is going on here.  Practice what you preach dude - it's not all about the money.   Or is it?  Queuing line to get in is confusing at best.   Lots of foot traffic as this place is at a major Planet Hollywood entrance point.   Music was super loud, cant have a conversation.   Cafeteria style food with Vegas bling sprinkled on it, save your money folks.  Burgers are small for the price.   Our hamburger patty was not made there, previously frozen low grade beef taste.    Major tourist trap you are paying for the name and it's not worth it IMO.   Gordon, you should be crossing your arms with disappointment after reading this review as you know the truth is being spoken here.

F8_oXNDGOSAiPkXcq6lqIQ.text: 45 minute wait? No problem, hit the slot machines for half an hour and check back in.   My first visit was a couple years ago for the fish and crisp burger along with truffle fries. I highly recommend the fish and crisp but prefer the sweet potato fries this time. A lot more crispier and complements dipping sauce

Dc09aTq5Sa3wDqRugXOltg.text: Went on Thanksgiving afternoon as our lunch pit stop for our long 8 hour road trip. No long wait, only about 2 minutes in line then sat us promptly.  I ordered their Backyard Burger ($15) opted out of cheese and pickles and cooked medium rare. I loved that they had a lettuce wrap option so I went with that as well. Boyfriend got the Hell's Kitchen Burger ($17) and Truffle Fries ($12). Wait was a little longer for food being served, roughly 20 minutes.  Burger patty quality: Fantastic. It tasted so fresh, almost like they had ground the meat themselves in the kitchen. It was fluffy, tender and undeniably juicy as I took that first bite. It was a pretty amazing burger only downside was it definitely ranked on the saltier spectrum of my preference.  They also forgot our Truffle Fries.  That mishap (although they apologized and made sure itbwas taken off our check) and the overly saltiness docked one star for me.

HVKWASc2nJSY9xPSo_XZLw.text: Ordered Hog Burger which made from pork but cooked in several ways, this is a very interesting burger, so tried it and it's delicious. Is it worth of $18? Well, considering it's Gordon Ramsay and location, it's pretty good.  One downside is, if you got seated next to casino, you may smell cigarette.   The Backyard Burger is very good especially with grilled onion. It is worth the $15 price tag.    Service was good, it took a bit to get burgers but it's fair amount of time due to they had to cook them like regular dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5eDY55f_LR230xXSG-RpmA.text: Tried this spot yesterday for lunch theres always a line to get in but goes by quick. Wife ordered the halls burger she loved it I got the farmhouse burger that was good we had the parmesan fries and 2 beers overall good times great burgers. We saw a guy order a hot dog that looked amazing and the milkshakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger was so good

HYYIS8cpTaA2t-ndzz0ZPg.text: The burger was good but the wait was insane ... 35min for two burgers!! Out of my bucket list ... I will not come again !

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pBwqY6PMoB-M_UCjuO8Njg.text: Tip: parties of 5 or more don't have to wait in line, walk up to the hostess stand and they'll text you when your tables about to be ready. We got so lucky with our party of 5 and were able to walk around and shop then go back upstairs to our room at Planet Hollywood to relax. The wait was about 1.5 hours, we sat at 7:30PM.   Price: super reasonable prices especially for the Gordon Ramsey name and it being located on The Strip!   Appetizers came out super quick, took about 2 minutes, it came before our server even gave us our water lol Kettle Chip Nachos: instead of traditional tortilla chips they use kettle cooked potato chips, I feel like this is up to personal preference. I wasn't too crazy about it cause the toppings made the chips soggy but everyone else in my party loved it. They weren't skimp on the meats either.  Beer Battered Onion Rings: super crispy and a good portion to share. Good but nothing too special. Parmesan Truffle Fries: the truffle dipping sauce was really good! Again, good size to share with 2-3 people. This didn't come out until the burgers which I thought was thoughtful of them haha. Cheddar Ale Soup: I wouldn't recommend, it was kind of plain and super super salty.  Took about 15-20 minutes after appetizers for the burgers to come out Our party ended up getting very similar burgers but all the burgers were excellent and cooked perfectly to medium rare, they were also hot temperature wise which I loved, I hate lukewarm food! :)  Hell's Kitchen Burger: LOVED IT! Two of us got this and both reviews were a thumbs up. Super juicy and moist, buns are important to me in a burger and I loved how the bread never got soggy. They weren't skimp with the avocado and there was a spicy kick but nothing too overwhelming. TIP: try adding some of the truffle sauce from the fries on this, heavenly!  Farmhouse Burger: who could go wrong with a fried egg? The mangalitsa bacon really pulled this burger together! I couldn't help but steal a couple bites!   Backyard Burger: a classic burger but nevertheless a good burger!  Can't wait to be back and try some of the more exotic options like the Blue Cheese or Foie Burger, I love foie gras.  Recommend going early cause lines get long, don't go during prime time like lunch or dinner. We walked past at 10:45AM, 15 minutes before opening and there was already a line! The line at dinner was super long but as I've observed, 2 and 3 top tables get turned over pretty quickly.

21bw9U4Nz6kQFX6tdeLCnQ.text: The service is so bad.  How Ramsey helped so many restaurants with their service but pay zero attention to his own.   Attention, here is the best part.  The waitress served us while sitting on a chair next to me... In my life never see a waitress sit while serving and she did NOT say anything before she sits down, like she has a disease or what. I even thought I invited someone but I forgot since she acted like I knew her!!!   I have to say no matter how good food is I would never come back to this burger place. The service is the worst experience in my life.

yJVOu2IXkM358RgFngg-Kg.text: Soooo tasty, juicy, and full of flavor! I got the Farmhouse Burger - that comes with the fried egg & I have no regrets ! Like everyone else said, the Truffle fries & Onion rings were fire.   Pro tip: If you have a platinum card present it up front, our wait went from 1hr to 10 minutes!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside the Farmhouse burger

6W-K7K1T5ffi7slf-PO33w.text: When I thought of a burger from Gordon Ramsay I  imagined it would be one of the best burgers i have ever had, and I was right. The Hell's Kitchen Burger, which my waiter told me was the most popular, was packed with flavors. The roasted jalapenos mixed with the avacado were a great match. The roasted tomatoes and the fries with the chipotle sauce were fantastic. The atmosphere in this resturant made me want to come back weekly. Great for dates or family trips. Highly recommend! Be sure to go early, we went a half hour after they opened and there was no line, an hour later people were all lined up outside and it was packed.
