x7P0r8fBcXxS25rn432ICw.text: After a 40min wait for my burger it was just "ok". In n out or Eureka is way better, pretty disappointed, I wanted to like it! :(

N1bjwbyjd12L-C5_tEL-xg.text: Well the wait is long....no different than anything good in Las Vegas...  Excellent food and service.

pKViY5T-kkT5aD1VxmU57g.text: Just, YUM. $$$$, but YUM! We waited a bit for a table and it was expensive but it was worth it. Possibly the best burger I've ever had eating out. We also had the poutine and, again, YUM.

Hia_ypI_WZBiL7aMGyXuKw.text: Got there just before opening and seated right away. Wife wanted to try the Foie Burger but our waiter, Jaime pointed out that burger will be phased out next update on the menu and suggested the Farmhouse Burger. I ordered the Backyard Burger and Truffle Parmesan Fries with Diet Pepsi. Wife wanted GF so Jaime suggest lettuce wrap as an option. She complimented the Burger with coffee. Both burgers came out perfectly cooked and very tasty. Jaime and his assistant, Don kept my Diet Pepsi and my wife's coffee replaced without being ask. That shows me that they pay attention to their customer's needs and aware of their responsibilities. Definitely be back next time visiting Vegas.

7yPjL9VkY1guLitjTUnM5A.text: I had the best burger ever here!!! I had the anniversary burger I definitely recommend getting it! I know the waiter had said it was only a limited burger because they were celebrating something but if they have it when you go get that one!

j9yPdirH23IImRVn1uJADA.text: Talk about a phenomenal burger! Everything this place has is worth trying out. Milkshakes are amazing and the jalapeno poppers are a must try if you like jalapeno poppers at any other restaurant. One of the best restaurants in Vegas.

2DZzagIFl5BbuvQd4MJIMQ.text: We ordered the best and largest cocktail shrimp I've ever had.  I dislike horseradish and this was the best horseradish I've ever had or will have.   I followed up with a corned beef sandwich with a Moscow mule.  They were both very yummy and would definitely order it again.

C_NzVOU-SoBUsq1TtAgHUg.text: We've waited in line here more than once but always gave up because the wait was too long. However, we were determined to try the burgers on our last trip to Vegas when the line was just a half hour. The burgers were good but not oh wow great. The fries were those big thick slab type, but I like fresh cut thin fries best. The house made ketchup was decent. We had the onion rings as a starter and enjoyed the rings but not the dipping sauces.  We ordered our burgers medium well. Mine was a mushy medium, but husband's was cooked as ordered. We both think a Coke is a must for the optimum burger experience, but no Cokes here so we got nice, cold beers. The service was slow. The ambience was nothing special. I wouldn't stand in a long line to eat here again. I might eat here again if I were hungry, and there wasn't a line, but otherwise it's a pass. There are better places if you want to indulge in a burger.

pkiEGQZqhcQQ3b-ViCfe2w.text: Delicious  the burgers are to die for and the sweet potato fries are the best ever! The dipping sauces are unlike anything you will find anywhere and all of them are amazing!

-EpOzJf9x2cwV6j1SIykbA.text: Not worth it. Although I did not have a burger, I ate with a group of 7 and all of them had a burger. One loved the burger, the others just thought it was mediocre. One person asked for a well done burger and they gave it to him medium rare. My other friend asked for her burger to be cut after it was already out and presented and the guy who delivered the food said sorry but he could not cut the burger in half because the chefs are "you know" and it would ruin the presentation, there were also no knives provided that were good enough to cut the burger. I ordered the ahi tuna sliders and they stuffed the slider too much to eat with my hands. I had to use a fork and it ruined the experience of what a slider is supposed to be. On top of that, they tasted like nothing. The bun was my favourite part of the dish. I will say, our server was excellent. Won't be coming back.

oz1f8l8LoBmD8yVAAvTVsg.text: Great atmosphere!  I had the original burger and it was fantastic. Service was a little slow. Waitress said they were short 5 cooks and it took 45 minutes to get our food.

xE4cnMRkPHlmMl1wnv7KRg.text: Waited for two hours to get my chicken curry burger. Had my salad. A guy comes in a half hour after me and gets all his food. I ask the server where my chicken sandwich is and they say sorry. Ten minutes more I wait for my chicken burger. They only comp the chicken burger. Not my whole meal. I was here over two hours. WTF!!!!!

5jj5dse2YRtiy8SWcpZz7g.text: I'm sorry but this was mediocre. If you're expecting 'perfection' you will not find it here. My burger wasn't how I ordered it (medium rare). Also we were seated near the entrance so we got the heat from that fire display. Seriously, you'd get better food at the Subway in the food court.

Nc-f25yv42H4TSb4gJZUSg.text: Long wait, rude hostess and very expensive mediocre burger....ordered the "f burger" after waiting an hour even though I saw tables available the whole time.  The burger I requested was supposed to be medium done and when it came out after 15 minutes it was well done and was dry plus I think ingredients missing....then the bill was sky high for this burger

KXfpNpxVHyPexDYt5xHDMQ.text: I love this place. It is amazing. My mouth is in heaven. I had a boner when I left and there was nothing I could do. Most people just nodded and acknowledged that they also enjoyed the burgers!

4jCnsp3iAUZrJY_cWJ2UWA.text: I'm a big fan of the Hell's Kitchen show, so I wanted to eat at one of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants on our vacation to Las Vegas.  Sadly, this one was a bit of a let down.  I naturally ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger which was pretty good, but I felt that I could get better burger flavor from Red Robin.  My wife ordered a set of chicken prosciutto sliders which were, admittedly, awful (over cooked).  I really wanted to leave this place a five star review because of my liking for Hell's Kitchen but three is all I can manage.

ODLFAVpLvJlLibu7ZzuXjw.text: As a long time fan of Gordon Ramsay finally visiting a restaurant of his, I was so excited. I ordered Parmesan fries and the Forest Burger and I am not lying when I say this was the absolute best meal I've ever had. The ingredients on the burger were ones I hadn't tried before so didn't prefer, but the patty just melted in your mouth. This gave me clarity on how all the burgers I'd eaten that were leaking grease were just that, but this was actually juicy and completely flavorful along with the perfect combination of the tremor cheese and mushrooms. That order of burger and fries has put everything else I've had to shame, most definitely a meal that will never be lived up to. Go to this restaurant so you can change your life and regret eating any other food forever

4o5qrXJKMSdDLuBfCUSUFw.text: First , I waited in line for 20 minutes  to get in. Second, the waiters take forever to take the order. Third, they run out of sparkling water. How this is possible in a place like this. Maybe the chef Ramsey is bs on his tv shows cause this is not acceptable in a place like this. I did not go to MacDonald so I expected better. Fourth,  after I ordered the food I realized I wanted to order coffee (freshly brew coffee) but I could not find my waiter, so I tried to reach other waiters, but they did not care. I was amazed. The other waiters were looking for my waiter. It took me 10 minutes to order the coffee. Amazing. Very poor customer service. Plus the coffee was horrible. I don't know how they can call freshly brew coffee. Burguer tasted good. Not complaint on the burguer. It's pricey but here is Vegas so this acceptable. Finally, I expected better experience because of Chef Ramsey , but now I don't know what to think. Maybe that chef is full of Bs in his TV shows cause definetly bad experience overall here.  Again burguer tasted good...

f7jPj8NiFD_3a11J1skXEQ.text: The wait wasn't extremely long when I came in on Saturday. Maybe a 15 minute wait to be seated, but for the food was around 30 minutes. Service was on point though! Very attentive service.   I got I believe the Hell burger (I think that's what it's called). It was good, had jalapeno, avocado, tomato, beef. It's was a great burger, but it's just a mediocre burger anyone burger restaurant carries. Delicious and satisfying but not finger licking.   My boyfriend got the farm burger (again I think that's what it's called) and just the same as mine. A burger you can get anywhere.   Our friend for the Foie burger (again I think that's what it's called) and he said it's a legit burger. Like the best he's had. I believe him because it was one of the most expensive burger on the menu.   We all got the truffle fries and it was delicious! I love it, but I hope I didn't just love it because I was starving... I did notice it was extremely salty so I couldn't eat a lot.   Overall, it's a great restaurant to try once and say you've eaten here. But the price is a little high and the food just isn't something I'd pay for because I can get the same meal elsewhere but for a cheaper price.

Swoipj40ZVNkW3MfaUn1Ew.text: This is a must for anybody who loves a good burger. We had sweet potato fries and the burgers were bursting with flavors. If you want to eat here with out waiting in line some after 2:00. Regardless, it is worth the wait! It is on the pricy side, but worth the experience. The waiters are friendly and it was a great experience!!!

xWcfjNpIMdZmayGq82tNPg.text: Expected way too much for this place, only to get disappointed.   Wait time: 40 minutes before we got seated, there was a line, ahhh must be fuxking good plus it's Gordon Ramsay for Christ sake!......then another 40 to get our food. That anticipation game is just adding up to the hype of eating burger of the famous Gordon Ramsay. (Not good when you have this type of mentality)   Location: Cozy, with "Gordon Ramsay" everywhere, plates, menu, coasters, even the little stick on the burger,  he also has a big picture displayed inside. Overrated.   Server: Good looking attentive tattooed chick  Food: I ordered the crown burger and bf ordered the "hells kitchen". Mine turned out to be salty and his is supposedly spicy but they must have used fake jalapenos. French fries are ok.   Overall, don't set your standard too high just coz a famous chef owns it! In and out is better than waiting almost 2 hrs for a 15-20 dollars burger alone!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vIJq1u2H7R7cv1DuH5baiQ.text: Ok. I'm just gonna say it. Straight up. And I don't want you to think less of me.   I went to Gordon Ramsay Burger and I ordered a salad. Yes, the wheatberry quinoa salad. And here is comes:   It was the BEST SALAD I have ever had in my life.   I'm just gonna repeat myself because I know you're probably in disbelief. I went to Gordon Ramsay Burger and had the best salad of my entire life!   I don't know when I became THAT girl that ordered a salad at the burger joint. I usually judge people who does that shit. It's like going to a Chinese restaurant and ordering fried rice and orange chicken. No! That is not acceptable. (I'm Asian if you can't tell). But I did. I don't know if it's because I'm pregnant and trying to be remotely healthy for this unborn child or because I've been eating shit all week in Vegas, but something inside of me was screaming for the wheatberry salad.   I was actually very hesitant to order it because I saw everyone around me eating burgers. And damn! Those burgers looked and smelled so good. So I thought I'd make the healthier choice and go for the salad. I knew I was gonna regret it.   But to my surprise, it was the best decision I've made in life. It truly was. (Am I dramatic? Maybe! But food is life!) That salad was incredible! The chicken was so flavorful! Not greasy at all! The salad was full of crunch with all sorts of nuts, dried fruits, fresh veggies, and quinoa. It was epic and it was everything I wanted and more. I couldn't have dreamt of a better salad. I had asked for the dressing on the side, and I didn't even poured an ounce of dressing onto my salad! It didn't need it! It was that good!!   The best part of the salad? It was massive! It can probably feed 3 people. Or one pregnant girl! Ha! I ate the entire thing myself even though I was so full half way through it. But I was determined not to let that deliciousness go to waste! Trust me on this- order the wheatberry quinoa salad!! You won't regret it. Your body will thank you.   I had a bite of my friend's turkey burger and truffle fries. It was pretty darn good. I won't lie! Truffle fries are pretty greasy though. You can tell it came straight from the deep fryer and you can see the oil dripping down as you dive in for your first bite. If that's your type of thing, then go for me. For me, it was too greasy.   I will definitely come back here! It makes me sad that we don't have this joint in SF. The restaurant is great- very modern and clean. Servers are attention and friendly. Prices are reasonable for the strip. And overall, it's just delicious! I don't know and I don't care who Gordon Ramsay is but man, he sure knows how to make an unforgettable salad!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ate 3/4 of the wheat berry quinoa salad before I realize I should take a photo of it! Best salad ever!

twihre7IshcWhBWgr2H3VA.text: Hands down the best burger I've ever eaten. A group of five of us went and somehow managed the hour and a half wait (which I would do again that's how good it was). Get the sweet potato fries. I didn't want them and ended up eating SO many. The other fries are thicker steak fries, which isn't my thing, but the others enjoyed them. But really, powdered sugar and sweet fries- it's love. Fries ought to come with the burgers, so idiots like us don't order them first and fill up on potatoes. My burger was the forest burger, but everyone got something different and we all came to the same conclusion- best burger ever. The meat is light and juicy, not greasy. The buns were really soft and fluffy. Also, sometimes in Vegas I receive spectacularly poor service since everything is so busy, but not here. The server was very busy, but when he was at our table he was engaged with us- he wasn't looking around, distracted and rushed. Will absolutely wait around another hour and a half next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OdPS_WTLGeA40B39Zgg0Dg.text: Absolutely beautiful restaurant with delicious food and service.  The line was long but was still totally worth it.   I tried the hummus with veggies and the poutine.  Both were fantastic.

9SGd8oJ76Dnl1o9LvAZ4Cg.text: The food is great. I've been here before and loved the jalapeno burger. If you like spice, this is a must try. However, their service is disgraceful. I really wanted my boyfriend to try this place and was disappointed when I saw a long line to get in. I was assured by the hostesses it would only be about a 30 minute wait, which not-so-quickly turned into a 45-minute wait. By this time we were only a bit more than half-way. I went to talk to them about why it was moving slower than we were told and why other parties were walking in (when there were no reservations available). I was told these were diamond players and they took priority. This would've been good info to have before we wasted 45-mins in line. We ended up leaving and going somewhere else. Terrible service Gordon!

n7rtvu6OoUZGBBjZQ0Zrkg.text: Luckily we arrived early enough on a Sunday afternoon to by pass the long line to get in to this place.  Staff was inviting, knowledgeable and friendly.  Refills came quick and upon ordering we were quickly informed we may be interested in a starter because all burgers take about 30 mins to be prepared and delivered to table. We decided on chicken wings and beer battered onion rings.  Was super excited. Expecting to be blown away, and I was thoroughly unimpressed.  The rings were made with shoe string thin onions, a lot of oil and light batter.  I literally felt like I had a cup of grease in my mouth   The wings were very meaty, but just seemed dry to me...but honestly I'm not a great wing eater, so according to husband, these were "pretty good."  Burgers--Hell's Kitchen burger, the chiles add a dimension of smokiness and full round flavor.   The Hog Burger, super huge and filling.  Very delish! Forest Burger, my burger:  bacon fried in duck fat, patty, sauteed mushrooms, arugula and I added an egg.  Thank goodness gracious I added that egg--it added some creaminess and moisture to the burger (even though I ordered med-rare, not very juicy) that it needed desperately.  I don't know if someone over seasoned the sauteed mushrooms and put too much salt, or if the thick cut duck fat bacon lent a salty taste to the burger, but darn it, my blood pressure went up!  I had to pull out the bacon  And I absolutely love--LOVE arugula on a burger, but the heaviness, and maybe the creaminess of the egg in combo with the arugula just didn't work.  The arugula lent a bitter, earthly zing to the burger, and not in a good way  gosh, I'm so bummed.  First time at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant and not super impressed...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d6X_5zHcrXDTRE6IbUUCYw.text: The restaurant is located in the Planet Hollywood hotel off of the Vegas strip. The restaurant is fairly easy to find since it is not fully enclosed. The exterior is decorated with a cool window displaying a fire design.   The menu is built around gourmet burgers. I ordered the Forest burger and Parmesan truffle fries. The fries were crispy and seasoned well with the Parmesan and truffle oil. It is enough for two to share as a side. The burger marinated well with the combination of mushrooms and tremor cheese. J was skeptical of trying the duck bacon since I am not a huge fan of bacon in general, but it complimented the burger itself, which was a thick patty. It was also topped with arugula and the sesame seed bun was toasted to a perfection and not too thick as to take away from the toppings.  I would definitely return to try one of the other burger options. The price point is decent considering it is a well crafted burger that will make you full. The menu offers a handful of burgers, but unfortunately you cannot substitute other toppings free of charge.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

10d7rH6kHN_mHF_N6LWRGw.text: For the price of a burger, I felt the meat was a bit thin and dry. The truffle fries with the sauces were excellent.

cOj0bPs159iy81iNLvCQsQ.text: We had the Farmhouse burger and Ale Dawg. Both were amazing. The burger was juicy and the dawg not greasy at all. Waitress was super helpful and never let thedrink glass go empty.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ale Dawg
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing Farmhouse Burger and Ale Dawg!

g3TCVpU2RWIkN831zlyeEQ.text: 1 word: YUMMY!  My husband and I went to Burger Saturday afternoon for lunch around 1pm.  We waited about 30 minutes for a table.  Once we were seated, we were almost immediately greeted by our server.  I can't remember his name, but he was GREAT!  He made an excellent suggestion about a secret burger (the F Word burger), that my husband ended up ordering.  It was a little pricey, but well worth it.  I had the Farmhouse burger, and then we shared the truffle fries.  So so good!!!  I must also add that this was not our 1st visit here, but probably the best food and service that we have ever received.  On that note, I am already looking forward to dining at Gordon Ramsay Burger again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dSYgMOJidO1PZNMPCVw2Uw.text: When it comes to gordon ramsay's place, it has to be good! The burger and the fries were awesome! Service was okay, but the ambiance of the place was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m_VyyXEHxnQbTW5U9_Jvmw.text: I didn't really wanna eat here, honestly. It looked frou-frou and overpriced from outside. I was glad we did, though. I was wrong. Burger was very enjoyable.  The food is not ridiculously overpriced. Pretty amazing food, too, actually. I can honestly say the Hell's Kitchen Burger was one of the best burgers I've had. I'd pass on the Tandoori Chicken Burger, though -- it's good, but nothing special.  The truffle fries with dipping sauces were delicious and big enough for two to share.  Service was pretty good, too. Friendly staff, drinks always refilled quickly. Food took 25 minutes to come out, but our server warned us about it ahead of time. It's worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yumness

CamYuKtbfrDVYi0bbNx2mA.text: Gordo!!   I had this on my must-visit list when coming to Vegas and Gordo did not disappoint! Went right before the dinner rush, which I recommend. No wait for my party of two - walked right in.   The menu was fancy and short - so Gordon, am I right?   I opted for the most expensive burger on the menu, "the foie" . It was the second best burger I've ever had. Meat cooked medium rare as requested. Bun... the bun . Never really considered a bun to be a really essential part of the burger but this bun is special .   Skip the $12 garlic fries. Good but Not worth it .

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordo!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Peek at the menu, including the foie burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $12 garlic fries . Don&#39;t bother

wBBxPc9elj0HWVjhTWS1CQ.text: Amazing food. Never tasted any chicken like theirs. It was truly remarkable. A very memorable experience. Waiter was very nice and was happy to help. I ordered the Swine Burger. It was memorable because at the end of the day, I thought of a new name for the burger. The Swine Devine! Because it truly was   a delicious burger. Great food and beautiful decorations. Classic outdoor styled kitchen.

xcP2gHE4j-DHt3-ihK5agQ.text: Looks cool from the outside but extremely hyped up... They made us wait 25 min for a table... Once inside the waiter was off his rocker nutso and acted like he was drunk. The food took 30 min to come and we ordered 8 burgers and 2 fries ... We paid like 100$US for 2 burgers and 1 fries .. Waste of money!!!

NQCWvaapek78e8ZjDNrpRQ.text: Burgers were good, soft moist patty and buttery buns. Only downside is the longer wait to be seated and served, but that's expected for the strip.

rjs17XEEn0lxYloIZstwhw.text: Came in for dinner at around 6, and the place was swamped. Service was slow, burgers took 30 minutes, but failry attentive. Sides are okay at best, but burgers Al la carte are worth the visit. I had the farm burger and it was skillfully seasoned and cooked perfectly; Bacon crispy and egg runny. Bun was soft and everything seemed well thought out flavor and texture wise. Everytime I have been here these thing have been True. And I returned yet again. Not a perfect experience, but a damn good burger. ( And great beer selection)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries

uEVukR3rjRpItumN7kVJmg.text: I'll start by saying the food is good. The problem with Burger is that the service is sooooo bad and everything is so expensive. I understand Vegas isn't cheap but for what Burger is, it's a little expensive for how terrible the service is. After eating here twice, idk that we'll come back.  Explanation of bad service - The waitress we had was not a native English speaker and was very very difficult to understand. She also could not answer questions about the menu and told us she needed someone else to help. It slowed the whole meal down significantly. Once we had ordered she brought the food out, and it was not as it was explained on the menu, or by her, or by the server who helped explain it. Idk if it was a language barrier/miscommunication issue but I would like to be able to expect that I get what I ordered and not something else.

amE-K8HMBvGqrf3SRtf16w.text: The wait is long, but it's worth it if you have your heart set on it.  I'm not the biggest burger fan, but the patty was thick and juicy at medium-doneness without turning the bun into a hemoglobin sponge. I got the forester which has truffled goat cheese and duck bacon. There was plenty of truffle flavor, but the duck bacon wasn't anything memorable. It wasn't the best burger I've had, but it was still top notch.  My favorite part of the meal was the appetizers. The kettle chip nachos taste like an upgraded version of something you might find at the Tilted Kilt. They were good, but the hell fire wings were better. They're cut so that they're easier to eat, and they're fried perfectly so that the skin is crispy while leaving the meat moist. The buffalo sauce is not too hot and slightly sweet, but it's more like a glaze such that it doesn't ruin the crispy texture. Finally, they're topped with some blue cheese. I loved them. Still, my favorite dish was the truffle fries, and that's solely because of the truffle aoli. The truffle scent from the aoli dominates the atmosphere no matter what else you have on your table. It looks thick and heavy, but it instantly melts into a rich cloud of truffle flavor once it's in your mouth. I could've stuck my straw in the sauce cup.  Finally, that oreo creme brulee shake is great if you like rich desserts. The creme brulee pudding layer is very sweet and heavy, and the oreo milk shake layer is runny with no iciness. Getting a little bit of both in each sip is key.  While Gordon's was great, I don't feel right giving it 5 stars when comparing it to other world class burger joints. For example, I still think Chicago's Au Cheval has a much better burger. Still, it's worth a visit if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forester burger was good for truffle lovers. I recommend having it with the truffle fries for a meal fit for a truffle-lover.

Pa4T3MvFVA0yAG-WMilNtw.text: We were very excited to Gordon Ramsay Burger, especially because we had Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips the day before and absolutely loved it. Unfortunately, it did not meet the hype. It was a 45 minute wait for a table of 10, and another 15-20 minutes for the actual burger.   We ordered the truffle fries. I don't agree with some of the reviews here, about the truffle fries being amazing. I've definitely had better. The fries were thick cut and not crispy, and the sauce that accompanied it was just okay. Gordon Ramsay Burger has their own homemade ketchup which none of us was a fan of. The onion rings were slightly better than the fries but again, I've definitely had better. For my entree, I've had one of their "secret" burgers which consisted of NY Strip and Ribeye and cost $22. The meat itself was amazing - very juicy and tender, absolutely delicious. My boyfriend had the Forest burger. He did not like it at all and only had a couple of bites. He thought it was dry. My friend had the hotdog, which he thought was good.   Service was great and the restaurant itself was beautifully renovated. I'd probably go back to Gordon Ramsay Fish and Chips and Gordon Ramsay Steak and skip this one.

i0T3mNj6QhhUWjZWVi4M1Q.text: Very underwhelming. The best part of the burger was the bun. We should have known this! Gordon ramsey is not known for burgers.   I ordered the Crown burger (mimento cheese, arugula, sun dried tomatos). Their burgers do not come with sides so you will have to order separately. We ordered onion rings and those were delicious. They came with 2 dipping sauces.  Would recommend going somewhere else for burgers...or food for the matter. Their only salvation was Gordon's pretty picture on the wall.

vKOhB4o2zHztMpeAYztAxQ.text: This was a very very good experience server was fantastic food was incredible. And how do you not like creme brulee on top of a chocolate shake

jvz6Zx5yltJba5qx7x-drg.text: I've visited 3 times and every trip is phenomenal. I highly recommend the Hells Burger, not as big of a fan of the duck bacon & lettuce burger (too salty for me). The burgers are amazing and perhaps the cheapest way to experience a Gordon Ramsay inspired menu. The servers are excellent, if not perhaps a bit over-the-top.  I will say, though, that on my last trip (5/10/18), The bald bartender without a name tag was ridiculously unprofessional. He threw a fit in front of everyone that "every shift needs to do stock" then continued to gossip about other employees right in front of everyone sitting at the bar...I really disliked being stressed by his negative attitude & rants.

kR8dYa4_KCuOA95yzHgvGQ.text: Oh my gosh! Food was so incredible. Had the brisket nachos and ale cheese soup as well as blue cheese burger.   I want to try everything on the menu!! The waitress wasn't too friendly, but I didn't care. Food was worth it and just the beauty of the restaurant. We went mid afternoon on a week day and no wait!  Go!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FTiUJbJ6LIGV2VbusO9phA.text: My second time coming here and noticed that they changed it up a bit. Food is great. I would come here again next time i'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FuEODnYzNYcPrceDNrz-Tw.text: The food was great, truffle fries are surprisingly worth it. Often when a restaurant says truffle fries the taste difference is negligible but in this case, it was well worth it. I had the hell's kitchen burger. To preface, I do have a fairly high spice tolerance so the burger to me was just heated, nothing to freak out about, even though the server warned me I might want to have the ghost pepper cheese on the side. That being said, the burger was delicious, tasty, juicy, and held up to the last bite. We also tried the salmon toast, pesto mac and cheese and the hummus. All tasty.   The service was great. Our server, Heather, was extremely friendly, kind and helpful. She did the most to accommodate our family and made us feel very welcome, from menu recommendations to accommodations for our picky eater.   Would recommend. Great atmosphere and decorations.

RNdbjHw2k-Z-yU9nOf65Hw.text: I had the best hot dog in the world here! Seriously, hamburgers are great but the hot dog was phenomenal!

Re9kDsCtnBH0LwnAg0SbPQ.text: Light, airy, and jam packed with pungent and juicy flavors that are a step away from melting in your mouth. Favorite burger so far, I got the Blue Cheesburger (blue cheese, figgy jam, arugula, cider vinegar reduction; I put the spicy mayo on the side).  10/10.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Light, airy, and jam packed with pungent and juicy flavors that are a step away from melting in your mouth.

jv05tgP_vD8N5xgoQoW7rg.text: Not what it used to be, farm burgers and truffle fries are bland and dry. Would not recommend anymore.

raoNi3ACRn8tEM1WRs04Aw.text: The blue burger is the best burger I've ever tasted! Server was friendly and very fast. The only negative is the fries, nothing special about the fries. The dipping sauces on the other hand are delicious!

RoF4I2b-qCJqA7B3MpTJ-g.text: The food is excellent, but the service is very slow. It took one hour to get a table, then another hour to get our burger!!  Why Gordon is not applying his own rules is his own business!!   Very disappointed!

hlcy2dsR99_7Q9Ytizn05w.text: Best burger I've ever had... awesome fries, and the curry ketchup is fantastic! The atmosphere is nice, but it did feel a little "busy" as the restaurant is very open and near the entrance of the Planet Hollywood casino. Would recommend!

7qsejuuGmH3ZGhLxJGqRow.text: Delicious and great friendly staff! Quality of beef was the best I've ever tasted, plus the selection of burgers had something to fit everyone's tastebuds...

Vqs9rvxigJfXgsUQ7E1egA.text: A friend recommended this place and said the burger was awesome. Ok, let's give it a try.  I came here after J Lo's concert at the same hotel. It was around 11pm but the place was crowded!  However, a table for 2 usually doesn't take too long.  We started off with a portion of their fries. Delicious!!! Thick slices just like I love. They came with some dipping sauces and one of them was truffle aioli, which was so good! I ordered the Forest burger. I had never had duck bacon before and loved it! This burger was very very good. The bun was toasted so didn't get soggy throughout the meal.  The other guest had the Blue burger. I tried a piece of it and it was good too. For cheese lovers it is a must! It is VERY cheesy.  We decided we needed more fries so we ordered the sweet potato fries. They are served in very thin slices with some powdered sugar on top. I really liked them, it is a different twist. But their "simple" fries were my favorite!

km_2o0DpA_1vgWyR-qBr9w.text: I'm never down to wait more than 30 minutes for food, so if you're impatient like me then SKIP the long line and order burgers to-go.   Food-wise, the Hell's Kitchen burger definitely lives up to the name. I usually get the wheat bun along with a patty done medium well. The burger comes with huge pieces of avocado and jalapeno aioli, which comes as a surprising (but tasty) kick. Everything was cooked to perfection and the burger itself just effortlessly melts in your mouth. However, I'm not a huge fan of their fries. Think thick-cut steak fries on the soggier side with no seasoning at all. Not even a pinch of salt or pepper - lacking some love, I'd say. Plus the curry ketchup was very much an acquired taste. The flavors just didn't mix well at all in my opinion. Skip the fries, but the Hell's Kitchen burger is a must.

5cNltoB4FN4iFIiYDNgtSg.text: The farmhouse burger is DELICIOUS! The brown butter shake is AMAZING! The ultimate burger was good - but a little strong on the cheese. Onion rings were crispy and a good size; Parmesan truffle fries were also good - although I wasn't a fan of the truffle mayo dip it came with, but my boyfriend really liked it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

27oib-OhFMTqulCk2XVv_Q.text: This is the first very Gordon Ramsay Restaurant that I have been to, and I really love this restaurant so much that I have actually celebrated my birthday three times here. The wait is not really bad, and if it is long, it is very much worth it. The staff are extremely friendly, and it pretty much has the best service of any other restaurant that I have been to. The food here is very filling. In my opinion, the best burger is the Farmhouse Burger. I just like how the meat, bacon, egg, and cheese compliment each other very well and create one truly memorable experience. The parmesan truffle fries are absolutely to die for. The creme brulee shake would make you think twice about purchasing a Frappuccino, In N Out shake, and even a Five Guys shake. One may think that the prices here are expensive, but I would be just as full if I ate at The Wicked Spoon and Wynn Buffets for half the price and a quarter of the food. I would rate the food a 5/5 and the service a 5/5. This undeniably deserves my second 5 Star rating. Oh... and make sure when you find a parking be close because it would be a pain for you to walk through Miracle Mile Shops after you eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday Parfait, I seriously couldn&#39;t fit this into my stomach after eating everything else.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plain Jane American Cheeseburger that flew down from heaven.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Creme Brulee Shake

7vDP_PpzXTOB0hZZARLgwg.text: Over priced, over hyped, mediocre burgers.  The wait to sit is long. The wait to get your food is even longer. Burgers are around $15 and up. Fries are not included and they will run you $8, $11 if you want truffle fries.   The burger patties are DRY. I wanted to try a specialty burger so I went with the Hog Burger ($18) and BF went with the Hell's Kitchen Burger ($15). Both of the patties were dry. We also got the truffle fries ($11) and they were steak fries which I am not a fan of. Also, they came out lukewarm. Now, I have no problem with the price if the burgers are good. I understand this is Vegas, on the strip, so I understand the high prices. But if I'm paying for those prices, I expect it to be good. I've had super premium dry age beef burgers upwards to $26 to greasy spoon burgers, and I love them all as long as they are good. I rather eat In-N-Out, Shake Shack, even Five Guys that I don't like that much over Gordon Ramsay Burger. Even if they are the same price.   The service is a whole 'nother thing. We waited close to an hour for the burgers to come out. The server explain that it takes them 45 minutes to an hour to cook the burgers. At least they could have given us the fries beforehand? And how come some people got their stuff quicker than us? We were highly suspicious they dropped our order or something went wrong in the back. Around 30 minute mark, we asked about our order and they said our burgers were next. Another 15 minute and no burgers. 50 minutes ish, the burgers come out and a bit later the manager comes over to apologize and explain, but there isn't much of an explanation. He says he'll get us a free beer or a shake but I know I'm gonna be way too full for that. I'd rather he comped the mediocre fries or something but oh well.  In the end, the bill was over $60 for two burgers, fries, and a beer. And a highly regrettable choice of meal for our short time in Vegas.

TqB_ws0nBdgkIsXgSYWRcA.text: Ate here during our latest venture to Vegas.  Had the Bleu Cheeseburger which was really good.  The beef was delicious and the flavors of the bleu cheese, arugula, and spicy mayo complimented it overall.  Only complaint was that it was a tad salty.  Truffle fries were legit.  Service was top notch, our glasses were never empty, but man our food took so long to arrive, it wasn't our table either.  If it wasn't for that, I'd give it four-stars.  If you're looking for a good burger on the Strip, check this spot out.  #GordonDontPlay

_BKmL_vYx6xyaLWuO1Icdw.text: Just a Burger? I think Not Whats going on here? Whats going on here is that there is a flow of flavores that are dancing delightedly on my tongue. A melding of a symphony of flavors that were developed by a genius. I had the Forest burger and I would have it again and again.

nqrdfueAr0uai4EB53sYkw.text: I would definitely come back here. The Hell's Kitchen Creekstone burger was delicious! The jalapeno did not overpower the burger, and it was cooked perfectly. The truffle Parmesan fries were also yummy. The service was great too!

k8LX4c4wYOmxz7BpWw6a9Q.text: This place is OVERRATED.  Been here twice, I told my friends this place is overrated the second time I came but they insisted on coming.  I got the Backyard Burger, and to be honest this is just a burger like any other burgers. I would say a burger from Jack in the box taste as good as any burgers from this place.

T4DSjrwZL-Ac6yr1mvDeGA.text: As someone mentioned, the wait is long! No only waiting to be seated but waiting to get the order. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was absolutely amazing. The food was definitely worth the wait, though! I'm already dying to have some truffle fries again

38FTfUvRIS1sy1vme_2KuA.text: Wow wow wow. What can I say about this place. I'm a big burger fan and this was a very good burger. It's not your regular burger joint like a shake shack or a five guys but it is a higher quality place. The staff are very knowledgable and honest. I would recommend a visit to here for a one off meal. It is a bit pricier than other places but you pay for quality and quality is what you get.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

znqhmaHtpn7croQalSYbIw.text: My husband and I just went here for the first time while we were on vacation in Vegas, and we were so glad we did. Those burgers were definitely worth the wait, and the staff was very friendly and attentive.

YgZo6yFXRm0FdP2w0NDTHA.text: Came here for an early lunch because anytime is a good time for a burger. It was a our last day in Vegas after a long weekend we decided to give this place a go. With so many good reviews and being the burger lover that I am this place was on our list for Vegas Dinning. Being as we got here early we didnt wait too long to be seated. maybe 20 mins for a party of two. We sat ordered and our burger came about 30 minutes later. Sure this is a long time to wait for a burger but it was worth it. We both ordered the Hells kitchen  burger and my partner added a fried egg which he really enjoyed. Over all good experience only wish they offered regular ketchup as im not a huge fan of homemade ketchup concoctions. Try it, but dont come when your already starving.  Burger average 15.00 Fries 11.00

4Ep49M9618I-XNN_-4Ferw.text: The wait was long for just 2 people took about 40 min and then burgers took another 30 min. The patty was a little dry and very plain. I'm not sure they seasoned their patties or not but the buns were good. We ordered chicken wing, 2 burgers, and truffle fries. Our total came out to be $70. Wouldn't come back again. Recommend going to other burger joint or go to Gordon's steakhouse over Gordon's burger. Portions were a good size because we had appetizers the burgers filled us up. We did not finish our truffle fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmer burger. Okay. But was little bland.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell burger. Not spicy if you&#39;re a spice lover.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings with unnecessary carrot strings.

Rgq7j1mgkgVa5Eh3VeN8XA.text: We love their Foie burger and Farmhouse burgers. It's so good. Their shakes aren't bad either.

it9PKmpSL8MJiR8KtXyytQ.text: Talking about this place makes me salivate. The burgers are incredible. I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger and the patty was so juicy, I was extremely satisfied with this burger. Don't forget to get their sides. Beware though, the line can sometimes go around the restaurant.

JgQ-at0mQKnbtPNNSUxXQg.text: You are paying for the name. Buffets are wasted on me, and I really wanted a Hell's Kitchen burger ... 1 burger and 2 lemon shandy beers later, $40 bucks was worth it for me. Was it a life-changing-melt-in-your-mouth decadent experience? No. But it was flavorful and spicy with every bite. Definately something to do once in Vegas! If you're complaining about price, hit up In-and- Out ... A cheese burger with anilmal style fries will fit your budget and you're appetite. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #hells kitchen burger

KW3TjKzqC4zYIFqctiW16A.text: I came across this restaurant as I was exploring Planet Hollywood, and of course me being a big burger snob, so I decided to check this place out. I found the exterior super exciting and cool looking. The wait was max 10 minutes.   Once we walked in and were seated, I was quite impress on how fast that was, however when I saw how big the restaurant was, my expectations of the quality of the food decreased. Thank goodness the ending was not a disappointment.  Being a huge burger snob of course I asked the extremely kind gentleman that assisted us for his recommendations. He gladly recommended a seasonal burger that was off menu. He provided the details of the ingredients and I was convinced so I ordered it ( forgot the name but it was beef with short rib, it was amazing!!!). I also ordered the fries that came along with a curry & chipotle ketchup. Me not being a fan of curry, chipotle nor ketchup, the thought didn't fancy my interest so in addition to what was already in front of me I still went ahead requested for regular ketchup. I ended up wanting to get the full experience of their touch to the fries so I went ahead and tasted both the curry and chipotle ketchup resulted in making my taste buds tingle and I ended up not being able to stop dipping my fries in the curry... wowsers..  Let's cut this long story to a conclusion...  The burger exceeded my expectations.. Yes, it did!! Would I try this place again.. Yes, I would definitely come again next time I'm in Vegas!!  Excellent Service and even though we were warned that we would wait a little while for our food, the wait was not as bad as we thought.   From a Beer Snobs point of view, the only downfall was that they don't have quite a large variety in Craft Beer and they don't support any of their local breweries... boo!!!! But the 1 DIPA available that I tried was a comfort to my beer & burger snob ways...

QBlZgP05AeZIscAF1kifqg.text: I had the blue cheese burger, burn ends poutine fries and the onion rings. The blue cheese burger is to die for. I personally hate blue cheese but this burger had a great balance of flavors w the figgy jam, super juicy and various depths of flavors, I just cant explain- its a must try. The burnt ends poutine were bomb and the onion rings had a light crisp and tasted kinda like a funnel cake but better, they were sooo good you didn't need ketchup or ranch. Basically I will be reordering the same thing next week when Im back in Vegas. :)

8soAOrUX24GH5eldr7DD3w.text: This place is crazy busy. We decided to do take out instead. I gave them my cell so they could text me when my burgers were done. It was going to take 35 mins. Lucky for them, it's part of a casino/mall so we had plenty of things to keep us busy. After almost an hour and no text, I returned to see how the order progressed. The girl returned w my order all ready. To my disappointment it looked like it was sitting there a while and the burgers were not hot.   We had the Hog and it was well made. Pink in the inside and favors well balanced. I also had one w curry spice. Wasn't what I expected but it was still good. No sides w order. Spent almost $40 for 2 burgers n tips. Great to try but I won't do it again. It's not bad but also not that that great.

jnp4btpe8oqH_0xqOg5WDg.text: They have really great burgers!! And great customer service.  They slightly messed up my husband's order,  and they were very proactive in correcting it. The manager even came out to apologize, and it was such a small mix up!

KJqTVQOLAZs2JvSRkS2IiA.text: We had a fantastic meal here with great service and reasonable pricing. The line to get in was a little long but it went surprisingly fast. We used the time to meet some great people from New Zealand. I would suggest a burger, the meat is fresh and hand prrssed. Great seasoning and buns.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Burgers are fantastic!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bangers and mash... superb!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great menu

IKIfocYNT_JiycIq99MOfg.text: I had one of the best burgers ever here! I came with my staff, and the food was off the hook! We all enjoyed it immensely! The fries were super good! It's super busy so get there early or get a reservation!

l4BMDEp1Ai9jlkzCTug-hw.text: Although the burger I had was delicious and the staff was great.  I was disappointed in the fact they way over cooked my burger and the fries completely sucked.  I would expect better after getting the top $22 burger it should at least be close. I asked for med rare and got med well to well done burger 0 pink.  The fries looked like they were the end of a bag.  Each fry was like 1/4-1/2 inch long.  I understand they are high volume but I would expect more even from  a chain burger joint how hard is it to cook a burger to proper temperature?

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MIkTWtys9-8DL55PGg-XLg.text: This last trip to Las Vegas we were in search of the best burger on the strip. It was found in Gordon Ramsay's burger house in Planet Hollywood. Everybody's plates and that which we ordered were all spectacular. This is a must try you are into gourmet burgers.   All of the burger should attempt to come close to the quality and taste of Gordon Ramsey's burgers.   If you are looking for the same for the french fries don't hold any hope because the French fries were actually disgusting. If you want fantastic french fries go to Bobby's Burger Palace. The burgers are good there too but the french fries are fantastic!  Grab your burger at Gordon Ramsay's and head  over to Bobby's Burger Palace for the fries on you are in for a fantastic meal.    MANGA!!

JMxkZe0TntP2ln68UtiQsw.text: 30 minute wait to get in, 30 minute wait for food on a Tuesday night. Good burger, good sweet potato fries. Onion rings too heavy on the batter. Waited until we had eaten all our food to get waters refilled. Not great service.

zpvbFkt-mArWyKn3Tu-EKw.text: without a doubt my favorite place as far as hamburger is concerned I love this place its entrance hummus this favulous I love the lamb burger

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my favorite place the best burgers a unique flavor I love them
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my favorite place the best burgers a unique flavor I love them
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. my favorite place the best burgers a unique flavor I love them

KtTB52e9SDXHEJ2ML_b3TA.text: Good burger selection, but that's about it. Overall, a little overpriced. 3 burgers and fries for the table came out to just under $100. The wait staff was very nice and professional which helped the long wait times go by faster.

O8fRj3XCqozvwXwI-G2b3A.text: The menu is inventive and fun making it hard to settle on something (but you must because $$$).   I had the Hell's Kitchen burger.   The burger itself was amazing - juicy and cooked perfectly.   Each burger came with a unique cheese and this one was so melty.   I would say it was so hard to eat and the toppings kept sliding off.  I wish I could have tried the truffle fries but as I was by myself knew I couldn't finish both.  Very busy place and long line to get in even for the bar which is not open seating.

L7dCsGMo005KjR-LjjFIFQ.text: Really good burger. Kinda burnt. Had no dressing. It tasted like a regular burger you'd make at home. Just popular because of the name

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TT7x3Rj68NZKcGz0bZA0xg.text: $35 for a burger and fries! Burger is pretty thin to what I think of for a gourmet, celebrity chef style restaurant.  Fries are thick cut with skins which isn't my favorite to go with a burger.  Overall it's a decent burger, but I've had similar experiences for about $12 elsewhere.  Save the trip, go somewhere amazing while you're in Vegas and skip this disappointment

qf5R0KdmAqcfpRrAog3HIA.text: Went on recommendation that the burgers were awesome.. and it didn't disappoint.  I read a review that the burgers were so big, it was a must to share one. This was False. The Forest burger I had,  with wild mushrooms and Duck bacon... good single serving.. and Delicious!  The special stand out was the Sweet Potato Fries.. dusted with powdered sugar and a sweet dipping aioli. This could have been on the dessert menu. Good attentive service.. the menu simple and easy to read. All the drinks were listed on a seperate Ipad..  The survey neatly stashed on an ipod inside the bill wallet was a smart touch too!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

twjgoleJeKGpl2OLurGu2g.text: The best burger I had in years!! I had the lamb burger and my friend had the veggie burger.  Highly recommend!!  The service was awesome!!

l_pZpc0vRVY6kd70HBtPfA.text: Simply put GRB is worth a 1/2 hour wait and not the 1+ hr. we waited in line. I had the Farmhouse Burger which was fine albeit a little dry. GF had the Fish and Crisp burger which was tastier. Our waiter was attentive and did a fine job. I'll try it again but keep walking if the line is too long.

wVHeedNUOzppMJMBm44AJA.text: The service was quicker than I expected. Even with the long line we got in quickly. The server was friendly and knowledgeable. The food was excellent and large portions on fries. I wish that the prices were on the drink menu.

5pwrX_BJnp94NhLvQaRLNQ.text: I've never had such a rich burger. I ordered the hog burger and it was absolutely phenomenal. This burger definitely set the gold standard for burgers. While it may seem pricey for just a burger, you'll leave full and happy wondering how any burger could ever compare.   If you have any room for desert the chocolate tart was amazing! It had the smoothness of chocolate, with a slight texture of caramel. The way it melted in your mouth makes it worth it. While I'm going to have to run for days to burn off the calories from this meal, I would absolutely do it again.

YE5CfNhk-aJMrpPaaYhjOQ.text: The food was pretty good, but not worth the price. Also, my whole party of six felt sick after eating here. If you are in Vegas and want a good burger, you'd be better off going to Bachi Burger.

bnM74I1-l9M5s3y5b7dFuQ.text: Gordon Ramsay Burger LV is Amazing! Hands Down! Staff, Food, Cleanliness and Quality!

XsQC2gBpjFKWFabQ_QkvJg.text: First time here after hearing how great the burgers were... Line moved quickly and we were seated in less than 10 min. Great service, our drinks arrived quickly. I ordered the forest burger, medium rare. It came out more of a medium.  The patty wasn't as thick as I had thought it would be. Taste wise, it was delicious. I really don't think it was worth $17, but it's Vegas. Glad I tried it but likely won't be returning soon.

9rDxiQJY0Ql7VYcWnxVNpw.text: I ordered hamburger. That was over cooked dry and simply had no taste. My wife ordered fish and chips. The fish smelled real bad. I was so disappointed. They had a lot of tables available and plenty staff to serve people but they make people wait on the long line outside to make it look extra special. Save your money and by the way it was real over priced for what you get. Not recommended at all.

u-LQaQaVYh0IrN_HO2lxPQ.text: Another amazing visit here for my birthday. Got kettle chip nachos and UK Burger! Been here many times and is always enjoyable

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
