Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1p4zz3seDDFjajs-EVo_Jg.text: while in Vegas we were walking by this spot and wife suggested we try knowing im a Ramsey fan....my response was eh, its not like he is here cooking or even doing quality control....just a building with his name on it as far as im concerned....but i gave in, the wait line was about an hour 15 minutes, with a sign stating some would get priority seating upon request.(hotel guests and card members)...so as we wait we watch another line move steadily along as we stand next to a glass wall with a huge fire behind it making the line temperature almost unbearable , after finally getting to our table i realize the chairs are really low to the ground making them very uncomfortable to sit in, im 6'3" as are many people and would appreciate not being asked to sit in a childs chair....the waiter arrived and was friendly enough took our drink order and returned with my $8 12 ounce beer and wife's $18 cocktail (yes its Vegas but damn)....wife ordered the Hells Kitchen burger and told waiter she wanted it well done because she dont like rare meat....he tried to get her to rethink saying its meant to be med-med rare....she declined, I ordered the forest burger and told him i want it to the chefs recommendation....he said "great it will be med-med rare".....I said "great".....we also ordered the truffle, parm fries to share....food arrived after about 30 minutes ...wife is loving her burger, mine however is already cold....after taking a bite its chewy and dry as saw dust, but i could tell by the seasoning that it would be good if it werent wayyyy over cooked, so I asked the waiter "what temp was this intended?" he said "med-med rare"   i showed him the inside and he apologized and sent back to recook.....so i sit as wife ate and i started eating fries....no flavor and soggy, not really what i expected for some $12 fries....only ate 2....after about 20 minutes my wife is done eating and the waiter comes back and tells me " they over cooked it again so they are starting over (at this point we are about 2 1/2 hours into our GR burger experience and I still dont have food.....15 minutes later he returned with my burger....it had been cut in half and was falling apart all over the plate...I was stunned they actually brought that mess to the table...but, now just wanting to eat and leave i said nothing.....started looking at the meat and it was just as over cooked as the one i returned 30-40 minutes ago....and had blue cheese on it (not supposed to be) the burger tasted nothing like the first one that was good but very dry and over cooked....this one tasted like salt and blue cheese.....he stopped and asked if it was better, I said "not really"....he said "OK, sorry ill take it off your ticket".....I left 3/4 of the burger sitting on the plate..(keep in mind, i didnt ask for the meat at a specific temp, simply what THEIR chef recommended)...so 3 hours and $100 dollars later i had 3 bites of a burger and two french fries for my patronage and support for GR .....very disappointing, but i knew going in it was just a gimmick, not a True chef inspired restaurant ......the GR ive seen on TV would never tolerate such incompetence.......or would he ?

CGfKZ_2szo7GLx13lSeu8Q.text: I came here for lunch, sat at the bar. The servers are very friendly and nice offering of burgers and sides. I had the forest burger and truffle parmesan fries. Everything was tasty and u can they used high quality beef. Ambiance was casual, comfortable yet trendy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle parmesan fries

Knc4JBdBxRzRtsrcavHFIw.text: Thanks to the Total Rewards Diamond card, we were able to skip the *gulp* 2-hour wait that was quoted to another curious customer. In fact, our wait was 5 minutes max, which was great. The parmesan truffle fries were in fact kick-ass, and the Caesar salad with chicken was pretty nice (I liked the little fancy touches of 2-3 other greens besides the iceberg lettuce) and amazingly enough, adding chicken on was ONLY $1. Say what? This was two skewers of chicken freshly grilled. Usually chicken is $3 or more as a salad add-on, so I was impressed, skewer or no skewer.   The downside is, of course, the wait on the burger. Like don't come hungry, cause you will be left hungry for a-whi-le. We were quoted 25-30 minutes, but it was more in the 45 plus range. More accurately, an hour plus but we had appetizers so it didn't feel that bad. The couple next to us only ordered burgers though; it got to the point where they complained, and their burgers were delivered first with a free appetizer, so maybe it worked out?   As for our burger, we got the mushroom to split. They are able to cut some burgers in half, but ours had bacon, so it was no-go. By then, I had filled up on fries, water, salad, and wait-time, so I took two bites, one for the experience, one for good measure and gave up on the rest. It was good, but nothing I would care to order again.

NWOxDHh2i8vwi25-XfpMHQ.text: Onion rings, Hell's Kitchen burger, butter pecan shake = English hat trick. Our server Julia was the best!

quY4_96yMQ3_6Z9tgWIC7w.text: Some experiences in life are free and others have a fee. Some cost are higher than others and Gordon Ramsay Burgers is a costly experience.   My wife and I are advit Gordon Ramsay TV program viewers so when we saw his burger restaurant at Planet Hollywood we thought what a great opportunity to have the Ramsay experience. We were not expecting to see Ramsay himself but to eat from his menu.   The wait can be incredible if you have a party of three or more. That night when we dine, the wait was quoted at 60 to 75 minutes. There were groups that waited it out. They wanted the Ramsay experience so they paid with their time.   The menu offers a variety of burgers with pricey stickers. The sides are good yet pricey as well. Our total bill for two was over $65. That's two burgers, onion rings and fries. No beverages just water (which is free).   The food is good but not worth the cost. You pay for the Ramsay experience.

sUJ7mlmflX6NyDjeDmntHQ.text: Not a hater by any means, but Gordan Ramsey might want to consider an undercover boss episode for his own burger joint to prove he's better at cooking than talking. The burger itself is a 3 star but considering the price and availabilities in Las Vegas, this doesn't live up to the hype at all. The worst part about the burger is the bun. The best part about Gordan Ramsey Burger is the drink refills.

eqmXSzj3NzgNSe67NKsAWg.text: This probably my favorite burger ever.  Try the Hells Kitchen burger you won't regret it. Every time my wife and I go to Vegas we always eat here great staff too never have had any issues.  Always recommend to friends and family.

NAh3cEaVJ1F1vWAE3S7SAw.text: Burger was delicious. Fries were delicious. Service is great!! Can't wait to go back again the next time we are in town. Not the best burger I've had but it was still really good.

UVMjwjhp_3QoCKoZ1NsHEQ.text: The name alone attracts most tourists (I really wanted to bump into Gordon Ramsay and have him yell at me for my lack of cooking skills), but the food will not let you down.  The menu describes every burger down to the T, so if you like your burger a certain way or enjoy the creativity the choices offer, then definitely go with your instincts and let your stomach order. The burgers are huge and the fries are as well so you can always share with a friend if you need to. I will say though, be careful of the truffle fries... the taste is really strong!

snKSQGflTiLCIq9ydGfwSg.text: Literally the BEST burger I have ever had in my life! I still salivate thinking about it.

ADgnEvuBLSh0idrrXCXnvA.text: I am writing this review because I am seeing negative reviews with regards to their gluten free menu. They DO have gluten free options; however like any burger restaurant the burger will be on a lettuce bun. I ate the Forest burger on a lettuce bun cooked medium well. The burger was cooked perfectly. I had never tried duck bacon before and I loved it. They also have gluten free fries. The menu is very clear about what is gluten free and what is not. I did not have a reaction and I am not gluten free by choice.   If I didn't have to eat gluten free I still would have ordered the forest burger on a glorious gluten filled bun. Either way the burger was delicious. The service is slow but it's Vegas and the restaurant was full. The line does move quickly. I recommend the restaurant.

e6C2D_NcCWNVKXxPsaZZjw.text: The kettle chip nachos were simply amazing. Hog burger was solid and I recommend the Oreo shake!!!

M7omikeINqBz-1b-t0bTig.text: This review is long overdue. I was in Vegas back in September. This was the best burger I have ever had. I am glad I didn't order fries because that Made me appreciate the taste of the burger even more! I had the ultimate cheeseburger with bacon. I can't wait to go back when I am in town!

RCndfgpMJ-uuN_dzqlFPFA.text: We stopped here before the rush however it was still busy since being in the casino. My husband wanted to try since well it's Gordon Ramsey. We got sat at the chef's counter. I thought maybe the chef would actually talk to us like he did to some of the other customers sitting down from us but he didn't. Maybe he was afraid we didn't speak English? In any case our servers were pleasant. I'm assuming they share tips since we had multiple ppl serve us. We ordered the hells kitchen burger and forest burger. My husband said the hells kitchen burger tasted like a normal burger with some spice to it. Mine was made of lamb, which i don't recall reading in the menu but maybe I missed it. It also had duck bacon, arugula ( which is the latest big fad to add to a sandwich) and some cheese and mushrooms that i don't remember the spelling of. Since I expected beef and turned out to be lamb it was obviously a surprise. Overall the burger was good but nothing like I would jump on the chair like Tom Cruise on Oprah Winfrey show or anything.  We also had the parmesan truffle fries which literally were french fries sprinkled with fresh parsley and shredded parmesan cheese. There was nothing truffle about it.  Since we were sitting right where the cooks work I literally saw the fries get fried, dumped in a cone, and then a waitress dashed some parsley on them and took a clump of cheese to throw on top and then they served it to us. Not sure what the sauces were as no one explained them and everyone was too busy to ask. Definitely not ketchup or mustard. I would say the red sauce was like a pizza sauce and the mustard was lije a mustard mayo butter mix. Overall it was a good experience and just to say we went to a Gordon Ramsay Restaurant, but wouldn't eat here twice.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest burger is actually a lamb meat burger, duck bacon, and arugula

QcasTOfjHQx7TEGXfrMEFg.text: Hell's Kitchen burger and fries were the best I've ever eaten.  Tender delicious beef.  Perfect bun and delightful heat!  Not so hot it sears taste buds, but very very warm. Every bite was great!   Fries are huge hot planks and extra delicious with special dipping sauce.   Extremely organized and friendly staff managed a very large holiday crowd with ease. We will return!

ggDBKGr1PhFq-URHX7E6Lg.text: Don't believe the bullshit from the Elites here it's not True, it can't be because I came here today and was not impressed.I was looking for something familiar and affordable and hey also because its Gordon's restaurant it's gotta be good right? . Although I was completely wrong about all my expectations. The wait was long about 1hr long wait for a table for four. The customer service was okay, it wasn't above average. My wife and I had already ate but the kids where hungry so we got them some grilled cheeses and we ordered the blue cheese burger with the truffle oil fries. And about three drinks at the end of the day we spent a whopping $70. The grilled cheeses were nothing impressive and the burger was so so, not what I would expect from a Gordon Ramsey restaurant. The flavor combination was overpowering, too salty the bun was swamped with butter or an oil. The fries were ok they were not crispy but super chewy like bubble gum, it was like trying to bite off the cartilage of a chicken leg bone. Would I come back? Neh, for sure would go somewhere else next time.

ZsbTYATweer3Ri2CJDFzYA.text: I had high expectations and GRB did not deliver. I've had a better burger at Denny's. Leave it to this Brits, who eat fries with mayo, to mess up a simple thing like ketchup. The ketchups here pretty much suck. My advice... bring your own ketchup.

LYtGm8YF3K1xHRmox5MCzg.text: If you're a fan of Gordon's work, there's only one word to describe this place. Perfection. From the staff to the food, its exactly what you'd think it would be like. Everything was on point.

Ux5QBrbakAm-gl24s2Wpzg.text: Amazing food and drinks but really amazing food!   We tried the wings(topped with shaved carrot and fresh blue cheese).... best wings to date especially in VEGAS. Duck and cow burgers were great topped and trimmed perfectly.  Truffle fries knocked me out with greatness.     The hotdog which cost $18 was thee best hot dog and $18 dollars spent in VEGAS!    I am a annual visitor in Las Vegas and i always stop here regardless.       The only con is the looooooooong wait for a table.

OpCYzJK4TtdXsfKZqMt9Ow.text: Hands down, best burger.  This review is a few months late but wanted to put this here since I just did one for the Fish & Chips joint and didn't feel the same way there.  The fact that I am still craving the Hell's Kitchen burger after few months proves that it was memorable.  The patty was juicy and not heavily seasoned.  I could taste the natural flavor of the beef and each ingredient inside the burger added a different layer and dimension to the bite.  The whole burger felt thoughtful and made complete sense.  I've never felt that way about a burger before so that was a first.  I should've ditched Fish & Chips and went back here last vegas visit.    Truffle fries were superb.  I am picky about my truffle fries.  Sometimes they can feel like when you're trapped in an elevator with someone with way too much perfume.  Not this one.

UmlZc3x6fmrF-6W8JQaFuw.text: My boyfriend and I came here for a late lunch so we only waited 20 minutes for a table. The service was okay, and the food was decent but it definitely is not worth waiting for 1 hour+. The prices are reasonably priced but it's not worth the hype. We probably wouldn't come back next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

23qDm7YpquKCRMHUzzp9xw.text: First time here and tries Hell's Kitchen Burger.  Best burger I have had in quite some time!!!  Top it with onion rings and a Guinness!!!  Recommend!!

SzJ-uzNG1ztE_5sV4Dcqtw.text: We must have gone at a good time, we were sat immediately. Service was good and the food was really tasty and fresh. I was really impressed that the ketchup and ranch were made fresh as well. Really good!

l_w4gDF9ANMq2ins8o62Bg.text: Good once. Maybe their shake will bring me back for a second try.  $50 for a burger, fries, and shake...and quite a long wait.  I stood in line for about 1/2 an hour just before 3pm on a Saturday, which was understandable. After being seated at the bar, the server took my order within a few minutes.  I ordered the Hog Burger, Truffle Parmesan Fries, and a Brown Butter Caramel Pecan Shake.  The shake came out within 5 or 10 minutes, followed shortly by the fries.  However, it was somewhere between 35 to 40 minutes before my burger came out. The server had warned of a 25-30 minute wait, and I had accepted that. However, by then, the fries were lukewarm, and my shake had been devoured as it was absolutely delicious.  The overwhelming memory of the Hog Burger was its dryness. The generous serving of patty was cooked to a perfect medium as suggested by the server, but I found myself requiring a lot of water to offset the dryness of the entire burger.  On one hand, this was a nice change to the usual grease-drenched burgers at other establishments, but perhaps a light spread would make the burger more enjoyable.   The Truffle Parmesan fries were just ok. There was a light sprinkle of parmesan over the top of the fries, which lead to a rather uneven distribution of the cheese once you got to the fries hiding at the bottom, especially since they were served in a cone.  There were two interesting sauces; one was red and mildly spicy(chipotle ketchup) and the other was a yellow creamy blend(truffle aioli).  One of the barbacks/assistants made my service experience excellent. He filled in for my server and refilled water regularly and noticed that I was scrutinizing my prestained fork and offered to replace it without my having to ask.   Overall, not a satisfying first experience with their burger and fries, but I've only sampled a small portion of their menu.

ADTZ0ZK9eAYiGFoIm84yjw.text: Food awesome.  Long waits and pricey.  But the burger was the bomb.  Truffle fries should be shared.  Little pricey but good.  Long waits n

9bIjqVWXukSlIkO11qyk4A.text: The staff were friendly and the food is really good! I highly recommend this place. Just be ready for long lines and some wait time during dinner time. The food is well worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion Rings

BPG-YUCYf_Pbx1INNnrD9A.text: I just ate a jellyfish. Just kidding it was that gross lobster and shrimp burger. Lol.  I also ordered the duck poppers. I could have ordered a garden salad and had more duck.  My favorite part of the meal was when the lady outside asked if I wanted to go to the strip club. I should have said yes. I'm gay but I think it would have been a better way to spend my money.  FML  P.S. Our server was sweet AF, but it didn't make up for my Jellyfish Sandwich.

u2c6z2HDGzYTLGHaUY4mzw.text: So I read somewhere that this was the "best burger" in Nevada. It was one of those bogus articles listing the best burger for every state. So, we had to try it.  After all, it was the "best" in Nevada supposedly.   We showed up relatively late, maybe around 930 and there was no wait. We ordered a Hellfire Chicken Salad and a Hell's Kitchen Burger. Both were really mediocre. The salad was some lettuce, a skewer, and a few other miscellaneous items. The burger was small and meh. Both not worth the price.   The best part of the meal was dessert. We had the sticky toffee pudding ice cream sandwich and that was absolutely delicious. The burger though, definitely not the best. I actually would've enjoyed an In-N-Out burger more. Gasp!

n_QT7x3kalR4LxkHco84VQ.text: After watching the various shows by Gordon Ramsay, we wanted to try this place and see how good his food was.  And we were not disappointed after a 20-minute wait in line.  We started with the jalapeno poppers, which are a variety with a surprise.  They are hot, but so tasty!  The truffle fries are really good with the various sauces, and the brittania burger with mango chutney is small but also provides a mix between hot and sweet taste.  The restaurant has a vibey ambiance to it and I recommend it to anyone who enjoys gourmet food by a world-renowned chef.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeno poppers with a surprise
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brittania burger with mango chutney

H7eTK-N6xQOFOsufaJE2Nw.text: Every time I come to Vegas I make sure I come here, I'm never disappointed! They make an elotes dip with corn chips, super good! Their burgers are always amazing and their onion rings with cheddar ranch are seriously the best.  They don't take reservations and you have to stand in line for a table but the wait is always worth it. And the only thing I would change is having more brisket on the burnt end fries.

LMLCes7Ge_-sGkTaLlWVcg.text: This place was hands down the best burger.   Also sweet potato fries  were crazy good.  Food gets A+.     Service.... not so much.  Was slow and took a while to get refills on beers.  Food made up for it but waiters need to be more attentive.    I would definitely recommend this place but please be patient as the food is worth it.

ORSWtcv4qn8homjS1xVQuw.text: Good but beware, the lines can get ridiculously long. That's why you gotta get your Seven Stars or Platinum buddy to come to the rescue. It just cuts everyone in line like a hot knife over butter.  -- Got to try 4 burgers and 3 fries --  Let's start with the BEST, the burgers:  1) Forest Burger $17 - AMAZING. Wow, the juicy tender incredibly flavorful patty with even more flavor from the tremor cheese, forest mushrooms, arugula (dressed, no naked ingredients here!) and duck bacon. I just wished my stomach could handle more but the sides we got were killers [I would not order 3 sides of fries for 4 people]  2) Farmhouse Burger $17 - This was great. All protein and not a sight of plant here. I think the fat afrom the mangalitsa bacon does the trick here, a shiny burger doused in liquid lard.   3) "Foie" Burger $22 - My friend got this and she didn't love it. I thought it was okay as I am not a fan of foie anymore. I think it was just too heavy in all aspect, fat, foie, cheese... I personally think burgers should have some vegetables to balance the heaviness. The last two did not.   4) There was also a Lobster and shrimp burger but it isn't on the menu anymore. It was good and lightish but here, you gotta get the beef.   Then there were the sides which really felt like the main courses too (not my favorite and next time, I would skip these altogether)  1) Beer Battered Onion Rings $9. Good but honestly, too much in terms of dough and the salty parmigiano-reggiano as they were very generous with it. The additives make these heavier than your usual rings. Plan accordingly because we did NOT finish any of the fries and we are not slim people.  2) Truffle Parmesan Fries $12. There were aromatic as expected. Thick cut, loads of potato action here. Possibly a tad dry and a little too hard for my liking.   3) Sweet potato fries. Disappointing because they were limp and not hot. They were clearly not freshly fried. I think they were SO busy that night that the quality of the food kinda dropped.   We asked them to bring us freshly fried ones but the next batch was simply hotter and a little darker but did not feel fresh. We left them. Service was slow, it was a busy night.

uNlmQiQbfJsKDTYxm2DdNw.text: I am a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay, so naturally I was excited to eat here.. But being a vegetarian I was very doubtful if it would make me ecstatic! The wait was not too bad..  Like an hr... We went around the casino and table was ready.. We ordered the fries, the hells burger, blue cheese and Mediterranean.. All with veggie patties. The fries was good plus they gave us a whole array of sauces that made it fun  The burgers arrived.. A good portion size... One bite into the blue cheese, I was blown away!! The patty was one of the best patties I have ever had and the blue cheese had a unique flavor profile that was sharp and delicious  They said the hells was spicy, it was ok, nothing to race about, the tandoori paste in the Mediterranean was pretty good but my heart belongs to the blue cheese burger  The reason I am taking a star off is that they charge 6$ more for a veggie as opposed to a meat patty and I am unable to justify it.. The patty is real good but that costing more than meat, I don't know

bmLHBKIEbstIWdAiSwTSHw.text: I had low expectations for this place. I don't know why. But I was so wrong. Service was prompt and pleasant. The portobello burger was the best I've had...ever! Their fries are awesome. I wasn't a fan of either of the ketchups they come with but I asked for a side of their lemon dill mayo...perfect!  Highly recommend for a nice lunch on the strip.

kTJVo2JXAIc85Yq3HUaalA.text: Very decent place. We were waiting for 40 minutes to have our burgers and they were just mediocre. Nothing existing! We ordered medium but we got medium well... I would prefer to go to Shake Shack l!

jv8HRPMcQnn_V3EMrCfSpg.text: The hype isn't all that. The server got our order wrong and service didn't exist here. I've been to Vegas multiple times and as a food network fan I have always wanted to try one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. But every time I walk past it the long lines make it real discouraging.   I've finally got a chance to try it. Typical wait but much shorter(about 20 minutes). When we were finally greeted by the host and brought inside It was empty! There were at least 10 tables that were open so I don't understand what the wait was about. When we finally sat down the waitress took forever to come take our order. When she finally did we ordered a 'Hells kitchen burger' and truffle fries. The burger took awhile to come and when it did it was the wrong burger! They gave us the ultimate cheese burger! When we told her it was the wrong burger she didn't ask if we wanted a new one made she took another 10 minutes to go get the rest of the toppings and came back with a plate of it. She gave us a small plate with roasted tomatoes, avocado, and a cup of aioli sauce as if she was saying 'here make ya own damn burger.'  The burger was very mediocre. It was too dry for my taste. I expected a juicy burger filled with flavor. For someone who made a living off of criticizing other people's restaurants maybe Ramsay needs to check into his own.

xnluJn08b3LRM1aYJm3obw.text: If you ever wanted to have an orgasm while eating a burger and fries, this is the place. I had the hell's kitchen burger with truffle fries and it made me feel like I lost my virginity all over again. 10/10 will cum again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s kitchen burger

O4NlAsUVWsakS-vxQKlsKw.text: The food is great but the wait time was outrageous. I checked in at 2:44pm and did not get seated until 4:40pm. Of course it was somewhat expected since it is a Ramsay makes restaurant but the weight was worse than a Disneyland ride, especially after asking several times my place in line as I gave my phone number to keep track. I highly suggest visiting this restaurant on a weekday to avoid some hustle and bustle but overall great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IoWi2G9xWLDsJH334t60kQ.text: One of my favorite burger places in Vegas! I've eaten here a few times but it seems like the menu changes slightly every time I come, which is awesome. Portions are great and the prices are very reasonable, especially for a restaurant located on the strip. The poutine fries were definitely my favorite!

c5C5BdYFKeLhaySi-q651w.text: Came here with a huge group of 15 people and I wanna say everyone enjoyed what they ordered. I got the Hog Burger which is $18 (on the higher end for a burger in my opinion), but it's one of their specialties, I was hungry, and I'm rarely in Vegas so I thought "Why not?"  The group also ordered truffle fries and onion rings for each table. Lemme just say - these were some of the best fries and onion rings I've ever had. The breading on them was generous but also light and crisp. I love my fries to still taste like the potato and these fries were perfectly tater-y. I've never thought onion rings were anything special, but Gordon Ramsay takes them to another level. These also came with some kind of aoli and ketchup, both of which were SO GOOD with the fries and rings. You have to order these if you go!   My burger came and it was big. At first I thought, I could finish this pretty easily because I'm starving. Halfway into the burger, I began to struggle. The Hog Burger has THREE kinds of pork - the patty, bacon, and pulled pork. The only veggies on there were some cole slaw and maybe a pickle LOL. Because I love my veggies, I kind of regretted ordering the Hog because I felt so greasy and bloated afterwards, but it was still delicious! Probably one of the tastiest burgers I've tried and the patty was HUGE.   The server accommodated our huge group well and everyone seemed to be satisfied with their food. Would love to come and try another one of their burgers sometime! And obviously order the fries and rings. Never forget.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog Burger (may look small, but do not judge a book by its cover)

4VUEJ1IPEVOySU1PTtWvNw.text: Great food but mediocre service.   Ordered: Blue cheeseburger  Farmhouse burger Truffle fries  Verdict: The food was good but nothing mind blowing. I think it's a great place for a good meal but I don't think the food is worth the long wait.

HtTFEL35I0qFgJcDkQD73A.text: The best burger I ever had. Everything from the meat, to the bun, to all the toppings. Everything was just right. The onion rings had the same truffle oil as the fries which wasn't my jam, however from a burger standpoint, I'm still craving a burger like this. So creative and delicious!

KiSeuubLe_kcksWdww2HxA.text: So good. Loved the burger here. There's nothing like this where I'm from and I'm glad I came here. I don't give out a lot of 5 star ratings but this place blew me away. It wasn't too terribly overpriced either. Great atmosphere and amazing food. The truffle fries hit the spot. Loved the special ketchup. If I'm ever in Vegas again I will be coming back here. I ate 3 different burgers while I was here and this one was the best.

XSuQnl06t1_hahWAIqAJSg.text: A nice burger place that is worth trying. But yes, it's on the pricier side for a burger. I would prefer my burger and fries hot instead of being warm...

DFep6EOzx9SZN2T4JLLMcA.text: When in Vegas, go here and eat burgers.  We've been to this place twice and Hell's Kitchen at Ceaser's Palace once and we prefer going to Burger.  Not sure what they do but the taste of the meat is phenomenal and always perfectly cooked.  The onion rings are sharable and also very good.  If you want a beer, try Gordon's favorite - Innus & Gunn on tap.  Very crisp and clean with no bitterness.  We make this a must visit place on every trip to Vegas.

H9iZ98ZjQzFbhxJg64E_Zw.text: I have been here 3 times and I can say each time I have been satisfied some times were more and other times were less.   the first time was the best, it was amazing, service was on top of everything and the meal was incredible. I remember this marshmallow dipping sauce and it was amazing.   the 2nd time i got the jalapeno poppers (not on the menu anymore), burger and my date got a hot dog, we both left so satisfied and excited.   this last time the menu has been changed, they dont have a lot of things they had before which is kind of sad. I loved the jalapeno poppers and they are gone. I enjoyed the hot dogs and there are only 2 now.   I ordered the anniversary burger which was nice and the meat was flavorful, they only had a veggie option that was mushroom and my friend is allergic to port mushrooms.   Everything was good but just lacked that something special the 1st 2 times provided us.   This  last time was for my birthday and it was very nice but I wish i would have stopped after the 1st or 2nd time because the 3rd time was a bit of a let down. I will be back again hope they bring back some of the things i enjoyed before.

2cFdBJHde_y9Td9nc00o-g.text: The poutine fries were mouth watering.  I enjoyed a Pork & Apple burger with fries. I love pork and apples but I wasn't sure how it would turn out in a burger.  It did not disappoint! The meat was juicy and the flavors jelled perfectly.  Hubby enjoyed the  Mediterranean burger.  We shared the HUGE onion rings.  I don't care for large onion rings because of the overwhelming oniony taste.  These were crisp and had NO onion flavor.  I don't know how they do it.

kSmbW0lk41BRLo-gScHjRw.text: This was our 1st visit to Planet Hollywood Gordon Ramsey Burger and it did not disappoint.  The food and the service were excellent.   Thank you!!!

HAH9ODShr8cER2zeXVFXBA.text: Sooo good. We got the nachos! They were sooo delicious. I got The Mediterranean burger and it was so good. Lots of flavor. My husband got the blue cheese burger and it was very good and the cheese was rich with flavor! Also had and chalorita(?) and it was delicious! Very fresh and the sweet was just enough!

25zYYMViAAGiLkTBMiNqJw.text: Gordon Ramsay's Burger never fails to disappoint. The burgers are always spot on. We got the Truffle Parmesan Fries, the Hog Burger and the Turkey burger (I think it was Turdunken Burger? ). The truffle parmesan fries were amazing (as always); I loved the Truffle aioli that comes with it. The pork pattyy in the Hog Burger was juicy and, and the pork bbq was just perfect. We so got a couple of cocktails.. The rum punch, bad donkey and another fruity cocktail. The cocktails were a bit disappointing though (definitely needs improvement).   All in all, it was a good experience and would definitely be back for the burgers and fries. Be prepared for the wait though. We had to wait almost an hour for a table for two.

I_yH4Sryrq3MEcOeBUAfWA.text: This restaurant was definitely below our expectations. The best thing about it is the name. The chicken sliders were good however the burgers were mediocre the fries and onion rings were tasteless. The creme brulee shake was very good. Definitely not worth $150 for three people for lunch.

_qIwTHybZRku5VDdeN9Xxw.text: Every time we come to Vegas, ITS A MUST... I'm a big fan of every Ramsay's restaurants

AUc6SI77eJBY3zagNdBtXg.text: This is one of my go to stops each time I come to Vegas. It is located somewhere in the Planet Hollywood. And each time I go I feel like it would be easier to find Narnia as there is little in the way of directions or maps to find the place.      Once you get to the door you are greeted with a wall of flames and a line that at times could be long. Lucky for us our wait was only about 10 to 15 minutes.     The restaurant has a nice atmosphere but is busy and feels a little cramped. On the menu your choices are mostly different forms of a burger. And my fat kid mentality wanted to try them all. My wife and I settled for the hot wings, the Hog Burger, the Fois Burger and some truffle fries.     The wings were some of the best wings I have had in my life. And the way they prepared the bone made it much easier to get access to all of the delectable meat. The Fois Burger was amazingly rich and delicious. I thought I was eating Unicorn meats. And oh my the bites I had of the Hog Burger were amazing. It was a pork and bacon lovers wet dream of all dreams. I'm getting excited thinking of it now. The only part of the meal not exciting was the the truffle fries. They were not much more than frozen fries you get at the grocery store with some Parmesan. And I was not a fan of the homemade ketchup.      Overall, I completely recommend and can it wait to try some of the other burgers one day

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foi Burger. If you want something more on the rich side than this is the burger for you. Goat cheese and a Foi gras like butter sauce. Wow!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You will not regret eating these wings. Love the flavor and prep that goes into the bones
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. About as good as frozen fries. Sauce was ok with a tinge if truffle. House made ketchup does take some getting used to

KbW7dHlVjRo085aQL-vw2w.text: Going in, I was a bit of a skeptic, having been burned by "celebrity" chefs in the past, but my "anniversary special" burger was unique and flavorful, while the onion rings were verifiably TDF!!   The staff were very friendly, always on time, and accurately split the checks for our large group. All the meals were on the table within about 2 minutes of one another.   We were able to get an "arrive at" reservation time and then it only took about 15 minutes longer to get seated...no small feat considering the size of our group (almost 30).   This was a great all-around experience....highly recommended.

The burger was incredibly flavorful and well made, the fries with the dip were delicious and the drink was pretty awesome too! I'm definitely coming back here next time I'm in Vegas.

CXT_ahZYnYzk07v957gZLg.text: We waited for about 30 min to 1 hr just to get in. Only to find out that we would have to wait an additional 30 min for our burger to be ready.  We stared with the blue cheese wings as the appetizer. I was a little skeptic since I usually don't like blue cheese ANYTHING! but I was starving and I wanted wings! I gotta say I was very pleased with the combination of flavor! Really amazing wings! We then order the hell kitchen burger and the farmhouse burger and a order of fries.  Was given the wrong order at first before it was corrected. Luckily I hadn't even touch the plate since I was taking the picture for this review lol Maybe my expectations where a little too high considering the name on the restaurant, maybe I just watch his shows too much idk lol But I gotta say I was not impress with the burgers. They where good, but that's it, just good, nothing out of this world.  Fries where totally flavorless, side of ranch was lacking flavor as well. My advice would be to go when you have time to spare, don't order the fries not worth the 12$ instead order extra wings! Lol  The wings is the only reason I was satisfied. If I would have just order the wings n left I would probably have given this place 5stars . Customer service was ok at best.

8nmRmLGoBdJ6HK6BCUrv9g.text: OMG!!!! SO GOOD!!!!  Husband and I waited in line for about 20 mins on a Sunday afternoon. I'm not going to lie. I definitely recommend starting off with Burnt Ends Poutine...ugh!!! TO DIE FOR!!! It's basically fries with burnt ends, cheddar cheese curds and pickled onions....smothered in this black pepper gravy.....YUM YUM YUM!!! I felt like I was eating something off the food network. Being big fans of Gordon Ramsay we felt it fitting to try nearly everything on the menu despite our stomachs capacity. The elote dip and onion rings were amazing. The burger was better than most but I hate to admit that I have had better burgers in Az. Their desserts were great as well. The line can get long however it goes quickly so do not let it discourage you or as an alternative you can check in and walk around until your table is ready.

ydZRC4pCrNECoJCf56_lDw.text: 3.5 stars.Good burger. Not great. Rich and succulent are all words to describe the Foie Gras Burger at Gordon Ramsay's. "Worth" would not be a word to describe it because at $22, the burger is about 4 inches in diameter. The flavor was almost there, but to me it was simply not enough to justify the price. The chevre goat cheese on the burger was delightfully creamy and a little bit tangy, which went nicely with the frisee salad on top. They recommend medium cook for their burgers but I always prefer medium rare. The patty itself didn't seem to have too much flavor and the toppings definitely outshined the burger.   The truffle Parmesan fries are great, thick-cut like steak fries or like "chips." The truffle aioli that it was served with was so fragrant, I almost prefer the fries over the burger.   Milk shakes looked yummy. My friends enjoyed the Creme Brulee Shake and the Brown Butter Caramel Pecan Shake.   Blue Moon Mango Beer was sweet and refreshing.   Great service and wait for two large tables of 8 was about an hour or so during dinner. I showed up to put my name down and they texted me when my tables were ready.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie Gras Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Fries

eKpNe4e51aEwA7KVqme_UA.text: Yes. That's it, that's the yelp.   And get the truffle fries.  Haha but honestly, it is a very great burger place. If you have 3 people, I would recommend sharing a fry side because the burgers are so huge, that you don't have a lot of stomach left for fries.   I would love to go back, or to one of the other restaurants when I go back.

iSrMMV5u8LsnDfS_WuyJSQ.text: Gordon Ramsay Burger is a full service upscale burger restaurant located in Planet Hollywood on the Las Vegas Strip. I had the most amazing chicken tandoori burger here a while back that has been discontinued. My husband had two very positive experiences here but this time differed some.   This time I tried the Fish & Crisps Burger.  I received a generously sized thinly beer battered piece of cod on a fluffy toasted sesame bun. It was fried nicely and came to me drowning in yuzu mayo (like a 1/4 cup) and it was piled with a lot of salt and vinegar crisps. It was easy to remove the extra dressing and some crisps so that isn't a big deal but this sandwich had almost no flavor to it. I enjoyed the fish and chips from another Gordon Ramsay Restaurant here so I thought I'd enjoy this sandwich. I couldn't complain or send it back because there was really nothing wrong (except too much dressing) but I really didn't enjoy it. I don't know if it was made right or not. It was also maybe too heavy and rich for me. I ate it open face with a knife and fork. It tasted better to me when I scraped off all the dressing and used the curry ketchup from the fries. ($17.00)  We were both slightly bummed about the fries. The good was that they came out hot and stayed hot during our stay. But the good fries were on the top and under them was a pile of little ends of fries that were all slightly over cooked. I liked both dipping sauces (curry ketchup and chipotle ketchup) that came with the fries. ($8.00)  My husband tried the Hog Burger this time (mangalitsa pork, bacon, bbq pork, cheddar, pickles, crisp onion and slaw) The bacon from this burger was juicy and very good. The pork patty was thick pink dense and dry.....it was very odd and was topped with dry bbq pork. My husband kept eating it and I asked how it was. He said he didn't know how this sandwich should be. The waiter does come by and ask how things were. I didn't feel like complaining about the fries......and I just thought I just didn't like the fish sandwich so I said OK. My husband had a mouth full at the time so he didn't say anything. Latter he did show me a big piece of the pork patty and I did feel it and it was dry and very dense......At the end of our stay he did ask the waiter what the pork was suppose to be like and the waiter said moist and juicy. He did say that you should have said something when I asked. I do agree my husband should have said something but he also didn't know what the pork patty should be like.  I know most restaurants have hot and cold days but I prefer to hit them on hot days.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and Crisp Burger - Yuzu Dill Mayo, Salt and Vinegar Crisps ($17.00)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog Burger - Mangalitsa Pork, Bacon and BBQ Pork, white cheddar, pickles, crispy onion and slaw ($19.00)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just Fries with Curry Ketchup and Chipotle Ketchup

wroPjM1ZiatvRQiQPjClsg.text: Valentine's day (late) dinner at the (in)famous Gordon Ramsay Burger place. We came here around 11pm after we watched a hockey game at the T-Mobile Arena.  We were in line for 5 min until we were told we could seat at the bar, we refused and said we prefer a table, 2 min later, they give us a better option, the chef's counter.   For drinks, they had a Valentine's special, for (as low as) $24 you could get 2 shots (coffee cream and tequila), 2 chocolate coated strawberries and 2 shot glasses as a gift and yea... we took that. As weird as tequila and coffee cream sounds, it was very good! Although the souvenir glasses were 2 regular glasses with (I kid you not) a sticker on top, which we thought was incredibly lame.   We ordered the Hog (no onions), the Hells Kitchen Burger and the parmesan fries to share. It took more than 30 min for our food to be ready, but we believe it was worth the wait. The Hells Kitchen was very very spicy but very flavorful, the Hog was a delight as well, no wonder it was marked as a special, it was incredible. The fries come with an amazing truffle sauce!  Overall good experience, pricy for a burger place (dropped $100) but the food was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front

s9E-uq5_lXc4tpWPrtDyzQ.text: I am a HUGE fan of Gordon Ramsey and his burgers did not disappoint! It was pretty busy, as expected, so we waited about 20 minutes to be seated. Once we were seated the service was good, just a tad bit slow because of how busy it was. Not gonna lie, I was a bit hungover from the night before which made time move even slower and it felt like a lifetime before we got our food. However, when the food finally came out it looked and tasted amazing! Exactly what I needed after a night out. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger and shared an order of Truffle Parmesan Fries. The meat was cooked perfectly and the burger was pretty juicy. I love spicy food, so I didn't think the roasted jalapenos made the burger too spicy. The fries were crispy, delicious and came with ketchup as well as a tasty truffle aoili. It was the perfect size to share between 3 people. I would definitely come back during my next visit to Vegas to try out some more burgers and all the desserts!

LEdK73PH0dyBsylhDbot2w.text: What I ate at Gordon Ramsey Burger while we visited Las Vegas in July. The burger was amazing. Flavors exploded in my mouth. The onion rings were to die for and I hate onions. They were better than the truffle fries. The chocolate caramel tart makes me crave it everyday. I need to find something similar in Houston. -KTUSqwu2ZY93JxbYLek6g.text: My boyfriend and I just ate here today.  First off our Lyft drive actually mentioned that it's the one place he hears negative things about but my boyfriend really wanted to try it so we proceeded.  The food looked good.  Tasted horrible. Everything was cold!  I ordered the Hog Dawg with the pulled pork on the side and it was brought to me with pork still on the dog. When I mentioned it to my waiter he attempted to say it was something else, my boyfriend straight up took a bit and said it's pulled pork. He was kind enough to get me a new one. But as I said things were so cold. Why?  And my boyfriend and I both had stomach aches, he ended up throwing up in the hotel later that day. Neither of us drink.

T1zybPqTGYVj2zussX0hEA.text: Yo this place is straight fire. I went in with very high expectations and it absolutely exceeded. I went with my girlfriend and we got the classic ramsey burger, stout burger, truffle fries, and oreo creme bule shake. The classic burger is delicious and refreshing. The stout burger is hands down the best burger I have ever eaten. The mushrooms and onions with the juicy patty goes so well together. The burgers go very well with their house aioli sauce. That sauce is so good. Don't even get me started on the shake. They put creme bule in a milkshake. Who tf does that? But that shake hit differently. To be honest I teared up a few times eating here cuz the food was so good. Definitely would recommend going here if u in vegas area. It also doesn't hurt ur wallet that bad. Definitely coming back again.

aWYRfudw3Ir4zCMyei5Zzw.text: After dining in and trying two different restaurants claiming the title of best burger in Las Vegas (who knows?!), and although both were great, they don't stand a chance of surpassing what the hubs and I experienced at Gordon Ramsay Burger.   Celebrity and hype aside, the food is friggin' delicious! FRIGGIN' DELICIOUS! I had the Turducken burger and nearly lost my mind, the hubs ordered the Bleu Cheese and arugula burger (can't remember the official name of his), but when we halved our burgers and swapped, I literally lost it! Juicy burgers, melt in your mouth toasted buns, perfect condiment to burger ratios-- SO GOOD!   Then there were the truffle fries! Not greasy, truffle-y, and simply perfect. The accompanying ketchup and aioli was delicious. Side note: That's not your average ketchup at GR Burger. I don't know what it is (and I'd like to), but I wanted to bathe in it. (Seriously, how the heck do you slay ketchup??? Never imagined it to be possible.)  And finally, because we were on a high and couldn't leave  well enough alone, we ordered the butter pecan shake and I lost it--yep, again! The shake is the bomb, the candied pecans, and that ice cream-- good Lord.   GR is more than celebrity hype (and I'm so glad). His food and service (our tatted up, blondie server with the ear gauge holes was absolutely awesome-- didn't catch or need her name because she was always there and amazingly detail oriented, with great suggestions) is perfection and I don't think I'll ever be the same! How the heck am I supposed to survive when I go home after eating 4 (count 'em) Gordon Ramsay meals?

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Currently.

Wh8lUzriaOLXe4WsVJdY0A.text: Me and T finally made our way here during our last Vegas trip to try out CHEF GORDON RAMSAY'S BURGR after seeing it so many times in our previous trips.  There was a little bit of a line at 2 PM on a Monday but there is usually a line at least 5-10 parties deep when we came any other time.   The love the signage in front of the restaurant - there are two long rods that are emitting fire (of course haha) and it's extremely "Vegas-y".  We were seated pretty much instantly and a server came to us pretty quickly and handed us our menus.  The menu was printed on a hip, laminated card and menu prices are in whole dollar amounts.  We ordered the Burnt Ends Poutine and the Hell's Kitchen Burger to Share.  Burnt Ends Poutine (3/5) - fries with black pepper gravy, cheddar, cheese curds, pickled red onions (yum), burnt ends.  This was a pretty HUGE appetizer - I would recommend sharing!  It was a pretty flavorful poutine with the black pepper gravy spread all over the fries.  I personally thought the gravy was a bit thick but the pickled red onions were REALLY good at cutting through everything.  Hell's Kitchen Burger (3.5/5) - Bun with black and white sesame seeds topped with a patty, asadero cheese, roasted tomatoes and jalapenos + a jalapeno mayo sauce.  It was an okay burger - the flavor was good but the burger itself was a bit cold.  The other complaint was that the bun was SUPER dry so it made the burger not as tasty since everything else was pretty lean and not fatty.  All in all, probably would come back again but definitely want to try different things.  Our server was great and didn't experience anything bad service wise!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger - Asadero Cheese, Avocado, Roasted Tomatoes and jalapenos Jalapeno Aioli
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger - Asadero Cheese, Avocado, Tomatoes and jalapenos, Jalapeno Aioli

3iSSKSXuIoTW-7AfIAvgjA.text: Honestly wasn't very impressed. Maybe I would be if it was Gordan himself who made the burgers for me, but my dining experience here was just mediocre.  First I must warn you of the wait! I came here with a friend around 9pm hoping the line would've died down some, but to our disappointment, we found ourselves standing in the middle of the Planet Hollywood casino at the end of a 50m long line. I gave up keeping track of time, but it must've been over an hour total, which is also partly due to the fact that THE WAITERS ARE SOOO SLOWW!! it literally took 15 minutes for us to put in our order after being seated and literally, I kid you not 45 minutes for our food to arrive. If it was steak, understandable, but these are just flippin burgers! If anything, it was this exorbitant Disneyland-like wait time that destroyed my experience here.  Then the burger arrived. I ordered the hells kitchen burger and it was... Alright. I was hoping to melt into that first bite, but it seemed that the first bite melted away too quick. The bun was for some reason a little too soft and almost soggy and the patty fell apart when I bit into it, almost like mushy cafeteria food. The taste was up there and I did enjoy the spiciness of the pepper coupled with the savory tones of the burger, but the texture and delivery was way off in my opinion. For $17 + tax + tip, this almost seemed like a rip off.   Had I known in advance, I probably would not have dined here.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells kitchen burger

9QbndNx-AQZnoJP5dUJlEw.text: Honestly, I expected better from a "Gordon Ramsay" restaurant.  Waited approx. 40 minutes for a part of 4 for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. Although we had an attentive and comical waiter, the comedy was a tactic to take our mind off of the almost 1-hour wait for our food. And, when we finally got it, my burger was...average. Honestly, I could've gotten the same satisfaction from Red Robin. And the Parmesan truffle fries are joke. Almost no truffle oil, some half shredded/half grated Parmesan cheese that you'd put on spaghetti, and you charge $12?!  Only came here because we were hosting an out-of town guest who HAD to eat here. Trust me: I don't need to eat here again.

QarFSS7PvoBUYQp6EiKZ0A.text: I've been a Gordon Ramsay fan for a while now, and I finally made it out to this Restaurant of his! Let's just say, now I understand... kpu_8J_TOhTfU0AMI03s8Q.text: We had to try this place because I've always liked Gordon Ramsay's cooking shows. The restaurant was clean and the service was excellent. My burger was so flavorful, juicy and the meat was tender.

Smo_BJzzDpbAk9SetfY1kg.text: I literally just walked out because the service was horrible! I was in line for about 10 minutes when the bartender announced they had a spot at the bar for one so I was able to skip the madness.   After about 5 minutes, the bartender takes my order. I order the ultimate cheeseburger, truffle fries and a lemonade. I have them bring the fries out before the burger. My fries come and I still haven't received my drink or given a napkin and utensils. About 10 minutes later, my burger comes out but I still don't get my drink or a napkin and utensils. After a few minutes, I'm pissed beyond words so I ask for a to go box.   I then hand him my credit card and ask him to take off the drink because he never gave it to me. He says, "why didn't you ask for it?" I just look at him because at this point he is just being ridiculous. He asks if I want the $4 fountain drink to go and I said no. He gives me my card back but no receipt to sign. I wait around a few minutes and still nothing so I get up and start getting my stuff together so I can go. He finally asks if I'm paying with cash. I said no, I gave you my card and you gave it back and didn't say anything or give me a receipt. He then says "well I can't separate the the drink without a manager." At this point, I am ready to go off so I said just give me the drink to go so I can go. I probably should have talked to the manager but I was too pissed to have a professional conversation. This was the absolute worst $35 I have ever spent in my 39 years of life.

_louh_kTV1NMvO6_n8bpmg.text: I would like to start off by saying that my friend and I waited about an hour to eat at this place... and it was sooooo worth it!!! We almost left because we saw a massive line around 5 o'clock (aka dinner time) but decided to wait it out. I am so glad we did!   Once we were seated it did take some time for us to be acknowledged and get our food, but they were busy. As soon as our waiter gave us water we immediately told him our order to speed things along and when he brought us our food we asked for the bill right then because we wanted to keep things moving along.  On to the food. Besides being a little overpriced (it's Vegas baby) and not coming with any sides (you have to order separately), this was probably the best burger I have ever had! I ordered the "Pork Chop and Applesauce Burger" and OMG was it not the best thing I have ever eaten!! It was the perfect way to start my trip! This burger had a pork patty (like wut???), dubliner cheese, branston pickles (which is a pickley-chutney I believe), APPLE BRAISED PORK SHANK ON IT, and a super yummy cabbage-apple slaw that just completed it! It was a little smaller than expected (especially for $17) but so tasty. We shared the truffle-parm fries ($12) and we had a bunch left over. They were thickly (thicc) cut and the sauces they came with were so flavorful (an aoli-like white sauce and a curry ketchup I think?).   All in all, I loved this burger. Yes, it was small. Yes, we waited a long time and didn't receive immediate service upon sitting. And yes, it's pricey. BUT, this burger had some serious flavor and they were all very unique!   My advice: go early and try a unique burger that you can't try anywhere else!

qzKAgM3XHDBMP5LcirDTsg.text: If you are a party of two there is a line for you to wait, but if you have a bigger group, they'll text you when your table is ready so you don't have to wait in line.     My friends and I all got one shake of different flavors.   I got the Creme Brulee pudding with oreos milkshake, it was the best one out of all them.   But, even with my sweet tooth, I couldn't handle all the sugar, it was straight up diabetes in a cup.       All their burgers are delish but it is very salty.   A fair warning.   This is definitely a man's meal, if you know what I mean, not for the faint in heart.

JthNdIi6r0XR05H716oquw.text: Solid burger joint with the man, the myth and the legend, Gordon Ramsay, slapping his name on it to make it famous. We were seated immediately because we went at 2:30 in the afternoon, but be warned that it isn't a large restaurant so wait time can be bad. After ordering, burgers take about 30 minutes to come out, with the option of your fries coming out before or with your burger.   My fiance got the Hog Heaven which is a pork burger with BBQ pork and tons of other meaty toppings. Although he went in with a huge appetite, he could only polish off a little more than half. I ordered the Patriot Burger, which is a turkey burger with smoked Gouda, cherry chutney, spicy mayo and crunchy topping. I LOVED it, and after peeling off over half of the bun, I was totally able to finish mine. The fries were tasty, and we found it more than enough to share an order.   I would certainly be back during non-peak times, but I'm interested in his steakhouse now, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look for the famous flames outside to let you know you&#39;re in the right place!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries and burgers... everything in HUGE portions!

1cZ4QXc4Y0SXlJ1y3T91zg.text: The Blue-cheese burger, farmhouse burger, truffle Parmesan fries, service, and Scottish winter cocktails were fantastic.  BUT But the cookie that accompanied the Scottish winter was pretty nasty: it tasted like the dough had been open in the refrigerator for awhile before they baked it.   Dawn was a great server!

elZ9KIM0Y74t-nBK7vpDdQ.text: Tried to stop in a couple of times but the wait was pretty long and we weren't all that patient. Finally bit the bullet and stood in line; ended up being a very short wait.  The tables are smallish and the chairs are large and comfortable. The dining area is a touch cramped.  The food was reasonably priced considering GR's name is attached to it and as you might expect, it was fantastic. We both had the Hell's Kitchen Burger and fries. Both burgers were cooked to the perfect temperature. Not as spicy as I expected so for those of you who "can't handle spicy food", this is a 2 of 10 on the spicy scale.  The French fries were thick and cooked to a crispy golden brown. The chipotle ketchup was fantastic.  The most striking thing for me was this: when the young man who was responsible for clearing, cleaning, and resetting tables was doing his work, he was so thorough and paid great attention to detail. That says volumes to me about the culture of the restaurant and their commitment to quality and guest experiences.

bBtQtygzoTHslezlM6PaIw.text: What a delightful experience. The food was great. The service was great; we thoroughly enjoyed the manager who brought us our delish bottle of wine. The ambiance was amazing. They mentioned they had their music up louder than normal for a trial run on how customers liked it, and we loved it! Great music! The employees seemed to enjoy it, as I was watching one employee who stood there and just sang her heart out while waiting for her tables food to come up.   Loved it! Will come back!

wvneDXjiWsEHFyI55YDMuQ.text: I'm giving this place a 3 star simply due to the initial expectations I had. Was this just any other burger place, it would be closer to 4 stars. The service was great but food took a while to get out. I got the hog which had decent flavor but the patty was just not very moist (prob due to waiting on all of our orders to get out at the same time). Personally I think hopdoddy burgers have better flavor, both for the burgers and truffle fries. I'm not complaining about the meal by any means, it was overall decent. It just didn't live up to my expectations of a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Will be going to Hell's Kitchen tonight so let's see how that turns out!

MzrhGkyzN28EKR7xxxf97Q.text: Great burgers and ambiance! I have to be honesty, I came initially for the novelty initially since watching "Hell's Kitchen" is a guilty pleasure. They have a variety of options (including a HK burger) to satisfy all types of eaters.   Blue cheese burger for $15 did not disappoint our taste buds. But the real stars of the show were the truffle fries ($12) and the off-the-menu special anniversary burger for $22. A lot has been said about the fries already, but let me tell you about this special burger. Yes, $22 is a lot in general. No, it's not a lot in Vegas. It was perfectly cooked to the requested temperature, the added brisket and frisee plus whatever else was on there was a great accompaniment to the meat - without outshining the star of the show.   Only negative, the service was slooowww. The tables seating after us received their food at a variety of different paces, so it wasn't like us waiting over 45 minutes for burgers and fries was atypical for that date. Perhaps the expeditor lost our ticket? Dunno.

xxWqt128t1tm-DYZYYqY7Q.text: Came here after some great recommendations, and seeing they had the impossible burger but god, was the service disappointing. First of all, an upcharge of $6 for a vegan patty is absurd!  So I asked the server, Renee, what sauces were vegan and how I could make a vegan option. She told me I could only do the mushroom burger, marked V on the menu. I then had to explain to her that the V, as stated on their menu is vegetarian. She didn't seem concerned, and i opted to do an impossible patty with avocado, lettuce and tomato. My boyfriend ordered the Hell's Kitchen. She told us it would be about 30 minutes, great.   So after about 20 an impossible burger comes out with cheese and pickles. Obviously not what I ordered so I politely explained to the food runner, he said he'd fix it. Instead of re-making my food, they decided to just scrape the cheese off. Big NO NO in food service. I, not so politely, pointed this out to the server to which she responded "I don't know what they did back there, that's on them". Cool, thanks. She brings it back to the kitchen.   It's now been 30 minutes. The lady next to us who ordered after we did had gotten her food and i was starting to wonder where my boyfriend's burger was. We looked at the bill that our server had placed in front of us and discovered she never rang his burger in at all. Awesome! So we ask to talk to a manager. The manager, who's name I did not get, was pretty nice and apologetic about the situation. She ended up comping our burgers and finally, they came out correctly.   In the meantime, our server was switched to Teresa. She actually came over and checked on us and was really friendly. She was probably the only good thing about this whole experience.   The impossible burger was average at best, I've had better. My boyfriend seemed to enjoy his burger. The fries were alright, I was not a fan of the ketchup options. Overall, average, overpriced food with terrible service.

ZHn6rUsuor0AyR5Wb5kqdQ.text: Second time here, not really sure why there's always quite a wait, maybe due to location. It's an ok place but not for a $15-$17 burger. That's like au cheval or hopdoddys prices but no where near the burger quality. Give me shake shack or in and out instead. I guess if you are staying at ph and too tired to walk down to NY NY this place will hold you over. I ended up splitting the crown burger and onion rings, again not bad but pricey for what it is.

VdOMYdB5TXJahUXV8h1OyQ.text: burger and beer and cheese soup were very good. Burger was cooked perfectly and served on a nice bun.  Place is well run and does a lot of business.  Good to see a restaurant with a celebrity chef name that doesn't disappoint.

TQ2ACxj5QGKmWifC_cEfcg.text: Regular burgers, and a lot of waiting time for my food and my table.I was hopping for more in taste.

lEt4yblR3dIxkYiCaf1b_g.text: The burgers were good and worth the hype. They came out well done when we ordered medium but besides that the burgers were good and the onion rings were superb.

GWlgUGYDZHTbz6OrJUkZ9Q.text: I've been to this restaurant since it opened. It has been amazing after construction, after the price increases, and for a year after those unwanted changes.   However, this last visit was the worst experience in both service and quality of food. I will elaborate.   The wait was the standard 30 minutes on a summer weekday dinner @ 8p. We met some lovely guests in the line who were excited to eat at Gordon Ramsay's burgr. They, too, had been there many times pre-construction, who coincidentally recommended Bobby flays burger palace over this restaurant due to the increase in prices (foreshadowing ).  We got seated and we ordered the chicken sliders and the farmhouse burger. I have been ordering the farmhouse burger since the first time I came to this location.   The chicken sliders had great texture and flavor. The fried chicken had a crisp crunch and the condiments gave the burger creaminess. However, it was heavily over-seasoned. The salt was so heavy handed.   The farmhouse burger was cooked well. The yolk was runny and the meat was cooked perfectly. However, the bacon had unrendered bacon fat. As a result, it was a chewy white fat drenched in oil that was slathered on top of the whole burger. I couldn't eat it. Additionally and unfortunately, they changed their bacon from the thick cut to the "store-brand" thinly cut bacon, which was a horrible change (likely implemented to increase profits). So I called the waitress over and showed her the stringy white fat from the bacon. I would've been fine if I got another burger without unrendered bacon fat. However, the waitress said, "It's supposed to come out like that." This got me upset. So everyone gets unrendered bacon fat? I've worked the hamburger grill for a long time during my humble beginnings in college and I never served white bacon fat.  On a side note, I really regret not taking a picture, because the waitress took the dish away.   For me, it's a level of standard and understanding from the waitress. When we are paying $15-17 for a burger and it's not cooked properly just bring out another one. No need to patronize a customer.  Later, I saw the plate being shown to the head chef, who talked to another chef about the cook of the bacon. And they swiftly made another one. Simple fix.   Service and food quality has gone down. Look at my previous review, I used to love this place. But I think Bobby's burger palace has taken the top burger spot in Vegas... Give us back our quality, Gordon.

bfQ_1UJMrh_BvTIq2VVVkA.text: Most amazing burger everrrrr. The Hell's Kitchen burger is amazinggggg & the customer service is superb.

LpSxDukOFSnXn8pg-3K2EA.text: My second time trying this place and another great experience. Food was good delicious as the last time and great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KOJ955GfihCqwU_UAIkY4A.text: Where do I start? We came to Vegas for the weekend & stayed at "Planet Hollywood " where the restaurant is located.  Very professional staff & restaurant is ran very well !! I watched one of the staff disinfect the place mats. Wished all restaurants did that! Utensils are clean to perfection. Food is prepared fast & efficient! Our waiter made sure our water glasses were filled. We didn't have to ask. When our food arrived. The server knew exactly who ordered what. Without asking. My dubliner turkey cheeseburger was sensational ! Very juicy. Good size too! Fries were thick cut.  Served with two different sauces.  Would definitely be back!

SNQ4DuFFiPOTVhllfhwx4g.text: We waited about 45 mins on a Friday night around 11:30. Since there were 4 of us, we didn't have to wait in line but they texted us instead. We ordered 3 different kinds of burgers and then 1 hog dawg. Then 1 onion rings and fries because the server said they're both shareable, she was right. They were all delicious but my favorites are the hog dawg and onion rings. I asked them to put the cheese sauce for the dog on the side because I don't like soggy bread. I'm glad I did because the cheese was a bit much for me and my husband. The burgers were really juicy and fresh.   I'm so glad we finally got to try this and hopefully I'll get to go back, if the line is not too crazy.

cSoXo0vTAu45xavvmgS5Cw.text: Best wings I have ever had! Also tried the Hell's Kitchen burger, which was just ok. I took the toppings off and the meat was delicious.  The French fries were also good.  I would come back to try something else on the burgers.

M48fwLjbs1urohgYxlPlzw.text: Great burgers! One of the things I loved the most was the Chipotle ketchup!  Also the New old fashioned was delicious.

fUs2fJJ1TpKc1mcP6blFYA.text: Colossal disappointment.  Is it all a lie? After all the YouTube videos I watched. Does Ramsay even know how to cook? Do I even know what cooking is?   Burger: Ordered medium rare. Got a dry, dry well done. Toppings were salty but the buns were nice so there's that.   Fries: Mushy, stale, absent any crisp. Not the friendly kind of mushy either like in mashed potatoes, but the bland kind of regrettable mushy like the 4th month of your first clingy relationship.   After a 45 minute wait & $50 for two burgers and fries, I would say I am mad, but my spirt is too crushed to muster anything more than a culinary existential crisis.

-mMxBddItaLcNYGT4Gw6vA.text: Well we were so excited to try this place! There was an hour wait so they took our name and number told us to walk around and they would let us know when our table was ready. So we had time to see water show at Bellagio and walk thru Paris. Take some photos and we got our page. Once inside our server came right away took our order and that's when we waited another hour for our burgers. We got 3. Backyard burger which is your basic cheeseburger. The farmhouse burger which had cheddar, bacon and a fried egg, the burger with bleu cheese and 1 order of truffle Parmesan fries. I hate bleu cheese let me just say that but the hubby likes it and that's what he ordered. Let me tell you!!! WOW that burger was amazing. Made me like bleu cheese. It was delicious and worth the wait. The farmhouse was good it would've been better with some fried onions on it! The fries were okay I've had better truffle fries. I took a star away for the wait and also for cooking the burgers wrong. We ordered med rare, medium, med well and we got medium, and 2 well dones

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bleucheese burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger

Z16Yf4cQATSkhqYxfHxjkw.text: I love Gordon Ramsay! I wanted to try the steak house, but they were booked for the weekend. We were able to try the burger joint. We waited 2 hours (which I would expect) except several open tables. In addition, they transposed our cell phone number. Loved the design of the menu, coasters, and plates. Waited awhile to be greeted but once we did the server was energetic and polite. We ordered duck poppers, Hell's burger, and Hog Dawg. Duck poppers were amazing. I split the Hell's burger with a friend but unfortunately a piece of the toothpick was stuck in part of my burger. Then, they also brought out the Hog Burger instead of the Dawg. Food was still good, but not the exceptional Ramsey standards I expected.

zmftYmAuo3CSGedAlQyAAQ.text: Just went there for the 10th time, (my son loves their burgers). Always busy, but we got in after a short wait. I had the chicken sliders and they were really good and different. The truffle fries are great as well as the onion rings. This place is always a must when our son goes to LAS with us, and the service was excellent!

Xa43xvwUKodq4-VfBbPQaA.text: I am not a fan of Gordon Ramsay. However, my date is so we ended up here as part of his bucket list to try one of the restaurants. We stopped by at noon so there was no line up. I tend to avoid lines if I can because I do not want to spend my vacation time in a line if I do not have to. Plus, as I read in previous reviews, they make burgers in patches so you have to wait for some time depending where your burger order is in the line.   We were seated right away, but it took another 35 minutes after we placed our order to receive our food. We ordered the two most popular burgers - Hells' Kitchen Burger and Farmhouse Burger. We also ordered truffle fries to share. I was facing the kitchen area and got to watch the staff make the food. The part I did not like was the fries and onion rings are also made in batches and would sit under the heating lamp until the burgers were ready. Think of how not crispy the fries are when they arrive at your table. It would have been better to just serve the fries fresh out of the fryer. I also found the fries to be too salty as the parmesan is scooped and sprinkled over the top portion of the fries and not mixed in.   I ordered the Hells' Kitchen Burger well done but the patty was medium well. I could still see parts of the patty with pink meat. I was not gonna send my burger back and wait for another one to be made after waiting so long for the order. The topping combinations were good. The bun was soft and paired well with the burger.   Our server checked up on us once shortly after the food arrived. We had to wave and get her attention to refill our water cups as my glass was empty and she never did rounds to refill water until asked.   Overall, I would only recommend trying one of the burgers if you are a huge Gordon Ramsay fan and show up early to avoid the lines. I would not revisit unless my date wanted to stop by here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries and onion rings under the heat lamp waiting for their &#34;turn&#34; to go out to the floor
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries ($12)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse Burger ($17)

WUstwdD9BhI73GD_jv4Y8Q.text: Omg.... when I say I love the burgers and fries it would be an understatement. My only complaint is the ketchup....

lvMxfYCBp-Vmtov6K_t6Cg.text: The food (ultimate cheeseburger) is amazing.  Service is good.  Wait time was a little long at 45 mins for lunch.  The problem is that the soda machine is down.  So it's Dr Brown root beer or cream soda (yuck and extra cost) or water.  Cmon, this is a travesty.  Pay the repair person overtime.  Go to the bar next door, just provide soft drinks or put a sign out front so we are warned.  Update, all out of creme soda now too.

bJqnC8oCEdA_oCAqcSvqHA.text: I am waiting here in half an hour for a burger , no wonder the line is so long. There are 100 places on the Las Vegas to buy a burger, Ramsey has a burger place in Caesar's.. go there.

4IbbH-bpeIJ4OGRDu_7OdA.text: My girlfriend ordered the ultimate cheeseburger and commented it was the best thing she has ever had. I however ordered the seared lobster and shrimp burger which was way too dry, how hard would it be to add a little melted butter?

MqtH7jg1KSSJ7Y1IIb8X_A.text: The meat is high quality and super tasty.  The fries are good but the onion rings are AMAZING.  Their cheddar ranch sauce is awesome. The only downside is they make their own ketchup and it's not good.

KB_p__qunsiajuK1QtNO5w.text: Finally tried Gordon Ramsay burger, I've attempted to come many times before but the line was always super long. I stopped by late Friday night and there was no wait at all. We ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was just okay, the avocado pieces were cut way too big and we had to take them out and cut them in thinner slices. Also ordered the Hog burger and it was really good, I would recommend, the patty was wrapped with bacon and all the flavors worked well together. We also ordered a side of truffle fries and it was not worth it at all for $11 it was too salty and it was giant steak fries. I think it would be better if they were regular thinner fries. The creme brulee Oreo shake was amazing, I would recommend as well. Overall I would probably return if there was no wait.
