et7w9hws522YbswsVdhPEg.text: This burger place had limited choice, but every time it was almost always perfect. Also, the wait time isn't that bad, at least for my experience, and the burgers are soooo tasty.

dJvBXMOOhDwMqjOP9Zd5Tg.text: Not the best Burger  I've had, but okay. It was a bit over priced.. 2 burgers 2 alcohol drinks was $88 ( eekkk ) idk about you, but for us it was a bit much.. especially since the burgers were small. There was a huge line to eat here and I just felt I would get more out of this experience. Gordon Ramsey I feel is Famous for putting up a show and good food! I would've enjoyed my Vegas Burger experience if maybe his waiters had people giving samples of food or introducing the menu to people so people can order faster, Idk all I know is I was wearing heels and in that line it was not the business and the service was ok, not exceptional or anything...this was a blah experience. But I guess you can be cool and take a picture by a fire wall (?)

BZqqEdJh2VPUb-VwHRtT0w.text: Nice waiter but the food was bad. My nachos came out in like 10 seconds and it's cold. Fries were awful and burger was okay

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gYDJ7poO6kCLUrL-U9NfTA.text: Let's just say to start that I am a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay. This restaurant however, shows some serious irony as to how he shows himself on television when it comes to running a kitchen.   To start we had the kettle chip nachos. These had a nice flavor and the meat was tender.   We ordered the Hog Burger and the Ultimate Cheeseburger with a side of Truffle Parmesan Fries. We ordered the ultimate cheeseburger medium rare and the hog burger well. We were told that the burgers take at least twenty minutes to come out since they are made fresh to order. We had no problem with the wait.   The burgers arrived.... the ultimate cheeseburger was cooked perfect and had great seasoning and flavor in the first bite... the next bite and the rest ended up tasteless and boring. The cheese even lacked flavor.   The hog burger, that was just under cooked. When getting to the middle of the burger the pork was cold, mushy and well... was just raw.   When we brought it to the attention of the waitress, now this is where it gets good, her response was, "Well that is the type of pork it is." We showed her that the middle was cold and raw and she continued by saying, "The chef says that it is the type of burger that no matter how long you cook it the meat stays red and that the center doesn't cook all the way, that it is the way it should be." I tried not to laugh. Kitchen Nightmares flashed in my head and I could picture Gordon Ramsay saying,"You bloody idiot".   The sad part is this restaurant bares the name of Gordon Ramsay a man who prides himself on how food is prepared and consistency of what comes out of his kitchens. I am just hoping that serving raw pork is not what his chefs think is best for his customers.   In this case they should be embarrassed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yZPmPL3St4pUX_IKr0VTww.text: Great atmosphere, good service, and one of the best burgers I've ever had. We had to try a Gordon Ramsay restaurant while we were in town and opted for burgers for lunch. Not the most family friendly place so I wouldn't take little kids but older kids do just fine. The fries are excellent and two orders fed six in our group. Try the Hog Burger if your up for a challenge - think upscale Cheeseburger in Paradise.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog Burger

ConolXyJ3YdL37nKuX8bQQ.text: This is  my favorite  Burger place in town. From its 30 foot long fire display and keg showcase., the atmosphere is as  exciting as the menu itself. We ordered ( the 3 of us cousins) the same . Lobster & Shrimp Burger, Hellfire Chicken wings & Their hand cut extra crispy Truffle Parmesan Fries with their signature curry ketchup . It's sinfully delicious!!! We top it with the ultimate sweet fix . White & milk chocolate Parfait.  Service is excellent! Celebrity Chef Gordon Ramsey delivers!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Fries

siqmHxSNvHN334YFqPkx3A.text: I'm a huge GR fan and this was my first visit to one of his restaurants. However, I'm pretty disappointed.   My waitress asked how I wanted my burger done, and I said well done. I don't like pink in my burger-- it grosses me out. I ordered the Hells Kitchen burger. I also ordered the truffle Parmesan fries. The cocktails are very strong! And yummy.  In less than 4 minutes my burger and fries came out. My burger looked delicious, until I bit into it. So raw, I could mush it (all I thought in this moment was that the cow was literally walking bc it was so rare, clearly I am obsessed with Ramsay). However, the ingredients were definitely fresh, the bun was perfect. The avocado was so huge, it was impossible to eat my burger without making a mess. So I mushed the avocado and then put it on my burger. No big deal, because it was a delicious and generous amount of avocado. The fries were a bit dry, somewhat crunchy, needed some salt, but tasted good once I dipped them in ketchup. You get a bunch of the French fries to share ($11).  I ate what was brown enough. The waitress said the manager took care of my burger which was really generous. I would come back for sure. But would probably choose a different burger and hopefully they make it well done next time I'm in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B_lDuerWwtbaZ_QgatKw1Q.text: we are gordon ramsay fans so this was a fun experience! the service was awesome and the burgers and fries were amazing! super tasty and fresh! prices are good for what you get ! you can taste the quality :) i will be coming back again and again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. so good

mh9VJqnLFqHqk3qfYLZjeQ.text: The food was tasty but there's a long wait to be seated and the food comes out late as well. If you don't care for salty French fries ask the server to go easy on the salt. Great atmosphere and I reiterate good food

4mKb1NCwAK_Oj_-xDYS2_w.text: This place is really good. Get there before dinner otherwise you'll be waiting in line to get in. The burgers are very well prepared, the service was probably the best i've experienced and the only reason why it's a 4 star is because everything is sold separate. The burgers and fries are sold separate with the burgers being about $15-$20 and the fries are $8-12 which is ridiculous and they're small and not special.   nevertheless, I recommend if you don't mind paying the extra bucks for the fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very good.

gxpOAO56guzc7xP4_Y7KqQ.text: So yummy. I've been here a few times and eaten 4 different burgers. All very different, but all great. I even tried the fish filet burger and the lobster burger and both were amazing. I definitely recommend!

HQXLOWP7xNoxvSbDyLAWqQ.text: Absolute genius. He knows how to make a burger. The flavor combination is perfect. My blue burger was salty & sweet. Meat cook was on point. We sat at the bar wait time for a table can be timely especially if you have 3 or more in your party. The atmosphere is very upbeat and inviting. Prices are reasonable.  If you want a burger come here. You won't be disappointed. .

xF6es8QhqR3P24-NAK0R5A.text: We had two burgers, the blue cheese one and the hell's kitchen one. I'd say neither was bad, but I'd also say neither was particularly outstanding, and given a moderately high pricetag (16-17) at lunch and a long line, that qualifies this place as overrated. The parmesan fries are solid. But honestly, if this place didn't have a celebrity chef's name attached to it, it would be nowhere near as popular.

r5Z8Tcm7-i-mtCTfNQ1ijg.text: While visiting Vegas, we were in the mood for a burger and decided to give this place a try. We've passed by it before and the line always deterred us from going. We had some time to spare so we decided to try. We did wait in line for about a half hour before being seated. They had a opening at the chef's table so we took that spot. We both tried the ultimate cheeseburger which was very tasty. With the burger, we ordered fries and onion rings. Both of which were fantastic. It did take about 30 minutes for the burgers to arrive which the waiter did advise us. I suggest ordering the onion rings or an appetizer before the burgers come out like we did.   If you have some time to spare to wait in line, I highly recommend trying Gordon Ramsay Burger.

abSBh5KM9rJG-Wg90luewg.text: We come to Vegas once a year. Every time we do we have to go to Gordon Ramsey Burger. It's our third time here and it's been remodeled since our last time it was Gordon Ramsay  BurGR. The burgers are still great which keeps us coming back every year. I had ordered the  farmhouse burger medium which comes with an egg, bacon and cheese. It was cooked to perfection. We also had the onion rings they are beer battered thick cut and come with two dipping sauces one chedder ranch the other chipotle ketchup it's enough to share.  Our previous visits we have had the truffle fries and they are great also. One other great thing is they accept total rewards comps. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Vegas.

Hogl4ua_iFEffEjjB7FFRw.text: This is what a $30 burger and onion rings, no drink looks like :/ I'm speechless ..... Is it worth the experience? Would the price affect your taste buds and sensory organs? ......... for you to find out!

vlNMLP1QrEMl15Fm8jiZ9Q.text: I love the hamburgers and the decor. Nice selection of juicy burgers. I would have given 5 stars but I didn't care for the fries. They didn't have much flavor but the sweet potatoes fries are really good.

CDD6VIRsHQP3sqO0g4HLPg.text: I'm torn with this place. I love Gordon Ramsay and perhaps my expectations were too high. The burger was good, but for the value and wait it wasn't worth it. First, you only get the burger for the price. No fries or side items. I can deal with that but not at $15-20 for the burger. Second the desserts sucked. I got some pudding that tasted very plain like a 99 cent pudding. The line was very long and we waited but if a place is popular kudos to them. The staff is nice, the place is clean, no complaints in that department. The fire pit thing in front is a nice touch as well. I would give this place a 3.5, it is good, not great considering the name it has.

pkIGKV-AP2vvWk-AazZPjw.text: It's a bit of a challenge going here with a large party, we definitely waited much longer than just waiting in the line and sitting separately. After about a 50min wait we finally got to our seats YAY! We already knew what we wanted since we had 50min to decide before we sat. I must say it was absolutely worth the wait not to mention they make everything fresh so the burger wait time is another 30 min or so. We had these bomb truffle fries while we waited for the deliciousness. I highly recommend the Hell's Kitchen Burger with bacon so full of flavor it tasted like Heaven despite coming from the kitchen of Hell lol pardon the corniness. My son had the Hog burger which was yummy as well a 1/4 beef patty wrapped in bacon topped with pulled pork and some sweet pickles to add some balance yum. I would definitely comeback and maybe just play some machines if a wait is necessary. Thanks again Chef Gordon

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Queen and Princess had to dissect her forest burger since she was already full from the truffle fries had no more room for the bun.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Party of 12 expect to wait about an hour on a busy Holiday weekend
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries plenty enough for 2 or 3 to share

K-lMC28sq6aanGqJ_VtpfA.text: Get the short rib nachos. You won't be disappointed. I took off 1 star because my burger was overcooked and the $11 truffle fries were lack luster. I'd definitely go back.

3H-Q2K8LmVaQZ4M4FZjiDg.text: Burger is a great spot to visit in Vegas. For parties of two or less, stand in line ( next to the amazing wall of fire at the entrance) and wait to be seated. For parties of three or more, place your name on a list wth the hostess. If there is a wait, you will be texted once your table is ready, a very convenient feature which allows guests to go elsewhere on the Planet Hollywood floor. We were seated after a 20 minute wait. Our booth was roomy and comfortable (note-the majority of seating in the restaurant was booths...a feature I LOVED). Drinks were ordered and the server provided helpful tips across the board. We ordered the kettle chip nachos as a starter-the brisket was tender, the chips were thick and well-seasoned, and the cheese was creamy (English cheddar cheese blended in with sour cream-delicious). I ordered the Blue Cheeseburger, and it was sensational. Juicy, tender, and bursting with flavor. The figgy jam and cheese were an amazing combination. The bread was soft and delicious. This burger was hands-down the best I have had in a while, definitely this year:) I even ordered mine "well done" which can frequently be too dry...it was not. It was a juicy flavor-explosion, and I am already planning our next visit.  We ordered truffle fries as well, to share. I love the thick-cut style, and the seasoning was nice. The truffle aioli, which accompanied the fries, was okay-honestly, the aioli seemed better suited to plain fries, since truffle on truffle was just a lot. But they were very good fries, and the ketchup was tangy and flavorful. Two thumbs up, definitely visit if you are in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall of fire as you enter
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu and place setting.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna sliders and kettle chip nachos.

WMtjV7Ez8wgrKlbanG4dnw.text: This place ruined burgers for me. It was absolutely delicious, and even the appearance of the the burger was stunning. I love burgers and I am always searching for a good burger. My first bite was so juicy and the balance of the cheese with umami of the beef was such a great balance. I got the blue cheeseburger, my boyfriend got the farm burger, and his cousin got the U.K. burger. Everyone at that table was amazed on the flavor of their burger. The fries weren't something new to me and the reason I'm giving a four star is because of our server. He got our order and gave us the check. Other people checked up on us, gave us the drinks, and the food. Also when he asked for our order he just starred us down instead of speaking up like "and what would you like to order," honestly is it that hard to do? There was a line but they got us in pretty quick. And as I've already mentioned the burger was spectacular and would love to get another burger from here again. Thanks to the chef who made our burgers!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Blue Cheeseburger

U_ati3APse0CgikmdxN_Aw.text: Husband went here last weekend on a business trip and hit the strip in search of a good burger. The burger was decent, not the best he's ever had but it was okay. He had set his expectations high being it was the "Godon Ramsay Burger" and it was meh...so so. Other thing that earned a 2 star rating was the payment error made by the server. My husband had to place the tip on his personal credit card because he can't tip with his business credit card. Though he asked the server 3 times, she still managed to put the entire bill $$$ on his personal card. Now I'm jumping through hoops with the bank to get the charge removed :(

HhnoWzfXzvc8F-G3SBMZug.text: Amazing place but Limited options for vegetarians, coupled with $25 burgers and long waits. Good for one-time try.

7CrU9BwyIO8EECHlJHZelA.text: If the food weren't so amazingly incredible and the staff so wonderful, I'd take a star away because waiting next to the fire wall for 20 mins when you've been out in the 114 heat of Las Vegas is kind of frustrating. But geeze the food is amazing!!!

FS88MfHCRdn7jM7t-ahkxg.text: Awesome burger. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger and the potato chip nachos. Also awesome. Definitely coming back to try the other burgers. Service was super fast. Very friendly server and she knew her stuff. Ashley was fantastic

Xhh2cVq0s0_K2Y44WQEkgw.text: Was not that impressed, there was 7 of us, waiter forgot my ice tea and chicken wings, he did make it up to me by giving me free chicken wings. The chicken wings were bad, we all ordered different burgers medium and they looked rare. Can't believe  this is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Only reason I gave it 3 stars is because the waiter gave me the free chicken wings even though we could not eat them. Gordon Ramsey I need your apron!

Ve69A38rUY0c4uub_1i5Zw.text: Delicious burgers at a reasonable price. I've never had such a delicious bun like this!

j8RDzkWSsFtf3uFSYpxi-A.text: If the food wasn't good enough, Paul and Brandon just completed our dining experience

f3R3YsRl0Rc390Ccck3oeQ.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had. Was in Vegas a few weeks ago and while I was there, could not resist returning over and over again.

sfRZWmK0Lt3FapuIcdP2Cg.text: Great burger. Cooked exactly like I asked. Parmesan fries with truffle oil were fantastic, 1 order is plenty for 2 people. Sat at the "Chef's table" which is basically a counter that faces the kitchen. Pretty cool watching them pump out burgers at blazing speed.

5e3LZSXDgc6CpzDrSBn19w.text: Best burger and great service with added bonus of being able create a chicken version to any of the burgers

LR0epHmVpzXMU724K-hLfg.text: This restaurant is terrible value in my book.  The service is terribly slow.  We (party of two) waited ten minutes to be seated (not a big deal), then after we ordered our drinks (water) it took another ten minutes to get them and be able to put our order in (not a big deal).  Then, it took us almost an hour for us to get our food (very big deal).  The menu is essentially just burgers and fries (we ordered two burgers and one order of fries) which are two of the simplest and fast cooking meals one could order at a sit-down restaurant (an entire industry known for "fast food" is built around burgers and fries).  It should never take that long to serve these items.  Again, service was inattentive.  We tried the sauce that came with the fries and didn't like it so we waited at least five minutes for our server to walk by so we could ask for Ketchup.  She said sure and returned with a third cup/dish of the same sauce.  We both tried it and looked at each other in amazement.  We waited at least five more minutes to be able to ask if there was any real Ketchup.  We were advised that there was not.  This put us over the edge.  My girlfriend like simple burgers with Ketchup and I, having already started eating mine (we were starving when we sat down), felt like the burger was mediocre (not a difficult item to make tasty).  Additionally, the fries (more like potato wedges) were bland and mostly hard - a condition that would have been easily mitigated with some Ketchup.  We finished our burgers in extreme disappointment.  Upon finishing, it took another 5-10 minutes for our plates to be cleared and then another five or so for our check to come back.  After providing my credit card, it took 5-10 minutes for it to be picked up and several more to be brought back to sign.  Once I had the check signed, we waited for our server to return to ask for a box for the nearly untouched order of fries so we could take them home and eat after getting our hands on some Ketchup.  We waited at least five minutes.  She came back shortly with the box and we promptly left the table.  On my way out, I spoke with the/a manager and advised him that the operations of the restaurant are poor and need work.  I also strongly suggested that the restaurant, a "traditional American" burger joint offer real Ketchup to which he responded "that will never happen."  That doesn't bother me because I will never eat there again, but I think it highlights a major issue with the restaurant.  The restaurant is not focused on providing a premier dining experience for customers but is solely geared toward attracting people with the brand name.  As is evidenced by the restaurant name, and Gordon Ramsay's face all around the restaurant as if he is superhuman, this restaurant, and Gordon Ramsay, is the poster-child for arrogance.  This is an expensive burger-joint.  $15 for just a burger, with no slaw or fries included.  Burgers are an easy dish - creating your own doesn't make you special.  Fries are simple as well.  Homemade fries are great, and always a little unique.  But let's not pretend as through they are a specialty item.  And Ketchup.  Well, Ketchup has been around a long time and is an All-American condiment.  To suggest that Gordon Ramsay could create a house sauce that is so good that nobody would ever prefer real, traditional Ketchup...is insane.  To call the house sauce "Ketchup" is misleading.  Not to mention that the sauce is actually terrible.  It tastes nothing like Ketchup and, to us, resembled a smoky shrimp cocktail sauce.  All said, I could never recommend this place. Food is sub-par, service is poor, and customer satisfaction is not a priority.  Arrogance permeates the atmosphere as the restaurant relies on the brand name to lure customers to pay high prices for cheap food.  Note:  The couple sitting next to us left in disgust shortly after receiving their meals.  We were only able to infer that something was terribly wrong with the food.  Either a grossly undercooked burger, a hair or other item in the food, or...no Ketchup (I had seen her spreading a giant glob of sauce on her bun/burger shortly before the server was beckoned to her.  The woman asked that her plate be taken away and declined an offer for any substitute dish.  The man stopped eating and asked for the check.  The manager who I ultimately spoke with, brought the couple the check and made an apology.  Note, he still brought the check which the man paid (over $60).  This does not seem like a genuine apology nor does it indicate any acceptance of responsibility on behalf of the restaurant.

OjpU3-1lLm4VgM8DBTOT9g.text: Hands down one of the best burgers I've ever had. The beef was delicious, the cook perfect, and the tomato, homemade ketchup, and bun were tasty. The sweet potato fries were a nice blend of sweet and salty, I loved that they were coated with powdered sugar. Add to that, the beer selection was great, and service was fast and friendly. The only downside was that it was a bit hard to find, and really loud, but I'm sure that most places in Vegas seem that way for first timers! I would definitely recommend coming here if your craving a good burger.

ZmELqU6wZ0Ybdt89c5drfA.text: What can I say? The burgers were something else! We tried the anniversary burger and OMG so delicious. The ambience is casual and the price is a bit high for a burger but the burgers are not a regular burgers so it was worth every penny!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders

5URhDdQZe95jTgdhcjV6ww.text: Wow, I was expecting to be let down or disappointed at yet another celebrity restaurant just using the name of the chef to sell its product.   This was clearly one of the best hamburger places that I have been too. I am more into a "blue collar" type of hamburger experience with traditional toppings and lots of beefy flavor. NOTE: so being from the Carolina's I love the Carolina-style hamburger but 1) I wouldn't even try getting this out of the Carolina's and 2) I wouldn't get a upscale Carolina-style hamburger (would be a oxy-moron concept).  The service and all the food was very pleasant and professional. My wife and I really enjoyed out lunch here. Highly recommend...  we almost went to Heart Attack grill but so glad we went here instead.   What we had:  Farmhouse Burger : dublinar cheese, mangalitsa bacon, fried egg Beer Battered Onion Rings parmigiano-reggiano, chipotle ketchup, cheddar ranch dip Hells' Kitchen Burger: asadero cheese, jalapenos, avocado,roasted tomatoes, jalapeno aioli Brown Butter Caramel Pecan Shake: BrownButter ice cream, pecan shortbread  crumble  Creme Brulee Shake: chocolate or oreo milkshake with a creme brulee top

La2hVYo_TmAVqdCOwCdrPw.text: No idea what they served me, it wasn't the hog burger that was described on the menu, couldn't even guess what the meat was.  Maybe it was a vegan burger.  Wait staff too busy to get it corrected.  Highly disappointed.

Dcu7a4OClcHxSjkfbmOzEA.text: Excellent burgers and very cool environment. They let us keep the menu and the coasters, lol.

WjPRwc4Jdr7G8qpVOz0uzA.text: Phenomenal menu knowledge by server Nadine. She recommended the Forest Burger after I explained what I liked. Needless to say it was beyond my expectations. The onion rings were breaded to perfection and the sauces were like something I've never had in my life!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest Burger and hog burger in the background

7ldHQPD7v2fgFpV3630LxQ.text: Second visit here after a few years away. Overall we had a really good experience again, and the burgers and fries were great! We arrived just after the restaurant opened for the day and while we were seated immediately, we didn't see a server for the first 10 minutes, and only because we notified the hostess. Once they let out server Brandon know we were there, he did a great job. I highly recommend the Mediterranean Burger with Truffle Parmesan Fries and the Curry Ketchup!

Y64od_ijvrGf67ztdPmiWA.text: Pretty simple to sum this one up: 1.  Easy and efficient check-in 2.  Table was ready when the text came 3.  Super nice server and very attentive. Even during shift change 4.  Burger was outstanding and we knew it would take about 25 min. It did take a little longer but they were crazy busy. 5.  Would have liked a few more options on the burgers but this is his menu. Settled for the UK burger and was a great decision. 6.  Onion rings came out quickly and were outstanding. Very light batter that held up to frying and the two sauces provided. Sauces were nice mix between sweet and spicy. 7.  Despite delay, burger was cooked perfectly. Love the toasted bun with sesame (light and dark). Fries were solid. Not greasy. Nicely salted -- and I like a lot. 8.  Server was very attentive with refills, as we were just doing tea and soft drinks that afternoon. 9.  Everyone cleaned their plates and we got out in a timely manner to head back to casinos/shopping/people watching. 10.  Exactly what you would expect from Ramsey. Perfection expected and delivered.  He might have dropped a few F-bombs on the timeliness but the food was outstanding.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Final outcome -- U.K. Burger -- fantastic!

B7b75vH-UKhBxMsCbZWB2Q.text: I have to say the Hell's Kitchen burger was BOMB! It  was worth my money, so much flavor i would definitely come back.

NYu9WJuebTV-zqWwpLxY9g.text: Good food. Not a typical burger and fries joint. Good flavor . I had the hella kitchen burger it needed a bit more spice since thats is what the description said. Food takes a while if your not in a rush this a spot friendly service

b9l9dc3SseKCS-7k2QjrQQ.text: If I could give this place zero stars it would definitely deserve less. I don't know if they ruined the order of two simple burgers on purpose so out of stupidity I'm hoping it is out of stupidity. The place has a decent line because Gordon Ramsay has a good name although the food and the people working there will quickly change that. I ordered a plain burger for myself and a burger with cheese for my girl the lady wrote down what I wanted in the burger which was just lettuce and onions well-done with no cheese. For these two burgers we had to wait about an hour and 15 minutes then to just get disappointed not only was the order completely wrong the burger was not cooked at all which begs the question, why did she even bother writing down my order if they were just going to give me some random burger instead. Opened the box just to be extremely disappointed about the taste the quality of the meat besides for how rude and nasty the workers were you are hoping that the food would be up to Gordon Ramsay's expectations although unfortunately you unfortunately will be disappointed beyond your dreams just save your money and go to a cheap a burger place that will actually get the order right and you'll enjoy the burger to without an hour wait for raw Burger. I hope instead of just making the food for his next restaurant Gordon Ramsay can just make sure the people working there don't ruin his good name. Save your money time and headache anywhere else is more satisfying.

1aD_eXaNMSSL9bot1cEzvg.text: My family ate here, and the service and food were a huge disappointment. My daughter ordered a hotdog, and when we asked for ketchup it wasn't what she was expecting. It was some sort of house ketchup, and they didn't carry plain. Our food was cold, and not to mention we waited over an hour just to get 2 burgers and a hot dog. Just to get our drinks took 20 minutes. The only thing good was that we were seated fairly quickly, only took about 10 minutes. The staff seemed careless and rude when we were asking about the different items on the menu. We came here thinking it would be a great atmosphere with amazing food, instead we got horrible service with mediocre food.

GkTaKP4xjd9Dn1m5gvPEWQ.text: This is an absolute bonafide winner, no matter what burger you choose its sure to please. However, fries are a chore to eat, dry and bland, horrible!

z3ZCZ4FsZBfwi3sot_JQRg.text: Best burgers I've ever had!!! Best wings!!! And the Parmesan fries are delicious!!! This is quality food , not some bs thrown together that you regret paying for later. Worth the wait!! I actually go quite frequently lol !! YUM!

UDydzu1hGzmuikogNzmcBA.text: 2nd visit with the husband and 1st visit with the kids. Everyone loved their burgers and my husband couldn't stop talking about the Mediterranean Burger. Everyone in this restaurant is so friendly and accommodating. It was a long wait to be seated, but completely refreshing when the staff thanked us for our willingness to wait. Jonathan the GM introduced himself to our table, and was buzzing around the restaurant greeting other guests, seating guests, and removing dishes from tables. The food is amazing, the staff is out of this world, and we will always come back. My kids were only disappointed that Gordon wasn't there yelling at somebody.

xMs_NRWeho3r1ecJzad83A.text: I love Gordon but this was my least favorite of all his restaurants in Vegas. Nothing special in my opinion.

yGMYW1gmfMBfVFgWXH9yqw.text: Me and my bf were visiting lv and decided to eat a lunch here. We ordered a truffle parmesan fries and hell's kitchen burger and a hog burger. Both burgers were very delicious however the hog burger was exceedingly bomb ass good!!! We will definitely comeback for hog burger when we are back in town. One star is taken away because the service we got was terrible. For 20 min we didn't know who our server was because no one came to us and we couldn't flag anyone down even though it wasn't that busy. After we finally got to order the server never came to check on us and it was hard to flag anyone down for drink refills. the food was great but I was disappointed with the service

pOraDGQJk6uOqL5N2OArQw.text: Have been to Vegas 4 times and this is the 1st time we tried this place. It was cool, we got to bring our kids, and usually they are very picky. Well, my picky kids absolutely loved their burgers. I really, really liked the onion rings.hard to find good onion rings. I had the bleu cheese Burger and it was amazing. My husband had the farmhouse Burger and he really did enjoy it as well. We did have a mishap but the manager took care of it without hesitation. We'll definitely be back.

I5dSeq8Q4nRzh72JOpEWxA.text: It's well worth the wait. It was bit busy but expected.  Once we placed our order they tell it's takes about 25 for burgers.  Burgers were fresh and tasty.  We also ordered shakes that were yummy.  Definitely try the Hell's Kitchen burger if you like jalapenos.

40qvAhGz-nCg_0ScHs18hQ.text: Gordon Ramsay is basically my food idol. I've always wanted to eat at one of his restaurants ever since I heard about them. I got the fries and they were pretty thick which filled me up a bit. It was good though with nice flavor but a little too filling. I also got the forest burger which was cooked to perfection! The meat just softly melts in your mouth and it's so juicy and flavorful. The buns were the perfect texture to complement the soft meat. Overall I was in love and I can't wait to try another one of his restaurants.   Gordon Ramsay,  teach me your ways!

rSrXP7TQL9oUzTTFSWLqfg.text: The fries and the oreo cookie creme brulee shake came out somewhat quickly and were delicious. The burger was a tasty and appetizing, but seeing as though we got here and ordered a little after 11 and it just barely got served at 12:20, even thought we were told the burgers take 20-25 minutess, not sure it's worth it...especially when you're really hungry.

HkgoFMDrUJeqgmr9WRwxhw.text: Let me start by saying that I'll never look at another burger from anywhere else the same after this experience. I've wanted to try this place for many years, and was not ready for the journey I was about to take. I don't know how one person can conjure up this magical of a burger, but it damn sure makes me a believer of the Gordon Ramsay food cult. My goodness, how in the world can a burger be this good!? And not only that, but then we had the two different types of ketchup that came with the fries and that was magical, too?? To top that off, our waiter hooked us up with the truffle aioli and the cheddar ranch dips to try, and I thought I was going to melt in my chair. How? How can one place have so many amazing flavors in one place? It blew my mind, no doubt about it. I can't wait to go back. In fact, from now on, every other burger not from this restaurant will just be a disappointment. And that, my friends, is how you make the perfect burger.

o54T5WIo8n1pic-x7R4FIg.text: Three stars takes into account the price, time of wait and quality of meat.  This was a very good burger overall. The cheeses, sauces, shoestring onions were all tasty. The bun with light and fluffy and was a nice complement to the meat. The burgers were cooked appropriately to my medium request. The house ketchup was excellent. However for a 45 minute wait and 20 dollar burger I expect to have some kind of unique beef like an aged prime beef that is ground in house. The burger itself was bland. The toppings were all unique and quite good. But For 18-22 dollars per burger and 60 dollars for lunch I expect more. Save yourself some time and money and go to earl of sandwich right down the hall.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog burger cut in half

iZ68IPQQPdHTSHc03-n6DA.text: Excellent service. The food came out quickly even though the waiter (Ian) stated the burgers do take a while. We stopped by for my husband's birthday lunch and ordered:  DRINKS: Moscow mule - delicious  Dirty Jim - delicious   APPETIZERS: Burnt ends poutine - bomb Hell's Kitchen wings - delicious   MEALS: Hell's Kitchen burger - okay  Truffle fries - good but would be better if they were shoestring (The truffle aioli was the best!!)  Everything was delicious, especially the poutine!  The wings seemed like a different cut. They were bomb and I don't usually like blue cheese. We actually weren't too crazy about the burger. Yes, it was good, but didn't seem like something we were in the mood for. I should have stuck with my first choice (The forest burger) because I felt like having something with mushrooms.  Oh well.. next time!  They also gave a free layered cheesecake dessert for his birthday. Compliments to the chef and Ian!  Thank you for a great lunch!

dq9WJy_jIMu_Y8aPQju6qw.text: It's raw! Feels like Gandhi's flip flop. Went there and raise up the Gordon Ramsay famous speech. Waited about 2 hours for a table for 3. 5_6PuYFVMjVN9_8Mju420Q.text: 4 Star coz I liked the Mediterranean burger that I ordered but mr. Husband didn't enjoy his Hell's kitchen burger as much. We will be definitely visiting when we are in Vegas next and try some more burgers!

MMISqdTAUog6kRV9O5QNlA.text: We had the turducken burger and the burger with blue cheese. I still drool just thinking about the turducken burger...a fried egg sat atop juicy duck confit, spicy arugula and a moist turkey patty. It's become my favourite burger and I can't wait to go back to have it again. I recommend getting the chips, but not the curry with chips as the curry sauces were watery and bland. The burger with blue cheese was tasty, but not extremely memorable. Must try Turducken!

mnFVKrZ6KWxc3tkYIO8Q3g.text: Amazing burgers!!!!  Our favorite was the sweet potatoe fries!!!!  Yum!  The wait looked long but they got us right in. Sooner than it looked.

xWQLwf4Y-m1nsRNZRfrGeQ.text: As a grown ass woman who just witnessed the glory of the Backstreet Boys Vegas comeback, it was only fitting for dinner's first course meal to be the immaculate creme brulee Oreo milkshake at Gordon Ramsay Burger. No, sir waiter, you did not hear me incorrectly - I am requesting my non-alcoholic dessert drink to arrive, flying on a beautiful unicorn, well before my humongous burger and onion rings. Sil vous plait.   Yah. That milkshake was fan-frickin-tastic. The creme brulee is a delicious layer resting on a creamy Oreo milkshake.   Tried the farmhouse burger - the meat was cooked to perfection, and the fried egg on top just makes everything ten times better. Sides are ordered separately at this joint, so the table ordered the Parmesan onion rings, truffle fries, and sweet potato fries. Onion rings - crispy and delicious. I was told the sweet potato fries were amazing thanks to the powdered sugar shaker they serve with it. I was told the truffle fries were meh. Everyone seemed to like the burgers they ordered.   The vibe is hip and the service was great. I hear the average wait time is 30-45 minutes, but they do text you when the table is ready so you could roam the casino in the mean time. We got there around 11 after the concert and had no wait. Definitely check this place out!!

My expectations were high because of Gordon Ramsay and i must say it was delicious the burger was perfect, it wasn't dry everything on the Farmhouse burger was cooked perfectly the fries were nice and crunchy the environment was good. I would totally love to come back to this burger joint whenever i could and i would recommend it to any people who are skeptical about trying it! My next place to try is Hells Kitchen.

_qAKDHOR-pbQzTt0YRisew.text: If the restaurant hours are posted as being open until 2, hostesses should still seat at 1:30 am.

usABXvG_1RedRvEQ86h7lg.text: Had the UK Burger. Great recommendation by the waitress. Best burger I've had in a while. Would recommend, particularly if you're in the mood for something simpler. Proportion of patty to bun to everything else was spot on. Patty was perfectly seasoned. The bun was nice and fluffy without being too soft and chewy. Had the perfect amount of mango chutney - just a touch, not too much.  Would recommend the lemonade - really smooth and refreshing on the 110 degree day I went.  Also the bar is a great place to chat up others who happen to be there by themselves because, say, they're in town with their husband or friend who is busy at a work conference. :) Super wide and cushy chairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. UK Burger - all elements were very well balanced. Would recommend if you&#39;re in the mood for something simpler.

J6oIFe-C_SPvi-R8LD3Mdg.text: Solid, solid option if you are near the center of the strip and looking for a unique restaurant in the area that won't beat the crap out of your wallet.  Located near the entrance of Planet Hollywood, I arrived on a Wednesday night at around 9pm with a coworker and there was about 30-40 people in the line when we got there.  I don't think that was unheard of and likely on the weekends you're looking at a potentially way bigger lineup.  Surprisingly, we only waited about 10 minutes to get seated so kudos to the staff.  There are a wide selection of burgers on the menu (You have to order any sides completely separately but this being in the center of the strip, that's about standard for the prices they are charging).  I had the blue cheese burger and it was excellent.  You can tell the burgers are high quality and they asked how you want the burger done.  I got it medium rare which is what I recommend as well.  The burger I got was around $16-$17 but was well worth it.  I would love to come back and try other options on the menu but I was definitely satisfied with this visit.  The restaurant can seat quite a few people so don't get discouraged with the longer lineup that you may see.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

984FLGyB0a9isIr6Pok47g.text: Sat at the bar, look at their giant beer list, ask if they had a pilsener and got a bit of a sneer from one of the bartenders. Ok Mr. Double-IPA, guess we haven't left 2014 yet?  In any case. Staff was a bit too casual if you ask me. One staff member loudly saying to the bartender how he lost his virginity to that song (kinda funny) but then proceeding to talk about how the other guy is going to get fired, etc.  Now to the actual burger. Got the Hell's Kitchen burger. Good combo with the jalapeno, guac, avo, but overall unimpressive. Slightly overcooked patty, but more troubling was that it wasn't exactly a great patty.   More troubling is the fact that the extra Truffle Fries I ordered (yes, Fries cost extra)... were actually Chips (the English kind, not the Lays/Pringles kind) instead of fries. Now since most Americans restaurants serve fries for their "Fish & Chips" instead of Chips, I'll give him a pass on this one, but seriously he should know better.  Then again he's probably re-using them on his Fish & Chips joint few blocks down the road.  Overall, not sure what I was thinking having a Brit make me a burger :)

HY2hfwJokH_XYwUFM9HEiQ.text: Although the food was absolutely delicious , the service was VERY slow.  Our waitress seemed upset when we didn't order alcohol.  After getting our iced tea, she took our order and seemingly forgot about us.  It was a 35 min (plus) wait.  I had to stop another waitress to obtain an update on our order.  We didn't see Donota again until half way through our meal.  I come every year when in town, this was the slowest, worst experience.  I will return and hope the service will be better.

-aVzQpCYiL9LI6QJIQegRA.text: This is the most overpriced hamburger I have ever paid in my life. I don't eat meat and you have a six dollar extra charge for a veggie burger? What a scam!   So. Mr.Ramsey you want to charge me $21 dollars just for a hamburger? What a joke. Rude service and long waits for the food on top of it being overpriced! Also I have two kids and no kids menu? Never again will I ever go to another of your restaurant and will tell ever what a scam your place is!

Z6fm_17_59rmJ-Rg329gug.text: If I could give this place 10 stars I would. We got there at about 3:30pm and there was a queue. We waited about 15 minutes before we were seated ( we were a party of 2). So the wait wasn't bad at all.   Our waitress was really lovely! We ordered quickly because we decided what we wanted while waiting in the queue. I had the blue cheese burger , hubby had the Gordon Ramsey ( Hell's Kitchen) Burger and we shared fried ( the fries are huge and enough for 2 -3 people). The food took really long to come out of the kitchen ( like 30 maybe 35 minutes). The wait was worth it because the burger and fries was delicious! Probably the best burger I have ever had. I'll definitely be going back to try a few other burgers while I'm in Las Vegas.   For vegetarians - they have a portobello mushroom burger which sounded amazing! I might have that one when I go back.   Tip- it's quite warm sitting by the glass window as there's a display fire .

MTAUIaS7ywHXoYV_2S2DCA.text: The food was amazing and the staff rocks . Sosa was very nice and sincere he made us feel very welcome even though we could see him running around like crazy from behind the counter. I will definitely be coming here again!

FJ8MJ6Fzzv-u6OUtAcNKNQ.text: Had dinner here tonight and it was such a good burger! The fries came with two types of specialty ketchup (Chipotle ketchup and Curry ketchup). Both had some kick to them and were great. I had the St. Archer IPA which was also fantastic. Do yourself a favour and go there for dinner if your in Las Vegas.

GA5Z1fsqfx2HrBbi9_7KBg.text: I love coming to Vegas; checking out new places to eat so I couldn't pass Gordon Ramsay Burger. I came on a Thursday evening around 6pm; there was no wait time in line and grabbed a seat at the bar. I was greeted by Bianca V. who suggested the backyard burger. Everything looked great! The burger was delicious and super juicy, for the price its definitely the quality you pay for! Will come back soon!

ZCfMsMa3n1_04VsrTz_lXA.text: Hands down the best burger out there. It must be something with the meat they use I don't know. I come here every time I go to Vegas usually two times per visit. Get the Euro burger. I fucks with it. Also all of there fry options are amazing.

ONZ8Fn6dZ2-2GbRaslNscw.text: I'm not a big Gordon Ramsey fan because I think he's mean..LOL.  However, my fiance is a huge fan and had to have something from one of his restaurants while we visited Vegas this past Dec.  So we tried his burger spot.  It was the best burger that I have ever had..literally.  We didn't dine in, my fiance got it to go, so even with that said (note, I like my food piping hot) it was such a flavorful burger.  I can't tell you the exact names of the burgers we had, but we both had something different, and felt the exact same..best burger ever.  So bottom line it's not even what you get, the quality of beef used and the execution of your burger will always be on point.  We are definitely going to make a return visit the next time we are in Vegas and we'll dine in.

YPka7p071YVUFzJQ4p8Tqw.text: Wasn't sure exactly where in Planet Hollywood the restaurant was but we found it after walking around the casino a little. Waited in line for an hour but man it was so worth it. I got the Forest Burger and shared the Truffle Fries. Wow it was so amazing. The service was surprisingly really good as well which is surprising due to how busy they were. Definitely worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Forest Burger

NiGFE91B3F3Qjpp8XSWBcw.text: Chef Gordon Ramsey is my favorite chef. Burgers are amazing, shakes are amazing, the atmosphere is amazing as well. Good service, great food what else could you ask for.

kHRJkazgLYM9C4keYcQDBg.text: Which chef doesnt taste his own food? I Was at this restaurant, i Got appetizer, main course and dessert, it was good expect The dessert, i Got a White chocolate parfait and it tasted like cheese, really strong. When i complaint The server told that no one Would taste it?? They asked me If i wanted a new dessert, but seemed like they didnt Care.  If it was my restaurant i would always taste my food

3O8IkOUgvdnV4xhaX_PC-g.text: Ordered poutine and Hell's Kitchen burger. Best burger I've ever had! Service is also good. Had margarita the other day. It's too sweet to me. But definitely will recommend this restaurant!

wW9ladkLaLOHU95NE_ihXQ.text: Went on a Thursday night and the wait wasn't too long. Staff were friendly. Ordered the special hamburger that was not on the menu (limited to 100 per night). It was priced at $22. It was a strip sirloin and ribeye grounded together and topped with a little bit of brisket. This was a disappointment. The burger was dry, not tasty and I ordered it as suggested by the server. The bun was excellent.  The nachos tasted good but had way too much cream sauce. The onion rings were tasty. They come in this cone holder. The not so good part was the bottom rings got soggy with oil. Which made them unappetizing. Would I go eat there again? Probably not.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. GR&#39;s take on nachos. Too much cream sauce.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dENU8SQRF4uUeG-fy8kp9Q.text: If you love burgers, and are tired of Burgers as usual, then this place is for you.  The restaurant is located inside Planet Hollywood Casino and can be a little challenging to find depending on which entrance you come through.  Dress code is casual. There was a little wait to be seated but the food was delicious!  I took a recommendation from my server and got the Uber burger with mango chutney added.  It was a 10! I also got a side of the truffle fries which are large enough to be shared by two people.  I would definitely come here again.

_4lw4bGYcmw8_4Rq-AO2yw.text: Oh what's the big fuss about..it's the guy we always see on TV -  Gordon. It's just a another burger joint. Lol. But after the first bite of my Crown Burger, I'm sold!  Very juicy and tender and full of flavor. Will definitely come back again, but beware there maybe a 30 min wait..just go relax and grab a drink by the nearby bars.

xl_pNVuZdDL17TmNCRsBsA.text: WHAT?  They changed the menu this past month and took away the jalapeno poppers??? They figured out that their is an "E" in Burger so changed the name to Burger instead of Burgr.  They revamped their menu but some of the classics are still there like the farmhouse burger (my favorite) The sweet potato fries are still great and unchanged.  But come on, you can get a good burger anywhere on the strip.  The Jalapeno poppers truly was my big draw to this place.

Q_BNzba9Aeo-OsfQ2U7Rqw.text: Its everything you would expect from a Ramsay restaurant.  The food was incredible, the service impeccable, the place was spotless, and it was truly enjoyed

-q7shSkJzlI0EOGAlyt4bw.text: I had high hopes for this restaurant that were quickly dashed by the slightly above average burger joint that is Gordon Ramsay Burger. We got into the restaurant very quickly and actually got to sit in front of the kitchen and see the food prepared. However, our order took 45 minutes to cook all the while several people came and got their food quicker than us even though they ordered later. I got the barnyard burger which was rather bland and mediocre in general. I also got the Parmesan fries; they were much like the restaurant: high hopes quickly dashed by an average product. In the end I would like to give them another chance but I am certainly going to give preference to other restaurants in the area first.

3Jxyv2epTeVOXibg13j3jA.text: Wait time was ridiculous. Not just the lineup to get into the restaurant. Once seated it took far too long to order and receive our meals. The fries were undercooked and the burger was a bit underwhelming. It's quite possible that I came on an off day when the food and service wasn't up to its usual standard. I would try it again if I didn't have to wait so damn long to eat

Phkk9QEbYWPW3yaMNOn2Ug.text: I had the backyard burger it was really good and the fries are big enough to share for two our wait time was about 20 minutes .

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BCP915A1ypIfidg283svbg.text: If it's a Gordon Ramsay-owned restaurant, you know it'll be good.

B-qFfsjCV2tn9Vcrfobe5A.text: Enjoyed Our Evening!!! Hubby's Birthday!! Thank you Sister Evy Eve for treating Pops!! He loved dirge Farmhouse Burger!!! I loved the Ahi Sliders!!! Great service!!!! So delicious and comfortable setting!!!!

25EAGSC2XqPoBx0pz1BDBg.text: When I order a burger medium well it shouldn't be extremely pink inside.  Did my order get mixed up with someone who order their burger rare!?!? And then to not even offer to remove the burger from the $130 check is very surprising, being it was obviously your mistake and you were made aware of the situation.  Sorry, but how can I leave a tip in this situation.  Very poor customer service Tammy!

Bdkc-Gy_OVyIEQ5as8t3AA.text: Great service here!  The bartenders (Robert and Michelle) were very friendly and gave us great recommendations.    The burger is very high quality and they gave us a plethora of different dipping sauces to try and it made it much more than just a burger joint!

2ru8k1mQMGGCC_wHOhgXmQ.text: The wife and I split two burgers, both were really good. Our server was attentive and helpful. All in all a great spot for dinner.

Feb59npbtWwK6EjPmHhy9w.text: The french fries were stale tasting... All they do is a powder them in a Parmesan mixture call them truffle fries... The burgers were OK.  They all came out the wrong temperatures. I definitely liked Guy Fieri's  place was 10 times better!

G2YFr7l2xMjZzbt7sIHXcg.text: Everything here food quality wise is just okay. The burger is wholesome. The shakes were rich and sides were all done well. What I like least though is the buns on the burgers. Service was excellent though there can be a wait at times. I went during lunch on a non-holiday weekend. Due to the just average food at above average price, I am unable to give a full five stars.

A8ULprZ4CapCmYfXNJ_WXA.text: Takes a lot to get 4 stars for a burger. The farmhouse is absolutely amazing. The truffle fries are absolutely amazing. The homemade ketchup is great as well. The only thing keeping this from 5 stars is the price of the food. I understand i am dining at a Gordon Ramsey restaurant but a gourmet burger dinner for 2 shouldn't exceed $75 and we didnt order drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m1yRZv_J5p-9FOpy54vEew.text: It's good. It's worth all the hype. Great burger, great sides, great service, and the wait isn't too long either. Highly recommend eating here when in town. For eating on the strip, it's reasonably priced. That being said you are easily $60 with tip for two people. Check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The &#34;F&#34; word burger

KHZ9jvvHUMT13K0x_fPC7A.text: One of Ramsay's Vegas restaurants. It was good overall but easy on the salt please. Get everything without salt and then season accordingly to your liking. Always a line with tourist as it deserves the volume. Duck fat poppers are excellent!

CbsziEBYuiuuih2k-_1dyA.text: Absolutely worth the wait! Excellent service and friendly!  Had superfruit antioxidant drink and WOW! Burgers are amazing and huge! Definitely add  onion rings to your meal... Love love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

czMI-KeG43OVriSxhTbNiw.text: My husband and I were here for my 30th birthday and this was on our list of places to check out. We ordered the nachos which I was really disappointed in. The toppings were cold but the flavor was there. Our burgers were one of the best things I have ever tasted in my entire life!! I really wish they would build one here in Chicago. The burger was juicy without being soggy and the bun was as grilled to perfection. The truffle fries with the aioli were to die for! We can't wait to go back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ckN2R7rZCu87tYONtfZ16A.text: Best lobster and shrimp burger I've eaten, Farmhouse burger were also delicious.  Burgers were juicy, loads of flavor! Onion rings and truffle fries were insanely addictive.  Wait time for burgers took awhile, definitely worth the wait if you are seated along the chef's table. Time flies by faster watching the line cooks and food prep.

YQQDeQX0w4x9y_wu-fNocw.text: I have waited to come to this restaurant for a very long time so was really excited to try this place out. We got to the restaurant around 6:45 and there was a huge line waiting to get seated. Parties greater than three can go directly and check in without waiting in line. Once we checked we were told the wait would be an hour. After getting seated an hour later we had a rude waiter that was rushing us to order. He told us that burger take 30 mins to make so it's better to order an appetizer until the food comes so we needed up ordering the truffle fries, Mediterranean burger, fish burger, Hell's Kitchen burger and the farmhouse burger. After placing the order we waited around for the truffle fries since he said appetizers will be brought out but everyone around us with a different waiter got their fries while waiting for the burgers. We waited for the waiter to come check on us for more drinks or additional orders but he never did so we ended up calling him over after 30 mins and he said your fries will come out with the burger. If that was the case I don't know why he told us to order apps. Anyways another 25 mins goes by and finally our food came out. I have to say the burgers were all extremely good but definitely not worth the 2 hour wait. The truffle fries were a huge disappointment though.  I just wished the server we had better customer service and at least checked on us once to see if we needed anything. Was really disappointed considering it's Ramsay's restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The line to get in
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger and truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6ohzNpFE_-8wJGoxoNI5Wg.text: Celebrity Chef's restaurant, did not disappoint.  It was packed when we got to put our name down.  There was a line just for putting your name down.  The menu was simple and being a fan of Gordon Ramsey's food shows, I was expected to be wowed. We had 7 people and a hungry appetite.  We ordered almost every appetizers and each of them was delicious.  My favorite was the truffle Parmesan fries (still thinking about them).  The burger was well made and very juicy.  Would have been a good idea if I had shared mine cause I wasn't able to finish (especially with all the appetizers we ordered)  Service was good. We were able to enjoy the meal before heading home.  Would recommend! Get in line folks! I think it's worth it.

xIKxfpbIrHh5-ryv_KRbqg.text: The burger wasn't FAWKIN RAW. IT WAS DELICIOUS. It was really good and that is the point, it was quick too. Even with the restaurant seeming like it was full, our burgers still came quickly. They were hot too, and cooked the way we wanted them.  It's really good.

0oBQMZ119X7ToFGGi7ccLg.text: Arrived here on vacation looking for a great burger, and it didn't disappoint. The service was outstanding and always looked after our needs, the atmosphere was very casual and felt very friendly. I also enjoyed the Gordon Ramsay decor surrounding the walls. In addition, I enjoyed the fire display at the front of the restaurant, very nice. Next, the food: it was nothing short of excellent. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was excellent, the flavors balanced out perfectly and I enjoyed it nicely with a side of truffle fries. I will definitely be coming back in the near future. Great place all around.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front display

WPTnPYuj547AXWmgmECdug.text: We've eaten here before and loved it but this time was a miss. We tried the burnt ends poutine and it really should be taken off the menu. None of the parts worked together and we left 75% of it. The street corn was decent but was lacking something because it was very bland and the popcorn top went everywhere when you tried to get the dip. The onion rings were outstanding and the burgers were good but they claimed because they had new menu items they couldn't take a sauce off one of them. My biggest complaint is all through the meal they left dirty dishes on the table and no one seemed to care. I think the long lines because of Gordon are going to this places head. It wasn't worth the money this time.

1LNCtZkKPB2ofAUZSYWLcQ.text: Excellent burgers. Even my super picky boys loved it.  We each ordered sow thing different and they were all delicious. One burger is more than enough for a full meal. We might go back each night with only 30 min wait around 5:30

4FdjEj8pwHVltK_tA9_bbA.text: Not a bad burger, but definitely expected more out of Ramsey. The burgers are okay. I even tried out their anniversary burger with aged Ribeye and New York strip. No amazing flavor or anything.   The truffle oil I got on the side though was amazing. Lol   My wife tried out the farmhouse burger, and she liked the juiciness of the burger as did I.

auhgRmlM-nmtVfatP7g9qA.text: if you want to go to a celebrity restaurant then I would recommend this place.  the price for burgers around $15-17 a piece then another $8 for fry's.   very good fresh juicy burgers.  recommend stopping by  tip: 3 or more people do not need to stand in line go straight to the podium and they will text you when your table is ready

03Tvl0JUJALX_yggLC8UoA.text: I had the hells kitchens burger and I was great. If you are a rewards meme we check in at the hostess and you can get in quicker if there is a wait

srAcSCqhIQRKSkGcy_NihA.text: Update: 10 stars for this place if I can give it!! They lost our ticket and we had to wait for over an hour. How does that warrant a 10 star rating? Both the manager and the waiter came to apologize. They comped the entire meal and even give us a shake to go! I highly recommend this place! We will definitely need back!!  P.s. shout out to our waiter Christian! You were amazing! We hope to see you soon!

I8kkvvBCW8BIiB_4ebugTw.text: We came here because a friend of ours recommended it saying their burgers were amazing. That being said, we went on a Thursday morning, right before they were about to open, at 11am, and already there was a line of at least 15 ppl waiting to be seated. Definitely come right at opening time if you don't want to wait, this place fills up fast.   I ordered the forest burger, which had duck bacon and mushrooms which was pretty good. Portion size, I actually expected their burgers to be a little bigger than what was given to me...but overall it was a good sized burger. Definitely tender and juicy. However, what I really loved about this place were the truffle Parmesan fries! One order was enough for 4 ppl..and we definitely asked for a side of extra truffle sauce!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The forest burger

VpG3VsJ2cw1KBB-03HrwrA.text: Recently tried this delicious burger place while out in Vegas. An absolute must stop if you are a fan of Gordon Ramsay and his delicious food. The line can be quite a wait but if you have a party of 4 or more can go by a bit quicker with preference for larger parties  Onto the food. I had one of the best burgers I've ever tasted in my life. Great quality meat and condiments. The ambience is amazing along with the friendly staff. Will def be checking this place out while in Vegas in the near future

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aIh7Z3ctpRWaBXQcHDyUhA.text: All I can say is "perfection"! I had the classic burger. It was juicy and delicious. My group and I shared the onion rings and truffle fries. The sauces and ketchup were tasty. The ketchup had some chipotle and I thought I didn't like that spice, but it was yummy there. I also had the salad with shrimp and apples. It had the perfect amount of dressing. The caramel shake was good too and I don't even like caramel very much. It is a little bit more expensive than other burger places in Vegas, and there are countless burger places these days, but the food is worth the price! Best burgers in Vegas!

uQbO_cOnwxY6etUoGy1BAg.text: The fries are Soggy. The quality of the burger is below average as the burger patty is a little dry when I ordered it to be medium cook. Red Robin burger is so much better.

3On7rTjwiZSHo1Vy2ta5IQ.text: I was so excited to take my mother in law and sister in laws to Burger on our girls weekend!! I had been a few times before, and it was always top on our list. We were seated and our waiter was great...at the start. But as soon as he realized we weren't ordering alcohol, we literally did not see him again. Another guy brought our food, which took forever (we saw everyone around us get their food before us), and our fries were forgotten. We were almost done eating by the time we got finally got the fries. I tried to flag our  waiter down to get him a check, and he said "what do you want?!?". Sheesh. Worst service EVER. Maybe the guy was having a really bad day, but honestly I will never return to burger.

o8cyEoSJGhrCVBB6RylqfQ.text: The wait time was good, the food was okay I had the fish sandwich very plain lacking in flavor my husband had the farmhouse burger it was good... the fries were a bit hard. I wouldn't come back again

NONesP6rJPQMuphi7tCe3A.text: This place is not all it's cracked up to be. For me less is more and this was just too much. The Burgers were dry, the sauces didn't make it any better because they were bland, and my sweet potato fries had powdered sugar on them. Also, the dessert menu is horrible, barely any selections. Go to In N Out if you want a REAL burger. Other than the food the customer service was great.

WDBK7RnbM5EImBgDLUEAfA.text: The best in town. Adrian, the kitchen manager, is incredible!! They have a great atmosphere with great music and we love going to BurGR. We go everyday we are in Vegas and have taken trips just to have BurGR. We are huge Gordon fans and feel you can't do wrong with the food. The Innis and Gunn is the best beer and they have it since it's Gordon's favorite beer. Worth the price and wait. Outstanding!!  Five stars!!

IQ_3yQZJ5C2h4T0JmZEP6A.text: Great burger! Great service! I will return, YES. I had avocado in my burger. I was SOLD! Plus, the server was very humorous and attentive. I know it's Just a burger.. I had a very pleasant experience at this place and I feel like giving five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_zAGkdIVMi8c-Oib4FbX1g.text: My boyfriend I went here as one of our first pit stops in Vegas the night we arrived.  We were so excited to get a Gordon Ramsey Burger and have some drinks.  First, the Manhatten that my boyfriend ordered wasn't drinkable there was so much Vermouth in it.  We sent it back and decided to go with beer....mistake too! He ordered a Brooklyn Lauger on tap and it was flat, no suds and the glass smelled.  The beer was skunk and tasted like those beers you got back in the day of HS.  Then, the burger came- was JUST ok and the onion rings were gross! To top this all off- not one drink was comp'd And bill was expensive.  Huge disappointment from a restauranteurs establishment that prides himself on quality!  I make better manhattans and burgers at home!  Bartender had no idea how to make any cocktails!  Manhatten was in a highball glass....

B56TQkfL8haBAX9wgQeEJw.text: If you like pork, hog burger is awesome. The line was very long, but worth it. I will back again

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eD9-OBjojhRnSdWdNA6fMg.text: Very good and different food paired with just the right combo of salty sweet and flavor packed dishes!  Only thing bad is the wait which is normally pretty long unless your a diamond or platinum then it's great but don't forget your iD

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse with eggs
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nacho average chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eclectic that&#39;s for sure

7gNVxPe2Crr-w7TlvRjKPw.text: One of my all time fav spots in Vegas! Even though i do not eat meat anymore, I went there for the Truffle fries. I ended up getting a Portabella burger too! It was AMAZING! Super juicy and flavorful! Did not miss the meat at all! The bun was perfect too! The burger stayed together without turning into a huge mess. Besides, they cooked it super fast and brought it to me within 10 minutes! Other people had to wait for their meat burgers to cook for over 25 minutes. The line to this place is always super long too, but it's totally worth it and moves pretty fast. Can't wait to come back to Vegas for Christmas and pay this place a few more visits! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

j9UoRqvHFpr_1uZZB_ha0g.text: Loved this place that was reasonably priced, great food with nice ambiance!  They accommodated our group of 14 with no contract or private room requirements.  I will go back when we're in. Grad next year!!

X8HvgYyOvJ6CpppbEj01Rg.text: After waiting a long time since we didn't have a reservation we were sat and the server came bye. Service was good but it was apparent that the kitchen was slammed and it took a long time to get our food. Kinda torn on how to describe the food. It was good but not great of which I was expecting.

VxhOWb0a2GQs7QSds8a9UA.text: Overpriced and not worth it. I had the Mediterranean burger which was not bad however the side of truffle Parmesan fries was huge and tasteless, I took the rest to go and took it home and added my own spices to it. For dessert I got the creme brulee shake. It tasted very bland and was a complete joke to be a dessert. Won't be coming back here again

pAFuTYPk6Qlk13VnwvScmQ.text: I found it mediocre at best. The burger was cold, bacon not crispy, fries truffle felt not fresh.  I felt dizzy as I left an hour ago, finally got to my room and got so sick I could barely stand to vomit.  I am not a drinker, so though in Vegas, I must be the only sober person around.  Those who rate above a star are comparing to McDonald.  Very very very upset.

3EigoSYvXpbwoZ-ncx-BPA.text: Very Good food... pricey, but a fun atmosphere. When you pay $16 it is only for the burger... fries $8 extra and onion rings is an extra $9... as long as you are prepared to pay, you'll enjoy your self. Staff seemed friendly and helpful!

8g4Zf9SsSzWRDcq8D2B0Kw.text: Can already see that this restaurant is way overrated and appropriately overpriced considering it's egomaniac namesake.  The process of checking in to request a table is unnecessarily slow, not to mention there are many open tables but the hostesses can't seem to get the customers in. Not that it seems like they care anything about a customer, too busy looking pretty.  The waitress also seemed uninterested in taking care of me, just going thru the motions. All of this is quite annoying and makes me rather uninterested in the upcoming burger I ordered. No matter what it tastes like it's highly unlikely I will ever return here. Okay the burger arrived, it looks outstanding and tastes okay. That's right, okay. It's big and juicy but lacks flavor. The fries are actually steak fries and they're very good, but served with a weird tasting homemade ketchup.  I'm glad I came here so it's no longer a mystery. What I can now say for certain is that Bobby's Burger Palace across the street is exponentially better in every aspect but most importantly Bobby's burger is far superior!

Fq_3_BfReunvQ-tDTKvTEQ.text: I was very disappointed for the service here. I am Gordom Ramsay fan and I do like Gordon restaurant but here I dont know. I came in at Gordon Ramsy Burger at Planet Hollywood to do some togo. The host who took our order gave us the worst service I have ever experience. She's not even gave us a menu until we ask. Her face was like, she didnt wanna take our order!??  She was super unfriendly. One star just for the service.

2hW1zyJLm3wA9TisEJMU5Q.text: Are we sure this is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant?! What a disappointment! Don't waste your time.  After waiting in line outside, I expected to walk in and see a cool vibe restaurant... nope!  Considering it's at the Planet Hollywood, expected a hip, young feel. Nope!  This place is 2 steps up from a Red Robbin.  Here's what we ordered: Poutine - Not the best. The flavor just lingered on in my mouth (and not in a good way). Onion Rings - So so. It was a different kind of batter.  Hell's Kitchen Burger - It was good Blue Cheeseburger - It was good Ultimate Cheeseburger - Not great   Crispy Cherry Pepper Chicken - Terrible. It had no flavor. I ended up sending it back. Literally 0 flavor to the chicken and it's not a battered crispy chicken. It's crispy because it's cooked skin on. Kind of gross!  Mediterranean Burger - Ordered this as a substitute for the chicken. The meat was tender but everything else was a mess. I literally scraped off the toppings and just ate the meat and buns by itself.  Parmesan Truffle Fries - Awful. It was disgusting! We barely touched it.   Half our meals were left on the plate. The only reason why I'm even giving it 2 stars is because the waiter was so pleasant and kind enough to switch out the chicken plate (which he suggested would be delicious).   We should have just gone to in-n-our lol. I can't believe this is a Gordon Ramsay establishment.  This was a terrible dining experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Cherry Pepper Chicken
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger

tftrHqINAnBM9Fd9Uy2AQg.text: Came here on Labour Day and it was almost 2 hours of wait time.  If you are coming here with 6+ people you have to go see the waitress to input your phone number so they can text you when your then us up. I came with a group of 6 people so when we received the text message that it was our turn they told us they are just cleaning the table now (that took 30 mins). We finally got seated down and the server was super nice, she got us drinks right away. We ordered our food and they asked us if we wanted all our items to come at the same time (which we opted for) and it took another 30 mins until we got to eat.   I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger and Just Fries. I asked for medium rare and low and behold, it came out medium rare! The burger was very juicy and you can really taste the jalapenos.   I'd come back to this restaurant again if I was in Vegas (but would definitely take note of how long the wait times are)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just Fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger

zpNIXfE2Y7hFCbUu9Q99wQ.text: If you're a party of three or more you should check in with the hostess and she'll tell you how long of a wait it will be and take down your number. You can then roam around and head back to the restaurant once you receive a text. Better than standing in line imo. The restaurant is plenty big so the wait wasn't too long. For a Sunday lunch Fourth of July weekend party of 3 waited for about 30 minutes.  I got the Hell's kitchen burger and it was delicious. Has a little bit of a kick to it. I am a big fan of avocado in burger and this one has plenty. I can do without the fries next time. They do have vegetarian options but they are limited.  Would come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s kitchen burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries, sweet potato fries, onion rings

imQlWWywTCYBZNrfY4jBcg.text: Gordon Ramsey's Burger, inside Planet Hollywood.  I was prepared to be disappointed ... and wasn't. We shared the Turducken Burger ($16) and the Hog Burger ($19), Beer Battered Onion Rings ($9), and Sticky Toffee Ice Cream Sandwich ($9). Everything was Great. No, really, it was Great.  Service was friendly, fast, and attentive (Thank You, Cristian!).  There was a 30-minute wait ... but we could see empty tables the entire time. Could Gordon be ... sneaky enough ... to deliberately keep us waiting, so his restaurant always has a line? I wouldn't put it past him, as a business strategy. Hmmmm.  Great Job, Gordon. Five Stars.

KQ1sZUzrkfQfeWoBPO-KUg.text: Food was 4 Stars. But the service was 1 star. After being so excited to come eat here. We was very disappointed in the service. Our Waitress name was Wendy and from the time we sat down she was grouchy. Here are some of the things that made us upset. Started with 1) we waiting 30 mins for our food and she didn't come back to check on us 2) we asked to keep on menu for keep sake and she just fling the menu on the table 3) we asked for ketchup and she gave us a look like "what the hell" 4) she was bending down to take another table's order and we saw her butt crack 5) the worst of all; my cousin ordered a medium well but when we got the burger it looked really pink. So we asked her if we can get it cooked longer. and she said no it is always red. And just walked away!!!!!! RUDE!!   When we got the bill we asked for her name. and after that...... she became nice. Wow right! Asking is if we needed a box. If we was doing okay. So after we went to the hostess desk to ask for a manager. And here comes Wendy with an eye on us. As we was talking to one of the girls asking for the manager. She buts in and asked if everything was okay...... (She knew we didn't like her service) Wow right. She was so rude!   Now another thing. When we asked for a manager, the front girls was giving us the run around on where he was. They didnt even know where he was. Basically there was no manager there. We ask 3 times if there was a manager There. The girls was stuck up and unwelcoming.   Not a place I would go again. Completely ruined my experience. Wanted to eat here and never again.   But flip side. The bus boy was super nice and smiling. The guy who brought out our food was really nice. We asked for ranch and he came back with it really fast. He also refilled out sodas with out us asking. And our glasses was not even empty and we had a fresh glass of soda.
