sS-yFSmHmM32DWqbpGws3g.text: The five stars are due mostly to their amazing Pork burger - the patty is ridiculously tender and juicy and it's absolutely loaded with flavor blasting toppings (BBQ pulled pork & bacon!). My parents and I return for this burger every chance we get.   Unfortunately, our other favorite dish (gooey fries) are no longer on the menu. We tried getting something similar, but it just wasn't as good. Bummer.   Hubby is quite a fan of their Oreo milkshake. I like it because it's topped with creme brulee. Lol. Yum!  Lines form early and often here. If you want to avoid a wait, get there before the rush!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FtPBkyzWRX6xhVyGk3qcEA.text: When you're in Vegas it's good to try this place at least once! First of all if you eat dinner just be prepared to wait 30-45 minutes due to so many people wanting to eat here. I've been here three times and all times were good and I don't even like burgers that much! But I am a die hard Gordon Ramsay fan so yeahh. My orders:   Forest burger: 5/5  Love this one! This is my go to burger - I love the mushrooms, quality of the meat (perfectly cooked), tasty, etc. it's also consistently good every time I come here.   Onion rings: 2/5  Ok not gonna lie onion rings were actually pretty salty and our whole group thought so. While I did like it it initially became hard to eat throughout the dinner because of all the oil and salt!   Fries: 3/5 Fries were also ok, it wasn't the softest but be sure to ask the curry ketchup! That actually made the fries better.   The most recent time I went here service was good, but they did forget to give us our appetizers (fries and onion rings) but they made it up by apologizing and comping it! so that was nice. Our waiter also catered to my demands as I did keep asking for extra onions and pickles and stuff and he made sure I got it!   The main reason I'm giving this place a 4/5 is cause their burgers are AMAZING (plus the curry ketchup) - our whole group thought so, but their appetizers are not the best. If I come back next time I'll just stick to the burgers.   I guess the weird thing is they give you refills of your drink before you're even done without you even asking. I mean it's nice but we actually didn't want more of the drink so we had like multiple cups of our soda LOL and overall it kind of wastes drinks but at least they're considering we might want refills LOL.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest burger!!! My favorite!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries - alright but ask for curry ketchup!!

gCeWzRCt06ZIg1ML-B2g1w.text: I mean... when in Vegas you go to a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, right!? This was my first time at Gordon Ramsay Burger and I was not disappointed! We started with some of the duck poppers and they were awesome. Duck confit stuffed into little red peppers fried with some seasoned breading, so good! The U.K. Burger was crazy, the whole time I couldn't help but think, "wow, this is literally as good as a burger gets". I'm usually one to try different things on the menu, but next time I'm back I don't think I'll be able to resist the U.K. Burger! It was my girlfriend's birthday when we visited and they brought out this amazing white chocolate parfait. I've never forced myself to eat something so slowly that I wanted to eat so quickly... I'm seeing a lot of comments about slow service in other reviews but that wasn't the case for us, our server was awesome!   The prices were reasonable (for vegas) and the wait wasn't too long, I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck Poppers!

hFq32mXMmZLJ6CJpGYZTfg.text: Given how many go-to restaurants I have in Vegas, it's hard to make time for a new place. But I did manage to run out of places to go to (or in the case of Palace Station's Oyster Bar, little desire to wait longer than 30 minutes for it) due to being in Vegas for six days. Gordon Ramsay Burger had been recommended to me by, of all people, my local BBQ joint in L.A. (shoutout Ray's Texas BBQ!). And my friends also vouched for it as such. So yeah, the time was right to give it a try!  A note about the line, which I read about ad nauseum on multiple reviews on Yelp and was somewhat of a deterrent for me coming earlier. We came on a Tuesday around 1:30 pm, and the line moved very quickly. Like, we got in like and 10 minutes later we sat down. Obviously we came at a time that wasn't as busy, but I've been told that it's easier to sit down for lunch instead of dinner. So there's that, for what it's worth.  Anyways, we came here because we wanted to eat some delicious food! There were many delicious burgers on this menu, but the Farmhouse Burger stood out to me because who doesn't love a fried egg in their burger??? I can safely say that I made the correct choice. Have your burger cooked medium rare for maximum taste! Also, we got the trinity of proper sides here: truffle parmesan fries, sweet potato fries, and onion rings. All of them were great, but those truffle parmesan fries are TO DIE FOR! Would come back just for the fries (but yes, the burger is great too obviously).  And somehow, we had room for dessert! Had the sticky toffee pudding ice cream sandwich. It was the perfect way to cap our meal.  Service was great, no complaints here.  Overall had a great experience at Gordon Ramsay Burger. Would definitely come back, provided I don't have to wait in a very long line.

8o01ZuQarTRHhnTfRPbxSg.text: If you're ever in Vegas, I highly recommend coming here. There's no gimmicks or extra costs for giggles or because you're in Vegas. Everything me n my bf had in this place was 117% worth it!   We had the classic burger, and the stout burger, paired with truffle fries and an oreo creme brulee milkshake. I had expectations, but they were completely blown out of the water by the food. Everything was melt in your mouth. I felt like i was flying. Me n my bf kept looking at each other and giggling after each bite cuz it was so good that the waiter had to ask if we were ok.   Gordon is a freakin genius and this place is definitely my go to in vegas from now on.

zt2YHkncTYNOCMeaWDo9fA.text: Great burgers with huuuuge potion! Gordon Ramsay's videos of cooking are feasts for eyes, and so is this restaurant. Fancy environment and good service.

ADPb6tpRmV48N91QqNAwOQ.text: Came here for lunch on a Wednesday the place was packed at 11:45am.  Had a 5 minute wait so not to bad.  We ordered the truffle fries, a farmhouse burger cooked medium and a shrimp/lobster patty burger.  For dessert we order the butter pecan milkshake.  The presentation on all of these dishes was outstanding.  The truffle fries served was decent portion served with ketchup-curry and a mustard aioli.  The fries were good had the earthy flavor you expect from truffle.  The farmhouse burger is in my top 5 all time for burgers, the burger was cooked perfectly medium.  The bun had a wonderful flavor with a nice sweet glaze.  The over easy egg compliments the burger well and the bacon was outstanding.  The shrimp-lobster burger was excellent I could tell when I was eating the lobster versus the shrimp.  The bun was outstanding as well and, I loved the Asian aioli and pickle that comes with it, compliments the seafood patty perfectly.  All n all an absolutely wonderful experience and meal, would definitely come back.

FVjM38sNShycdeP7Sl_bfA.text: Wow Gordon really does have great food!   The entrance was so interesting, lit up with fire across the windows. The wait was not that bad for 5 people around 2pm!   I ordered the Mediterranean burger (lamb) with an order of truffle fries! The wait time for my meal was around 30 minutes.   Out comes the burger and upon appearance, it was very attractive. My first bite and it was so soft and cooked medium rare  it was honestly one of the best burger I've had. It was not heavy at all, I finished the whole thing.

pEMxAHG5FyfIUGiuuNB7bg.text: "If you know anything about me, you know I love few things more than big, new, unusual, comes from somewhere else, mutant versions of the giant hamburger."  Anthony Bourdain  A little piece of me dies when a restaurant on The Strip doesn't take reservations. Oh well. We put our names down and walked over to Bellagio to watch the fountain show. Before we knew it, we were back at the hostess stand to wait some more for our table to be cleaned. An hour and a half later...  I ended up sharing half a Foie Burger and half a Shrimp & Lobster Burger and some Truffle Fries. I don't know if we were starving or what but everything was delicious! The Foie Burger was cooked a perfect medium rare and it was so juicy. My friends got The Hell's Kitchen Burger and The Hog Burger (featured on Buzzfeed's Worth It and was Steven's Worth It winner). Not a single person was upset with their meal. The size of the burger is a good size -- not too big and not too small. As for the truffle fries, they were super tasty. They were great with the aioli and it was good with the curry ketchup we got on the side. You can definitely share one order of fries between two people. It was hefty meal and I definitely left feeling full.  I'm kinda mad about how good Gordon Ramsay Burger is! Even after eating the burgers, I was thinking about all the other burgers but that wait time at GR Burger ain't cute. :(

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hog Burger (Featured on Buzzfeed&#39;s &#34;Worth It&#34;).

3t1DD_oLaHOQVlgigHPSlw.text: So many great options for interesting Burger combinations I had the Forest Burger Medium Rear , This beast includes Soft and Tasty Bun, Forest Mushrooms that look like magic Mushrooms ( turned out it wasn't the Magic kind), Duck Bacon and Arugula , Some kind of Aioli as a Moisturizing element  The Burger made Perfectly , Juicy and Moist ( Great Combination btw)  Don't forget the Fries , Sweet Potato or Regular  Both excellent , Oh and Onion Rings too  There are many Beer Options and other Alcoholic and non Alcoholic drinks   Waiting time, for 2 Guests you will need to wait in line , Groups of 3 and more, sign in with receptionist get a pager and wait for your page ( I waited 20 Minutes, cost me extra $40 that i lost in the slot machines while waiting)   Have Fun

RaloOS47CeHsp4dPXwO_GQ.text: I would never admit it out loud but I kinda have a man-crush on Gordon Ramsay... That blonde hair, those blue eye, that British accent, and the way he calls people an "idiot sandwich!" 23 out of 10 would marry the guy and become Michael Ramsay.   Even though I have been to Vegas 50+ times, I have yet to go to any of his eateries. Maybe I had a fear of being disapointed by my man-crush but I never stepped foot into his restaurants until this last trip with some friends and the wife. They didn't accept reservations so we must have waited almost two hours for a table but it was worth the wait. I got the Shrimp & Lobster Burger and my wife got the Foie Burger. We ended up trading halves and sharing some truffle fries on the side.   That first bite had me pee-in-my-pants ecstatic. It was like the ocean punched me right in the kisser! And that Foie Burger! Holy mooing cow! So juicy and flavorful. All those times I was here in town and missing out on putting some Ramsay in my mouth. Dang it! I threw a dirty look at the wife for us having gone to her celebrity crush's "Burger Palace" and being disappointed. Her and her ginger-crush can marry each other because I'm loyal to Ramsay.  In all seriousness, they make a bloody good burger here. Stop by and fall in love with Gordon Ramsay. Burgers so good it'll give you gout!

0X6SadQsXXKk-FvfZmKjug.text: The sweet potato fries were delicious, they have a bit of a sweet topping on them. The burger I got had beef, cheese, butter lettuce, onions and tomato, and was good and was very filling. I personally liked the Greek Quinoa Salad more than the burger though, but I'm not so much a burger girl.   The only thing about this place that was awful both times I went was the terrible service. The first time I went there it took about 45 minutes for our food to come and it took us letting about three different waiters and the manager know about the situation. The next time I went there I ran into the same issue where my food took extremely long to come out and on top of it the table next to me was also very frustrated with the poor service.

_JzW6rtB-BvDpkGt52Cy9g.text: Man I was SO excited to eat here again after a fantastic meal two years ago! _KmpVhqBHTYCM75jzsN8Ig.text: So I went here for the first time about a week ago, I ordered the hella kitchen burger. The burger was probably insanely well cooked cause the meat was a different type of beef which tasted good but the onion rings that we added was way over battered! And let alone the SERVER didn't tell us that the FRIES are an extra charge... a 9$ charge... like that's a big difference.  We ended up getting a creme brulee milkshake for 10$ and it was honestly not the best... ID PREFER A DQ MILKSHAKE ALL DAY! We also ordered the chicken wings which came out insanely well honestly probably the BEST WINGS I've ever had!! But that made the whole meal so I Wasted the fries wasted the shake only ate the burger and spent around 65$ on the meal I would only order a select number of options and the guest service wasn't that great.. very close to other people eating and server hovered over waiting for bill and for us to decide for order...

Od7eijP_3FU2INNa8JlYTQ.text: This is up in the "last meal" category for me. Ordered the blue cheese burger and my companion got the ultimate cheeseburger. Split an order of the truffle fries and the onion rings. I'm really not a fan of onion rings, but this is a "must order." Perfectly crisp and battered and the sauces for both the rings and fries are amazing. I really enjoyed the curry ketchup. The burgers are quite large, cooked to perfection, bun is perfect, and the toppings work perfectly to create an amazing bite each time. I recommend ordering a hefeweizen and you will be in food heaven. Yes, there is a line to get in. Yes, it is not the cheapest place. It is worth it. Just go.

u6Sy-KH-0orDhHrHPzH5eg.text: Gordon Ramsey restaurant located in the Planet Hollywood Casino.  The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is because the restaurant does not take reservations. I tried to find here on a Sunday night and the line was about a block long with a 2 hour wait. I came back on a Monday night and waited about 20 minutes for a table.  The prices are very reasonable for being on the strip. Burgers are between $15-$24. Everything is a la carte so fries are purchased separately; however, you can easily share an order of fries.   Our food was delivered to our table super fast. I had the Ultimate Cheeseburger and it did not disappoint. The truffle fries were equally amazing.  I will definitely be back on days with a short line.

ec5Gd4QWMOwJGO5vXBe0CA.text: Always wanted to try it, but never wanted to wait in line.  Finally on this trip we decided to stand in line.  Not too bad on a Monday for lunch.  about 20 minutes later we had a table.  It is really loud inside, but the seats are super comfortable.  Waitress came immediately and took drink order.  We then ordered and she suggested we get fries immediately since burgers would take 20-25 minutes.  Good suggestion.  Fries were excellent and quantity was good.  I had the Blue Cheese Burger and it was excellent, but I think it had too much blue cheese.  The bites with no blue cheese (or less) were much more enjoyable.  Wife had the Crown Burger and it was also good.  We left full and satisfied.  Prices not too bad for lunch on the strip.  Usually cheaper to eat, than gamble.

gubbTf-jTZiCVPmscaD-LA.text: I've recently became a Gordon Ramsey fan  and when We were in Vegas for a weekend I knew I had to stop by @ one of his restaurants. I just had to. And so our flight was a bit late We decided on Gordon Ramsay Burger. It is perfectly located next to the Paris Hotel inside Planet Hollywood,so we didn't have to go far and do a whole lot of walking. The wait wasn't very long even though there was a huge line.  Needless to say, it was well worth it.   I ordered his Blue Cheeseburger.  It is out of this world. Seriously one of the best burger ever!!! Kid u not the 7 ounce meat patty melts in ur mouth so incredibly flavorful and savory.  Not too big and not too small, and defiantly  not for sharing lol. And with all the other ingredients that came with it, arugula, spicy mayo, fig jam..... OMG my mouth waters. It's cooked to perfection, let's get that right (as Ramsay would say hehe).   Finished off my meal with a blood orange creamsicle. Excellent way to close off my pallets. It's just the right amount of sweetness and all the added "dots" around the plate is a must.  U have to literally clean off ur plate while u eat this creamsicle. It's a popsicle on a plate that has been elevated to a whole other leve. (Hehe another a Ramsay saying).  oh......btw..... the chocolate caramel crunch is to die for.  Just sayin'

tFP9HgZjbQp8Mbng4HkTPw.text: Loved this restaurant!!! I give it Six Gold Stars.   Being alone standing on a long line, I volunteered to be seated quickly at the bar rather than wait for a table. The service was immediate and friendly.   I first ordered has the hummus for an appetizer, which was superb. For the main meal, I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger with asadero cheese, avocado, roasted jalapenos, roasted , and jalapeno aioli. It was cooked to perfection.  I can honestly say that this was among the top quality burgers I ever had in my life!  Highly recommended!

wHpS2EPpvFGRRsUqb7OeTw.text: Absolutely terrible service. Servers were incredibly disrespectful. The food might be nice but the vibe of the restaurant left a bad taste in my mouth. I hope Mr. Ramsay chooses some new workers. However Thomas was a delight. Hire more workers like Thomas

yPniKVZ8wezmuGf2z9q_fg.text: I expected to like but not love this celebrity-chef-marketed moneymaker.  But it was truly innovative and satisfying.  Right to the food: - Burnt Ends Poutine.  Poutine is pretty fantastic as it already is.... but could it be made better by the addition of fatty pastrami??  YES is the answer.  The only problem is that this thing is huge and we filled up on it which made us appreciate the burgers less (which was OK because they were still epic as leftovers a few hours later).  Oh right, the burgers: - Farmhouse: yes a classic, make sure someone orders it. But there were some innovative (or optimized versions of previous idea) burgers that are really worth the visit: - Lobster and shrimp: perfect for the pescatarian in your group it comes out piping hot with some interesting sauce. - Hog Burger: instead of burger meat they use various rich fatty hog parts... bring an appetite though.  Too much poutine and you'll barely be able to do any damage!  Oh, and the cherry on the sundae was that GR himself actually showed up, toured the kitchen, and sat at a table where his security selectively let only some people say hi to him.  (It was a Sunday afternoon around 4pm.  We asked our server if this was a common situation and she said he stops by at random times, but more such times recently as he is working on Hell's Kitchen across the street.)  Maybe you'll get lucky.

scsSFEjHvBzMNm9Fcmr6iA.text: Ah, Gordon Ramsay Burger - the serviceable alternative for customers who don't have the budget for Gordon Ramsay Steak, or the time and patience for Hell's Kitchen. Ever since I got into food during my college days (go Bears!), I have always wanted to visit Gordon Ramsay Burger along the Las Vegas strip. For years, the image of a "perfectly" cooked burger that was invented by the renowned chef pilfered the inner chambers of my mind. If I could just have one nibble, I'd be set for life... And finally, a couple weeks ago I actually had the opportunity to visit Gordon Ramsay Burger on a quick trip to Sin City. After a night of amazing steak at BLT (yelp.com/biz/blt-steak-l...), my girlfriend and I followed it up by getting gourmet burgers for lunch. Gordon Ramsay Burger was found right at the front entrance of the Planet Hollywood Casino, smack dab in the middle of the strip. It was definitely a good idea to come for lunch around noon because we ended up having to wait just around 15 minutes in line. I highly suggest going with a party of 2 or fewer during lunch time, otherwise you'll have to call ahead and maybe wait much longer than you'd want. Despite the name recognition, Gordon Ramsay Burger was just a tad more than your typical casual burger joint. On top of the at least 17 (so many!!!) different burgers, this restaurant also served the usual assortment of scrumptious-sounding snacks, soups, salads, and desserts. When it came to the burgers, you could tell that this had "Gordon Ramsay" written all over it. There were ones that had curry, foie gras, and even lobster! Cost here was a bit pricey as you'd expect from something in Las Vegas, with most burgers going for around $16-$17 (doesn't include fries). My girlfriend and I ended up getting the Hell's Kitchen and Crown Burgers. Here's what we thought of the experience: -- WORLD-CLASS BURGERS, BUT SOME FLAWS -- Don't get me wrong. We've never had burgers like the ones here - even at the best joints in California. The complex flavors, amazing textures ... it was glorious. But there were a lot of nitpicky things we personally didn't like. 1. Hell's Kitchen Burger (8/10): What I really loved about the Hell's Kitchen Burger were that the jalapenos had lots of fire, the avocado was fresh, and man the meat was cooked PERFECTLY! And one of the best parts to me, actually, was the bun. It was toasted well, plus the sesame seeds added an extra layer of crunch. However, it really bothered me that this burger was heavily lacking in sauce (where that aioli at??). Furthermore, the roasted tomatoes were extremely salty. Every bite offered an explosion of sodium-filled juice that overwhelmed the burger. Not bad, but so close... 2. Crown Burger (8/10): On my girlfriend's end, she felt very similarly about her Crown Burger. Though the arugula added a great crunch to a delicious patty of meat, she also echoed my sentiments about the lack of sauce and the saltiness of the tomatoes. Like me, she expected more. -- SUPER CASUAL, TOURISTY ATMOSPHERE -- This place definitely had a great vibe for a chill meal. Lighting was good, tables were spacious enough, and I loved the comfortable seating. However, I thought it was geared WAY TOO MUCH towards tourists. Gordon Ramsay's picture was everywhere, his products were up for sale at the front, and the flames by the window that started out as a great marketing material became more of an attention-grabber later on. -- EXCESSIVELY SLOW SERVICE -- For a very relaxed setting, you'd expect the food to come out pretty promptly. I mean, we weren't inside a five star steakhouse. But sadly, we ended up waiting almost 30 or so minutes before our food came out. Lots of nice people, but too slow for our liking. If I had to put my finger on where Gordon Ramsay Burger would rank in regards to the top burger eateries I've ever had, it most likely wouldn't be at the top. Considering all factors - the food, price, atmosphere, and service - I'd say that this place is worth a visit in Vegas but definitely not worth dropping all your things for. I give it a "Nice-su, you can take your parents here and they'll be happy" rating. Eat well and prosper,

uZC-tAiAjzS62OXgUksI5A.text: Me and my friends came here for dinner on Monday. We waited an hour which was expected since it was a busy night. The service was pretty good and the waiter that served us was friendly and gave us some recommendations for my friends who couldn't decide what to pick. I ordered the Farmhouse burger for myself. It's good but I found the patty to be a little bland and flavorless but it was still quite juicy. I won't be coming back again but for the experience it was pretty nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sI5ZGp0JAi_Ew9OnljMjhA.text: After my friend and I went to a popular buffet shown on Buzzfeed, we decided to take our food adventures up a notch by going to Gordon Ramsay Burger!   We went here for an early lunch and chose this place because of the famous chef. We arrived around 11am and there was no wait. I got the farmhouse burger and my friend got the forest burger and we also ordered truffle parmesan fries to share. My burger was good, but nothing too special about it. Maybe I didn't think it was super special in flavor because I chose a simple burger since my friend liked the burger she chose a lot. Both of us loved the truffle fries and the sauces which comes with it. The fries were placed in a cute cone-shaped container stand with sauces on the side.   The presentation of our food was very neat, which I appreciate since I tend to get bored of food when the presentation looks messy. I'd recommend this place if you want to try a unique burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries

7Cpk4j_bEd3J82QOMLiSWQ.text: What a disappointment.  Let me start by saying that my wife and I are big Gordon Ramsay fans and we have been to this place 3 times before.  Each time was good except for this last (4th) time on July 1st, 2019.  Gordon sets high expectations and therefore, it is fun to see how his restaurants run.  This is what we noticed this time.    First thing we notice was there was no more Jalapeno Poppers, (WTF!!!!) who made that decision?  Instead now they have red pepper duck/ creamy type of poppers -- don't buy them they are a waste.  We also used to like their truffle fries.  Once again they were disappointing as they were undercooked.  Keep in mind this place isn't cheap.  No big deal.   My wife and I ordered the same burger which is the Hells kitchen burger (not sure of the exact name right now but its the first one on the burger list-- clearly one that they are proud of).    As we wait for the burger which takes a while, my wife notices a few blonde waitresses who are handling food, walking around with their hair down and constantly running their fingers through it.  Not sure what their policy is but all the other girls had their hair in a bun which seems much more professional and clean.  No big deal we just had to watch out for and be mindful that there may be some blonde hairs in our food.    Biggest disappointment was the burger.  We ordered it medium rare because that's what we like.  the burger comes out and sure enough it is medium rare as we can see some pink in the middle.  The only weird thing about this burger was that it was dry AF (As Freak).  How do you have a medium rare burger that is dry? I could literally cut the burger down the middle and no juice came out AT ALL.  I had to dip it in some left over sauce from the fries.    So here's the break down of the price v.s. what we ordered.  Two burgers, one order of fries, one order of red pepper poppers, one Bloody Mary, one glass of water = $104.18.  I understand its Vegas but I like paying for something good and this was far from it. This is the last time we eat here.    By the way our waitress was very nice and she deserves a 4 .  Save your money and go to the Wynn buffet (I'll write a review about that later).  While in Vegas we also went to the Gordon Ramsay restaurant inside the Cesars Palace.  I'll write a review about that as well but once again be ware. These Ramsay restaurants are not the same as before.

TA2EzkBgvpJbcsfv2vV49g.text: Great service and food. Wait time wasn't to long given that when we had gotten there the line was all the way to the extreme lounge, but there is a board that says to visit the front of party is 3 or more. Most definitely will be coming back, and hopefully visiting the second location of Hell's Kitchen

wa8TReZwxNXtJRLJFgtpYQ.text: Only place we spent the money. Burgers were delicious. Worth the money? I think ehhh.. had better, but they were delicious. Onion rings were also delicious, but had better at Goodwood Bbq. Drinks were good. Expensive, but refreshing. We went when Vegas was in the 90's!Long line, but they got us in pretty fast. Our server was amazing, but all the girls? Geesh.. they need to eat a burger! Skinny lil things. Would I eat here again if I was in Vegas? Probably not, but it was a good burger when we were there.

a0LZioJurNuVH5FukAjgYA.text: Party of three. Ate here last night for dinner. Took a while to get seated even though we saw a lot of open tables. Asked if we could sit at the bar and they said no because that's part of their seating. Thought that was weird.   We had a strange waitress. First. She was insanely annoyed when we didn't order drinks. She just walked off once we said that. She only came back to bring us food and to give us a check. She didn't come by to check on how our table was doing or if we needed anything.   I ordered hellfire wings and corn dip. The hellfire wings were cold by the time the food got to us. Honestly, I've had better wings at BDubs. The corn dip was good. The buttery popcorn was definitely weird. It says it's like Mexican street corn. That is incorrect. It didn't taste anything like street corn.   My friend got the veggie burger patty and her burger was also cold.   Only one person got food that was still hot.   My friend with the veggie burger got sick to her stomach last night after dinner. I was sick to my stomach this morning when I woke up.   Definitely won't be going to anymore burger joints by Gordon Ramsay.   The only good experience so far is Hell's Kitchen by Caesar's. Go there. Don't bother with the burger joints

quFb9XJkEXilssNLD8PI7A.text: It was definitely exciting going to a Gordon Ramsey Burger restaurant. If you are a fan of Gordon Ramsey I would say give it a try but expect to pay more than usual for a burger.The burgers are good I would have expected amazing considering it's Ramsey, the biggest critic their is. The fish burger though was the winner of the night, the onion strips and sauce really did it for me.

WQa9J6MktcjgRxnZA6lA8Q.text: Not a bad spot to get a burger. I've been here a couple of times. The consistent highlights are the milkshakes. Specifically the Oreo Milkshake with Creme Brulee topping is possibly the best milkshake I've ever had. It's small and expensive, but we're in Vegas so it's worth every penny.  The burgers themselves are pretty good too. The Hell's Kitchen burger is spicy and balanced whereas The Crown burger I found to be over seasoned and a bit bland otherwise. The burger buns stand on their own though. They're soft and pillowy but also sturdy and soak up the burger juices without falling apart. They're buttery and have a good flavor from the sesame seeds. A perfect bun really.  The fries are pretty blah. I've had better many places. I like my fries crisp on the outside and soft in the middle and I feel like these lack a bit on the outside crispiness. The poutine is OK if you like mushrooms, though I've had better back home.  So if you're a Ramsay fan stop here and grab a Hell's Kitchen and shake!

1Kg_2ZW9qmGXnAJMjfhh7Q.text: This place is a decent average burger for Vegas prices. Nothing need to frequent but decent. I will note service was not very attentive and we asked for ranch since the ketchups were atrocious and were  told they didn't have any left because they THREW IT ALL AWAY pre closing time. We couldn't finish our fries due to lack of ranch. The menu is trying too hard to be hip and trendy. No one needs duck liver thank you.

sN7-fb40l0ZYTYCLvrDmeQ.text: I went here on a Sunday night at around 9. The place was super busy and Poppin but it was worth the 40 minute wait. The service was fantastic and the servers are attentive and friendly. The atmosphere was semi casual and very clean.   The food: My girlfriend ordered the forest burger. She says it was amazing and the mushrooms were fresh and the patty was cooked to perfection.  I ordered the crown burger and the aioli was great with the meat. I added bacon and it was crispy and flavorful.  We both agreed that the buns were the best component as they were fluffy and had some good sesame seeds on top.   The truffle fries and aioli were the best things I've ever eaten. I would die for those fries.  The only negatives were the patties themselves as they were a tad underseasoned, but the ingredients and buns help with that.   Overall: if you like burgers and Gordon Ramsay, this place is worth the wait and the moderate pricing. However if the novelty of a celebrity chef isnt your shtick, you might not be too impressed

am72Uz6KHbjxRDxriCk5Hw.text: One of the best burgers that I have ever had in my LIFE! Believe the tails of Las Vegas, you will never forget it. There are so many flavors that were going on in my mouth, not a party but a riot! Mind blowing bbq flavor and after eating this density of a burger you will say yes to a light walk! Now let's not ask for the check before,....you guessed it finishing that great paired beer. Blue moon was the one with this one. An IPA too hoppie for a burger this dense. Burger was the pork burger wrapped in bacon (you already know my weakness) topped with pulled pork. The pork butcher deluxe is what I call it! Gordon, your welcome.   Keep it fresh and clean (hands that is) with a cut down the middle. Sit back take it in...1...2...3 NOW ask for the check and treat yourself to a walk on the strip maybe a little gamble dessert at the blackjack table followed by a nap.   Overall, you can't go wrong with this place just get in before dinner time 5pm because it gets crowded. Don't forget, TYS, always!!!

4D95wjqHhMCDId2aELVIHQ.text: Expect it to be very busy! If you have a party of 3 or more, walk up to the hostess without waiting in line and inquire your reservation. There is also a sign with its instructions too if you did wait in line like me without reading the huge prints!! Lol the line is only lent for parties of 2 or less. When you request your reservation from the hostess, they ask for a contact number to send you a text when the table is ready for seating. Usually takes about 30 minutes wait time to get our table, so just stick around the area and/or do a little shopping.   I love the seating arrangements. There's quite a few bar areas and good lighting especially if you're next to the glass wall of fire .  Let's talk about their menu! It's like a British flag  that unfolds like an origami!! Lol jk more or less.   Now let me talk about the service! Gordon Ramsay trained their crew perfectly, cuz when you talk gourmet burger, my tastebuds felt gourmet expectations lol All the servers are very keen on our needs and all ways checked back on our table for feedback.   I purchased a Forest Burger = tremor cheese, forest mushrooms, duck bacon $15, Farm House Burger = dublinar cheese, mangalitsa bacon, fried egg $15, and Sweet Potato Fries $8.   I'll end this review with a famous quote, "why did the chicken cross the road? Because it was way too f@#%*ing undercooked!" - Gordon Ramsay

hW4TxPbPgqLg7rU8UlTIoA.text: The burgers are as good as they look. Expect the long line because of the popular brand name and tourists. I waited for 40 minutes in line. For the service part, either it needs to be improved or add more staffs since it's always busy and the waiter/waitress doesn't care much.

3lH2Gb8JgeUz1ZexFNmhJw.text: We went there  for lunch, we had to wait 15 minutes to seated. Nice sitting and environment. We ordered the truffle fries ( was good), lobster and shrimp burger ( was ok but too greasy) and the hells's kitchen burger ( I loved the bun and the burger too) but the I had better burgers, I was expecting more from Gordon Ramsay. It is quite expensive, average $16 for a burger sandwich. But overall, good experience.

lEvLT9cDscnQoTk2pHgiNQ.text: Located in the Miracle Mile Shopping Center by Planet Hollywood, Las Vegas the restaurant doesn't disappoint.  My son and I were here for a basketball tournament and wanted some place close to the hotel.  Yes it is a burger joint but it is definitely much better.  My son ordered the Ultimate Cheeseburger which had aged provolone, dubliner and Boursin.  Which he proclaimed as the "best burger" ever in his young life.  I ordered the Forrest Burger which had tremor cheese, seasonal forest mushrooms, arugula, duck bacon.  The burger didn't disappoint and was well worth it.  Yes, the burger is more expensive than a regular burger joint but the quality of ingredients and most important the taste of everything ordered was worth it.  FYI, everything is a la carte.  We ordered the Beer Battered Onion rings which were equally incredible.  The chesse coating topping the onion rings and the chipotle ketchup and cheddar ranch sauce were great compliments to the rings.  The "Just Fries" which were good but I thought the contrast of the two different ketchups made it interesting as I have never had curry ketchup before.   Compliments to Chef Ramsay and his management team.  The staff was well trained, courteous, and on point. When our "Just Fries" came out cold, I mentioned it to Ashley our server and she returned in a flash with a set of fresh hot fries.  The restaurant is clean, with a bar and numerous TV's to watch games.  It is a little loud.  The menu has vegetarian options as well.  I mentioned this as my wife who wasn't with me would ask.  If you appreciate the taste of your food, eat here.  If your interested in the volume of food and not the taste, this isn't your restaurant. I definitely will be back on my next trek to Las Vegas.

62mCxu3ceBl8-eZmbt1ICg.text: The burgers are great! Believe the hype! But the wait is not fun.You literally have to wait in line. You can't just check in and sit somewhere. We waited about 40 min standing then got seated and waited another 45 min for our food and it was only for two of us. The service is great but it takes long. So don't come starving. And it is very pricey for how simple the food is here.

gc9nwnWdZgHCZY1IQWhsJg.text: I am a diehard fan of Gordon Ramsay and just recently stayed at Planet Hollywood where this restaurant is located. Of course there was a line upon arrival, but it moved quickly and I was told by the hostess that the wait would only be around 15 minutes. Not bad for dinner. The inside of the restaurant is nice and clean and the servers are friendly! My daughter and I both ordered the Backyard burger which was very tasty and plentiful we also added a side of fries!   All in all I was not disappointed at all and would return again the next time I am in Vegas!

fckgfvvUz1mG9VTNxbTQQQ.text: I came here with my family excited to try the burgers everybody was taking about. We ordered the lobster shrimp burger which turned out to be undercooked and gave my husband food poisoning which made him have chills and stomach pain. The burgers overall were way too salty and undercooked even when we asked specifically for well done burgers. The breaded layer on the onion rings fell off in tasteless clumps and the fries were salty. Hopefully Gordon Ramsey checks up on this place because he wouldn't be proud.

2stjvyoCFhRILyE7V-c-_w.text: This place is a must when in Vegas. They serve amazing food. The only issues we had was the long wait. It's first come first serve so no reservations aloud. We wait for over an hour to be seated. The young lady kept telling us about 30-45 minutes. After almost an hour she told us could be another 45 minutes. This was the frustrating part. She told me the kitchen got behind and that they stopped seating people so they could catch up. Appeared to be very disorganized. Not something you would expect from Gordon Ramsey restaurants. Other then the long wait the food was absolutely delicious. The black garlic Caesar salad was the best I have ever tried. Definitely a must but be ready for the line and long wait times.

Lots of empty tables while a line is outside. Fan of Gordon Ramsey but he needs to retrain the employees at this location.

2YkE8Yuey5CMG7xS24uBcQ.text: Great burgers, fries, and shakes.  Employees were incredibly friendly and attentive. Our server was excellent, he did a great job explaining everything to us and we never had to ask for anything. Our water cups were always full. He had a great personality. Their burgers are made with quality ingredients and you can taste the difference. The bun held everything together and was fresh. The meat patty was juicy and seasoned well. Their fries are also cooked to perfection. Our shakes were amazing and was a meal in itself. I highly recommend getting one and sharing it. The shake, burger, and fries was a lot. You can also share the fries too, their portions are generous. The ambiance is relaxed.   Good stuff!

3jF9zDnOAn3S50UoxUJ6iA.text: They don't take reservations, but they do text you when your table is ready. So put your name on the list, then walk around Planet Hollywood to gamble, people watch on the strip, shop in Miracle Mile, or get a drink at their bar while you wait for your table.   It's kid friendly, casual, and not insanely priced. You still get a taste of "Gordon Ramsay" without breaking the bank. Everything is a-la-carte, so fries are extra. But one order of fries is enough for two people to share, and you can choose from several different types of fries, so it makes sense.   All of our food (and drinks) came out quick and hot. The hostess, server, food runners, and bussers worked well together making sure that all tables were taken care of in a timely manner. Out of the 4 of us, we all left full and happy!

rlitWuHsShC9zObhhs0X8w.text: If you're in Vegas and on the strip and you're in the mood for a good burger, definitely visit Planet Hollywood! There's always a line but it moves quickly. I think I waited for about 15 minutes.  The Blue Cheeseburger which has blue cheese, fig jam, arugula, cider vinegar reduction and spicy mayo is a must! Pair it with some truffle fries. Our service was great, he answered every question we had and was super knowledgable about the menu.  The food took a while, but that was a little expected since the place was packed. KLGRwNwuK7NrcxCj9KBkVA.text: I came here on a Thursday afternoon for a late lunch. Gordon Ramsay Burger is located inside of the Planet Hollywood hotel. There always seemed to be a line in the evening (7pm-8pm). There were four of us and we were able to snag a table immediately at 5pm. The staff here are great, very attentive and constantly refilling our drinks without us even having to ask :)  I had high expectations since this is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant and I was not disappointed. I ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger which comes with asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes and jalapeno aioli. This was one of the best burgers I have ever had, I loved the spiciness of the roasted jalapenos and jalapeno aioli and the bun was perfectly toasted. The burger itself was cooked medium well per my request, the meat was juicy, not overcooked and dry. There is a huge variety of burgers on the menu so if you are not a fan of spice, there are many other options. I also ordered the Truffle Parmesan Fries to share as a table. The fries were perfectly cooked and I loved the flavors. The burger is very filling so sharing the fries as a table was ideal.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant and I plan on coming back on my next trip to Vegas. The prices are super reasonable for a high end burger created by Gordon Ramsay :)

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Fries

W09PUMR0MQIKaL69bHiW_Q.text: I may be a little biased because Gordon Ramsay is an idol of mine, but I try to come here every time I go to Vegas. I've had the signature hog burger and the forest burger. Both were awesome. I get the truffle aioli fries on the side. Save room for the creme brulee shake for dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar Ale Soup
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The forest burger. Mushrooms and duck bacon on this burger were delicious.

Za7KTPp1zy42vtY4jUn_Lg.text: AMAZING service with great attentiveness and humor, and food was surprisingly great! We are local, and will soon return. Custom burger with fried egg is usually hard to find. GR has em!

ymMRiNkhqLH5Hu05QLthIA.text: Gordon Ramsay Burger never disappoints! Got the hogs burger tastes like pork , shredded pulled pork, bbq, and cheese amazing. Loved truffle fries and Oreo milkshake is a must.

30cGxHUYpB3N1B0hDCxh-A.text: I really enjoy the crab popper and that was about it. Got the Hell's Kitchen burger and the folie burger and it was very plain. Only the cheese gave it favor. The Bloody Mary was $16, the folie burger was $22, the Hell's Kitchen burger was $17, and the fries were $9. The duck popper was the best thing and the only thing I would buy again. Definitely too high of a price. Our totally for these items came to be $87 and we tipped $15 on top. Not for the food but for the service. Definitely a one time thing only. I rather eat at McDonald's as it have more favor. The only favor from these burgers came from the cheese. Not worth it in my opinion.

ehIApXZouj54_5xfS7a5-g.text: Had the Cheeseburger, Hot Dawg and onion rings. Hamburger was perfectly made and the hot dawg is a must!  The onion rings were too greasy. I'd stick ti the parmesan fries that were much better.

ioyq0g7Dlp0PZ0RjwxRAow.text: A burger is a burger. The wait for a table wasn't bad, and the service was good. We just weren't big fans of the burgers. The Hells' Kitchen Burger was okay. The turducken burger was different. The flavors were uneven. The marinade for the duck confit was too much in some bites and unevenly distributed. I bit into a piece of bone at one point. The fries came out after we already finished our burger, but they comped that from our bill. Our favorite part of our meal was the Creme Brulee shake with oreos. That milkshake was the most amazing milkshake I've ever tasted.

xa9UFoAGcACoeJG6dyVTug.text: Super fresh and delicious backyard burger. Well done beef patties and I love the bun a lot. I am a big fan of Gordon Ramsay! I saw him on tv a lot and I said to myself when I visit Vegas, I must try all his restaurants.

There was about an hour wait but luckily I was able to get seated within 5 minutes since I am a PLATNIUM member. GET PLATINUM PEOPLE, YOU SKIP LINES! The food took awhile to come since it was super busy. The Truffle Fries came first which were pretty tasty. I will definitely be coming back here again.

cv1d2qlASfSfnB4mdxC0LA.text: Referred to me from one of my colleagues. i have visited twice now. two things to say Wow & wow. The beef. my gosh so fresh and so well seasoned. The brioche bun, the combinations of toppings. I will be back again for sure. A must whenever you're on the Vegas strip

v9HrMiOpfTSbmrCYKksD7Q.text: Had the opportunity to come to Vegas for an industry related event, so of course a group of us had to visit at least one of the celebrity-owned establishments on the Strip. We opted for the moderately priced Gorden Ramsay Burger, located inside Planet Hollywood and were seated faster than the given wait time (early weekday evening).  Ambience is definitely buzzing, and the establishment was smaller than expected.  Food was great, as stated by my group who had the Truffle Fries, Bleu Cheeseburger, Hell's Kitchen Burger, and their off-menu special, The F-word (in honor of G-Ram's new show).  Fries come thick-cut with 2 sauces, Hell's Kitchen was not as fiery as presumed, and the F-word was mouthwateringly delicious, with its dry-aged ribeye and short-ribs. I myself had the Tandoori Chicken burger, which was on the dry side and begging for more of the scrumptiously-described tahini & mint vinaigrettes. On the other hand, love the black & white sesame bun aesthetic.  Skip the jumbo onion rings.  Service was 3/5. Kept our waters filled but the food took a good while.  The experience was not as amazing as I expected, but I'd recommend stopping by for a good beef burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tandoori chicken burger, halved
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tandoori Chicken burger

8DOQoML9x2tSbSpCP-y1AQ.text: The pudding shakes here were BOMB! The burgers are good, but nothing special and the truffle fries are good just as you would expect. It's a nice, yet typical tourist trap. You could wait quite a while to be seated during peak times. The service was bland, but good enough, I guess?

faHMsMZ0yM7GGBhu9IfoVw.text: The burgers here are just mouthwatering. We arrived for a late lunch around 3ish on a weekday and there was not much of a line. The environment was friendly and not too loud. For drinks I ordered a Superfruit cocktail(dont recall name) my husband a beer. We ordered a side of truffle fries as we waited.For our burgers he ordered the Hog burger which was huge but delicious and I ordered the Farmhouse burger, which came with the usual lettuce, tomatoes, but with an egg and bacon. Everything on both burgers worked well together in every bite.

j2aAtpxyeFnk58tJrN2L0w.text: I would describe this as a Gordon Ramsay themed restaurant. Everywhere you look, his face stares back at you. I'm not sure if they have a restroom inside but if they did, his name would be on the toilet seats and a photo of the man himself, hands folded, would be taped to the back door of the stall, judging you. His name and photo are literally all over this place. I get it, it's Vegas, but I feel like if this was on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon would have a few wise cracks for the "donkeys" that chose the decor. THE FOOD: a tasty burger that won't blow your mind, but it's good. The flavors are there and they did not disappoint. Go if there's no line, it's convenient for you (staying in Planet Hollywood), you LOVE looking at photos of Gordon Ramsay, or are simply very very hungry for a decent burger.

-tmbvjXWxEiZEX9PgZTXNg.text: Food was standard fare... Nothing special.  However the desserts were amazing....  Eat dessert first

I was always have very good opinion about Gordon's restaurant, but the reality was different. I ordered Lobster&Schrimp burger and Hell's Kitchen one, also the Trufle fries. The fries was so salty it wasn't tasty and for Lobster burger I also had higher hopes. The Hell's Kitchen burger was very good and I can recommend it at least.   Also the service was very bad poor. For sure it isn't good memory.

Pricey but a single order can easily be split by 3 people.  Way more than anyone should solo but I might try.   The Good Good burger.  Fun atmosphere.  Waitress was on point. SMEt8ffFcz9DwC2luEIUCw.text: Absolutely love Las Vegas and Gordon Ramsay is one of those characters that you love to hate with the shows like hell kitchen and top chef Going to going to this place was definitely on today's agenda and also it was a tourist attraction and the fact that it was located in my hotel which was playing at Hollywood was another added bonus The greeters to the waiters to the cashiers everyone was pleasant and eager-to-please the menu itself wasn't that long burgers nothing shocking there I opted for the turkey burger option but my husband went in for one of the signature burgers that included everything but the kitchen sink which he got with fries we both have fries and drinks and for two people the bill alone was over 35 almost $40 but the experience was nice and the food was pretty good so no complaints you just have to know that you're going to spend a decent amount of money here for the name alone

iBAwlHJXR4gODZEfvkOuEw.text: Personally I would give them a 3&1/2 stars. I riding find the burgers really anything special. Maybe because I'm just an easy to please guy who loves In N Out. Tried this place cause it was the most affordable of all his restaurants. $100 for the four of us with drinks. So for a casual upper class burger restaurant it was reasonable. It would've probably cost me more at 5 guys and I found Gordon's burgers better than theirs.

yQNViVUzQWKXZ7EffvKOHw.text: Service good, wait good, the food came at a very good time. BUT I got the Hell's kitchen burger honestly paying 25+ something for a burger and fries of course I'm going to have high expectations but what the heck the meat was so bland it literally needed salt, garlic, pepper or something, everything was just mediocre I would for sure rather just go to in n out I found myself having to put so much salt and ketchup to make it decent Gordon Ramsay you're the idiot sandwich here :/ or maybe the chef was having a bad day either way disappointed save your money go to five guys or in n out or cook it yourself better.

1bK7u6GeKTJlRrsAJXm9Zw.text: Hella good! This restaurant is located at the entrance of Planet Hollywood facing the strip. Came here on Saturday around 3:30 and it did not disappoint. Being a Saturday, there was a line and we ended up waiting about 45 minutes or so. Some bar seats became available and 2 groups in front of us didn't want them, so we happily jumped the line a bit.   Food: Amaaazzing! I wasn't feeling to good, so I nibbled at everything, but everything I tasted was so yummy. We ordered a burger (forgot which one), ahi tuna sliders, hellfire chicken wings and a side of fries. Everything was delicious. The burger and wings especially! The ahi tuna wasn't anything special, but wasn't bad either.I was sad I wasn't feeling well, otherwise I would've enjoyed the experience much more and ordered more food to try.  The restaurant itself is nice, clean and the service was great. We were very pleased with our experience here and look forward to coming back next time we are in Vegas.

Sk47L5hriSV7ny5zYmmxRg.text: We have a platinum player card still need to wait for an hour to be seated,  but worth it ..i take off 1 star because of the service ... this is the second time we here for lunch , last time we order a burger for each person and we cannot finished.  This time we gotta share.  It was very good juicy meat.  I love the hell burger  The lobster and shrimp burger is yummy too but little bit pricy... and we also order the wing too,  the burger is the best , save more room for the burger is good enough  . Definitely will come back next time

sSLEo4HV72B_AcQ-ihVh4g.text: I'm sure I could make a lot of Gordon Ramsay-inspired jokes, but suffice it to write that while the ingredients were refined and fancy-sounding, the taste just wasn't there. I had the Forest Burger and the mister had something else, both of which we nodded along with since, you know, we were in the shadow of the great insult tosser.   Both my beer order and my burger order came out wrong, like, completely different items than what I ordered. Both were replaced but no offer was made to comp or do anything despite having to flag down and wait for them to fix both issues. I spent more on other meals in Vegas, but this was the only one that felt like too much for what came of it. Agree with other reviewers that the sides are not too hot either - given that our onion rings came out immediately, it was clear they keep them at the ready, fast food-style. Had always wanted to go in whenever we passed this spot, but happy to know now that I won't need to return. (Alternative recommendation: Holstein's.)

nABeODGLBzBQGWYqDnLbPg.text: Great burgers! My favorite was the Truffle fries. I will definitely be trying more of Gordon's restaurants in the future!

Wgu4orhyqo8tU7k6rSMFzQ.text: This was our first stop right after we had dropped everything off at the hotel. Wait was about an hour - which was to be expected. But was nice because we got a chance to really look into the menu and knew what we wanted when we sat down.  We ordered the truffle Parmesan fries to share and I got the Forest Burger, medium rare. Food took a little long to come out but they were packed so I will give them that much.  Burger was suuuuper tasty. It was cooked perfectly and everything was just perfectly seasoned.  The fries were good but I feel like it was a try once and done kind of deal.

zCMFvojMTBGLZqmgzykXSw.text: Loved the burgers! High-end burgers and you pay for it LOL fries have to be ordered on the side for extra. Also the smothered steak fries as an appetizer was delicious. A little much to pay for a burger but it was great service and good food

PEWkPhxSQUdx6EJwYetUvQ.text: I'm a huge Gordon Ramsay fan so I had some pretty high expectations for his restaurant. GR Burger not only met my expectations, they surpassed them. To put things into perspective: I hate pickles. There were pickles in my burger and I loved it. Now that's saying something in my book.  We ordered the UK Burger and Hog Burger with Onion Rings and Truffle Fries. Everything came out tasting great. My buddy scarfed his UK Burger down in about 2 minutes. The Hog Burger was perfectly done. I actually added an egg per the servers suggestion, and it was an amazing choice.  Overall, the service and food were a solid 5 stars. The restaurant is clean and they do a fair job at getting people in and out quickly without making you feel rushed. This is definitely a must-try Burger restaurant.

bNyumD935CTrR8EbCwLTag.text: Being a foodie in vegas is really difficult ...SOOO MANY PLACES ...Anyway, we met up with my aunt and uncle, and decided on Gordon Ramsay Burger. We were all excited for this place..  waiter was pleasant...drinks good, took a while to get our cocktails, busy place..so expect that!   Breakdown for burgers-  Fish and crisp burger was alright. Really oily(the bun)...wouldn't order again.   My aunt got the lobster and shrimp burger ($26) ...not worth that price!  Hubby and uncle ordered the hells kitchen burger.."small patty" said the husband-"basic" said the uncle..lol   All in all ...ok place..but I would skip it and head over to Ramsay pub and grill at Caesars!

gEEzjwVAsewMjPQ2ngctoQ.text: My boyfriend and I stopped here after the Backstreet Boys show in Planet Hollywood. I was excited they offer an Impossible burger substitute for any burger on the menu. We had a short wait and had a friendly server from Moldova, I forget her name but she was friendliest server we had in Vegas (hard to find there) and very good. The cocktails were creative and tasty, we both enjoyed. The appetizer list was simple and since I'm vegetarian we were stuck ordering the creamy corn dip. It was tasty, just didn't have enough chips to finish it or something other than tortilla chips would be nice for dipping. Creative burger menu, hard to choose. My impossible burger with onion strings and gruyere cheese, I forget all toppings, was delicious. It really does taste like a real burger, I always have to second guess if it's actually meat they served me when I taste a good one. This one was cooked perfectly but I'd just say the toppings and sauces were lacking a little, not enough for the size of the burgers. The lack of sauce made it a little dry. The burger buns with seeds are soooo yummy! My boyfriend is a real burger guy and he's pretty critical about his favorite food :) He said his farm burger was good but not great, and overall his burger patty itself was on the dry side. He ordered medium rare but it came more on medium side. There was no dripping burger juice from his burger, from my days of consuming meat, I know this to be a good sign for a juicy burger. But his burger was not very juicy at all even though the flavors and quality of the meat were great. It could have used a sauce or tomato to help make up for the lack of juice. I saw other reviewers comment on dry burgers and now I see why. It was still tasty just not what expected from Gordon Ramsay establishment. We loved the truffle fries and aioli, the sweet potato fries were good but the dip was just ok. The restaurant is not over the top touristy as expected, it is tastefully done. This is a good spot for after show or late night food and yummy cocktails.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Impossible burger

T6ZTjcRfng4ojI3--HcQWg.text: Very friendly waitress, Pat, who walked us through the menu options. Suggested the favorites. Very attentive. Told us ahead of time that it would be ~20 minutes from order time to serving. Well worth the wait!  The burgers were excellent! Hell's Kitchen burger was a nice blend of spicy jalapeno and cooling avacados. The Farmhouse burger with its over easy egg was great! Truffle fries: crispy. Ask for the spicy ketchup.  Overall, a great place.

yULfYVudjUlJkr8ZipPo-A.text: Loved the chicken wings!  Although the Hell's kitchen burger is a little dry, I still loved it!  Truffle fries is great too!  Will definitely come back!

YY7ktN_9ANwET-b6OdseZw.text: Burgers are average. We waited for 20 minutes just to get two burgers. Even then one of the burgers was cold.

jnMMhkjsrFZ-J2K_f8uqzQ.text: This place was very very good. I had the farmhouse burger then our table split fried and onion rings. The fries were pretty much normal but they had some very tasty dipping sauces for them. The onion rings were probably the best I have tried to date. The farmhouse was easily one of the best burgers I have ever eaten. The egg was nicely cooked and added some great flavor. I would give the food overall and servers five stars. But the wait time for food was very long when people who and after us got food first. Also I ordered a medium and it was at best medium rare closer to the rare side. I would definitely recommend if you like burgers though.

vB-6d6qSZ-Ak6xZowTu0Sg.text: My husband and I were just passing through Vegas on our way to the grand canyon and he really wanted to stop and eat here. We waited maybe 5 minutes in the line to get to the host station but was sat right away. Service was decent, sounded like our server was reading from a script. Blackened Caesar salad was good. Backyard burger was excellent, especially if you're like me and want a classic burger. My husband LOVED his Mediterranean burger. Sweet potato fries were okay, (we're a fan of sea salt sweet potato fries, these are sweeter). Would definitely come back and recommend to people traveling here!

TgJ8HpOUpCe7bejjavPorQ.text: Had the Forest Burger, asked for Med rare. It's cooked to order and it was "spot on". The nachos are also a must have.  Staff was very friendly and on their game. Would definitely go again!!

rwojctHL8Z7Z_J02gsmHmQ.text: Amazing food and friendly service. My friend and I split the Hell's Kitchen Burger and Crispy Cherry Pepper Chicken-- they were both amazing. We also got the sweet potato fries, which come with vanilla powdered sugar and jalapeno mayo. They were also surprisingly good. I highly recommend.

qzKuxTtL4Gz_XkRBZP3Zqw.text: Great experience. The wait was not long. The burgers were delicious. I didn't like that they added powder sugar on the sweet potato fries. The hummus was delicious and the Cesar Salad was my favorite. I had the Farmhouse Burger and my boyfriend had the Burger with Genesis.

T-3CV0_lzSO4yyY2CVMerw.text: I am not ready to put Ramsay Burger on my list of 'Best Burgers I Have Ever Had'. Partly because, despite what my size might suggest, I have eaten a great many burgers in my life (I am from the Midwest, after all). But do trust me when I say that the quality of the food, as well as the price you will pay, will both leave you somewhat floored.  My company and I somewhat reluctantly came to Ramsay Burger after being too negligent to make a timely reservation at Hell's Kitchen. Oh well! The wait at Ramsay Burger for 3 folks on a Saturday night proved to be... well, not nearly as bad as I imagined. Right around 45 minutes in all. I have a feeling that it would have been shorter if it had been just the two of us, but thankfully we were in Vegas so... there was plenty to do while we waited!  The setting for the restaurant is nothing remarkable. The menu is simple and straightforward, as you would expect. There are a few starters, a couple of salads, beef burgers, a chicken burger, a vegetarian option utilizing mushrooms, and a couple of dishes that incorporate hot dogs. I initially tried to order the bangers and mash, but my server waved it off as, and I do quote, 'disgusting'. Crisis averted. I ordered the curry chicken burger instead. And I was glad that I did!  The burgers here are good, as I mentioned. Really nothing earth-shaking. But the prices are not bad at all, considering the name and the venue, and the accompanying pieces make the experience worth the while. Particularly, the truffle fries were incredible, but the real gem that we found, was the poutine. The gravy, the burnt tips, everything was absolutely incredible. I seriously cannot overstate how good this was. I am considering coming back just to try these amazing fries again. That being said, the starters and side dishes are a bit on the pricey side (which comes as no surprise), but in my opinion, the poutine at the very least is well worth the expense.  Finally, there is a wonderful assortment of craft beer on draft. Can't speak to the availability of cocktails too much. Not really my scene.  In closing, believe the hype! This is definitely one of my favorite spots in Vegas for a reasonably priced bite. Don't come in expecting the world and you won't leave disappointed. But do make it a point to try that poutine!

4mt91A5FzUmDXAi66wwtvQ.text: Here's the thing...... my review is very limited because, for some bizarre reason, upon arriving in Vegas for a mini-vacation, I was battling some kind of stomach flu and/or was seriously overtired.  I did manage to take one bite of the burger my husband ordered, but that's all I could muster.  I must say, for that one bite, it was OUTSTANDING.  The beef literally melted on my tongue, and it was easy to tell it was very high quality.  The flavors were excellent, and while there was more waiting for me to eat, I just couldn't.  Everyone else devoured their burgers and 2 types of fries that were ordered (plain and truffle fries).  Oh, if only I was feeling better........ but for that one bite, yeh, I am reporting excellence on that.  Gordon Ramsey Burger is located in a very heavily smoke-filled Planet Hollywood, so if you are sensitive to smoke, beware.  Please also note that the wait-time can be quite long.... no matter what time you go !!  They do not accept reservations.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OP-oliY0sK-Dxln_2rKpPg.text: The line was scary long. Luckily they let Total Rewards Platinum and higher levels cut the line. I know it's not fair but I'm not complaining. I would say it's not worth the wait but if there is no wait then it's a pretty good burger spot.  The hell fire wings were not spicy. It had a sweetness that I rather it didn't have. It also didn't come with any dipping sauce. I had to ask and was told they don't have blue cheese. They did have ranch but it's just not the same. I was happy to see that the wings were partially deboned.  I got the farmhouse burger. It comes with bacon and an egg. It was really good but the burger came dry, no sauces. I had to ask for mayo. It also doesn't come with fries so I ordered the truffle fries. I don't like the fact it was the thick steak fries. I wish it was cut thinner however the truffle aioli that it came with was ridiculously good.  They also had a lot of unique burgers but I was not feeling adventurous that day. Great burger spot if you don't have to wait. Otherwise it's not worth the wait.

hxXzxd1oMutm8aOF7d7I7w.text: One of the best burgers I've had so far! The party was cooked perfectly the way I wanted mine medium. Quality sure was top notch and the size was more than enough for one person.  Their French fries and onion rings are super large so I suggest couples to order one and share unless you can finish it all. The atmosphere is upbeat. They have an open kitchen so you can see the cooks in action while the servers constantly deliver the plates out. Out waitress was attentive and kept checking on us. The price was definitely more expensive than most burger joints but the food and service made up for me and I can recommend this place to the people who enjoy high quality delicious burger served by attentive food service people.

9aIqXoNMqp0bRe_3gYmhxQ.text: This burger joint has the best burgers I have ever had. Although the wait may be long it is worth the wait. The intense flavors you get out of a burger is a special kind of flavor that I don't think I have ever had before. I recommend this burger joint to you if you are in Las Vegas as a visitor and are looking for a good place to have lunch or dinner because trust me, you're never gonna find a burger place better then this ANYWHERE else but Las Vegas.

0YjjBHEls1DghSYs7lsTyg.text: I came here on vacation and ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger, Forest Burger, and just fries. The Hell's Kitchen burger packed so much flavor it was unbelievable, the peppers and the burger itself was amazing, 100% incredible and worth it. The forest burger was a perfect balance of subtle flavors, the buttery arugula and mushrooms blended so well with the duck bacon.   The only complaint I had was the fries... I was really hoping for the classic "piping hot" crispy French fries but they must have been left out too long because they were tough almost rubbery like jerky. The two ketchups however, had the most delicious flavors I've ever tasted, I would have just ate them on their own.  *If you're trying many burgers I recommend ending with the Hell's Kitchen burger, it packs such a flavorful punch and might takeaway from the other subtle flavors for the other burgers.   With the exception of the fries, I've never had burgers with such amazing flavors. Definitely recommend!

U8ZrI9eRWC16KDrytBO0cw.text: Very incompetent hostess/ girls working at the front. We checked in at 12:11 and they told us the wait is 25 minutes, which means that we should have a table at 12:36. At 12:20, we see people going in as priority since they have diamond/platinum. Since I had platinum, I went back and told them that I have the platinum rewards priority card as well. They seemed nice and told me that I would be next. 20 long dreadful moments go by as my family and I see two parties of 5 walk in right before us. Before that, 5 or 6 full waves of people in line proceeding in before us. Frustrated, I asked the hostess for a status on our place in line. I was assured I was next (once again). We decided to wait and 5 minutes go by and we see another party of 5 go in right before our eyes. This was the straw that broke the camels back and we decided to ask the hostess. At 12:50, we told them that they can take us off the waitlist and they shrugged with attitude and said "ok." Very unprofessional, did not even offer any apologies for the delay. My family and I were shocked about the fact that the workers didn't even care about our business. Was a huge fan of this restaurant whenever I came to Vegas. This restaurant really needs to start training their hostesses to provide better customer service. We would like being treated like people and not another number or group trying to go into the restaurant.

N9iImWx4px01S5Ff5BG9SA.text: I wish I could rate the food separately from the customer service because the food deserves more than 10 stars, but our server WENDY not even 0. First of all we waited 45 min for the food, not including 20 minutes waiting in line to get seated.  My waiter Wendy was showing attitude. I ordered Hog burger and asked our waiter Wendy if I can get no bread but letters wrapped, and she said, "I don't know, but I will ask." She never let me know whether they can or not. Then she was tripping with my son, who leaned on the table, and she was warning him that this is glass. Come on, I know that my son is too alert. And finally she was not behaving professionally since she was flirting with another waiter, they were literally hugging; she let him hug her around her waist. Do whatever you want, I do not care, but not in front of your customers. She never gave nor asked if we need the receipt. I mean she gave us a check, but we got no copy of it nor we were asked if we need one BUT the HOG burger was DEVINE, it upgrades the whole negative experience to 4 stars. I still recall the burger with my mouth watering. The patty is about 1 inch thick and wrapped in bacon and cooked this way, and topped with some kind of pulled slow cooked meat. So tender and juicy, I cannot ever describe it. It wins your heart immediately.This is the best food I have ever tasted in my life. And I wish I could experience the same with the customer service because  I pay to experience amazing food with great service.

rMZZ24g0TqJX7e36KpgD0w.text: If you want to taste the real shake shack go to New York. The one in Las Vegas doesn't compare, I won't be back

0RHZDsBPHoHA-KiGKTDuGQ.text: Best burger to have in Las Vegas! There was a line to get a table about a 20 minute wait but worth it. Definitely coming back next time I'm in Vegas.

BbM11iBWSizLBLkik04oug.text: Very good service and great food. We ordered the onions rings (amazing) and parmesan truffle fries and the forest burger. Definitely can taste the quality. Love the decor as well as the signature fire sign outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d1DAHLHk6TOmJ8FeWMmVFw.text: I was worry this place was all hype but the burger was very delicious. It is inside planet Hollywood right near an entrance. The wait was 30-40 mins on a weekend. The burger did not take too long to come. Service was decent.   We got the Hell's Kitchen and lobster/shrimp burgers. I enjoyed the lobster/shrimp burger a lot. The burger patty was very flavorful and you can taste the shrimp and lobster. The patty texture was very good too - doesn't fall apart and not mushy with a slightly chewy texture. The pickled carrots in the burger was nice and crunchy and added the needed acid to the burger. The buns were light and didn't feel too heavy.   I thought the burger was gonna be my caloric heavy weight but man the Oreo creme brulee shake stole the title! It's super decadent and delicious but probably 800+calories! Definitely would order it again if we ever go back and workout like crazy to burn it off!   Glad we try this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oreo Creme brûlée milkshake
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and shrimp burger

b7NA-USqeqdiH9Z9irxAmg.text: Holy cow. My wife dragged me to "Gordon Ramsay Burger ". The idea of going to a celebratory chef restaurant is not my favorite idea. I guess, I just didn't want to follow all the other fans in.     However, this place is really, really good . My wife got the Hells kitchen burger and I got the Hog burger. Both were enormous. At $17, and $18 they weren't the cheapest burgers around, but still a very good value for what we received. Our waiter was attentive and I never had to wait for a drink refill. The food came out hat and fast. Give it a try.

ZO2J-rA8N1Izy1VB2gmWCA.text: This place looks cool with the fire from outside the restaurant, but the hostesses could care less if they work and the food was disappointing. I was starving and had just landed in town so I thought just about anything would be good - but it wasn't! I had the Hell's Kitchen burger but it was so bland and had no flavor. The only flavor was from the one big jalapeno you bit into and that was just burning your mouth. I usually love spicy and hot foods. The onion rings were decent because I liked the spicy ketchup, but the Cheddar Ale soup was yuck! Way too much chive.  The wine menu was awful and was all cheap bottom shelf stuff you get from Costco. I like trying new wines and champagne when I'm out - especially Vegas, so that also was disappointing. Definitely don't stand in line for this place. It's just hyped up because of the name behind it.

dxo8mCwtL4yySvhDlQjBLQ.text: I had a Portobello mushroom burger with just fries and sweet potato fries. This was one of the best burgers I ever had and it was so tasty. The herbal leaves added the flavor. Both the fries were really good and went really well with the dips they provided. The ambience is great and the people are friendly too!! A must go place to eat if you are in Vegas!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just Fries

3Kc-v4zIHPYSGSB7eGpfjQ.text: Gordon Ramsay makes some badass burgers. Be a little careful if selecting the ghost pepper burger as you will feel the burn :-) I have been tricked to eat ghost pepper before, so it wasn't as bad as I expected, gave it a nice kick. And I'm not the one to eat super spicy food. Usually get spicy number 2 of 10 at Thai restaurants f ex. In either case. Great burgers and beers, what more can you ask for from a place like this.   Yum yum will be back.

Tgt-vImqMoYOt-ddTs16ww.text: This place is always amazing we always stop here when we are in Vegas the food quality is always excellent yesterday when we went the night manager was there Ryan he was such a humble guy he cleaned tables helped the bus boys and also served food you never see managers do the job of others I will always recommend this restaurant awesome job guys  our server Rick was awesome as well and so was Curtis

SfO13-D5rCYvh6hP1i48vQ.text: Great service and food: fabulous atmosphere with British Invasion sound track. Love the fired signage. Sat at the bar where I was addressed by name. All about the details!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sorry, but I had the wings in a burger place. Ample serving of wonderfully prepared wings. Cannot begin to imagine how they&#39;re done?!?
