xPnBKYj-QaNezGHwhQbIrw.text: Got the blue cheese burger. Had great distinct tastes. I did think the burger could have more meat on it for 16 dollars without fries. Parties with 1-2 must wait in line for 35 minutes without being able to put your name on a list. Little annoying  Overall good experience. I will be back.

VoGr9-y_Dy_YsVXagO53Vg.text: Love the burgers, the fries and the onion rings. But I was sad that they took my favorite hot dog off the menu. It was crazy delicious. The only other hot dog they have had a cheese sauce and I would NEVER eat a hot dog with cheese sauce but then, I don't eat movie theater nachos either. My burger was juicy but a tad over cooked. She said medium would have some pink but it did not. It was still quite good. Service was extremely slow however so be prepared to wait . We were near the pass and food did sit quite a while before runners showed up. I found that surprising. The manager was also running food which I like so they must have had some people call in sick! The line to get in was only about 15 minutes so that was good. Please put my spicy hot dog back on the menu!

Zie_Xgnjt0bW_HelIUuBGw.text: Love the burgers and salads. The fries are on the mushy side and the Parmesan they use is overpowering. The onion rings are great. Some of the best but two of mine had onion peels inside. I if this would happen in master chef, Mr. Ramsey would have a fit and understandable so. Hence the three stars

yjiILKvmpBWzIyRuYkKR2Q.text: The bar is set very very high when Gordon Ramsay attaches his name to a restaurant!! But honestly, the burger was no better than the Burger King version we can get for a fraction of the price! The ahi tuna sliders were delicious but not the best we have ever had! The service was handled well, the wait to be seated was shorter than we expected! I wouldn't discourage anyone from dining here... but done go in expecting the best burger of your life, or you will be disappointed!

vRZfVp4qkQ6gx8lRQH730g.text: First time here to see what all the fuss was about. To be honest my husbands pork chop burger was bland no flavors at all. My Hell's Kitchen burger was like any other burger the grill Chile over powered the taste. Overall wouldn't come back

D2ZHOOqknPEU8kmEFVC9fg.text: I have to say the flavors are great. The burgers were exciting yet overpriced, but for the name, I wanted to try it. The fries we got one order to and I was disappointed with the texture and got some with pieces of potatoes that had black in them. The texture of the fries was off and seemed to be tougher as if they're had been reheated. I loved the ketchup flavors that the brought with the fries though. As far as I am concerned the place is more touristy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D444NrYvEq1QMGrtdq17Ww.text: The service was quick and friendly. The hostess gave us suggestions and the server did a great job explaining the dishes. We wanted to eat here because it seemed like a nice middle ground where we could get delicious food inspired by Chef Ramsay but not pay an arm and a leg. Plus the casual atmosphere was great! We had the burnt ends poutine and wings to start, then split the hog burger. The poutine was amazing, the meat was tender and the gravy was rich and delicious! The wings were huge and had a great spicy/tangy flavor. The hog burger was massive and did not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qb7-UPcYowpEM7doOeocyg.text: With all things in consideration, you get a gourmet burger for a good price. I was even more inclined to go because I'm a huge Gordan Ramsay fan.  You are welcomed with a wall of flame on the side of the restaurant. It feels a little bit like you're eating inside of Hell's Kitchen. Flashbacks to all the seasons I've watched... Anyway, I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger and it was cooked very well. Each bite gave me goosebumps. We also ordered a side of truffle fries which was seasoned perfectly.   The customer service was top notch. Our waitress did a great job keeping our party of 10 happy. With Ramsay as their boss, who can dare to mess up? This place gets a thumbs up in my book!

9NKwzn7ti9Po5ibK8frnww.text: The food is amazing! Cooked perfectly, well seasoned, and flavorful. It took a while to come out but the restaurant was busy and packed. Our waitress Denise wasn't that great, she didn't really check on us and seemed bothered by questions. Besides that we really enjoyed our visit and we'll be back.

3XJm2Q5j6S5jLpFTKZhVKg.text: I ordered my burger medium with the waitress telling me there's be red throughout the burger. Instead I got it well done. Told the waitress but after I'd eaten most if it. I told her to let the chef know and she stated she would if I told her about it earlier? WTF does that mean? For a $17 burger it better be perfect. It was not. I was offered a new burger but I can only eat so much. Should've offered a complimentary desert or taken some off the bill. Didn't happen.  Gordon needs to come down here and kick his staff in the ass. I won't be back and I will spread the word. Gordon's steakhouse on the other hand is first class!

PW3pFJOcGJa5-pcJvfAafA.text: We went there for dinner after the Criss Angel show located at the PH hotel.  We ordered two Backyard burgers along with an order of truffle fries. One of the burgers we added the avocado. The burgers are juicy, meat to bun ratio was perfect and ample veggies. The truffle fries tasted good but was a tad bit salty. Service was good.

VMw0KxocGqDf6HNVQ7Mkqw.text: This option is miles ahead of the Spice Buffet at Planet Hollywood. Burger is what you expect from anything bearing Gordon Ramsay's Name.  Service and location are really nice.  A great place to have a premium burger

ClR8h07a5JBi8eZoIiuHsQ.text: Of course we had to come here to get something after seeing Gordon Ramsay killing the game on tv. I was trying to set realistic expectations for this place but it's really hard with a chef of this caliber in its name. For me, the burger was only alright. We got the forest burger and it was just too fancy for us. I guess sometimes simple is better, and this is definitely the case. The buns were really good and didn't look or taste like it came from a bag. The meat was well seasoned and cooked medium just like the way we liked it. Somehow the meat wasn't very juicy though. I wonder what the ratio of fat is in their patty...The part that threw me off was the cheese. In my opinion, the tremor cheese just doesn't go well with the burger. It tasted like goat cheese and I felt like it overpowered the burger. I was really surprised about the arugula though. It wasn't too bitter and actually went well with the burger. However, I still feel like normal green leaf lettuce would've been better. But I did really like the mushrooms which gave it a different change of texture. We also got the truffle fries and it was phenomenal. The truffle and cheese gave it a unique, creamy flavor that tasted best with the normal ketchup. Service here was great and our server was very attentive. To justify the price for just a burger I expected this to blow my mind away. This didn't happen today. If it wasn't for how good the fries were, I would've given this place 3 stars. I hope I just got the wrong burger and the others are actually very good. Probably wont be back for a second chance though.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3_7i3N7fLMsd3miYO_gLOg.text: My husband and I decided to try his burger since it's Gordon Ramsay. We decided to split on the Hell's Kitchen Burger and regular fries. The burger is smaller than the average American burgers, but the fries were just perfect to split with another. When we bit into our burger, the bun and the meat was just perfect! The crunchiness and buttery bun was delicious from every bite. The flavor of the burger meat was cooked perfectly!! We'll definitely go back to try other burgers!    Total: $35 for 1 burger, 1 regular fries, and 1 beer

m2NxR8iWZNABSWsr48KkWQ.text: Best burger and hummus I have ever had!  Service could have been better.  Our server was polite but did not check on us often but she did check her cell phone often in the middle of the dining room.  Food is 5 stars service is 1 star that's why I gave 4 stars.

sTR5t6dxpfQcQDUiTcNQag.text: Taste of food are good but it seems managing can not handle the crowd after 35 min wait out of resturant it takes 40 min for our burgers to come believe me guys thats not worth to waste 1,5 hours for just 2 burgesrs ots better to work on your staff to have enough waiters and kitchen crew.

x_kfSFENHDBAgP5nY5prDw.text: We sat at the counter because we were told it would be faster. We had about an hour to grab a bite to eat before we needed to leave for our flight home. After nearly an hour our waitress asked if her manager came out to speak with us. We said no. Less than one minute later the manager walked by us, never made eye contact, tapped the bar in front of us and said "gentlemen, sorry for the delay" without even pausing. So, one order of onion rings, one order of fries, two burgers to go because they didn't come out in time for us to eat there and two beers - $100. Giving a 1 star review to a great chef who hired a fucking idiot to manage his restaurant- priceless.

i_7F8aIHdj11BqA4QM4Ypg.text: Went here years ago and loved it. Everything was perfect and delicious so I made a point to go when I went back to town. Something changed. The truffle fries tasted stale. The burgers were acceptable, but nothing like the perfection of before. With a casual atmosphere and barely satisfactory food quality the $40/person price was not worth it. Sad and disappointing situation overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Exb09ac4Sdn3740L1Ng2HA.text: So disappointing: I ordered a Hell's burger to go on a Sunday afternoon. Restaurant was busy, but nothing out of the ordinary for what they are used to. The order took about an hour (which was totally Ok and they prepared me for). However... when a person spends $18 on a burger (without any sides), they expect it to have some good flavor and at LEAST be hot! I was waiting for the burger at the nearby Extra Bar and as soon as I received the text notice, I made the 30 second walk to go pick it up. When I sat down to eat it (30 seconds later) I was sadly disappointed by it's lack of flavor and the fact that it MIGHT have been luke warm(ok, nope... totally cold). I tried to convince myself that it was better than it was (since it was a little $$$), but in the end... lesson learned... In-n-out burger tops Gordon Ramsey burger any day of the week

mPAMqPpcUhfq_f1NwbgfrQ.text: Pretty good. I shared truffle fries with my boyfriend and got the forest burger because sometimes people say I am a woodland creature, whatever that means. I was not a fan of the trumpet mushrooms on top but other than that, this was pretty good. The truffle fries were quite salty and definitely well-made. Gordon Ramsay did not disappoint, but I don't think I will come back. I loved the decoration inside and the mini waving fingers of fire in front of the restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest burger and farm burger

N0z7bZegcNwcSWAnt3ICZg.text: This place needs an episode of kitchen nightmares. The chicken burger was horrible the chicken smelled as if it was old and the the ambience is very meh. The chicken wings and fish n chips burger were pretty good

gMpTCxqmDc5-sD2tXD1JpA.text: The mouth watering jalapeno bombers here are just straight from heaven . They are literally the best ever!! They come in a 6 piece all individually dipped in a cool house ranch and all of them are not too spicy except one or two of them! They do it on purpose yes it's for those to enjoy it if they can't eat too hot! But excuse yourself if you get the really hot ones! Rip! Sliders and burgers are also great! Good size burgers not too big not small at all but fills you yo good. Long wait at times but get there at a perfect time when there's no line stop right in!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño bombers !

_wC-5VAIRTnYt9CgqJtD3A.text: This place is exactly what you expect for a burger with the backing of Gordon Ramsay. In my opinion it is reasonably priced $15-22 depending which burger you get. Even the truffle fries priced at $12 is not bad especially if you share with one other person.   The only con is see is because of the wait time- but for me that doesn't warrant losing a star. If you plan accordingly and go off peak times, you should be okay.  I do not believe they have a reservation list. I came on a Monday at approx 6:30pm with my parents, we waited about 15 mins for a table (or could have been seated right away at the bar high tables). But when we came out a while later, there was a line all the way to the gaming tables- yes still on a Monday night. I've gone on a Saturday during peak time before and have waited almost 2 and a half hours for a table for 4. So don't do it and let it spoil everything.  The service was great, and the burgers are not monstrous. You will feel full and satisfied but not bloated, even with the fries. I recommend that everyone try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries and Backyard Burger

9-tise6zbCqTjUOL7yYUoQ.text: Had the Farmhouse Burger. One of the best burgers I've ever eaten. Great atmosphere, super friendly staff, excellent food. Five stars easy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

c65fKFXMCmvmhD_cGXfzhg.text: The kitchen messed up my order but Victor and Roberto at the Bar made it right. Thanks guys. That's a billion dollar culture right there!

__TopGKx08prEuwAHZu4vQ.text: I'm a vegetarian (and healthy eater foodie) and this place rocks!! Plenty of vegetarian friendly dishes! And the drinks are amazing! The fries are with the toxins in your body- they come with cool flavour ketchups. And great vibe and atmosphere.  Get on list for table and they'll text you when ready.  The line gets pretty long!

ZJAXCkk02AK4YHIzUdgcNA.text: Don't miss out on these burgers. That will be the best you have ever had. The service is exceptional. The Mediterranean burger is made with lamb. It is my favorite. My wife likes the blue cheese burger.

LsKtGg-8bpWXBd7vRWatQA.text: We were in Vegas for a few days and decided to give this place a try because it was where we were staying.  We started off with potato chip nachos.  OMG, it was delicious.  We also got the hells burger and hot dog.  They were both super delicious.  The hot dog was just a little to smokey for me, but that was my only complaint.  We also ordered the plain fries that came with a curry and chipotle ketchup.  The fries were just ok, I dont think it is worth $9.  The curry ketchup was a fail.  But over all I will be back when im in Vegas and ive been telling everyone I know to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chef Ramsay would be upset with ununiform cut onions....
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries were good..
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells burger was amazing as well

eZj7wNnOgwlOGPX36UgGmQ.text: Amazing service, AMAZING BURGERS! Was very happy with the quality of food and the great service def living up to the hype.

QdLvNx4g8jILeaAA_2g1zA.text: It was kind of a disappointment. The restaurant was very pretty, the beer was good and the truffle fries delicious, but the burger we ordered was what we ordered. My girlfriend ordered hers medium well and I ordered mine medium. When they arrived, mine was well done, and hers medium-rare. The server offered to get a new one at the end of the meal, but that would take around 30 more minutes.

HMaMFS73s7bbjbeFqM8duA.text: Pretty good food but not spectacular. We all got the farmhouse burger (which was decent, but not great) and shared the onion rings (which, when dipped in their ranch sauce, were super good! ) and the parmesan truffle fries (also pretty good) but for 100 bucks for 3 people seems a bit spendy when all we drank was water.

mJOrcZ0eMl6LL7nQ-hAGLA.text: Perhaps the best burger I have ever eaten. Planning on going back before leaving Vegas!

An3rAGlV06g4-8Gs4sEFjg.text: The food was simply amazing. I ordered the crown burger, truffle fries, and a shake (must be the kid in me). The food was exactly what I expected from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. The food had big bold flavors with seasoned burgers and fries. The staff was extremely knowledgeable about their menu and service was perfect. We waited about 25 minutes for our food but it was well worth the wait. Thank for an excellent meal and great final experience as we get ready to leave Vegas!

yZUlNvfp-gWP_E2TjBucew.text: I really wanna give this 5 stars because the food was perfect! So was the waiter! But the hosts seemed like they didn't know what they were doing as if they were completely lost.

gBKvtk59upBpSk5mbNU6bw.text: Came to Vegas so many times and finally had chance to try that famous burger. Maybe because i came after lunch time there was no line.  But i was so dosappinted, we ordered a hell's kitchen burger ,hog burger and truffle fries. And i asked the jalapeno on the side for my hell's kitchen burger. The fries had came first and it not crispy enough and sauce tasted very light. Then burger came i noticed there was only one set of silverware on our table. Meanwhile the buser dropped plates and cups while cleaning the table. The burger was over charred and i noticed i didnt see my jalapeno on the side after my first bit , guess where was it? yep it was inside my burger! so i just moved on the side. My server came and asked how everything i said its spicy and i thought its on the side then he just ignore what I said and walk away. Well i dont usually complain, but for the famous restaurant like that i expected more. We all know Gordon is a high standard person and thats why he is famous and successful. We expected his restaurants are same high standard. For people who want to have a nice burger i suggest you go in and out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bread was over charred and the meat was not juicy.

X_Om1m9egarC4hTU2toXUA.text: Meh. Satisfied the need for hunger but I've tasted so many better burgers. Not impressed. Maybe this is considered really good for the Vegas area, but no comparison to Texas burgers!

_dse_iqSq1ynsHmV3FXe7Q.text: For dinner we order hummus. It was outstanding.  However for the main course i ordered veg burger which you not pleasing.  I am vegetarian and served with a burger that looks like meat and tastes like meat is not appetizing.  I hope Ramsey reconsider his recipe for veg burger.  It is not worth paying extra $6 for it.

mjLmxHvTFSKrMFEySyjfWw.text: The food was great and the service was so amazing. Especially with our family of 5 and two little ones under 3 years old.

kzmQY0Rs5il3zFq9zSbkmg.text: THE best burger I have EVER had!   It was totally worth waiting 30 minutes in line!   Ultimate Cheeseburger was delicious! Everything anyone can want in a cheeseburger! Hell's Kitchen Burger...anything with avocado automatically tastes great.   Both burgers were amazing! You can taste the quality in the patty itself.   The Creme Brulee Shake was delicious! Suggestion: make sure to finish the creme brulee first. I was not a fan of mixing the creme brulee with the rest of the shake.   All in all, I didn't expect less from Gordon Ramsay!  I literally went back the next day to have another burger, but looking at that line which we were most likely going to be standing for, for 2 hours or more is what stopped me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QN_56CdP0vJnqpcp-tNFZQ.text: I only give four stars because of the service and cost overall. The price of the burgers at nearly $20 without any sides isn't worth making multiple trips here but, it was fun to say we tried it and visited one of Gordon Ramseys restaurants. The meat itself was delicious and cooked to perfection! I just can't justify spending nearly $100 with tip for three burgers, one order of french fries and onion rings. The onion rings were the best I've ever had! As much as I wanted to try a refreshing alcoholic beverage being on budget I couldn't do it but, I would love to return for some onion rings and a cocktail! Very loud busy environment but, fun to try with the family. I followed the tips here on Yelp and it did help to not get confused and wait in line as this is only for parties of two.

EhGgl3Iru8HwA1TK9ukcYA.text: We waited about 30 minutes for a table and it was worth every minute.   I ordered the Hells' Kitchen Burger ($15.00) and my husband decided on the U.K. Burger. ($15.00) Both of these burgers hit it out of the park. They were amazing!! Cooked to perfection!! The Hells' Kitchen was prepared with asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos,fresh avocado, roasted tomatoes and jalapeno pesto aioli. The U.K. had dublinar cheese, major grey's chutney and arugula.    We also tried an order of sweet potato fries. ($9.00) They were fresh and hot.

_guJcACpxSOhjVQlNQyDPw.text: It is an honor to have a delicious burger like this and especially from chefs that work for Gordan Ramsay. I would definitely come here again to have another Hell's Kitchen burger.

j455G9I823SuWMa7ApLRcw.text: This was our first time here and it was amazing. We're out in Las Vegas visiting family and they said it was amazing and we had to come out and experience it.  We were not disappointed. It was so delicious. The way the ingredients complimented each other were phenomenal!! We will definitely be back when we're in town next. The Hell's Kitchen burger was delicious!!!! Definitely get it the next time you visit. Ask for Daniel! He made some awesome suggestions!!

4gIWMf_kGpeXJB_1US42Lw.text: It was okay. Not worth the 1 hour wait to sit in the place. For how much I paid, I have better. Might wanna try somewhere else

r_UjNlR5wUM_ThWgwwLoRQ.text: I am stuffed and happy.  As a fan of the Hell's Kitchen show, wanted to try this and other Gordon Ramsay places.  Well, this one exceeded my expectations.  Great food, amazing service and a pleasant ambience combine to give an awesome dining experience.  My forest burger was over the top delicious.  The backyard burger was "really good."  Too far from home to become a regular here but will plan to return whenever I am in town.

a6A-gI5FnhyZxHotRyo2Aw.text: It's pretty expensive, but the burger is worth it. My friend and I both split the farmhouse burger and the forest (?) burger with medium rare meat. The farm house burger was great. The egg was nice and runny, and the flavors melted together so nicely. The forest burger had great mushroom flavor and tangy cheese. The meat is so tender! They burgers are on the pricier side and fries are extra, so look to spend $20+ on a burger and fries. The burger is def worth it. They have unique dipping sauces for their fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger

1Qox_Yx17kYcApgANO2Nrw.text: Yes it's exactly what you see on tv. From the moment you enter till you leave service is about you. First time my water cup never was empty. And the wing we ordered was the best wings I ever had in my life. We ordered extra just because it was good.  Will go back just to try it again when In Vegas.

rfdToRVj5qitAPj633tesw.text: I ordered food from here to go, so I can only review the food, not the service.  First of all, they only take to go orders in person, so you can't order over the phone or anything. This wasn't a big deal for me, as I was staying at the hotel that this restaurant is inside of. They do let you leave and just text you when your food is ready, so that's a bonus.  Our food was done in about 35 minutes, which is exactly how long they told us it would be.  I got the Backyard Burger with no cheese and the vegan impossible patty. I LOVED this burger. This was my first time trying the impossible burger and I really enjoyed it. Even though I got one of the more basic burgers on the menu, everything tasted great and fresh. That being said, I do think they're asking a lot of their customers to pay $6 extra for the vegan patty. My friend got the Blue Cheeseburger and really enjoyed it. We also got an order of the "just fries" to share (the burgers do not come with any). The fries were okay, but i've had better. At $8 an order, I'd probably say skip the fries if you're planning on just getting the plain ones. All in all, this was a great meal and I would definitely recommend this restaurant, but just know what you're getting into. It is a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, and his name can carry a hefty price tag. The wait can be extremely long and they don't take reservations. But if you're okay with all of that, the food is great, and it was worth it for a nice special meal in Vegas.

CkvpseCnoSK2MNXqLiWinQ.text: The hype is real folks, this place is awesome!!! Came here for dinner to fulfill my longtime desire to eat at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. Add burgers to the mix and bam, paradise!  First off, the wait is a little disheartening. For a group of two, you wait in a line next to the hostess' booth until a table opens up. There were about 20 people and the wait was about 45 minutes long when I was there, but continued to grow and grow as the night went on. It sucks, but it's Vegas. Just suck it up!  After we were seated, I ordered the blue (yeah, not bleu) cheeseburger and a side of parmesan truffle fries. After about a 20 minute wait, it came out and it was phenomenal. The burger wasn't the absolute best I've ever had, but it was damn good!!! Definitely a top contender. It was very well put together, it wasn't sloppy, it was perfectly cooked, and a great great burger. Perfectly moist. So good. Next, the fries. Holy cow, the fries were freakin' amazing. The fries were the best I've ever eaten. Simply perfection!  Very good restaurant. A few cons, but the pros greatly outweigh them. I would come back over and over again!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheeseburger, so so so good!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The hype is real... amazing burgers!!!

wMKITSdOKgXC18p-72KwJw.text: This was my first time eating at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant!   Food: This place should be five stars! I had the Crown Burger, truffle fries and Baby Black Kale Apple Caesar Salad. The burger was cooked to a medium. The flavor was all there and everything inside the burger was A+. Truffle fries were bomb! The ketchup was amazing, I don't know how to describe it but I couldn't get enough. My brother who doesn't like ketchup actually wanted to finish the sauce. The Dijon mustard was suburb! Lastly the salad was light and filling. It was a great way to start the meal.   Service: Our waiter was hilarious! He informed us of all the specials and joked around with how we reacted to the food. He could see that we thought the food was delicious. I don't think there was a point where he did not check up on us. Keep up the great work staff!   Ambiance: I love the British theme. All the posters and color design are pleasing. The dragon with the fire up front was great to look at. The tables and seats were comfortable. I like how you can look into the kitchen and see the chefs cooking.   Overall a wonderful experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby Black Kale Apple Caesar Salad
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown Burger

Z1fBDmFD-g66XinlSOymAA.text: Been here twice and it was okay both times.  Nothing about the food or atmosphere justifies the long line.   Must be fans of the show that come here because the food just isn't amazing enough to justify standing in line over 30 min.  The fish sandwich was bland.  It didn't have anything to give it Pop!  I wish there was a spicy tartar with lemon on it. The Ribeye Special burger I had was ruined by the shredded beef that was all over the burger.  Ribeye burger is by itself supposed to be more than enough.  I just didn't like it.  The best part of the meal was the truffle fries.  If you come and eat here, those are a must!!!  If I ever return, it will be for those yummy fries.

-ZKfSAvue8PC1l7WrfYCvA.text: We all ordered different burgers and they were all very tasty. Fries have to be ordered separately and we enjoyed the sweet potato and truffle fries. Loved the decor and the flames in the entry way a nice touch.

YeIk7NZkvIkZkkR8BFfFfQ.text: Amazing burgers! Sub-par service.   +Crown Burger: My boyfriend ordered this and it was delicious, something about the dried tomatoes complimented the burger very well. +Blue Cheeseburger: I got this because I love blue cheese. I asked for the spicy mayo on the side because I didn't want it to be too saucy or spicy. This burger was not as good as the crown burger because it tasted so buttery and heavy. It was cooked perfectly and once I removed some of the cheese, the buttery-ness subsided, which was good.  +Onion Rings: Best onion rings ever! So glad we got these instead of the truffle fries. The breading was perfectly seasoned and crispy and the ranch and chipotle ketchup were amazing.   -The server disappeared after we got our food and we weren't able to flag her down to get the check for around 20-30 minutes. She tended to the tables around us but never came back for us. The bussers were extremely helpful though.  I would definitely come back but not if I'm in a rush to be anywhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown Burger, loved it
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheeseburger with spicy mayo on the side
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BOMB onion rings! Get this!

7exuq-JGNXd3I4zY-xMPRA.text: Rating: 1.5/5  In a word: overrated. The burgers themselves are solid, but not nearly good enough to justify the wait or the price. I feel like those are a premium just for the Gordon Ramsay name. I had been here once before and thought similarly, but decided to give it a second chance since some friends wanted to go. Nope, that just cemented my opinion to never go again.   But anyways, getting onto the food. For the name alone there's a certain level of expectation, but the food does not impress. Rather than sticking with a more classic burger like the first time, I figured that maybe if I go for a more high end burger then the quality of this place might be able to shine. Big mistake. I ordered the $26 lobster and shrimp burger and if anything it just disappointed me more. The shrimp and lobster flavors were both very muted, it could've been some other type of seafood patty and I wouldn't have been able to tell. Also a little on the dry side. Will have to try another one of his establishments to find something that can live up to the Gordon Ramsay name.

l63lEeg1l3Qrso0Yd9d43A.text: Fantastic burger and truffle fries. I had Hell kitchen burger. The buns are baked perfectly. When biting the burger, you would feel the hardness of the buns exactly right! Besides the buns, the avocado is also amazing, balancing the flavor of meat. Fries with truffle are also beyond my expectations. The most important thing is the prices are affordable! Recommend everyone!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0ygvFxql3hZvGYyPCEerbw.text: I can't believe how much better the service was in comparison to Gordon Ramsey Steakhouse.  Katie (not sure if I spelled your name right) came back regularly to check on us.  Service was friendly and efficient.  Food was amazing.  RASPBERRY TEA  ONION RINGS  PARMESAN TRUFFLE FRUES  LOBSTER SHRIMP BURGER  AHI TUNA SLIDERS W/ SPICY JALAPENOS

cZDD8YOjwDLpSMB1K_3V8g.text: You may be turned off from this place since you have to wait in line for about 30 minutes but let me tell you, it's worth the wait.   We were first skeptical of this place since most gourmet burgers are typically good but how much better can you get by going to this place? TONS!  This place is definitely a must visit... It's a Gordon Ramsey for God's sake.  For starters, the onion rings have a great crisp and flavor.  It is served with home made ketchup and their home made ranch.  They also have a french fry with a curry dip... Delicious!   If you are hesitant on  burger choices, I recommend the Hog burger . Patty made out of beef Chuck, brisket and bacon which is then wrapped in bacon and topped with bacon, BBQ pulled pork, coleslaw, pickles and fried onions!  AMAZING!!!  They also have great shakes and an amazing chocolate dessert as Gordon Ramsey would do.   You definitely have to make it out....SO GOOD!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gU5_yM2XQRXZtnpaqIy9vA.text: Excellent restaurant to sum it up and we've been coming here every time during our last 4 Vegas trips. It is usually about a 40 minute wait but you can venture off and do other things while you wait because you leave your phone number and they will text you when your table is almost ready. It's about $17 a burger and it's relatively cheap for how great the burger tastes. Food is prepared so that you can have enough time to casually talk while waiting for your meal. There is free parking at the Miracle Mile shops making it easy to come here if you wanted to. It's also right by the Las Vegas Blvd Planet Hollywood entrance giving you more easy access from the Strip.

IZseCIomurrx3B1pZSdUqA.text: I recommend the Farm house burger!  Be adventurous and trust the fried egg!.  The Parm fries were also good.

SwD5RPy3QT_EZQai7XIfXg.text: After a long drive, it was nice to find a place to sit down and eat. The line for this place however is ridiculous. It was near closing time and the line went beyond the their fiery design. Luckily we had a card carrying member and we got to skip ahead. The place is good but I think that the popularity is carried by his name. A man who made his name by being mean. The burgers were good but it was the truffle fries that won me over. Stop by if the line is short other wise go on ahead and skip it.

4tWkMxVb-MzqJS6LIaxaPg.text: I love coming here every time I'm in Vegas!  Unfortunately, they changed their menu recently.   I always get the Hells Kitchen Burger! It has a nice heat to it. I always have to share because their burgers are pretty big.   Since they no longer have the gooey fries, I got the kettle chip nachos instead. They were a decent substitute, but still miss them!   The fries are more like steak fries. They had the texture as if the fries have been sitting under a heat lamp. It was crispy but a strange crispy.   Still coming back but I really wish thy bring back the gooey fries!

xEMV_A_mjgbv8e5T_sxaHQ.text: Good atmosphere. The food was DELICIOUS, TASTE WAS excellent,  BEST BURGER in vegas! Get the Hells kitchen burger. You won't regret it. Very happy with the quality of food here, this chefs resturant did not disappoint unlike guy fierries. This one you won't be disappointed that's forsure

eRhT_CzjZ1TdA34Qd128OQ.text: The onion rings, Backyard burger and fish & crisp we're amazing, our server Michelle was the next best thing to the food served..... go to GR Burgers, make sure you ask for Michelle

zD1ETi3aoXH0Cxp33v6X-A.text: Great burgers and top notch service from Kelsey! We had the fish and chips and backyard burger, both were cooked perfectly. Looking forward to come back again!

HYM8hnW4-Vy6aBPdtB8bAg.text: Love this place.  I try to go to Food Network star restaurants when I can to see if they are as good as I would hope.  This did not disappoint.  I ordered the Blue Cheeseburger and Truffle Fries.  Amazing burger (albeit pricey).  If you are debating this venue vs Bobby Flay Burger Palace definitely go to Gordon Ramsay Burger.

l5yxB6E32LsVfQtbDNQqZA.text: This place is sure popular at all times! We waited about an hour and a half to be seated. When we ate here in April (I know, super late review), they were in the process of switching over the menu so the server notified us of a back up in the kitchen and that the food could take up to 45 minutes to come out. Kind of annoying after having waited so long for a table, but whatever. The Tandoori Chicken burger was great. I really liked the vinaigrette. My husband got the U.K. Burger and really enjoyed it as well. We liked the food but felt it wasn't exactly worth the price or long wait. Overall, it's a yummy and trendy celebrity chef restaurant that you should at least try once!

U2i1hVrJXC4QYb9IQlJ3rw.text: My second experience for GR burger actually ended up being a subpar experience.  As where I am paying 4 times higher price per burger, I expected an equivalent service. However, our service was nothing but a disappointment. The server forgot our drinks. Once she brought them she spilled them all over the table and me. Broke a glass on us. Our food was served super late. No one came to really apologize us about the whole awful experience.  The food was alright. The beef was not even juicy to think that i got a steak in between my buns.   Would I come back? Not really unless a friend visiting wants to try it

Zj-zBTvPqOS-WBmUrCee7w.text: Best burger I've ever had! The garlic truffle Parmesan fries are AMAZING!!!! I got the crown burger which was great. Almost got the Hell's Kitchen burger but wasn't too crazy about the jalapenos. The sweet potato fries were so so. Nothing great. My mom got the blue cheese burger and said it was amazing!!! Long wait but so worth it.

pmOG_KMHtjiZVsBmb9IGWw.text: This place is excellent for burgers for sure. I came here after looking at yelp reviews and I must say I am impressed. Good burgers, beers and fries. When I come back to vegas this will definitely be a place to come back to. Long lines but worth waiting for.

3A6Am42hMqzvNWgogtk9xQ.text: 4 times ive visited, and all of the times the food is just above average, i dont understand if people havent eaten a good burger before or are stargazed at the fancy names and ingredients, but the burguers and snacks are truly  just above average. Ive eaten a better burger on the streets of new york and on foodtrucks over in tijuana Mexico. Not a bad place but i will not be coming back, for the price, id rather eat somewhere else.

OPMa2-6LpUEIGJfEhB3SOw.text: Other than the long wait this place was great. We went back 3 times at three different times of the day and the line was still lonngggg. Decided to come back after seeing our last show and waited 30 min to reach the front of the line. This was about 1045pm. Plan ahead if you want to eat here.

-9N4nCcJXDAIxiInCz0oyw.text: Maybe it was the hype, but this place wasn't THAT good. It was a good burger but nothing special, if I'm honest. The staff was good, from the hostess to the waitress to the bussers. I'll probably be back, but I won't be expecting a meal I've become accustomed to from other GR establishments.

h8aMq7aQPVM3HbnGvolpTA.text: I always wanted to visit this restaurant so last night I finally did the waiter whose name is Paul was amazing very friendly the Oreo creme brulee milkshake was also amazing the highlight of the entire meal as far as fries and burgers it was ok I had higher expectations I guess if I do return definitely will try different burger the one I tried was hells kitchen burger since I'm big fan of the show it has something I don't know if it was jalapeno or aioli but some bitter taste my daughter had farm burger she liked it no complaints overall the dessert and the waiter will get 4 stars

QnKn3AqhIdDNVx_GPyekBw.text: My Pick-up Request: After a long work day and several flight delays, we land in Vegas around 9 pm. We planned to pick-up the order and eat in our hotel room.   Right when I got into the taxi, I called the restaurant and asked if I can place an order for pick-up. She said "no, you have to come in and order." When we arrived, we went straight to the restaurant to place the order.   However, the hostess said that I cannot place and order. I had explained that I called 15 minutes ago and was informed that I could. The hostess continue to say that I can only place the order for take-out before 5pm.   This was super frustrating! We were starving. So, we dropped off our stuff and ran down to wait in line for a sit-down meal. We waited in line for 30 minutes and ordered dinner around 11pm. We waited about 30 minutes for our burgers.   We ordered truffle fries, forest burger and blue cheeseburger. Everything was tasty except the forest burger. The forest burger is bland.   After the meal, I'm still annoyed about being misinformed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries

tQuW-dYMq4rd8zyRcK1ypQ.text: The hamburger was one of the most flavorful and juicy burgers I've ever had! Didn't even need any mayonnaise or ketchup! The fries were ok, told my hubby the fries were like a Prius compared to the burger which was like a Cadillac. But wouldn't deter me from going back. Everyone was so tentative, and our waiter was very knowledgeable and friendly. All around great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The burgers were great, very tasty. The fries were ok, didn&#39;t have the same standards as the burgers.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best burger I&#39;ve ever had! So juicy and tasty, a must try.

Cpe1jHubGrWrzih4Hlx3VA.text: I have to say, it's a bit over-rated.  Every time we walked by, there's a long line, so we assumed the food must be damn good.  As a result, we decided to check this out at non peak time so that we didn't have to wait as long.  Our wait indeed wasn't that long but the food disappointed us. We ordered: Farmhouse burger: bacon and patty a bit dry lobster&shrimp burger:  delicious!!!  The best of all we ordered.   backyard burger: dry onion rings: good but nothing to rave about and hellsfire wings:  dry and soggy.  Should have skipped it.   Service was great except for one hostess.    Good thing we didn't have to wait long for a table.  Would probably stick to Bobby burgers instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backyard burger

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse

2R-zO8NyuHUoPMIMNwRBpQ.text: This was an amazing burger !!!!!! Me and my boyfriend both for different ones and they were both awesome. Line was out the door all the days we were down here but we went here in our last night in town and luckily it was no wait. Eat here !!!!

Jb1hrt2AWXZ_4n1U9O-42g.text: The make each burger to order so don't come here hungry. It takes about 30 minutes to get your food. Not bad considering how tasty the food is. We order the Hell's Kitchen burger and the Forest burger with sweet potato fries. The Hell's Kitchen burger is absolutely amazing. Couldn't get enough of that jalapeno flavor. However, in comparison the forest burger was bland and overcooked (asked for medium rare/received more like well done). The question we asked ourselves was "should we have them remake the burger". We ended up just eating the burger because we didn't want to wait another 30 mins for a new burger.

THXOQfeJ2LltN4Z-ouJZ2Q.text: $14 min for your Burger, hot dog or otherwise. It's good, but I've had just as good a burger if not better at places that give you fries with your menu item. We ordered the tuna sliders, parm fries and the bangers and mash. Fries were ok, but a little dry, not made to order. Dipping sauces were the star there. The garlic aioli was fantastic.  The tuna sliders were good, lacked the burst of flavor I think we were hoping and expecting it would have. Bangers and mash was pretty decent, the little potato balls were awesome, the roll the sausages were on were fresh and delicious. I can't complain overall, however - devils always in the details.  That being said the curry dipping sauce I requested on the side had been sitting in the fridge and I had to stir it up a little to be able to dip anything in it.  When you're paying $25-30 for a burger and fries..... I expect little things like that to be right.  It just sort of misses the mark for me.  I've been here before and said the same thing.... I only came back because my sister had never tried the place and wanted to go.  I can't really say that I'll be back.  The novelty is in the name, certainly not the dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bangers and mash
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna sliders

v4GEByLr4DXAowNCR2I9tw.text: Our first night in Vegas for a work event and headed to burger. One of our friends had come here before and raved about it. We waited, maybe 20 minutes,  which wasn't too bad. We all ordered different items and had great service.  But what grossed us all out was that there was a baby cockroach crawling across the floor right by our feet in a walkway for customers and staff.  One busboy saw me see the cockroach, stepped on it, looked back at me with an "oh $hit" look on his face and scooted the cockroach from where he stepped on it towards the kitchen . Yes, the kitchen!! We never spoke to a manager because we were completely grossed out. The food was excellent but the bug issue totally turned us off. Call an exterminator,  Gordon!

2HJMd3QrFzmX2ldW21eX_A.text: OMG! The Wheatberry-Quinoa Salad is the best salad I have ever eaten in my life! Perfect amount of dressing. All flavors complimented each other. Tons of greens, but they were balanced by all of the other vegetables and the delicoius grains in the salad. So I guess I"m saying, it's a very large salad. And it was sooooo good!!! We also had the Hummus and Pitas. Yum!   My husband was in the mood for a salad and so was I. When I suggested we go to Gordon Ramsay's Burger restaurant, my husband was like, "For a salad?!" But he humored me.   After we finished eating, he said that his salad (we both had the same salad) was superb. He really thought a salad at a restaurant that specializes in burgers would be lacking. But he was happliy surprised to find that his salad was really good.  The only downside to this restaurant - and it's a big downside - is that they don't take reservations. So you either have to go very early and wait by the fire sign (not ideal with the Vegas heat), or eat at a time that most people won't be lined up, or just wait as long as it takes. The line was fairly short when we arrived at about 5:30pm on a Saturday night. But it still would have taken about 35 minutes to just be seated and we had a show to catch.   I asked if they could do a takeout order for us instead and they did. That saved us! It was super delicious and I'd eat here again for sure!   The staff were friendly and very helpful. Thanks for an awesome dinner!

rN0rwQ_ZUb0Q_rDKzC2KCw.text: We were a party of 6 and a high chair. The wait was an hour long to be seated. They texted me my table was ready but made us wait another 10 mins. We places our orders and it took another 30-40 mins for our food to be ready. Food was good, but not worth the wait. Plus it was like 16 dollars a burger not including fries or drink. Our tab was 180.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger

4ZgSG0f4_AmZSmyVYRU4-Q.text: Hell's burger was awesome with nice blend of mushroom patty ,jalapeno and avocado. AMAZING Taste

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger

MtkGZF5oUTUKu-P_bfKozA.text: Meh. Ordered burgers and fries and shakes. Waited forever. Food was fine but nothing special. Even for the strip it seemed incredibly overpriced. After the long delay, they got two of the orders wrong, even though nobody ordered anything special. By the time they brought the re-do orders, everyone else had cold food. One of the re-do orders was still wrong. All of this took more than two hours and nothing was above average. Except perhaps the shakes. Those were tasty. The waiter never apologized which seemed tacky and just kept saying it was too loud to hear anything.

Ssnn-fOLkhXa5g7jsiccuQ.text: So I gave Gordon Ramsay's place 3 stars  first just want to mention really was thrilled to eat here heard good things about this place just disappointed about the service they seemed a little unorganized at the front to check in no one explained you can check in with a large party in front until after standing there & realizing there was a sign saying to check in with hostess after being in line for 30 minutes are actual wait to be seated and to get out good turned into 3 hrs our waitress was by far professional & excellent atcwhatvshe does had to get food to go we had somewhere to be Great service by her & Burgers were Bomb !!

X_ybIRbCbB1vFrbAKSAzSw.text: Damn tasty. Excellent burgers and bar food, very friendly staff, upbeat and sporty ambience. Went back twice in one weekend!

aSBv_92KBlQ56BCSvxWtnQ.text: Perfect Burger is Ramsay burger. Nice interior with fire and it looks modern and it's just a burger place shouldn't expect anything else. We tried Tandoori Chicken Burger and Lobster & shrimp burger. Lobster & Shrimp which is a specialty burger which is worth 25$ too pricey but worth the penny. They don't serve any fries with the burger. I tried onion rings they were a bit salty. The tandoori burger was good they made the filling paneer or tofu, cucumber, and some lettuce. Pretty good place to try on the strip.

v7iYtQMZClnbFcc7isZWcA.text: Burgers were awesome! No words for it. Especially the creme brulee shake! We were so full, but the food didnt stop us from having more. It was that good

lq7ur_OOmX5AR-CyPc4_zQ.text: Food  was AMAZING. But service was horrible. The manager greeted us which I thought was very cool. But the front desk ladies, chatted amongst their selves while I stood there, and later after waiting over a half hour for my food... I saw a chef stand in front of me on his phone for like 15 minutes. What the hell? What kind of people  do you employ.?? Disgraceful. Great food doesn't excuse poor environment and staff. Wouldn't return, my time is exponentially more valuable.

NwVLOACgbADrVTzvPaLMbg.text: We were eventually seated and our waitress came over and sat at our table with us to take our order. We received our hummus which was very good and then she came to sit with us again and take our order.  When my wife ordered Med Rare she asked if she's good with red? She said yes and then I ordered and I said would like M R also. They brought out the burgers and truffle fries which were good but underwhelming.  I then took a bite and realized my burger was not just well done but well well done. I asked my wife about hers and she showed me her well done burger. I was in shock since we watch every show that Gordon does and couldn't believe they couldn't get the cook right. Our waitress or I should say order taker took them back to the kitchen. We tried not to eat the fries but figured they would only get cold. The manager brought our burgers back, set them down and asked us to cut into them to make sure they were right. He didn't apologize or say anything about the error and it felt like we were being unreasonable to ask that it be cooked properly. Then he started small talk "what brought you here" etc and said he is the manager if we needed anything. The whole situation was very strange. The burgers were the best burgers we've ever had but would not go back there for all the other nonsense. Thought maybe they would comp a drink or something but should have figured.  We went to Gordon Ramsay Steak and had the best food and service you can imagine.

QPvtSHfzjXwzZetwTgNljA.text: Favorite burger place ever! Get the hell's kitchen if you can handle spice, you won't be disappointed! :)

8jUBq19Z2ER0AMBg0gGDkQ.text: The Blue cheese burger was delicious. Lots of flavour. I thought the parm truffle fries could have had more truffle flavour. Service was fast and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8DSW-8u8xgfFQl7sHk4XQg.text: Really this should be five stars for the food and one star for the front staff. Had to come back a second day just to get in because the wait time was hour and a half at 10:30 at night! Not going to wait that long that late even for Ramsey food! We did get a txt in half an hour but had gone elsewhere. How could they be that far off?!? Anyway, second try same dumb staff out front who could barely understand simple questions! Geez! If Ramsey knew you know what he would say! Food worth all the bother. Totally memorable! I will never look at a burger again without thinking of the one I had. Cooked to perfection. Truffle fries were incredible. I will come back again. If you go, go before 5PM. We had practically no wait with a party of 3.

I gave it 4 stars only because we were waiting for our food and no one came to check in on us or give us any updates until we basically got our food.

G7NqnT_960T4SZAzaVZU5w.text: I highly recommend this place. The burgers are pricey but once you indulge in the flavor, you know it's money well spent.

7oZjRRQatvTtqfJftidGyw.text: We took an Uber to specifically eat here because we were craving a good burger. we arrived at 11:30 and they close at midnight. They turned us away because "the kitchen is having issues" however people were still not served their food so what kind of issues would this be? I spoke to the manager who said they can't keep up with business and have long ticket times so they had to close early. What kind of restaurant of this name in Vegas understaffs their cooks and closes early?

KQYckUhJLnV3apbIIs-uxg.text: Let me start by saying I'm not huge into burgers I usually like more of a foodie scene but this was great!  We had a bit of a wait but the food was worth it.  Loved the fries with curry sauce and the Forest burger was delicious. Hell's Kitchen burger was really good too (could have had a bit more of a kick).  I loved all the British touches, being a Brit all all, with the decor and menu, super fun!

iiDeoDBY0_jg2_nQEUcI4g.text: Over priced burger, fries are extra. Didn't care about that...burgers are just ok I've had better.

w1vPHaBdf2h3oC5Fz6Mr8Q.text: Best burger joint in town! Huge fan of Gordon Ramsay, and I was not disappointed in any aspect of this restaurant from the food quality to customer service. We had an AMAZING bus boy/servers helper, his name was Caleb Henry and just exceeded mine and my groups expectations. We never had an empty drink, and when we asked for something we had it within seconds. He truly made our experience 10x better, he deserves a promotion and then some!!!

xYPtd3JlAY02_3BqxaHvyA.text: So sad... one of my favorite Las Vegas stops has gone to dumpster. For several years now I have made a tradition of eating here when in town for our annual trade show. This time was just so bad! First of all, after waiting in line for thirty minutes (understandable in the past) we were seated. Then it was no less then 15 minutes before a server came to our table. After we placed our order it took 40 minutes to get our food and even then the order was wrong. I asked to speak to the manager and instead of taking responsibility, which he should have (since these are management issues), he walked away saying he wanted to talk to the server. She returned with a check which instead of comping our meal or at the very least removing the entree that was wrong, he had the waitress remove the automatic 20% gratuity. Just so bad. If Gordon Ramsey new what was going on, heads would roll. We tipped the waitress anyway and left a tip for the manager (a note about what an ahole he was!"

InuGnwEaLotZ86ZJhW9ZKA.text: I went here for lunch with my son a few months back and have been meaning to write a review. I got the Farmhouse burger and some sweet potato fries... and my son got the Big Dawg. Mind you my child is 6 and took down this humongous hot dog. The little bit that he let me try was delicious. Now my burger... OMG. This burger guys. This burger? OMG. I just about died and went to burger heaven if south a place exists. The Dubliner cheese and the duck bacon and the fried egg just blended so well together that I could've ordered another had I not been trying to watch my calories. This place is definitely worth a try and worth the wait if there's a line out the door like there was when we went.

They didn't seem to care!

0bf1wuK62dv2mZqhVhRCiw.text: This place was great. Truffle fries a crown burger and a beer. Meat was perfectly cooked and the buns felt and tasted like they were made just for our burgers. Some say it's hard to f up a burger.... but it happens all the time. Over cooked... stale bread... yuk.  But not here! Perfectly done! Cheers Gordon. We will return!

Wly9CIW0cYY1P030QDd3VA.text: Have eaten at Burger many times and each time the line gets slower along with the service.  Tried to dine there this Sunday since we had two hours before leaving for flight; waited 15 minutes in line even tho many tables open, it was 11:45 in the morning! Once seated, placed our order when we sat down then waited and watched ppl be seated after us and get served . After 40 minutes we walked out.  I don't care how great the burgers and for the price.... but no burger is worth the lack of service.

WwHWskLBTa43BBk4WnvHMw.text: There are plenty of places to eat while in Vegas. Competition is fierce and relentless. The masses dictate the survival or death of an establishment with their thumbs, like back during the Roman days of the coliseum. One key to unlock the success of a restaurant is to appeal to the majority and even offer a selection that simply can change ones mind about a dish or entree. Gordon Ramsey's Burger has done that. I hate onion rings. I've never been attracted to the concept of wasting batter on an ingredient that's used as a topping or for just flavor. I absolutely love these onion rings! They are by far the showcase menu item to me because the level of excellence it presents overshadows the delicious and decadent selections of burgers that the famous F-you chef's menu offers. Cheers to you sir!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fLFWMijkemEWrpW81_SyNA.text: Great food and great wait staff! Long wait time but for good reason and worth it. The appetizer and burgers were cooked perfectly and the portion was just what we needed to feel full. The interactive tap list was pretty helpful as well.

ffh3pa_ISd14Ja_PtvfpJA.text: The burger place is excellent the burgers are fairly expensive but it's worth the price they try to do a very good job with the french fries really interesting twist on it I would try it out and don't let cost for a burger Scare you off

5zfdTbZy551_h_EyXgNP4A.text: Me and my husband were in Vegas for couple of days. And every time we're in Vegas we always indulge in bomb A$$ top of the line juicy burger. And we like to try different burger joint every time we're in town. So this time around we decided to try " GORDON RAMSAY BURGER " located in planet Hollywood.   We got there, got seated right away. Atmosphere was just an ordinary topical restaurant nothing fancy or anything. Only eye appealing was the fire place, which made it more formal.  We ordered ~  Truffle fries - thick cut, not much flavor, came out kinda cold. Not a fan :/  My husband got the Hells Kitchen Burger W/ Bacon - he rather have 5 guys burger all day long  I got me the ultimate Burger-  lack flavor and meat was dry even when I ordered it Med rare   Over all I was expecting more from this burger joint sense it is Gordon Ramsay. But there was no party or firework in our mouth. Wasn't satisfied and not worth $70. Like my husband said 5 guys are better and it's half the price.  Sorry Gordon Ramsay but you're burger and fires need re-vamping. Ney :/

e4j4JQV0CsSUaE7UXwCnsg.text: Great variety of burgers with lots of flavor, perfectly cooked. The blue cheese burger was phenomenal. My colleague had the farmhouse and said the egg was perfectly cooked as was the burger. Good IPAs on tap. Truffle fries would have benefitted from some more crisping.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese burger (also with manchego, fig jam, caramelized onions, apple cider vinegar reduction) in a lettuce wrap.

CL7iYhig7ljJI8jrr0bp2A.text: Gordon's Ramsay burger is a great burger at Vegas prices. When you trying to live big but not too big this place is worth the try. Sometimes your just down for a burger even if we are all "idiot sandwiches." Without the need to cook it ourselves.   Ambiance wise this place is casual, it's Vegas fancy but no need for coat service here. Just rock and roll in your bro tank or your party dress. It's somewhat loud but what do you expect it's Vegas. You can keep a decent conversation with your buddies as long as they're only 3 feet away.   Service here is good. It's not mind blowing but these people are busy. You get the menu take a few scans and pick what you want. Our server recommended some pretty good beers to go with our burgers so kudos on being a step up.   Now let's get to the meat and buns oh and the spuds! We got the the poutine appetizer, pleasing to the eye and even more to the taste buds. The gravy was delicious the fries crunchy yet soft and the meat oh so tender. Sad face no huge cheese curds so those from the cold north might be a bit turned off. We opted for the foie gras burger and the forest burger.  The foie gras burger had a perfect medium rare and with a nice little creaminess from the foie. It was also slightly citrusy which was great for all the richness.  The forest burger with its duck bacon and tremor cheese(goat cheese) was a barn door classic. I'm not a huge fan of goat cheese but after a few bites I was really enjoying the burger. The burgers here are medium sized. This ain't a whatburger and it's about quality vs quantity. Oh yah the truffle fries. The fries themselves were good but the homemade ketchup and the truffle aioli are the cherry on top of the French fry pie.   Overall this place is a great experience. It's a taste of Ramsay without the fuss of the higher up places. Enjoy a bite a beer and create some great memories. Take some pics and enjoy these burgers they are more than "adequate"

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PVI0tQ5NkdwlqI_DZJmxMQ.text: My experience here was excellent. The line at the front can be deceivingly long, so ask the front ahead of time if you're concerned as their prediction was pretty accurate.  We tried the wings for an appetizer. Thought it was weird there was no dipping sauce at first but despite the wings being hot it wasn't off-putting to where I needed a dip.  Burger was excellently cooked and tasted great, and the truffle fries had an amazing flavor.  Been here twice, always love to bring people when they are visiting.

Uoxzkuh85D_xrXz5lLQ4lg.text: Like many, I love Gordon Ramsay however this is a very over-rated place not worthy of his name.   The Burger is slightly above average but nothing special and the fries were not great.    In addition, our waitress went home and no one came over to check on us while we waited seemingly forever for the bill....very weird process and not good for the customer experience.    If you are deciding between this place and LV Burgers, go to LV Burgers... they have OUTSTANDING Burgers and service.

Fb1w4mLFV6XMH2WtD10_JQ.text: To sum up it was okay. One time experience yes but not sure that i will make a point to return. I've definitely had better in other burger joints.   I had farmhouse burger and truffle oil fries. Keep in mind that it takes about 20 to 30 mins for your burger.  They dont tell you this. I overheard next table complaining about the long wait and only then the server "reminded" them. We were not in a rush so didnt mind the wait but would not recommend if you're on the clock for this reason.  The same server carried some of that frustration with her when she took our order which was noticeable though i think she did try to brush off.  As far as cooking the burger pattie to your order i.e. medium in my case that was done well.   Though i did enioy the unique combo of truffle oil on my fries i could tell that it was just sprayed over on the top portion of the fries as once you work your way through it was just regular fries nothing special.  The portion was generous though.  Overall i just felt that it was all about the celebrity chef hype that did not really live up to anything spectacular.

3C3CA10fvBkAus79eAFo7g.text: I ordered the Hells' Kitchen burger and the truffle Parmesan fries. I really do like my burger. I gave it a 5 stars. The fries is just ok. Wish they cut the fires thinner and had less Parmesan to make it more crunchy  and less salty.  The service is pretty nice with friendly attitude and the restaurant is pretty nice and clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan fries @flightofthefoodie
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells&#39; Kitchen Burger @flightofthefoodie

Ke4TV0OGx5e4_f5miGo43Q.text: Awesome place, quite a wait, even being Platinum. Prob mean that this is popular spot. Staying in Cosmopolitan, but walked all the way here for this amazing burger. Lobster and shrimp Burger

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yAQT2U-Pr9PXOaXC08Kwxw.text: We've eaten here a few years ago but it looks like that Yelp page has been closed so I guess a new review is in order.  While they don't take reservations, if you get there early enough, the line is maybe a 10-15 minute wait. This is absolutely one of our favorite restaurants in Vegas. I don't think you can go wrong with any burger at this place but I've got to recognize the Ultimate Cheeseburger, which is my go to item. The buns are quality, the burger is juicy and flavorful, and it has three kinds of cheeses mixed together in what can only be described as my version of heaven. My husband had the Lobster/Shrimp burger which has a shrimp/lobster type patty and pickled veggies on it. It's really a different option then the traditional burgers.   Lastly, you need to get one of their milkshakes. We didn't last time we were there so we made a point to try the Oreo Creme Brulee Shake on this trip. It is so rich and the flavor is better then just your average oreo shake because of the creme brulee pudding on the top. The cocktails we had were also on point. I don't remember what they were called but the white sangria I ordered was our favorite because it had this really nice cinnamon after taste. Do not miss this restaurant!

d4RQhcRYe104erN9u_FVAA.text: Love love this place .. hamburgers are worth every penny.. Will be going back .. The atmosphere was perfect too . All I can say is go try this place ..

nHAkopIvFz7ggwj6dDtGwg.text: Yum! Food did not disappoint! Would be 5-stars but our food was terribly behind schedule. Our waitress was nice about it, but essentially blamed the kitchen and didn't offer to comp anything. I wonder what Gordon Ramsay would say?

tQgU2oBHK2D9D0wHe_v7hg.text: Service was fantastic, I can't lie and they were super busy (at least 50 people waiting in line)   So I know GR will never read this. And I'm sure he's making fat stacks off this place. But it fucking sucks. I'm sorry. It's all fucking fluff and shit like that pisses me off big time.   Burgers are small. They don't taste super awesome (I understand it's just a burger), it's mostly the condiments that make the burgers taste ok.   Fries ! Mistake mistake MISTAKE. Regular fries & truffle fries suck huge monkey balls. Ever been to fat burger and gotten fat fries? They're cooked all the way through right? Here, no one's fries were cooked all the way. They "looked" pretty but tasted super bland, yes even the truffle ones.   I paid 8 dollars for a popsicle. The creme fraiche tasted ok. But like come on, I didn't pay 8 bucks for a tiny lick of creme fraiche bro bro.   We had a party of 15. Again, our service was fam-fucking-tastic. But this place is all hype and no substance. I tried a bite of wings, bite of hot dog and if I could give this place zero stars (based on their food, I would)  Go to Morton's steakhouse and get their prime burger for the same price. It's better and bigger.

ESMLDOLHKS-KUjXRYPoirg.text: Came here 20 minutes before closing and sat at the bar. The host greeted us and was friendly. The bar server was cool and attentive.  The hell's kitchen burger which is there best seller was soooo good. I added an egg which cost 3 bucks extra.  Their shakes are awesome. Their caramel with pecan sounds super sweet but wasn't too sweet at all.  Their oreo tiramisu shake is the bomb! definitely a must get if you're not on a calorie count lol

yD89kY7-5B8hzmr9kHBROw.text: Simple request I asked for my burger with no bun to be placed on a salad. This Allows the juices from Burger to flavor the salad. What I received is A thin slice of lettuce under my food. The Duck poppers are hollow greasy and gross. Not a fan!

RZSr2FH-YwOH5cg2gQ7fpA.text: I had wanted to eat here for some time and now I must say how disappointed I was.  Everything was so salty.  The truffle fries were pure salt.  Hamburger was very good if you could overlook the salt.  As critical Gordon Ramsay appears on TV he should monitor his restaurants better.  A salt lick was just about an equal.

ZRjVvzcdgKtVswTux00Bhw.text: Hell's Kitchen burger is the Best burger I've had in my life period!!! Strongly recommend this place!

9wjz0caeJ0Iqpjk8RUHcZg.text: I got the lamb burger and it was pretty decent and the truffle fries. I'll rate this a 3.5 because the food is DECENT, but certainly pretty expensive for $35 for a burger and fries (plus tip). The wait on the line certainly doesn't justify the cost of the place and the service is just mediocre.

t3n0AulaT-99ICkl-CYRnw.text: After watching a concert at Planet Hollywood, I was starving! When we saw Gordon Ramsay Burger had no line, my friend and I decided to grab dinner here. We walked in on Wednesday, May 10th around 11:30pm. We were seated immediately at their counter with a view of the kitchen. A friend joined us later and we were able to grab an extra seat.  *Beer Battered Onion Rings: parmigiano-reggiano, chipotle ketchup, cheddar ranch dip ($9) *Hell's Kitchen Burger: asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes, jalapeno pesto aioli ($15) *Ultimate Cheeseburger: aged provelone, dublinar, boursin ($15) *"Foie" Burger: pate foie gras, chevre, port wine aioli, frisee ($21) *Truffle Parmesan Fries ($11) *Just Fries ($8) *Black Butte ($9) *Coors Light Draft ($8) 2 *Guinness Draft ($8)  I got the foie burger with truffle fries. I should have read the description closer as I thought it was going to come with seared foie. Instead, it was a foie pate. It probably would have been fine, but paired with the chevre, the burger was too rich. And not in a good way as the chevre added a tanginess I didn't like. It also seemed like the cheese and foie were fighting each other instead of complementing each other. I did enjoy the truffle fries, but I think it's hard to mess those up. We'd been drinking all day, so I just decided to get a couple Coors Light. It was easy to drink. The boys got the rest of the food and thought everything was okay. Not worth the price was the consensus.  I don't mind paying more for a good burger, but these are just okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guinness Draft ($8) &amp; Coors Light Draft ($8)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate Cheeseburger: aged provelone, dublinar, boursin ($15)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just Fries ($8)

XiKbGgIkXuQNcFY1hh1W_w.text: Actually, the server, Ronnie, I believe her name is, deserves 100 stars- the food- not the best. If it wasn't for the professionalism of the server, I would have felt generous giving this 1 star!!! I had ordered this lobster/seafood burger which actually stunk!!! I couldn't get the fork past my nose to eat it, if I had wanted to!!! The server was AMAZING!!! She returned it to bring me back a cheeseburger which was totally on the dry-side and lacked flavor. However, back in-the-day, there use to be these delicious salami fries which were amazing that is no longer on the menu- a real shame!!! Bring back salami fries!!!

zgDl9GDXIw6XzpMSu6BhVg.text: By far the best burger I ever tried. I had the Stout burger and my Husband had the Farmhouse burger and we both shared some Truffle and Parmesan fries. The staff was friendly and the service excellent. A must try.

0kLo6tE_jVsImGBpIl4Kuw.text: Best burger I have ever had in my life, period! As a die-hard In-N-Out fan, I used to view Burger as a fast and convenient eat. After trying Gordon Ramsay Burgers, it totally changed the way how I used to perceive Burgers, I had never thought Burgers could be this delicious. I was totally awed by their creativity in combining so many different ingredients to make each burger so unique and delicious. This is not only making a burger, but this is also making an art!   During my stay in Vegas, I had the opportunities to try the following:  1. Farmhouse Burger(Rating 5/5)-The bun which grilled over the apple wood has a slight sweet taste to it and combines so well with beef, cheese,duck bacon and egg. This is a very traditional style burger can be served in many places, but the way Gordon Ramsay does it and the ingredients used making it THE BEST!  2. Lobster and Shrimp Burger(Rating 4.5/5)-The pickled vegetables, aioli combined with the lobster and shrimp patty was incredible. You get the taste of the sweetness and sourness of the pickle vegetables and the ocean taste of the shrimp and lobster all in one bite. The only downside is that the shrimp flavor overshadowed the lobster.  3. Hog Burger(Rating 4.5/5)-The pork patty combined with bacon tasted very juicy, tender and crunchy at the same time and the pickled cucumbers gives a slightly sour taste. Very very good.  4. Just Fries(Rating 5/5)-The potatoes they used were so fresh, clearly hand cut, not frozen and were fried perfectly. It comes with two different sauces: traditional tomato sauce and the spicy tomato sauce, both you can tell easily are home made and both taste are OUT OF THIS WORLD when you dip in the fries. I have never had any fries this delicious before.  The price is significantly steeper than a fast food chain like In-N-Out or Shake Shack, but I believe the quality and the taste made it worth every penny.   I sincerely wish Gordon Ramsay Burger can be opened in LA one day. I will definitely be back when I'm in Vegas again.
