Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just Fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse Burger

Lp98tyhIRom3NzutBNrhHQ.text: For starters, you shouldn't have to wait an hour for your food at 3:00 pm on a Monday, plus 30 minutes to even be seated. But besides the wait, the burgers are overpriced and bland. The French fries are disgusting, and the atmosphere is loud and boring. Do not recommend.

zmBxfVkY9PfuhlbghdSGGA.text: Excellent quality burgers at a high price.  If I'm paying this much for a burger, I expect the quality that Gordon Ramsay Burger brings to the table. Each bite is full of richness. I also really liked their truffle fries.  We put our name down on the waitlist and ended up waiting about 2 hours. Fortunately, Gordon Ramsay Burger takes down your phone number and you will receive a text to make your way back to the restaurant. Since it's located in the Planet Hollywood Miracle Mall, you can shop while waiting to be called. Once you get the text, your entire party has to present itself and you will have to wait in a line at the front of the restaurant for a bit.  --  taste / 5 aesthetics / 5 vibe / 5 service / 4 price for quality / 3 OVERALL / 4.4

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GeXLIaUHYfQe0jhBpZOMKA.text: Over the years I've watched Gordon Ramsay on his show, "Hell's Kitchen" on Fox. I started to get less and less interested in watching reality TV but that never stopped me from trying one of his Vegas restaurants. I know Hells Kitchen just opened at Caesar's Palace but I was dying to try Gordon Ramsay Burger at Planet Hollywood. I was on a budget so I strictly ordered the classic Gordon Ramsay Burger with fries and just a glass of water.   Whenever I passed by the restaurant, the line was almost out the door. Thank, God I only had to wait 10 minutes and with the bar having open seating. I quickly stay down right away when there was an open spot. I didn't bother ordering anything else but the Gordon Ramsay Burger. Honesty, it wasn't excellent or below expectations. Maybe because I'm use to having gourmet burgers so it's hard to tell the difference. Let's just say the burger was cooked just right, juicy and tender. I'd comeback here to try other items on the menu. Now I can finally cross off the Gordon Ramsay Burger off my Vegas list.

zvp8nREcWGswh7QyVGIX7Q.text: Had to try this place when I was in Vegas. Have to say I was a little disappointed. The burger wasn't seasoned at all. The Parmesan fries were really good though. Very near flame decor on the outside.

rFwaQnmSVTmvwd-tZIg-aA.text: Disappointed. With such an iconic chef's name attached to this place, we had such high expectations. Unfortunately, the burgers were good, but just not worth the price. While the service was excellent, from the hostess to our server, it is challenging to pay that much for the burgers. My brother and father both had the Backyard Burger which were good, but nothing special. Thick like an Applebee's cheesburger. Both said that a portion of their burger was salty. This may be because each patty is handmade. My mother had the Portobella Burger which she liked, particularly the mushroom, but again, there was saltiness to her burger. I enjoyed the Blue Cheeseburger. The flavors were good, specially the combination of cheese with fig jam. We ordered one Pepsi and one order of Parmesan Fries. But I cannot justify dropping around $100 for four burgers. Again, the food was unique, but average.

2zGaZvcH3M21aSdrpQm8cQ.text: Tourist trap!   For $75.00 you can get two cheeseburgers, one order of fries, and two beers.    The cheeseburgers were above average, I guess.   The fries were nothing to write home about - I was surprised that they were not good/dry and cold.   The location is in a mall.     Eh....it is what it is....a popular television chef with a sit down fast food restaurant...it is what it is...overpriced and not so good.

JZdlqrRZUFF15hIquGQG3Q.text: Absolutely love Gordon Ramsay but this was a miss.  It was our second time here and I'm not sure we will go again. The burgers were pretty good, the poutine was odd and the corn appetizer also seemed disorganized.  My main complaint is that when the runner delivered our entrees she literally pushed the dirty appetizer plates out of the way and left them there. The manager was patrolling  the dining room and never did a thing about it even though he stood beside our table at least 3 times.  Our service was nice and mostly attentive except when our entrees came we didn't see him for about 10 minutes and 2 of our drinks were empty.  It's a basic of good service to clear dirty plates ASAP from the table and ours literally sat there the entirety of our meal.  Maybe have a refresher on the basics even though this is a burger place as our bill for 3 was over $140.

hEOE5hU9GGFilSe1css4Ng.text: We came here around 10pm on Memorial Day weekend & were pretty excited to try it out since everyone had said it was amazing. We were seated within 10 minutes and a waiter came to take our order shortly after. We decided to share a burger and couldn't decide between the farmers or the Hell's Kitchen burger so the waiter told us to try the Hell's Kitchen burger and add an egg for $3. We also ordered a cheddar ale soup. The servers seemed to be gossiping amongst themselves the whole time; we were seated near the kitchen area so we could see & hear everything such as which tables sent their food back & which tables were complaining, etc because the servers were talking pretty loudly. Also, our food took forever to come out; I think we waited for at least half an hour for our one burger to arrive at the table. By the time it arrived, we were so hungry that we didn't even notice that they had forgotten our egg until we were almost done with the burger. We informed our server & he looked at our food and asked if we wanted to get the egg now -- obviously we didn't because we only had a few bites of burger left -____- the cheddar ale soup was good but a little too salty. The burger itself was pretty good, but the overall experience and wait was blahhh.

uELya4qAlNKV0bTGmH7MVg.text: Burgers were cooked to how we wanted them to be. It is a bit flavorful for children whose palates are not well rounded. We enjoyed the burnt ends poutine vs the ones we actually tried in Canada.

F5X-9Rx-Tpg061g7p1D6CQ.text: This place was amazing! You have to wait about 20-30 minutes for the burger but completely worth it. I had the blue cheese burger and my husband had the Hell's Kitchen burger. Both were phenomenal. We also had the truffle fries and the onion rings which were completely worth it. I highly recommend it!

12r6zvqZ53ohf2K_vNqw8g.text: Worth the wait. Burgers are made to perfection. The milkshakes are to die for; make sure you save room for it!

3ORWksINSKcyQPs_v2Zm9g.text: Hog burger are crazy good. I'm not a fan of bluecheese so bluecheese burger (in my opinion) is not that crazy yummy. Every piece in the burger makes it worth with the price. Pork meat in hog burger is thick. Pickles are homemade fresh and unique taste. I don't like pickles in general but pickles in hog burger are bomb. Veggie in bluecheese burger is fresh. 2 appetizers (fries with curry souce and mushroom poutine something) are ok but not crazy good.   Service is decent. Waiting line is not bad (I got the table right away when I got there. I came there around 7ish Sunday night). Location is easy to find and decoration in there looks nice.  Worth to try at least one time in your life!

RaabytN1FAcszJAYUWcClA.text: Best burger I have ever had in my life. My friend recommended me this place and I didn't understand what all the hype was about. As we walked into Planet Hollywood there was a line (an hour wait). We put our names down and walked around for a while. Once seated we looked through the menu and I eyed the Hell's Kitchen burger. My friends all opted for different burgers and we ordered some truffle fries for the table. My burger was cooked to perfect and the cheese was perfect too. Something about the sesame bun just made it even better. Our table ate the fries so fast, so I'll tell you now...its a must!!! This place won't disappoint you with its good service, clean environment and amazing food.

d5yjZ-Uo1TXeo2CCX_CnDw.text: Great burger. The restaurant is nice and the service is great. I had the hell's kitchen burger which was cooked perfectly.  The jalepenos did more for the burger flavor wise rather than making it spicy. I also would reccomend the onion rings which are big enough to share.

m_I45PqTY9_3tG0toNsqSQ.text: Long line - be prepared. Over an hour for a table of 2. Great service. Onion rings were the star of the show. Get a side of jalepeno aioli- it's life changing. Burger was good but I've had better.

Si6mazV_cU7c33_NY92tvA.text: Been excited to get here when I made it to Vegas. Thank god that I was not disappointed. Yes he delivered so much that my girlfriend and I went back later that night. The scout burger truffle fries and the buffalo blue cheese wing dings was a bomb. I will be back.

dza_jUomZAFatAcjgFy6UA.text: It's a good burger place but fries have little to say for themselves and bar tenders are not the best

BPNwDMPPYIDnQqBSOnvVQQ.text: Good food slow. It took 30 minutes for a burger at 9:30 at night. Multiple seats open throughout space. The restaurant group that operates this is obviously capitalizing on a name already stretched thin. I respect the man but for f$#ks sake 30 mins for a simple burger.  Nice atmosphere  Staff is friendly for such a busy space Food is good...beer is cold  Just have time on your hands.

eV_bmpruG94S_XFhXEb7Uw.text: So delicious!!!!! Two of us and we were seated within 5 minutes! No wait yay! Ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and the ultimate cheeseburger *added lettuce, tomato, onion and pickles. No complaints! So yummy! Our table server Ian was awesome, super sweet!

zR40FXR24wnnAhK0p-yNHw.text: Atmosphere here is top notch, and you can expect a long wait if you miss the opening time. Walking in, the restaurant reminds you on multiple level that it's a Gordon Ramsay restaurant (maybe to hypnotize your taste buds).   As most, this place was on our bucket list but we were half prepared that it was mostly hype. And, we were right.  Granted the meat, condiments and buns (wish it was warm but more on the cold side) were fresh. Although the burger we wanted was suppose to be medium rare, it could've use another minute on the grill.  Be forewarn that their foie gras burger is actually a "SPREAD", not a foie gras patty. Knowing this we still gave it a shot. Knowing it's a spread we still couldn't taste the foie gras, perhaps because the bleu cheese was too over powering. If there was a must try burger, go for the Anniversary Burger (it's not on their menu) and their Seafood burger.   As for the appetizers, the onion rings are the best of all the bunch. The wings with bleu cheese didn't work for me. The Nacho's was made with fresh chips, but for some reason the meat, sour cream and everything else didn't mesh together. The white truffle french fries was unique and worth a try if you must have french fries.  Their shakes were on the overly sweet side to the point where the kids didn't even finish half.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

feAuD5_e_vTjSxO5RHLk1w.text: We ordered the poutine fries which we really enjoyed for their rich gravy yet acidic slaw condiment on top to balance it out. The onion rings are a must order...fresh and accompanied by a cheddar ranch dipping sauce and a sriracha ketchup.  The burgers were flavorful, juicy, and the condiments well thought out.  Thank you, Chef Ramsay and staff, for a great experience!

GpFzw7tTK9pqt0L2vz8usQ.text: Just an FYI: this restaurant is located in Planet Hollywood. Now for my review:  My husband loooves Gordon Ramsay. Lately he's been watching reruns of Kitchen Nightmares, and I've been trying to avoid hearing it in the background (yuck!). When we were staying in Vegas, I knew we had to go to one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. If you're dining at Burger, there'll likely be a line. We waited for about 20-30 minutes, and were offered a seat at the bar and we took it. The line seemed to die down around 10 pm (on a Sunday night).   Yes, this is a splurge. You're paying for the experience of eating at a celebrity chef's restaurant. That said, my burger was outstanding. I had the U.K. burger and it was honestly one of the best burgers I've had, if not the best. It had fresh green arugula and chutney on it. I'm not sure if they grow their arugula, but as someone who's currently growing lettuce, it usually only looks and tastes as fresh as it did if it was harvested recently. The other standout of the night was the white sangria. It was amazing. It has apple, pear, and cinnamon - just fantastic!  I'm only knocking off a star, because of a few things:  - I wasn't a fan of my husband's Hell's Kitchen burger. The flavor was just odd to me. - The online menu needs to be updated. - I wasn't a fan of the sweet potato fries. Maybe I wished they were more savory. They were kind of sweet, but not like dessert. It seemed like they were having an identity crisis.  Otherwise, if we're in Vegas again I might have to come back for the U.K. burger!

q1Xmykhe4aGrFapfbCXBkg.text: Been here twice. It was amazing the first time but mediocre the second. Make sure you order the burger medium cause it's a mixture of like 3 different animals that cook differently so it comes together and cooks well together at medium.

LFBahFeP8DNlaZmjgZX87Q.text: After watching the Dear Evan Hansen musical at the Smith's Center, it was pretty late.  Gordan Ramsey Burger closes at 2 am on Saturday so it worked out great!  It is located in the Planet Holleywood hotel on the strip.  Look for the huge fire burning restuarant entrance sign, it was so cool!    One of the best burgers I have ever had!!  I ordered the Bluecheese Burger and let me tell you, each bite I took was so satisfying.  The bluecheese and fig sread went so well together along with thhe arugula.  I ordered medium on my beef patty and it was cooked to perfection.  The entire burger went well together, so tasty, tender, and delicious.  The bun is super soft and sort of just melts together with everything else.  The truffle fries were really good too.  One order of truffle fry is enough to share between two.  They weren't stingy on the parmesan cheese either which I liked.  The girlfriend ordered the Ultimate Burger and she agrees that it is really good.  She wasn't feeling to well and had half a burger left for the next day.  She lightly warmed it up the next day and it was still just as good.    Service was great.  Our waitress was nice and friendly.  Prices are reasonable and totally worth my money.  We spent about 46 bucks before tips, but we only had water.  Still I think the price is good for the high quality burger.  I totally recomment you check this place out if you are looking for an amazing burger.  I will definately be returning to this place again!

qGj_JFgvbXMTgO3s7yJP9A.text: Wow...  burgers are so good.. It is pricy but very tasty...  I ordered Hell's  burger and Farmers burger with Putine  fries and Truffle fries...  The door opens at 11 am but already long line was formed...  I would say at least 30 people waiting in line..  Luckily I was 3rd person in line.  In the beginning dining area was empty but in minutes, whole place was filled up.  Hell's burger was very spicy... So if you can't handle hot spicy food, I don't recommend.  However, Farmers burger is good for every age.  Uncooked york of the egg makes burger more juicer and nicely blends with the patty.  Putine fries are nothing like the ones I ate in Canada..  It was totally different but visual, and taste is something you must try...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-JRZWQMqw-G2IsykxzsVZQ.text: Decent burger, a bit overpriced for what you get.  You get a 10x better burger accross the street at Hexx  (easily the best burger in town... even..) in Paris for half the price.

K1WpDA85oI1gL-L3KQx1EA.text: If you like burgers, you'll love this place. The menu is limited so if you don't want one of the unique burgers, you may want to skip this place. We've had almost everything on the menu at this point and our only complaint is that there's no regular, plain old ketchup for the fries.  Compared to the Gordon Ramsey restaurant in Caesars, this place shines.  Plan on standing in line during peak times.

rzURijegxGBPUtxL8DHLzA.text: 3.5 stars. On the last day of our trip, my husband and I decided to give the line a shot. 30 mins before opening, we began to line up. We were the first to be seated and first to have our burgers served. Although we were the first, it still took 30 mins for the burgers to be mad after we placed our order! Def pack your patience and don't come too hungry!   Lobster and shrimp burger - saw it on "Worth It" Buzzfeed channel aka basically  what we came for. In sum, it reminded me of eating a bunch of shui mai  (dim sum dumplings) sandwiched into a burger. Not exactly how I imagined it.. tasted fine but a little plain to be honest. With pickled  carrots as the only topping, it became boring almost immediately.   Hells Kitchen's burger - traditional burger with jalapenos chili and avocado slices - tasty but compared to Holstein's the night before, it was pretty forgettable. Safe choice for those trying out Gordon Ramsey's burger for the first time though - original flavor with a slight twist.   Sweet potato fries - game changer! - going to start dusting all my fries in powdered sugar.   Overall - good burger but definitely not worth the ridiculous line/wait line.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and shrimp burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells kitchens burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and shrimp burger

vXMsvbuQX7leGul0SuBl7w.text: The burgers here are phenomenal. You'll eat every last bite! It was kind of annoying that fries were separate. One order of fries is enough for two though. We had sweet potato fries which were also amazing.   For the atmosphere, it's a bit cramped and loud but it is in the middle of the casino.

-8FYpgrFGIfwKcFy1Hc6kw.text: Holly Molly! I don't eat too many Burgers but... I will take Gordon Ramsay home with me forever!!!  Prime location in the Strip within the Planet Hollywood hotel. There are enough servers to take good care of the hundreds of people that have the pleasure to stop by in a daily basis.  I ordered the Blue Cheese Burger ($15) with Manchego cheese, figgy Jam, arugula, took off the Spicy Mayo and it was GLORIOUS!  The patty was perfectly cooked, it was juicy and tender but not runny, the Figgy Jam was sweet and was the perfect combination with the Blue Cheese chunks.   I also had the Truffle French Fries ($12). Steak fries, crunchy outside but soft in the inside.   The servers were welcoming and very attentive.    I will come back while in exciting Las Vegas.   Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue Cheese Burger $15 with Figgy Jam and w/o Spicy Mayo. It was incredibly good, I love the contrast in between the cheese and the jam.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon Ramsay!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burger Menu! Superb!

nnMJnB0LAc-u--OPd2MaxA.text: Arrived there super hungry, expecting to be served quickly like in a fast food, but sadly the wait was pretty long and painful. However, that wait came out to be totally worth it, since there I had one of the BEST Burger in my life!!  1) Hell's Kitchen Burger (5/5): Not sure if it was because I was super-hungry or because it was simply perfect, but this was one of the BEST Burger I ever had. I wanted to take a picture of this, but the burger just disappear before!  2) Hog Burger (3.5/5): This could probably have gotten a better rating from me if I haven't eaten this right after that perfect one. Just a good solid burger, would not order again.  Overall Rating (4.5/5): Go there - order the Hells' Kitchen Burger  - ENJOY an incredible moment - come back here - thank me ;)

O1tQjm9SkDuVE9SfMGC57g.text: Had a great experience here from service to food!  Hostess greeted us promptly and provided a very accurate wait time. Once seated, our server was very prompt and exceptionally courteous.   After making our selections for drinks and food arrived rather quickly. The lettuce wrap for burgers is very well done and I was actually able to hold it and eat it and not use a fork and knife like I do at most places. The Parmesan truffle fries were fantastic! Definitely order these! They were perfect!

hrpPdijpCJfqvrcXDKJGfg.text: Not impressed, burger was just an average burger and the fries and onion rings are over priced, well i guess 17$ for a burger alone would be overpriced to. We all ordered medium done for are burgers and they all came out differently cooked. Oh well wont go back there again.

ZldtUq4osKmZFMSC2zXjKA.text: First time and we loved it. Started off with the baked Mac and cheese it was Perfect and then we ordered the kettle nachos. Tasty and last we finished a burger. Good service and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shared burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon Ramsey burger

loe_TG2cUU4mTnANlX34Ag.text: First of all, I'm a Gordon Ramsay fan, but had never eaten at his burger restaurant in Vegas, so I had to try it out. Walking up to the restaurant, there's a wall of glass with the name of the restaurant and a fire display within the glass wall. And let me tell you, you can feel the heat; the heat was on!  Looking at the menu, it was difficult choosing which burger I wanted to try. This was in November of 2017, so they were offering the Anniversary Burger which didn't help my decision. I was with two friends, so we decided to each order a different burger, then cut our burgers into fourths and give a piece to each other. That way, we could all have a taste of three different mouth watering burger combinations created by the man himself.  I ordered the Anniversary Burger, and I'm sorry I cannot remember which ones my friends ordered. But what I do remember is that all of the burgers were delicious. It was everything we dreamed of!! The burgers were full flavor, were not over or undercooked, and presentation was on point. And not to mention, the staff was nice and attentive.   If you're in Vegas, I know there's plenty of restaurants to choose from, but you should definitely put Gordon Ramsay Burger on your agenda.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall of fire
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Anniversary Burger

L77yBNynvnbDnUupViycSg.text: It's alright. The staff is wonderful for sure. The burger was cooked to perfection. The rest of the toppings on my burger (stout) and the Parmesan truffle fries just tasted bland. The dipping sauces were the saving grace for the fries.   There is a line, but it moves quickly and the staff tries to accommodate you asap. So if you want to come here, don't be discouraged by the line.

OC22pcbqoSUaSpOsbeESzg.text: It seems this place is always busy. We came here at 8 pm one night and were told that it would be a two hour wait. So, we decided to come back another night. When we arrived, we came here in a group of four at 9 pm and waited about an hour and a half for a table. By the time we were at the front of the line, we were super hungry - but we were told that a party of four would take 45 minutes longer, so we ended up splitting our party into pairs.   We ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger and Kettle Chip Nachos. The burger was really good! The beef patty was tender, juicy and cooked perfectly. However, I was extremely disappointed with the nachos as the chips were basically drenched in oil. The chips were soggy from all the oil in this dish. One of my relatives felt sick to her stomach after eating this dish, and she was sick for the next few days of our trip.   Overall, I would not line up again and wait to eat those nachos. If I come back to Vegas, I'll be heading over to Ramsay's Fish and Chips instead!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s kitchen burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle chip nachos (looks crispy in the photo but the chips in the bottom were drenched and soggy from the oil)

2Mdh39c3C2IjRSePfgjbww.text: Ok so we did it.  We fell for the tourist trap celebrity chef burger joint.  The difference is we knew we were falling for the tourist trap that is celebrity chef burger joints.  The lady friend and I came here to get our traditional vacation burger fix.  No matter the trip, we always end up at a local burger establishment.  We decided on this one because of the namesake celebrity chef.  The restaurant has a very chain like feel and it's extremely busy.  The wait staff is flying around in circles trying to hurry up and turn those tables!  They want you to scarf down those 20.00 burgers so they can get the next sucker in here to buy a 20.00 burger.    I had the farmhouse burger which comes with a fancy cheese, fancy bacon and a fried egg.  They cook the burgers to order and the fried egg oozes out upon 1st bite.  The burger is actually pretty damn good but it's 17.00 and comes with nothing else.  The fries are fresh cut and have to be ordered separately for 8.00.  Now the fries will feed 2.  We each ordered 2 beers to wash it down.  4 beers, 2 burgers and 1 fry and I spent damn near the same money as a 5 star restaurant back home in Nola.  The food was solid but you are paying for the neon light bill of the casino it's in.  Be warned

We8sePeiGVrmQ6ABMMx9fw.text: Came here actually May 1. Flew into Vegas late, checked into hotel, and headed straight here. My 3rd time, girlfriend's 1st time. Again did not disappoint. I had the farm burger while she got the ultimate cheeseburger. Farm burger was cooked just right medium, bacon crispy, egg runny when bit into center. Yummy. Took a couple of bites of her ultimate cheeseburger adding bacon to it also cooked medium, just as good with it's own different taste. Had the onion rings for the first time and discovered what I was missing out on my first to visits as these were the best onion rings ever. Crunchy every bite with the sauces just as amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate cheeseburger add bacon
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best onion rings ever!!!

71XPR5ubHl622ORTnec-SA.text: This place is overrated and overpriced for what it is. You are paying for the name. The line wasn't worth the wait. Make sure you are prepared waiting in line (standing) for min 30 mins, ---parties of 3 or more must wait a min of 1.5 hours and check in with the host. I wouldn't bother trying this place, I would find a more basic place and pay less and actually enjoy the burger if that's what you're craving.

T9mROLtwY01e9H7i0Gv_Tg.text: I love this place and enjoy almost every delicious food in the menu. The staff are nice and friendly and they make you feel welcomed every time you go there.

-jya4ovJgF4q7fyScdyhmA.text: The Blue Cheese Burger is literally one of my favorite burgers all over the world. It's so good. Paired with a Blue Moon you will be so fulfilled. Make sure you arrive at 11:00 am to get in promptly if you aren't a Diamond or platinum card holder as the line fills up quickly!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue Cheeseburger, Truffle fries with Parmesan and garlic aioli and a blue moon.

TGzPCdupUrAU2wze0aD18Q.text: I ordered the signature Hell's Kitchen Burger medium and it was prepared to perfection. Wasn't a big fan of the onion rings but the fries were really good.

THKqXoJ42LiOsRgr1BjoCA.text: I'm not huge on burgers, but the Hell's Burger was pretty darn good! It had a nice spicy kick from the jalapenos. We also ordered onion rings and truffle fries to share, and each appetizer came with 2 sides of sauce. Within my table, everyone ordered a different burger. I had the Hell's Burger, and the others had U.K Burger, Backyard Burger, and Forest burger.   My brother was very disappointed with this place because he ordered a medium rare, Forest burger, and his meat came out almost well done. Everyone else ordered their patties to be medium and ours came out almost well done too, but I was okay with it. I would probably give this place a 3.5 stars if possible, but I still enjoyed this place.

-V-07nxVjbT3_H0MnuXtdQ.text: I didn't get a chance to try this place out the last time I was in Vegas so this was bookmarked as one of the first places to eat when I came back.   Wait time: 45-1hr wait  Ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger - Medium rare and Parmesan truffle fries  - the burger was juicy, cooked to perfection, and had a nice kick from the jalapenos. The burger looks small but it was soooo filling!  - Truffle fries were good with 2 sides of dipping sauce  Overall it was 3.5, the burger was good, the service was good but probably not worth the wait.

BIvKXCb_k21lpe-4fJlHnA.text: The service was so amazing, very fast and professional and informative. The elote dip was to DIE for, I could eat a hundred of those and be happy for the rest of my life. My boyfriend and I both got burgers that were cooked to perfection and made with their own twists and the sweet potato fries were outstanding. I hope to return!

If you have a large group you can put your name in but groups of two just have to wait in line (expect an hour!)  Got the HK burger and loved it! The salad with quinoa was great! I'll be back even if they don't take reservations!

HvdZIVtU1ugyhtnqAFObBw.text: This was the best burger we've tried in the US. Great ingredient selections, perfect cook, awesome taste. A must to go in Vegas for Burger lovers ! We also tried the onion ring and it was great too, a bit salty. There is long line for parties more that 2 people. We only waited for 25 minutes on a Saturday night. We ordered "The kitchen hells burger" and farmhouse burger. Both were amazing.

rGcRI0_7s3BwCBWhc7bDgQ.text: So disappointed. Showed up with a party of eight. Was told by the two 17yo hostesses that we would need to split up into two parties of 4 and wouldnt get sat at same time. Empty tables all over.. this made no sense.  No manager at the door or driving the bus. First 4 of us were sat after 30 mins in one area, and second 4 on the other side with empty tables around both. Made absolutley no sense.  Watched manager only expoing and accasionally standing in front of bev station looking around. No coaching... was def. Not in control of his restaurant. The restaurant was running him. Food took a while, orings were terribly greasy.  Gave two stars because burgers were good.  Do yourself a favor.. go somewhere else for your burger fix. This restaurant team doesnt know how to provide a good guest experience.

BrGt62GgOu538FrmjshQ2w.text: Service was amazing! The waiter was quick to deliver food and offer refills. He even took the courtesy to pack our food for us after we were done eating.   The burgers were amazing. So much flavor and tasted high quality. You really get what you pay for here. It was understandable why the prices were quite high.

xewsIMN-ZuIk9b7-SIr6mg.text: This place was awesome! Delivered on ambiance, service and taste!! We wandered over and saw there was a huge line which moved quickly and was worth the wait. Check it out if you have a chance!

6kyiotkBuRpJsMPHC2126w.text: I'm rating Gordon Ramsay Burger a 3 stars because I rate a restaurant based on the food, dining area and experience. The food was just ok, nothing memorable. It's supposed to be gourmet Burgers whatever that is with fry's fancy ketchup that I had a hard time keeping down. The service was not very good. Waiter walked over said hello then walked away. Came back took our order, not being very helpful about the menu. Didn't explain anything! About 15 minutes later he walks by and we ask about how much longer will this take. He's answer was well it take about 30 min to cook a burger. You've only been waiting for 10min. Ok, Ass!!!! If you would have mentioned that during our order we would have added some appetizers. We waited over an hour and a half to get in this place. And it was totally NOT WORTH THE WAIT!!!!  I definitely expected more with it have Gordon Ramsay's name attached to it.

Oy7NCkdhAPO4VWJZGjcBiA.text: The food is awesome and amazing serviceThe burgers are delicious and very tasteful you will like this place too!!!!

kw2l_E5p9aQMuwSdmjcsDA.text: This place doesn't live to the hype that is around it. I tried the curry chicken burger and Mediterranean lamb burger, both seemed just ok. The parmesan fries were really good.  The wait time is over an hour and the food taste doesn't seem to justify it.

EE4oxXRQvPrxGo1wJoBvag.text: I ordered the hogburger and truffle fries and can't stop thinking about them. The flavour was excellent. The wait for a table was quick, but the wait for the food was long. I'd return again but try a different burger for variety

D9oR46Ss53c4gE4xVgDtPw.text: Gordon Ramsay Burger is a MUST every time I visit Las Vegas. My review may be bias because I adore the man but damn, he sure makes some tasty burgers !!!  Review:  Sweet Potato fries: 10/10; crispy, delicious & FULL of flavor!!! You have the option to have the fries served with powdered sugar (passed on this because I like my fries savory)...it's served with a housemate chipotle ketchup & honey jalapeno jam  Truffle Fries: 10/10; these were life changing...the truffle used to top the British chips were full of flavor!!! The truffle was superb, my tastebuds were very much happy.   Farmhouse Burger: 10/10; best. BURGER. ever. The duck bacon, gooey cheese, caramelized mushrooms, & medium rare meat...could you ask for anything more ???   I highly recommend dining here, whatever you order, you will not be disappointed. Gordon, you nailed this one!

3yRgnA4vpPXKJXY0pYVHIg.text: BEST burger and dessert you will ever eat! The onion rings and sangrias are delicious too. You MUST come and try their burgers at least once in your life! The hype is real. Everything is so simple yet brilliantly thought out. The burger was perfectly seasoned and cooked. The dessert had the perfect amount of freshness and sweetness. The staff is world class. Everyone was beautifully synchronized and worked without stopping. The line was long but the wait wasn't brutal. Definitely had a memorable experience! Would recommend and visit again.

ifqUpiBkacoxU6Gvywao4w.text: Was here about 5 years ago to the day. The only thing different is they changed the name by spelling burger correctly.   Same excellent service. Same excellent food. Location is still a meh for me. As a non smoker I have a hard time seated next to an area where there is smoking allowed; open to casino floor.   Wait was significantly lighter this time as we ate late lunch as opposed to heavy traffic dinner time.   I had the fish and crisp, and poutine "appetizer".  I messed up and requested poutine with main but that thing was a main entree all by itself. (Reheats and taste great the next day as leftovers). Fish and crisp was great but a little on the heavy side.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

H7mFRq8xhu1BNL3oKkCfIw.text: Amazing food! I will admit being in Vegas, you drink a bit too much at times, and this was partly the reason I wasn't able to finish a lot of my meal, but what I did try was very good. Other than the price being very expensive, especially for those from Canada (with the exchange). The burgers are sold separately from sides, but I was okay with this! I would totally recommend.

iqXPcrEJBC82nyKMOcHBuA.text: Welp. Wanted to be like the cool kids and give this a shot.   THE GOOD:  1. Line moved quickly. We took under 10 mins at 7.30pm to get a table.   2. Whatever ketchup they used was awesome!  THE OK:  1. Service was slow.   2. Food was ok. I ordered the Forest Burger, which had mushrooms, cheese and duck bacon. Bacon tasted good. Beef pattie was tough unfortunately, and the mushrooms were overlooked little rubber tires. I asked for lettuce wrapped and they were great with that. So that was good. But the food was forgettable. Wouldn't come back.   3. Husband ordered The Farmhouse Burger. He tells me it was a 7/10 so that is good!  3. The fries were good. Not perfect, but good. Solid effort.   THE BAD:  1. My biggest complaint was the ambience and NOISE!!!! Good grief, if I wanted my ears to bleed I would have gone to a frikken Iron Maiden Concert. There is No carpet anywhere and the noise just resounds to the point where you have  to SHOUT to be heard. I am in the audiology industry and 85 dB is where hearing loss begins to occur as a result of noise damage, and I clocked an average of 83dB in this restaurant. So damn loud to the point of super uncomfortable. Just bad form Gordon.   2. TVs were broken down and not playing- kind of added to the vibe of lack of care.   All in all, for the price, I wouldn't come back due to the noise and lack of ambience. For my money, I'd go elsewhere.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NOISE!! So damn loud!!

vL3fYKHGDCCTkw9qjavglw.text: Gordon Ramsey Burger was divine! My fiance and I got the bleu cheese burger and Hell's Kitchen burger. The bleu cheese burger was juicy and flavorful! The bleu cheese was not strong at all. The Hell's Kitchen burger was a delightful mix of flavors with the creaminess of avocado to balance out the burger. We added a side of beer batteries onion rings and fries. So bomb!

jk0sCcIJOBSgnFGv8P_xVg.text: Always wanted to try this  Went for lunch.  Quick seating if we sat at the bar.  What I like about Ramsays restaraunts is the menu shows the ingredients. I like knowing what makes my plate.  Had a bleu cheese burger, which was lovely, and truffle fries, which were fine.   I would recommend to anyone who is willing to eat a burger and fries on a 30 dollar budget

78t5fNJkrAmi0f7ZoE_PFw.text: OMG... delicious! Went there last night with family and ordered the hells kitchen burger, crown burger, and ale dog with truffle fries. Best burger I ever had. Requested the burger be cooked to medium and the temperature was perfect! Can not recommend enough if you are hungry for a good burger in Vegas!

1Q4q5pGFclwpMpcRSlDU3w.text: Fresh, tasty and the burgers combinations makes you want to try them all! There's a bit of a waiting time but it's worth it.

NIi0Slr6zTLljHz35Qvc7g.text: The hype is real!! We wanted to go to Hell's Kitchen but it was far and we were walking. We had to send my burger back but they made me a brand new one and it was perfect! I wish I got the servers name so good!

lGs-07NJrjE9g_YaW2T41w.text: This is one of the few 1 star reviews I'll ever give and I didn't even go to Gordon Ramsay Burger. This review is of the reservation system they have set up there.   It all started with me calling them to make reservations about a month in advance for July 3rd. I wanted to reserve a dinner for my family of 15. Everything went fine until they emailed me. The email said that because we have a large group, it's a minimum of $95 a person and we have to pay an estimated down payment ahead of time. I thought they must be joking. How can you bill someone a meal BEFORE they even eat it? Probably the most absurd thing is that even though it's $95 a person, they sent me a list of set menus that had a couple of three course meals for $70-80 each. That means pay $1500 up front? That means that every person has to have a drink? Well, we have 5 children a couple of my family members that don't drink.  So when I tried to talk to the "Sales Manager" Heather, she just so happens to be on vacation for the week. As popular as the Gordon Ramsay name is, I can't believe this is how they function when someone tries to book a party ahead of time. There's no way I'm going to pay money ahead of time for food we haven't ate and I can't believe people actually would. Even though I expect great food and great service, it's a people's business and all it takes is one person to have a bad day to ruin our experience. How do you expect us to pay for that in advance?

Ph-sBxbFLS_ltXTVX-FP4w.text: Just go, don't overthink it! This place has an absolutely perfect management, great food, and reputable service. The menu is simple, food is high-end and the service is fast.... and if they ask you if want  dessert say yes and go for the milkshake, do not say you are too full, there is always room for great delights. This one is really special, you will thank me later. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KriNX0bjSQSTe5hgXk5L3Q.text: I stayed at Planet Hollywood and visited on a Sunday night.  It was a 20 minute wait but it was worth every second.   The truffle fries were heavenly and the Hell's Kitchen burger was perfection.  Fancy burgers at reasonable prices.  I would go back in a heart beat.

SnAAHNc2BXXroctvz0cYVQ.text: Pros: -Farmhouse burger was cooked a perfect medium as ordered. Tasted so great. -Others in my party ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and they loved it. -Great service with a very knowledgeable staff.  -Fries and added sauces were great. -For Vegas, I think it was priced right.  Cons: -None   PS: Also saw Gordon Ramsey. He came in, waved at diners and seemed like a good dude.  Noted- Gordon Ramsay's surprise visit did not influence or mold my excellent review.

C4oWbqk8z2Ziby04qqidGQ.text: Ordered 4 Burger's (1 meat 3 vegetarian). They messed up our order and gave us (3 meat 1 vegetarian). Took more than an hour for them to serve the food.

vyXf1sCCY3P-v1EqX48tog.text: Even at 11pm there was a 1hr wait and let me say, absolutely worth it! Our party of 7 ordered all different kinds of burgers and they were all a hit. The Forest Burger is awesome with the duck bacon as is the mushroom poutine. The brown butter pecan shake is the perfect sweet note and is like a dessert dish on its own. Other favorites include the Hells Kitchen Burger and Farmhouse Burger. The burgers dont come with fries so you can order those on their own. One order of fries can easily be shared between 2-3 people. I do have to say that fries were a little dry and bland. Still, we loved this place! Oh, and they split our bill as we needed it without hassling us so thats a hug help when trying to figure out the bill after a night out in Vegas.

aM-ZM3DCf4orw52esaAenQ.text: Now this is a good burger...yess there are others . But after you wait 20 mins online it tastes so so much better. Out of the 40 burger we have tried in the past 2 years. This is in the top 5. But also top price.  Enjoy .!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks good and tastes even better..just be prepared to wait and..OUCH.. the Damage..lol

IJc5OKBPrgRLO-7Oc37ySA.text: Was really excited to try out Gordon Ramsay Burger. But we were disappointed. We ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, forest burger and chips and curry sauce. The burgers were good but not great. Fries were rock hard. We waited 30 mins before the food came out. I dont think Gordon would approve. With so many burger option in vegas, don't think we will come back.

1POcMZSMzOkQ896clRw6Sw.text: My second time here. My friends ordered the burger and I customized one of the sandwiches to have mushrooms avocado and cheese and it was sooo good. The first time I was here I had the mushroom burger and it was also great! Our waiter was quick and friendly and made the whole experience even more enjoyable.

f_84O_d5bxrozXBTn_FUjw.text: Loved our burgers and experience at this place! Our server was very knowledgeable and accommodating with our orders. I had the Blue. So good! The onion rings are perfectly done with a balanced amount of batter to onion.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Oy8KZCX3zkoZL_NOk_FltQ.text: Honestly, The burger was ok but nothing special. It was dry and frankly for the price I was expecting more flavor and better quality of meat. Super Duper burger in the Bay Area and Fukuburger on Buffalo and Warm Springs were definitely so much better and half the price.  A bit disappointed especially we had to wait almost an hour to get in.

EfIwYIRLiBuJB4E586vjPA.text: I thought it was strange when the listing for Gordon Ramsay BurGR was marked as "closed" on Yelp. Then I find out they remodeled. But.......what was even remodeled?! Everything practically looked the same. Except for a menu change.   Yes, burgers may be expensive at $15 an order and that's WITHOUT fries. Adding a side of fries will be an additional $9-11. Get the parmesan truffle fries....yum!!!!!!! The burgers are  delicious and full of flavor. It's a perfect size, enough to make you feel full but it doesn't make you feel like a bloated person waddling outta there. You can request how well you want your burgers cooked and they're pretty on point with that. The Hell's Kitchen burger is all that I order. It's spicy with jalapenos, cheese and avocados. Typing this is making me salivate.     Keep in mind, DO NOT come here when you're starving/hangry. Not only will you have to wait for a table since it seems like there's always a wait here. My party of 4 and I were here for dinner on a normal Thursday evening and we still have to wait about 20 minutes. So after our waitress took our orders, she informed us that the burgers will take 30 minutes to make. WHATTTTT.....30 MINUTES!?!?! Urmm....okay, that caught me off guard. Wow...patience is a virtue here at Gordon Ramsay. I mean, she gave us the option of having the fries out first so we can munch on those but we didn't wanna spoil our dinner and get full off fries. But....different strokes for different folks? *shurgs*  All in all, this burger joint is definitely a must. Much better than Shake Shack in NY NY or this burger place at Fashion Show Mall. Come here instead. I will forever be returning here for my gourmet burger fix.

6jYh_7L-cMqRfKhUHoSH7A.text: This place recently underwent a change of ownership, which we did not know until we were seated.  NONE of the delicious burgers that were on the menu are there anymore. The burgers we did order were NOT delicious - they were AWFUL.  4 of us in the party and no one finished theirs.  We ate what we were served as it took FOREVER to get our food and we were starving.  Plus, we had to send 2 of them back to be remade as they were overcooked (we asked for medium rare, not chared) .Fortunately we are Diamond players so we did not have to wait in the 45 min to 1hour plus line, but I PITY whoever waits for this crappy food.  The cafe would have been better.  I eat burgers once a week and was looking forward to Burgrs, what a let down.  Maybe change the name to BUGGERS.    GORDON, YOU OUGHT TO BE ASHAMED OF YOURSELF FOR ALLOWING YOUR NAME ON THIS PLACE, BUT I GUESS THE LICENSING FEES YOU RECEIVE MORE THEN MAKE UP FOR THE LACK OF FLAVOR, SERVICE ETC...  I can only hope that your star is now fading in Vegas and soon ALL of the place with YOUR NAME attached go under.  I cannot wait to see what takes the place of this joint (I cant even bring myself to call it a restaurant) - HOPEFULLY by the end of the year....or sooner.  * SHAME ON PLANET HOLLYWOOD or the F & B manager or whoever for allowing this place to remain open.  Apparently, I am in the minority as there are rave reviews here. Those who gave 4 or 5 star reviews most likely NEVER had the opportunity to eat at the original BURGR, or they would probably change their ratings.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. R.I.P.

KQqaBpKf6l19octYzbp97w.text: This is my first Gordon Ramsay restaurant and let's say I was expecting a bit more, but still enjoyed my experience overall. We decided to each order a burger and share so in case we wanted more, we knew what we would order. We ordered: The Hog Burger: surprise burger of the group, as my party and I didn't expect much because our waitress sold us on the special burger ("F Word") on our particular visit. This is layers on layers of pork, it isn't wasn't saturated in grease, and it was quick flavorful. All of the flavors mended well together and was the surprise "favorite" pick amongst us (party of 4). Being as hungry as we were, we decided to try Chef Ramsay's take on poutine. It was winner for us as we enjoyed the mixture of gravy, duck bacon, cheese curds, and vinegar pickled shallots. My friend even said on her next visit, maybe she'll just have an order of this by herself. It satisfied our taste buds and piqued our interest on what else was coming our way. Shrimp and Lobster Burger: had a nice texture and though I liked the curry that seasoned the patty, I felt like it muted the shrimp and lobster flavor (as we know those aren't prominent to begin with). Still a pretty good burger, but I felt it could have been better. Hell's Kitchen Burger: had a subtle kick to it from the jalepeno ingredients, but wasn't overpowering. The avocado did help quell the heat and add another flavor profile to the burger itself. I would say this was the second best burger of the group. "F Word" Burger: this was the special (off menu) during my visit, which is constructed with a patty that is a blend of a 27-day, dry-aged New York strip, ribeye and barbecue short rib. It's topped with frisee, pickled shallots and lemon vinaigrette. Though sold as soon as we heard the ingredient list of this bad boy, we felt like all the flavors were not pronounced enough, but was still a good hunk of a burger. We noticed all the beef patties were consistently good (they have that process down) and the difference on the beef burgers were just the toppings/condiments associated with each "specialty".

PJ5PKd69j1JUbM3eCXzkZQ.text: When you bite into your burger, you will close your eyes from the sheer ecstasy of it all! These burgers are cooked to perfection! And the fries... OMG! It's one of my favorite stops in Vegas. There's usually a wait, but the line moves quickly! Don't miss out on what will be one of the best burgers you'll ever have in your life!!

t2t1Hge5vHGKDVsCA7k60w.text: My burger was amazing. The creme brulee shake to die for. There is a long wait if you don't get there before they open but it is totally worth it.  My only complaint is that we didnt get our order of fries until after we had already finished our burgers.

The service was a bit slow and when we got our food (onion rings and wings) we were excited about the food BUT then a few seconds later the taste hit us! IT WAS TOO SALTY! The wings and the onion rings had too much salt we couldn't even enjoy our meal. A huge disappointment. The burgers were over $20 dollars and we didn't even want to try it if they cant season chicken wings and onion rings properly.

5hL_ggzIRX6AdtFflaxuHA.text: Long line and just ok flavors. I tried 3 different burgers so far. And haven't taste one that makes me wow.

KYmRXZVWqNlEQOaVrFX-JQ.text: What has happened at this establishment Mr. Gordon Ramsey? Have dined at STEAK during a Thanksgiving and every time we visit Las Vegas your Fish & Ships are a must. Sadly did not have the opportunity to dine at Burger thanks to the horrific customer service beginning with hostess Sterling and ending with manager Joe Rich. Such an incredibly discerning Michelin Chef needs to make sure the issues are handled. See all the reviews over the last 30 days have all been dissatisfied with the appalling customer service. My satisfaction is having walked up to Mr. Rich (lacking greatly in skill for his position) and asking "are you the Manager", replied yes. I said "no doubt that your staff is a reflection of you"! Did not do anything to professionally handle our situation. We have invested time and money (a lot) and my daughter & boyfriend who took us have visited everyone of your establishments (except this one thanks to the poor service & management) WE WALKED OUT!! Sad m, but will not put another cent towards any of your establishments.

oCb9n6ApU_s8PtI6t2rMgA.text: I would give 0 if I could.   It was a huge embarrassment that I brought my friends who flew all the way to want something special to this place where used to serve better burgers.   The patties we had were BURNT, and it did NOT have any beef flavor or I have to say ANY FLAVOR AT ALL. If you closed your eyes, you would have no idea you are having a burger LITERALLY. I would only pay $8 at most for such burger or avoid having it. I think I was too nice to refuse to pay the meal but I would never forget the pain and regret.   Probably, the better burgers I had here before was just an accident. The cooks are incapable of making equivalent burgers and they may not know how to cook good burgers. And it is even Gordon Ramsay's. Hilarious.  It is really a shame they are still open and many tourists come to have such terrible experience. I guess they would never come back and the city would lose money. PLEASE, THINK ABOUT THE CITY, SHUT YOUR PLACE DOWN.

K0rAP1XKQSMxMv1dGlymng.text: The place is clean, the atmosphere is nice, the waitresses was good. But my crown burger was dry and didn't really have any flavor. I was really disappointed in my meal.

ZWg7y4b1q7RD2AG5I22O_g.text: Delicious Hell's Kitchen burger and truffle fries. The wait for four people was approximately 45 minutes (not bad for a Saturday) they texted and called us when our table was ready. I would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K-AJjQBnx6u2G64ZF5dFkA.text: Prepare to stand in line but good thing they accept reservation and they will text you when the table is ready. So while waiting, why not play some slot machines in the area!?! The burger is definitely gordon ramsay's style. Worth the wait!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Who doesnt want to try his burger!?!

nlLeQib_Lag78rbD2PZ9vQ.text: After watching the Bruno Mars concert, the wife and I headed back towards our hotel and stumbled on this gem of a restaurant inside the PH. It was about 11pm and didn't expect to wait as long as we did. I should have known better, this was Vegas! We stood in line for about 45 minutes before we got seated. Took off one star for this experience. They have a dedicated line for couples and trios; larger parties skip the line and head straight to the hostess for seating. Why penalize the smaller parties. When we got to the front of the line, we counted three parties of six that were seated before us. How about clearing one or two couples in between seatings for the larger parties to make it equitable?  We got seated and proceeded to order. I went with the cheeseburger with bacon and egg and the wife went with the one with arugula. And some fries. In about 5 minutes, a runner came with a plate of tritip nachos. We didn't touch it and waited for our waiter. Asked him what it was and he immediately realized it was wrong. To our surprise, he took the plate away. Why didn't he just leave it? It's not like he could have served it to another party? He came back a minute later and offered it to us no charge. It was excellente! Found out later that it was intended for the trio of drunk girls next to us, to which we had some good conversation.  The burgers came out, and it was perfectly cooked. Medium as we ordered. These burgers were legit, the bun was great and the fixins were perfect. Great great burger. Bacon was thick and crispy and the egg yolk made a de facto sauce for the beef. Wish I came back. And surprisingly didn't feel too gross after. Fries - just ok. I've tasted some awesome fries and this here is lacking. (my baseline for great fries? Lazy Dog)  Legit burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon n egg

W-X88TMfWIQj3QOcXN9jZw.text: The food was GREAT!  My rating is due to a few things I wouldn't expect to experience at a Gordon Ramsey restaurant.  1.  The wait is ridiculous.  We waited over 1 hour for a table when there were easily 12 were available.  We then waited 15 min. for a waiter to finally to come over. 2. The basics are missing. There was no Equal sweetener available in the entire restaurant. They "ran out." They also we're "running low" on mustard and gave me 1/10 of a serving size of it when I asked the waiter for it. He never brought it over, by the way. I had to go get it myself from the kitchen area.   Overall, if you're looking for a great burger, have 3 hours to kill, and don't mind mediocre service, this is your place.

p3pNugRjUGc-SagQJBkisw.text: Good burgers for the hype, pretty popping for midnight so always gonna be good vibes here! Their anniversary burger that's not on the menu is so so compared to their pork burger for those looking for pure taste.

rNzNXZJRmVKlJtUeTA2HoA.text: The food was amazing and so was the Creme Brulee Shake for the dessert. Our server Chelsea was phenomenal and full of good energy and tended to our every need and always came at perfect timing! This was the best burger I've ever had and when I visit again I'll most definetly come again!

qnKDlZV8PbpLK8IE7pgB5A.text: We wanted to go to a GR restaurant so we decided to try his burger place. We wanted to get something that we had never eaten before so we ordered the lamb burger with mint vinaigrette. This burger is amazing!!!! Service was great but atmosphere was very noisy.

1W-Rgkq0ZWT89e58rH4pYA.text: Horrible!!!!!!! We ordered the onion rings for appetizers and if you feel like drinking oil, go ahead order the onion rings at this place. With each bite I felt like I was just drinking oil along with some onion and bread. Disgusting!!!!! The mushroom burger was just okay. I was expecting so much more out of this place. 0 stars for food, 1 star for the service which was good, attentive and nice.

m1D22r5jtaHSmRRwlSm8qg.text: I've had a lot of burgers from various establishments, but Gordon's burger takes the crown. Best burger I've ever had in my entire life.

PkmQ5eHi_P_jyyL3GHfcZQ.text: Great food as expected and good service on everyone's part except for my waiter, not very friendly and acted like he didn't want to be there had to get up several time to go get condiments he was no where to be found. Drinks were constantly empty had to ask for more made my visit not as good as it could of been.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sgoIkYayVq7_I6v7xmHoiw.text: Always wanted to try the burgers here, I mean cmon! It is Gordon Ramsay! The service was awesome, and food came out quick, unfortunately, the food did not wow'd me.  We had the following:  - Beer Battered Onion Rings - parmigiano-reggiano, chipotle ketchup, cheddar ranch dip - typical onion rings, nothing out of the ordinary or anything  - Mushroom Poutine - gravy, duck bacon, cheese curds, vinegar pickles - flavors were good, but a little too salty.  Since the mushroom was the medium for this dish, it did not mellow out the flavors well  - Truffle Parmesan Fries - your basic truffle parm fries  - Farmhouse Burger - dublinar cheese, mangalitsa bacon, fried egg - I was highly disappointed in the burger, the bread was amazingly cold and dry.. the works inside were good though..  Maybe I went on an off day?  Hopefully I did, I do want to give it another shot.

sH-Nr9Bm_pgUdPif_RZLjA.text: This eatery is very busy. Waited outside with a velvet rope holding the long line at the hostess stand. Blonde, tattoo girl with an MS 13 tattoo on her arms waited on us. I reiterated three times that we needed to get to a Vegas show. Waitresses was annoyed and rudely told me In a condescending manner that the wait for the food would be 15 minutes, it was already 30 minutes. There was a station next to our table and there were 5-7 servers hanging out for 5-7 minutes during different intervals while I watched plates of food sitting on the cook lines for 5-10 minutes without anyone delivering the food. Food arrived and both burgers were undercooked. The first server had given our table to a kind male server who tried to appease the poor food. The fries were cold. I actually had the manager hold one of my greasy fries. Food is expensive $17-20 for a cheese burger but not worth it. Fries are soggy and greasy, $8.  I do not recommend this eatery. Very disorganized. Manager was kind and brought my burger in a to go box but the ambience was already over. How do I enjoy a $20 burger in a box?

vOVd55ZDXv3ezcJXxIuY4Q.text: The food tonight was incredible! I could die now and have no care in the world! Kelsey was a wonderful waitress, always there when we needed her. Made sure that we always had our drinks topped off too! Kurtis was pretty cool, making sure that anything finished was off of the table quickly. Even Ryan, the manager, was making sure everything was going smoothly. We were pretty much treated like royalty here. Will definitely be coming back as soon as possible!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello Burger

VO5vgGmj-0YZR28jmRz5wg.text: We came here on Saturday night and waited about 50min for a table. Given the night and the popularity of the place, I felt like that was a reasonable wait time. After being seated, the first thing I noticed was the place was loud! I basically had to scream across the table to have a conversation with my parents. After waiting about 30 minutes, my Hells Kitchen burger arrived. It was juicy and all the toppings went well together. It was fantastic burger and definitely the best burger I've had in Vegas. I didn't give it a five star rating because the regular fries were cold when they served them. Moreover, we also orders sweet potato fries and they had sugar on them (who does that!?!) which were lukewarm as well. That being said, I will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mzcv0q7-4jZITU59v9JXuA.text: I'll start off by saying that I'm not a Gordon Ramsey fan. Never watched Hell's Kitchen, or anything. But the memes I find on the internet about him are hilarious!  Hubby had been wanting to check this place out for the past year, so during our last trip to Vegas over LDW, I thought what the heck, let's try it out.  We waited in line for about about 20 minutes, when one of the hostess asked us if we wanted to sit at the chefs table. I didn't really want to stand in line anymore since I was starving, so we took it. I'll admit, they made it sound like a cooler experience when they were telling us about the chefs table, so I was a little disappointed when it was just a bar counter. Fine, I'll let this pass, my expectations were a little too high.  This is where things went pretty sour. First, it took about 15 minutes for a server to say anything to us, another 15 minutes to get our drinks, and about 45 minutes to get our food. Considering that i was starving, I was in a pretty hangry mood. I couldn't believe how slow this place was. I'll give it to the cooks, they were moving pretty fast at times, but other times, they were just standing around waiting for the food to cook. I noticed that the burgers would all come at one time, about 5 or so, and then the cooks would just be standing waiting for more food to cook. It's like they would cook the food in shifts, rather than being constant. Why not just consistently be cooking, rather than putting everything together, then waiting for the food to be ready together?   Now about the food: I had the Tendori Chicken, lettuce wrapped. All I asked for was the chicken, and cheese wrapped in lettuce. Not too complicated right? Well, the chicken has some kind of sauce that took away the goodness of it. But since I was starving, I just let it go and ate it. But I wasn't a fan of this sauce. When I asked the server what this sauce was, she didn't know, and had to ask a chef, who looked liked he didn't know either, and then just settled it with being "marinade". Umm no, this was not cooked with the chicken. This was tossed on top of the chicken. There is a difference.  Hubby had the Backyard burger, no complaints from him. He thought it was ok. High quality ingredients, but not really worth the price tag.  We decided to share an order of sweet potato fries, which are huge btw! We both weren't a fan of the powdered sugar they added. I don't get powdered sugar on fries. Whats the point of it?   Overall, I don't think I will come back. There are better burger places around Vegas. At least I got hubby off my back with trying this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tendori Chiecken, lettuces wrap. Chicken is tiny.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backyard Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet Potato Fries with Powdered Sugar

EaP4esWoLFDHrb69Z04NSA.text: We decided to try this place because it was right next door to our hotel and it's got Gordon Ramsey's name on it, so it's gotta be good, right?    Aside from the twenty minute wait in line (no reservations) next to fiery welcome sign (even behind multiple lanes of glass, I could still feel the heat), the food was great!   I ordered the Turducken burger with a side order of truffle Parmesan fries.  FYI, none of the burgers come with sides but the fries are worth the $12.  We started with the Poutine and scarfed that down in minutes - it was absolutely amazing!    Definitely come with your stomachs empty because the food is awesome and the portions are huge!  I thought I'd have room for a Creme Brulee Shake after but, clearly, my eyes were much bigger than my stomach.

V-6jGQgKAajyW6dCwQ2CyA.text: Worst hamburger ever, too salty. Cheese on burger and fries tasted like at least a day old. Waitstaff was excellent. They got the two stars. Very helpful and friendly. Located in Planet Hollywood..

a-kqJ1jyEi-RBHe2kJmbkw.text: Our servers Justin and Kurtis were amazing at their job and gave us, a group of 7, the best experience possible. Both of them had a great personality and was so kind and fun. The burgers, just fries, and onion rings we had is amazing! Unlike any other I gave had. Traveling from Houston, Texas but for sure will be back!

ALPMDJhk5abOZtLaRRVhTg.text: So disappointed!  4 of us, each had one drink, burger and fries. Waited aver 45 minutes for food, the fries were hard and over cooked. Burgers were tasteless.  Not one of us were impressed and the two guys next to us were grumbling about how poor the food was. Two burgers showed up, a replacement waiter took over and asked if we needed anything else.  Um, yeah...the rest of our order.  After a 8 hour drive into Vegas we were hoping for a decent meal. No luck. $180 for a lousy meal.

s0fAk7wZkMa9AyvdXViHXQ.text: The burger patty was very tender and my favorite part. We ordered the poutine fries which were just okay- ive had been poutine. For burger we got the Hell's Kitchen burger which was very good. Patty was cooked how we like, good flavor. Takes 30 minutes for a burger to come out. The line was pretty lengthy too, but we got seated at the bar. Would recommend!

a93eeRi5lQBuJH3x3p7H7A.text: One of the best burgers I've had in Vegas.  Even the fries were top notch.  Be sure to ask for all the sauces.  They have a couple of different types of ketchup that all tasted great, but the start of the meal was their ranch that was mixed with some cheddar cheese.  So good and worked perfectly on every item we got.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V8oNlmghyVQQex_R6qgPuw.text: Beautiful burger at beautiful venue! We could not enjoy our burger at the restaurant as there was an half hour wait at 6pm Monday night! Plus our children were restless then. So we bought two burgers and ate at hotel. Even then the burgers were destroyed by us in seconds while fighting over who will have the last bites! It's that good!   The buns were tasty and fluffy with sesame seeds.  The beef patty were real quality meat that was cooked perfectly to our order, medium well done, while succulent with a bit of red inside.  The matching of the sauces, herbs and condiments bring unique flavors to each burger but retains the original flavors of the star, the burger itself.  I don't know much about Godon Ramsay but having gone to both his fish and burger restaurants, this man really knows food!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t say anything bad about the food coz Gordon is watching

I6ysBy_gDALQH4CaLG5kCg.text: Great Burgers!!!  Having Gordon's name meant an hours wait to be seated but in reality was a lot less 35 mins is no problem.   Burgers really well prepared and all the builds were perfect - 4 shared 3 burgers and 3 sides and still didn't finish all the sides!  Pork burger was amazing.   Great food, reasonable price given who's name is above the door, certainly would recommend to anyone who wanted to try one of his restaurants on the strip but lost in the casinos in the way in.

a9pItPUymI8e5Igqhi9z7A.text: We went at 11am and got right in. We ordered onion rings to start with and did not care for those so the waitress noticed we weren't eating them and offered to bring us fries instead. The parmesan truffle fries were delicious! Blue cheese burger was excellent and the jalapeno burger was as well. They were accommodating and wrapped my burger in lettuce.

CpDFzgDYImoWVdpIrYkSvw.text: SOGGY, STALE, RUDE & OVERPRICED!  I went to this place with high hopes being it has Gordon Ramsay's name on it. Unfortunately it was not an enjoyable experience. Not only were the fries soggy and stale, the burger tasted like the meat was cut from a cows anus. On top of that, the wait staff at the bar is rude and slow and the place is way overpriced. I wouldn't recommend this place.

5n0riEzPGXm56fYBljsMvQ.text: Amazing, food was delicious! The vibe was great.  We got the hell's kitchen burger and it didn't disappoint. On the side, we got some truffle fries which were equally great.   Gordon Ramsay is a food god!

r0uSZCfwBH7Q7NxEqHx_Sg.text: Delicious. No wait with platinum or above. Definitely recommend farmhouse or Diablo burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Phe5CZwWeB2qLhmWlRbHTw.text: My husband and I are not from Vegas and whenever we think of it our mouths water over the thought of Ramsay Burger's shakes. Whaaaat!!! You have not had a great great shake until you try these.  In four days we can easily order 10 of them. They cost around $9 but it is totally worthy. Their creme brulee one with either chocolate or cookies and cream ice cream OMG. I crave it all the time and I do not even have a sweet tooth. Also, forget about eating healthy, we are talking SHAKES. They are big and filling. They may take a bit to make but again, worth the wait. The staff in the front is helpful, some more than others but the servers, the manager and the food make up for it.  Cannot recommend it enough.
