Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cLCmnhDNHHVFwgCHmpVO2g.text: HUGE disappointment! After over an hour wait we finally sat down and were told it's an additional 1/2 just to have your burger cooked.  Ordered onion rings, way to greasey and flavorless. Sent them back and we got sweet potatoe fries. Center of the fries were raw and the outside was so greasy that they eventually all stuck together. Gross!  Fish & chips burger. So dry! The sauce was invisible! Trying to flag down my waitress was also a mission. Terrible service and they still ended up charging us for everything, including the items we returned.   Huge disappointment because I am a fan of Gordon Ramsey restaurants. Love; Steak, pub & grill; fish n chips... burger sucked!

XrPYGj8spFan39Pzp44g8w.text: I first heard of Burger 7 years ago! I have always been a Gordon Ramsay fan. Hells Kitchen, MasterChef, Kitchen Nightmares, YouTube, etc....... I have been to Vegas 3x since and never got an opportunity to go. This year was finally my chance. My Wife and I were sat at the Chefs table and I was stoked! Well needless to say I assumed Gordon Ramsay restaurant quick bites or not would be ran cleanly and with decent food. Well I was wrong and this has to be the biggest food disappointment to date! I ordered the Hell Kitchen Burger as recommended by the waitress, and a Oreo Shake. My wife order a water and the Cherry Popper Chicken Sandwich based on the waitress recommendation. As we sat there and seen the burger chef smash all the goodness out of every burger and countless orders or fries sit under the warmer I started to question what was really going on here. The main chef checking orders before they went out was holding dish tubs, rubbing his bare hands on his jeans, opening and closing the little fridges, and then sticking those same fingers in the ketchup cups! GROSS and unsanitary! When my burger finally arrived the presentation was good. I prepared with to finally eat Burger heaven. When I bit into my suppose to be medium rare burger I realized it was really rare! I was like you can't even cooks burger to temp here?!? I decided to eat it anyway. After the second bite I realized this burger is never going to taste better. It literally tasted like a everything bagel with avocado. There was not flavor to the burger, the texture was crap, and all the other Hells Kitchen flavors were no existent. I decided to try my wife chicken which has crispy chicken skin on it. The skin was so Chewy she couldn't eat. We asked for our check and left super disappointed and hungry! I won't even start in on the stale warmer baby truffle fries! Good luck diners but I caution you about this place. It could use a visit from Gordon himself and hope he can fix his own nightmare!

nj-vx5aGgByo27FC9Y13Zg.text: Right away loses 2 stars for service. Our waiter Sergio was rude, unwelcoming and clearly didn't want to be working. He didn't greet us with a simple hello or ask us how we were let alone introduce himself.   He merely handed us the menu and said he'd be back in 5 mins - ok cool, what if we had questions? Or wanted recommendations?  He came back took our order and that was honestly the last time we saw him. We anticipated before we ordered that he needed the check spilt and he rolled his eyes! To top it all off he charged the wrong cards with the wrong amounts which resulted in people owing each other money. UGH.  We left him NO tip - he didn't deserve one. He spent his time chatting with expensive regulars next to us clearly schmoozing to get a job not in the food industry.   *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***   The Positive We visited on a busy Las Vegas Fight Weekend (GGG V Canelo 2) and were seated within 20 mins - not bad. Food was delicious and a good portion for what you pay. YES it is expensive but the flavors are crazy delicious and it fills you up. Will come back and make sure Sergio isn't our waiter.

wIAeFQe6fZnipnE7eEuMPQ.text: Burger was very good.  Pretty much what I would expect from an upscale burger at a restaurant from a well known chef.   However, the wait was very long.  Prices reasonable considering top notch restaurant, but the burger is small.  Did not fill me up.  Fries were not hot and cut short which wasn't my favorite.  Thought the burger was good, but would not return.

i8XK9BpofdX6f8elho6W8g.text: I expected a really good burger & I was very much dissapointed with our visit. The wait for food was nearly a hour. My husband & I ordered med-rare & they BOTH came out well done. I ate mine because I was starving & it wasn't very good. My husband sent his back & received a new one that was closer to a medium than a medium-rare about the time I was done eating. Even the food-runner looked at his burger (after he had taken a bite) & confirmed by saying, "Yeah, that's not even close." It was overpriced, took too long & wasn't even really that good. I had a better burger at FatBurger down the street. I've been to many Gordon Ramsay restaurants & this was by far the biggest let down. I wouldn't visit again.

2w2_dbFjY38PoY48dk_-Zg.text: Just waited in line for 30 minutes. Then waited 30 minutes for our wings then another 15 hour our food. Service was horrible. We were surprised, especially since it a Gordon Ramsey restaurant. Go to Holsteins across the street at the Cosmopolitan. Way better food and service.

CucVX4hVAEDrtK4sociNTA.text: While the food was great, the wait wasn't and I dont think I'll wait that long for a burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sQNga_U-t4wlKcKE0YfGuA.text: We walked in around noon with a shorter than expected wait time of approximately 15 minutes. Unfortunately, their fryer was down so most of the sides weren't available. Oh well, gives me an excuse to come back for more. The service was great. Our waiter was knowledgeable about the menu and recommend us drinks.  We ordered their signature Hell's Kitchen Burger ($17 USD), which consists of asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocados, roasted tomato, and jalapeno aioli. This phenomenal burger is worthy to be called a signature dish -- a thick juicy patty cooked to perfection with everything sandwiched between two toasted sesame buns. The avocados and cheese adds a layer of creaminess. Some would argue that you need some greens to balance it out but this savoury burger hit the spot for me. Flavours: 8/10 Juicy, creamy, savoury Value: 7/10 - The second burger we ordered was the Stout Burger ($16 USD), made with Guinness mustard aioli, gruyere cheese, mushrooms, and crispy onions. This monstrous burger was extremely heavy. I personally love savoury and fatty foods, but this was a little over the top. Don't worry, it's not something a refreshing beer can't fix!  I would definitely recommend coming here to try it out if you haven't already! It's worth your while. Flavours: 6/10 juicy, savoury, fatty Value: 6/10 Overall Service 8/10 Total $: 23 USD

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell’s Kitchen Burger ($17 USD)

sLWlles-vNRcyDTZeAFHEQ.text: Food was delicious. Waiting time was about 20 minutes to stand in line. It's pretty much gourmet burgers. It was pricey but that's what U pay for when ur in Vegas. Server was attentive, kept refilling our waters.

qDRLp8yoCuTJs3_onzQwqw.text: This place was AWESOME!!!  The wait for two looked a lot longer than it was, the line moved really quick. The food was amazing!! We got the ahi tuna sliders and the flavors were pretty damn near perfect. The tuna did seem a little fishy , but not bad. We also got the shrimp/lobster burger and man oh man I am still thinking about that bad boy. So GOOD! As for the service I literally have nothing bad to say at all. Our waiter was very helpful and very attentive, especially considering how busy the place was. And to top it off the manager gave us free tickets to a show, right place right time.  Overall amazing and highly recommended!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome tuna sliders!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite beer of draft!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So excited to check this place out!

sU9_B-sZXTYJH0e3BtvCSA.text: It was a great burger especially a great stop before leaving Vegas from my 40th birthday!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Jw7MDNZfZkl4O0k6QMtbWA.text: After an exceptionally long wait, which we totally expected because of where we were, we got seated. Our server was super polite and helpful and the booth was cozy. The menu is concise and not overwhelming. We ordered Parmesan truffle fries and sweet potato fries and they were excellent! Then, our burgers. We sampled everything, but try the Hells Kitchen burger and the blue cheese burger for sure! Every bite was delicious.

-bc60wyeG8ZzSCP6hIqi5Q.text: Pretty good burger, but the service and fries could be a better. I got the backyard burger, and it was very good, with lots of fresh toppings. The spicy ketchup goes well with it. If you get the fries, there are plenty to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-KC47ldQN4NQlbMaWgJBOA.text: Best burgers, biggest, juiciest burgers! I was amazed on how great the burger was. You really don't need to add any condiments to it. Didn't think I'd enjoy a burger so much. It's flavorful and so delicious. As big as it was I manage to finish every last bite (yes, that good!)   Everything ala cart. Fries are big enough to share with the whole table. We ordered the regular fries and the Parmesan truffle fries for the four of us and didn't even dent any of them. The burgers were filling enough.   Next time we come we'll be trying more of the yummy looking appetizers and maybe sharing a burger.   I couldn't give it five stars because the service was very slow and our fries were served cold. Other then that, everything was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t-tt7epfXMfIdgwPXWQ2uA.text: Nice restaurant, nice decor and staff was friendly.  We tried 3 burgers the Forest, Blue Cheese, and Stout.  Sides were Onion rings and truffle fries.  Son didn't like his forest burger but I like my blue cheese and hubby liked his stout. Bums were lightly toasted and soft. Burgers were cooked to our liking and not greasy at all. Onion rings were all clumped together and more batter than onion. Fries were good and the dipping sauce too. Not too sure if we would return.

2BKaCblqQ25LijykNFK2Lg.text: We stayed in Planet Hollywood, so we always saw a super long line here around dinner time. You can't make reservations here either, so your best bet is to go during a less popular time or wait in a really long line.  The burgers were delicious. I tried the Blue cheeseburger. The blue cheese was subtle and blended well with the other elements of the burger. The Hell's Kitchen burger was also yummy. The burgers don't come with fries, so we ordered the truffle Parmesan fries to share. It came with two sauces that had very different flavors, but added a nice twist.  A star is lost due to the lackluster service. Overall, great burgers at a decent price.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue Cheeseburger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger

SOvW7LM8fbh7BKL1gQqDWA.text: I did a farmhouse burger which was one of the best option, I highly recommend it if you like a burger with an egg. The taste was really good, well cooked, can't imagine how we enjoyed our meals. Onion ring was a good appetizer.  Drawback:  party of 3 or more should stay more in line or leave their phone number; however we waited 20 min or less. +A bit salty.  All in all was so good. (The front burger in the picture)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k4m5vgGwStl7RltkqBguhQ.text: Food was very good.  We split a burger and onion rings.  The burger was cooked to perfection.  I liked the onion rings, but my wife did not.  I would defiantly return for burgers.  One draw back is it is very loud so don't expect anything romantic.

fMAw2n4jSpNUGepE1JSARQ.text: One of the best bangs for your buck on the strip.  Check in process is pretty streamline. They take your name and number, text you when your table is ready and....  Then they forget about you.  What had happened- got the text, we were told to wait near the hostess booth that they would call us within 5 mins.... We waited. After 15 mins I approached the desk and asked how much longer. I guess they took us off the list all together. A manager was nearby and was able to get us seated right away.  Get the onion rings, parm fries, curry ketchup, all the burgers.  All 5 people in my partner talked about their burgers the next 3 days of our trip.

bH6abRt-qYr2Kq7NbvwOLg.text: For all the hype ( and Gordon's insistence on delivering exceptional food in a reasonable time on all his TB appearances ) this was perhaps the most disappointing meal I've had in Vegas.    After a 1 hour wait, we finally were told a table was ready.   Then. We couldn't be seated as Gordon did photos with patrons.   Then, he had a meeting with 3 others in the booth next to us.   We watched as his food rolled out before any patrons.   In all, we waited just under 2 hours for a Burger that looked amazing - but was over $30 per plate with fries ( no drinks but water - which tasted bad - like it wasn't even filtered ).   Fries were chewy - not crisp as advertised. We watched the kitchen for an hour while we waited. It was amazing to watch plates or burgers and fries spend sometimes over 10 minutes waiting for a pickup.  ( a hotdog sat for 12 min )  Waitress was amazing. Place looks great. Clean.  Food slightly better than average. Cost for value - excessive.   Lesson learned - celebrity chefs make great TV.  Not great burger spots.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon Ramsey

NmtoNB-hyoplYVCNFXZRDw.text: Surprisingly, this restaurant always has a line. My friend and I came around 12:30 pm on a Monday and there was a line. Since we were a small party of 2, we were seated immediately. We chose the bar for quick service as we had plans for the day.   I ordered the Portabello Mushroom Burger and my friend ordered the Blu Cheese Burger. We shared the Truffle Oil French Fries to complete our lunch. Both burgers were amazing! The Truffle Oil French Fries were a bit of a disappointment. First all, the fries were soggy. French Fries should, under no circumstances, be soggy. Second, the truffle oil was very faint. it's like they ran out of truffle oil and gave us the small drop that they had left.   French fries are my life! I love them. I always order them. These french fries were disappointing, especially from such a well-known chef as Gordon Ramsay.  I would definitely come back for Gordon's burgers, but I would skip the French Fries next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle oil fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blu cheese burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello mushroom burger. Delish!

m7o442uKlUCrA-IpDKVXRQ.text: The waiting time is the killer! They don't do reservations!  We came a party of 8 at 5 pm and was given a time to come back for our table at 7:43pm ALMOST 3 hours waiting time. We went to  Bellagio to see the fountains And a flowers exposition. Came back around 7:40 pm and waited another 20 min for our table to be ready ( even though we had 2 elderly people one of them is disabled and has problems standing- there is no waiting area) I had to ask hostess twice to check if they can do anything about our situation. Finally at about 8:10 pm we got the table.  The other disappointment was that to get a vegan burger we have to pay extra to substitute meat patty for beyond burger patty. I can buy them in a store pretty cheap why in the hell we had to pay extra!  And the only way they can serve it is as a wrap.  No buns!  The rest was very good experience. Service is outstanding. Burgers very delicious. French fries is big enough to shear between 2-3 people. Timing for getting food after we ordered was very reasonable. Every one were pleased with their food. I might come back if I'm a part of a meat eaters party, but it won't be my choice if it's just my vegan friends. But I would recommend it to try at least once and have that experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n_wlFT3MzgDBNOlSFjQYgA.text: I came here with my boyfriend on a weeknight at around 9pm and there was a long line out the door. Forty minutes later, we were finally seated and ordered our burgers. I had the Chanterelle burger and my boyfriend had the American burger. We both agreed that the burgers were cooked to perfection. I am a big mushroom fan and I absolutely loved the delicate Chanterelle mushrooms nestled in my burger. We also ordered one side of the "Just Fries" which came with two kinds of ketchup, Chipotle and curry ketchup. I would recommend just one side of fries for two people to share, as it was plenty for us. All in all, everything was extremely delicious, and certainly worth the wait. We will definitely be back on our next trip to Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious burgers and fries at Gordon Ramsay&#39;s Burger.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loved every bite of my burger.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The outside window of Gordon Ramsay&#39;s Burger.

qfUlf8PS5LcGlZuRlIlppA.text: It's ok! I honestly would prefer the burgers we make at home. These were a bit overpriced, probably because of the name, and could've been more juicy than dry. I would have given 3 stars but the customer service was poor. We have to flag our waiter down 3 times for thing he should've been paying attention to (drinks, to order and our check). Nothing burns me up like being ready to leave a restaurant and having to wait for your ticket! We went to eat, not spend the night. We experienced the name but won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells kit hen burger with lettuce instead of bread.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar infused ranch

qdq7fIJZZouCJ_sgTTfgLg.text: AWESOME burgers!  A little pricey but that's what you get with a celebrity restaurant on the Vegas strip. Yummy!

rCcAwhftUQEKYqDkbF8k_Q.text: I have never had a burger that was so good in my life. The burger was cooked to perfection and the truffle fries were incredible! Definitely will be back!

9b9-MFQnkVtOHcuT_ic8Aw.text: The burger was as good as advertised!  I had the hell's kitchen burger and truffle fries, and everything was excellent.  One order of truffle fries is large, so good for sharing.

hxh4NrrY1ULBPj9BfkoHZw.text: Backed by a famous chef for a reason! This place blew the away when we were here on vacation recently. Location was in walking distance from our hotel, and wait was only five minutes even though it was super time. Food too a little while to come out but man oh man, what a delight it was. Will have to be back whenever I'm back in town. Hopefully soon

WyPNHw7oASkAKxpR-2esOw.text: Good burger, awesome curry sauce for the fries!

jsYkVSTtZJcdFxK86BWphA.text: Burgers were great. I had the country-bacon eggs cheese burger. The sweet potato fries came with a jalapeno aioli that made them pleasantly unique. A bit pricey and we waited a good 45 mins for a table. But we'd go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger

kAArM-t_x066ENs2TbmQUg.text: Great burgers! Love the beer batter onion rings and yummy fries with truffle drizzle ! Great service

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh meat bun and toppings worth 30 min wait

ccjlLkrNpRGkCjO3bDRSXw.text: This is probably the best tasting burger, but considered  the time to prepare the food and the price I give it 3 stars. The service was excellent, waitress are very polite and friendly, one of them even show us her son video. From the time we sit down and ordered our food, took about 36 minutes, 2 Hells Kitchen burger, fries, and a soup. Drink are coming right away though, water and couple of glass of angry orchard. Total bill is $71. By the time the food came out we kinda tired and lost our appetite a little.

NxArQcFKr3sozGpn7kULTQ.text: I just had the lobster burger and foodgasm.  Kettle chipped nachos. Holy heavens batman.  This place blew my mind.

PY1JI31D_LW-VKWviqBx-g.text: My family and I went here on a whim since the reviews were so great, and my late-night binge watchings of Gordon Ramsay. So my expectations were super high. Unfortunately, our experience was terrible. Went here at 12 in the afternoon, and we had to wait 15 minutes just to be seated. We ordered the truffle fries, some Thai/curry shrimp salad, and a blue cheese burger. It took roughly an hour and 30 minutes just to receive the order. Our fries were room temperature and stale, though the truffle sauce was good. The burger wasn't charred, it was burnt. You couldn't taste the cheese or the meat whatsoever, all you could taste was the bitterness of the burnt parts. Now here's the worst part: the salad. The shrimp was the SALTIEST thing I have ever eaten. I've had plenty of curries in my life, and nothing has ever compared to the burnt, sodium-ridden shrimp that we were served here. Left with less than half the burger gone, only a few fries gone, and a plate full of salad and shrimp. Maybe we just got a bad batch of everything, who knows? Skip this place and go eat somewhere more worth your money.

qEeMuN056vdNjSrJJmeNGg.text: Ramsey would be pissed I sat down with a party of 4 host was very nice but the server was non existent we waiting over 10 minutes before we just got up and left it seemed all the severe wanted to do was chat with each other at their computer station should have expected it since as we walked in another group had approached the host table and asked where do we pay cause they had not seem their server in a long time very disappointing

GnqPPQwxDtgvurfYCBfCKQ.text: Wait was 30 minutes on a Friday night (not bad at all). The burgers were delicious (we got the Farmhouse and the Swine) but the highlight was the Parmesan Truffle Fries, they were thick cut, well-seasoned and not too truffle-y.

nugIP4kmzOYG92tBylYf1A.text: Love this place!  My favorite burger place!   The burgers are well balanced with a good bun to burger ratio.   And they don't drool drippings all down your hand.   They are on the Strip, so prices are high and the place can take a while to get in.   But as I said, my favorite burger and the fries are very good.

STLm0jxUzXXxlte36T80ZA.text: Delicious! Great service. Highly recommend getting the Truffle Parmesan fries. Right near the slot machines so you get to people watch :)

27Jr8228rSsqXfmSinpj2A.text: Best burger and service I've had. The meat combination was perfect and so were the burger choices. Really hit the spot.

fK37-59woQEv38NHJrg7jA.text: This was my second visit here, so it's not like it is terrible. The burgers are fine. Because of the price and the hype, I expected them to blow my mind, but they are just ok. This time, we were there on a Tuesday afternoon, so it wasn't crowded, and yet the service was still slow. I think the part that got me was that when I flagged down a waiter from another table to point out the cockroach skittering across the floor, he didn't even speak to me; he just scooped it up in a napkin and went back to laughing with his waiter-buddy. I would have thought a comment "oh dear" or brief apology would have been in order. I definitely get a "we don't care; we don't have to" vibe from this place. Overall: Meh.

YcQRWXuEDlFThsJjuAMVkg.text: Sat at the bar and had a Hell's Kitchen Burger with the truffle and Parmesan fries with a Belvedere mule. So damn good!

jL-wW6cFyZK18NLfV3Y6CA.text: The burger was awesome. I got the classic burger, American cheese, lettuce, tomato, and onions. We ordered french fries and onion rings. The onion rings were out of this world and it came with two different sauces, both delicious. French fries, I woudn't go crazy about them, a bit mushy. Just that we got seated next to the burning flames which I guess is part of the decor at the end of March, and the waiters were not willing to seat us somewhere else and would want us to go out and wait in the line again if we wanted a different seat. I am not sure what's Gordon's plan for those flames in the summer, it was only March and we were burning already. Maybe that would make people order more beers.

3arzovYeamsDOk-Z7yuLSQ.text: We got a lovely surprise... My fiance took a bite of our lovely nachos and ended up with a mouth full of cheese flavored plastic. The waiter scooped it up and had it replaced immediately but after spitting up a huge chunk of plastic we were like "ehhh,no thanks." The waiter persisted and quickly brought out a fresh plate. We were surprised to see that they were not taken off our bill. We didn't even get an apology from the manager. The burger was good enough but my hot dog was pretty gross. I was so excited too. Gordon is my absolute favorite. Oh the disappointment.

0UfPzXWrJ-3uci7PnQN3fg.text: Totally surpassed my expectations!  The truffle fries were off the hook!  Both of our burgers were amazing!

7cifMc25grLsTSvaNPmFgw.text: I'm a big fan of Gordon Ramsay... from his shows, books, and restaurants. This place did not disappointment. I'm a pescatarian and found the lobster/shrimp burger more than satisfying. The wait was very long... but it was expected. This place was more than exceptional.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bg3jYBs3gAPj4uNGgsSSSg.text: Best burger I've ever had. cooked perfectly. parmesan truffle fries were to die for. great service

uVEvNBNDsWJyYtniiEiPdQ.text: Absolutely delicious! The smells coming from the tables around us kept on our toes for our own food. We were even seated fairly quickly for a party of 8 on a Saturday night. If I'm in Vegas again, I'm definitely going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen Burger (I added lettuce and tomatoes)

sGs1oYBFhlysS640kfT9YA.text: Based on all the reviews I thought the food was going to be something special. Definitely nothing really good. I ordered the tandoori chicken burger and it was on the dry side. Not much flavor. Not worth $14.   We also ordered the shrimp salad. Shrimp was extremely salty! Order it and try it for yourselves! It has good flavor, but the saltiest thing I've ever in my life tasted. The rest of the salad was a basic green leaf salad. Worth $16? NO.  Parmesan truffle fries. It was OKAY. Nothing special other than sprinkled cheese and garlic on fat soggy fries. Worth $12? NO.  Lastly service was extremely slow and lackluster.  Friendly employees at least.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Extremely salty shrimp
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No flavor

82bSL7LXgfOYLqBiiycQxA.text: Favorite place to eat in Vegas. Be prepared to wait in line on busier nights, but it's totally worth it. Every burger I have tried is delicious, and the truffle fries are a must have. Only negative is that it's right next to the casino, so sometimes the background noise can get a little loud. Otherwise an awesome burger joint and well worth anyone's time and money.

OSTrzL3Svl13Pe9nDYXP6g.text: My buddy insisted we go here and was hesitant at first, as I'm not big on celebrity hyped restaurants.  Well I'm happy I went.  I can say that it was one of the best burgers I had. I ordered the farmhouse burger with side of yam fries.  My buddy ordered the special which was an sirloin burger and side of eer battered onion rings.  I did try his onion rings and though they were good, one was enough as didn't feel like deep fried battered that night , as it was very filling.  My burger ordered med-rare and was cooked perfectly.  Beers on tap are plentiful and actually pretty good priced starting at $7 (remember this is Vegas I paid at some places $13 for the same beers).  Service was awesome and constantly checking on us. Usually I am not a fan of burger places that charge around $14 for just a burger, with sides extra, but this is one place where I found it worth it.  Just be warned of you don't have reservations then it could be a bit of a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer battered onion rings and yam fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My buddy&#39;s sirloin burger

t5HUgUASGPzwtVyiGMFTRQ.text: Didn't cook it medium on both visits this weekend . Very disappointing ! Management doesn't seem to care

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

f3KUTm9nmnaO2aIGVdQd1Q.text: $16 dollar burgers without fries. A little expensive, but the meat is so tender and in my opinion worth it.   What we ordered:   Appetizer- nachos. These were great. They come with meat and some sort of sauce. They could reduce the sauce and add a little more meat but they were good!   My fiance ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger: a little too spicy to enjoy it. The peppers are HOT so just know that. I took a bite and couldn't believe how hot the peppers were! Fiance says it was still delicious  My burger: the farm burger wit a fried egg =delicious. 5 stars.  Check it out. Although  expensive it's delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farm burger

tsRiweuc92IyY2zeE4ARmw.text: The hype is reaaaaal.  The burgers aren't bad, they are tasty, but definitely not worth the pricetag. The servers are super slow, and that's the reason they always have a long line outside. There are plenty of tables inside, they just dont turn them over efficiently. Maybe it's their plan.. trying to make it seem more busy than it is.  It is such a popular place in Vegas, because its probably the only moderately priced Gordon Ramsay restaurant in all of Vegas. Try it once, but it's really nothing too special.

NtQA54oniNpwTUxIwP558g.text: Vegetarian impossible burger is trash. Paid almost as much for the lobster burger and was definitely not worth it at all. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger. It came with avocado, grilled jalapeno, cheese, grilled tomatoes and somehow it still didn't manage to taste good. No flavor at all and, it was super dry even though I got it medium rare. Probably one of the worst veggie burgers I've ever had. Tilt in Oregon still the best one I've had. They had truffle fries which were really freaking good I just wish the rest of the dish was just as good. Our sever was awesome too! He even brought us extra sauce. Don't think I'll be coming back for more though. :( l really wanted to like it.

ZgS5BYR9Bk7jkyueTW9DiQ.text: There was a line for lunch at 1pm, but they seat people quickly! We didn't wait long at all. The atmosphere is cool and everyone was very friendly.  The Burnt Ends appetizer was delicious, the Parmesan truffle fries were delicious also!! The burger was just ok.

JzNIRCzdvlEt6kXrvM9nOA.text: Amazing Burgers! Went here on the weekend, had a line, but got in and seated quickly. Our server made great recommendations with the beers. The burgers and fries are really good. Not crazy expensive also. Definitely recommend to anyone coming to Las Vegas for lunch or dinner.

LXc-gy9_p97E7at1Fi6C0g.text: When entering the casino at 9 o'clock on Tuesday the line looked daunting but after a 20-25 minute wait we were seated. The menu is filled with burgers, a couple salads, a few appetizers and some sides. Cone filled shaped sundae cups came out overflowing with truffle garlic fries but sad to say I didn't try them. I did however have the Farmhouse burger and found it to be cooked perfectly, with the bacon crisp and the yolk on the egg just right. My husband had the Hells Kitchen burger pictured below topped with green chiles and avocado slices. $36 for two burgers  It's Vegas after all. Would I go there again, probably not because though everything was delicious I wasn't blown away. I would reserve for his Hells Kitchen Restaurant in advance though.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen Burger

Th2pu7MV266Yddjw09IPLA.text: We had an excellent time having dinner at Gordon Ramsay's Burgers in Las Vegas.  The wait to get in was not as bad as I had expected (they do not take reservations) being only around 20 minutes for parties of two, which most of those waiting seemed to be. If you have a party of 3 or more, they seem to be seated more quickly.  The line to enter the restaurant runs past a 8' high glass wall with large, dancing flames spaced about 10" apart which makes for a somewhat uncomfortable wait despite the thick double glass walls. It's hot enough in Vegas without having to stand next to an artificial open flame fireplace while waiting to be seated.  We had hamburgers, naturally, and the Truffle Fries were quite a nice experience.  Service was quick, the food good and ,although high, the prices were reasonable for being on The Strip.  All things considered, I'd eat here again.

3ASBhotlf5_zTm8c4x5xTg.text: I would come back just for the kettle nachos and truffle fries. **get the nachos and fries!!!!!  The burgers are large. I liked that the buns were grilled but I didn't care for the patties. I had the hog burger. Too much pork for me and it was in the dry side.  I really wish they would serve fish and chips.   I liked that our waitress said we could order grilled cheese for our toddler. I probably would have ordered it for myself too if I hadn't gotten the burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lGegaLBSQHj4CRKU0x4KJA.text: 11/10.. had a Wellington burger. Wasn't on the menu and glad we were told about it. Best burger I've ever had and set the bar very high for future burger joints!

rOobM3bqo8CGLx7NiBOOFA.text: Worth the wait! Had the onion rings and the flavor was delicious. I've never had onion rings tho good. I had the Hell kitchen burger and it was to spicy . It was juicy and flavorful. The service was excellent and our waiter was very attentive. I will definitely be going back on our next visit .

1d_a-LYElDvAfKHX7tPhWQ.text: Yummy burgers!!!    but this review is based off of service and it sucks ( what was the waitress doing) I wish Ramsay came in and put two slices of bread on this waitress and ask her "WHAT ARE YOU!?" .....and I think you guys know the response to that, if not then just look it up.  There was a party of 2 that sat 15min after us and received their food way before us; we had to wait an additional 10min for our food to come out. What a bummer.

nHe3HPiKZfrqtFZoH2hQxQ.text: Brought our daughter here as this is one of our favorites in Vegas.  The burgers are some of the best.  She loved the standard cheeseburger.  I tried the Pork burger which had an amazing match of flavors, the burger was the base for a juicy slab of pork on top with great flavor enhancers.  My daughter enjoyed the parmesan fries too!  Said if they were curly and smaller they would be as good as Arby's, OK so her palet is not that sophisticated!  My wife had a Kale Salad that was a HUGE miss.  Some of the Kale leaves were yellow and had spots on them.  When we showed them to the waitress she asked the Chef, who said kale comes in many colors.  True, but not yellow with spots.  We threw in the BS flag, so the waitress (with attitude) went to get the manager.  Manager never showed and just took it off our bill.  Moral of story, don't get a salad at a burger place!

Ovi51NLkSNOf7IEwV_ZRjQ.text: This restaurant is once the best burger places I've ever been! The burgers were deep and flavorful, and the meat was cooked perfectly. Their Oreo Creme brulee was also delicious! It's an experience that me and my boyfriend will never remember!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pFvlvJ_xlzaJqWRc3tzVfg.text: This place is a gimmick, but it's a gimmick that tastes dang good. I grew up watching the myriad of Gordon Ramsay reality TV shows, so when my family was in Vegas with me for a night, we knew we had to stop into one of his restaurants.  The first thing that surprised us was the stunning length of the line. Luckily, for groups of three or more, you can have them text you when your table is ready.   The burgers are delicious. You could make the argument that they aren't worth the price, but honestly, for the experience, and just knowing that I'm in an incredibly touristy city to start with, it felt like a fair price.  It's definitely something you need to experience at least once!

29gcZPppzIvDriiDqiVNOA.text: Incredible Burgers. In town for convention. Heard about the awesome burgers . Hot spot .

dVuAJkyoDG34VXGzlAnJsA.text: This restaurant isn't just good because it's owned by one of the world's most renowned chefs, it's good because of the food! I've heard really great things about this restaurant and I'm so happy I got to experience it myself. I really enjoyed my meal, and so did my parents (who usually don't like "American food".  Order: - Hell's Kitchen Burger (5/5) - Farmhouse Burger (5/5) - Crown Burger (5/5)  Pros: - Amazing food ~ the burgers were cooked to perfect and the onion rings and fries were crispy and delicious  - Great service ~ our waiter (I believe his name is Josh) explained the menu well and checked up on us regularly to make sure we were enjoying the food - A lot of great options to choose from ~ they have more than just burgers (apparently the wings are amazing too) - Large burgers ~ don't be fooled by the photos. Looking through Yelp, I thought the burger would be small, but they're actually pretty large  Cons: - Expensive ~ Each burger is about $16 - Long wait ~ Including the time waiting in line and waiting for our food, my family and I probably spent about 1 hour waiting - Hard to find ~ the restaurant is located inside Planet Hollywood Resort & Casino. It took us a minute to finally find a sign pointing in the general direction of the restaurant, not to mention we had to cross the whole casino   Overall: - Despite the hefty price, Gordon Ramsay Burger is WELL worth the wait (when in Vegas, right?)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown Burger ~ Ordered w/out cheese (don&#39;t be fooled by the photo, it&#39;s actually a large burger)

MaCLD6qolJtYhGUuimVlsA.text: Walking The Strip we knew we wanted to eat somewhere special, which is why we came here for dinner. The lineup to get a table had a wait time of 35 minutes but no worries, the staff took down my number and texted when a table was ready.    Everything from the food and the presentation was top notch; the waiter was great too. I didn't realize this was the "cheapest" of Gordon's restaurants until my wife showed me the other high-end prices, yikes!     We didn't wait too long for our food; I ordered a Farmhouse Burger, beer-battered onion rings and this caramel-shake concoction that I couldn't finish! The burger was one of best I'd ever had, hands down. The bill was high but to be expected...and well worth it!    If in Vegas and you want a taste of greatness consider eating here...highly recommended!

Sc4SfodA4anFzyyV8Uz12A.text: 2 hour wait for 2 people on a Saturday night! It was worth the wait but it took forever to be seated. My husband wanted to take me to try the famous Gordon Ramsay burger for song long that he finally did. He loves Gordon Ramsay burger and he finds it to be the best burger he has ever tried. Was it the best burger I ever tried? Indeed it was!   The design of this place is really nice and gives off chill vibes. Our waiter was really nice and handled everything well. For appetizer, we ordered the hell fire chicken wings which was finger lickin good. The flavor, the level of spiciness, and how crispy the wings were to perfection! My husband and I decided to order 2 different burgers and split it to try the difference. I ordered the hells burger and my husband ordered the  Stout burger. As for the side we ordered just fries which is enough for 2 people and that was also really good. I'm not a fries kind of person but I must say these fries hit the spot with their different varieties of ketchup which was fused with chipotle and curry.   The burgers did not disappoint and I was really impressed with everything.  The stout burger was my favorite it was really delicious. My husband didn't have any favorites he just loved everything equally because it was that good for him.

L7WX8lSYNb0Nfnd--RrIBw.text: Gordon Ramsay was my favorite childhood celebrity chef. Known for his  uncensored comments to competing chefs, I was always drawn in to the drama. I had high hopes of his burger restaurant in Vegas.  The line wasn't too bad at 1pm on a Sunday. You line up along the fire lit sign outside. It was about a 20 minute wait.  I was super hungover from the night before and just wanted a glass of water. Service was extremely slow and it took around 10 minutes for the water to come out even after checking up on it.   I saw some white girls post on yelp that the beer battered onion rings were amazing. I knew I shouldn't have believed them! The rings were overly battered and soo oily. Not worth.  I ordered the Hell's kitchen burger and my friend ordered the forest burger. We shared half each and both patties were super dry. The Hell's kitchen burger looked and tasted worse than a normal burger. I wanted some heat from the roasted jalapenos, but it wasn't spicy at all. The forest burger had more flavor because of the tremor cheese, seasonal forest mushrooms, arugula and duck bacon, but it was still bland.  Gordon Ramsay really needs to do a kitchen nightmares on his own restaurant! The burger was plated on a large white plate and sooo not pleasing to the eyes. At least add some fried or salad to it!  I expected much better for a restaurant with GR's name. Someone really needs to do a consistency check because i'm still having PTSD from those dry patties. The service was really slow and can be improved.

PaQ5aiCG-e143bSOBhDw0w.text: On my recent trip to Vegas the charge for my family was "a good burger".  I like to tell people that I haven't had a good burger since Trump took office.  Very likely a coincidence but you never know.   For starters we got the truffle fries and onion rings. Those onion rings are something else. I've never had an outside so crispy and light yet the inside so toothsome. Must be how they do the fish and chips. If it is. Sign me up.   I liked the thickness of the fries. My only complaint is that the truffle flavor was not very uniform. Some bites were very intense and others had none.   Now for the burger. My patty was actually a hair over but I didn't care. It was juicy and flavorful and the best burger I'd had in a long time. I'm sure any of the other burgers are just as good there.   So there you have it. I got my good burger to hopefully last me at least four more years.

tK5BvEJH7b7trKG_Tq23rw.text: Wish I could rate this restaurant higher. Love the other concepts and even Gordon's shows but my experience was beyond off putting.   There were two in our party at 10am on a weekday. The restaurant wasn't even half full when we arrived. Entrees took around 30 minutes maybe more. Fries were exceedingly hot but sadly our burgers were not. Mine was even cold and a bit over cooked. As if allowed to cool before adding the cold sauces etc. I did not observe any manager walking the floor nor working off to the side for the entire duration of our meal. Our server checked in so quickly I didn't get a chance to eat any more than a fry. By the time he came back I was ready to pay and leave. I tried emailing their management team to which I have not received a reply other than their events coordinator rapidly saying she forwarded my email to the management team.   Great ambiance, but food execution, management presence, and salvaging a guests poor experience are severely lacking. Pretty sad when the other brands perform at such a high level and Gordon on his many shows preaches such a high level of excellence.

lqg6p5FH667fA7VhKlh3JA.text: I had friends speak highly Gordon Ramsay restaurant.  Like everyone has stated it's a long wait however they do take your number and text you when your table is ready. Don't go to far you only have 10 minutes to get back, or you lose your spot. Although a wait, well worth it. The burgers are amazing. The flavor, everything is throughout out from the burger to what's add to it, to even custom sauce. If you're looking food a meat lovers burger, get the Hog Burger. You want regret it. Friends got the Fish and Chip burger and spoke highly of it as well. Cant have a burger without fries. The Truffle Fries with the sauce, a must have. Definitely worth the wait to taste a burger from the famous Gordon Ramsay

U3_Sa0iT4IpidLvfMEuA2g.text: Man, what a disappointment. I probably set myself up for disappointment because I had such high expectations of this place.  I got there early to beat the lunch crowds because there is often a wait for a table. This place offers no reservations so you just gotta arrive and see if they have tables or put yourself in line.  You are greeted at the entrance and taken to a table. The dining area was large, very clean and had a nice modern decor.  The server was great. This was the best thing about the operation. The servers are on top of things. Immediate refills, clearing the table, etc, and they do so without loitering.  The menu basically has appetizers, fries, and burgers. It is not labeled as such but the fries are a huge portion that seem to be intended for sharing. There were regular fries, sweet potato fries, parmesan truffle fries, and maybe another. We asked if we could do half regular and half sweet potato but they said no. Evidently it would be too difficult to fill the thing with some of one and some of the other but maybe I shouldn't expect too much from a $20 order of fried potatoes. So, we ended up with parmesan truffle fries. What a load of crap. The fries were caked with oily parmesan crumbles and they had a ton of garlic flavor. I could hardly taste the actual potato. And the truffle? It's just a little dish of truffle aoli, so basically some mayo with truffle oil and a few tiny shavings of truffle that served no function beyond using the word "truffle" on the menu.  I ordered the standard burger cooked medium rare. It came out at least medium, maybe medium well. It was the same cook level as others in my group that had medium well. I don't think the beef was seasoned well but to be honest I couldn't tell because this burger was not balanced.  The bun was huge and fluffy so it basically became mushed bread as I ate the burger. I tasted more bread than meat and cheese. The cheese was American and it was only partially melted. The lettuce, tomato and pickles were chilled which made the meat and cheese cold. The pickles were sweet like butter pickles which I do not think went well on the burger.   Also, the tables are too small. Our burgers, fries, and appetizer came out at the same time and we had no room on the table for all of it. My burger sat there getting cold as I rushed through the appetizer. I really hate when courses are brought to the table early. This shouldn't be a difficult process to manage.  Two burgers, shared fries, shared appetizer, waters and tip = $85. Not worth it. I recommend going somewhere else for a burger.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backyard burger. I added the mustard
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backyard burger

fe6tpSNzsCq1sSTttrQqKw.text: Watching Gordon Ramsay yell at people and just idolizing that man.. If I'm coming to Vegas, I'm gonna go to his restaurants!   I've been to bread street kitchen and this place is way more casual.   Classic Gordon Ramsay restaurants with its amazing decor and wow factor.   They have a separate line for 2 or less people near the firing flame of fire where Gordon Ramsay's burger name is.   If you have over 3 people, check in at the front.   There were about 5 couples ahead of us and the hostess said it would be about 20 min but we waited for only 10.  We got the special Hawaiian burger. It was the best burger ever!!! Not a pineapple ring, but pineapple chunks, marinated pork, with the hamburger and amazing bun.  I got the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was so good. A little spicy but amazing.   We also got the pecan milkshake and it was amazing.   We got the truffle fries and it was good but the fries were a little burned.  I wish they gave the fries first because the burgers were pretty filling so we ended up eating half the fries.   Also the shake came first so it was super good but sweet and a little filling.   Service was a tad slow hence the 1 star off. It was not a full house as there were empty tables but it wasn't like amazing service. Water not full, waited around a while for our check, etc.   Overall good place to go for your first time!

jcMu-aun1ttBfirmqwRX1g.text: Go for the burger! Ha! This place is self explanatory. The flames are very eye catching with a mesmerizing motion to draw you towards the long line of people waiting to have a bite of one of these mouth-flavoring burgers.   It's conveniently located near an entrance which is great if you want to avoid the cigarette smoke when walking through the casino area.

EHitGs5efb95OamMxkN2TA.text: This is my second time coming and this place always leaves a great impression! The staff is super nice and friendly... not the "fake smile because I want good tips" friendly, but genuinely nice people. The burgers are over the top with flavor and not too expensive (for Gordon Ramsay, of course). Not too much of a drink menu but the drinks are still really good and they don't hold back on the alcohol.

4sS2DwwDpl-GoNkG0Ov1iw.text: Be prepared to wait in line for a long time but that's OK because they have a wonderful view of a fire wall on display in the window m. the burger that I got had fried egg in it and the meat was a little tuff.

y5-TAWYhiqaboQgf5Bl08w.text: My husband and I loved this place... about a 30-40 minute wait but completely worth It... service was fast enough to calm the "hangriness," but not fast enough to make you worry about the actual freshness of the meal. t111teDh224bPU5Wg2DFug.text: THE. BEST. BURGER. EVER.  Literally words can't describe how flavorful, tender, and juicy this burger was. I love a good classic burger that uses fresh ingredients that compliment each other, instead of relying on gimmicky crap. I got the crown burger and it was outstanding. The bun was perfection, the tomatoes and fresh herb aioli was perfect together. The arugula was a great addition to the burger. We also had the curried shrimp salad which was very tasty and full of good flavors as well. Drinks are good too. I will be back for those delicious burgers. Definitely lives up to the hype.
