dDHT8lhx0o6IadSv7MwFiQ.text: Doesn't really live up to the hype. The sauces (ketchup, honey mustard, mayo) all had really weird tastes to them (made in-house) so we asked for regular ketchup. Burger was okay and the staff was really nice.

uRGAevud0iI8b0dW18OU3Q.text: My friends and I have decided to try out Gordon Ramsey Burger this weekend while we were in Vegas.  Host: 1 star  For anyone who is a first timer, parties of 3 or more do not need to wait in their line. You'll need to go to the host and tell them your name/number of people. They will ask for your number and send a text. Once when you get a text, you have 10 minutes to return back to the restaurant to get your table.   Initially, we had a group of 7 present, which we need to wait about 35-40 minutes. We then had an additional 3 more people added to our group, a total of 10. I went up to the host, Kelly (asked our server specifically what was her name just in case if she gave me a fake name), to change the number of parties. She again asked for my number but  I never received an updated text. I reconfirm with another female host and she also said they will resend a text. Guess what? My request was never on the books. We ended up with 7 people in one table and the other 3 had their own table on the other side of the restaurant. This service is not acceptable.   Food: 5 stars  Highly recommend: TRUFFLE FRENCH FRIES  Burgers do not come with fries. We've ordered truffle French fries, ahi tuna sliders, hellfire chicken wings as appetizers. I've ordered a crown burger, super delicious!   Server: 5 stars  We had great service from our server. She was very organized and friendly. Food came out quick.   Would I return to this restaurant? Yes  I understand that the awaiting guests may be overwhelming to the hosts but this type of service is unacceptable. People come to the restaurant because of Gordon Ramsey. The service may just be ruining it.

Idhs31MONnOt6LDyJLQuVw.text: The fries were on the mushy side. The burgers were average. When the burgers were served the meat wasn't hot and the cheese was cooled as well. It took an unreasonable time to  be served, and to receive the check. After the check was received the server didnt return for 15 minutes. I expect more from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant that charged us $92 for a mediocre experience.

TPpFFF8yuBY92Nn2bFWAjw.text: Worst customer service ever. The host girls didn't know what they were doing. We were a group of 12 willing to spend our money here. We put our name In and told us an hour and half wait which we were ok with. They said they would text us when our table was ready. About an hour and 15 mins we received a text saying our table is almost ready start to head over so we did. When we got to the host the girls had told us they given our table away and there was nothing they could do. We arrived at the host 5 mins after we received the text. I asked to speak to the manager and they claimed there was no manager there at the time. Very disappointed.

E5ceaoJNI85KEA2xJ_178w.text: Dined in here the day after Christmas. Wait time was around half an hour to 40min. We ordered the truffled Parmesan fries, Hell's Kitchen burger and Hog burger. Price was reasonable. The Hell's Kitchen burger was ok but Hog burger was really good. It gave you different layers of flavors with burger patty, bacon, beef, brisket, and the fried onion layer offers a crispy texture. The fries were also very tasty and not oily at all. Recommend this place.

Fr94r-H-5cwacOtzUs51TA.text: Finally got a chance to try a Ramsay joint and was super excited to. With all the hype around Ramsay I was sure this place would be good. Boy was I disappointed!! Are you kidding me!? This place was horrible. Can't believe I waited an hour to eat at this place when there were so many other options, it is Vegas. First the fries.. ordered extra crispy and when the food runner brought it out we asked if it was extra crispy and she was like sure. Then when we tried it, it was all soggy and def not crispy. Server came to check saw it wasn't right, took it away and brought us a new one. Same thing, no flavor and barely fried. Burgers.. there were 8 of us so we got to try everything from the lobster to the regular burger. Not sure if it all sat there a while before getting to the table but even the center of the meat was cold. The buns was stale and cold, probably didn't even get toasted. Not sure why this place had high ratings maybe cause of the name? However we won't be coming back.

OzPUYYwZ2y8EfAJdh1KYMg.text: What can one say, it's everything one expects. The best buyer ever, onion rings.  From seeing other dishes they look delicious as well

89tIBSl7dYreHwLXkEihDA.text: In the Planet Hollywood directly next to the door to the strip, easy to find. Or as easily as you can find anything in Vegas!  Great decor, distinctly Gordon Ramsay and delicious. Not a "giant" selection but what you should expect from a renowned chef.   I had the Hog Burger and can say it's one of the best and unique burgers I've had. Made with a pork patty, bacon and other delicious ingredients and a great bun, definitely a great burger. My girlfriend had the blue cheese burger and it didn't disappoint. We shared a batch of salt and vinegar crisps, very good and unique.   There is usually a wait so be prepared. It's in a busy casino so be prepared. It's likely that Gordon won't be there so be prepared.   Service did not disappoint and the prices are consistent with strip celeb chef places but worth it. I will go back. Passed it last time I was in Vegas and will try something different.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VOxYJaUYWtPJQXj9iWX49w.text: Ate here last week and loved my experience...I sat at the bar and key note is that the line outside could be long but the bar seating is open seating. Sat down right away with a 30+ minute wait. The bartender staff here is really on it and the service I received was outstanding. I decided on the Hell's Kitchen Hamburger which consisted of asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes and jalapeno served protein style. My only dock of this place in a time and era of people not wanting to eat tons of bread learn how to properly protein wrap a burger. Throwing a piece of butter lettuce on the bottom and one of top isn't cutting it. What was cutting it was the flavor of this burger. Thank you for asking how I like my burgers cooked and actually delivering on it. This burger was cooked to a perfect medium with just the right amount of pink. Also the other combination of flavors where down right delicious! I also against my better judgement ordered the beer battered onion rings. My body said no but my taste buds said yes and my hunger. These onion rings are probably the best I have ever had. Served with parmigiano-reggiano cheese AMAZING! served with chipotle ketchup and cheddar ranch dip AMAZING! I really loved eating here and would for sure be back again...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer battered onion rings with parmigiana-reggiano served with chipotle ketchup and cheddar ranch dip these are amazing!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen Burger asadero cheese, roasted jalapeños, avocado, roasted tomatoes as jalapeño aioli protein style.

1ZXk0K_3NC1zsoZY0htbsQ.text: Ordered Hog Burger which made from pork but cooked in several ways, this is a very interesting burger, so tried it and it's delicious. Is it worth of $18? Well, considering it's Gordon Ramsay and location, it's pretty good.  One downside is, if you got seated next to casino, you may smell cigarette.   The Backyard Burger is very good especially with grilled onion. It is worth the $15 price tag.    Service was good, it took a bit to get burgers but it's fair amount of time due to they had to cook them like regular dish

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5wcsgeuH7BXkY55gHBuVMQ.text: Was able to walk in for lunch and be seated right away. Wendy introduced her self and received our drink order. We just stayed simple with water. We then ordered the HOG DAWG, cheese on the side, the Crown burger, medium, unfortunately it was not as good as we expected. For it to be cooked medium, it actually looked really rare. Meat was not flavorful and was actually a little dry. I know that sounds weird but it really was. The truffle fries and onion rings were good. Both were crispy and the fries were made better with the parmesan and truffle. The hog dawg was delicious though. Well, it was wrapped in bacon and then there was pulled pork on top of it. Made my mouth water as I prepared to eat it. The place itself is clean but a little cluttered with so many tables and chairs. Waitress provided good service. I was shocked when I looked at my bill and they charged $4 for a slice of avocado. Wow! I would not return here, even though the hog dog was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

42PA-x9eWeUo3y35ux0Buw.text: This restaurant is located in Planet Hollywood and you can earn tier points for your purchase as well. Our server was awesome and very attentive. It is a busy place, so I was pleasantly surprised. My husband and I started our meal with the black garlic Cesar salad--It was your standard Cesar, except elevated. We ordered the hog burger which was heavily meaty, slightly sweet, juicy and with texture variation due to the crispy onion straws. We also ordered the Hells Kitchen burger and added arugula; I love the way arugula cuts through heavy foods. It was juicy and had a great flavor balance of spicy and fresh. We ordered the truffle fries and they were delicious. They were crisp and well seasoned.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger add arugula
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog burger

F7UKlUY2tP2W966hkb_SOg.text: The fries are more than enough for 2 people!!   Our waiter was fantastic (I feel so bad for forgetting his name!) & very helpful.  I ordered the Mediterranean & my fiance got the classic cheese burger. Both were absolutely incredible. Definitely put this on your list if you're a foodie!!

W3Bi5i3rdOicwIh3NVG86A.text: everytime I go Vegas I saw long line there...  finally took the morning lunch with no line.   the burger is great no doubt  meat is high quality. if you add drink and fires price will be high.  for the price, I may have BBQ buffet off the street.but burger is great no doubt.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. hell kitchen burger

nS5q9OnCsup772MUY2g4RQ.text: Great place to get some stunning burgers. I've been here three times and I've never been disappointed by the burgers or entrees.   One thing I must say about the chips (French fries) is that they can be so hard or stale sometimes. I'm not sure if this is affected by when I go in (the later I go in, the more stale the chips get), but it's a bit annoying because I love having fries with my burgers. The sauces are good but I would love some more universally friendly versions of them. I know the curry sauce had a very overwhelming spice to it.   The burgers are good. The salad (pictured) is also great. It's Gordon Ramsay, what else do you expect?   The only reason why I took two stars off was because the service is always sooooooo slow. I don't get it. I understand that it'll get a little slower when it's busy, which is fine, but even when it's not and there's barely a line, my server will always forget something or take forever to check up on me.   Otherwise, it's a great burger joint. Maybe avoid the fries if you can? Breading on the onion rings were stellar!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HAgBhayeWhkrEfH3emLHEw.text: This place was so less than average. I had really high expectations & took my boyfriend here for his birthday since burgers are one of his absolute favorite foods. There was a long wait, which we were prepared for, since they don't do reservations. Then we started with the kettle chip nachos which just did not turn my crank for lack of a better phrase. They were so average. It tasted like I took lays chips from the store and cheese and threw it together myself! Then we ordered our burgers and fries. The truffle parmesan fries were no truffle & all parmesan. As if you just cut potatoes and sprinkled a bunch of parm on them- just not a great taste to be honest. As for my very simple backyard burger.. it tasted EXACTLY like Shake Shack- and if that's your thing, do yo thang. But I'm an In N Out girl! So I would have rather payed for that and had a better experience than come here. My boyfriend loved the Hog Burger though, which I was happy about! Subsequently, the walk from the parking garage here is really long. Be prepared!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backyard Burger

_FoArNzwAVsXXP__tef8UA.text: the best burger I've ever had. Definitely recommend. Stopped in around 11pm on a Saturday night & was seated fairly quickly. Great spot that's open late night.

E5hZ2wrpU13FzztRrSTeiA.text: Wow what a fun spot to go eat after watching some Gordon Ramsay clips on the internet. I had the duck poppers, stout burger and onion rings.  All were really good and no complaints. The duck poppers were really something unique and really good.  There are so many burgers that look so good.  The stout burger really hit the stop and was cooked very nicely. This is a great place to stop by in Las Vegas, just be prepared to wait in line.

OHiyNPD4GnB8m9NZubZ-bw.text: Staff is wonderful and attentive! Refills without asking, nice fun with family and food was great! Staff interacted with our children considering not many kids, made they feel important as well. Well done chef, food was amazing and fresh!

Q4rzzK_VaSnf_r7wy2pc2A.text: I can not put into words how amazing these burgers are.  I usually go for a farmhouse burger but this time I tried the hog burger and I'm glad I did. Made from mangalitsa pork which is probably some divine pig in Europe. Also I'm not a fan of coleslaw but it totally works on this hog monstrosity. If there's one downside to this place it's their ketchup and if Gordon Ramsey told me I was swine not good enough for the hog burger I wouldn't disagree. I have my taste though and Heinz would be much better on their fries than the in house ketchup they serve. We opted for regular fries but the parmesan truffle fries are great too next time we come back we'll try out the sweet potato fries, yes there will be a next time. Oreo cremebrule shake is great give that a try too if you love sweet treats.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gi9-KH9DNdAa3YgMjvv32Q.text: For all of you Vegetarians out there, this restaurant offers an "Impossible Burger" patty to be ordered in place of regular meat patty on any of their burgers. And let me tell you this: IT IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! Even meat lovers will be converted! This place will definitely have me come back for more. Also, their milkshakes are out of this world! My husband and I had the Oreo Creme Brulee shake, it was fantastic. Can't wait to go back! If you want high quality food, this place is it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest Burger with the Impossible Meat patty
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest Burger with the Impossible Meat patty
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X6VBmUEOWgWCWDVd5rIKbA.text: My favourite burgers by far.  I'm a local and I will brave the Strip to have some of these.  Service is great, food is exceptional.  I got a blue cheeseburger: the figgy jam perfectly pairs with the bleu cheese.  Onion rings are not very sweet but the breading is perfect.  Got a sticky toffee pudding ice cream sandwich for dessert, very yummy.  I recommend going at lunch if you want to avoid a wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheeseburger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheeseburger

BNhuveSiP90otOAaNHJc6A.text: Was skeptical at first due to the hype around this place but wow what an amazing burger.   I ordered the hells  kitchen burger, avocado, jalapeno roasted tomato and a side of steak fries.  Burger was cooked perfect, had amazing flavor and was perfectly put together, absolutely loved it!  The fry's has zero salt on them and overcooked a touch.   The service here was less then great, we sat with empty waters, the server came back once just after the food came before we knew we needed salt.  Meal was very expensive for the quality of service. Order water  skip the frys and come for the burger.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7WfbDnA4Ub8TocpOxhNFmQ.text: It pains me to give three stars. We're big fans of Gordon Ramsey and we're really excited about going here. We ordered a grilled cheese for my friends three year old and asked them to bring it early. They forgot to put it in. When everyone else got their food they said it was three minutes away. Twenty minutes later we got it. That wasn't all. One friend's burger was cold and took an additional 29 minutes and the other friend got the wrong order and just sucked t up and ate it because she didn't want to wait. Mine was good, but that didn't make up for the overall bad experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BlvghBmyx44jPY1VNhY_tg.text: I can't review the food because I didn't even get a chance to sit down. I don't usually leave bad reviews but I felt compelled since the Gordon Ramsay Pub and Grill disappointed me too.  This review is about his burger restaurant at Planet Hollywood though.   I arrived around 11:45 and there was no line.  I stood in front of the hostess stand about 5 feet away and looked for room at the bar.  There wasn't room, so I patiently waited in front of the hostess stand.  I was ignored for 30 minutes as the line started piling up. I asked the hostess if I could sit at the bar and she told me to get in line. I explained to her that I had been waiting right there the entire time and she rudely told me that I had been waiting in the wrong place. I get it, Gordon Ramsay is a famous chef, but have some common sense and don't ignore people who are obviously waiting for a seat. The arrogance and rudeness was unbelievable.    Luckily there are tons of burger places on the Vegas strip and I found a great burger elsewhere. This just goes to show that you can slap a well know name on anything and get away with a sub par product. Get a clue and focus on your service rather than just banking on a famous TV persona.    Shameful.

qV4v5e5OZfetdzr49hUJEw.text: I wait over an hour for my order then the hostess tells me I have to wait longer, I come to find out they gave my order away to someone else and ask if I'd like to wait another hour while they remake it.

gL3XlRaS_7mlIGGYYr4teg.text: The burgers were AMAZING! I had to wait in line for about 40 minutes but it was worth the wait. It was my first time here, and it is a Vegas must. I got the crispy chicken burger with sweet potato fries. The chicken was fries to perfection - crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The service was great and everybody was super kind.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy chicken burger

Jz0cr4n0HSx1I2u_f-zPfg.text: Came on Sunday Night, late, line was short but wait about 15 minutes.  Young female hostesses laughing about things in their life as the customers wait with not even a greeting or an estimate or anything. I definitely felt there was no caring for the customer and wished Gordon Ramsay had walked in causing the hostesses to stand at attention and get people seated. The burgers are excellent, maybe the best I've ever tasted, but the onion rings were not 100% done, a bit doughy on the inside. For the price of these hamburgers I would have like to be treated with a little bit more respect.  Just not feeling anyone cared.

fGBc4AKL5IrzcsBlmJG9mA.text: Not a burger person but had to stop in for a try. Service was amazing. Good was well priced. And the burger was one of the best I had

xhOd7WhKw4Y6MGNgxReb9g.text: Waiting over 45 minutes to get our food the service is horrific!!! The attitude of the waitress was like what do you mean the service is taking too long I'm a look at one of the good burger I guess I came to the wrong place

95rLzx5r7q-3eicldzH05w.text: Good food, terrible service. The hostesses are incredibly rude while we are waiting to be seated.

XREwcvJHSIehJd8CewxXXA.text: First time to try the Gordon Ramsey burger! I was delicious! Definitely would come back again!

r0BADOk9jlQrc1EgT0PhWw.text: This was an amazing experience. The wings are incredible and I don't really eat wings often. I had the Hells Kitchen Burger. And the Jalopena Rita!

dHiazOR6FkufaiFjM7zFfg.text: Gordon Ramsay is my idol and his creations are perfection. I love the truffle fries and I got the house burger. Both items were perfect, the first bite got my mouth dancing! The environment was really cool too!

2pXFqr20bBCFAo3x0jTWRQ.text: My God, this was the best burger I have had in a long time. Besides the wait, I guess other people like great food too, the food was pretty quick and our sever was really nice and personable. Even though it was twenty something for the burger and a couple bucks more for the fries, I will definitely swing by the next time I'm back. While you wait, walk around the corner and check out Tipsy Robot. Fully customizable drinks from a robotic bartender.

fPlbbJePy9nwULbz4f5Muw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. Always tasting great and service is amazing. The manager always comes to our table to check how we're doing and if there's anything he can do to make our experience better.

lATgULOcZ_4zYf47tT7aZA.text: I think the name of Gordon Ramsay is the big draw. We ordered two burgers and neither was what I expected from a big name chef. The wait is also very long and the fries were disappointing. I wouldn't recommend this place. Just not worth the wait.

vWfXushuT6aa1w_o_Qf-1A.text: One of my "have to go" places before my first trip to Vegas. Waited a while in line and got seated by very pleasant hostesses. Wait staff also was amazing and very friendly. The food was what I had an issue with. It took FOREVER to get our food!!! Almost 40 mins for burgers to come out. The fries were cold when they came out. I was sorely disappointed!!

I-FcZhCtNOZX1J-LdxAqFQ.text: The burgers are amazing, and they are incredibly reasonably priced. My bloody mary was weak, which was a bummer, but the food was mega satisfying to me and my friend so that outweighs the drink experience.  I will definitely hit up this place again when I'm in Vegas.

OXA_Egs2ahpyaATjYvdLhA.text: I was dining alone. When I inquired about bar seating, I was told by the three hostesses to wait in line for a place at the bar...that they would come and get me as soon as a place was free. After 25 minutes, 4 places opened. I waited and watched the 3 hostesses laugh and chat with each other while the four spots remained empty. 10 minutes (yes I timed it) and I decided to tell them places were available.  They laughed and pointed to the bar saying I should go sit. When I said they SAID they'd come and get me, they giggled and said "you can have a seat". Unbelievable.  Many tables empty with a line of 20 people waiting. I have no problem waiting but when there are at least 5 tables, 4 bar stools available...and the hostesses are ignoring us...something needs to be done. Now onto the food! I ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger and truffle fries.  Both were delicious.  I expected the burger to be thicker bit it was really good. Bar staff were attentive and friendly.  I'd have given 5 stars except for the hostesses...who still haven't sat people at  3 empty and clean tables (and I'm only giving a quick glance) to the people waiting.

3_DppihRHR6tA1IWWXaooA.text: I don't know how people could say this place doesn't live up to its hype, because I LOVED my experience here! I had the lobster and shrimp burger  ($25) but it was $25 well spent! It's one of their specialties! The lobster and shrimp patty was so fresh and freaking delicious. The truffle fries were good but the sweet potato fries were even better. It had a nice crispy texture with powered sugar! Also, if you get the lobster and shrimp burger be aware that the pickled veggies are kind of spicy because there are jalapenos in it! Besides that, its definitely worth trying and the service was great!

Z7NtYdKNklqiSAlf-xUoug.text: Skip it. Skip it. SKIP IT! I have been in Vegas for a week and literally couldn't find a bad meal. I let my guard down. Fool me once... This was horrible. We ordered chicken wings and they were ice cold in the middle. Clearly precooked and reheated. So gross. I had to insist that I wouldn't pay for them, rather than being offered a comp. Burgers were sub par. Definitely nothing to write home about. Disappointed for sure. I expected way more from Gordon Ramsay. So sad.

kMjMJpbpYZFoY_htTwDuNQ.text: The wait for a table was over an hour for dinner but it was worth the wait. I shared the farmhouse burger, an alcoholic beverage with blueberries (sorry can't remember the name of the drink), truffle fries, sweet potato fries, and hot dog. All I have to say is the service and food were awesome. The servers were very attentive and fast. The quality of the ingredients used to make the burger was unbelievable. I love how balance the flavors were and how it was not over seasoned. The burger meat had a nice crest on the outside and cooked all the way through but the patty was still very juicy. The fries were great. There was nothing special about the hot dog but I had to try it since we're already there. I would definitely come back to try other items on the menu. I almost forgot, the drink I had was awesome. It was very light and refreshing. I would order it again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jpo6lLqYmZw65pDn1XdUQw.text: I had the soup and a burger.  They were both good and seasoned perfectly. This is an above average burger( I have had one better in Vegas) and I would recommend this place to anyone who is a burger fan.

4trQ1G_FAz3wFVj4OZtiGQ.text: We came last night after trying Gordon Ramsay Steak in Paris hotel. We only waited about 15 minutes for a party of 2. We came with high hopes and left extremely disappointed after the service we received. We both have worked in the service industry for years so maybe we were a bit critical but this bordered on ridiculous.  After 12 minutes of being seated, our server  greeted us with "Did you decide what you want yet?"   Not a hello, not a "welcome, have you been helped?"..poor server looked bored and tired. With an unapproachable demeanor she made us and apparently her other tables look a little hesitant to ask questions. We ordered water and cocktails, but our water glasses were empty for 25 minutes and cocktails didn't arrive until our food did.   Appetizers arrived briefly, chips and curry were slightly cold but good.   A whole 45 minutes later our burgers arrived. The meat was delicious and the flavors mixed perfectly, but the server never checked up on us after we started eating. Server was no where to be found when we wanted some limes, and only saw her maybe twice the whole evening.   We had to remind her several times to refill our water, and at the end of the meal when we asked for a box she looked at me as if I spoke to her in an alien language.   If you want to truly experience Gordon Ramsay: try the steakhouse and their amazing beef Wellington and ask for Victor, he will treat you like a proper server should and make sure your experience is worthwhile. You won't wait nearly and hour for your food and you'll leave fat and happy.

O6QS6SeDqkVLf1fEu7U6Nw.text: This place has some awesome burgers and very good fries. The spicy jalepeno burger is great if you like spicy food. I gave it a 4, because it's very expensive. Look to pay at least 30 or more per person if you want a burger, fries and a drink. Burgers are approximately $16 each and fries are $8 on up. It's definitely a great place to try if you haven't been. Ask for your burger to be cooked well, if you don't want any pink.

BiOQTElMrMjsJ0DK5fzSJQ.text: Decided to eat here at the last minute.  Got in quickly and was very impressed with the staff and organization.  We were greeted promptly and had a very nice server.  The manager was great too! Our food was excellent.  My husband said that it was the best burger he ever had.  We will be back for sure.

4DI_prhk5ZymLHazPI5sJg.text: Like burgers and WAITING?? Then look no further.   We decided to visit Vegas on a whim. Also we wanted to eat at a "celebrity chef" restaurant. Btw Gordon Ramsay has like 4 restaurants on the strip. We figured we would give Chef Ramsay's burger place a shot.   We came on Monday night and there was no wait for a table. But according to the server sometimes the wait is two hours!! I ordered the UK burger which had arugula, Dubliner cheese and a mango chutney. I prefer my burger or meat to be close rare. The server asked how I would like my burger I told her MEDIUM RARE BUT MORE RARE. She took my order and my hubby's and friends' orders. My friend wanted to modified or substitute an item. The server was nice about it but she did explain that the chefs are picky about modifications they usually DO NOT do stuff like that. But she would ask anyway and the chefs refused. So orders were finally placed. We waited 30 MINUTES!! Still NO burgers in sight!!! We asked our server about our food. She said it's a standard 30 minutes. She could tell we were irritated. She felt that management should post it somewhere but of course they wouldn't!!  Our food finally came out 5 minutes later.   The burgers and fries (btw everything is al la carte) looked good. We were starving too!! My girlfriend order her burger medium. When I cut into my burger my patty was medium well. My girlfriend's burger was more rare and she ordered medium! I was upset!! Not only did we wait 30 MINUTES plus, the chefs DID NOT ALLOW CUSTOMIZED BURGERS and this place's speciality is burgers and they STILL COULDN'T get it right!!!! The burger had good flavor but the patty was OVER COOKED and DRY to me. For almost $20 this burger should be magically! It's was the cheese and chutney that saved it.   I told the server my issue of my overcooked patty. And of course when you're a vegetarian YOU HAVE TO ANNOUNCE IT TO THE WORLD!! I don't know why the server felt it was necessary to tell me she doesn't have issues with overcooked meat because she's a VEGETARIAN!!! *hand clap* very helpful you millennial! I told her I didn't want to wait 30 minutes again because I was hungry. I asked her what can she do for me. So she said she would check with her manager. She returned and gave us 10% off the bill. Thank you millennial vegetarian working at a burger joint! *thumbs up*  SUMMARY  PROS: the mango chutney  CONS: LONG wait for just the food, self righteous vegetarian server, OVERCOOKED DRY PATTY  LAST THOUGHT: Chef Ramsay would shame this restaurant and staff! Never returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

654k7lnPmY-zyq1nmN2yeg.text: Good food but overpriced and small burgers. Service pretty bad. In our case were were brought the wrong food and not checked in for over 15 minutes.

z0esz6Ahb-bG71BxUGsMGg.text: finally tried this over memorial day weekend. called ahead to see if there was a wait and they said about 25-30 min wait for lunch. walked in through the door and saw a long line but apparently that was for parties of 2? we gave our number to the hostess and they would text us when our table was ready. shopped around planet hollywood for about 15-20 mins and our table was ready. i rely heavily on yelp pictures so even though the menu sounded good i had to check yelp. i ended up getting the farmhouse burger medium rare, my friends got the hog burger (its pork so they can only serve it medium at the most), and the hells kitchen burger. we also got the onion rings (delish!), fries (amazing), and the sweet potato fries(ordinary). the fries are huge btw. can def share with your group. they also had a lot of different sauces you can dip them in. we also asked for the aioli which i looove with my burgers. everything was so juicy and delicious! definitely come here it is worth a try! gordon ramsay lives up to his name!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SefbZKGo6mPwDpxLHdSxBQ.text: Big fail! This was one of my favorite eating spots in Las. Eva's. We have always made it our go to for great burgers, however this time it failed miserably. The food took over an hour to get, all the burgers were over cooked, eggs were over cooked, onion rings were cold, all this and we waited an hour. In the hour we waited we didn't see our server at all. No drinks ever showed up that were ordered with the meal nor were refills provided during the entire meal. The bill came and since it was 12 of us we had him split on 2 cards. I realized he never gave me a receipt for one of the cards. I brought it to the managers attention, they proceeded to argue with me about it. I could have just walked out and they wouldn't have been paid, but I did the honest thing and tried to explain to the server and manager that they hadn't run the card and if they did I had no receipt. They argued and we finally resolved the issue and they ran my card. What gets me is that here's a celebrity chef who talks about kitchen nightmares yet his own restaurant was a nightmare. Went to Bobby Flays Burger Palace the next day and it was phenomenal at half the price! #bobbyflaybeatgordonramsey

CJRuOqxm9OtCVfaXiAeyFQ.text: The manager and hostess were constantly lying about wait times and they were very rude

7qleHTz7rw8KkhtLp8ndOA.text: The best burger I ever had!! All the sauces are great and milkshake was phenomenal! I'll go back to Vegas just for this place lol

JqryVeJqsOFyi01dA2_ngA.text: Great food, unique flavors put together. Only complaint was felt very rushed by the waitress. She gave my husband the dessert menu for me to look at while ai still had a half of my burger to eat....

_KtcBKYxlFzOSZOb4QwvYA.text: Best Burger in Vegas/the world. The Hell's Kitchen Burger and off the menu F-word burger are both outstanding. Parm fries and onion rings will be the best you ever eat. They both come with 2 flavorful sauces that will blow your mind. Whiskey lemonade and Caribbean Dreams to accompany the meals were awesome and refreshing.  If you get there when they are opening don't panic at the huge line- it moves fast and the food is very much worth the wait.  Server was excellent. They are quick service and delivery, but you don't feel rushed out the door.  The atmosphere is casual and fun and the food presentation is on point! Fire feature adds a lot to the experience.  Highly recommended.

5XI9ISzcguMuDmPryP_azg.text: A good overall experience turned into a not so well "after" experience! The staff was super friendly, the burger itself was full of flavour, the fries were deep fried a little bit too long but the onion rings were really good. The line getting into the restaurant was long, super long actually, we waited for roughly over an hour to get into the restaurant.   So overall the experience was good, I'd rate the experience an easy 4 stars out 5. It was a few hours later in the day that made my rating drop to a 2 star rating when I was sick with food poisoning in my hotel room bathroom on the first day off my trip.   It was an unfortunate experience that I wish didn't happen because I quite enjoyed the burger, but with this being a Gordon Ramsay Restaurant I was really let down that i got sick from eating there.

sYjKqZZJcccQmCdUWLNxIg.text: Not all it's cracked up to be. I ordered the blue cheeseburger based on the recommendation of the waiter and was not overly impressed. The meat had no real flavor of its own and you could hardly taste the blue cheese. I can see now why the waiter was pushing hard for fried onions and bacon on everyone's burgers since by themselves they tasted  like they were missing something. My friend ordered an egg on his "Anniversary Burger" and it came with a half inch piece of shell in it. The waiter apologized but then only reimbursed the charge for adding the egg. Poor customer service move.   One positive was the delicious Poutine we ordered for an appetizer. That was done extremely well. Overall, this place is not worth the wait or the money.

Gw2ZQzOUHp4UBQWGkOhRzw.text: Love this burger spot! Had the curry burger and Park truffle fries, DELICIOUS. Super casual & solid food

wMw_z-FyOo5rbbQVd34f4Q.text: The hamburguer is not that good... everything was salty and the waiting time to get the food is to long for a burger  I don't think that the price worth the experience

The experience was what you would expect from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. The presentation was spot on. The cook on the meat was perfect. It was juicy without being messy. Everything was perfectly seasoned. The waitstaff were friendly and knowledgeable and the food arrived in a reasonable amount of time. I couldn't have asked for a better experience.

v9poSFcNd2n4ZeklZ_39dg.text: This is a hard one. Am I grading it for the food or for the experience? Eating at any Gordon Ramsay restaurants is always an experience..the decor, ambience, and crowd make everything so much more exciting. Of course, the service is amazing, even for a place that serves burgers. The burgers are reasonably priced, but the fries and onion rings are a bit expensive. I ordered the truffle fries as well as the Farmhouse burger while my wife ordered the blue cheese burger. They were both good, but is it much better than Inn and Out, Ilands, or Red Robin? I'm not so sure. At least I couldn't tell a big difference. I think Red Robin's onion rings are much better. Overall, it's still a great restaurant if you just want to eat burgers, munch on some bar foods and chill out with some friends without going out to a fancy restaurant. For #Thinsulin fans, you can eat the burgers without the buns but you'll probably want to order two if you want to be full.

lcPXoGJ56RNydFz9HHflqw.text: Was here a few years ago while attending a Britney concert and apparently this place has been re branded a bit? I couldn't really tell but nevertheless the food is still amazing!!! Before my flight I got here shortly after they opened and was offered a nice table for one. The service was very slow to start but after my order was taken, things definitely improved. I started with a glass of prosecco and settled on the Hell's Kitchen burger medium rare. The burger was absolutely delicious and the meat almost melted in my mouth. I'm pretty sure I scarfed down my burger so quickly and with so much pleasure that people at an adjacent table asked me which burger I was eating haha. The jalapeno peppers and aioli combined with the avocado and toasted tomatoes made for quite a delicious combination. I normally only eat half of my burger buns but with this one, I didn't leave a single crumb of bread left. 2 glasses of bubbly and this burger definitely made me a happy camper on the flight.

This place is a lot more chill and decent size, so if you go outside of peak hours you should be able to get a table fairly quickly.

wkkJ04-2l4S_6xyRlrmHtg.text: Been wanting to try GR Burger for a while and did so on this current trip to Vegas. I was in a party of 4 people, they got us seated within 5 minutes. Service was up to par with your regular everyday restaurant but not in a bad way. The food though, tasted great. Try the Nachos, the sauce is amazing. Forget what type of fish but they have some fish sliders that are good. My wife had a turkey burger with a crazy name in menu and it was really tender and juicy. I had a regular burger and definitely  better then your regular everyday burger you could find elsewhere. Butter pecan milk shake was really good. Overall if you walk in with super high expectations then you're probably going to be let down.

r_7KGxKAvY5vmc1Gnk-ZMw.text: Best burgers here! Been twice and both times had great food and great service. There was a bit of a wait the first time we went in the summer (about a hour long) but we just went again this winter and only waited about 10 mins before we got in. Truffle fries are a must have btw! Delicious!

dEwQyDjOvNHw-i390aJIZQ.text: Burger was incredibly salty, and loaded with way too much cheese. But the big disappointment came with the restaurant itself. Silverware under tables, indicating not cleaned, and tables being balanced by napkins. We've all seen his shows, so how can a restaurant with his name have tables balanced with napkins underneath?

lR7iyP1taiIqLbMgRKIaJg.text: This is the second time I've been here. Got the onion rings again because they are that good. Not to heavy of an onion taste but crispy and goes well with the homemade ketchup. Tried the Fish and shrimp burger. Pretty good. I say that because there was a sweetness to it that I'm not fond of. But great taste of fish and shrimp. The shrimp and fish were ground into a patty which worked well. Overall the atmosphere was buzzing and the staff was friendly. I enjoyed my meal once again and would recommend this place to anyone that would like a good burger

SpuBnm1Ahdw2bOtDIAzOdw.text: We have when past this location a few times and there was always a line. Especially with the name of Gordon Ramsay and being impressed with his Pub location in Casaers, we decided to check this place out.   At 3pm, there was a decent line outside the location. I thought it was kinda odd since we eat early to avoid the lines but maybe that is a good sign. Finally, we made our way to the front and the location was not filled to capacity. Why we waited, I have no idea but will learn why later as dinner progressed.   Our server was very friendly so that is a huge positive. She took the time to explain a few things and was very bubbly. There was probably the only biggest positive there.   My girlfriend ordered a cocktail and I ordered a creme brulee milkshake. They both were amazing. And we ordered the duck poutine. The fries took about 20 minutes and they were fairly good. It came with duck bacon, the sauce had good flavor and depth. But the fries had a little grittiness to it. I dont think they washed the potatoes because it was almost like a small grains of sand. Very disappointed in that. As someone who once worked in fine dining... how could you miss an important step like that?  After an hour upon sitting down, our burgers did not arrive. We were finished with the fries (which I hoped would be enjoyed with the burger but as I slowly ate it... it was finished a long time ago) and we sat there talking and waiting. You look around and everyone has the same sad face of "Where is my food?????"  Finally, after over one hour..the food finally arrived. By now, my food has expanded so I am not that hungry anymore. My girlfriend ordered the Hog burger which came like 1 foot tall. I remember a clip of this shows of "How do I even eat this burger? Its so damn bloody big". Well, he probably didnt say that word from word but close enough. We wondered the same thing. You couldnt smash it down but you couldnt eat it like a normal burger. The Hog burger was mangalitsa pork, mangalitsa bacon, bbq pork, white cheddar, pickles, crispy onion, and slaw.  I ordered the "Foie" Burger which had pate foie gras (spread), chevre, port wine aioli, frisee. It had a decent foie spread but at the same time, it was a little tangy from the aoili. It was slighty more on the tangy side so it could put down some people who dont like that flavor contrast. Luckily, my burger was manageable and it really did come out medium rare like I requested. At least they did something right.   Overall, the server was great, the food was decent and the wait was horrible. I do not think I would return to this location when I am back in Vegas. Instead, I may check out his Steakhouse or go back to the Pub location.

eHGXn3Z3llwD3S7eb1OVbQ.text: One of the Worst experience I had in restaurant in a very long time , we stand about 45 min at the line and when it's our turn to go inside the restaurant the host very rudely tell us this line it's only for party of 1 or 2 , we explain to her that nobody tell us nothing and we waiting for a long time and she simple say she don't care , we ask to talk with a manger and explain the Situation and he say it's a big line and he gone try to help , after another 15 min. That we waiting the ask us is we want to be at the list (after we stand 1 hr in line ) what a juke . Never again

Wp8bfX7o-KnSfmIjopk8LA.text: To sum it up - my second visit here with the wife was False hope for quality - with the visit being saved by the shake.   Second visit for me to Vegas and Gordon Ramsay burger joint and the atmosphere is great, starting with the flame wall at the entrance.   My last memory from 2 years ago was amazing. I was expecting the same quality. Having been at Gordon's steakhouse the night before, our expectations were high. We both ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, truffle Parmesan fries and the sweet potato fries. The wife has a cocktail (signs of alcoholism for sure ;) - and I ordered the brown butter caramel shake.   The fries came out first, we were very hungry and the fries were excellent. The truffle Parmesan fries were square cut and crunchy with a hint of shaved Parmesan on top. The dipping sauce was amazing - some kind of mayo rendition with some type of peppers. The sweet potatoe fries were thinner cut and crunch - absolutely to die for. They had a touch of powder sugar on top, as well as some on the side if you wish to add more. The dipping sauce was a jalapeno custard mayo type of sauce and is the perfect companion to the sweet potato fries.   A few minutes later, the burgers showed up. This is where the disappointment happened. Gordon and staff - if you ever read this - I suspect you take quality very seriously and I'm not sure if this was a one off or what but the burger was atrocious - almost not edible. It was overly salty, the bun was stale and overall over cooked (we both ordered medium). Wife and I both cook, and we would not want to serve anyone that type of quality.   Having ordered the shake, they must have forgotten it. The server apologizes and is in awe why it was not brought out already. She proceeds to bring it in a to go cup. Man, I am glad she did. It was perhaps the tastiest sweet item we've had in Vegas all week ( the desert at Gordon's steakhouse is top notch). The brown butter and pecan were rich and creamy - it does not let you put it down no matter how full we were. We were upset we didn't go back later that evening for a second round.  In summary - the fries and shake were a solid A The burger, which is supposed to be a signature dish, was a complete failure. Shame on Gordon Ramsay and his staff for putting out such a terrible product. We may be back for the shake but doubt it for the food.

49mllQo9_9CWR8fPS8IYWw.text: I have been twice now. Once on my own and once with my wife. On my own I was able to get a seat at the counter right away. With my wife we made an effort to get in line at 10:30am so we could be sat as soon as they open. When going here expect a wait. It is very popular and for good reason. It is located in Planet Hollywood on the north end of the casino.   Service was excellent both times. The burgers are extremely flavorful. The bun is delicious. There are many good options to choose from.   On my visit with my wife, Gordon himself actually stopped in. I was very impressed that the first thing he did was walk around and shake every single employee's hand and thank them. Clearly a good guy to work for if you do your job right.   Plan accordingly for the wait, and I think you will find this place to be worth it. Plus a 30 minute wait really is no big deal.

f82tTWzyJtbv2qOWzAgW2g.text: 2017 Review 33/100  5 stars for some of the best food and best service I've ever received at a restaurant. I'm a Gordon Ramsay fan and this was my first time at one of his restaurants and I was very impressed.  The food was the shining star, as it should be. We had the hummus as an appetizer and W.O.W. It was probably some of the best - if not THE best - hummus I've ever had in my entire life, no exaggeration. After we finished the dish I immediately looked up Ramsay's recipe and I plan to make it very soon. Funny enough, neither of us ordered burgers and this burger joint. We had burgers for lunch so we were feeling something different. My friend ordered the Chicken Saltimbocca Sliders and I had the Wheatberry-Quinoa Salad. Both were extremely good. And the burgers looked amazing. I really want to return again and try one. For desert, it was the Blood Orange Creamsicle. Tangy orange popsicle goodness with a creamy center. We also ordered drinks. I had the Skinny Screw and she had the Acai Lemonade. Again, very, very good.  Our waiter, Ryan, was the best. He was super personable and knew the menu extremely well so he was able to make some great recommendations on what to order. Since he seemed to be such a foodie we even asked him for a recommendation on where to go for breakfast the next morning and his recommendation did not disappoint (see my review for Mon Ami Gabi).  It's worth noting this place does not take reservations. You will have to wait in line to get a table. How long you have to wait just depends on the day and time you choose to dine here. We went on a weekday for a little bit earlier dinner and only had to wait about 15 minutes. But I have heard from others the wait can get up to 2 hours, so plan accordingly, particularly if you are catching a show afterward.  The hype is real and I highly recommend you add Ramsay's burger joint to your Vegas foodie "to do" list.

I just wish the lines weren't so long, but that's what happens when you make the best damn burgers in the city!

UzV9CI1l0kJZR2cjGKoXQA.text: At first I was hesitant to come here. I've read reviews about how theres always a line.. & i hate lines.. I kept thinking to myself how good can their burgers be? No way they can be better than In-n-out's...  Anyways so one day i was strollin down the strip, it was around dinner time, stomach is getting a bit growly.. figured its time to find a bite to eat.. decided to stop by Planet Hollywood and chilll there for a bit.. enjoying that free AC while searching on Yelp for my next meal.. had this place bookmarked for the longest time so figured.. hey, im here, why the heck not!  i absolutely love the exterior of the restaurant, the highlight of it being the "fire wall".. just a really neat piece and great for photo ops.  The food here was amazing! its not comparable to In-n-out, being that these are gourmet burgers.. but they are definitely worth the price you will be paying for these bad boys.. you really cant go wrong with any of them.. but their most popular one is definitely their Truffle Burger which was DELICIOUS!!!  INSIDER TIP!!! ORDER THAT MILK SHAKE TO WASH IT ALL DOWN!!  No lie, my favorite item i got here was their milkshake, their custard, creme brulee with oreo to be exact. it will cost you around $11 but it was one of the most satisfying shake i have ever put  in my mouth!

Jsy0wS03R5jNRLFstMl8JQ.text: It's Gordon Ramsay. I mean, come on.   It was everything my heart desired and more. The nachos were exceptional and I don't think that I've ever had nachos this delicious or as absolutely smothered in creamy delicious cheese.   I got the Hell's Kitchen burger and it couldn't have been more perfectly made. I would love to criticize Gordon Ramsay and one of his establishments but it truly was incredible.   If you have a chance, it's not above the hype. It is what you'd hope for and they do it well. I highly recommend and would take the wait. They don't have a really large "waiting " section so you might be standing. It is important to note that if you're platinum or diamond they'll let you in EARLY!

Hx5jNC72moAZHYs9tVCNaA.text: The Hells Burger was ok. Nothing spectacular. Our local burger place in Idaho in comparison is much much better. Fries were ok. Best part of the meal were the shakes...both chocolate and caramel one...and the mixed juice (orange and pineapple). My son loves Gordon Ramsey so this was a bit disappointing. We did take him to the Gordon Ramsey's fish and chip and that was much better...liked the different sauces, the crunch of the fish...a little greasy but not unbearable.

IehbvgKdetB2G3PQxAk5Aw.text: To be honest I had high expectations for this place and was preparing for them to be not met- but Gordon Ramsay really nailed it on this one!   I just got a hamburger with just lettuce, medium well. It was cooked a perfect medium well, most places cook either too much medium or too well done.  They had some very unique red wine mayo too which I recommend you try- Ive never tasted anything like it before!   The wait was about 20-30 mins in line for a party of 2. Dont get in line if you have a party of 3 or more!

1m5Svc3xK1qezCFCKaVS5g.text: My husband loves burgers so we had to try this place. The location and ambiance is great. Service was pretty spot on except they never offered to refill his iced tea and I saw our waitress bring other tables a second drink. The price for what you got was high but not so much considering it is Vegas. I got the lobster and shrimp burger and it was great. He got the Stout burger and enjoyed it but didn't wow him. I felt the burgers were busy. Even the buns had seasoning. Sometimes less is better. We also had the truffle and Parmesan fries. They were good but steak fries are not my favorite with a burger. It was a nice meal but I would try another burger place if I came back.

3-fThSoKOsCqitTkSUtQWg.text: In 9 years of being on YELP I have NEVER written a bad review for a restaurant, but it is virtually impossible to allow what happened last night go without review.   Around 9pm we arrived at Gordon Ramsay's Burger. The line was about 20-25 mins long. We let the hostess staff know that my father was in a handicap scooter and would need something other than a high top because he can not get out of his scooter because of his muscular disease. As we arrived to the front of the line there were numerous tables of four where he could have pulled his scooter up to. They told our party of 3 that they could not do that because his scooter would block the walkways (this was a ridiculous statement because many of the tables were in a space with very amble moving around space). So I suggested that since there are three of us only that we could remove two chairs on one side, he could then move his scooter sideways near where the two chairs used to be (his scooter chair can turn to face the table). They said they could not move the chairs.   Their solution was that there are TWO tables to the left when you enter and we can sit you there out of the way (now if you have made it so anyone with a handicap scooter must be out of the way then why are you not reserving these tables for people with actual handicap related needs). There are literally only TWO tables there that they claimed were available for handicap people who cant get out of their scooters. They said well we can have you wait until one of those people leave. They did not tell us when we first came up that we would be waiting for only two tables which could have taken another 30+ mins to leave (above the original wait). What was absolutely even more astonishing was the rudeness of the girl at the hostess stand looking at me and arguing that moving two chairs would have been too much of a hassle for them. When I argued that it would not be any trouble or blocking of walkways to just please move the chairs, their manager Ryan approached us. He realized that moving two chairs was not that large of a trouble and moved the chairs so that our original request would be met. We waited a long amount extra, received an incredible amount of attitude and rudeness from the hostess, as well as what seems to be a general discriminatory attitude to those who have a handicap.   Las Vegas is frequented by people with handicap needs. It happens to be one of the most handicap friendly cities in the world. We have ate at this exact restaurant in the past and the prior staff moved chairs and made it very simple to eat there with a handicap issue. The staff last night not only embarrassed my father, they were disrespectful, unable to think about a simple solution, and when a simple solution was presented to them they simply refused to help. I urge someone with some ability to make changes at this restaurant to read this review and put into place some serious safeguards in place for this sort of situation. As a multiple business owner I would be appalled if any client of our businesses was treated the way that your restaurant treated my father last night.

AdGpq_r7h8OMXZsYOhDBRg.text: Don't go to this place and expect a basic burger or their burgers are unique and extremely creative. Nothing better on this trip then Gordon's burger joint

12L5DnaoqQQwlsVZK1pDmg.text: What can you say wrong about Gordon Ramsay or anything branded his name? First off, impressively over the top window display of a rollercoaster of fire  (its Vegas, are you even surprised?) and of course we have Mr Ramsay himself posing, that definitely will having you "caption this" while you're munching on your burger (I came up with "now that's a f?#kin burger, don't forget about it chap!).  What is there to order ? Well it's burgers with fancy buns served with glorified sides , not a lot of cooking knowledge needed, except...foreign cheese names. I suggest you google as you go down the menu to educate yourself because I have to say, there's a method behind the success of GR. If you are someone who's into classic burger spots this ain't for you, but if you are hungry walking the strip and got $30 (on average) to burn, try it out. Look, you won't get a greasy burger with a bun soppin with butter (still sooo damn good) but what you will get is a clean presentation that is well structured with the freshest ingredients you can ask for. You can walk away from here and say "wow I actually feel good" instead of hating yourself for consuming some burger monstrosity. So if you are fancy, appreciate different European cheeses , fresh ingredients and a not so greasy burger in a picturesque bun, throw your money here...plus they stay open late so there's a perk you can't pass on

While the cool fire display might bring people in, the food will keep them there.   As a burger lover, this place is a must for me every time I'm in Las Vegas now.

etlTnA1XYgb4S86ZY-aiDg.text: Is there more than 5 stars. You ever had something so amazing your eyes just popped open? My eyes literally popped open and I stopped talking to just devour my burger. I ordered the turduken burger, and my wife order d the fries. It sounds like a small non-filling meal, but the fries were never-ending. We didn't even finish the fries. The burger never stood a chance with me it didn't last too long in my hands either. The table prep was extremely attentive to us and made us seem highly important. It seemed as if our glasses got low he was always aware of the levels of the glass  The one problem that we did see is the waiter wasn't really there for us, we waited a little while just to receive a hello let alone fill our order. He didn't even stop by after our meal came to ask how everything was going. But we just ignored him also as we ate our great meal, and we enjoyed every second of it. I would run back to GRB, to try other meals, and I will continue to dream about how amazing that burger was. Definitely will be back!!!

Fg6eoGWlpUb1pW3G-B9Ajg.text: Very good burger cooked perfectly. Fries were also great Homemade  Ketchup was the best.

In addition, my son ordered an oreo shake and it was so good because it had creme brulee on top of it.  Definitely a must go if you haven't.  #firsttimers

Y5Gv7Pltot-EjzURSe6lDw.text: I have tried other GR restaurants and have been pleased in the past. The best time seems to be Saturday between 2-4. Parties of 3 or more can check in with the hostess but 2 or less must stand in the line. On Friday and Saturday nights, this is a very long line. My food was good but I was not about to stand in line for 60 minutes plus.   I chose the patriot burger which is a turkey burger with cheese, a spicy mayo, and potato sticks. It was crunchy and very flavorful. I paired this burger with the truffle fries which were terrific.

HVBLjheiOmDHNI3c0pYlzQ.text: This is my second time here. Quality not good enough for this price, overpriced IMO. We did order the truffle fries and onion rings, both were dry and really nothing special.   I think the habit burger grill (chain restaurant) is way better than this.

gmJ274ZlUMFV1z7putXz3Q.text: Great service and really good food! What more could we ask for? Try the Rince Caschon beer REALLY FRIGGIN' GOOD!

ObRNvDKTTACHJ8mA0V8CbQ.text: Great service and great food! I was so full and the fries are also amazing. The place is a little more on the casual side and overall this was a great place to have a delicious burger.

tXdXqGty5Q1OE4qn7_E6IA.text: The wait is a bit long but my husband and I think that it's worth it. The burgers were delicious and the truffle fries.. yum! Tip: If you do go here, it's better to have a party of 2. For parties with 3+ people, the wait is a lot longer.

Rx3dHjPXZFEvrnXBVkWIXA.text: So we came here to Mr. Ramsay's burger joint and the wait was an 1 and 30 minutes. Luckily our waiter was so awesome. He took very good care of us. Kept the drinks filled and the food came out really fast. 10 stars to Guy he totally rocked our socks. Now i didn't enjoy my burger all that much. But that's not taking away from Guy's 100% amazing customer service.

Z1eeBr4SmL4dOJfUYFhewg.text: I'll be back. This place rocks. Food and service was great. Very clean place burger was amazing. Quality of ingredients was fresh. French fries with the souce. Wow.

saV8F-pvWswfY4cU6OiSOQ.text: Easily one of the BEST burgers I have ever had. Excellent service too! Staff is very attentive.

43VPV0R4JZbJesnkGKe1ZA.text: This may have been the best burger I've ever experienced. Definitely top 5. Had the Forrest burger and truffle fries and ever bite was a treat. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

0SM3lGEP95eKyKSC82Vf8A.text: Really awesome place!! Had the mushroom burger since I'm vegan and the onion rings!! It was flavourful and did not disappoint. Definitely on the pricey side for burgers but worth every penny!! I definitely recommend this place

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DRWmi3sTYT36KM9Pgu1BcQ.text: Went here on Thursday evening.... there was a long line but it moved quickly.... I tried the Blue Burger --excellent Really tender meat and great flavor great burger!  The onion rings -beer batter with grated  cheese... sides of ranch and ketchup Chipoltle ... unfortunately the onion rings were too salty and ranch also--like someone lost control of salt shaker !  The ketchup Chipolte was less salty  but still no good with onion rings still having sooo much salt! Service -I eat at bar was fine... people tending to eat their burger and leave .. quick turnover...

yZJPM71L-fs_N_-w9w1Lwg.text: This is a great burger joint but with Gordon's name attached, I was expecting something a bit more.   We were able to get a table without reservations after a moderate wait, only 30 minutes. Which is to be expected with a place this popular.   The drink menu was creative and delivered the flavors promised  There was nothing tricky about it but in hindsight, I should have just gone with a beer.   We ordered poutine and onion rings to get things started. The onion rings were amazing. Usually onion rings go limp and soggy almost immediately but these held up.   The poutine, however, was just a mess of flavor. Poutine is simple. Fries, brown gravy, cheese curds and optional meat. This was needlessly a complicated dish that tried too hard and was a disappointment.   The burgers served up were delicious but the entire table I was with ordered them cooked the same way, medium rare, based on our servers suggestion. When they arrived, however, we had burgers that ranged from rare and almost blue to almost medium. I had one of the rarer burgers and while tasty, it just became a wet mushy mess a few bites in.   The service was great. The ambience was cool and what you would expect. It is a bit noisy and crowded but this is Vegas after all.

p5pHx3YGDYFaXSzq_6oMdA.text: Oh.....My.......Gordon Ramsay! We're loving the burger bar trend, and this place sets the bar very high! The decor is super cool British themed, cool use of color and a walk of fire. The food was absolutely decadent. My husband and I shared the ultimate cheeseburger and onion rings. The burger was so fresh, the cheeses were tangy and smooth, and the sesame bun was toasted to perfection. We were happy we decided to add bacon to the burger, it was perfectly crisped and had great smoke flavor. The onion rings were breaded perfectly and served with a chipotle ketchup that is out of this world! The ranch sauce with the rings was good too, but the ketchup was a nice spicy treat for the ol tastebuds.

VdAILeD2cbIpNp4glSKfJg.text: First time eating here and I have to say I was a little disappointed. The food was good but the service was terrible & I'm sure Gordon Ramsay would fire our server.

EEoZoEyvB3wBDkfml_wFoQ.text: Alright Bobby. First off, we  came from across town to eat at your place. Did not expect the very casual atmosphere. But that's ok. Got over that. I ordered a bacon cheeseburger rare. It came out well done...I talked to the server. The second burger came out medium. I didn't want to say anything further. Was ok. In addition, the server said y'all did not have thousand island dressing. I made my own!  I won't be returning...sorry.

2Uj-xkD0zLnto24i0n_HbQ.text: Best tasting burger you will ever eat! I had the lobster and shrimp and my husband had the Hell's kitchen (spicy). Both were delicious. The truffle fries are a must for truffle lovers.   Make sure you stand in the correct line. For parties of 3 or more there's a separate line. We were a party of 4 and had to be split while dining due to being in the wrong line.

o-6taT0o8C2mDLObG3dPgw.text: Really good burger but overpriced for what you get. I believe I got the hell burger and it was good, but nothing spectacular. The fries however were absolutely amazing. I don't think I've had better fries in my life. Kind of pricey

W6bR2WjFAUL3wJu7FBY-EQ.text: Our expectations were high since the place was owned by THE Gordon Ramsay and I must say, our expectations were met during our visit! The burgers we got were very juicy and flavorful, while the side of sweet potato fries was the cherry on top. Overall, our dining experience was great! Will definitely come back when we get the chance.

2Yk8xzRUoDirTF9MYSn1zw.text: The burger was to oily and the onions rings was oily to. The burger was too small only 4 Burgers and one onions rings $97.54. It is not worth it at all. Believe me in n out is way better than this place. I threw up 4 times today after lunch. I don't recommend Gordon Ramsay Burger at all.

RkNgMf38KoqmFiq2S1WM1w.text: How to properly write a review for a Ramsay restaurant without using the F word? ;)  I'm up to the challenge.  Of course there was a wait, and that's to be expected.  I don't necessarily think the hostesses handled this in the most efficient or friendly manner, especially for there being 4 of them.  4 employees to do one job and to do it poorly, kinda weird.      The great thing is that you forget about this pretty quickly after you sit down.  Excellent menu with thoughtful creations and options for everyone.  What I loved is that from the fries, to the onion rings, to the dipping sauces, to the burger and every component on the burger....all thoughtful.  All tasty.  This is not a place that serves Heinz with his hand battered onion rings or raw onions with their pork burger.  All components are thoughtful and delicious and that's what makes this a stand out, gotta return, Ramsay name worthy establishment.   Go!  You'll enjoy your meal here.  Trust.

D1BHej_sKaV5ovvzTJPTFQ.text: As a Vegas local, I usually try to avoid restaurants, especially chains, located on the strip since they're always so overpriced and are catered more towards tourists. But I had family visiting & we were already in the area, so we gave this place a try.... I was BLOWN AWAY. We got the onion rings and gooey fries as appetizers. I am not a fan of onions in any way, shape or form, but these onion rings were BOMB. The truffle Parmesan fries, tho it sounds about pricy at $12, came in a huge serving size and were also terrific. And finally.. I got the tandoori chicken burger. This was probably one of the best chicken burgers I've had in my life (and I've had a lot b/c I'm not a big red meat fan).  Other than the fantastic food, the customer service was on point even on a busy weekend night. We actually had a 1hr wait to get seated, but we didn't mind it since there were lots to do around & we were notified when it was our turn. I would absolutely come back here again.

WfthmrktXtClyXRhgFhzXg.text: The ultimate cheeseburger changed cheeseburgers for me forever. SO GOOD! Tried the chicken wings too and it was as per my liking - not too hot and super crispy. Definitely worth that 30 minute wait outside the door. Will come back again.

hw-zVkPAeiNXMwBQPnAyfg.text: Gordon Ramsey burgers are soooo amazing.  It's located in Planet Hollywood hotel and definitely worth stopping by if you are craving for gourmet burgers in Vegas.  There is always a line no matter what time of the day.  So expect a wait.   The wait time isn't too bad since there is a lot of things to do at the hotel while you are waiting.  Since Vegas is the city that never sleeps, its always a good time to stop by for a quick bite anytime.  They serve gourmet burgers, fries, sandwiches, and shakes.   The ambience is modern and hip which you can either get dressed up or casual depending on the occasion.  The staff is friendly and always checks in to make sure you are enjoying your experience.    Food also was served fresh and fast.   We didn't have to wait long before our food arrived.   I highly recommend trying the turkey burger, sweet potato fries, and truffle parmesan fries.  I normally don't like sweet potato fries.  But it is so amazing  It was hot, fresh, and served with a homemade garlic aioli sauce.     Overall, it was a great experience.  I would highly come back again and try different food on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan truffle fries! Super yummy and cheesy.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qUYEGltn-LewnWKDDWcgVw.text: Who comes to Gordon Ramsay Burger and doesn't get a burger? I do! Haha well, my friend Tony did but he inhaled his food so quickly that I couldn't even snap a pic.   This is my third time in Vegas and second time here. I just knew it was going to be one of my many stops. We stood in line for about 10 minutes before we were seated so the wait wasn't too bad.   Now, before I get carried away I want to say that if you are looking for a cheap, or even slightly affordable place to eat/drink, look elsewhere as GRB is anything but. I imagine 70% of the people who come here on are some sort of vacation so they don't mind the splurging because that's exactly how you will feel when you see the prices.   I didn't even bother ordering food due to the huge meal I ate at the airport, so I knew I was only getting some drinks. I asked our waiter what he recommends, and he said a Long Island, which of course is one of my faves so I ordered TWO! He called them a Strong Island, and Let me just say they were strong enough to knock you off your feet. After running my mouth for another 30 mins or so I ordered a cranberry vodka which was strong too. It seems everyone has a heavy hand here but I'm not complaining.   Although I cannot remember our waiters name for the life of me, I LOVE a person who circles back and constantly asks me if I need something. It annoys a lot of people but I'm all for it. Bug and bother me because I would rather not have to hunt you down for another water or something, so I appreciate the attentiveness.   Gordon Ramsay has at least three more restaurants here in Vegas that I have to check out but I will circle on back this way to really dive into the menu because by the looks of things everything looks delicious.

ztY8UQCfl2GTn_Bt6hq7xw.text: Backyard Burger with the added mushrooms, truffle fries and onion rings were all DELISH and we would definitely visit again if we are at Planet Hollywood.  the only reason I am not giving (5) stars is the way service is handled.  While all the servers were very pleasant the approach at the restaurant feels a quite rushed - they take the order and bring the food but getting something in between is a HUGE effort to just get their attention.  this place is VERY busy so this is part of it, but it's also just how they do it there.  It's a very well oiled machine the amount of people they are able to get in and out with such good food.  A little more attention in between delivery of food and exit would be my only request.

N9eryvf95xrGmy6632qr3Q.text: I've been to Vegas many times over several years. Unfortunately, traveling with my parents meant we always hit up the buffets at different hotels. No offense to buffets, but that meant I never got a chance to try all the amazing restaurants Vegas has to offer. Let's start with Gordon Ramsey's Burgers inside Planet Hollywood. The wait line for a table can get pretty long for dinner, but even then it didn't take as long as I would have expected. The burger was huge and juicy. Add the egg if that's an option you like. It was worth the wait. The truffle fries were some of the best I ever had. I'm not a big burger fan but sometime, I crave this place.

LCV5DPwHxHqdDTVQgOFUVw.text: Best burger I have ever had! The wait in line was worth it, this thing was incredible, it literally melted in my mouth. I got the blue cheese burger and have been craving it ever since.  Our service was solid, the atmosphere was fun. The wait time was reasonable considering the quality.   This burger is a little spendy, but if you're in Vegas and looking for a good burger, then honestly it is not that overpriced since everything on the strip is extra.  Would highly recommend, will hopefully be back soon.

lzBlbU3CMWVhF57eLTFvqQ.text: The service here was good they were pretty attentive. Usually when I walk past here, I see people waiting in line but this time there wasn't too long of a line. The burgers are pricier and a la carte. I think the price does not match the quality of the product in my opinion. I got a burger with a subbed impossible patty. The impossible subbed patti was $7.  They really don't have options for vegetarians otherwise without paying a lot extra. We all ordered burgers besides me and we all thought they were extra dry. There was no flavor whatsoever. I would say it was the driest least flavorful burger I have tasted which is disappointing. My friend got the Parmesan fries and they were pretty basic as well.   My final bill was $30 with tip for just a burger and I would not return because it is not memorable.

JU6f7_fqwb_CKJ9eZkYB7A.text: A bit more tacky than I thought it would be. Gordon Ramsay's face is posted everywhere, and when I say everywhere, I mean EVERYWHERE!! This is was a really exhilarating experience for me to meet people who have met Gordon Ramsay in person-- so you might say that I was "overhyped". Although the Hummus was great (although not as good as the stuff I ate at Israel), and burger was too, the Onion Rings and Garlic Fries really fell short. I tried to like them, and they got plenty of chances, but I couldn't really get into them-- I think they were too greasy. Also, the burgers we got (Backyard Burger and Hell Fire Burger) lacked sauce. Not sure if I just missed it or something, but I really felt like it could use it. The bill came out to $100, which is not horrible for Las Vegas. I thought that Mr. Ramsay was the best chef in the world, but I guess that even he has his fare share of problems.

_O_kV_SGooyRijAinJw9pQ.text: This was where I choose to have lunch on my birthday. I ordered the ahi sliders and truffle fries.  The ahi sliders were so good. They had tuna, guacamole, crispy onions and some sort of spicy sauce. I loved the combination of crunch, creaminess and spice that worked throughout everything.   Truffle fries were not cooked well. I had some that were still raw, some that were soggy/mussy and a few that were edible. I ended up pouring them onto my plate trying to find enough to eat. These were expensive and not worth it. This is a burger place, you'd expect the fries to be perfect! Sauces were also not up my alley, flavor wise.   Service at the bar was lacking. The bartenders seemed more interested in talking with each other then providing a decent service. No one checked on me after my food arrived, I was never asked if I wanted anything other to drink besides water and when I asked to pay the bill the bartender threw the receipt/card in my direction without much anything else.  I love GR but I think he would be disappointed to know how the food at this restaurant is being represented. You want a good GR food experience, go elsewhere like GR steak (Paris) or GR fish and chips (Linq promenade).
