k6ScyzqLnX6EcW-ykUm_YQ.text: We loved everything here: from the burgers we've ordered to the waiter that served us.  So, we got the Crab&shrimp burger and  the Backyard burger, and fries. Please, keep in mind that when you order a burger here there's no sides, you need to buy it additionally.  The interior was nice, a lot of people here, but the air conditioners were working just fine. Clean space with good interior and sitting places plan.  And the last thing that made our experience here just great - it was Justin. The way he was helping us and making us comfortable and calm here deserves all the rave. He provided an exceptional customer service! This guy deserves his salary increase right away!

c5OBNL21TcTx2FIMkz09HQ.text: My wife had the "Hawg Dawg". It was delicious. The mixture of flavors and dextures. Perfection. Myself I had the Cherry pepper chicken sandwich.   Some how the whole cherry pepper thing got lost or left off my sandwich.  That being said the crispy chicken skin added a great crunch and the soft brioche bun was tasty.   Service well we didnt get any..... waited 45 min for our food and never saw our waiter once.   He then left without handing us off to our new waiter who was great as well the manager who handled our situation.   One thing.  Sticky toffee pudding ice cream sandwich.  Dont leave without some!!!!

n4-8kCzht_-HgTpu5lhnuw.text: TLDR: Did not live up to the "Gordon Ramsay" expectations...   When I was planning my trip to Las Vegas, one of the things that I had on my "to do list" was to visit one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. As the hotel that my friends and I (a group of 10) stayed in was near the Gordon Ramsay's Burger, we decided to give that a try (it was also the slightly cheaper option to his other restaurants). We arrived just before it opened on a Sunday lunch hour - the line was decently long, but we were able to get seated fairly quickly (about a 15 minute wait). While standing in line, we were able to view the menu, which contained a variety of different dishes - but hey, I'm at a burger place, so I have to try the burger!   I ordered the "Hells" Kitchen Burger ($17), which consists of asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes and jalapeno aioli - I got the patty medium well. I also ordered a side of Truffle Parmesan Fries ($12). Let me start off by saying, the wait was horrendous... when we asked our server why the burger took so long, she advised that the kitchen can only make/cook 10 burgers at a time... but for a restaurant this size and the amount of people that are being served, you would think that the kitchen should afford to make more than 10 burgers at a time - but I understand there must be a reason behind it. Anyways, we waited about 30-35 minutes and the burgers finally came out - on its face, the burger looked amazing (I was also starving since I haven't eaten anything yet), then the truffle fries came out a couple minutes later.  Review of the "Hells" Kitchen Burger - very plain, not a lot of taste. Also, my stomach instantly reacted to it... I guess I should've ordered the patty well done - but I could not finish more than half a burger before feeling awful.   Truffle Fries - this was good when hot, but it got pretty sickening after a while - I could only have so much fries (just get it to share).  Overall, because of my stomach reaction, I can't say that I will be coming here again...

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6zRNEdX7m77jh5hG98d9Vw.text: Hmmmm.  I completely expected to pay at the high end for a burger.   But I was disappointed that the staff was so unfriendly and acted As if they were doing me a favor by delivering a $29 hamburger to me.   That kind of killed the whole experience.   It obvious that the namesake for this restaurant does not pay much attention to this burger and fry joint.

9nLzJH9Z1LCkbTxgqNmiBQ.text: Absolutely delightful place!  1. Affordable meal - not an easy thing to find on the strip. 2.  Delicious food. Perfectly made, small details matter.  Simple menu, delicious appetizers. 3. Service.  Professional servers that know their stuff.  It was my Mom's birthday and they served her dessert that was out of this world. Coming back!

MhdTQbMystxSl-0DGuZnjg.text: Came here with my boyfriend before our last day at EDC. There was a short line about 30 minutes before getting seated.   We get seated and order right away. Our server, Christian, was super empathetic and kind right off the bat. He provided us a lot of insight on the menu but was also able to hold great conversations with us.   I asked for hot water with lemon (didn't ask for honey because I didn't want to be annoying) but he had asked if I wanted it anyway. Without even asking, he brings out two cold waters with no ice (because of our throats) and my cup of hot water with lemon and honey (which came in a cute li'l jar).   We ordered the ultimate cheeseburger and farmhouse burger with a side of truffle parmesan fries. The burgers were a great size and so were the fries. They were cooked exactly how we wanted and for meat lovers like my boyfriend and me, the two burgers came without any vegetables.   We also ordered the creme brulee cookies and cream shake. The shake was super delicious and creamy, while the creme brulee portion, which sat on top of the shake, was really light, fluffy and not too sweet. It was a great combination of the two.   Overall, our whole experience here had been amazing, from the service to the food, it was all so so great. I would definitely recommend coming here and trying everything because from what we have had so far I think that you can't really go wrong ordering anything on the menu.

t8dmJK2H62LOylhLhL6F3Q.text: Excellent burger!!! Probably the best in Vegas. The problem is the long lines that you have to wait. First time that I tried to go I give up because the wait time was more than an hour. Second time that I go there the wait time was between 30 to 40min and I and my friends wait and we got a seat with 40min.  So, waiting time normally is the biggest challenge

0V2ohg8W4qMQfvcdZsxRJg.text: Who doesn't know about Gordon Ramsay? When in Vegas, I felt that I just had to try a Gordon Ramsay restaurant and since it's conveniently located inside Planet Hollywood (not too far from where I was staying), I figured this was a good place to start. The wall of flames was definitely a cool thing to look at while waiting around.   The line.... Oh boy, there was a line when we came and there was an even longer one when we left. Luckily, there was a sign that told us parties of 3+ should see the hostess before waiting in line. This basically let's you get on their texting waitlist where you'll get a text as soon as a table is ready for you.  After we received our text, we were promptly shown to our table where we had Matt as our server. We asked him for his recommendations and he told us the popular choices: the Hog Burger and Hells' Kitchen Burger. We also ordered the Truffle Parmesan Fries.   I hope you enjoy waiting, because if you didn't get enough of that before you got in, you'll get to wait some more for your food to come. It took about 30 minutes for our food to arrive. The burgers are tall and huge. Get ready for it to fall to pieces as you eat it.  Overall, the burgers and fries were very tasty. The Hog Burger was a bit salty, but I guess that's what you get with pork. I wasn't too fond of the long wait, but that's probably what happens when you eat at a popular place like this. Matt was a nice guy and constantly came by to check up on us.

wDejNZGOtFO1Pg7rRSCdkA.text: I tried this place to see what the hype was about.   So if you have a party of 2, you wait in line on the side. If you have a bigger party, you check in with the host and you'll be notified when your table is ready via text!   |Food| I tried the Hell's Kitchen Burger and I thought it was good. It was pretty basic though. Just a regular burger, with avocado, and a piece of grilled jalapeno. I did not think it was spicy.   My table shared the fries and onion rings. The fries are really thick and not really special. It wasn't as crispy as I would preferred. It came with two unique sauces. For the onion rings, it was definitely different. I think they grilled the onions before they dunk it in the batter. The batter was very light! This also came with a sauce. The sauces were curry ketchup, chipotle ketchup, and cheddar ranch sauce. I loved the chipotle one!  |Service| Good! Server was helpful and great.  |Overall| It's worth a try if you're into trying one of Gordan Ramsay's restaurant without breaking your bank.. but I think it's still over priced for an average burger.

OznThTjqMhxiowU0aZoqMQ.text: Nice place and delicious burgers. Just needed a little bit more variety. They also ran out of some stuff due to labor day weekend so we had even less so choose from. One of the food runners even took my appetizer plate before I was finished and didn't bother to ask me if I was finished. So some onion rings got wasted sadly. Oh and the burgers don't come with a side.  On the bright side, the burgers were cooked perfectly.

DTsaP9AwURG__O9zBh9W1Q.text: I have been waiting to try for three years today we get her done. The waiter said that the kitchen is behind and burgers are taking 25 minutes. What! If Gordon Ramsey was here he would say 'move your ass you stupid cow'. So I ordered hot wings which were very good. Balance hot with a mild sweet taste. Good flavor.  My burger after 25 minutes was dry average at best. I got the backyard burger which was a classic cheese burger with fixing only more expensive ($16). Very pricey  Outcome: I liked the wings but dry expensive burger are not my thing. My advice, Go to Five guys and take a picture of Gordon Ramsey with you. Then look at the picture as you eat a real juice classic American cheese burger.  Don't believe the hype. I will not be back here.

tYOesyON4EROB5haZQdGGQ.text: We have been back to Burger twice since my last review.  Wow, this place has changed from when it first opened!  Our last visit, was my wife and daughter coming through town on a summer vacation.  I was so excited to take our daughter, as I was bragging about the burgers and the fresh fries, as my daughter loves good fries!  FYI-she is a huge Five Guy's Fries Girl...  Anyways, I may have overplayed the fries at Burger, as we were very disappointed.  We noticed, before we were even served, that there were multiple orders of fries just sitting in the window, under the heat lamps, waiting for orders?  Yes, if I didn't know better, they were pre-making fries and holding them?  Anyways, the fries were like warm at best, soggy and very oily; not impressed.  What happened?    We were also very disappointed in the burgers, as they were served warm at best; not fresh off the grill piping hot, sorry.  I did try something different the last visit, by ordering the seafood/shrimp burger.  Big mistake, as it was like twenty bucks and tasted like old seafood, with a rubbery texture, not good.    As for the other burgers we ordered, they were both beef, and tasted better, but not great.  Again, the food was warm, not hot.  I also think they may have changed their supplier for their burger, as it really did taste like a lesser product than we had the first couple visits?  Sorry Burger, but I think you lost our business.  I am a big Gordon Ramsey fan, but think he is just starting to spread himself too thin, as I see the fall in quality...    I'm still a fan, please just don't lose that special touch that put you on the map!

M7pF9dRZSC3b2zjvYbEgHA.text: I went to Gordon Ramsay Burger on a Friday evening around 6pm and we got seated immediately, but shorty after we could see a line forming outside. It's very spacious inside and although we got seated quickly, I could tell it was already very busy inside. We ordered the Hell's kitchen burger and hog burger. The food took very long to come out, but it was understandable since there were so many other patrons. Personally, I liked the Hell's Kitchen burger much better, but people have their own preferences. It was definitely tasty, but more on the expensive side for a burger. The presentation was nice and the patty was cooked perfectly to how I preferred. If you're in Vegas and you're feeling something kinda fancy, try this place!

7jt2pgzg_dj_vLLuoRBoWA.text: The food was amazing. I had the Ramsay Burger and fries and a skinny margarita. Everything was delicious. The service was slow, only reason for 4 stars. It's Vegas and it's super busy but it seemed like a long wait for a couple burgers. mcdQzCpK5_EpbbHCHWb7_w.text: I will gladly say that place did NOT disappoint. Upon walking in, I was super excited because obviously Gordon Ramsay but also because it's a simple burger shop. Of course he's known for more fine dining but I also know that he wouldn't just open a random burger shop so my taste buds were thriving with anticipation. I ordered the shrimp and lobster burger with onion rings and french fries. I kept debating on whether or not I should try poutine but I only have positive experiences with that dish upstate New York and Canada so I didn't want to risk it lol   Okay first, the onion rings literally dissolved in my mouth. Whether that's a good thing or not, they're definitely worth trying. I personally like my onion rings to have a thicker batter but paired with the BBQ sauce and ranch it wasn't too bad. They were also topped with parmesan cheese which made them pop. The steak potatoes fries were crispy and delicious. Crunchy on the outside and soft on the middle, just as I like them.   Now the burger. I order this burger simply because shrimp burgers are my favorite and I haven't had a good one since I lived in Louisiana. That said, WOW. IT WAS ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS. The shrimp patty mixed in with the chunks of lobster was an anomaly to my taste buds (a wonderful anomaly that is lol). Perfectly seasoned and paired with the pickled veggies and light greens, it did not need a sauce. The burger buns itself was buttered to perfection. Ugh. I loved that burger!  So if asked, whether or not I would go here again, the easy answer is yes, specifically for the shrimp and lobster burger. The Hells kitchen burger was good but I can get the same, if not better for a more reasonable fee. For the burger, the Hell's kitchen burger, fries, and onion rings, I spent $70.. I said $70. BUT Vegas is expensive so I want to say that's just the way the dice roll? For a cute, casual date this place is perfect atmosphere and menu considered,  or honestly if you just feel like splurging on an overpriced burger. GR did a great job.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and lobster burger

eJH58hdw9SvRVP4G2mR4PA.text: After eating at Bobby Flay's Burger Palace the last time I visited Vegas, I had to try out its competitor: Gordon Ramsay Burger.   Food 5/5: I honestly believe that a burger or onion rings can't get any better. The burger was juicy and cooked perfectly. The onion rings were evenly crispy throughout.    Atmosphere/Vibe 5/5: It was a fun, lively crowd. As I was waiting for my food, I noticed many soccer fans watching Mexico vs US on the monitors. Overall, customers were excited and in good spirits to be eating at such a well-known celebrity restaurant.     Price 5/5: For the quality of the burgers, the prices are more than reasonable. I will definitely come back.   Service/Cleanliness 3/5: Our server was excellent. He came to our table and refilled our drinks many times. However, the greatest drawback was our seating location. They sat us at the end of the restaurant right next to the pathway to the casino. There was a big cigarette tray/dispenser close to us that people walking by actively used. The smoke smell was off-putting, and I know better next time.   Tip: If you are a party of three or more, don't wait in the long line. Walk up to the hostess and give her your name and phone number. They will text you when your table is almost ready.

k6-UYfT4ZExV1Q7dC0NZhQ.text: Chef Gordon Ramsay's takes on burgers! You've seen his angst, you know his skill, so why not eat his take on what a burger should be like?  The burgers here are really filling (and a little over priced) because it is a Gordon Ramsay stamped burger, but worth it if you a fan of him and burgers! (Pssst, it's literally the name of the restaurant.) The food is delicious as expected and the vibe is pretty cool. Even if you were to take his name out of the restaurant it would still be a pretty damn good burger. However, it can get a bit busy with delays in service dealing with a lot of people, but they are trying their best to accommodate.  I like to think that he is in the back yelling at the cooks to make it the right way--his way. Haha, one can imagine it happening, right?  Oh, and I recommend hitting up the Fat Tuesday for a good cold (and strong!) drink afterwards...or even before. It's Vegas after all.

RBVTRoJWJJB9MaTiTs8LXg.text: I'll start this off my saying I don't eat meat. However, this place has a million options for vegetarians. You can get any of the burgers with a fake meat burger for an extra $6. The burgers are fairly expensive anyway, so I opted for the portobello mushroom burger ($18). I also tried out the truffle Parmesan fries. Food took probably 40 minutes to come out, but it was very busy and I would say the food was worth the wait.  Everyone at the table seemed to love their burger. The look deceptively small but were super filling. I didn't even get close to finishing it. The toppings on this burger all complemented it so well. My only complaint about it was that the mushroom could have been cooked a little more. I didn't really eat the are near the middle of the mushroom because it was too tough to chew through. The fries were awesome, I could eat them all day. I would definitely try this place again on future Vegas visits.

-QaqQjjWRau0p5WtZ083Lw.text: I constantly watch Masterchef so I am honestly disappointed in myself it took me this long to go to one of Gordon Ramsays restaurants. There was quite a long line so make a reservation if you're able or you will be waiting to get in there.   I got the lobster and shrimp burger which I thought sounded gross but the people I was with were raving about it like it was the best thing ever so I had to try it. I was pleasantly surprised that I really did enjoy it. As you can see if the picture mine kind of looks like it was poorly put together so I don't feel like I got a full bite with everything in it but it was still good.   *If you're watching your figure or keto they also have the option to get the burger as a lettuce wrap instead of bread*  We also got the truffle Parmesan fries to share and they were delicious. I'm not super into fries but I could've eaten all of them myself because of how good they were. They give you ketchup and an aoli for dipping. The aoli complimented the fries really well so I preferred it over the ketchup.   Service was good, our waitress had a smile on her face the whole time and was attentive. As far as burger places go this is a good spot to try!

KbnPkPU8gDEsTnf-bTJfaA.text: I admire Gordon Ramsay, and to have lunch at his restaurant was very exciting! I'm not much on waiting in a queue to eat, but for this place, I obliged. I actually did. The wait was probably an hour, followed by a wait to get serviced as well. We settled for seats by the kitchen, and that wasn't very inconvenient. Our server was really sweet and friendly, but I think she had many more tables to tend to, that made the service slow.  I ordered the Hog Dawg, my friend got the Hell's kitchen burger with truffle fries. It took about 20-30 mins to get food. And it looked GORGEOUS! The Hog Dawg was divine. Every ingredient was cooked to perfection. The bacon wrapped sabrett, bbq pulled pork, the cheese, the butter, the onion rings- all sooooo good! My friend enjoyed his burger as well, and was very pleased to get a perfect Medium rare patty.  The truffle fries were good, especially the aioli dip with it. However, $12 is a steep pricetag for it.  Most burgers were $17-$19, with some specialty burgers more expensive.  I loved my experience here, other than the service which could be faster.

n61DshKA1cR-eTG0sStlwg.text: I had been earlier in the year and had a much better experience than tonight. Our wait, quoted at 30-45 mins, was actually a bit under 30, so that was good. However, once we sat, we waited a long time to be greeted. Once we were, service seemed to improve, although we did wait a long time for our food. The table next to us was seated well after us, ordered well after us, but got their food well before us. My burger was good, but I asked for it medium, and it was much more rare than that. My wife thought her burger was just fair as well. Onion rings and sweet potato fries were both great. I also really enjoyed my peanut butter stout beer. Very good after a hot day. In total, $120 seemed like a lot, but I guess it is Vegas. If it hadn't been so great last time, maybe my expectations wouldn't have been as high.

1E64JZfcHCyItPD97DBopg.text: Ramsey lives up to all the hype!   Located inside a Planet Hollywood, the "Forest Burger" was beautiful on the plate and an even better bite.  Topped with sliced Duck Bacon, chunks of Tremor Cheese, Arugula, a variety of sauteed Mushrooms on a mixed Black and White Sesame Bun, this burger was really hard to put down.  The three-four slices of duck bacon itself were definitely ducky, not crispy but very lean.  There were at least two kinds of just sauteed perfectly, mushrooms that fell out of my burger while chomping, which I quickly were quickly scooped up and ate.  Finally the arugula added a slight contrasting bitterness.  The bun was toasted and aided with some truffle butter from the Truffle Parm Fries appetizer, this burger was perfect.  I was given a server recommendation that included the Hog Burger, but I wasn't disappointed and I'd have a hard time not ordering this again.  In fact all the burgers ordered in my party were great and well received, including the standard Hell's Kitchen Burger and the Cherry Pepper Chicken topped with an additional fried egg.  The Truffle Parmesan French Fries were a fantastic side.   Crunchy and salted, had me wanting more when done.  These fries were delivered in cone shaped plate with a ketchup and a truffle butter dip.  Every last bit of the truffle butter was used, with my fries, then in my burger.    The lines outside the door was pretty consistent even on a weeknight, if that matters at all in Vegas, I'd recommend coming at an off hour to get seated more quickly.  The service was fast and friendly.    This is a truly an all time awesome burger joint.

m80hFGZL2nFOfcpg3aAkDQ.text: This is my third time here. Wonder why no other info or pictures, because we ate good food too fast. The food here is good, it's always good, thats all I have to say about that.   This trip we ordered the hog burger, yummy, crown burger yummy, uk was ok, farmhouse burger yummy. We also ordered onion rings, super yummy. The  fries are ok but I'm not into this restaurants  fries, but the dipping sauces that come with it are good though. The sweet potato fries are okay, my girls like them a lot.   Overall, I will continue to come back when I'm in Vegas, as often as possible. I have nothing but good things to say about this Gordon Ramsay Burger.

5Y8Y_3JjANKP9QeFkaXMJw.text: My wife and I were ecstatic to find this little gem in Vegas (located inside the mall- in casino- within Planet Hollywood). It can be quite the walk if you don't know where you're going.   However, although is says the environment is good for children, there is smoking galore, and the restaurant is open to it.   We had about a fifteen minute wait, and the hostess told us it would be another five minutes or so, if we could just wait back within the roped-in line we had just come from. Sure, no problem.   There were already people who gathered in that line, and because we had begun there, we simply stepped three feet to the side, so we weren't on top of anyone.   Because we weren't specifically in the square foot she was referring to, she took a customer who was behind us in line first.  She called us again to the counter in five minutes and said, "the line is over there," again pointing to the line directly next to us.   We politely explained to her: "We began there, and waited, and the line filled up, so we just stepped off to the side to wait."  She stared at me with a dumbfounded glare, and shook her head.   "Um the line is there," shaking her head at us.  Well, it's not necessarily my favorite thing to be made to feel stupid from something so minute, when I'm first trying out such a popular restaurant.   The server who took us to our table was amazing, respectful, and kind. Although I was excited to experience the Gordon Ramsey atmosphere, the noise level was so high, we had to get our food to go.   We ate quietly in our car, and the food was amazing, unique, and delicious.

1NRRy3dD3_O26ZF3vpta_Q.text: One of my friend wanted to check out this place after passing by the restaurant. There seems to be a long line for lunch and dinner, but if you have a party of 4 or more, they will give you a pager and you wouldn't need to stand in line.   The food was mediocre. To me, it was nothing more than an all-American burger joint with Ramsay's name (and price tag) attached to it. Burgers were about $17, which was not worth the money. The patty is a generous portion, so it's definitely possible to split a burger and order some gravy fries to share. Overall, we thought that the food was a bit too salty.  It was a fun experience to check out a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, but would I come back again? Probably not...

YOMhJAn_YB-xzLzFE8fVaA.text: I was curious try this place. Coming from the San Francisco Bay Area, we have many great burger places. We went around 3:30 and waited about 10-15 minutes. We opted to sit at a high top table.  I ordered the farm house burger. I really wanted the fried egg. I asked for my burger to be medium rare - basically red in the middle. It came more medium, pale pink the center. The burger was very tasty and well constructed.   My husband had the jalapeno burger. He ordered his burger medium. It came closer to medium rare. He felt there was too much jalapeno for him.  We also had the sweet potato fries. These were the best sweet potato fries! They were perfectly cooked and dusted with powdered sugar.    We also ordered the Oreo shake with 1/4 creme brulee. That was the right amount of creme brulee without it being overpowering. The shake was too thick for straws so we spooned it up. Delicious!  Service was very good. Our server was prompt and just attentive enough. Overall, it was a little spendy for burgers but very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9s9kY3_nmtLmRAWIF5PKyA.text: Don't need to post the food. Wait time is a horrific 2 1/2 plushours. Okay its the New Year's weekend, but we started waiting at 10:15 p.m. on the couples line. The hostess at the front desk never informed us that a party of three or more needs to check-in for a table. We waited at the couples line for 45 minutes.   Once we got to the front of the line, we were informed that we needed to check-in for a party of three or more. We barely had our name on the list at that time. We waited an extra 40 minutes. I complained to the manager on duty that they should post signs in front of their establishment about check-in procedures. They shouldn't put signs that aren't visible at the couples line. They also should have their hostesses inform guest about their check-in procedures.  Meanwhile, after being seated at 11:40 p.m., we're still waiting for our food at 12:27 a.m. NEVER GO HERE.

aBXjfoCegKNJ0qFynNUrPA.text: I've visited this spot a dozen times before, but won't be back.  Two stars because past experiences verify that IF you like meat, cheese and waiting far too long to be served, you'll definitely enjoy your burger.  Since the restaurant has a strict "no substitutions" policy, delivered with an unapologetic sneer, a vegan guest would have a hard time getting a burger worth $22+.  Good News: Ramsay Burger now allows guests to swap out any patty for Impossible Burger ($6 upcharge). The fries are usually quite good.  The Misses: No consideration that that any burger is already $16+, and that without the ability to change toppings or build your own burger, someone who doesn't want cheese, aoili or whatever else the kitchen decided you should enjoy, will end up with a rather plain expensive burger that isn't what you really want.  The beverage list is limited at best. And the staff...ugh. Just know that at this restaurant what you prefer, what you spend and how you are accustomed to being spoken to ... none of that matters here.  Strange that one of the most prolific chefs in town hasn't figured out how to swap toppings. Burger Bar at Mandalay Bay has it nailed. The service and beverage selection are superior there too. In fact...just go there!

VmZ73QHpp7x2gUW7znauPw.text: It was a tasty meal, however after leaving I felt like we should have shared one burger. In True Vegas fashion there are so many places to eat. Great atmosphere we sat at the bar with no wait.

pYehNJrdPlv0NHEkS2WVqg.text: Prepare for a lineup. Hubby, baby and I were staying at PH so every time we walked by there was a line, no matter what time of day. They don't take reservations. We decided to brave it on our last night at the hotel. We waited 45 mins. We had a view of the kitchen and were shocked to see a guy without a beard net on his beard.  Our waiter was friendly. There are lots of unique burgers to choose from. I wasn't feeling brave tho so I ordered the backyard burger. Hubby got the Hell's Kitchen burger. We also shared the Oreo milkshake with creme brulee on top. Unfortunately, fries don't come with the burgers, they are sold separately.  I got my burger cooked well done and hubby got medium. Two bites into my burger I realized that there wasn't any ketchup or sauce on it at all. It's also not provided at the table. I decided to roll with my sauceless burger and actually quite enjoyed it. The lack of ketchup and mustard allowed me to take notice and enjoy the flavour of the grilled burger and the delicious American cheddar cheese. I really enjoyed all the individual flavours.  Hubby was not blown away with his burger. He was expecting to have the best of the best and said it definitely didn't meet his expectations.  The milkshake was yummy and certainly big enough for the two of us.  Not very baby/stroller friendly.

5OFaKD787C2OUyyD_YUbBQ.text: The foie burger and truffle parmesan fries are a match make in heaven. I finished everything with my Modelo. Pleasantly surprised because this is the first time I've come here and it surely won't be my last!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie burger! It needed ketchup but eating it with truffle fries dipped in ketchup did not disappoint!

nMLngu8PgNPW9IbPrgXpVQ.text: This place was so amazing we went two days in a row. The first day we had the Parmesan truffle fries and ahi sliders. The second day we had the Hell's Kitchen Burger and the Hog Burger. They were both packed full of flavor and absolutely delish. I can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan truffle fries and ahi sliders
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog burger

6VTAfGU0AUO3GRja1B0-2w.text: The burger was very tasty. The meat is very well seasoned. I had the poutine, which was awesome as well. Many other things looked very good as they came out of the kitchen. A stop that needs to be made when in Vegas!

_CQibxS8-olw5f3Kxoo3NQ.text: Oh...My...God! Soooooo good. Worth the money! Got the farmhouse burger, Hells' Kitchen Burger, Stout Burger, the onion rings, and the Burnt Ends Poutine. This last dish in particular was AMAZING...we licked the plate clean, it was that good.  But even the onion rings were great...crispy light breading and a touch of parmesan. The burgers were cooked a perfect medium. Loved the slightly runny egg on the farm house. Ambiance and service were great.

F-B7aq_Upe3oiMRt5RpnjA.text: Went on a Wed night and was seated in 25 min. Had the farmhouse burger and onion rings. Both of them were great! It's a little pricey but your getting an amazing burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yeVuyLQLkeMQLC8JjxgvlQ.text: The beer is ice cold.  Best draught beer I've ever had.  I had the hog burger and it was delicious!!! My husband had the farm house and it was unbelievable.   Fries and onion rings were awesome.   Service was great too!  Awesome experience here!

RBzc8_HQsv8oRWPEcxSZSQ.text: Great food and staff. Definitely a bit on the expensive side for a burger and pub restaurant.  I would love to return but would need to save up some $$$$ first.

VcCKSIfHBkE3GBDZjLQ5EA.text: Hit and miss on food.  Can be really great, but can be really disappointing as food will end up flavorless.  Seems to be a cycle. Get one good run at it and then the next one is absolutely tasteless. The hostesses are always condescending and have an attitude.  The servers are generally pretty attentive.

xVVYjulNbOnPNxr8tJgp3g.text: I went here on Friday night about 11 PM (party of two) and they asked if we wanted kitchen bar seating which we were fine with. Our waiter was quick and provided very good service throughout the experience. I got the Cheeseburger and it is AMAZING it has 3 different cheeses! :) for the price I wish that it came with fries but the burger was enough for a late night meal. I have gotten this burger before about a year and a half ago and I never have forgotten about it and it is just as good as last time!

LdzwY8cVo8wkklVAc13F1g.text: I'll start by saying that I really enjoy this place, and their burgers are delicious!! Their service is great, and it's definitely a casual place, but you can dress up and not feel out of place. The burgers are great! Oh, and the parmesan truffle fries are my favorite! The reason I didn't give it 5 stars, is because I have kids, and there is not much on the menu for simple taste buds. I know, "What are kids doing in Vegas???", but as much as I don't like taking them to Vegas, they like going for the lights and nice rooms. So, we take the kids for dinner, because they need to eat too.  For parents: if you find yourself at Gordon Ramsey Burger, and you're with the kids, I would recommend the Chicken Sliders, just ask to get them plain. Also, wait times can be long. We waited 40 minutes for a table (5 people). Our last visit was Thanksgiving week, 2017.

7vPMjV-OxeSWuM5ooowtmQ.text: Writing this review remembering that I'm reviewing a restaurant located in a very touristy Planet Hollywood Hotel in Vegas.   Pros: High-quality burgers, fries were amazing Cons: ridiculous wait time, pretty expensive  The wait is crazy. If you are not a Total Rewards member, it may not be worth it because depending on the day, you might have to wait up to two hours to get a table. When seated, the service does move pretty quickly. Our waiter was very nice even though he was handling like dozens of people.   At our table, we had the Hell's Kitchen burger, Portabella burger, and Backyard burger, and the Truffle Parmesan fries. All of the food was awesome. It's pretty pricey, and may not be worth it for some which is completely understandable. I don't think Burger is one of those "must go to" places in LV, but the food is still really good. Overall, I don't know if the food quality justifies the wait and the price but that's just personal preference!

tTkTtKO-_XqBEcEgzaUviw.text: My husband ate here for the second time last night. Last year we loved every bite. This year was a different story. My husband got the hog burger and he said it was just ok. I got the portobello burger which has no meat but still cost $18. The mushrooms were horribly salty, also the menu said it had shaved veggies.....I can cut thinner veggies by hand at home. The waiter was nice enough to take my burger off the bill. He said they tasted the mushrooms in the back and in fact they were brined in a salt solution and that they were way too salty. All I could think of is what Gordon would have said, "You served this to a customer?!"  I will say the onion rings were light and crispy and not greasy....they were the best part of our meal.

_OZtg8zf5IA35jQjWV1pvQ.text: We came here because all the buffets were closed. Didn't expect anything and chose it just because of Gordon Ramsay's name and we were blown away. The wait was a bit long but it was still dinner hours so definitely understandable. The service was fantastic; the waiters walked us the through the menu and made sure that everyone was heard (we were a pretty sizable party). At one point, someone in my group shattered their water glass and the situation was dealt with quickly and efficiently. Moving onto the food, I had one of the specials which was a burger boasting three different kinds of pig and it was honestly one of the best burgers I'd ever had. Definitely really hearty and I wasn't able to finish it but I'd come again for another attempt. If you're going to come though, you have to try their shakes; in particular the creme brulee shake is to die for. I've recommended Burger to many of my friends and will be making stops here whenever I go to Las Vegas.

EUBO3O8P9dHrqp_jlBWejQ.text: A good burger place. You can stick with the norm or you can try something a little bit different. Service was fine, fast and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Poutine Fries: mushroom gravy, red onions and duck bacon.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest burger, it is BIG enough to share if you are ordering a appetizer or a side. Everything is a la carte.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom poutine fries

yHW5nsvDcLt73qoGgfeI9A.text: We went here back in March & were in love. We went back in May and were disappointed the menu changed. The burgers we got were still amazing and we left stuffed. Be sure you stop by hostess stand if you have a larger party. All small parties have to just wait in line.

7UYYEHsYXfWDB39RppAKfw.text: Great service and food!! You have to try the oreo shake my first Gordon Ramsay restaurant and I loved it.

8LBnD3L1N3Xem6QivvYHbQ.text: Shouldn't be this hard to rate an establishment. While I would have rated it higher, if you are comparing, I went to Guy Fieri's place the night before. That became my number one all time ever, and after visiting Gordon Ramsey's Burgr, Guy's is still my number 1. In fact sorry I can't say Gordon's is my all time number 2. Don't get me wrong, it was good. But not the best.   So if you are out for the best, I've compared for you. I think you will be happy with my honest burger opinion. .

YOravYqlvDFYn-lJEWDTwg.text: Amazing! We took the crown burger and blue cheese burger, great taste, worth every penny.  The Gordon recommendation for bear was great (can't remember the name but it's includes vanilla taste)

KrjNL9565aN_IyNS1upSqQ.text: Went for dinner with my husband. Got seated right away but service was very poor after that. I got the potato chip nachos. They were so salty I could barely eat them. My husband got a burger and loved it. It's annoying that there is no bathroom and you need to walk through the casino.

GZrbOfgqBbbcTQN0X4tWsg.text: Burger was really good....expensive but good. The truffle fries were also pretty good.

oDAsqJQ4qLC6YlwNMOi-rA.text: I'm still thinking about that burger! I had the Tandoori Chicken burger which was tiny bits of chopped chicken in a delicious tahini vinaigrette with crumbled feta cheese. I will be going back to Planet Hollywood for another one. I loved it!

Ni1MF-hDaXpUwXRjEe3gSw.text: I had high expectations considering it has Gordon Ramsey's name on it. The burgers were outstanding (we had the farmhouse and ultimate) and they were cooked to perfection. The truffle fries are definitely sharing size so don't let the $11 price tag deter you. The beer selection could be a little better but has some decent staples. Now the not so great...the service. Even my 16 year old recognized that that our server was clueless. He kept forgetting what we said and seemed totally distracted. I get that it's a relatively new place but perhaps a bit more training would help.

ZhfCGlEoXEC1Pke_y3S0PA.text: I didn't really want a burger for dinner, but after walking the strip, we ended up here. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen (hot) burger. It was very good. My daughter ordered the Farm burger and loved it. The skinny screw was very good too.

fI8yky6Wqp8HdGmLxkNOvA.text: We were so excited to come back here after a year but everything was a big disappointment. The hostess was super unfriendly, the waiter didn't have enough information about the menu and finally those burgers didn't,t have a good quality like before. I,m sorry but we are not going there anymore.

0IdV88iYCvXeUA3Xmkl9vQ.text: Was walking around Vegas looking for somewhere to eat and when we saw this the burgers called our name, I had gone here before and it was good!!!.  We were quickly serviced and seated. Then we ordered, and to our surprise the burgers came out 3 maybe 5 min after ordering.  At first, since we were starving, we were happy to just have food in front of us, however that feeling was short lived.  We quickly realized the burgers got there so fast that they must have been sitting there already cooked for god knows how long.  But again since we were starving, we continued to eat.  And let me tell you what a mistake that was, I've been having stomach pain since and wasted a lot of time last night and this morning in the room rather than enjoying my trip.  Very disappointed.  Will not be returning.

8teQAQkzek_37hJZ7Pjehw.text: Great food, customer service is terrible , waiting time is ridiculous , girls with fake smiles  and a lot of attitude completely unhelpful at the host post . Too bad of an experience for me to come back .

fv5v9X5_04fW8kjTWjItSA.text: Gordon Ramsay Burger has a permanent spot on our things to do list when we come to Vegas. This was our third time eating GRB and I must say superb. The burgers are so good you over look the wait, about 25 minutes or so. I would definitely recommend GRB to everyone but keep in mind the burgers aren't cheep.

4x18KhAF8S5LdIT09Mku9A.text: If you want to spend 3 to 4 hours just to heating to Bruegger. Then you can go  tease please. The food is good but the service is horrible

LQ_R-4ky0SnHMGzEVGrcnQ.text: Wife and I stopped by and so glad that we did. I had the Farmhouse burger and was probably the best burger in my life. The burger itself was a perfect medium and the egg was so incredible on it. The chicken wings were also amazing and high quality. Would recommend this for any burger fans looking for something a little different but amazing in taste.

LvEPBnpwQ-9fpOZWkTibcw.text: Surprisingly good!  We ordered the Blood Orange Cosmo's, Hog Burger, Ultimate Cheeseburger, Truffle Fries and got a small creamsicle desert.  A little pricey but totally worth it!

OrVPh9zzXk2yfZqPTaQW9w.text: This isn't a review of the food at Gordon Ramsay Burger - but rather my parties' experience - and specifically the customer service at this establishment.  My wife and I were in Las Vegas celebrating my 50th birthday with 2 other couples on 2/17/2018.  It was during the dinner hours and were happy that the wait for our party of 6 was only 30 minutes.  We were all excited to try his restaurant - having been fans of the TV program and having dined at another higher end Ramsey restaurant on previous business travel to Las Vegas.  Upon putting in our reservation at the hostess stand, we stepped to the bar, placed an order for 6 cocktails ($75 for the round of beverages), and began to watch the Winter Olympics on the TV at the bar.  After a few minutes a hostess approached my wife and explained that we couldn't stand were we were  (at the bar).  Upon surveying the area - I at first thought that the server was saying that we couldn't stand near the area of the bar where they pick up bar orders (i.e. near the rail) or we were in the way of the servers -- we were not.  I totally understand this -- so I made a point of moving down, making certain that we were well clear of the server area.  A few minutes later the server returned -- and very RUDELY told my wife and friends that we "YOU NEED TO MOVE"  (no "please" and in a very rude tone)  *** Important note *** several seats were EMPTY at the bar.   I explained we were having our drinks that we had just ordered -- and the server explained that it was "against policy" and that we would have to stand outside of the restaurant "on the carpet".  We walked back to the hostess stand --  I requested an explanation of the policy from the hostess and she reiterated the same.  Not satisfied with this, I requested to speak with the manager.  He came over - apologized, but said that was "the policy" -- the bar was "full service" and we would have to wait outside of the area.  I explained to him that I had just ordered a round of drinks and pointed out that ample seating was available -- I suppose I could understand if they had diners at the bar... but not really ... these weren't "tables" in the bar ... this was "the bar" -- and we were customers!  Unbelievable!   I explained to the manager that my friends and I were all frequent Las Vegas business patrons -- and didn't appreciate the terrible customer service.  Even if it was a "policy" - the server had no excuse to speak to my wife in such a rude and inappropriate manner.  He apologized for that (indicating he would speak to her) and offered to attempt to seat us -- but at this point I couldn't see giving the establishment another dollar.  Before leaving, I returned to the bar to put my $14 cocktails in "go cups" and the bartender also apologized for the policy.  Very unfortunate as I had enjoyed my other experience at GR restaurants - but given this experience will not return on future business or leisure trips.   I've been to many restaurant bars in my years of business and leisure travel -- but never experienced a policy like this - nor been treated so rudely.  Las Vegas has many great restaurants with exceptional customer service -  and we experienced several over our long weekend --- Gordon Ramsey Burger is not one of them.

Omc1zrbI_OlzMKTpsABrMw.text: Stopped in for lunch having dined at both Steak & Fish and Chips. The standards here are no different. Everything is top notch from the table setting, to the decor, to the food. I ordered the hog burger and almost contemplated cutting it in half since it was so big. Quite delicious. I also ordered a side of fries. So damn good! Service was fast and friendly, the only negative I saw was wait staff appears to stand around a lot in the center of the room. I do not care for having the feeling that I am being stared at. Its just a bit awkward for me. Otherwise I highly recommend Burger and cant wait to go back and try something else from the menu. Its pricey but I feel the food was really worth what you pay for.

YJXf1xWGCFjNgvIDKyBsZA.text: I wasn't expecting much when going here. I thought it might be one of those places people go just for the name of Gordon Ramsay. The Hell's Kitchen burger was absolutely incredible. It was moist, cooked perfectly (medium just how asked) and the bun was just the right amount of toasted. We also got the truffle fries which were delicious. The aioli that comes on the side is something you will just have to try! We will be back here again. The Only thing I didn't enjoy is that they didn't have any kind of kids options so our 4 year old helped us with the fries and had some crackers.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W2Ie8sidrKzm35o8s_SGMQ.text: I was extremely impressed with the "Forest" burger it was cooked to perfection. The exceptionally juicy burger was topped with tremor cheese, arugula, grilled mushrooms and duck bacon. The combination of the arugula, cheese and duck bacon was a flavor explosion. Again, the duck bacon was such a unique twist on the traditional "bacon" burger. Everything was on point including the service. A must go! Reasonable priced as well. Dessert was .

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nNm7RQmJQDpXmFo0wtowew.text: Went here with a group and all enjoyed our burgers. But what really made the experience was Caleb who was assisting our server with drinks etc.  Before we could even finish our drinks,  he was already there with a refill and smile on his face. The whole time we were there, he was running around helping the whole restaurant. It was so refreshing to see someone who loved their job with a positive attitude!

wScfS1_8sdr718qj8hDJEg.text: Lively atmosphere, good food, good selection of draft beers. Good, attentive and prompt service.  Hells' kitchen burger - Perfectly cooked with excellent choice of condiment combinations.  Must try IMO.  Curried shrimp salad- Perfectly seasoned and cooked shrimps with fresh and balanced salad. Highly recommended.  Hellfire chicken wings - Great flavor and great choice of wing section. It will be better if it's more spicy or have a choice to pick how spicy.  Baby black kale apple Caesar salad -  Nice salad. Wish there were more kale and the croutons were not soggy.

pGNxiWHIsGKLKOgAvbtJ_Q.text: Really enjoyed our burgers here and the concept. My negative is that they don't take reservations and even off times there is a long line. So while I did enjoy it I would prefer to just go somewhere else than to stand on a long line because it is good but not worth it to me.

q3eivO5f1NTAHUJE8jxcHA.text: The line was long but surprisingly it moved quickly! Excellent service, great food (very tasty) & absolutely LOVED the chocolate pudding shake w/Kahlua, it was definitely a heavenly dessert in a cup! We ordered the Hell's Kitchen & the special F -word burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2dm4p_f4rgVfvjZToqknew.text: Been going here for the past 4 years when driving through or staying for a convention. While the burgers are good, the quality has declined over the years. I would still recommend.

dHbxEx_iFtasWSxWiynk5w.text: Yumm! It was worth waiting in line for.  Great experience for our vacation.  Fun selection of burgers and they were cooked perfectly. Recommend it for sure.

BFuLNypM6FaGm5XxNzO7TA.text: Loved our burgers!! I got the blue cheese!! Yummy & fast service as well. I would go back again soon!! Such a long line here, but we went at an off time & only had to wait about 15 minutes.

C7CH-1SnFjvZav2F90R5gQ.text: We were really excited to discover this famous burger even after an hour wait. But when we got our drink (regular soda) , we found a big bug in one of the ice cubes.  The manager came to tell us that we were going to have a discount on our check, but at first we didn't get any. After waiting a while, we got a new check with a minimal discount compared to the situation that we experienced.   For the high standard that the restaurant is supposed to match, it was very disappointing. I guess Gordon Ramsay should check his own kitchen...   So be careful when you order your drinks there...

sXhPElfqRqnjtSZ1E5kJcw.text: Too slow. The burger is good, but I generally would not like to take over 2 hours to eat a burger. Long line outside. When you get in, you don't want to see lots of empty tables. The table one row over was empty for over 15 minutes. Less then 1/3 of the tables have any dishes or food, yet there were 8 fries sitting at the counter waiting for waiters to pick them up. Needless to say, we waited a long time for our food.

RW0wSDNfmNZcA2P1S9ROOQ.text: Got here right after they opened - no wait. I sat at the bar, and was helped by a very attentive bartender/server. I ordered a beer and the Farmhouse burger. I really wanted to try the truffle fries, but couldn't deal with the $11 price tag. As it turned out, that was fortunate, because the burger was so filling that I couldn't have done justice to both the burger and the fries. My situation in Vegas wasn't one that played well with doggie bags, so it's good I nothing left to take "home."  Best burger I've EVER had, and I've had a LOT of burgers from a LOT of excellent burger joints. Perfectly cooked (I ordered mine medium rare), juicy, delicious, impressively complemented by the egg and bacon. Maybe you've never heard of mangalitsa bacon, but don't let the unfamiliarity of the name scare you off. Order this bad boy. The bun was awesome.  $15 for a burger without fries? Well worth every penny.

iZBLeFRNeXnEmCiaKERuhQ.text: We are sad that we visited Gordon Ramsay Burger on our last day in Vegas!  Wished we would have the first day so that we could go back on our last day.    Husband ordered the Yardhouse and I the Hell's Kitchen burger (replaced beef patty with turkey patty).  OMG- the burgers were very moist and juicy!    You know it's a good burger when you see the patties glistening and juicy, however, no grease at all on your plate or fingers after you are done Inhaling it.   I don't care much for onion rings or fries and boy were the onion rings Delicious!  We also Inhaled the onion rings with its two dipping sauces within minutes!  We will be back!

Dh-Rqv46c9Ezi6665ddQ3w.text: I typically am basic with my burger, but I branched out a little here. I ordered the Farmhouse Burger which has bacon, egg, and cheese...I was not disappointed! I also got the truffle fries which were great! People traveling with me loved the sauce/dip that came with the fries.

BCsUGtQIxL9wvAkUGR5WJw.text: Gordon Ramsay should do an episode of Kitchen Nightmares on his own restaurant. The burgers were below average, some of the "snacks" were gross. The only thing good about the restaurant was the service.

Uc1Bl1RuW5Zz99zeHAHDxA.text: This place is amazing!! I really enjoyed the meals I got! I would say that the workers were happy! I was really satisfied with what I got, it was a bit of a wait though but it was worth it!The place was very put together!At the end I had a great experience so... I think this is a place that you should probably go to if you are going to Las Vegas, with a empty stomach!

76D24TZ281--aG3Risrwzw.text: As my husband and I sit her waiting after already waiting to be seated. After the initial 20 min wait , we were seated and proceeded to order our beverages and appetizers. Granted the restaurant is located in a prime location. So a slight wait is always expected.. From what I see on Chef Ramsay's show his tolerance for long wait times , cold food and not enough food is very slim. 1. They ran out of the lobster and shrimp burger. The time was 4pm in the afternoon on a Friday. 2. We waited nearly an hour to get our meal. (A burger and a veggie burger) Mind you something I only settled for due to the face that my first choice was sold out. What makes this restaurant what it is and appealing to the public is Chef Ramsay's name.

965G4xFE5Ty8bMHeqMATtA.text: Best Nachos ever.  Also our grou had the blue cheese burger and the ahai sliders amazing.   Lobster seafood not so much other then that fabulous to pout. Craving the Nachos.

OBFDyHTfUo_Y4pt-QpEJyw.text: We ordered the Hells Kitchen Burgers and were really disappointed. It was like an ordinary cheeseburger that someone threw a slice of green pepper on, not worth 17$.  I will say that the service and atmosphere were good, but we have had better burgers. Try any burger at Moo Creamery in Bakersfield, Ca.

iorqk91WrAG7KW402TWiGA.text: This place was the first place my wife and I went every time we went to Vegas.  In fact we would plan our trip so that we ended up in Vegas at lunch time just so we could go straight here after we checked into whatever hotel we checked into.  The burgers were great but the poppers were our favorite and basically the main reason we went.  They have discontinued the poppers so now we will have to find another place to call our favorite because this place no longer is.  The burgers are great but you can get a great burger anywhere.  What a shame

exIg6EsB-UPj727qdDehNQ.text: The wait was too long. The food terrible. For all Gordon Ramsey brags about... not worth.

UOmY36SPDRzSOi4O81DaNg.text: Wow.  This place was amazing.  The service was awesome.  Waiter was super attentive and very courteous.  Food was delicious and perfectly cooked.  My kids loved it. The picky eater said it was the best burger they ever had.

pu8K8hv_yB_caypSvvQSRA.text: My friend and I really wanted to try this place and we were not disappointed. I got the "Hells" Kitchen burger while my friend got the Backyard burger. The burgers were soooo good omfg. We both got medium rare and it was nice and juicy. We also got the truffle Parmesan fries which comes with garlic aioli and something else. The garlic aioli gmfu in a good way though. Legit I would eat that garlic aioli with everything haha. The other sauce was just too sweet so we didn't like it very much. The servers are friendly, but we waited 30+ minutes for our food. People that came way after us got their food before us or at the same time so that's why I knocked off a star. Would def come back if I'm ever in town again.

qqIboFPI1qZ9Dqxik_sNvQ.text: Unfortunately our experience was not a good one. We asked when we first were seated how long we should expect to be waiting for our food, because we are on a time crunch. The waitress said it takes about 25 minutes to have our burgers come out. We ordered, got our drinks and even got a refill on our drinks. Then almost 40 minutes later we are told by our waitress that our food will be right out. Guess what? Our food never showed up. The manager on duty, Zach, came over and was apologetic and helpful. He found out that our ticket wasn't ever put in. That is a damn shame. Zach then took our order and told us it would be out in a few minutes and on the house. He kept to his word, and our food came out within 5-7 minutes. The waitress came up to us and apologized and stated it was her fault and not the kitchen's. I appreciate her being forthcoming and all, but that didn't help that we were now running late because of this mess and still had not eaten lunch! I thought things were looking up, but then when our food came out my burger was f*cking well done!! I asked for medium. -- So to start out our waitress forgot to put our order in, then the kitchen messes up my order, and we are waiting over an hour. I didn't even finish the whole burger. The fries were over done;almost as if they had been sitting under a warmer for a period of time. So incredibly unimpressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dry/overdone.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I ordered my burger medium.

zAaG3M4PJyzL4xfV5Y4Hvg.text: Waited 2 hours at planet Hollywood to get food at Gordon's burger no call or anything from the front desk just go to of Chang's instead

iNvaebV_JcVrIvdZfD01Qw.text: Best burger in town! Hell's Kitchen burger amazing! Friendly service, amazing food! Shakes were awesome! Will definitely be back

-Ilul7uv-ZW3RyWaj_LPLQ.text: Always a 5. I would recommend Burgr to everyone! Especially if you own a restaurant! This is how a restaurant should be run. First Class service is followed up by the best food you'll eat. This place is a must, but fair warning, go EARLY, if you 'pop' in after 6 looking for a table, you'll be waiting for a long time.

kUnv-sc17YwJVD9iPArmyg.text: We found hair in the sauce for the fries.....forgot to take a pic since they already took it away

ro_xnldVB65DU-5WOOCB7g.text: Definitely worth the wait; don't be intimidated by the long line. Lobster and shrimp burger was fantastic. I ordered the foie burger, I was disappointed. The burger was fine but I got only one bite of real foie gras taste. Was not worth the extra six dollars price above the regular burger. The truffle Parmesan fries were great tasting from the fries on the top of the dish. After that, they were just plain fries. Worth trying at least once.

1c7TYJ_UA2W69FBn3ry5rg.text: Decided to try this place out after seeing it on a worth it episode on buzz-feed. There was around a 40 minute wait. The waiter was nice. I ordered the mushroom poutine and the onion rings for appetizers. My table had also ordered the U.K. burger, the patriot burger, the hells kitchen burger and the crown burger. The poutine was very good, i would highly recommend. But the onion ringer were terrible and very oily. All the burgers were very good, but the waiter did mess up my order and brought a different burger. After notifying them of the mistake they brought my burger about 10 minutes later and they took it off the bill. All together a good experience.

OIe6jZ2v_lZU1ZIXFSZ1BA.text: Ordered the Turducken burger.  Took my first bite and choked on a large bone.   Showed the waitress, who showed the head chef.   Guess they didn't give a shit.   Otherwise, good stuff.

DwoP7jqNh44LRk8VLyRNTQ.text: I was actually very surprised by "Burger". I ordered their "hells kitchen" burger.  I didn't expect much since most restaurants believe it or not don't know how to make a good burger.The meat was very delicious and perfectly seasoned. Juicy and not over seasoned to hide the taste of the meat. The buns were toasted perfectly and the jalapenos were a delicious option as well. Our waiter was very friendly and pleasant. Despite how busy they were I was surprised at how fast the food came as well. I would love to go back to this place again!!

AsHtd1X-4trGXWGjwQFAeA.text: Amazingly good burgers for a very decent price! The burgers are perfect, the paddies great. And the combinations are great! Have tasted the hells kitchen and blue cheese burgers. Both were really tasty. Also good service.

gyeQJYenNfU8i2Y16YJlXg.text: Still the best burger I've ever had. These guys don't F'around. Had the sirloin burger with parmesan sprinkled fries but that burger stole the show. I've been here several times and it never disappoints. They have some really good tasting strong beer as well.

GZNsb-_Ikn6pr2Bbb1JtaQ.text: Went to make a to go order and the blonde blue eyed ostess working Wednesday the 14th at 5:30 claimed the food takes thirty minutes to make and when I inquired why she said "because that's how long it takes" with her snappy attitude instead of explaining that to go orders take longer or being nice about it. Idk if you guys take pride in having girls work there with nasty attitudes or what be nice you're in the food service industry I'm a paying customer :)

mHcD-wHrT5AvQnRYmMuNJg.text: I was very excited to try this place even though i heard mixed reviews.  I came on a friday night at 8 and the wait wasnt too long 25 minutes which was a surprise.  Waiter was very friendly and came multiple times to ask if we needed anything service overall was great :) im giving it three stars because i felt like the onion rings and the truffle Parmesan fries were way too salty.  The burger was ok nothing amazing overall the meal wasnt worth the price and i wouldnt come back again.

-R7RJ5b4Wkhl9NLpaHw5jA.text: One of my favorite meals while in Vegas. True to Gordon Ramsay everything was cooked fresh.  We had a Farmhouse Burger and an Ahi Tuna burger along with the truffle fries.  Delicious, delicious and delicious. Could not imagine anything more delicious until dessert arrived.  Do not visit this restaurant without trying the Brown Butter Pecan Caramel shake. It's Ramsay's signature dessert and yes, it is life changing.  I'll be back!!

rbRiI6h2gTqaafsxG0NQ8A.text: Best burger I've ever had! Definitely don't go to Bobby's Burger Palace. Gordon's is waaaaayyy better and similarly priced. Also make sure you get the Fries!

uOQeFwLiv4TE93Zq5SWsqw.text: Bar none the best server in Vegas, Alex. Not only did he make me an off the menu iced coffee, he made me three! Nice atmosphere, but Mr Ramsey, I need more cheese on that burgr!

I84gj0HMPwN-zerbAWd59g.text: This is one of my favorite burger places and I stop by whenever I'm in Vegas! Good food, nice setting and great drinks...you can't go wrong!There's always a line but don't be intimidated, it goes by relatively quickly! And you can always sit at the bar if you're in a rush!

2UgPpXghCBodyC6FEbC5rw.text: The burgers are definitely worth the wait. We were a large party and they text our phones when our table was ready. That allowed us to grab some pre dinner drinks at the little bar around the corner. Server was super sweet and accommodating to the first timers!

nUkTrhzOg0w2OFDQXIXz7w.text: Finishing a trade show at 10:30 and trying to find decent food is a challenge, especially with four sober men who need a beer and some burgers. Stoked GRB was open. Great beer selection and menu. Buddy had a lobster burger and liked it, I had the farm stand burger and felt -yeh. It was kind of like eating a fancied up Johnny Rockets burger. The truffle fried and onion rings made up for it. Worth and shot just know its pricy... like all burgers on the strip.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zGSEvWAlN9uKTp61vQOaMQ.text: This was on my Vegas bucketlist so my friends and I had to come here on our visit. There were 10 of us and we were seated fairly quickly. They even text you when they have a table available, however they don't take reservations. I had the specialty lobster and shrimp burger and it was delicious. My drunk self definitely thanked myself for saving the other half for later that night. Most of my friends thought it was the best burger they had ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and lobster specialty burger

z0zw_h6RMc65Mbdzx5FRGA.text: I was here when it opened and somehow was not impressed. On return, the total experience was amazing from greeting at the front to servicer at the table. The burger was probably the best I've ever had with juice dripping down my hands. And the milkshake to die for. This will be a stop every visit I have to Vegas until I die!

t334PnEHS8AqamNhbhZgKw.text: I absolutely LOVE Gordon Ramsay. He is an amazing chef and I applaud all his hard work. The first time I came to this restaurant was a couple years back when they had on their menu this amazing delicate fancy fish sandwich. I came back here early june to find out they took it off their menu which was a bummer to hear but Instead I tried one of his other options I got the tandoori chicken burger I believe. It was VERY moist and had amazing flavor to it ! I highly recommend it, My husband got the hells kitchen burger and he was it was pretty damn good. and My in-laws also got great burgers but unfortunately I cannot remember them at the moment. I suggested we get the onion rings because the batter (from what I last remembered) was out of this world! His recipes are to die for and his kitchen runs so smoothly. I love how immaculate everything was. We would LOVE to come back next time.

7OqF_R6N9hjupa0edNv-KA.text: Had the burger that wasn't on the menu..  the F-Burger, it was definitely worth the $22 Tasty and delicious!

zE09pPwxAdSJyLZ_DTgkkQ.text: I'm not sure why we go to celebrity chef restaurants like sheep to have our wallets sheared.  It's not like they are in the kitchen ensuring the food that is turned out is up to their standards.  The host of Kitchen Nightmares needs to hurry back to Planet Hollywood Las Vegas and get all Hell's Kitchen on whomever he left in charge.  Arriving after a long trip to Las Vegas, we didn't feel like getting dressed up and going out so we decided on Gordon Ramsay Burger for dinner.  We arrived just in time to get seated right away.  A long line formed soon after and I started to feel sorry for these people because they had no idea what mediocrity awaited them.  Before I go further, our waitress Ashley was fantastic!  We started with Burnt Ends Poutine.  If you don't know what that is, consult your cardiologist before trying it.  It is delicious; just not this one.  We found GR's to be slimy.  They used the really big steak fries which tend to be too soft.  IMO, if they would've used a smaller cut fry that crisped more, then the gravy wouldn't have made them so slimy.  The burnt ends were good.  I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger.  It was good, the jalapeno gave it some great heat without being overbearing.  My only complaint is that the cheese and oil from the roasted jalapeno and roasted tomatoes made the condiments slippery and the burger messy to eat.  But, maybe that's just an eating disorder of mine.  My fiancee ordered the Ale Dawg.  It is a bacon wrapped Sabrett hot dog.  She took a couple bites and couldn't go on.  Of course, bacon is high in sodium but she said the hot dog on it's own was so high in sodium it was inedible.  Ashley replaced it with the Wheatberry-Quinoa Salad.  It was lathered in oil like it was going to lay out by the pool.  My fiancee just bit her tongue and ate around the oily greens.  When the bill came, I noticed that Ashley had removed the poutine and hotdog from the bill without being asked so I gave her a very big tip.  Another positive is that they have Unibroue's La Fin du Monde on tap.  It's one of my favorite beers so cheers, GR!  It cracks me up how there are so many chef competition shows on TV where you hear the judges critique each other over a single scale left on a salmon prepped and cooked in 5 minutes or a couple extra grains of salt, etc.  Meanwhile, us regular folk are served this crap for an arm and a leg.  Do yourself a favor and don't go unless you want to have a beer.

n9XGF7ZNsj7Gz9e5H-6hAQ.text: By far, the best burger I've ever had! I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger with side of Truffle Fries to share. The meat was tender and juicy with a kick of spicy-ness. The customer service was friendly and attentive. Be prepared to wait to get a table, I checked in with the hostess, and killed time gambling in the Planet Hollywood casino until I got a text message that my table is ready. I highly recommend calling ahead of time to see what the wait times are.

CV5mfWYDmBYKPo0rmz8N4Q.text: Great burger! A bit expensive, but worth every penny. The truffled fries are also awesome!

LBgwrP3b3-avm7cV5pZR7A.text: Burgers aren't normally my thing, and Im typically disappointed with restaurants that have big name chefs associated with them, but I reluctantly agreed to eat here with some friends after a Britney show. Holy sh*t, this is all I wanna eat the rest of my time in Vegas! I got the blue cheese burger and it was hands down THE BEST burger I have ever ate in my entire life!!! Everyone at my table ordered a different one and they all agreed... Best burger they've ever had. The staff was welcoming, knowledgeable, fast, and friendly... but honestly the staff coulda been rude and I still would've given this spot 5 stars because the food was that good. OHHH I almost forgot! The creme brulee shakeeee! I died.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese burger. The way the cheese, fig, arugula, and the juices from the perfectly cooked patty all melted together was to die for.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée shake (chocolate)

luBm6DMGFb0hcTegVFb-iQ.text: Dry burger, fries and onion rings sit under lamp for over 5 minutes before being served.  Don't ask for a straw they appently decided to stop ordering.

ZoBbeOsEO2UZ5CV7T7hZgw.text: Was in Vegas for the weekend of 6/30 to 7/2, we stayed at Planet Hollywood and this restaurant is conveniently located in the hotel. When you check in you give them your phone number and they text you when your table is ready. Which is a really nice feature because you can walk around the casino or even go back up to your room if you are staying there.  The food was delicious! I had the ultimate cheeseburger since I am a big fan of cheese, it did not disappoint really juicy and the cheese is fantastic.  We shared the truffle fries and onion rings. Personally, I liked the onion rings better, they were light and not oily. The sauces they give you are also very good. Both of my sisters really enjoyed their burgers, one is vegetarian and got the portobello mushroom burger she loved it and it did look very tasty, the other one got the blue cheeseburger she was very satisfied with the burger. All in all we all really enjoyed our food and would definalty come back next time we are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Fries and Onion Rings both big enough to share!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. At Planet Hollywood Hotel

f8v872CCBc_T-wDyiv6zVg.text: Im a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay, so I had to try this place. I had a plane to catch an hour later so I took it to go, I think the experience inside would've been better. They took about 45 minutes that day when promised around 30 minutes for a to go order (anxiety)! Regardless they were nice and didn't seem bothered when we kept checking in on them.   The burgers were about $15 a pop, which isn't too bad, I've seen worse! I got the hell's burger. Medium well, my friend got it well done and it was very dry! It was tasty! Had all the right things inside for my liking!   The truffle fries and sauce they used on them were amazing, get those with extra sauce!   This place was good, I would definitely go back and try out some other things the next time I'm in Vegas!

OIBpuNYbkIpM47LcSD9aAw.text: Meh. Came here last night. I will say service was 5 stars. Wait took forever, they sat us next to the fire wall but we were way too hot and the staff reaccomdated our seating which made them get 5 stars in my book. Our waiter was helpful and really knew the menu. Reason for the lower ranking is that I had really high hopes for this place. Now I ate the entire burger because I was so hungry. The ketchup is home made and I was not a fan, it was spicy almost like a cocktail sauce, but just not good with their fries. Fries were overly seasoned. I preferred the regular ones over the truffle. The onion rings were bomb. The burger I had was good, but dry and I did not like the cheese on there, very stinky like goat. I prefer red robin over this place.

J6qtcyBW3LeR_ZgVZgYi6g.text: The sweet potato fries are amazing! Served with a jalapeno honey sauce that's rad. The ketchup is also fresh and delicious. However the trying to be trendy metal cone in which they are served causes most of the fries to become soggy before you get a chance to eat them.  The burgers are pretty lovely. Have had The pilgrim every time. Heard great things from my Indian lover about the indian themed burger.  A creme brulee milkshake shouldn't be served with whipped cream, covering the brulee top. Be sure to order without whipped cream! The milkshakes are too sweet, the creme brulee pudding is good but sweeter than a creme brulee- more like American vanilla pudding.  I wasn't the biggest fan of the chips n gravy.  I actually like getting the shake and fries take out because I can take them home and pop the fries in the oven and shake in the freezer, so the shake is thicker and the fries are crispier. It would be grand if they were thicker and crispier, respectively, in house. Fries gotta be crispy!   I also wish this location offered alcoholic milkshakes, I love a chocolate milkshake with Guiness or malt liquor.

SIYZJ2mYgGkY6W5aEK8vkw.text: If this is the standard for Gordon Ramsey, then I wouldn't try a higher end place. For as much as he talks about seasoning, there certainly wasn't any on my burgers or fries except for cumin in the ketchup which was less than appealing. I just went with the plain Backyard burger hoping for good flavor but apparently you need to slather it with 3 different cheese and sauces and bacon to make it taste good.  I would skip this place and go straight to Shake Shack.

NHUOqQmvwen5qBuT3mhRkw.text: Best burger in the country.  Taste, quality, pricing, location.  It's a reason I bring friends to Vegas

Ud0ckONB55j5V6gfy_L-ww.text: Food was really good, especially since we were a group of 7!  Burgers were juicy and the truffle fries and onion rings were awesome.  We had an hour wait at 2:30 on a Wednesday and service was even a little slow once we got served.  There were empty tables, but apparently weren't staffed to handle everyone.

8bvnW5PqwMTt347zIOm3jA.text: Excellent burger .   The atmosphere is nice. Very clean and quiet place. The service is a little slow. But my waitress was polite and nice.  Would have loved to take a picture of my mushroom burger but my battery died on my phone.
