uj2zuQmryB9tYkmHffLNmA.text: Great burger food and service! They got the order wrong but it didn't matter the food was great and the waitress was amazing.

NhE-6kjgC04ncATJbb6RvQ.text: Our server Rick made sure we were set up. Just as if we were sitting on the set of Hells Kitchen. Rick recommended a burger for my son, and I. Also I let him pick the beer I washed my burger down with.  We started with a order of onion rings, fantastic. Lots of flavor. Light. Not greasy at all. Our burgers, and a order of fries that we split came out quickly.  Burger was done perfect. It was honestly 1 of the best burgers I have ever ate. Rick did a awesome job taking care of us both. Did a great job with his pairings. If you head there for lunch, or dinner...Rick is your guy

FxRZiGfhpP2pK8xfNSEaPg.text: While the food was not bad, it did not deserve to have Gordon Ramsay's name on it. Let's start with the fries... The fries tasted old and stale. The first round of sauces provided had very little flavor and weren't enough for the amount of fries in the cup. The second round of sauces, while supposedly being the same thing, tasted completely different. They were so different I thought they had given me something else... And now for the burger... Let's start with the good: The burger was cooked perfectly; it was juicy, had great grill marks, and a bit of char flavor. The egg was also cooked perfectly; no extra juices and the yolk was completely runny... Now for the bad: Aside from the slight char flavor of the meat, there was almost no flavor to the burger. It's like they are scared of seasonings. Also, the burger sat too long after being plated because the bottom bun was soaked completely making it extremely soggy and difficult to handle... Again, not saying it was bad, but I would rather have gone somewhere like Five Guys and spent 1/3 of the money.

NdATM_a7-0nT15mvnNdFbA.text: We had the best waiter here his name is Alex. Ask for him if you can. My husband got the blue cheeseburger and I got the onion rings! I am a very picky eater so I always stick to something safe but OMG the cheeseburger was amazing and the onion rings are to die for.

Hts5wYKVvO8AV1ok7gVCWw.text: Best Damn burger and truffle fires I ever had in my life!!!! You won't be disappointed if you are your just hater and don't know quality.....

wwXqTeYMW83Tq0FAc6EEQw.text: One of the best Chicken Wings we've tried, and of course those Burgers are incredible, service was great, the line to get there was pretty long, waited about 45 minutes to get seated, but this is Vegas! If you are traveling to Vegas and looking for a great burger spot, then this place is a must try!

Da48fJq7G9co2yX6NP0Z3g.text: Food is amazing, and has great taste for the value, HUGE DOWNSIDE is the wait when you can clearly see thru the window all the open tables!! What up with that?? It's not like they take reservations.

578o-5D_mwXdLFnjRJMK_w.text: The food here is amazing!! I got them nachos! Wow the cream cheese was delicious! And got the Poutine! The meat on the pountie was was sooooooo good! And the sauce with it was absolutely and eye opener. The burger I had was the Hog Burger. It was so juicy that when I took my first bite, the meat juice dropped on to my pants! It was worth it! The text message was a plus!

MA4jPIzADyEDL4wr7-iNoA.text: Good burgers, fries and shake. Appetizers are weak. Service not great. Same issues, second time going. Stick with the basics.

Th02qkKp8NcSgbqIYmNV0w.text: The burger was great; exactly what I would expect(especially for the price) the fries however were terrible! $8 for fries that were bland and uninspired.

TnKgWC9zqPTr_X2ceaPe_Q.text: We had the Hell's kitchen burger , Butter Pecan Milkshake and Beer battered onion Rings.  Onion Rings were good , could have improved on the portion though.  The burger is one of the best I've ever had. My 2 cents -- Add the Roasted Jalapeno to it . The milkshake is so good ! 2 of them a day is definitely worth 2000 calories though :)  Highly recommend !   -Pradeep

UL9BmXoTdXew9G0UGrQH-g.text: This place is SUPER OVER RATED.. Burgers were dry.. food was basic.. and the wait was even worse... only reason I am giving it 1 star is because of the good service we got from our waitress..

8ZyQmvNtXq_4fCB4lpbcBg.text: The line wasn't terrible and seemed to be moving so we hopped in to get  a taste of the Ramsay Burger.  The line DID move fast indeed, however once seated we were ready to order as we spent enough time in line reading the menu and so we ordered right away.  The basic burger for the wife and the crab and lobster for me, with parmesan truffle fries to share.  We waited, oh, AN HOUR to get hour food.  Seriously.  And we were not the exception - everywhere you looked in the restaurant everyone was getting antsy and asking around for their food, and the waitstaff were tactful in avoiding us.  I could just hear Gordon in my head screaming at the staff had he been there.  We were borderline walking out when it finally arrived.  The food was pretty amazing I will admit.  I didn't care for curry ketchup, regular would have done fine, but the burgers and fries the flavor was amazing.  Just wish I didn't have to scarf it down to make it to my next scheduled item.

PTDEmvNfO9xv8GkDvg5B9w.text: Most delicious burger I have had till date. They make a simple burger to perfection. Food is just so fresh and cooked to perfection. If you are looking for quality not quantity do visit Ramsey burger

YQiaKBH7D4WD3Q5K-ABVbA.text: My family and I traveled from Southern California to Las Vegas to try a Gordon Ramsay burger. I have to say that after waiting 45 minutes in line and another 45 minutes to get our order I was surprised how mediocre the food was. The burger was okay the fries were nothing special. I won't be back it was not worth the travel, time and wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AsuaBxkUXAxMf6DVlXCoGg.text: Was in Las Vegas for a week for business so I didn't have much time to enjoy the local restaurants, but there was one restaurant my GF and I could not be more anxious to try out. We both are huge chef Gordon Ramsey fans, we wanted to see if his meals were as good as they looked on TV! We showed up at about 3pm on Friday. It was a 30 minute wait in line just to see the hostess! Bring comfy shoes because there is nowhere to sit down unless you want to lose your place. I did see a couple come up in front of the line and retrieve a reservation they had made, so if that is a thing they allow I highly recommend doing it. There is a large fireplace with custom ironwork. It can be very warm standing in line so make sure you have layers that you can shed. But it was worth the wait. After getting through the line, we were seated immediately. I ordered a Backyard Burger with bacon and Dubliner cheese, I'm sure it tastes authentic with American Cheese but I wanted something a little more adventurous. I ordered an IPA cause you can't have a burger without a good beer. Their beer selection had a decent variety but not overwhelming. The food came fast but not rushed, I'm sure they take their time preparing. Burger was as good as I hoped it would be. I was surprised how high the burger was stacked, I generally like burgers I can fit in my mouth and not have to cut with a fork. And the spicy ketchup that came with the fries was interesting and good! Overall great experience. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Food was top notch.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Of course, Chef Gordon Ramsey 12 feet tall.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My backyard burger!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. from our table looking toward the kitchen

g-oiHqrphlZS8TehSgncSA.text: This place was simply amazing. Everything tasted fresh and amazing. Get the farmhouse burger, you will not be disappointed.

uaz5bAS9Xpy2Tw6BF2V_gA.text: I think 4 stars is about right. Way too long of a wait for these burgers. They were good, but too much hype for them. Definitely not worth the 90 mins wait time and then another 30 mins for them to cook it. I tried the hell kitchen burger and the truffle fries. Fries were amazing. Burger was decent.

AMH487pRDfFYyT-me_DaVg.text: Was dying to try this place out. After waiting almost an hour for a table, we finally got seated. The service was sooooooo slow. Literally took another hour to get 4 burgers and 2 fries out. I had the Triple cheeseburger and was very disappointed. Honestly I've had many burgers before and I can say shake shacks burger is better. Not only was it overpriced at $15 per burger, but it lacked the quality that I thought chef Ramsey would have for his food. Would not return!!

VxrxlJXxw_Es0h636Ki75Q.text: Easily one of the best burgers I've had anywhere. Go for the Hells Kitchen burger you can't miss. Fries are delish too. Weekend evenings can get busy, go for lunch to avoid a wait.

s3nqCfrRmH2OIkHkMAMNAQ.text: I have eaten at a lot of really good restaurants but this by far has the best burger I have ever had. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger and my  Girlfriend got the blu burger and they were both amazing.

PozFXV0RwosNWXpFA6G0Ig.text: Worth the Gordon Ramsay tax and the wait. Great quality ingredients, excellent flavors and service.  Maybe skip desert...

xwtuD86Sj0cK7KTUCuzg4g.text: I have had a lot of burgers in many places, but this was hands down the best burger I've had to date.  I ordered the Crown Burger, and asked for the chef's recommendation on cook level, which the waiter informed me was medium rare...soooo glad I asked!  The burger was so flavorful and juicy.  I have never used this term on a burger before, and didn't think it was possible, but the meat seemed to melt in my mouth!  Everything on the burger worked well together, the seasoning on the bun ('everything' seasoning maybe?) had a little saltiness and a bit of crunch to the soft bread, the herb aioli was delicious, the arugula was a perfect leafy green to the burg, the ONLY thing I might have changed is to have a slightly heartier slice of the mimolette cheese on the meat.  Also had the truffle fries which were amazing good -- they came out nice and hot and the truffle was not overpowering.  My mouth is watering just thinking about it...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown Burger, Medium Rare (Chef&#39;s recommendation) -- sooo good!

swkKtOAT4xyhRGEt2yr74w.text: The atmosphere was good.  The hummus and onion as starters were tasty.  Ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, not bad but our foursome agrees that Wahlburgers is hands the winner.  Overall, the food was overly salty but above average burger food.  The wait staff were really good! Winner for the waitstaff

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Finishing up...

7-Mlk3a47CFItyxWplq2pA.text: Love this place! The service was amazing, & the food was delicious. We had a terrible experience at a different restaurant where we ended up leaving hungry. Came into this one and told them about our cruddy night. And they turned our night completely around with the service and the food. I'm vegetarian so it's hard to find a good veggie burger but this place has delicious vegetarian options! Cooked perfectly with flavors I never even thought to put together. Can't wait to go back!

2dcw5jyDt-3L22P-BYh18w.text: I'll be positive as this was not a positive experience. But, a lot of it was the service, not really the food.  Long line - go hit a slot machine first for your drink to stand in line.  35 minute minimum wait Sat at bar. Bartender w no personality. Never seen this in Vegas before. I asked if he had an eta and he said on what? Lol. My food bud. He said 35 minutes. I said well we are at 34 minutes. Thx for the notice.  Don't know if I ever got asked for another beer or refill. It's cool. I'm at a bar at a restaurant I'm Vegas. Lol. Burger was ok. I make a good burger, wanted excellent !

SLwXaBwGgll6M1_zsukRiA.text: I was told the wait was 30 mins to get in but the line moved quickly. Once we ordered I did feel like the food took awhile to get out but the burger and wings were definitely worth the wait.

In2kMPhS7xOnDDQxYfcx1Q.text: Sucks balls. They good isn't as great as you think it would be. Service is horrible don't recommend

povKKO0B-RUUryJ931Colw.text: Never fails. It's my second time here in Gordon Ramsay Burger and every order always tastes good. The first time I was here, we ordered the ahi sliders and the foie burger. The best we've ever tasted! I'm not a burger eater but I ate the whole burger. The second time we ordered Hell's kitchen burger and the lobster and shrimp burger and they both taste so good! A must when in Vegas.

2dti9yCrsRWs07cQ4e06yg.text: I have been here a number of times, and each time something has either gone wrong or gone missing. I don't know why I keep coming back. Last night we ordered the Backyard Burger with no cheese; they put cheese on it. It took 40 minutes to get 2 burgers. The bartender (served at the bar) didn't put in the order for sweet potato fries. We just let it go because it wasn't worth the wait or fight. We opted to eat at the bar because there was virtually no wait, and now I know why. Be prepared for fast drinks, but noisy and inconsiderate wait staff collecting their tips from the bartender's POS. They bumped into us jockeying for position to get their cash, threw trash over the counter, and left a mess next to us. They did this with no qualms, which tells me this is regular behavior at a top chef's establishment. People will eat here regardless because it's Ramsay's place, but perhaps Ramsay may want to pay more attention to the staff that represents his name. As for the food, it is good, but worth a 40 minute wait? Not so much.

xF5wpQAOIMsB3PMJw4WB2w.text: It wasnt the best burger for that price but a nice experience.  We got there @ exact 12pm on Thursday got seated immediately. But by the time we finished, there was a short line.  We ordered 1 helllkitchen burger and 1 lobster&shrimp burger, 1 truffle parmesan fries and 1 hellfire chicken wings with blue cheese. Ah an 1 cocktail (cant recall the name) The burgers are huge!! Luckily we were really hungry that we can finish all.  Chicken wings was what I was craving for. Im not a big fan of blue cheese but it was a good combination with the wings.  I would say the lobster burger was slightly better. The beef burger was well cook to what I ordered(medium well)  Truffle fries were a bit too hard (i think they were coated with corn starch). Service was Ok as it was not too busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hellkitchen burger (closeup) and lobster burger

PfZqIV6ZPTc4l_DiSOnW-Q.text: We went as part of our typical LB visit. We used our Total Rewards to get to the front of the line. Unfortunately like so many LV restaurants they do not offer Coca-Cola. The best burger your taste buds will get. Service is awesome. Make sure that if you are a Platinum or more member it will get you to the front of the line. Great service.

pjChRmd4nQ5hkDK8GlBrag.text: You might have to wait to get a table, but overall the  experience was very good. A good selection of very flavorful burgers, but I was not a big fan of the truffle fries. Everything else including the service was top notch!

fhAD5V_kToTcgrcEY9IWfQ.text: Grab an Uber and go to In n Out... Go anywhere but here. Most disappointing were the fries. The sweet potato fries were soggy and barely edible, so we ordered the regular ones (for $9) hoping for nice, thick cut fries and classic ketchup. Gordon - WHAT HAVE YOU DONE TO THE KETCHUP?! Heinz 57 is beautiful and perfect the way it is... Yours is a disaster. This meal wouldn't even be passable if I were wasted.

OHmUuL7T4aphvXoDhaS7mg.text: Let me start by saying I really love my burgers and walked in with the expectation that this could be an overrated celebrity restaurant with a huge line up for a disappointment and yes the line up is quite long !!! My first reaction when I saw the menue was that it was actually reasonably priced and there was a lot of original burgers with high end ingredients!  I decided to go for the forest burger as I like my classic bacon cheeseburger but this one had tremor cheese, forest mushrooms and duck bacon !  When it came out the burger looked gorgeous and the onion rings were huuuuge haven't ever seen them that size and thankfully we were sharing them!  So the burger itself did feel like it was mass produced but one of the best tasting one I have ever eaten and as for the onion rings very crispy but more then 3 would probably blow up my stomach so definitely a good dish to share. I really have to say that for lunch it's the perfect experience in Vegas! Casual, good value and fun !

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YeeX2HYO8TUhfk24f_KWLg.text: Where do I start??? I'm not a typical burger and fries gal, but believe in giving things a fair chance. I do have to admit, I did have high expectations of a "Gordon Ramsey" restaurant.  Everything from service to quality was absolutely unenjoyable.   Small patties are hidden under an oversized bun. I expected a nice handmade patty, plump, and juicy, but the patties were undersized and all perfectly shaped and well-pressed under the flame. I ventured to order a "special" burger: lobster and shrimp... boy-o-boy was that a bad idea. The patty tasted like a rubber tire! I took a couple of bites just to make sure it wasn't me and tossed in the napkin. It ruined my appetite.  Quite some time after I'd tossed in the napkin, a manager stopped by to ask how our meal was. I commented on the poor quality and preparation of the lobster and shrimp burger. He did apologize and asked why I didn't let them know, as they could have made me another, but when I said I wouldn't want to try it again he said he'd let the kitchen know and simply moved on.   The sides were just as disappointing. The sweet potato fries were soggy, barely warm and covered in powdered sugar. They were served with a sweet opaque sauce they called a spicy aioli, but there was absolutely nothing spicy about it... it tasted like desert.   I'd put burgers, sandwiches and fries at this establishment in the same class as Red Robin, Johnny Rockets, Applebee's, etc.   If you want a good meal, go somewhere else.

gykc7OZhxepALdpnHlE-sA.text: Went here to try the Impossible Burger.  I had the Hell's Kitchen burger with the Impossible burger patty cooked medium.  Was amazing.  The presentation, the way the burger was prepared, everything.  The staff were also super nice and knowledgeable about the Impossible Burger.  I was so impressed and have not stopped talking about the burger and showing people photos of it for the month it has been since I had it.

Se7avS2ig9l1zkG_-P3B8w.text: My husband really wanted to try this place while we were in Vegas. We stood in line for almost an hour when the hostess said it would be about a 30 minute wait. Sure I can get on board with the wait in line.  Once we were seated we placed our order. After another hour finally the food shows up. Well at least half the order did.  The guy who brought our food sat down the burger and fries and nothing for me. He said "anything else"? Yes my food please. This is all the order that was placed. He went over to our server and she came over and said.. I don't know what happened I guess your food didn't register.  What can I do she says, give me 2 minutes. Really we wait for an hour and then you tell me you can have my food in two in minutes? NO. I was done. The fries we cold but my husband did enjoy his burger. The bill came. We are so sorry so we took the fries off the bill.  No tip for her.

rgEpsAQIFWZe8mNDUnvj3w.text: Food was dry and over cooked, Gordon needs to jerk a knot in their tails. For the price we paid, and his name on the establishment, I expected better.

1204uf1twpxAeucuA1qYKw.text: This place is all hype! My wife had the $26 lobster and shrimp burger, I had a blue cheese burger, honestly I've had better burgers at super duper. I wouldn't waste my time going here again, we should have eaten at Pink's

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iKZZ_D7KVna1LB0sCvV6HQ.text: I was really skeptical of this place at first because usually these types of places don't live up to the hype. I was pleasantly surprised. The burger was cooked to perfection and the parmesan fries were delicious and crispy. Service was a bit off, but that was no big deal. Was it the best burger I've ever had? No. Would I eat here again? Yes. It's also pretty conveniently located on the Strip.

PoTHlllNiKc-4HzP8ubIIA.text: We walked in at 10pm on a Tuesday. Straight to a table and had really good burger. Straightforward. That's what they're going for and they do it well. I had the crown burger (well done) and it was immaculate. I always order my burgers well done. I am gonna try a different temperature the next time I'm there though. The food is slightly on the pricey side but it's the best I've eaten on the strip. They could throw in regular fries though. Had to purchase the sides. Everything was done to perfection, which is what you expect from GR's place.

bQ9vLXAKDyPG1d_LuCEqnQ.text: Dang, how have I not written a review for this amazing joint? I don't remember what I ate since the last time I was here was years ago, but the experience was so good that I still keep telling people it's the joint to go for a delicious burger that won't break the bank! Anyway, just happy to drop a 4-star review to this tasty joint!

xu_fOpTz5UcgfXPNkJrGbg.text: A 90 minute disappointment   Wait time 30 mins  Took 30 mins to bring the table food  The server brought me the wrong burger and had to wait another 30 mins for my burger I ordered. Only to get my burger by the time the rest of my table was finished eating. This probably doesn't happen often but this was by far the worst experience I've had at a restaurant in vegas.

dD1vOyycx_GMEr9XzW3Q-A.text: I am a cheeseburger connoisseur and Gordon Ramsay Burger IS THE (BOMB EMOJI) !!! Atmosphere is great, service was excellent, price point was actuarare. The quality and taste of everything from my Bloody Mary to the America Burger was D E L I C I O U S!!

F-9Q1SsnLda70FO6dvfToQ.text: Upon our arrival we glanced inside and noted many available tables. There was a long line outside but thought they simply needed to get people seated so we jumped in line.  The reality was that they were saving the tables for groups of four and would not seat a party of two. Everyone in the line was in groups of two. I understand they are there to make money. And filling each chair means money. We decided to wait it out and while waiting reviewed the menu online. 35 minutes later we were seated. 12 minutes after being seated, our waiter stopped by to introduce himself. He wanted to excuse himself to go get our water but we asked if he could take our order now. He seemed bothered but obliged us and took our order for a burger and fries (x2). I set my timer again. While waiting, the couple next to us received their order. I commented "I hope it is worth the wait". They replied that they had waited over an hour for their food to arrive. They finished eating while we waited. I asked "so was it worth the wait"? They replied F. NO! It was just an expensive burger and fries! From the time we placed our order until the burger and fries were on our table we waited 72 minutes. Yes, an hour and 12 minutes.  No burger and fries is worth waiting a total of two hours for. To summarize the food I would have to say it is way over hyped and fails to deliver anything more than a burger and fries. And the service was off the low end of the charts.  As we walked out there was still a long line of groups of two and the same tables for groups of four were still unoccupied. What a poorly managed business.  Not only will I never go back to a Gordon Ramsay's burger restaurant. But I will never support anything with his name on it. Further, I will make sure anyone I care about knows of my experience and is forewarned.

MRIe09NT1gNSyXZ0PnexXg.text: We were excited to go here on our first trip to Vegas in over 10 years but little did we know we should have passed on this place. We waited 1 hour to be seated and 1 hour for our food.  Service was terrible, the waiters never asked us how our food was or even refilled our drinks. The 17.00 burger was good but the bun was very greasy. At the end of our meal, we waited and waited for our waiter to bring our check.  Then we had to walk up to the register to pay because the guy never came back to pick up our check and payment. You'd think for a Gordon Ramsay restaurant at their high prices would have extraordinary service. But unfortunately Denny's would have been a better experience! Very disappointed!!

FGlEKFa30cA2_PGwy1Mtzw.text: Good food and service, not too long a wait considering the location.  I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger, awesome patty, full of flavor and not dry. The problem came in the form of a 1/4 of an avocado that was not sliced and just plopped atop the burger. My wife had the back yard burger with slices of tomato over 3/4" thick. Service and food otherwise were great.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger

zr06oz0d97nT5dHslteDnw.text: Fantastic food and best service for casual food in America. Plaud to their staffs! Well done!

xQ_1HURBZNaQAz8RrPcSVQ.text: My wife and I went to Gordon Ramsey Steak a few nights ago and it was absolutely delicious. Probably the best steak I've ever had. We decided to try Gordon Ramsey Burger and were not disappointed. The food was incredible and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. This is my first time to Vegas, but both of these places will be on my "must do" list if I make it back.

CdPpPqfKoU9vIkMvJIDvww.text: I'm from Las Angeles. We got some of the worlds beat burger joints and food trucks. I would buy this again for my Dog. But its way down on the good burger list. I would compare it to the maybe IM burger just triple the price. Oh and did I mention they serve you TAP water straight from the tap? I could teach this guy how to make a better burger lol

8JzOF3Z_gLXcfWsq0Asn2A.text: OH boy can you say that this place is the BOMB! Since I have been to Gordon's Steak House I vowed on my next visit to Vegas that I would come to this place. First and foremost I want to thank the new GM Laurence from Gordon't Steak House for arranging a table for my family and I will forever be grateful for it was perfect.  Gordon Ramsay Burger is located in Planet Hollywood which is right next to Paris. This location is on a first come first serve bases. When we went to the counter to announce our arrival we were greeted with a very welcoming smile and they informed us that they were expecting us and they were preparing our table. As  we awaited the few minutes for them to finish preparing our table we had a chance to review the menu which was in Gordon's style; simple and elegant.   In the front of the restaurant there was a bar with several TV's for watching current sporting events for those who wanted to enjoy some appetizers with their drinks. As we were brought to our table we were seated in a lovely blue colored booth with the traditional Ramsay white table setting. My brother was amazed by the weight of the cutlery, which I love a nice balanced fork and knife. Our waiter Jared was just amazing, he answered some of questions about the various types of hamburger's that were offered on the menu. Jared also informed us that they had a special F Word burger that was not on the menu and of course you knew I was going to have exactly that. I also informed Jared of my allergies to shellfish and nuts, which he had made a special note so that the staff would be informed to use equipment that were not used with any products that could cause an allergic reaction.   Some the of things we ordered along with our main dishes was a delicious Cesar salad with green apple slices minus the kale, I am not a kale fan. We also ordered regular fries and the truffle fries with parmesan cheese. The funny thing is that the pictures makes these fries look small but they are actually fairly big and even with 3 of us we could not finish all the fries. The nice served with different sauces too and came out hot and crispy golden.  The ambiance of the restaurant is very relaxing and it has this wonderful wavy fire wall display. The temperature in the restaurant was perfect, yes I am one of those people that get cold easy lol so things like this are very important to me. Jared was very attentive and informed us that our special burgers will take about 20 minutes and I do appreciate that he served all our burgers along with the fries at the same time and they were all nice and hot. We were able to enjoy our dinner and Jared was very attentive by removing dishes that were not needed anymore and keeping our drinks constantly filled. If we were not so stuffed we would have ordered one of their delicious desserts but again the 3 of us shared a salad and fries and we all had our own individual burgers and we were stuffed.   I wish I could describe how delicious this burger was but I have to let the picture speak for itself.  I know that there is no doubt that I will come back here again and I would hope they still offered the F Word burger. If you have a list of things to do in Vegas then put this on your list for you will not be disappointed. Everything is well thought out and you may think 23.00 for a burger? Well it is one of the best damm hamburgers you will ever have I can promise you that.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. GM Laurence of Gordon&#39;s Ramsay Steak House. Thank you for our reservations at Gordon&#39;s Hamburgers
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Timmy and brother David and me at Gordon&#39;s Burger.

i4j0xfCeLuY_U7upX56YrA.text: We really enjoyed the burgers here, even the kids liked the specialty burgers. The service was good and quick. The prices are high but that's to be expected when the place says Gordon Ramsey and it's on the strip. The wait was long so plan ahead for that at lunchtime.

cxtf2pJI2p_N5qimA6V7_A.text: Best Burger on the stripe!!! I love coming here, sometimes there is a wait but it is totally  worth it. The nachos are to die for!!1

7iwKsHsxP0DFCnQd58I9-Q.text: I'm in love with this place! The burgers are juicy, I recommend getting the truffle fries and don't forget the salads! Everything on the menu is to die for.   If you're a Vegas tourist, expect a lot of walking just to find this place - deep inside the Planet Hollywood (PH) casino. I'm not a fan of PH at all. I think it's a dump - one of the dirtiest places on the Vegas strip. (No wonder it's the center for drug dealers and strip scammers.) That's the biggest disadvantage I think this wonderful burger restaurant has.   Otherwise, just make sure you arrive before 4p.m. on weekends to avoid long lines. In spite of its location, it's worth trying out at least once!

GnoTI20BQ2aUg3Ik34lQgA.text: I had the "Hell's Kitchen" burger and it was very very good. Although I ordered the burger a bit too done for me, it was still awesome.  I also ordered the truffle fries and they were good but truth be know, I'm not a steak fry type of guy; I prefer skinny fires.  The truffle aioli was fantastic!!

rhv3BiR2O5CvCdNP_y3NMA.text: First time here and got seated under 10'. The restaurant has an american burger place style to it yet still very fancy in its own way. Huge poster of Gordon Ramsay hanging on the wall yet he's rarely at Vegas. They also sell Gordon Ramsay gifts such as trophy, shirt, apron, etc for fans. Our waiter was very quick and nice. For first timer we went with Hell Kitchen Burger and Hog Burger which is their specialty. Both tasted very delicious, meat was cooked perfectly, my Hell Kitchen burger was more on the spicy side due to the added jalapenos. My husband's Hog Burger tasted even better, meat was exactly medium rare as he ordered and yet the flavor was there, seasoned really well, don't know why some reviews here said it's bland, the patty for Hog Burger was wrapped in bacon so it was super juicy and has lots of flavors. My patty for Hell Kitchen Burger was cooked medium well per my request and got the char flavor to it yet still juicy at the same time. Their buns was grilled nicely, has a very shiny color and taste so really good and slightly crispy. Overall, the burgers totally worth the money, visually and taste-wise.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell Kitchen&#39;s burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog Burger

o6PAekvS0DF_K0s16TlJHQ.text: Situated at Planet Hollywood the place is always packed! Got seated 5 mins before closinG since i had to line up for 30 mins.   Good beer selection from crafts to classics. I opted for a hoppie beer 9.% but it didnt seem that strong so i wonder if got the right one. The hops were nothing out of the ordinary for IPAs   Had the farmers burger and hells kitchen burger both were really good. The hells kitchen burger has jalapeno aioli and roasted jalapeno, fresh avocado which complimented the burger alot, and some good cheese. That burger was a killer. The farmers burger was good too, with an over easy egg and duck bacon, which tasted like regular bacon to me.  Service was weak, since i guess its closing time.

C0kr3CcjssE4uuOhSD7vDQ.text: The burgers themselves were good. We had the farmhouse burger, forest burger (mushrooms), and hell's kitchen burger. Personally, I thought the Hell's Kitchen was the best because the jalapenos gave a nice subtle kick to the overall sort of oily and overbearing burger. It also wasn't really spicy which is good because I can't do spicy. They were gourmet style with steak patties, so they asked us how we wanted them, but I would say they burgers didn't come out exactly the way we ordered them (though that wasn't too big of a deal). Biggest problem was the wait. It actually didn't take too long to get into the restaurant (we had a party of five and so we skipped the line and was in the queue) ~20 min, but when they called us up, we had to wait another 15-20 minutes in front of the restaurant for the table to "be cleaned". I don't know why they would call us up telling us our table was ready when it wasn't. Also, once seated and after we ordered, it took forever for the burgers to come out. We ordered onion rings (good, not spectacular) which came with two sauces (one white and one red, something like tartar and bbq) which came out relatively quickly, but the burgers took another good 40 minutes.  Overall, I don't think it's worth the wait. The burgers or onion rings weren't spectacular in taste. They were good, and I'm glad to try them once, but I don't think I would make the effort to go back again.

tQklI3umEXacjq7Y70wZTQ.text: We eat here every time we're in Vegas.  My husband loves the burgers.  Unfortunately, when we were there in February, 2019, according to our waitress, they had made some changes to the menu, including adding onions to the hot dogs (there were no onions in the past, I have ordered them several times).  I don't eat onions.  I requested the onions be removed and the waitress stated "since they have made changes to the menu, the "chef" will not make any changes (including removing ONE ingredient).  In my experience, onion is one ingredient that can still be tasted after removal.  I could not believe my ears.  Even after requesting again, she refused.  Even though my husband is a huge fan of this place, I will think twice before eating here again.  One improvement from our last trip, I was glad the female staff no longer wear incredibly short skirts anymore.

rY6yNVeFlni-wd-WqtMU5Q.text: Amazing burger and fries!!! Salad one of my dining partners had was "eh" but it's a burger joint! Seriously one of the best burgers I've had. My husband wanted a thicker burger but I was super happy with my burger and fries. I'd definitely go again!

yzKVBAWJdl_9JJpJmNsBvw.text: This place is a great find. Sit at the counter in front of the kitchen to see how hard the cooks work and how much fun all the servers have. The food is amazing, one of the best burgers I've had in a while. Can't wait to come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KXlRfI64--HaKN0y8V1X_A.text: The Hell's Kitchen burger with the Impossible Burger (vegetarian) patty was The Best Burger I've Ever Had, including all the meaty burgers I ate during my 20+ carnivore years. The roasted jalapeno made me want to return home to Texas and add these to everything: wheat roast sandwiches, cream of mushroom soup, vinaigrette.  My biggest fear is being hungry because when that happens, I either turn into a beast, feel faint, or both. While the burger didn't look too substantial, it ended up being the perfect amount - paired with the plain fries - to feel satisfied, but not overstuffed.   As others have mentioned, the fries were terrible: lukewarm, dry, dense, grainy. Oh well, it's not called Gordon Ramsey Fries.I still ate them, because: fries. Next time, I'll try the onion rings.   The burger was such a delicious experience and the service was exceptionally timed and friendly. I can't wait to return.

oGdKCkfLlXKb1I4PD3gWlg.text: A must stop visit if you're a fan of Gordon Ramsey's work. That man knows how to slice and dice so lets see what his creation tastes like.   So glad that there wasn't a line or wait when we had came here. We get promptly greeted by the host and seated within minutes upon check in. The server came out to introduce himself and took our beverages and order. It was my friends and I first time eating here so the waiter was extremely helpful on pointing out which one to try. He suggested the Hell's kitchen Burger for me so I took his suggestion.  The restaurant was semi busy during the lunch rush so the food came out in a fairly decent time. Our server was amazing. He catered to our every needs so the customer service here is superb.  As I bit into the burger, I could immediately taste the seasoned, savory, juicy burger going down my esophagus. I felt the heat from the grilled jalapenos and jalapenos aioli spread swirling on my tongue. The egg yolk was gushing down the burger which gave it a nice syrupy coating to the sandwich. The cheese also gave it that sharp taste and creamy texture. There was so many flavors and texture happening all at once. The sesame buns was a great choice of bread. A solid burger if you were to ask me! Sweet potato fries were good as well but I could care less about it.   The ice cream smoothie dessert was great itself.  Nothing special but a delicious treat to eat none the less. Overall, it was an great dining experience for a first timer. And yes I would recommend it to a friend!

cGjtWR66Tlvvscqpj4AQmQ.text: Well we are here in Vegas school shopping . Our hotel gave us dinner credits. So we decided to try something new and it was good the only down fall is that where they sat us was close to the slot machines so all I smelled was cigarette smoke and so I thought they should put up higher glass. But the waiter he was good and the food was very good.  Would we eat here again yes may even try the  locations he has.   My kids who are picky even found food to eat.

IcQ7sI_qUSVSTfxakl1Rlg.text: Unfortunately... we were excited to eat here. Big fans of Mr Ramsay. Waited in line, but we figured the finish line would be worth it.. Pleasant staff! Ambience typical of an upscale burger place. The waitress had told us that Gordon Ramsay was supposed to be coming  to visit the next day - pretty cool! We both ordered the specialty Fish and Chips Burger and regular fries to share. They came fairly quickly and looked amazing... However- my sandwich had a very distinct odor and taste of AMMONIA?! I struggled through the first half and kept wondering if I was confusing the sauce, something else.. knowing that vinegar has an acidic taste ( I love malt vinegar on my fish and chips!) and this smelled and tasted like... ugh -  like Mr Clean! I normally don't make a fuss about food, but quietly queried my husband to see if he was picking up on the same flavor profile...? And yes- he did too- so we both were left with half eaten sandwiches. To boot- the fries were only barely warm as well. The waitress came by at that moment and the look on our faces prompted her to ask if everything was ok... we normally don't make a fuss and implored the waitress to not do anything, comp, etc... but to just inform the manager that something was wrong? I invited her to even smell my sandwich and she declined. We laughed and said that we were pretty sure that GR wouldn't want his fish sandwiches smelling/tasting like ammonia? She came back with the check and told us that the manager had never heard that comment or complaint before.... uh- end of story. So, we paid and left. Likely never to return. When we got back to our hotel we started googling fish and ammonia smell... and apparently it is a smell associated with old/decomposing fish!!?? Ugh- I'm writing this and hoping we won't get sick tonight. Best of luck to others... and I hope Mr. Ramsay takes this seriously. We are pretty bummed at the experience. Am a bit leary now of eating at his more upscale restaurants?

6_IzJvoaOqXMntJylH3RlQ.text: Food: 4/5 Service: 3/5 Cleanliness: 4/5 Decor & Style: 4/5  The classic burger was tasty but it didn't stand out to me probably because I had it built up in my head that it would be a lot better. With that being said I really enjoyed it and will definitely come back to try a different burger, maybe....sometimes the line here is so long and with limited time in Vegas I don't want to wait that long and will end-up eating somewhere with less a line.

FQMA4WyeOX0HsznmnNGAoA.text: When in Vegas you HAVE to stop by the Gordon Ramsay Burger, there may be a line but well worth the wait.  We were able to get a table at the bar, the staff is amazingly well trained!  We started with two cocktails that tasted similar to the "audios".  We also ordered two of the Ultimate cheeseburger-aged provolone, dubliner, and boursin.  These burgers were amazing!  Full of flavor, perfect blend of cheese and very juicy!  And to top it all off!!!  We saw Gordon Ramsay!!!  It certainly made my day!

mqmDOygRWJd_5wNYzXNBUA.text: Okay, so I have seen Gordon Ramsay's TV show Hells Kitchen, so I got my hopes up that I would be getting the best burger of my life.   Our bartenders name  who's name i forgot was awesome, and polite. We sat at the bar.   We ordered the bleu cheese wings and they were amazing! The sauce and cheese was the perfect combo. I did order ranch and it was super thick and didn't taste good at all   When we ordered our burgers we were informed that it would take about 30 minutes, I think they actually got to us faster.   The taste was okay, and mediocre. The meat had no flavor at all, honestly I think Burger King has a better flavor. The presentation was okay, but over REALLY REALLY underwhelmed with the burger itself. The fries were okay too, but just okay.   Not a place that I'd go back to that's for sure. The bill was over $80 for one drink 2 burgers with 1 order of fries and an appetizer

1tRSnrzG5oRyaCy1lvScPQ.text: The food is amazing and bursting with flavor! The sangria was the most refreshing drink I've ever had! The service was really lacking here. No one seems to be interested in working here.  Make sure you eat here!!!

r_XXEfNE8rfAVEvXPF2QNQ.text: We had the pleasure of dining at this particular Gordon Ramsay Burger location inside Planet Hollywood, and it was FABULOUS!!!!! The hostesses Jasmine and Jessica were so friendly and accommodating even though the line was rather long, it moved quickly and since we were only 2 it wasn't that long before we were seated. I had read on a previous Yelp Review mostly bad things about the restaurant, the waiters, and the hostesses and I can tell you totally wrong.   We were seated and our waiter ADAM who was terrific, explained a few of the burgers to us since this was our first time there. We ordered "The Backyard" and the "Stout Burger" and both were absolutely delicious!.    We waited a little while, not too long considering the restaurant was completely filled.  The Burgers were delicious!   Also being it was my son's birthday our waiter took it upon himself to bring a little dessert with a candle in it.  I thought that was really special.   So all I can say is the hostesses Jasmine and Jessica are wonderful, and ADAM our waiter was the BEST!... There is nothing negative to write.  This is a great eating establishment with good food, a great staff  and wonderful service.  Will return...........

KvqZaM11BYe3vM5ArSvUPw.text: Service was great. The decor/ vibe was cool. The Hell's Kitchen burger was good, unique flavors but the just fries with the two sauces were awesome.  The prices are a bit steep.

XX-ghb6HFPCeiUE0PJ62aw.text: Arrived 4 the of July day we sat at the counter. Great customer service. We ordered chicken wings, hamburger, chicken sandwich fries and onion rings. The meat is so lite and tasty. I was in shock I was expecting salt and pepper. No way the food had so much flavor. To Chef Ramsey it totally rocked. Will definitely go again whenever were visiting Vegas.

isj1XZaCn353EjWIsi440w.text: Ummm YES Please!! First time here and it did not disappoint. I don't know why but I've been reluctant to try this place and I'm GLAD I finally did!!!  BURGERS,  I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger, that had avocado and poblano peppers. I love spicy food and let me tell you the pepper in this was just that!  I was actually surprised how spicy it was but it hit the spot for me. Very juicy and good balance of bun, meat and accompaniments. My hubby got the Lobster and shrimp burger  this was probably my favorite of the two!!! It was lightly panko breaded with chunky chops of lobster and shrimp patty. There was definitely more meat than bread.  It was sooo juicy and topped with pickled vegetables and aioli that really have the whole burger that flavor pop in your mouth!! Thinking about makes my mouth water.   FRIES,  we had parmesan fries and onion rings that they serve with cheesy ranch dip and chipotle ketchup. These were both very good,  maybe a little parmesan overload, but if you like that,  then definitely get them both. They were a bit too heavy and rich for me so we couldn't finish either.  Next time I will get 1 order to share. But all in all they were great!  DRINKS,  I had sangria which definitely did the job!   Good serving size and right amount of strength,  not watered down like most places.   Great place to go for date night, with  friends or just by yourself at the bar! Service was quick and friendly,  we had Andre who sad very knowledgeable of the menu and made some great suggestions!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Burger,  spicy and just right!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and shrimp burger!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan onion rings and fries.

yb-CAHZcnMfMuFebJaAajQ.text: It's good but is it worth the wait? I'd give this place 3.5 stars. The restaurant is eye catching, it has flames to draw you in. Oh and don't forget the star power name attached to the place. But once you get inside, it kinda feels like an upscale diner.   It has a mix of counter, low and high table seating which seems plenty but the place has built quite the reputation and can certainly draw a crowd. If you don't mind the wait the food is pretty good. They take your favorite burgers and fries and kick it up a notch. I had the anniversary burger and truffle fries. The burger is made in limited amounts so ask ahead to see if they have any. The gourmet beef patties are cooked over an open flame using prime cuts of meat. And of course the fries are generously coated with a taste of rich truffles.  If the line is short I'll probably pop in again.

Efoz23B6tZC8VogfuzRzWQ.text: Popped in for dinner for two..the wait was  about 30min...not too bad. Got seated had ro wait a little for the waiter, but from that point forward he was on.  The Burgers  My wife had the Farmhouse I think it was called. That isht was great. Cooked to perfection was the burger & over easy egg.  I had the Forest and did not like it. It had a weird taste...maybe the duck bacon? I eat duck so I assumed it would be ALL good, but not so much for me. That is not to say it wasn't cooked perfectly because it was. Just didn't like it.  I told my waiter he apologized like he was wrong and offered me another burger in it's place. Well by this time wifey is done & we have to go see the fountain show. So I decline the replacement beccause we are leaving. The waiter assured me it would be quick so of course I got the Farmhouse cause it was effin great. He did not exaggerate the burger was packed to go before my visa came back.

jUoiaUxD2HoTS9h4VCTTtA.text: The line was long and they said the wait time was about 40 minutes; however we really only waited about 20. Our waiter was a little slow so it made the wait seem longer. I enjoyed my burger, cooked how I asked with blue cheese and bacon. I also thought the French fries were pretty tasty!

rROARNSXsfBhiV32caPUGQ.text: After seeing Gordon Ramsay's Burger location at our hotel Planet Hollywood I told my wife we had to try this out before we left. My wife and I love his shows and thought we would love to try his burger. We traveled with our family and we were a party of 6. We arrived around 12:30 for lunch and we were told it would be an hour. We asked if it was possible to have 3 tables of 2 near each other so that we wouldn't have to wait as long since we saw plenty of empty tables available specially directly behind the hostess's desk. The answer we were given was no that would not be possible. After talking a while longer they agreed to sit us in 3 separate tables. They proceed to sit us in separate sections of the restaurant. I really didn't understand why it was so difficult to just listen to the customers request instead of upsetting them for no apparent reason. My wife asked for the manager Joe. Which after listening to our request stated that unfortunately that was the policy of the restaurant and did nothing to accommodate us. Sad when "policies" supersede customer requests. Ultimately the waitresses were the only ones that had any customer skills and assisted us . The food came out and it was delicious although my family did not agree with me I believe it was more due to being upset with the service we had initially received.  Service is key to any business and if Ramsay's name is on it the expectation was so much more than we received. I hope this is not the norm and they figure out that the customers needs and wants come before any known policy which ultimately doesn't make sense.  All that said best wishes to Gordon Ramsay his success is due to his achievements in the kitchen which is well earned.

iaWGOPjSOem7CkXB62RDLA.text: For late-night dinner I tried the beer-battered onion rings ($9), burnt ends poutine ($14), truffle parmesan fries ($12), and the pork chop and applesauce burger ($16).  The onion rings seemed well-battered. The batter did not overwhelm with oil and possessed a fluffy texture.  The burnt ends poutine seemed at times over- and under-garnished. The burnt ends, in their limited quantity and size, made no apparent change in flavor profile. The shredded carrots' hard texture did not juxtapose well with the rest of the dish; future iterations should omit the carrots. The cheddar cheese curds also arrived in such limited quantities that they made no significant effect. The only redeemable element of the poutine, the black pepper gravy, had a lot of black pepper but needed a thicker consistency.  The truffle parmesan fries seemed satisfactory.  The pork chop applesauce burger contained a pork patty, dubliner cheese, branston pickles, apple braised pork shank, and cabbage-apple slaw. While these items individually sound delicious, their combination seemed underwhelming. The base pork patty seemed subdued in flavor, and the apple braising dominated the palate, relegating the other flavors to afterthoughts.  With the majority of my meal (burger + 1 appetizer) resulting in mediocrity, I will pass on future opportunities at this establishment.

-t_U5eAlIlQ4DzY4c4na-w.text: So, don't get fooled by a name, this is not the best Gordon Ramsay's restaurant, we ordered the Duck Poppers to start, they were actually pretty good, the Chipotle Ranch sauce to dip them in was a lot better than just Chipotle Ranch, we also got the "Crispy Cherry Pepper Chicken" burger it was a little dry and honestly just ok, on the other hand the "Hell's Kitchen" burger was moist and delicious, not the best burger I had but also not the worst, if the wait was not over 30 min on a standing line, I would be back...

jb-sNbDZJtVYAcQktvcvRw.text: Had the turduckin burger n truffle fries. Great flavor on both but had the worst heartburn afterwards.

pAnvz23ZL3siCE14G7YhVA.text: EXPECT A LONG WAIT!  We went there on a weekday around 4:30. The wait line was probably like 20-30 people deep. Being that I'm Caesar's Diamond member, we had priority seating.  Even with that, our wait time was 28 minutes which it's not too bad considering the popularity of the restaurant.  The three hostesses were very overwhelmed and not friendly at all. Once seated it took 15 minutes to take our order and 40 minutes to be served burgers, fries and beer.  The restaurant is too small for the high demand. That was the downside.  The upside is that the food was incredibly delicious. It was one of the best burger I've ever had. We got all three types of fries that they offered and onion rings which by the way, were amazing.  The servers were friendly and helpful. It is definitely something to experience when visiting Las Vegas (Planet Hollywood)

n8yingx3eZsqGsRZLVQ9Iw.text: Quite possibly the best burgers I have had in my life. The hype is very real for this restaurant and the Gordon Ramsay name does not fail to deliver. I tried the lamb burger, curry burger, and creme brulee milkshake. The milkshake is delicious and is a wonderful dessert as well as accompanied with the burger. The burgers are both very succulent and filled with flavor. Will be coming back when in Vegas!

DupDimswrCyN4JMyEr633Q.text: Wonderful, taste delicious, service excellent, it's my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas

TFCXDNCAlGk59W-ZmLbuog.text: A delicious burger for everyone! Let me start by saying that I love anything Ramsay (TV shows, Restaurants, etc...). Upon arriving at this restaurant the look of the restaurant is very Casual chic. I love the wall of fire on the outside of this restaurant. The hostess greeted me warmly and since I was alone she asked if I wanted a table or sit at the counter facing the kitchen. I love being at the counter because you get to watch the action of the Kitchen and you have the captive audience of the staff that are back there. They have a selection of approx. 25 beers so they offer these shooter glasses of beer to taste a couple before choosing. Love it! I tried a IPA and a citrus beer to compare. I chose the Citrus Missy and it was amazing. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger (from a very good selection of different burgers) medium-rare with fries. The burger was cooked to perfection and the avocado added a nice texture to it. The fries however were a little stale (slightly warm but just tasted stale.). The service throughout was friendly and engaging. The Wait-staff seem like they really like their job. I asked about Gordon, if he ever came to the restaurant and the said he comes sometimes and is very nice and takes pics with the staff. Glad to hear he has a softer side. I would definitely return to try out other burgers. tripadvisor.ca/ShowUserR...

-cZDQGVAAHsb1w9X6m_MYg.text: The whole restaurant is really nice and there's so many pictures of Gordon Ramsay you would swear he is there plus you can buy Gordon souvenirs. It's nice that it's in Planet Hollywood as us right next to the strip. I had the bleu cheese burger it was good and almost $16.00 I can now say I ate there but to me a burger is a burger and it was an expensive Burger but the decor is awesome.

bWqwT1FTIS-rNwkuCkhExQ.text: It bums me out having to write this review because my expectations of this place were super high.   It was 10 min from the time that we got sat before our server came to introduce herself to us. She came over and asked if we were ready to order, my husband needed some more time, so she said she would come back. She could've easily taken our drink order but she never asked. When she came back, took our order, then at that time she asked us what we wanted to drink. It seemed odd due to the fact that everywhere we go, we get asked what we want to drink before anything else. Anywho, we never saw that server again, a younger gentleman came out with our appetizers and sat them down, it wasn't until shortly after that our drinks came out...   The food was okay. We ordered the Kettle Chip Nachos, it was a little disappointing with the small about of shredded short rib it had! I'm pretty sure I would've been able to count the shreds of beef on these chips. We ordered some fries for our 2 year old to eat and they were so hard and tasteless, she gave up after 2 bites and would shake her head no when we offered her some more. This little girl eats crayons and she refused to eat these fries.    Next up was our burgers. I ordered the Ultimate Cheeseburger, it come with different kinds of cheese and just the meat. My son ordered the Backyard burger, just a basic burger and my husband ordered the Hog Burger. These were actually pretty good. They aren't served with any sides so we ended up ordering some beer battered onion rings, but just like the drinks... these didn't come out until later, way later.   Basically, service needs to improve. All food should come out at once except for the appetizer, don't bring out the side to my burger when I'm half way thru with it, at that point don't being me anything at all. We found out that the server never came back to our table because she got sent home, there was no introduction to the person that was going to be taking over her section. Really? And on top of this bad service, I'll still expected to tip 18 %  I don't think we'd come back, we have reservations for Hell's Kitchen in a couple of weeks, hoping that it will be a much better experience.

iil9NH4t714J9nal51SLSg.text: We came here this past Thursday around 3. No line got seated right away. We ordered ballas point ipa beer caused it was recommended. We didn't care for this ipa. We ordered the blue cheese burger medium. Sweet potato fries. Juicy burger. Cooked to our liking. We shared one just Bc this was a snack. The sweet potato fries with powdered sugar and sweet dipping sauce was flavorfully brilliant.  We also ordered the cookies and cream milk shake. Sooo good. $10 milk shake better be good lol. The waitress suggested we wait till we go to Hell's Kitchen to try the sticky toffee pudding. Overall a great experience but server should suggest desserts not suggest to try t elsewhere. Thank god we had reservation for Hell's Kitchen. And it was so good.

EKx-83R021KdzZxLN89Ybw.text: If you like burgers, you're going to love this place! Easily, one of the best burgers I ever had. Cooked to perfection. Say what you will about Gordon, but that Brit knows how to make an American burger. Fries were decent, but the real winner here is the onion rings. Lightly fried and full of sweet vidalia onion. Place is always packed, so try to go early.

Y7PAOttTrBXxshPFxeDBCQ.text: Got to try the Crown Burger. Super soft and well put together....the way buger supposed to be. Not break apart as one eats. Really enjoyed it.   Only thing was... server never came back to ask if the food was... yum . I wanted to order chocolate shake....maybe next time!   Definitely coming back @ date night!   Next time trying the "Barckyard" burger.

OHdm8xrovahiOFpRX6_qsA.text: BurGR was always a staple for us during all of our Vegas trips. When we passed by on our most recent visit and saw that it got rebranded to Gordon Ramsay Burger, we were a little surprised, but it makes total sense seeing as how GR seems to be taking over the strip with new places.  The menu has been revamped. There are definitely new items, and there aren't Total Rewards discounts anymore. The shakes have also been redone so that they aren't just named by numbers anymore. All that being said, the quality of the food is just as good as it was. Juicy, medium rare burgers with heapings of mouthwatering toppings that will just barely fit into your mouth.  Farmhouse Burger. Still our classic go-to. A juicy burger topped with bacon and a fried egg. You know, just in case the burger itself wasn't enough protein for you. The bacon has been upgraded from duck bacon to mangalitsa bacon, which we're told is like the kobe beef of pork. What's mangalitsa, you ask? Google it. You won't be sorry.  Forest Burger. This one offers up more greens in the form of arugula and 'shrooms. Duck bacon still comes into play here though, so don't let the name fool you into thinking this is just made of rabbit food.  Just Fries. Because sometimes, you just want to be fries. Thick cut fries served with two sauces. One reminded me of a curry-like sauce and the other was more a traditional ketchup with a kick.  Didn't have room for dessert this time, but we'll definitely be back!

1-o7QSDZOCdW336TghHQEQ.text: Like many another's that have visited vegas, I came here because of name, Gordon Ramsay. I wanted to experience what it was truly like be in one of his restaurants after so many years seeing him on tv. It also helped that the restaurant was just across the street from our hotel. Located in the planet Hollywood hotel, sits Gordon Ramsey fame burger restaurant. When we arrived around 4pm there was no wait but the restaurant was filled with customers. Shortly after we were seated a line started to build for the dinner crowd so luckily we arrived in time. The menu is made of paper and you get to keep it as a souvenir if you wish. As you would expect, a wide selection of burgers, from the classic with lettuce, tomato, pickles, and American cheese to   After waiting 30 minutes our burgers and fries finally arrived. I had the thick steak fries, while my girlfriend had the sweet potatoes fries sprinkled with powder sugar. They are very liberal with their fries portion, so one order is more than enough for two people. The fries were stale as they keep them sitting under heat lamps. I don't understand that if they are going to keep hungry people waiting 30 minutes for their order, why don't they just bring out the fries ahead of time so that people are occupied with food and the fries see fresher.   When we asked the server why such a long wait, he replied it normally takes 30 minutes at minimum for the food to be prepared. It didn't help that we were starving since all my girlfriend and I had were granola bars and snack chips, but having to wait 30 minutes for any meal is just not acceptable.     I had the forest because mushrooms go so well with burgers but the seasonal mushrooms just didn't do it for me. They were sparse and didn't add much flavor. The burger meat was okay. I'll be honest, Denys burgers are much better. If you haven't tried Denys new burgers they are actually pretty good, I highly recommend.  I was definitely expecting a lot more from someone who is such a critic of others. Perhaps Gordon Ramsey should film his own restaurant in an episode of Kitchen Nightmare.

vlw-ZGHhIvpezmHb19FqAg.text: This was a pleasant surprise on our Vegas trip. We had just arrived and were looking for a good, casual dinner place. When we got arrived, there was a line waiting but don't let the line intimidate you. They were very quick and we didn't wait much longer than 15 minutes.   The burgers were great and will be returning to try more of them. Also the truffle fries were outstanding, even down to the dipping sauces that came with them. Lastly, the sticky toffee ice cream sandwich was more then I expected. Overall, the portions are all very good. My partner and I split an order of fries and that was more than enough for both of us. Very good place.

by9mkZzEEI5oMMe0vBwDMQ.text: We have eaten here on different visits to Vegas and I do enjoy coming here. We both tried something different this time is set up a hamburger we tried a chicken burger and a lobster and shrimp burger. Both of them were very pleasing and tasty. Wasn't just a chicken patty it was actually chicken that had been formed into a chicken patty and then cooked properly to make it better than just your usual fried chicken thrown on a bun. We have asked for our onion rings to be delivered before the meal they did not get there until the meal. There were numerous orders of onion rings sitting under the lamp that we could see from our table. When the server brought our food we address this and her response was if you don't want them I'll eat them. With the Empire of restaurants Mr. Ramsey has,we have noticed that there are the same issues you would find in other restaurants. Some servers do not understand it took a lot of work to build a brand and they are tarnishing it with their attitudes and lack of attention. The food does keep us coming back in most cases.

l5iYW2-Ydkw_HrQ1NoRlKQ.text: Ummmm wow!  Okay totally a huge Gordon Ramsay fan so this was obviously on the list! Haha!  Hells Kitchen @ Caesar's was booked up!  However, WOW!  The ambiance, the energy, the decor and the FOOD; all amazing   Wow!  I got the farmhouse burger medium and cooked to perfection!  My husband got the blue burger medium well also cooked to perfection and added fried onions to it!  Yum!  The service- top notch! Literally from the host staff to our waiter Ryan! Wow! Knowledgeable about the food, drink pairings, and hell how to make something even better!!! He crushed it and made Rosing super helpful (Chef has a bunch of things on the menu I couldn't understand)  Wooooow!!!  Eat here

The garlic fries were okay.

Bta34HouHNTUjS1arJNHTg.text: First of all, it's overhyped. There is a wait. The line is for 2-4 people and for parties of more go to the desk directly. The place is clean and the service was pretty good at first. It did take a while for food to arrived because the kitchen was busy and backed up. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger to share with my sister. Also go the Oreo creme brulee shake, onion rings, Parmesan fries, and sweet potato fries. The Hell's Kitchen burger was ok, wish it was spicier. Filling enough for me and my sister. The fries were pretty good but after a while it will get soft. The onion rings were really good and came with cheese ranch. The milkshake though was the best. It will be my sole reason for every coming to this overhyped and overpriced

nO9boWSd3ecAT8KxpZzR4w.text: Okay...let's start with the positives. I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger and it was amazingly delicious! The reason for the 3 starts is because 1. I ordered my burger well done and it has soooo much pink that they had to take it back to recook (3 other people at my table had the same issue) 2. The service was mediocre and the waitress didn't come buy enough to check on us 3. The burgers took 45 once the order was placed 4) For the price of the burgers and fries it wasn't worth it.  I got the Parmesan truffle fries and I did not like them at all. There was way too much Parmesan cheese on it  The manager was very apologetic about the burgers not being cooked how we ordered them so she gave us 10% off and everyone got a free dessert! Now the dessert is amazing!!! I tried to Oreo and chocolate shake and YUM!! The Oreo shake tastes better to me as the chocolate shake was very rich.  I won't be returning.

bWCLvg-c8_ln1hmtVB3uDQ.text: Our table of 4 each ordered a different burger. For starters the nachos and I must say the shredded beef was delicious but with the cheese sauce and fried potato chips it was greasy overkill. Onion rings are delicious and fries are good not over the top. Ketchup = what is this imposter red sauce they serve with the fries and rings???  I get the I am Gordon Ramsey and a great chef but let's leave it at that and serve the best ketchup ever Heinz!    All the Burgers we ordered are very good! Cooked perfectly and meat has great flavor. Light handed on the sauces which is perfect for me I don't want the meat masked.   Prices are excellent!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jalapeño burger

sOpw5079TpkBmI5-zy9nOA.text: When we found out Gordon had his own restaurant in Las Vegas we were more than excited to eat there. We even waited the 40 minutes around 8 pm on the 28th of January, 2019 although we were starving of hunger! We then sit down and a very polite waitress took our order and came out with the appetizer fairly quickly. After my first bite of the Kettle Nachos my stomach started to feel nauseous. I continued eating them because I was so hungry and thought my nausea would go away as I continue to eat, especially at what most people would consider a high end restaurant. Finishing the Nachos I then take a bite out of my Farmhouse burger and run straight to the bathroom. On my first trip to the restroom I had serious diarrhea symptoms hoping my stomach would feel better so I can finish the atleast 20$ burger I am paying for. I go back to the table, try for another bite, and I immediately ran back to the restroom again to vomit everything I ate out! I couldn't even finish my meal & went to sleep/woke up feeling very sick. My stomach feels like it's battling a bacteria. Me and my family would watch Ramsay all the time on TV and honestly it's ironic how I never got sick before eating at a restaurant until I ate here! I feel mislead and definitely think I deserve a  compensation for the meal I didn't even finish. Also I wasn't the only one sick at the table just saying!

The nachos with corn bread is delicious, and creme brulee milkshake is spectacular! The xburger was great, the service was VIP.
