bhDa5BcpBnuUurZgZ7LEaA.text: Came for lunch on new years eve day. LONG LONG line. Waited almost 45 minutes. Finally got seated at the bar,  ordering was quick and easy. We got some tequila shots while we waited. $11 a shot, but they were a good pour and the bar tender put some salt in the shot itself so it was super smooth. We also ordered a mixed drink of Jameson and champagne, and the bar tender was happy to make it for us. Food took a while to come out, but once it did OH MY GOD! My fiance and I shared the just fries and they were cooked perfectly with great dippings. My fiance got the farm house burger medium rare and loved it, but let me tell you the foie burger that I got blew my mind!! It was absolutely delicious!!! I could eat it every day of the week!

gsFpOQl5KR2c76t9ctXdtg.text: Not bad but not great. The size of burger patty is on the small size relative to price and other burger places. 2 out of 3 at our table were over cooked. Service was fine but hurried then slow. We won't be back.

2zF5t1ekk24mKKUJ_giX0g.text: I ate at this restaurant on Wednesday night about 10:30pm. Every table was full and there were lots of staff around - which I will address later in my review. We started with the Beer Battered onion rings. MISTAKE. They had obviously been fried earlier and the re-dipped in the fryer. They had this weird powder on them which was not Parmesano Reggiano as advertised  it was strangely reminiscent of the green can Parmesan.    Come on Gordon, that would have caused a famous f-bomb and an equally famous spit-out. Now, I know you don't oversee the day to day, but your name's on it so ya gotta own it. These things reminded me of onion rings you would get in a take out that's delivered to your house hours after they are cooked.   My husband had the Specialty fish and crisps burger... or should I say the indistinguishable protein burger drowned in a STRING dill mayo. F-bomb... spit-out.  A specialty ... wow NO.   I, on the other hand, had a perfectly cooked Hell's Kitchen Burger. It was a perfect medium cook, great bun, and just the right amount of sauce to be moist, but not like the fish thing over-sauced.   Now, the restaurant itself and the service. First we waited in line for ten minutes or so and there was this bizarre fire sculpture behind the glass. It was generating enough heat to actually cook the food there. Really!!! It was 95 degrees outside in Vegas so fake fire would have been welcomed.   The service was less than stellar as well, actually it was terrible. We had 4 or maybe 5 different people waiting on us. The guy who took the order and the check and who didn't get a great tip stood on the side and joked around with his friends the whole time. He never checked on our drinks or anything. I chalk that up to management. A well-trained  floor manager would never have let that happen.   My advice... there are lots of great restaurants in Vegas. Find one other than Gordon Ramsey  Burger.

vlqkqRajOr6_ioNq-Sr_xQ.text: Came Here For Valentines Day Just My Date And I, Hostess Sat us Quickly, Food Was Great! Fries Were A Little Hard, And Regular Ketchup Wasn't Provided. Maybe They Didn't Have It? But The Spicy Ketchup Was Great. Our Server Was Excellent. Will Come Back Indeed. Ask For Christian!

ORbotkkBW5r4DWXiRKCUig.text: Honestly was expecting a really gooood burger but I only give it a 3.5 star. To my taste it needed more flavor and the meat was a little too dry. For a $ 17 burger was expecting something better.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lTW2MMgj55F2joww5eQbHQ.text: Delicious, that's all I honestly have to say! I got the Farmhouse Burger, it was so filling and flavorful. Amazing onion rings, love the crisp. The service was great too! Elijah took good care of us, helpful and insightful about the menu. Will definitely be coming back my next Vegas trip!

OHtyk10KZeMVRUuLvd8XGQ.text: I've been dying to go to this place for a long time but always happen to miss it when I come to Vegas. I found time this visit and I'm glad I got to go. There was a line of people waiting, but my mom went straight to the front and checked in and they have that text service where they'll just text you when your table is ready so you can walk around instead of waiting in line. So make sure you check in instead of just standing mindlessly in line!  We got a text no more than 5 minutes later that our table was ready. We walked back to the front desk and they made us wait like 15 minutes for a table to be cleaned, and they they got frustrated with my mom for standing at the desk instead of further away which was not cool. I didn't witness it but my mom said the front desk girls were super rude and gave her attitude.  After we got seated the manager came over and apologized for everything that had happened which was nice.  So my family all ordered the "Hell's Kitchen" burger which was AMAZING. I got the "F Word" burger which is actually not on the menu! They only sell 50 a day and it's pricier than the rest of the burgers at $22 instead of $15. It was good, but if I came back I would def get the "Hell's Kitchen" burger.  I'm not a fan of sweet potatoes but my boyfriend got those fries and he loved them. I got the truffle fries which were delish as well. The fries are like $12 so they're big enough to share between 2 people.  Overall great food and atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger

zNI4H21MtcAVkDPs3GzMUw.text: The food was great, the services sucked.  We waited one hour to get seated for four.  They were suppose to call me when our seat was ready.  I asked when I was going to be seated and they didn't have me on the list.  You usually pay for the service, price of food should be the same but didn't get my money's worth for the experience.

vtlYUgNoRNRx7oXur4AZgQ.text: Every time we're in town we eat here and every single the time the service is excellent and the food is excellent. Gordon Ramsay has built quite an empire and knows what he's doing. Best burger ever

Wc6GCsDVfFb5EixbporkFw.text: Had a great first experience the first time so of course I went back. But the second time I went, it was a much different experience.   I had a horrible visit with our server Janet and the manager Eric. If you are looking for great service, this is not the place to go!   After we were seated we ordered waters right away and when she brought them we were ready to order. It took 55 minutes to get our food and when we finally did there was a huge problem. Last time I was there I ordered they turkey burger and loved it so I ordered it again and it looked much different. It looked like chicken this time and last time it more resembled beef. When I questioned Janet, she went on about their spicy chicken patty...listening was just not her thing. She then said that I was probably given beef last time. I asked to speak to the manager. I explained to him the problem and he said there was nothing he can do.  I took a few bites of the burger and did not like it, leaving over half. I told Karen that I did not like it and had lost my appetite and she said "Excellent, no worries." Who says that?!  She then charged me for it and I asked her to take it off because she took it away. She sent Eric to our table and he took her side and told me there was nothing he could do. He then proceeded to get in an argument with me and refused to leave my table when I asked I'm to.   Dont' waste your visit to LV on this place.

TjfzDlrWj-2kH0HPD7YQaw.text: This is hands down the most amazing burger ive ever had it was even worth the 2 hour wait we had the first time. My group of friends and I came out here about a month ago and all six of us agreed that it was the best burger we all had had. Everything was perfect, so much so that a few of us came back to vegas 4 weeks later and decided to make another stop at Ramsay burger and we had an even better expirience than the first time! Our server, Ryan, was amazing! He gave us all some amazing recommendations based on our preferences and made sure we had everything we needed!! Needless to say we will be making an annual pilgrimage to Ramsay burger for our girls trips!

nfYJa8SrGUHfnK2T-gda4A.text: Burger was pretty disappointing. Got the burger with blue cheese and it was flavorless. Got the brown butter shake which wasn't properly mixed. Waitress explained all the drink and menu options to table next to us upon them sitting down, but didn't do the same for us. Had to wait 30 mins for burger, so we reluctantly ordered the fries. Fries were average, flavored ketchup were not very good.

4_3IKyx0BnjVoyPRGMuCgg.text: Boy I can't wait to come back! Gordon Ramsay you did not disappoint.  We went during the weekday so the wait was minimal.   I love how they had vegetarian options. You can replaced any of the burger with the portobella patty. Don't forget to order a shake with your burger. Let me tell you, it was probably the best shake I've ever had. I've been craving it ever since.   We ordered Hell's Kitchen Burger with the portobella mushroom patty, Truffle Burger, truffle fries, and Creme Brulee Shake.

xws7Qy_8PwOLug7WRU6mwg.text: S-L-O-W. Took 15 minutes (maybe more) for a server to even say "hi" to us after being seated. No drink menu - server gives you an iPad and then stares you down to make a decision quickly. Servers all advise 45 minutes for a burger - they advised it was because burgers are "made to order" (hmm, I cook burgers for 10 minutes at home.) Ordered 1 burger, truffle fries, hummus and 2 drinks = $70 + tip Food was good but experience was disappointing.

YUEi6abIacUxClXK6EDb8g.text: The food was okay. But our server TAMMY was HORRIBLE. She never acknowledge us. But she was more focused on the other costumers. She had a whole conversation with them until we finished our dinner. That was a disappointment.

OWGUPcdr8vkECobNSuaIWA.text: Very good burger. Got the "Hell's Kitchen Burger" cooked well. You can actually taste the meat, not smothered in ketchup and mustard like most burgers.  Every bite is flavorful. Getting good food for the price! And really.. not that spendy. Had it inside planet Hollywood, was not disappointed! Highly recommend trying it out. Between Gordans, burger, steak, and fish + chips you can't go wrong. Skol vikes

GfNJJQbU0twZwNyQpQ4YSQ.text: Best burger I've ever had hands down.  Great service even though super busy.  The food was amazing and I would come back again for sure

IfK2ELtSsdFkLU4DK-1DTA.text: Too expensive for the quality. I'm speaking about the burger I had. The wings were pretty good, but I expected a better experience with my burger.

PN51S5Q3zT0KoOi3Knauxw.text: Sorry for the long review, just thought I would explain everything that happened.  So I was flying from Iowa to Sacramento with an overnight stop in Las Vegas. Thought I would stop in at Gordon Ramsey Burger Restaurant and get a burger.  I got there around 5:00 pm on a Monday and there was no one in line. That was good for 1 star.  Sat down at the counter instead of waiting for a table.  GORDON, GORDON, GORDON!!!  What happened after that was a testament for not eating at the bar.  Ordered a drink, Captain Morgan and Pepsi (they don't have coke, mistake #1), was a little watered down or else Pepsi makes it taste funny.  Ordered the Forest Burger cooked medium and some fries.  Waited about 30 minutes before the burger arrived which is normal for this restaurant.  Ordered another drink just before my food came, Captain Morgan and Pepsi, that is even hard to say. No improvement in the drink, actually was more watered down than the first (mistake #2).  First bite, no pink, no flavor, no rush of "Whoa, that tastes so good".  Took a few more bites, no pink whatsoever in that overcooked burger (mistake #3).  The duck bacon was overcooked, but at least the bacon had some flavor along with the mushrooms and cheese.  I slow ate the burger waiting for someone to come over and ask me how the food was.  No one ever asked me how the food tasted or was it cooked right.  There were three of us customers sitting next to each other.  We all got to talking and we all had the same problem, overcooked food and no one asked us about the food.  Back to my situation, the bartender offered me another drink, I declined and said "I'm good".   About another 5 minutes later, the bartender finally noticed, which was about 25 minutes after I started eating and said, "I see you are slowing down there buddy".  Finally, I get to let them know about the food, which should have happened 3-4 minutes after I received the burger.  I let him know that the burger was overcooked, I still had only eaten about 2/3 of the burger, so it was there to be seen.  He asked, "Was it cooked medium well".  I raised my eyebrows and then he said, "Oh, Well done, eh".  He then let me know that he would get the manager.  The manager came over asked what the problem was and I proceeded to tell him the burger is way over cooked and had no flavor.  He said I should have let the server know that it was not cooked to my liking. I let him know that the server/bartender never came over and asked me about my food.  I told him, anyone, and I mean anyone, can cook a burger correctly the second time.  I let him know that I was not the only one here at the counter having this problem.  He apologized politely and left (mistake #4).  The bartender came back over to me and asked why I had not told him about the burger.  I let him know that I was waiting for him to ask me about the food and he argued with me that he had asked me earlier. Big Mistake #5!!!!     So my lesson that I learned here was that bartenders are bartenders and not food servers. Don't eat at the bar.  Don't eat here on Mondays, as the part time chef works on Mondays, plus the chef needs to learn the difference between, rare, medium and well done.  Gordon Ramsey Burger Restaurant gets many 4 & 5 star reviews but not from me. FIVE MISTAKES for one customer, let's see.  How many stars is that worth!  I gave it one star because I got seated right away.  After that, all downhill as they say.  Oh wait.  The bill for the burger, fries and 2 drinks was $51.96.  They gave me a nickel back, so they gave me a penny tip back!!!  I left the nickel....will I be back or eat at a Gordon Ramsey establishment again...time will tell, but not anytime soon. Thanks for listening!!!

Hs4ksu16AxAwmU9gPPIITw.text: Everything was uniquely delicious and put together. I had the Lobster and shrimp burger with a spicy margarita. My hubby had the "Hog Burger" and we shared the Parmesan onion rings which were fried to perfection. I'm picky about shrimp and was so happy that it was not a lot of filling in my lobster and shrimp patty.

HHgWqasfYJHgDEVaFB8f3Q.text: Fantastic burger (Hells' Kitchen Burger), great service and a nice, friendly vibe, cant wait to go back and eat again

ZXxsKSL2gKY0m1aKhq0UPQ.text: As many others have posted, the wait just to get a seat is long.  Once seated, service is ok, they're quick to take your order, but the wait for the food is long.  I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger.  The meat itself was cooked perfectly medium rare, but the toppings left something to be desired.  For something called the "Hell's Kitchen", I expected there to be some heat, but what I tasted was very mild, almost without any heat.  I think they need to boost up the heat factor. Fries are good, boosted by the excellent spicy ketchups they provide. Overall, everything tasted fine, but nothing special.   There are too many other burger options on the strip for me to give this a high recommendation.

Vp3o7T3iD8WQYVXwGu0gMQ.text: Well...we waited 1.5 hours to eat here. It was edible. All I can really say about the flavor is that it lacks flavor. I gave it a three stars because the root beer was good. I got the parmesean fries and the ketchup that came with it was funky tasting. I hope Gordon Ramsey reads this, your burgers are not the greatest buddy, stick to British food and leave the American burger alone.

ec_ssskdoRKPdv6vamwf6A.text: Well worth the extra cost related to the name of the Chef. Truffle fries are legit, my son said the sweet potato fries w/lemon infused powdered sugar are the best ever. Waitress was super knowledgeable & helpful for us. Oh yeah, the best Onion Rings ever!!!!!

PCPLH7fuLXDIva6bP0S9uw.text: BEST Burger I've ever had! Must try in Vegas. Had the sweet potato fries and were delicious as well. Service was on point. The only set back was a long line to get seated, But definitely worth the wait.

tHMyFzici0c5Uyqs9XxOqg.text: The review is for the Tandoori Chicken Burger only. It tasted overly salted and was inedible half way through. Really sad as I had high expectations for this place. The other burgers seem good though. Maybe I had an off one.

eJbz9JE675GFg1IIGaxfwA.text: Well, we waited in line a long time for a good burger, but I certaintly won't eat here again. It was still just a burger. The fries and onion rings were different from the typical place and were far above average. I will say that the seats were surprisingly comfortable. Otherwise, it was louder and more crowded than I would like after sitting at casino tables all day. Our server was excellent and the other servers all helped each other out.

Aefm_ZtrmSmMcgVg_8pjEw.text: ** update ** - manager came by and apologized. Gave us discount. And they started telling tables about the food wait time. So ... gotta give credit where do. Fwiw - food was hot and delicious when it arrived. Subpar experience overall tho  Writing this from our table. 30 minutes into sitting here. No food.   Waitress just said burgers take 25 minutes. Not for tables around us. And not mentioned on the menu. Just ours. So that's great.   The line out front is a lie btw. They have Plenty of space, just want you to think it's great. There are multiple empty tables.   Gordon - they are shitting on your brand mate. Step it up.

ySQd0QZUjxLFFfvhL8-Vxg.text: Credit fraud.  That's what happened when I dined at Gordon Ramsey burger in April 2018.  Our waiter overcharged a pre-paid Visa card, and kept some of the cash to himself.  A $90 dinner for three has turned into a $320 dinner.  It's been 7 days since I alerted management to this situation and have not had anything credited back.  Check your bill and do not pay with a card!

Z5WZYuREzpT0L_OHs8fQVQ.text: Great tasting burgers for such a great price! One of the best tasting burgers I've ever had. The restaurant itself was quite busy. The food was decently priced, the drinks seemed over priced for their taste. Our waiter wasn't very attentive and spent most of his time chitchatting with people. We ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and Crown burger. My husband liked it so much he ordered a second one, but it came out very undercooked. Overall, the food was great and this will definitely be a regular stop anytime I'm in Vegas.

PTXZezqWqz68BmFtcT2GPg.text: We came here at around 4:30 and only had to wait less than five minutes before we were seated. We ordered truffle fries and some beer on tap. My husband ordered the blue cheese burger and I ordered the farm burger, both medium. We did wait a while to get our food but the waitress let it be known that there was an average of a 30-minute wait to get our food. We didn't mind. Shortly after being seated we saw the line get very long. The average wait time was about 40 minutes to be seated. Our burgers were excellent. Can't wait to come back and try some more.

psIw0ZKtb-iEO4tfWPwQ1w.text: I just had a fantastic lobster-shrimp burger. The only pitfall is the wait time both to get in and to actually get your food once it has been ordered is super long. It feels like the place is too big for their small kitchen.

enahjlBABVT3YeGOyhny2w.text: 12/24/2018 They didn't have any sodas. After a long wait, we had to eat our burger without any kind of soft beverages.

zrRm48xLqEH6FYTrJY2_SA.text: Why do they make you wait when there are tons of empty seats.  And the burgers are not that great. Poor service and ok burgers... there are way better places to eat . Don't bother and shame on Gordon Ramsay for letting this happen.

XewTkYUnHPeKEYljYI4WRQ.text: I ordered the hell's kitchen burger, probably the best burger I ever had in my life. The house wine was not super great but who cares when you get such a world class burger!

SRUx-nwTSfp7h80U181AUg.text: I had a mix of emotions at the beginning. I was very excited to try this place, but was very disappointed that was another open wall restaurant into the casino/hotel. For luxury restaurants, I usually expect a private restaurant experience and I feel like the open places feel too much like mall food and not enough like a luxury restaurant. But the location was great, easy to find and right on the strip.  The atmosphere on the inside was very appropriate for what it was. Thematically he was going for the American/British burger joint and it was set up that way. Large TVs with sports (which don't anything for me, but I thought was smart) and the blue and red color theme. Merchandise and photos of Ramsey made it seem more like a destination dining location and less like a luxury restaurant.  The menu was perfect. Small, to the point, and cute. It had burgers, but also offered vegetarian option for burgers which is highly appreciated, modern and makes the burger menu feel complete.  The service was good. We were seated fairly quickly, food didn't take too long to arrive, we were checked in on and my water stayed full. Nothing complain about! The food itself was played beautifully. My chicken was a bit dry. But I will say that I was very much pleased with the flavor design. The idea of the creme brule milkshake is a brilliant twist on the classic beverages! And it was delicious. My chicken sandwich made me feel like a journey to the Mediterranean and it was almost a gyro burger, but without the tsatziki sauce.  The onion rings also were great and the dipping sauces were good too.

xRTYtHaSyZIzzerjeNHC7Q.text: Waited in line for the driest burgers ever.  They even managed to ruin the French fries. Service was super slow and careless.

MUu3w6zZDSPO40gzjcdqkQ.text: Short line to get seated and didn't take more than 10 minutes on a late Friday night... to be seated in the middle of the damn dining room, my fave spot for utmost comfort btw. I wish they would've asked what we preferred or gave options.   My hubs ordered the Hog Burger medium done and enjoyed it more than my Hell's Kitchen Burger. I thought mine was pretty bomb, good flavor balance. They really do medium to perfection!   Since everything's a la carte, we ordered truffle-Parmesan fries and some wings. Truffle n Parmesan fries were aromatic n wings were deboned n delicious; be sure to smear bleu cheese onto each bite.   Finished w a nicely plated blood orange creamsicle, homemade from scratch, that tasted really nice.... except I wasn't sure why it was so soft n melty.  Overall: Great upscale ambience, perfect gourmet burgers n spotless service. Iced teas kept coming before we even thought to ask and our waiter never failed to check on our alcohol situation. Solid place, so glad we tried!

However, she ordered the Farmhouse Burger and she ordered it cooked medium but it came much closer to rare, the fried egg was supposed to be over medium and it was over hard. mrWTeNECFe4V7okLH-Fq9g.text: Delicious burgers and poutine.  The server was very friendly and attentive.  We ordered the Farmhouse Burger, Hell's Kitchen Burger and burnt ends poutine.  The food was brought to us very quickly and was done to perfection.  We didn't save room for dessert, but will do so on our next visit.

aiXca171P2x8THRJI68LuQ.text: Good Burger! Nothing out of this world but very tasty and good. Nice well run place with a friendly staff. Not a Gordon Ramsay fan by any means but his spot does make a very tasty burger. Would recommend if you looking for a good burger in Vegas.

ro333TPkT9rOTAyVB7bjhw.text: We eat here every time we come to Vegas. Always  the best burgers. Bursting with flavor, you can tell they use only the best ingredients.  However, as stated in a previous review,  avoid Ramseys steak at Paris. Rude customer service,  terrible cooked steak, and on top of it... it was the night I proposed to my soon to be wife. We will always go to Ramseys Burgr,  but will never step foot in that Steakhouse...

jdSdzTnG9vs13G9-7WY5Cw.text: so this restaurant was on my to-do list since it opened. i finally had the honor to eat here (huge gordon ramsay fan) so let me detail was wonderful experience here...  we got in line at around 8. there is two lines for big parties and smaller parties. i believe if you are more than 4 then you go into a separate line. the bigger line seemed to go faster just because there were so many small parties of 2 and 4 that they had to wait for other tables to finish first. we waited about 30 min which is not bad at all.  once we got in it was so classy so you def pay for what you get! we got a booth table and wow the set up was beautiful and they even give you menus with his face on it and you get to keep it as a souvenir!! which i def did!!  even as you sit and wait for your food they come over and snap some pictures for you to possibly purchase.  the wait was a little long but they let us know just because they do make the burgers from scratch. they did bring our fries out earlier - i just wish the burgers were a little faster so i could eat it with the fries.  so to the most important thing: THE FOOD!!!  -just fries ($8) - literally just fries; not amazing but they were thick cut and the sauces weren't anything special. -truffle parmesan fries ($11) - just get the regular fries. again, fries were nothing special. -farmhouse burger ($15) - THE REASON FOR THE 5 STARS. THE BURGER WAS AMAZING. highly recommend and all my friends were happy with their other burger choices.  OVERALL: i would come again but JUST order a burger and no fries. id love to come back and tries the other sides. trust, the burger is worth the wait.

iSvj-MStid7Ui02bzGKPjw.text: I loved this place! We had a couple of burgers and truffle fries which were extremely delicious! And at the end of the meal we had a brown butter pecan shake and it was out of this world ! I absolutely recommend this place!!!

eLYplQwB3p2g6whvZUtryw.text: My husband and I stopped in a couple nights ago. We only had to wait 20 minutes and it was so nice!  We ordered Hells Kitchen and the Farmhouse burgers. They were phenomenal!  We also ordered onion rings for an appetizer and just fries with our burgers. I can't wait to eat there again!

0lI-oTf1dxYqx4u83Tr2Kg.text: This place doesn't disappoint . There was a long line but if you are diamond card or greater you can skip that . This 30 minutes wait at prime time only had us waiting 3 minutes .   Service was a little slow but the place was packed . Every table on a Monday night taken .   The draft beer list is is 30ish beers Long . Great for a strip non yard house restaurant   There were 3 of us for dinner .   Poutine fries - duck bacon !! Cheese and gravy  Hell's Kitchen burger -really good burger packing some heat .  Crown burger - mimolette cheese ! One of my favorite cheeses .   Overall top top burger spot in town . The Bill for the 3 items above and two draft beers $68.00 .  Not too bad and definitely worth it for the quality of burgers .

7EEfS2JK-u9uIdLSXdwx5A.text: Such a great experience! The line  had about 35 people and we waited about 20 minutes to get seated!  Hostess was extremely friendly and the service superb!  We got the Hell's Kitchen burger, sweet potato fries and the fire wings!  All was good but the wings were amazing.  Best I ever had! Josh S the server was very laid back.  He came to us and told us that he was going on break and let us know who was going to take care of us and the latest server was as smooth! I will be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-XJkL8GMAIsxn3J2iI-EQg.text: I had written a review previously for Burger PRE-renovation but after coming here not too long before the renovation in mid-March, I have to admit small details disappointed me on our last visit a few weeks AFTER the renovation, and would disappoint the great Mr. Ramsay himself as well.   My family (fiance, my pregnant sister & her husband, my big sister & her young daughter) and I came during the late afternoon and were told there'd be a 35 minute wait but were actually seated quickly. We noticed there was a slight change in decor and table setup, but for the most part things looked nice and new. At the table we were given the menus and ipad.   IMMEDIATELY my sisters noticed that their favorite jalapeno poppers were abolished. Lol. New burgers were introduced but they kept my favorite Hell's Kitchen, and changed up the farm burger to a farmhouse, with a different cheese. Basic sides were the same. I thought I'd like to try the forest burger next.   We were waiting a solid 15 minutes before our server came and asked what we would like to drink. She was busy I could tell but I felt that she was also flying through everything, NOT in a good way. As a former server I could just feel the tension from her juggling us, adding us to her pile of mounting mental madness.   We ordered quickly (my sisters pushing for them poppers to no avail), and then waited a lengthy 40 minutes for our food. When our food came, presentation was not as it had been before. My fiance had a piece of old cheese melted and stuck to his plate from either another plate or from a bad dishwashing. Our server had also forgotten one order of fries which we waited til the end of our meal for. We all needed refills for tea a few minutes into our entrees because they had not been filled after we had gotten them.  Although I have had the Hell's Kitchen burger a few times previously, it wasn't the same as it used to be. I feel like in the name of profit, the restaurant has become more for tourists and not for taste. Before, whenever we got our bill I had always thought "I can't believe I'm paying so little for such a great meal and time." Now, when we got the bill I thought "This is just another typical Strip Burger joint bill for a typical Strip Burger experience". Which is sad, because it had always been a place we loved to go for a treat on the Strip every other month or so, and whenever we had friends or family in town.   Needless to say, we all won't be returning. Sorry, Gordon.

1NwIQGDbovMXDmYVNsFPQg.text: His steak place at the Paris Hotel is to die for.  This place, not so much.  Expected a lot more for the price.  Burgers are expensive, which I expected, but they should have been excellent.  Don't go if you expect to be wowed.

Cz3fX_78-O9LOKB97yRuWQ.text: Burger is not that great. Had high expectations before eating, kind of disappointed. The patty was not delicious at all.

HfH_tkEfyd9Dt_IQHJM4iA.text: Terrible Experience! No reservations accepted...so after waiting an hour at lunchtime, we're seated at a table that is basically in the hotel entrance way. Then we waited an additional forty minutes for our food. We mentioned all of this to our waiter, who apologized, agreed, but claimed no ability to affect the situation. I  complained to the Manager, trying to be much more gracious than Gordon Ramsay. He as well claimed no accountability. I'm writing this YELP review, trying to be much more gracious than Gordon Ramsay. Either Gordon Ramsay has no idea what is going on at this restaurant or he is a SHAM.

hmJZxsylYKLcGi8Ebzq6Ag.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had with handmade ketchup to go with your fries. Mic drop.

d5aPg2lP8RPRUmOrYZYa8Q.text: I've only been here once, and that's enough for me. Wasn't good at all. Burger was way under cooked and fries average. And that the good part. We waited an hour for this meal. Much better and cheaper burgers on the strip. Shake Shake is right down the road and In and out is nearby as well. Save your money.

JUd0uP8a-1JgsVgLaZV9kw.text: This is my first experience at this restaurant. After short wait in a line outside, we were let into the restaurant. All food came out fresh and warm. We had the onion rings for an appetizer and they were great. I had a burger that was essentially a ground pork patty topped with shredded pork wrapped in bacon and it was good, I wish I would have gotten a regular burger. The Truffle fries were fantastic, as was the aioli that it came with. Next time I come I will try a different Burger, but if there is a line outside this place is definitely worth the wait.

vpsphLkT9NKDDPoFPeOixA.text: Best burger, ask for the f burger ia not in the menu. Don't forget the onion rings and the truffle fries

QbjIa92NMC7xfuQZkJfDSA.text: First the burger WAS GREAT! Can't argue that. But after all it is a $15 burger, it had better be, lol. The reason for the 3 star rating was the way they pile up extra charges without letting you know.  After my kids ordered their plain ole hamburgers the witness asked if they wanted mushroom or bacon. They, being kids said, "ok".......They don't tell you that that added $16 to the bill by doing that. Actually they way she mentioned it I too assumed it was part of the meal, she never said that it was extra, but then again I live in Vegas and know how they underhandedly gouge visitors. Shameful. Gordon, you don't need the money that bad.

A3aRHtMz0dg2Wa5SlBAkHQ.text: Ryan is the GOAT of all waiters! Best service I've experienced in the past 3 years of coming here, and at any restaurant for that matter. Brandon did a  stellar job as well. Outstanding service. 10/10 will be back.

mZDMMvtCvmaVYXAhtuwMcQ.text: Egg slut is way better. This place is Not worth the wait.  First it took us 30 min to get a table.  One we ordered it took 30 min to get the food.  The burger came out looking great but when I took my first bite there was no wow factor.  Just a plain unseasoned burger.  The bacon was the wow factor.

pRebNKcyU4CUawmADkB0DQ.text: What an amazing burger. I ordered the F word burger which wasn't on the menu yet. Wow! The best burger I ever had. I really hope they open up a place out here in New York. If I ever go to Vegas, coming here will be a must!

FB4sqo6p_mS6hFmRcfxg_w.text: This was the best aged burger I have ever had in my life. They have this one burger that they only serve 100 per shift that's made with aged steak and it's just the greatest thing ever! I love Hell's Kitchen but the Hell's Kitchen burger is too influenced on the sauce rather than the burger itself. The fries themselves were crisp and ultimately ended up melting in your mouth. We all loved every burger except ironically the Hell's Kitchen burger

KjIj_usY8Zn50Hnm1ALVNw.text: I personally love this place, aioli ketchup, curry ketchup---truffle oil Parmesan fries---priceless.  Especially get those out first because burgers take some time.  Really great beers on tap.  I love the farmhouse-juicy beef with bacon and egg.  Love it.  Buns are great.  Don't pass up this place, in the Planet Hollywood.  Highly recommend.  The only downs are always a wait(good sign), and burgers take a minute to come out.  Make sure you order the fries------

Q4o6vkUrz5_V3FmsWOwJ3g.text: One of the best burgers I have ever had. The patty was nicely seasoned and cooked to perfection. I ordered the Hog's Burger which surprised me how good it was because it was an all pork burger! Also the fries were very good with housemade ketchup. The milkshakes and tart were a perfect finish to the meal. The service was also very nice and all the staff were very attentive and friendly. A great restaurant in Las Vegas

L0120HVvTKZPQso2dWTGpQ.text: Been to this place numerous times. When Gordon Ramsay ran it, it was the best place in town. Now that the casino runs the place, the quality and service has suffered greatly. Menu changes were disappointing.  There are better burger places in Las Vegas. Not going back and will no longer recommend to friends coming to town.

Vm89xL3uKb-iyxsQu_MSFA.text: I absolutely loved our two visits to Ramsay's Burger restaurant. Each time I ordered without the bun and my husband ordered with the bun. We were both enjoying every bite. The Parmesan truffle fries and decadent and tasty.  They come with two sauces which are fine, but next time I want mustard (just my preference.) I tried the chicken tikka burger without the bun, and loved the spices! I would order this again. My husband ordered the same thing both times because he loved it so much, and it was served exactly the same on both occasions. The beer is pretty good as well!

ma5cLuKnMeEQHqfLxfD-bg.text: The presentation of the establishment is nice, even if no thought about the environmental impact is taken into account with the 24 hours a day flames. The fries tasted stale, and the burger meat was a bit on the dry side.

IHKAN8Xb556puh-RXlefPA.text: Amazing got the F burger you have to ask for it, it's not on the menu   Get the Hell's Kitchen!!!  If you have a hard time to figure out what to get just ask them it's pretty good all around

ZITZ-JoV7FlDGIPetUAeYw.text: Probably the best burger I've ever had. I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger, it didn't dissappoint. There was a bit of a queue to be seated. It probably took about 40 mins for the food to arrive but it was worth the wait. The prices were reasonable too for a celebrity restaurant.

qbUkGT_v-5rBZCh02a4-2g.text: Gordon Ramsay babe I love you so much. You just know how to make my day. The only negative thing I can say about this place is that I have nothing negative to say. I've had some good burgers which is the ones I make, but this burger was like a golden burger from heaven, I had to pinch myself to make sure I wasn't dreaming. Gordon marry me please!

MFmgS4MagJ5tkzNMqO-Yew.text: Unfortunately Gordon Ramsey Burger served me both the most expensive and the worst burger I had during my trip here. Not that the burger was terrible or anything, but all the fancy ingredients left me with a pretty average experience. The anniversary burger was pretty flavorless, despite the aged steak used to make the burger. The hog burger was a little better, being juicier and better seasoned.   The Irish nachos we had as an appetizer were absolutely amazing!! The corned beef was savory and sweet, and the cheese sauce that drenched the nachos was divine. Unfortunately even that hardly redeemed the overall experience here.

0VNb2RRXd85d2Vux3M1x9g.text: Amazing Burgers and Service. I had the Hells Kitchen burger and it was cooked perfectly! A nice medium rare with a slight kick . I like hot but this was not very hot .   Our server was amazing and took care of our party of 5 and ensured we had everything we needed . Second time here in the last 6 years and to be honest nest we should go more . The prices are reasonable and the wait was not very long .   A must visit for great Burgers and fries .

ggxcOFRUHc5qajnPADaGtA.text: Good burger, but very pricey! $25 for a burger and fries. I guess that is what you expect when eating a at burger joint with Gordon Ramsey's name on it.

1t_42r0A7rPTUv-eHPBPSA.text: Absolutely delicious! Oh my God I had no idea that this was how Onion rings are supposed to taste! Had the Hells kitchen burger medium rare... And it was perfect!!! Thank you Gordon!!!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xRo8YpgB40ZZuUvkzrFrEQ.text: I am a big fan of Ramsay's shows, so when I saw this place I had to go. First, I have to say that I have a mobility scooter to help me get around. On August 9, 2019 I went to this restaurant. Before I got in line I spoke with 1 of the hostesses and asked her the process. She told me that I could just get in line because I was by myself. If a spot opened at the bar, they would come through the line and ask if someone wanted to sit at the bar. Okay, so I rolled myself in line. Twice they came by asking me if I wanted to sit at the bar, and I declined. Finally, after waiting in line for 35-40 minutes I was next. It was then that 1 of the hostesses informed me that they didn't have a table to accommodate me, I had to leave my scooter outside the restaurant (policy) or wait an hour to be seated. When I asked why wasn't I told this in the beginning she said, "you didn't ask.) I pointed out several places inside that I felt safe leaving my scooter and she said "no" to each one. (Meanwhile, she also instructed other hostesses to seat my intended table) When I asked to speak with management,  she said I could park it in one of the spots I had asked about. I waited 15 more minutes and was seated. There were many tables that were wheelchair accessible, including the one I sat at. Now, to the food. My server was Paul and he was wonderful!! Very attentive. Everything is a la cart, I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger & onion rings. Excellent!! They said the burger was spicy "hot," I didn't think so. It was so good, I ate the avocado, and I don't like avocados. They had every kind of cheese I hadn't heard of, but it was good. The onion rings were so good, not overly breaded. I would love to go again, as long as I don't have to encounter that hostess again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wheelchair accessible table I sat at.

AJUOiYUi3wbBdXwUwNH3Mw.text: This place is great if you're looking for a cheap, crap ass burger.  I got the farmhouse, and tasted like it came from the farm barn. Asked for medium, got well done. Hot dog was better than the burgers.  Not to mention sink water...  Cool fire flaming wall and fancy dudes in suites but nothing more.

o99sgQHScLPnw2eqTqOGNA.text: Ultimate Cheeseburger, Truffle Parmesan Fries, & Creme Brulee Oreo Milkshake -- ALL delicious! The milkshake was my favorite, it was the perfect sweetness and neither the creme brulee or the Oreo milkshake was too sweet!

bj7wEDxSphkJB_mmbYEzDQ.text: I was really impressed with this upper scale burger joint. My boyfriend and I got seated immediately on a Thursday night around 10pm. It was pretty packed but I think because we were a party of 2 was the only reason we got seated quickly. I would recommend calling ahead for bigger parties. I didn't order any of the alcohol because it looked over priced and small- it did look delicious though! I figured I could save money by not ordering a drink from here because the burgers start at $15. Which brings me to the burgers!! The burger was absolutely delightful and was super filling. I had mine with dubliner cheese and that was possibly the best cheese ever! I think every burger should have dubliner cheese from now on haha I'm hooked! I would say the pricing is a little silly but it's Vegas and Gordon Ramsey has his name on it so it's kind of expected to pay $15 for a hamburger. *Warning** The burgers do not come with fries. The fries are $8. I chose not to order the fries because I noticed that the kitchen premakes them and then puts the $8 fries under a heat lamp...basically the fries aren't fresh. I refused to pay $8 for a small thing of fries that are just sitting under a heat lamp..no thank you, I'll pass. If you are going strictly for a burger - this is the place for you.  If you are concerned about money - this place is NOT for you.  If you want to eat at a cool burger joint because you love burgers- this is the place for you. The staff is very friendly and attentive. I really liked my waiter. He always made sure my water was never empty and that's always scores points with me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3lxnVyNQ9krUaDwFCfyHNA.text: Quite a few "Celebrity Inspired" places fail to impress and leave you wondering if they would actually eat this food. I am sure no one would face higher criticism if something with his name on it disappointed in any way since he seems to know everything related to food, restaurant, service...  I am happy to say this was 100% and I could see Gordon actually eating here. Yes it was busy since we were in town on Labor Day Weekend. The food is better than I could have imagined, the service was great especially considering how busy it was. (just over a 2 hour wait)   If you are thinking "maybe" treat yourself.

j_p7FUDdRWFQ9ybUKnSBMQ.text: The burger and fries were so extremely dry. So disappointing... I was expecting a deliciously juicy burger and amazing truffle fries. Unfortunately, the fries were dry as a bone!!! I mean horrible... the burger (crown burger) was so dry I had to slather mayo and ketchup on it. Just wrong!!! From Gordon local I expect much more. I understand they had a chef missing, but that's unacceptable. And yes, to not comp us anything or a free drink, is not right. Service was mediocre at the bar. Overall dissatisfied. Will not be back.   UPDATE: They had us come back and with new management and lots of updates I have to say we were pleasantly surprised. Thank you for accommodating us and showing us how service & food can be fixed

OT1Y-X2VWbOXw3vRY9hFag.text: While in Vegas we checked out Gordon Ramsay Burger. I read on their website that they serve Creekstone beef so I was excited. Creekstone is known for humane slaughter and care of animals. I called ahead to confirm this as well. While waiting in line for a seat we were asked if we'd like the front row seats of the kitchen with the chance to view the chefs. It was a nice opportunity especially because our waiter was able to point to dishes that were made and ready to go in order to show us what certain dishes looked like.  We tried the curry chips which are basically French fries that come with a curry dipping sauce. I wasn't a huge fan of either one. The fries were not crispy enough and the sauce had wayyyyy too much turmeric (trust me I'm Indian). I had the Hell's burger and my husband had the Crown burger. Both were delicious. Unfortunately my husband's burger was not medium rare as he requested. It was over cooked on the sides. The burger buns were all the same for all burgers, multigrain (mostly sesame seeds).  Towards the end it was hard to get our waiter's attention because it got busier for the dinner rush. I recommend coming at maybe 3-5 pm to avoid the rush!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells&#39; kitchen burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chips with curry sauce

5p4VqX9875F6iTQKWbSR8A.text: We went early at 11:30 to avoid the lineups and were seated right away. Seating was tight but not uncomfortable.   Simply the best burger (farm burger). Nice and messy. The onion rings were and crispy. Parmesan truffled fried were good. They were thick and flat - not my favorite type of fries. Wings were great.   Service was average.

wa56d_nzhJapo_n88Jrq-w.text: Their burgers are superb and please get the appetizer beer battered onion rings. Don't bother with the fish this place truly excels at Burgers. Who would of thought!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ChpLvKcokM1loYPOJKoHXA.text: No consideration for disabled people my autistic son had to stand waiting in line for 45 minutes and when I asked for a chair the manager told me "we get disabled people here all the time and they have to wait in line" I was stunned. When we got in I had to wait for my order for over 20 minutes. It's a real shame to have such a callused staff. It was a real hell

H4-JJh9cT5RomWSccifvCQ.text: The best burger I've ever eaten!! I got the jalapeno burger(well done) with avocado. The fries were delicious and so were the nachos. Our server was very kind as well. Will definitely be going back on our next trip to Las Vegas.

jlqL1z9AXxO9NxRKjpYVWg.text: Exceptional food! The only reason it is not 5 stars is because of the service. Our waiter forgot to bring out our wings as an appetiser and they came out with the burgers. There was about 30 minutes of us sitting at the table and placing our order before any food hit the table. But once the food got there it did not disappoint. Amazing wings, some of the best I've ever had and the burger was glorious.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These wings were some of the very best I&#39;ve had...and I&#39;ve been addicted to wings for a long time.

7-YAcCvvAlDY7w74hJpi2Q.text: If you are a burger fan then this place may get a 4 stars. I am not a burger fan but I wanted to try prior to a show at the V theater since everyone is raving about it. We ordered all 3 choices of specialty. The lobster and fish burger is very bland, fish and lobster has no (ZERO) flavor. Hog burger is fine. Their buns are good. The truffle fries is good but not a must nor close to a wow like other people claim. The wait is pretty bad but it's GR, right. You know prior to get here already.  Service is good, decor/ambiance is nice. Free parking. Overall it's just an ok, forgettable dining experience.

Ro7v-p-dsQqjo6fCz0GLXg.text: The best burger I've ever had in my life...! We got the Hell's Kitchen Burger with jalapeno aioli. I took some of the meat out without any cheese or sauce etc...and the flavor of the meat was PHENOMENAL!! It didn't even need cheese or sauce...the flavor of that patti was hands down the BEST I've ever had in my life! WILL DEFINITELY COME back again!!!!

K7xeS3iewI5sJGBUnWBK_A.text: Be prepared to wait for table at least 20 minutes. We opted the bar for less wait time. When seated at the bar there's a strong breeze coming from the ac system that will blow napkins away. We were a bit annoyed. The bartender looked new and not well trained. The food was just ok. I think wolf gang puck makes better burgers for the price you pay. We tried the Hell's Kitchen burger, the poutin burnt ends and the onion rings. We enjoyed the poutin burnt ends the most. I don't think I will crave to return, I might or ordered the wrong burgers however. The burger tasted bland.

My5jVgo8Rmfkpt5XOb_AVQ.text: Our first stop in Vegas and we were starving.  There were maybe only 5 parties ahead of us so the wait wasn't too long.  Once we got seated, our server immediately grabbed our drinks and helped us out since it was our first times.  We started off with the kettle chip nachos.  They came out fairly quickly, maybe 2 minutes from ordering them.  It came with a good amount of short rib and corned beef but thought it was a little underseasoned.  For our burgers, my boyfriend ordered the farmhouse burger cause he really wanted an egg and I ordered the anniversary burger (aged rib eye patty topped with short rib).  Burgers were juicy but we both thought they were just ok.  Our server was very friendly but had to wait around since she was busy.  Burgers are reasonably priced, starting at around $15, but fries are not included in the order.

R75Z56dp7QD9liiBmUQl9Q.text: Gordon Ramsay just can't stand to disappoint his customers. Because his food is memorable and definitely an experience. First I tried the Cheddar ale soup. It was the perfect balance of beer and cheese. The bitterness from the beer just added to the creaminess is of the cheese. It's summer now, but on a cold winter night, I'd probably search this soup out to warm me from my bones. Then I got the blue burger while my friends ordered the ultimate cheeseburger and the Forrest Burger. All three of us said that are burgers were the best we'd ever had. The blue burger had the bite of blue cheese mixed with the sweetness of the figgy jam and saltiness of the meet. But the food item that got the most comments? Fries. Truffle fries literally melted in your mouth. The truffle oil actually added to the fries instead of overpowering them. The ambiance was warm and friendly. The staff answered any and all questions and their uniforms are great (jeans). The fire decoration near the door and the barrels if beer really give you that feeling of being near a barn and ready to have a fantastic pub meal. As with all of his restaurants... I'd go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C767IjZ2tEhREDDFWo_0PQ.text: This place lives up to the expectation. It is pricey for a burger place, but man! These are theeee best burgers. I like their sweet potato fries more than the truffle fries, but they're both good. There is always a wait so get there early. Service is okay. If it's your first time here, try their Hog burger, delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nomzzzz hog burger

x0EdsctHymlhoxf-a_26vw.text: Tried: Kettle Chip Nachos, Cheddar Ale Soup, and "Hells Kitchen Burger".... absolutely delicious!!!  Got there on a Thursday around 4:30 p.m. and it was busy but still got a spot. By the time we left (around 5:45 p.m.), there was a long waiting line.  They add/change their menu, so as a local looking for new options, I would recommend to keep an eye on this one.

BMUxswRkiYTTx_kZWRBJPw.text: Something for everyone! Fish burger, veggie burger and the best hummus and pita in the strip! I don't eat beef or pork so I was hesitant to go when the group decided on eating there, but Alas, I'm so glad I went!!! I had the fish burger and it was tasty! Next time I'll try the veggie burger called The Impossible and ask for it to be served in pita bread instead of the bun. Don't take me wrong, the bun was amazing, but the pita bread was absolutely the best! The wait was just 5 mins and the staff was first class. Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful table setting.

I4NrzmdOZOOzPeJRQak6Ug.text: Felt like a tourist trap with a famous name. Our wait was 30-45 minutes for 4 people.  The pork burger felt overcooked and didn't really have any flavor even though we were quite hungry. Service was great, but slow. There's just too many people for the restraint to handle.  Would not recommend going here.

HwP6KlklHDdUoHDImroVgg.text: Line was fast even though it looked long. Blue cheese burger was good. The shrimp rolls were ok. Service was great. Will be back.

vTBnQ4-mahPFAmfAO-ycJg.text: If I could do no star I would.    Gordon Ramsay's restaurants continue to disappoint.    His shows must be entirely scripted because his restaurants are poorly managed and the food is sub par at best.

i6G3EIKtzKlZ3X2fuS4cIg.text: Just delicious. Stout burger and turducken burger were thoroughly enjoyed. The flavors combine so nicely! Fries and onion rings were amazing too. We received better service at GR's Pub and Grill, but they were still really good here.

cgYOt2ZLuAycaBdfp0S-oA.text: Have been here twice. Once a couple years ago and we remembered the burgers as being excellent so now that we moved to vegas this was on my list of places to go back to but was thoroughly disappointed. It was about a half hour wait to be seated, then another 40 minutes to be served our food.  We ordered 2 burgers and 1 regular fries and 1 truffle fries. They have 3 different ketchups and all tasted bad. The normal ketchup tasted plane. Didn't like the truffle fries at all and the normal fries were ok...but McDonalds fries taste better. Their ranch was so so but not great.  We ordered the ultimate cheeseburger and the Hells kitchen burger. The hell's kitchen burger was ok but lacked flavor. The ultimate cheeseburger had little to no flavor. I asked for a side of tomatoes, pickles, jalepenos, and lettuce. None of these added much flavor to the burger.   Honestly In-N-Out has a much tastier burger for $3 vs $17 at Gordon Ramsey and you don't have to wait forever to eat it either.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheeseburger and Hells Kitchen Burger

W2kv1xXnNYf1dacG4HDX9g.text: The Atmosphere was busy and perfect for a Burger Joint in Las Vegas.  The service was perfect and the branding was excellent.  The food was brought out quickly and was presented well on the plate as well as had wonder taste and bold flavors.  The Burnt End Poutine Fry Starter was delicious.  This place is a must try and definitely the Best Burger I have ever had.

I am a huge fan of Gordon so this was a must stop during my wife's birthday weekend get away. We were very impressed with the service and quality of food but we didn't expect anything less with Gordon's name on it.

5xZSVRgAmIcyUy_WYxlLUA.text: Flipping amazing! Not too expensive, everything is delicious. Everything is gourmet, cold beer on tap, great staff,right in the middle of the strip.  Definitely recommend if your in Vegas.

EFfatHIn0Y7afUHUI4X02A.text: Huge disappointment. You are just paying for the name. I'd rather have Red Robin. It's one step above McDonald's.   Waited 2hrs.   Backyard burger ordered it medium, got it over cooked to med-well. Asked to remake. Got another one back over cooked at well done ++  Gave up. They gave us credit for it.   Hell's Kitchen. Wife ordered med-well (I know, I know), got it over cooked at well done ++  Maybe ask for it rare to get it medium?  The beef size is like 1/4 or 1/3 lb. very small amount of meat compared to say John Howie or any other high end burger/steak place.   Fries were reheated what seemed like 4 times.   Ketchup was trying too hard.   Won't be back. Ever.

G09DNifwrUjPtP76TNIw3A.text: Juicy burgers and loved the Farmer's Burger with Arugula. Pair with Cochon blonde was dynamite

dW5XPXUeQf8kSVjQJ26_RQ.text: Review for truffle fries, forest burger and oreo cookie cream brulee shake   * Fries: tasted amazing! The yellow dipping sauve makes it 10 tines better. 10/10 recommend. * Burger: patty tastes super juicy, yumm. I don't like the cheese at all, maybe it's not my taste. I could only finish half of the burger. * Shake: if you can't comprehend a cup full of sugar then don't. 60% of the shake is the thick, overly sweet cream brulee cream, the rest is oreo shake.   I still give it 5 stars because I really like how the food is cooked. I will come back to try other burgers, and more truffle fries!

qUlx0A_DrtSh9VlowSkmWg.text: Decor and layout of restaurant was average. Well lit and plenty of pictures of Gordon in case you forgot where you were. Ordered the Farm Burger ($17) which included bacon, over easy egg, cheese. Overall, good service good atmosphere, good name and that's what you're paying for.

_0XAuEOo8jXG-p5FmZsxJg.text: The flames in the window are a big waste of energy.  Had the fish sandwich because he is a Brit and that is their specialty.  The sandwich was small, nothing at all special about the fish.  The french fries were soggy and the only thing that was different was the curry ketchup.  Can't speak about the burger, but based on my experience I'm not planning to try either.  It is all strip hype, not worth the wait or the money.

AyFXFtP72hWuVzNuXAxezg.text: Great food, very nice atmosphere!!! I was super high but didn't feel out of place still.. the only downside is the line is ridiculous and Silver 7 members can cut to the front of the line the so the person just wanting a burger who is not staying at Planet Hollywood can end of waiting quite awhile.. ours was around 1 hour 20 minutes..  But if we can wait it's well worth the food they give you l!!!

Q8RfkBjBkNB9bFkKlr7cxw.text: Dawg, I haven't been to Bachi Burger yet, but dawg these burgers right chear, these burgers right chear!  Greats buns, ingredients, and perfectly cooked patties.  Just plan to wait in line.    If you're a burger dude like me, you will absolutely notice that these are qualities burger that won't disappoint....As of now this is my favorite burger spot in Vegas.  Still got to try Bachi, Bobby, and Holsteins.

WitULy2O8MN-EHUCdGTHmg.text: Yep... Gordon Ramsay knows what he's doing, but was there really any doubt? The burgers were seriously fantastic. Came here on a double date and we all ordered different burgers so we could try a little of each other's. Each of them were excellent as well as the drinks. I ordered the antioxidant one. I cannot stress enough how delicious all of our burgers were so which ever one you choose to order will probably be delicious.  There was a really long line, but... there was a sign that said for parties of "three or more" to see the hostess. We did and boy am I glad we can read. They put us on a different list for bigger parties and we were seated in a reasonable amount of time without having to wait in that long line we initially saw. So we gambled a bit more and were then texted when our table was ready. We waited approximately 30 minutes total and if you saw the original wait line, it looked like a busy day at Disneyland so 30 minutes was great in our minds. They don't take reservations either so FYI.   I honestly can't wait to go back the next time we're in Vegas. The burgers are so worth the wait.

QJvIeY41Td0cSwne9P-tqg.text: Our server was personable, and he took very good care of our table.  We mentioned in conversation that it was my daughter's birthday.  The place was packed, and we weren't expecting anything, but he made her feel like a princess.  Can't wait to come back!

0bnp2iRoX0uBnpVHCZTITw.text: The burgers were fantastic! I ordered a Farmersburger & Hell' kitchen burger with Fries. I'd have tried every single burger if I could. However, the fries was not so good. It tasted lile it was made an hour ago, meaning not crispy at all. But it is absolutely worth waiting to taste the burgers ;)

AwDGGdlJ-TXm_fYQtLuoeg.text: Did come here to see how the chefs from Gordon Ramsay team would prepare the burgers and other items. Would say a complete let down.   I had some uninvited guests in the form of stone/broken chicken bone spec. When asked about it to the waiter he was kind enough to send his manager to speak to us and imagine what, I was told that these kind of things can be possible and sounded so obvious.  My question would be, who would have been responsible if I broke my tooth trying to chew that bone? Gordon Ramsay or his manager?   Before I was assigned my table, I saw almost all tables having fries so I thought it might be the best item in the menu. I think it should have been named as wedges instead of fries. Moreover when they were served they were not served hot. Not sure when they were prepared.                                                  Not quite a standard when you are selling stuff with GR tag to it.

CgO4C5BTl8boeOzD30LO6w.text: Wasn't overly impressed with this place.  I thought for a 25 dollar burger it would be amazing but it just tasted very beefy.  I couldn't taste anything else on the burger.  I will say the serving of fries and the burgers are huge.  It was definitely way too much food.

WwRnD370j-YjqpmXuVlrUw.text: My husband and I went here on Thursday around 5:15pm. After a very small wait in a very busy restaurant, we got seated and placed our food order around 5:21. Our server was very prompt and got us our drinks (he got a beer and I got the jalapeno 'rita) right away and we got our onion ring appetizer within 5 minutes.  Our burgers and fries arrived at 5:36.   The burger was cooked beautifully and was very tasty, but not nearly as spicy as we were hoping (Hells' Kitchen burger). We love spice and were just a little let down about that, but the overall flavor of the burger was very good. We got one order of fries to split and that was enough for both of us, and they were cooked well.   I decided I couldn't leave without trying a creme brulee milkshake, and I was not disappointed with the Oreo one. It was delicious and generous enough to share if you feel like it.   I mention the times we arrived and were served because this was the FASTEST food we had gotten anywhere in Vegas during our entire stay there, and the food was delicious.  When I saw how packed the place was, I was expecting a long wait for food and was pleasantly surprised.

n6BhavfKQT4AphBJotEdDQ.text: Got to the restaurant at 10:30pm on a Tuesday night. After waiting 15 minute for our waiter, a guy named Andre approached us. After taking our water order, we didn't receive them until 10 minutes later. He apologized. We placed our dinner order which seemed to be pretty easy, but then we waited another 45 minutes.... it was 11:45pm. I was watching Andre to see whether he acknowledged what was going on, but he seemed to busy at the cashiers processing payments and checking his tips. I checked their yelp page and it said they closed at midnight. so at that point I searched for a manager, I stressed how upset I was and that we had been waiting forever and he just apologized and we walked out. Worst service I have ever had! Especially for a Gordon Ramsey restaurant. Was definitely looking forward to the food and it was a complete let down. I highly DO NOT recommend this place.

92tccyaOp5aQKIO8eeO6ag.text: I was expecting a lot, based on the very good reviews of this location and previously great experiences with Gordon Ramsay establishments. I was quite disappointed. I ordered my burger medium, which should have some pink remaining. It came out quite well done. I ordered and Old Fashioned and they muddled a cherry and put a quarter of an orange in it. I know this is not a cocktail bar, but an Old Fashioned is probably the most basic cocktail and at $16 each, I would expect them to get it right. I would expect Gordon would not be happy with the product they are delivering in his name. Consistency and accuracy are his hallmarks.

AxDm21fY1OeecCgUVRU_CA.text: The Poutine fries weren't bad; flavorful but needed a little more gravy.  The Hell's Kitchen burger disappointed me significantly.  I asked for medium rare and got a thin patty that was way over cooked. The bun was dry.  It had a little heat from the grilled jalapeno, but I've had better burgers for the price.    Sorry Gordon, I'm a private chef and your restaurant disappointed.   On a good note, the beer was half way decent.   Cheers!!!

-_0ekxCBT9E9M8KQyyFTBA.text: This was our first experience at this restaurant and I have to say these were the BEST burgers we've ever had! -1RMuXbbnJQF8fzEuryNaA.text: BOMB. Best burger place I've ever eaten at. Honestly left feeling sad knowing I won't have this place at home.  They don't take reservations, but our party was fairly large and we needed a handicap-friendly table so they made an exception. We were there on a Sunday around noon and the line was about a 30 minute wait. We stayed at Planet Hollywood (where the restaurant is located) and the line was always long when we saw it.  I had the Tandoori Chicken Burger- every bite was so flavorful. And that goes for literally everything our party of 10 had. Our favorites were the Kettle Chip Nachos and Truffle Parmesan Fries. Seriously sooo delicious! I swear every bite my whole family would look at each other and say how good it is lol.  Service was 10/10 too. Crazy busy, but they still brought our food quickly and checked up on us often. Overall, an amazing dining experience! :)

I was looking around at the tables and seemed like everyone was just waiting for their food with empty tables. The hog burger was $18. the pork was overpowering. It comes in a super thick pork patty, wrapped in bacon, topped with shredded pork. They should've given more Cole slaw. I couldn't finish the pork patty because it was so thick and so I left it on the plate and the smell of it was making me noxious. Very strong pork smell. Everything was just mediocre. Can't say it's worth the money. Total was about  $170 for five people.

hlefMIMvhcrDTWRPlBGjBQ.text: Delicious !I have never had such wonderful good in my entire life. I suggest the onion rings.

hpaPFwVDigFxRk5QjGOJ3A.text: It is hard to walk into a restaurant without any expectation when you see one of the most famous names in restaurant business. Walking into Gordon Ramsay Burger, my expectations were very very high. Once you are seated you are greeted with a table setting that reminds you of the British Flag with and a simple menu on top with very minimalistic fonts with the name of the restaurant. The physical Menu it self even felt like there was a lot of thought, design elements and interaction put into it compared to a regular menu at majority of the restaurants. The drinks and dessert are on a separate tablet menu the server brings that seems a bit out of place and don't see the use for but I feel like its because of the limited space on their actual menu.    On to the food. I had the Anniversary Burger which also seems like the F-Word burger that wasn't on the menu. The patty is a blend of 27-day, dry-aged New York strip, Bone in ribeye and barbecue short rib. It's topped with frisee, pickled shallots and lemon vinaigrette. It seems like the design isn't very sophisticated and I like how simple yet flavorful it is. People might ask whats the point of all the best meat in a patty, you won't taste it.. but the truth is it made a whole lot of difference. you can actually taste the dry aged and the quality of meat in each bite. Parmesan Truffle fries are cooked to perfection with subtle yet enough seasoning and flavor of both Truffle and Parmesan in every bite of the Fries. It is hands down one of the best gourmet burgers I've had.    Service is a bit slow due to the place being so damn busy but it's understandable since the place was jam packed. The only gripe about this place is the waiting system. We had 5 people in our party and they were kind enough to take down our number and text us when our table was ready but for party of 2 or less, They said you have to physically wait in line. Though we didn't have to wait in line, this just didn't make any sense to me. If you already have a system of where you can take peoples name and phone number down, why can't you do that for everyone so they can go enjoy a little bit of Vegas instead of waiting in line next to a window full of flames?    Price is a bit high for a burger at $22 but I understand as it's hard to find anything to eat with less than $20 at a sit down restaurant in the stip of Las Vegas.    Regardless of the wait, and what other people may say, I personally enjoyed every bite of my burger and it was a extraordinary burger. it is definitely worth the try. c'mon it says Gordon Ramsay and how often do you have the opportunity to walk into a restaurant with his name in front.

I did ask for it to be cooked well done and that was probably a mistake. I always get my meat well done and I've had very juicy burgers. But here it wasn't that way. I loved the batter on the onion rings but not the Parmesan cheese they added on top....it made it too salty. Service was outstanding. I would eat there again.
