3zdVzmvppTtiOOrorr9zJw.text: I thought this place was good but not great. Might have gotten four stars if not for the fact that they don't take reservations and always have a pretty big line. While I really enjoyed my burger, I don't think I would stand in line for 30+ minutes in order to get it again. There are lots of amazing burgers to be had in Vegas that don't require the long wait.

5GJrWVnT3joFML_NY6fx8g.text: Solid burger but one major flaw having to do with toppings. See our full video burger review here for the play-by-play: youtu.be/DxMHN-r7-Ps

POUGdm-kA7YKg3VWD5Wmmg.text: The wife and I watch Gordon's hells kitchen all the time and we can tell you for a fact they represent. The stout burger was cooked to perfect and the truffle fries are to die for.....service is exactly professional and our waitress was spot on in all aspects and always smiled. We are onto Bobby flays to compare lol stay tuned

FEE2DhtvQ5LbDOynxY1ISw.text: I have been a great fan of gordan ramsay and was so excited to try his one of the restaurant in vegas . We ordered oh bloody hell cocktail...do not order if you dont like tomatoes.onion rings were okish.in burgers we ordered crispy chicken and my husband ordered lobster and shrimp which was good but the chicken burger was not as per expectation. Food was bland

xCEsRsPnOa1u2vPLyZ8MOA.text: We were in Vegas on Vacation. We decided to check out Chef Ramsay's burger, since we are big fans of the show.   Restaurant is located in Planet Hollywood.  As we arrived, there was a long line. The host was going down the line taking names. For a party of 3 or more you do not have to wait in line. They write down your cell phone number and call you as soon as a table is ready.  Wait was 1hr. 40min.  Finally we sat down!!!  Restaurant looks very clean and Nice decor.  Ordered 3 Hells Burgers and 1 hot dog.   Took about another 30-45 min. For our food to come out! A total of almost 4 hours from the time we checked in to the time we left. Wow!!!   My Party and I where really Disappointed!   $15 Burger does not come with a side.  We ordered a side of wedges and onion rings.   "Hells Burger" the description seemed like if it would be a spicy burger includes jalapenos and avocado. Nope!!! The presentation was really nice, but my burger was tasteless, it needed something, no sauce, I did not taste like jalapeno, it just needed something. It just seemed like a burger I could have prepared myself at home.   Fries and onion rings, nothing special.    Hot dog is huge, but nothing special.   They don't offer a children's menu.   I was just expecting way more. I have had a way better burger somewhere else for cheaper, with a side, and without the almost 2 hour wait.   I probably won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FW0Ko7o0tmqDSTC3FUqUFg.text: We are huge Gordon Ramsay fans and the food here was absolutely amazing. We waited in line for about 20 minutes and it was absolutely worth it. The onions rings and cheddar ranch were to die for! The meat that the burgers were made of was the best I've ever had to be honest. 10/10 would recommend even if the line is long to get a table!

TOXsvspJXpq_QPSB71phZA.text: For a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, a guy so quickly bitches at everyone, and expects perfection and if he doesn't get it, he is ready to chop your head off....going to his restaurant was a major let down.   This is actually my second visit and it was equally disappointing but I wrote first one off as "it can happen to anyone, let's give it another chance".   Burger patty itself was ok - but flavor combination of my burger was excellent. I ordered Blue Cheeseburger and really the combo complimentary flavors were amazing. Bun was really good too.   Beyond that everything else was awful.   I came by myself just to grab a burger and the line was maybe 30 people - mostly two party groups. I walked up to the front and saw that bar had about 5 empty seats and also kitchen bar had 5 empty seats. I asked if I could just sit there and she said no. So I went to the line and waited for the actual table. If I am going to wait for 40 min might as well get an actual table. As I waited I heard other single parties that would be ok with the bar but they had to wait as well. I am just trying to imagine Ramsey screaming at some restaurant owner for having 10 seats available at the bar while 30 people wait.   40min later when it's my turn she tells me that there is room at the bar if I want to sit there.  I was like - No - I waited 40min I am not sitting at the bar now. So I wait another 10min and she gives me a table next to the bar (maybe 3ft from it) in the middle of the walkway. So people are constantly buzzing around me. I don't understand why they put the table in this location. You feel like you are always on everyone's way.   Besides that after waiting 15min to get my order I am now freezing because it's in a passthrough so you can feel the cold air from door opening. Now it's 25 min later and I am shivering. I ask one of the managers dressed in a suit to move to a different table, because I am really cold. And he says No.  there are some tables available but he said they may be turning them into 6 tops later.   So I wait for my burger eat it while shivering and leave. Meanwhile those tables that they were going to eventually convert into 6 tops and about 10 other tables in the back of the restaurant where it's not cold and you can't feel the outside breeze, were all empty when I left. This was all on a Monday at 2:30ish PM not a prime busy day or hour.   So basically I paid $37 for burger and fries (no drink) $15 for parking - totaling $52 for a hamburger that was ok, and I was treated like dirt.   If any restaurant owner charged $50+ for a burger and the customer left rushed, freezing, and uncomfortable he would be screaming at them. I guess I can only conclude Ramsey keeps others to a different standard than himself.   As a side note - the first time I came I was seated next to the cash register. My left elbow was touching the register side. Which felt like a train stations since all the servers were coming consistently.

TpmSCqEcdNjbutww2JuTPw.text: Really good food but the front service wasn't as expected. We were a group of 4 and made us wait until our group was complete to be seated but they gave a table to a group of 6 that was after us and was incomplete too.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan truffle fries, Blue cheeseburger and Hell&#39;s in the kitchen burger.

v_WZJwm7p4Gw314JmlNHoQ.text: Just had the burger with the egg and bacon. So so good! Meat was cooked perfectly. Egg was done just right and the bacon brought it home. Can't say anything bad about it. I've always wanted to try a burger like this. Glad I tried it here. Wasn't disappointed. Overall place was very nice. Definitely busy. Our server was good but it did take him some time to get our stuff. For instance my husband ordered a coke and when it came for a refill it took forever for him to get it to us. We were already done with the meal when he brought it. Other then that I really enjoyed it. Will definitely come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TobCKbWyWPSeFCDE4wGG6g.text: Ive been to this restaurant 8 times now and it's very consistent in quality, but they menu keeps changing. The burgers are very good and the service is great. Definitely recommend.

6P7zblRyTXQpmcku1O1zcw.text: Cannot go wrong here!! I stop by every time I come to town, as the food is amazing and service is top- notch. Never had anything that was less than stellar. I miss the jalapeno poppers they used to offer, but there are plenty of other great apps, such as the ahi sliders or poutine fries. The burgers are large and always cooked perfectly. Each one combines unique flavors that are just perfect. I recommend going early, as the line gets long during main meal times.

8VYJ-gL3esiceuDTWxLmVw.text: Delicious burgers. The fries is ok and there is long wait for food but overall they know what their doing and its not a simple burger.

ORiJBOXdPRmJyaYlGjFtMw.text: It lived up to the hype. Great burgers and service. I will definitely be back any time I am in Vegas.

r8hnjKvF6wR16sPZXqjM3Q.text: Best fish sandwich had in years didnt have fishy taste the service terrible no refill on ice tea no fries which ordered waitress preoccupied.

L7wTqU7svNbZ-qcVAQ4rwA.text: We visited here 6/28, and we had high expectations. The restaurant was clean and nice, our server started off nice, but once we ordered drinks and our food she was nowhere to be found. We requested that our Truffle Fries come out before our burgers because we were hungry, after waiting 30 minutes, all of our food came out together! The burgers were overcooked (we both asked for medium) very disappointing! She also let my husbands Diet Coke go empty twice. This place is just an overpriced Red Robin. Sorry Gordon Ramsay, your food and servers at this place suck.  The only good thing was my cocktail.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate cheeseburger

rW9GJpyYgM_oQVS1Ry03cQ.text: A friend and I went here when visiting Vegas. It was an hour wait but worth it. They have great food, I had Hells Kitchen burger with their truffle fries. I remember it like it was yesterday. And not to mention good beer to go along with it. Try the Innus & Gunns with your food. We got seated at the bar near the kitchen. The sous chef in the kitchen talked to us and didn't make it feel like we were sitting right there but it was nice to see where all the action took place. Next time I'll want to sit by the nice fire.

CxytaMG9UoOkXy8U_Xo_1A.text: Very delicious.  Great service no wait to order. Had to wait about 15 mins for food to be made but duh it's made to order right there gourmet.  Boyfriend said best onion rings he ever had but his burger was a little too cheesy ( ultimate cheese burger) Mine (blue cheese) was very good. So much flavor.  Drinks were a little pricey but super cute and delicious and strong.  Always a server always by to help  We left full and happy

agFpUweC0uPkDvYpeI4rCw.text: This place brought me to burger heaven. I would die a million times if it meant I got to visit burger heaven if not just for an hour. I wouldn't recommend this place for a date, cus you'll completely forget about your significant other and fall completely in love with the sweet sweet burg. I'm drooling just thinking about it and my girlfriend is wondering what's wrong with me. Little does she know I'm fantasizing about putting those delicious buns in my mouth.

o7ktrDh-vj7fSsgclQYing.text: I ate here with my husband about 3 years ago and the food and service was amazing. Tonight the food and the service was horrible. Our whole party came from all over the country to meet (before a wedding) on our recommendation and the party of 11 was horribly disappointed all around. So unhappy and SO expensive for poor food. Dont EVER order the poutin fries.  Tasted like a cafeteria microwave meal with dog food on it.  Nasty

D7EyNSuUcduuj04IoGxE5g.text: I got the Farmhouse burger sans cheese and it was perfectly cooked and delicious! The fries were excellent as far as steak fries go even though they're not my favorite. The service really was excellent also! The waitress was very attentive! The only negative is the line to wait is right next to the beautiful fire display - I totally don't mind waiting but it feels like you are waiting in the steaming hot kitchen!  (no pun intended!)

Hgx-xERa9rLp3CJ_WifKWw.text: This is my first tim here and wow the food was amazing! What was more amazing?! Ryan Burch our server! He made excellent recommendations as well as provided excellent attentiveness. The next time I come back I have high expectations as Ryan Burch set the standard and made the experience memorable!!

9fZV1UheZWEJCd-dVY9AUA.text: We decided to have dinner here last night after the Britney concert. We had to wait about 20 minutes and were seated at the bar. The bartenders were great and attentive. I ordered the wings and my husband ordered the ultimate cheese burger and onion rings. Best we have ever had. Everything was fresh and cooked perfectly.

k5iSrMgWWfT0ZOnIeP4mSQ.text: I am a sucker for a good burger and the first time I came here, I was beyond satisfied. The service was great, I never had to hound a server down like I do at some other restaurants. I sat at the bar and I love the fact that all of the workers were genuinely smiling, having a great time and getting along, stress-free. It created an exciting and very joyful experience and I will be going back.  Burger suggestion: The Hog Burger

sAGvn2GkXAgq3MTosGJ1Nw.text: I really want to give this place high marks, because the food was fantastic. The foie gras burger was definitely the best burger I've ever eaten, but there were two things that bugged me about my visit. The glass that my beer was served in was not very clean, and had visible food residue from the previous customer on it. I'm pretty sure I got sick from it, and looking back I should have asked for a new glass, but it was pretty hard to get a hold of our waiter. Speaking of which, it took nearly 20 minutes for our waiter to come collect our bill. It was a busy day, but I feel like a restaurant with a high-profile name like Gordon Ramsay on the front should be able to handle a full load of customers with little to no difficulty.   Overall I was satisfied with the food, but the service and cleanliness could definitely be improved upon.

ClC53nakL4fzRCv7fUbRuQ.text: Casual, sports bar feel.  Friendly service.  Yummy burgers and really great truffle fries!

eIVEi7a156vszHywL6y7nA.text: Currently at the restaurant. Friday 3/9/18 only reason why I'm rating low because the food is above 30 minutes and not out yet. A table came after us and got the food before. The server is nice as well as the Hostess who walked us to the table.

Gw4D5XzJRVn8Sr5D4lUduA.text: I am a big fan of chef Ramsay and wanted to go here when I was in Vegas. This is a great place to have a burger but there was a long wait. The time it took in line to sit at the bar was about 25 minutes. When I sat down the bartender informed me the burgers take about 20-30 minutes to come out. He was accurate but the wait was worth it.  The burger was cooked to perfection and tasted great!  I was so full from the burger I couldn't even finish the fries.  The bartenders were also very friendly and personable.

kEnuwqfvWjJNXPuWd4gKMw.text: Ate here on our wedding night! My husband LOVES this place. Every time we are in Vegas he suggests eating here. The jalapeno poppers are super HOT!!!!! Burgers are creative and always delicious. The truffle fries are a must. I suggest splitting everything, portion sizes are too much for one person.

fq-wRbykirXx4siMwxn0yQ.text: Long wait-time for very slow service and an average burger makes this an over-rated, over-hyped tourist restaurant just to check off a celebrity owned Vegas restaurant. Biggest issue here is the service. Our 45-minute wait time on a Friday afternoon was expected, but it took 1 hr between ordering and our food to come out, and an addional 20 min to get the bill after requested. There are a ton of workers buzzing but hardly come around - even just to refill water, let alone order. Fries are thick-cut, and average. Burger was good....but worth $15...no, however they did cook it to a great medium-rare. Curried shrimp salad was big for $15 with lots of shrimp and spiced well.  Ordered -Hell's Fire Burger -Backyard Burger -Curried Shrimp Salad

LyHTSgLustqkUnuAKDXpbw.text: This used to be one of my favorite lunch places when I am in Las Vegas.  Previously this restaurant was named Gordon Ramsey Burgr.  The quality of food and cleanliness has gone down substantially since the name change.  The Fire decor at the front of the restaurant is so dirty and grungy.  The sweet potato fries were hard not soft and crispy.  The dipping sauce for the fries tasted fishy.  The Hog Burger was still very good.  Service was still excellent.

4VYQCxQkh5CS4MwxlsLcOw.text: Tried this place because we'll they have a celebrity chef owner and would like to see why so many people are waiting for a hamburger.  Well to start off her the chef recommendation. It's huge and worth it.  The other burger in the menu are smaller than the chef recommendation but it's cheaper.  Fries are good size and looks fresh.  Server is friendly and attentive.  I'm surprised how smiling they are even though the place are packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. With my daughter treating her burger craving

iBk0UzCbGYTrzm7bczrYGg.text: Two people in my party complained about the food but mine was pretty good.  It's a neat atmosphere and my meal was what I expected.  I do think it's overpriced for what you get.  However the burger is really good.

NcbvTOQVDBWQvZEW6aahZQ.text: Really over the top for a burger place, fine fast food if you will, everything from decor down to the burger bun was perfected, the quality beef, the perfectly melted cheese, the spicy pesto, the fries, the curry ketchup that came with the fries, really unique. We get so used to burgers being this widely available junk food, this place gave the burger its glory back, will definitely be back.

dv12fZD32edQYsHIeA9f5g.text: From the moment we walked it we knew it would be fantastic! When you have a hostess like Evelyn who greets you in such a warm and friendly manner it sets the tone for an incredible dining experience. IMO Evelyn should be put on the fast track to management training. She certainly has the people skills.  And of course the food and dining service is as always marvelous.

MNsXxiRKu9poP4cCbgN5rw.text: Came here Thursday evening at 8pm and the wait to get a table was about an hour. We got a table around 9. The line moved depressingly slow -- mostly due to the fact that they gave priority for reward card holders.   We ordered onion rings ($9), Hell's Kitchen burger ($15) and the UK burger ($15), and a beer ($8). The onion rings came out pretty good, and fast, though $9 is overpriced for onion slices and batter. Both the UK and the Hell's Kitchen burger were decadent and pretty tasty but I was a bit disappointed, I guess I expected more, like more complex flavors. Also, a few bites into the Hell's Kitchen burger, I realized that the avocado was missing. We were sitting at the counter top, so I called the nearest waitress over and told her about the missing ingredient. Without saying anything she went over to the set up table and handed me a small ramekin with a small avocado sliced, said maybe a curt sorry, and hurried away. Even our waitress took a good 10-15 minutes to get us our check after we finished. They all seem so busy that, other than the water boy that came over frequently to refill out glasses, I don't feel like we've been given enough attention.

We  tried different things to save the bland burgers, like dipping it ranch, adding salt, and adding truffle fries  but  no avail.  So back to ol faithful (Burger Bar!)

Zm0g6y0obOFSD4W7TfZvQQ.text: Starting from the beginning,   we waited maybe 15 minutes to be seated.  1STAR seating was nice and comfortable  2 STAR waitress fast, attentive, and happy to answer the wife's 1,000 questions with a smile.  3 STAR Additional wait staff did not allow our drinks to get low  4 STAR FOOD WAS AMAZING  5 STAR  This place was more then we expected. We waited forever to try this place. My wife went outside her comfort zone and surprisingly wasn't disappointed. She has very picky taste and to please her is a challenge and this place did it with ease.   We will be back and we will spread the word to our friends and family in TX!!!

FNF1E5TsZh_1tb6X0rx5UA.text: A little pricey and I think the sides are even better than the burgers.  If you're looking for a great burger there are less expensive options.  But sometimes you need a fun Gordon Ramsay experience.    Everybody who has tried the farm burger loves it.  Get the onion rings. Amazing.

3zOKIo49zV56vA0Ud8a1mA.text: So much food- Tip the fries comes as a large portion. We ordered one for the two of us and it was filling. The burger blends are amazing.

J_7w7hgxOhIhItLCied31A.text: I make sure to eat here every time I am in Vegas. I am a huge Gordon Ramsay fan so I may be biased but I think this restaurant is fabulous. It is so affordable and the burgers are to die for. Most recently I ordered the 'Patriot Burger' which was actually a turkey burger and it was amazing. I also really enjoy the 'Caribbean Dream' drink. Although I'm not positive what is in it, it is delicious.  Atmosphere and decor are different and fun. Good for families or date-night.

_I49ALy5KDvYQds_zj_T7g.text: It was good. I liked the bun and burger itself but all the toppings were kind of bland. The fries were probably my favorite part of the meal. And for being Vegas, I didn't remember thinking it was crazy expensive.   And that's all I have to say about that.   Jackee

RaF9DzqZCOxXT0cFu2-L7g.text: Had a Curried Shrimp Salad on my visit! Are at the bar and had great service! My drinks were perfect and the salad was memorable. Delicious big shrimp with tasty dressing, almonds and apples. No it's not a burger...it is still worth a visit!

iQItk8xXdCdbCtu7DIHZRw.text: We ordered the shrimp lobster burger and it was one of the most amazing burgers I've ever eaten. The burger was juicy and full of flavor. It came with truffle fries which was very good as well. The wait time was long but we were prepared for that.

K9hsh5G8dOKJFPPKqlpaDA.text: Gluten free bun for a delicious but expensive burger.  The meat was tender and well seasoned.  The staff was understanding of my gluten situation and had no problems recommending how to place an order that was safe for me.  Kudos.

jl-m8oL-lb4txsUcvtOVpA.text: Totally overrated and completely overpriced. I had the Backyard burger and my husband had the Mediterranean burger. Nothing special. Ordered fries as well and they were soggy and their homemade ketchup was less than desirable. After waiting over half an hour for our food and due to the lack of quality we definitely won't be back.

NY8exF4Q8ozZqYL4zhgPGA.text: The location was great in Planet Hollywood where we stayed. The burgers looked great. Considering  we waited for them to be cooked. My burger was not hot and it just came off the grill. My husband was in the middle of eating his. I contacted the manager. I informed her I waited for the burger to be cooked and I an in the restaurant so why was my burger not hot. She was accommodating and I waited for another burger to be cooked. The second won was hot. She said they have to be at a certain temperature. I understand but it still should be hot. It seemed it was pre cooked an d tossed on the grill to heat up but not hot all the was through. I love burger from medium well to well done. This on was requested well done. I had sauteed onions and no bacon or fancy topping added to it.  I didn't see anything special about the burger but  a bit over priced for the name.

zKj8IVrYw_sc_CDVcZiPCw.text: I know I have written a review of this place before because we eat there each trip.  I think it used to be Gordon Ramsay "burgR", with no "E"????  (This is driving me nuts, I know it used to have no E!).  We look forward to this and make this place a stop each time in Vegas. The burgers really are that good.  The wait this time was ridiculous, over 2 hours at some times!  Luckily on Friday at about 6pm the line was only 30 minutes so we again got our burger groove on.  Our server (can't remember his name) but he was spot on, super friendly and helpful and very attentive.  It's hard to have this type of attitude when a place is as busy as this place is so kudos to great service.   The only downside to this visit is that some of the past menu items are gone.  :-(   No more Euro burger, it was a favorite and the new lineup of shakes is missing some of the old and best ones!  We actually declined on getting a shake this time due to there only being 2 offered that just did not sound so great.  We never get the fries as they are really expensive and quite frankly better at any Habit Burger.  Nothing special with them at all.  Sorry Gordon, the chips just ain't happening.  I wish the server would have told me that the "house wine" was $14 per glass when I ordered it, I might have changed my mind as it was really nothing special.  I guess I should learn to ask first.  Burgers = A+

tlkrq18lFPUMlWIQ3Isu8A.text: The burger was great but the service did not come close to the expectations of a restaurant with Gordon Ramsey in the name.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JE104s-3kYejnBstgDnErw.text: The quality of the food is worth the prize. Burger is delicious and the meat is juicy and tender and packed with flavor melts in your mouth delicious. Fries and onion rings are nice a crispy on the outside and soft in the inside. Dipping sauces are flavorful too...worth the wait.

RTbI7QtiZPQ-GYlQVIDg7w.text: My husband and I were in Vegas for our 28th Anniversary attempted dinner but the line was soooo long. We were told it was the best. Hell I gave it 5 stars just by the people waiting to eat there.

l8FibN0TwDns2n033Cjncw.text: Great place for a burger. I tried their plant-based Impossible Burger, which was fantastic and worth the $6 up-charge. Portions are huge, which makes up for the above-average cost for a burger. Loved the onion rings and the Parmesan fries as well.   Great ambiance and feel in the restaurant. Plus, it is connected to the Miracle Mile mall, so you can shop there and then stop here for food. Would recommend this as one of the many must-try burger places in Vegas.

SCEG1mJakA40Lkct8okL7g.text: Had high expectations about this place but food was not cooked to order. The meat was too dry.

lRR4nc7FUmJyHu-Dv2Dosw.text: I was really excited to try this place with my husband. We were seated at the bar & ordered within 5 mins of being seated. We waited 30 mins for our beers, when we asked our bartender/waitress where the beers were she said she forgot about them. We waited 60 more mins & 2 groups who sat after us were already getting their food. We asked our bartender/waitress how much longer for our food & she asked where I tab was, we told her she never gave us one, she forgot to put our food order in. Needless to say we asked for our beer tab & left. Thankful the other bartender was nice & apologized & just told us he'd take care of the beers. Super disappointed that due to bad service we didn't get to eat here.

-eHfQkxVco_BGHXOpJeByg.text: The service was awesome. The recommendations on point. Get a medium burger. Live your life (we didn't die) and it was amazing. Get two burgers. Skip the fries. The hot wings will melt your tits off. Ugh still thinking about how good the burgers were....it obviously is a very busy place but the best restaurant in planet Hollywood for sure.

kk-aaFMlSFveqwXqSr_6Bg.text: We ordered the blue cheese burger and was so good and the Parmesan fries was to die for...

M4iq-4KWgY_OfN86p5uwuQ.text: We got there around 10:40 and asked for a table of 5, the wait was very short and our food arrived in a good amount of time. Definitely had high expectations bc its Gordan Ramsay's restaurant. The burgers were delicious and the sauce that came with the fries tasted different. Will come back on my next trip to vegas!

O3KwQo_TlCohep9Ah01tQA.text: Hands down the best burger I've ever had. My boyfriend and I shared the truffle fries and they were phenomenal! We were just back in Vegas and disappointed that we didn't eat here again. We'll definitely go back next time we're there. There was a really long line so we sat at the bar but the service was still great there. We enjoyed watching them prepare everything. Gordon himself even stopped in which was awesome. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.

vYrmGkMuQ2YJDC28y144UA.text: place is overpriced and shiite food. ramsey is a sharmutta simply amazed by georges collection of boys n girls.

1mSMe3elbKfd5szIjng0zA.text: Gordon Ramsey's Resturant at the planet Hollywood casino has the best burgers in the world. Whatever burgers they are they are the best. I love the different cheese selection. If you're looking for a good quality burger for a good price you need to visit this resturant.

_qDguMRkAPFU_Otfv1vQNw.text: This is between 3-4 stars. I have eaten here before and experienced much better than service/ food. We waited in line for a party of two for half an hour. Then it took another half hour to get our food.  The burger this time around just didn't cut it for me. Truffle fries were OK. Sweet potato fries are always good. Can't go wrong with those. Fairly priced for a burger spot in Vegas, especially when a celebrity chefs name is on the joint. Props to them for keeping the pricing decent.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries

_FNz2qd3e8AfqEv1jzVwOg.text: With this famous name stamped on everything, I would expect everything to be better. The burger had no real seasoning aside from the taste of the toppings. The Parmesan truffle fries were also disappointing, because they were kind of burnt and the sauces that came with it were odd. The place looked great, but my brother and husband agreed that the food could be better.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CuP3DGCCflvPlR88bIduLA.text: I'm not gonna lie. I'm not GR follower so my expectations were nominal. We got right in on a Monday evening at prime time dinner time. The night before we passed by & there was a HUGE line way out into the casino. So I'd recommend reservations for sure. The burgers were stunning. Stacked high with toppings & a fresh baked bun. I had the lobster shrimp burger that was tasty wasn't impressive. It was on the dryer side due to preparedness. The rest of the table had juicy, delish perfectly prepared burgers. Kind of jealous I didn't order a more traditional burger. The table ordered & shared fries, sweet potato fries & onion rings. The fries were all thick cut crispy outside & pillowy delish potato on the inside & the dipping sauces were yum. The onion rings had a crispy beer batter & also a couple of traditional dipping sauces. The cocktails were as delicious as the were strong. The check did have a Vegas GR price tag on it so come prepared to spend some cash & enjoy your burger.

c1f-rRhOt37vexpkrrcs_Q.text: My friend had been here before and wanted to take me there. We had quite a wait. Our server was so friendly and that always makes for a nice experience. The burger was good. The beer battered onion rings and truffle fries-ABSOLUTELY delicious!!!!

c-NnVqSpeyN-si5P4AyX2Q.text: I must say great experience from their service to their food AMAZING everything we ordered was cooked to perfection and their  juices we were made fresh absolutely recommend trying this restaurant out u won't be disappointed

lrCjc-okPhcaMIlKXm9-Jw.text: The burgers were fantastically delish. Almost as good as in-n-out! Sure, I'd rather have an in-n-out burger at a fraction of the price but we were celebrating bff birthday. Fun, loud place. Long wait but why be in a rush when you're in Vegas.

eam9pYuqnUmGg-0XN1BlcQ.text: Our group of friends from Seattle last night came for dinner. Everything was excellent. They sat our party of 7 within 10 minutes. The burgers and drinks were delicious. To top it off our server Adam was very friendly and punctual. We will definitely be back before we leave!

lMlXlZsdGHbsNRHPEPzP9A.text: If you're in line waiting to get in or debating whether to get in line, don't!!!!!  You will end up walking out wondering why you did that.  One of the worst burger and fries I've ever had.  Simple order, a cheeseburger no bun with a side of avocado and a fried egg, that's it!   I got a piece of meat that tasted like it came from Safeway, a soft boiled egg not even on the burger, and I kid you not a sliver of avocado.  Server agreed it was ridiculous and did the right thing.  Go Elsewhere, hek even the salad at the hotel cafe had 2 pieces of avocado!

VnHO_byuOKKlcylZFT_Y-w.text: Bad service.  Slow service.  EVERYTHING was far over cooked - even the fires.  We had to wait 18 minutes to even send anything back.  Awful!  Try something else.

dKxHJEnZg1wDfsEQ18Lw8A.text: First impression wasn't great. While waiting in a line sucks, watching others constantly skip the line is frustrating. You can skip the line too we were told - if you let the casino open a credit card in your name.  This means that while you're told 20 minute wait you're really standing in like for nearly an hour, in front of a roasting gas flame too (to give the Hell's Kitchen aesthetics, but is terrible placement for a line). I have to point this out the lines wait because while we were waiting at end of the line the hostesses continued to tell people 20 minutes and I'd keep interjecting "we've been waiting nearly an hour" so those people's expectations could be more accurate. It felt they were being disingenuous to people who may have plans/shows to go to. In the end they also stopped offering people tables (except to those skipping the line) and could only offer chefs bar seating.  Once we sat down for the meal it was prepared quickly however my party agreed the burgers were really nothing special. My own Hell's Kitchen burger was kinda ruined by the half-an-avocado which just kind of slides out as you try to eat, pulling the toppings out.  The one great aspect of the food was the truffle fries and onion rings. Those truly were great, and we agreed we're worth waiting in line.  Unfortunately at the end of the night the computers all went down and no one had any orders or bills so waitresses had to go around asking for orders again to calculate bills - then said people needed to pay with cash or else they'd need to go find those carbon-copy mechanical-slide credit card machines. Wasnt a great final impression.

vvaEs0BRxihhzBejQqoXug.text: Have eaten here before and was content waiting in line, however service was under par. Once sat, the first comments out of the waitresses mouth were "prepare to wait another 40 minutes to get your burger" We ordered drinks right away but it took 15 to 20 minutes to get those to us. The staff appeared to be unorganized. Our waitress was inattentive, not really checking in with us at all. After 40 minutes we recieved our burgers which were cooked perfectly and very delicious, however overall was not a good experience. Plates could use some updating as the Gordon Ramsey logo was very worn.

wF0OH6nc5pZ4AegidM06Mw.text: Been to Steak and Pub a few times-this was the first trip to Burger. Had the Hells Kitchen Burger, a regular Cheese Burger, regular fries, and Onion Rings.  So the highlight of the meal is definitely the onion rings!  Amazing. I would go back just for them. Fries were mediocre at best (way better at Pub). The ketchups are interesting... I would have preferred regular- but they don't have it (eye roll). The burgers were cooked well, nothing special. The HK burger had really good/hot green chile - and I'm from New Mexico and know my green chile. The peppers on it (poblano?). I could have definitely done without. Shakes were amazing as well!  Filling!!

i-KUml7Pz0ZWX7LLDAQN2Q.text: The name Gordon Ramsay doesn't add up to the burger. The bread and the meat were not better than Shake Shack. Dissapointed and overrated

mPiFAL94cFbCl0M9m70LRA.text: So good and so juicy. Very large fries that was good for 3 people. Ypu need to wait in line if you a couple but definitely recommend.

I3v-2z9gM0gKsGpXUXXJgw.text: Decent ingredients, burger was undercooked, fries were great, server was attentive.  Restaurant is on the border of the casino, so the smell of cigarette smoke still permeates into the restaurant.

1eYl6MNVAzqvkN-Qg8yyzw.text: This is the best piece of food I ever put in my mouth . I've never ate a stake that taste this good . I had the farm burger . We also got garlic parm fries and sweet potato fries . Both were excellent but even with four people I recommend just getting the burgers . With the fries it was to much food. This is a can't miss if your in Vegas . I wanted to go back before we left but ran out of time .

Y3rVL0m5OOMJMSq9TGDTFA.text: This was my third visit to GR Burger. First two were amazing. This one no so much. Burger was great. Fries were over cooked. Sent them back and they came over cooked again so we gave up. Server seemed to forget us too. Started well. Then waited over 20 minutes for a refill. I used to look forward to coming here whenever I visited Vegas but don't think I am coming back.

CtX09rxxbRd0hs8IdeEqNQ.text: The place feels a little more elevated and fancy. The fire by the doors gives it a True Gordon Ramsay feel. I waited in line and it moved rather quickly as long as you are in a party of two. They have to move tables to sit more than two people which is understandable. I got the crown burger which just melted in my mouth. My friend got the Hell burger. The server was great and took the initiative to have both burgers cut in half for us to share. Both were amazing in their own way. If you love burgers, check this place out. It's unbelievable. Highly recommend and plan to return.

91ELDxgStjjujtXh49cGgw.text: AMAZING burgers!!! Definitely will come back here when I come to Vegas next ;) Great service even tho they were super busy!! Sweet potato fries were to die for!

lUV9UdjAF0JU10O0cSKpYw.text: This was our second time eating at this location. Our first was a year ago. Last year we enjoyed it. We ate lunch and had generous portioned salads that were fresh and good. On Sun. night Sept.9, 2018 we arrived at 9:00. We had about a 40 minute wait in a line. My husband loves good burgers. I don't eat a lot of meat but was confident that I could find something to eat. They have 4 salads, one with curried shrimp. I wanted something hot, not a cold salad. On the menu, above the burger Iist I read, "substitute the Vegetarian Impossible Burger Patty for an additional $6. Since the hamburgers range in price from $15-$22 that is ridiculous! One is being punished for not eating meat. So...I ordered the only other thing which was A Fish and Crisps Burger for $16. When it came it was not hot but warmish. Cod is supposed to be flaky and WHITE. This was mushy and had a lot of tan- brownish color inside. I really don't think it was very fresh or cooked with much attention. I told my husband who is very knowledgeable about fish. He tried it and said it wasn't good. I left half on the plate. I never did discover what the crisps were. They were on top of the sandwich. So basically it was fish with crunch on top....NOTHING ELSE ON IT--NO TARTAR, NO MAYO, NO LETTUCE. NO TOMATO! What were the crisps??? Not French fried onions. They had no flavor. Not good alone or on the fish. If you look closely at their burgers, the huge buns are to deceive you into thinking you're getting a gigantic burger. Not really the case.We won't go back! Too many other great spots. This is my first review of a restaurant. Couldn't ignore! Waiter was nice, but never filled our drinks or asked if things were ok.

EoYAIfOytyNYEkwPy8NQ5A.text: HUGE disappointment!  Come on, GR!  You may want to come check on this restaurant of yours.....  Server Ryan- rude.  Food- eh.  Would I return?  Probably not.  Mentioned to my Uber driver that we had been there and she said it's a common thing to hear her riders say they were disappointed with their experience.  I will say though,  the glass fire wall was super cool!

hvVTHKpq6WCUDyKmH6TBsQ.text: Awesome service, up to par food quality. Will def come back when in town! We had the F word burger which is a new burger that hasnt even been added to the menu was the bomb!!! And also the hell wings best buffalo i have ever tried! Im not a fan of buffalo sauce so asked for it on the side jeez!!!! Was delicious!!! We split both plates with my husband and we were soooo full after! People may think is expensive but we are from San Francisco so these are in the cheapest/average prices for us but the portion size is at all comparing to SF here are huge!!! So at the end we save money... win win...

9cpGa6K2ALGATywmMAo4Dw.text: The Oreo shake was the best I've ever had. Get that. Burger was pretty good, but I'm not sure it's worth the big price tag. Chicken wings were also amazing.

Yya32wZJ9-bCACUCLvBVaA.text: Probably one of the best burgers I've ever had. The rings and fries, not so much. Definitely a little pricey. So, burger 5 stars, atmosphere 5 stars, server 5 stars, rings/fries 3 stars, value 4 stars. I live near Bobby's Burgers and we eat there often, this burger was definitely better, but I paid for it. Had the fries/rings matched the burger, I would have given 5 stars.

JISfRB3cU8rlzbTzfOcB6g.text: Definitely worth a detour if you love burgers. Their burr here are always juicy and well built. Recently had the backyard burger, a simple burger with cheese lettuce and tomato. This let's you taste and enjoy the meat without too many other flavors...well worth it. Also had the wheat berry quinoa salad with chicken skewers. Only complaint about that was the chicken. Taste was great but had a lot of fat and cartilage on it. If you like lean white meat it won't suit your tastes. Or maybe that was just our order.   Truffle park fries complemented the burger well. Also they have an impressive beer list which was great. They also carry la fin du monde on draft which was a nice surprise.

xvT45lNWjK5OD6C5-y-eMQ.text: Food was great and worth the wait! Staff was friendly and helpful. Definitely recommend you give it a shot, you'll probably be back for more! I got the hell's burger and two orders of fries for the table we would've been okay with just one for us three. Not expensive compared to other restaurants we've visited on our trip to Vegas.

dWRcV3xdF-Rdxm2N8xDO1Q.text: I was so worried that this place would be overrated! I am glad to report, this place is not overrated at all!! The Hog Burger was absolute amazingness, the truffle parmesan fries compete with the burger. We also tried the Farmhouse burger, which was very goood....but not as amazing as the Hog Burger. Next.....we noticed many ordering the creme brulee oreo shake, so of course we tried the creme brulee oreo shake and it also lived up to the goodness of this place! It was pricey, $75 for 2 burgers, fries, shake and a beer, not including the tip; but it was very much worth it. It's Vegas....so $75 on lunch vs a slot machine is a win for me!

r6S6DHpqp8Cu22LfjOx6-Q.text: Everything was good except the seafood burger. It was really weird and did have a good taste.

0KWK5jINBxz_sem1TWGy-g.text: Great burger and would recommend when you're looking for a nice juicy burger. It is the hotel and you need to walk around to get there. We were seated quickly but when we left around 7 there was a line and I had read they usually have lines. So go earlier if you can.   Service was just okay. But again, recommend if you're in the food for s burger! The sweet potatoes are also so tasty.

zBrJw3RQgwPTC8PRsYVQrw.text: Decided to have our last meal in Vegas here. Waited in line for about 15 minutes which wasn't to bad. Ordered the Crown Burger and the Blue Cheese burger, the burgers were cooked well bit disappointed as was expecting more flavour in the burgers. Also sampled the truffle fries which were delicious. The meal was expensive and not sure if worth the money

UJN8gYxXyG7C3EcS5mqTIw.text: The burgers were very good. We had the spring special - Jamie was our server, he was personal yet very professional. No one in our party was disappointed! Philip McDermott idolizes Gordon!

gmhpzxZNZ3eVnStE1gFRoQ.text: Wasn't as great as I thought it would be. The onion rings had too much bread and they were too salty. The burger wasn't all that good. Spent all that money and ate none of it. I ended up going to White Castle. You can NEVER go wrong with them

6j2iYwlpej6bRql1bmIc_g.text: Highly disappointed in the change in the menu. Less selection than what there was 4 years ago. Sat at the bar since I was by myself. The bar tender (Robert) was less than attentive and doesn't remember an order. Doesn't know the menu either, when asked what is in one of the menu items, he couldn't recall. As a professional bartender one of the BIGGEST skills needed is the ability to mingle with the clientele, to start and carry on conversations to help pass the time and also entertain a little. For some reason the ART of suggestive selling to help guide the guest through an experience has been lost.  I ordered the Hells Kitchen burger Medium Rare (The only way to order a burger)at 17:45(according to the time on the ticket) delivered at 18:19 (time on my phone when it arrived)wow what a long time. It was cooked to Medium Rare+ (just on the outside cusp of Medium Rare edging towards Medium). The flavor profile was somewhat bland with the exception of the mild heat from the roasted jalapeno and roasted tomato. The beef had absolutely no flavor. The fries were warm (not hot) and quickly cooled to a spongy soft potato. The flavor of salt and herb quickly disbursed. No follow up to insure the meal was prepared to satisfaction nor was a follow performed for either of the two guest sitting next to me.  The 2 guest sitting next to me were also displeased with their experience as we entered into a conversation about their experience after I spoke up and mentioned an incident to a bartender (explained below). I informed a bartender that the guest to my left burger was over cooked and the bartender seemed dumbfounded and when I explained what a medium temperature should look like the bartenders response was "I don't know, I'm just a bartender". Wow - that really sealed it for me. My experience was ruined.. A moment later the guest was asked if they wanted to have the manager come by.(WOW really!! There should be NO question there a manager should have been informed immediately without asking anyone)  To add insult to injury, when a different bartender uses a bar towel to wipe his head and then leave the towel for future use on the bar that kind of turns my stomach. When I confronted that bartender his reply was (I wasn't using it) then I explained that he had JUST wiped down the back bar top with that very same towel  he just turned, shook his head in disapproval and said OK and took the towel and put it away.   Overall, this experience was disappointing and only confirmed by the disappointment with 2 other guests dinning at the same time. It is obvious that Mr. Ramsey no longer is involved in this concept and the company that now owns the restaurant is milking the name for all they can. Overpriced drinks ($15 for a cocktail), poor quality of product and execution along with a poor service level brings this experience to a close.  I was SO looking for a great experience like the one I remembered from years past. Unfortunately that didn't happen. It causes concern for my next experience coming up Ramsey's Prime Steak House (I have reservations in a couple of days)..

94QHo71aRN1yCdWxTgx2_w.text: I went to the one at Hollywood planet.    Burger was very good but customer service is so bad. I know Gordon Ramsay places always have wonderful service, I don't know what's wrong with this place.

JHPFN2XhcogEduBaT3aedQ.text: This location you can save a few bucks compared to some other options in the area but if you're not careful can definitely blow up your wallet.  The burgers here really are top notch quality! Lamb burger was super juicy and moist! Just be prepared to fork over some cash.  The irish nachos were subpar, the cheese sauce is amazing but the pork had inedible chunks of fat on them.

VNZQO4nTWlPVE3NC5bpAFA.text: OK so let me start by saying I stayed at planet Hollywood Hotel and I decided to eat here with my mom. Especially by the amount of people that were waiting in line to get in.  So I assumed it would be amazing. We each got a burger and we told the hostess to put it to go  because There was a long wait for a table . But what I didn't know is that our food literally took  like 40 minutes or more. Once we got it we saw that it didn't come with fries or chips or anything. Just a big box for a plain tiny burger. That doesn't have a taste to it and the worst part is that it was raw in the centerof the meat. I was so disappointed especially for the price that you pay for it. I guess i was just paying for his name.

0QdLwSt69YvnR_HasfssHw.text: Best burger my daughter has ever had! All 4 of us tried different burgers. Yummy! Cesar's salad was great we split it this is half size! Want to find out if he has other burger restaurants anywhere else! Want to go back!

TEyOphAyMl3YAFxbK-N2mg.text: Atmosphere was fun and the service was great.   The onion rings were a big hit at our table. Unfortunately, two of the three burgers we ordered were overcooked. Outside of that, it's a good restaurant and fun place to eat.

MgSdf8aWdR6rsJcQVlhYAg.text: Great burgers for a tourist but hang onto your wallet! Mucho denero!  If U are really craving a Unique burger this is your place for a date! Right up the street is Fatburger for half the price and just as good!

bpGB31FRGsH4a4tQA55ulQ.text: What can I say.. there are mortal burgers and there is hog !!!  The chef takes us by hand into a mangalitsic triple delight. To start with, a moist succulent pork patty wrapped in bacon topped with slow smoked/ braised pork brisket with melted white cheddar sandwiched between toasted seeded buns. Cabbage tarragon mayo slaw coupled with crispy onions flavored with garlic, paprika, and cayenne as delectable toppings. Bread and butter pickles cutting through the saltiness of the bacon and sweetness of the brisket, completes the scrumptious package. Hog burger is definitely an ambrosial experience to relish in spite the long line to get in.   Gordon Ramsay Burger at Planet Hollywood is an urban casual spot for a gourmet burger with ambiance mirroring the peppy energy of Vegas.   Recommended, Cheers!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog burger !!!!

iN4Ar0KZ--YeRedHrV-OMA.text: This is a great location with a wonderful upbeat menu.   There are multiple choices for burgers as one would expect as well. As many other main course selections.  The appitizers are a plenty and well worth the attention as Everthing has explosive tastes.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos with short ribs and tasty chicken appitizers

3JJ1nVHYjHbHtNF-rOKa9Q.text: The burger is not worth the price or the wait.  It is a $5 burger thinking that it is a $15 burger.  You ONLY get the burger.  Fries are an extra charge starting off a $7.  The place is noisy that makes communication with friends and staff difficult. Find someplace else where to eat.

9Se1kMA-bHoI0BoRt4JUBw.text: I heard so much about this place and decided to try it out. I got the "Hell's Kitchen" burger and it's dressed with avocados, cheese, roasted jalapeno, roasted tomatoes, and jalapeno aioli. Wow. Best burger I've ever had!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l78exeBWKJTymITiOvlVdA.text: This place was AMAZING! Totally worth the wait! (Though the wait wasn't even that long). My husband and I sat at the counter in front of the kitchen (where most people seemed to not want to sit) but I really enjoyed it! It was interesting to see how it all worked back there. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger, it was sooooo tasty! So much flavor, cooked just perfect! Definitely one of the BEST burgers I've ever had. I also ordered their speciality cocktail which was a cinnamon pear sangria, I wish I could order this drink everywhere! It tasted amazing. All in all a great experience here! Definitely planning to come back! Tip: unfortunately, you cannot make reservations here so make sure you give yourself plenty of time to wait for a table.

ZthSQtrf3xaBXFTkA2ejhw.text: Went here when I got my wisdom teeth pulled out and it was a great experience! Really enjoyed the cheeseburger I got from here and the Oreo milkshake, really made my day better! Service for superb and the food was awesome. Wish I didn't live so far, I'd come all the time!

slQ_2189N1dwI1b4OfNWmw.text: Burgers are good. I ordered a hog burger and liked it. My friend ordered the hell's burger and it was good too (if you like spicy). Fries and crepe brulee drink were alright. Like the fire display out front too.

A_2ckrTbDMEPFnkOXrr-iA.text: i have eaten only one time food is excellent i enjoyed the backyard burger ($15), sweet potato fries ($9), chocolate caramel tart ($7), pepsi ($4) cost plus tip $45.  if you want the one time experience eating gordon ramseybetter then go. as for a local i am going to in-n-out.

K7-sXy6DvlGzq69AikNkkg.text: The sweet potato fries turned out terrible because they covered them in powdered sugar. The food took an exceptionally long time to make for two burgers, but the burgers themselves were very good. I had the Portobello burger. Our waiter was great :) too pricey for Burgers and fries though.

Rk3noJL82Ne-5yoohk6K-Q.text: Forest Burger is life...yum. One star off because it's a little hard to get a table and it took us two tries to make it to get seated. Really good!

UxjaGh2jNtVy8dvPSwAkgA.text: Called while walking from the top of Planet Hollywood to the bottom (where the restaurant is located) to check on making a reservation and wait time. Jessica stated that they did not take reservations, that there was currently in line, though she did not promise it would not change. As it took me and my family less than 6min to get there after the call I was not worried. When we arrived, there was a huge line. When I went to the front desk, the person in charge was rude and dismissive. I asked why if I had called less than 6min ago they didn't inform me that it would be a 40min wait with a possibility that they would close before my family and I could go in. He stated "I don't know why someone would say that, this like has been that big all day today." And walked away without a knife ounce of acknowledgment that Jessica had messed up and furthered ruined our plans. It was terrible customer service and there was no need to lie.

ODsOcOU1ABdBh-kAZ0msMg.text: Jessica the hostess should be fired.  She asked me for $20 tip to move my party to the front of the line.  Then when my party waited over 45 mins she handed me my $20 back and said good luck waiting an hour and a half.  Jonathan the manager was quick to take care of us with good service so thank you sir for the great customer service!

mq_r0ROQZDOv2tlgG-lY4w.text: Honestly, I can give 2 stars or even 1 because of the wait time, but the service of the waitresses is very good so I give 3 stars. We came almost 9pm, wait to get the seat for about 30-40 mins. I think since this is a famous restaurant, so it's reasonable. But the burger and the fries came almost 1 hour after we placed the order! I know that the restaurant is busy, but I don't think that it needs more than 30 mins to prepare burger, (especially because of Chef Ramsey's famous image) The waitresses keep coming and check on us and say sorry for the wait, they are very nice and friendly. About the burger itself, I was order the hell's kitchen, it is good and I give it 4 stars for the taste.  But the fries is just ok.

F0xj3vyzfN-UTnZT2J0CyQ.text: Here is my review Chef Ramsay.... I did go to you LV site to have a burger and maybe if I would have followed my own advice I may have had a pleasant experience however I ordered the lobster shrimp burger... Hugh mistake on my part. Lobster and Shrimp are so delicate you have to beware of over seasoning them this location or this chef was not... I wasn't sure if I was eating seafood or sausage the consistency and flavor were that bad, it was unrecognizable, If it was truly Lobster and Shrimp it was over cooked to rubber consistency .... I was very disappointed

xA8S-Y2CdYV6qS5imx8M9w.text: This was the best part of my trip to Las Vegas.!! My wife & I were so excited to eat here. Best food ever!! Next time we are in Vegas this is going to be another for sure stop on our adventures!!

wk61Z3ZJqkGq-Qpe9-rBhQ.text: Disappointed. We arrived at 2:30 but waited for 20mins, which is acceptable cause Ramsay has so many fans. We ordered sweet potato fries, hell kitchen burger, blue cheese burger and farm burger. They are just good/ok/not bad. They are not WOW. Maybe I expect too much

NkShVT3NpfH3U4b53pIGaA.text: This is seriously the best burger I've ever had.  We were so pleased with our meal the first time, when we went back to Vegas a year and a half later, we returned and the burgers continued to live up to what we remembered.  I highly recommend the parmesan truffle fries.

2F0wP2G7LdZLehCX0-fDsQ.text: This place is INCREDIBLE!!! Even though it's always packed with people, they still manage to provide an efficient and fast service. Their burgers are AMAZING! Best burger I've ever had hands down.

V6FRtgh4nskwYELtetZxHg.text: Very very good burger! Ordered the ultimate cheeseburger with veggie fixings and fries. Everything yummy!! Long wait but worth it!

ckg620SK62y9gE3ZP9kRzg.text: Where do I begin so I had the lobster and shrimp burger and that was probably the most delicious burger I've ever had in a long time definitely worth the price!! Got sweet potato fries barely finished them cuz they were so generous with the amount they give lol highly highly treccomend!!

nSPQXqc6xcJENQ6hqOBUsQ.text: I went to this place because of the Gordon Ramsay name. I'm a big fan and the line is always long at this place. I have no complaints about the burger, it is good. However this place is pretty expensive. And keep in mind (atleast when I went there) the sides were not included so if you wanted fries you had to pay separate when most places included this in the price. The sweet potato fries though are great! My biggest disappointment was the desert (we got some sort of pudding) and it tasted just like a high school cafeterias pudding. Other than that I would give this place a shot and I like the design of it.

LTBcaQ9LzB_orELceUcJpA.text: I really had my standards set high considering how many Gordan Ramsay shows I've watched. First, it was difficult for me to find this location considering that I'm a tourist lol. Parking was terrible but that's to be expected I guess. The decor was great. A wall on fire, multiple tvs. But why is it so squished? They truly tried to fit as many tables as they possibly could in here. Since it was the 2 of us we were seated within a minute. The waiter (I think his name was Sergio, I feel bad to have forgotten) was awesome. He let us know the burger would be at least half an hour, so we went ahead and ordered Just fries, truffle Parmesan fries, and the mushroom poutine. The just fries and the mushroom poutine came out first. The fries was deliciously crispy and lightly salted. I wasn't a big fan of their curry ketchup nor the Chipotle ketchup. The mushroom poutine was so bland! All of the toppings, and honestly had no flavor at all. Our waiter made no deal at all about taking it back and the manager came out to apologize and ask if he could get us anything else, so we asked for the sweet potato fries. Ommgggg. They come with a vanilla powdered sugar with its own shaker. SO BOMB. We ordered the Hells Kitchen burger and it came out at the same time as the truffle Parmesan fries. No words. The meat was juicy and just as I ordered, medium well. The chunk of avocado was perfectly ripe and had no imperfections. The avocado sauce it had was full of flavor. The bun was perfectly toasted and soft. The truffle Parmesan fries were amazing!! Bursting with flavor, perfectly crispy! We ended our meal with the chocolate creme brulee shake. Wow. Speechless. The chocolate shake was rich,decadent. I don't even like chocolate ice cream but wow. Our ending total was $68, so for the average person it is pricey, but honestly worth it. The customer service was incredible and I hope they continue to treat every customer the way we were treated.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just fries, mushroom poutine fries (which were bland, and we sent back)

hg79ihEytrjp04CdfDjO7A.text: Holy shit Ramsey! Your food awesome! I love your youtube channel. I have learned so much. But your greeting staff is absolutely fucking terrible!! I have always loved you proficiency, this is not what I accepted from you professional standards. They told us 30min we waited 55min and there where 10 tables open. We were only a part of 2 and 4 parties of 8-12 went before us. What the fuck happened. Sort this out! Horrible just horrible! Rude staff that didn't give to cents about the eager paying customers. Please come down and whip some ass. Turn over the greeting staff ASAP!

HSaL2vQkwhxfEKh4yw6XVg.text: Visited for lunch. Nice atmosphere, didn't have to wait. Ordered the chips with curry sauce to start. Chips were very crispy but great with the sauce, we really enjoyed them. We also ordered the bangers and mash and a burger with cheese, bacon and egg. We both enjoyed our meals and I would recommend this restaurant to others.

FhMc75n71EJc17b-9I9CYQ.text: Came after reading a bunch of good reviews and was extremely disappointed. We arrived a little after midnight and the place was not busy. There were 3 girls at the to be seated booth. We stood there waited to be seated and not one addressed us and ask how many. We looked like idiots standing there until my girlfriend utter maybe we should just go somewhere else. It was then, one of the girls turned around and seated us. Our waiter was good but the lack of service from the beginning really sour the experience. I ordered the farm burger, truffle fries, and wings. Farm burger had no taste, wings was cold, and truffle fries taste old. Aside from our waiter, we would have given this a negative 2 stars. Not what we expected for a Ramsey restaurant.

jLjSGv8VNoZr6Yg6PIdmQA.text: Best burger I've had in Vegas and this is my second time coming here. You get to skip the line for a table if you have diamond or seven star casino status which is great, cause this place is always packed and rightfully so!   Service has been great both times I've been, once at a table and once at the bar. Staff is attentive. Also, attention to detail. When you arrive, the menus/cutlery is displayed the same way. When you get your plate, it is faced with the Gordon Ramsay logo facing you. Small details make allllll the difference!   The onion rings are HUGE and the portion size is fantastic for the money. Def enough for two. I like the touch of the parmesan cheese dusting and the ranch is great, prob made in-house.   Had the blue burger and its pretty incredible. Great pairing of flavors, but even more impressive is the beef! Meat is flavorful and the cook has been on POINT! The medium rare has been perfect twice which is arguably the most important thing to me. Toppings come and p, but the meat should be the star and if it's not cooked right, what is the point??   Will be back next time I'm here. Keep saying I'm gonna try Holstein's, but I can't seem to not go to this place!! Good problem to have!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue burger with Onion rings

n4oo9ZRSvGB1wKQYbEnxXQ.text: I love this place so much. Everything I ate was so delicious. I had the burger of the month (August) ($25) and it was sooo good. It was so full of flavors, just as I expected. The garlic truffle fries ($12) were amazing, I have never tried such a delicious fry. Everything went so well together and the atmosphere was super chill and relaxed. Our waiter, Justin, was super nice and friendly. The creme brulee shake ($10) I got was aaaaammmmaaazzzzzzing..... best burgers. Best fries. Best shakes. I'm pretty sure everything they serve here tastes out of this world. Whenever I watch Gordon Ramsay on tv now I feel like I can taste what he's making and it's awesome lol. Such a great experience, especially if you're a Gordon Ramsay fan, you will not be disappointed!

Y2mCy8dJeQQY7BmVYFyMMQ.text: Given that Gordon Ramsay's restaurants have been awarded 16 Michelin stars in total and currently hold a total of 7...there are expectations for going to a restaurant that has his name on it.  This may explain why lines tend to be longer for this place, but don't get me wrong--it is tolerable (15-30 mins) and for good reasons.  They change their menu design frequently, entrance/line area have a beautiful fire display behind glass walls to enjoy while waiting.  Atmosphere and uniform are cute.  Prices are fair.  They run about $15/burger and sides are ordered like appetizers, with a variety of sauces.    All the food I've had have tasted great.  They also tweek their menu throughout the year, so certain things that you may have had last year may not be available this year (RIP my beloved nutella shake).  The hog burger is good if you're a fan of bacon.  The foie gras was alright...a little too gamey for my preference, but for those who aren't quite as sensitive, you guys might enjoy this a bit more than I do.  The Farm burger is great as well.  The patties for all burgers are always cooked perfectly with just the right amount of seasoning and savory juiciness.  Textures are always great because they're packed with toppings...if you're a plain cheeseburger/hamburger type,  you will most likely not like this place.  I also enjoyed their salads--great flavor while being relatively healthy.  Overall, I'd recommend coming here if you want a decent burger.  I'd also recommend asking the servers for the advice if you're uncertain about items--they're very knowledgeable and service is great.  You can also customize if there are a couple burgers you're in between!  P.S.  They do a military discount!  You're welcome.

88k1RiS1a7-qbIwABOVKpg.text: The combination of ingredients in the veggie burger was new to me. The issue was the amount of blue cheese. There was so much of it that you can barely taste anything else.

TR9gO9mygPgQGaOabD77YQ.text: I was seriously underwhelmed by this place to be honest. I was expecting the food to be better for the cost of the burger. It was definitely a place that you came because you watch the show, but I wouldn't say it was anything to write home about. Although I will say that our service was excellent. Our server gave us great suggestions and checked in with us often.   I would say if you know going into it that you will pay for a really expensive burger, which is mediocre, you won't be too disappointed.

nP_XY4R8CodbTmtNA4Cxrg.text: If you are looking for a great burger, you should try this place.   They didn't get my 5th star because of the long wait after I ordered and the not hot enough fries.   I was eating solo and got seated at the chefs bar so I had a front row view of the kitchen. It was a busy day but many food items came out way before my burger.  When I finally got it, it was worth the wait.  I ordered the just fries and the forest burger.   The burger was cooked to perfection and had just enough toppings of fresh mushrooms and cheese. The bun has a nicely seeded top and grilled.  The just fries come with chipotle ketchup and curry ketchup.   The curry is my fave!  Fun loud atmosphere!

R0u7zQgOGD5_Y9ju-Q9AjA.text: Vegetarian review:  - portabella mushroom burger: this this was fantastic. I mean, for $18, it had better be above and beyond, and it was. There's an aioli and a cheese that was amazing, and the mushroom (you get two caps) is juicy and flavorful. Even the thinly sliced vegetables were good, mostly because they added crunch. The bun was soft, and the sesame seeds, for the first time, actually added to the flavor.  - garlic parm. fries: not as crispy as I would have liked. The texture is more of a soft, chewy, thick-cut fries. The dips- wondrous.  On a Saturday night around 11pm- no wait. Caveat: this was not a popular weekend.  Service: friendly.

yF0QllAozaqKkxE9DmMTPQ.text: We always come here whenever we're in Vegas. The line is hella long but you can cut to the front if representing diamond / platinum card. I highly recommend the Farmhouse Burger & Hell's Kitchen Burger. The restroom is outside of the restaurant so you should ask the staff for direction. The tomato soup is outstanding and is a must try!!!

dUF4NsEn1-vtJRsJi4oWFg.text: The first time when I visited the food served a little slower but the second time was perfect. I had the lamb burger this morning just to give it a try for the new taste ever and its fantastic. This restaurant always super crowded but also really organized. Everything is clean and super interested interior designs.

pVqP7VPWhkhlne1CNwOO1w.text: My return to Gordon Ramsay Burger...formerly known as Burgr when I last visited. Not only did the restaurant get a name change but it added a lot more burgers and appetizers to the menu. Me and my co workers dove into drinks then it was straight to ordering entrees.  We started with the burnt ends poutine and the kettle chip nachos. Those who are fans of black pepper will love the burnt ends poutine. You get a lot of black pepper flavor from the gravy as well as sweet from the pickled onions making it a sweet and savory dish. The kettle chip nachos takes the crown of the two appetizers. The chips are topped with both shredded corned beef and short rib. It's also topped with a flavorful cheddar sauce in contrast to cheese curds on the poutine. The flavors of the three combined were awesome.   For my main I ordered the lobster and shrimp burger. Like the poutine, this burger was a combination of sweet and savory. You get the savoriness from the patty which is made from both lobster and rock shrimp meat while the sweet comes from the pickled onions. There's also some zestiness from the herb aioli. None of the fixings takes away from the patty allowing the flavors of the lobster and shrimp to be front and center. I enjoyed it a lot, too bad there isn't a double patty lobster and shrimp burger haha.   Different name but still the same great food with new additions. I'll be returning as always to get through parts of the menu I've yet to try.  Dinner 4/3/2018

TO3NruAzMJUapOVdFuKxaw.text: I was scared this place wasn't going to live up to the hype but it definitely did ! We waited about 45 minutes in line which went by pretty quickly. The star of the show for me was the burnt ends short rib poutine!! The sauce they drenched it in was amazing, I've never tasted anything like it. I had the foie gras burger and I enjoyed it, but I liked my bfs lobster and shrimp burger more!! The shrimp they used was definitely tiger shrimp. The foie gras was really good too although just a little on the salty side. These four items ran us about $90 which was expected. This place is definitely worth a try, can't wait to try the other GR restaurants next time we visit !

UYOENuCv83xnvF6Mxzu-XQ.text: Simple and Sweet  Located in Planet Hollywood, this fine establishment awaits you. What are they known for ? Burgers. GOOD burgers. I tried the hog burger and the forest burger and both were fantastic! I preferred the hog burger simply because it had more flavor. The pork patty was nicely cooked and reminded me of a breakfast sausage. The bacon with the bbq pork added not only texture but a nice smokiness to go with the patty. The pickles and slaw were slightly sour but rounded out the burger nicely. We also accompanied our burgers with truffle fries. If you don't like your fries thick, then i say skip them. Fortunately for me i love thick fries and these were nicely fried and salted. It also came with ketchup and a strong truffle aioli.  The decor is very nice. It has the hell's kitchen vibe with fire running through the glass wall. There are plenty of TV's so you wont miss your sports games. The wait for us was about 45 minutes which gave us enough time to win some money at the slots. From the time you order, it will take an additional 35 minutes to get your food when it's busy (which is always). For burgers, the price is steep (and you're paying for the Gordon Ramsay name) but the burgers are monster sized . Even without fries, i think you will be really full. I encourage you all to try it if you haven't.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog burger

F4IE6LUOMrJ3v0cwjXAzsA.text: I wasn't sure if I was going to love Gordon Ramsay Burger because, well, how do you mess up on - or improve upon - the classic burger? Well, I was wrong: the burgers here are absolutely on another level. Each visit here I had the Uber Cheese Burger - 4 different cheeses that, when all melted together, topped this burger perfectly. The mix of sharp, rich, and cheesy flavors along with the gooey melty texture atop a perfectly cooked beef patty was just exquisite. A True treat to the palette.  I have also tried the Hell's Kitchen Burger, and that definitely had a powerful kick to it, but then again I'm a wimp when it comes to spicy foods! The Farmhouse Barber was also mouthwatering - you can go wrong when you add a fried egg on top!  I have also tried the Burnt Ends Poutine - this was different, as I've never had poutine before, and thought the combination on the gravy was different - it wasn't bad, but wasn't my number one choice. Then of course are the Parmesan Truffle Fries - an absolute must-have side when you have burgers!   Worth the stop; I just wish it was a shorter walk from the parking garage to the restaurant! I hate having to go through the miracle mile every time, but I guess it's a good way to walk off your meal!

zkjCaRrHm3ZOxnaBdhbYmQ.text: Slightly disappointed by this restaurant. With a great name behind it, you would think it was be delicious.   The saving grace on the menu was definitely the onion rings, the truffle fries, and the curry fries on the appetizer portion of the menu. The onion rings were fluffy while crispy, and had great dipping sauces to them. Same with the fries, it was so much fun to try all the dipping sauces.   For the rest of the menu, it all sounds very interesting with eclectic burgers and hot dogs; however, the flavors don't fully deliver. I tried the Ale Dawg, which was a hot dog with bacon wrapped sausage, cheddar ale sauce, caramelized onions, Fresno chili's, cheddar dusted potato crisps. The hot dog was huge and had a great look, but the taste was pretty bland with nothing more to offer. The potato crisps on it were pretty good. My friends options for burgers were mediocre too.   Overall, fun concept but no flavor. The service was good for a busy restaurant.

BM9O2fAzYRteAX8biZuRXg.text: Coming to eat at one of GR restaurants has been a dream of mine for some time now. My fiance and I are huge fans of his who love to enjoy his shows together. So for our post engagement photo dinner we decided to treat ourselves!   We ordered a farmhouse burger, onion rings, and an Oreo crepe brulee shake.. WOAH!! I never in my life have tasted such flavor and juices from a burger. I'm not even a huge burger lover but this blew me away! The egg, bacon, and cheese on that burger set that juicy patty flavor off. The onion rings were delicious and so different from what I'm accustomed to. With the Parmesan its an amazingly different take on the classic favorite. But that shake was INCREDIBLE!! From the creamy Oreo to the thick creme brulee top this was so delicious.   Our server Greg was very funny and attentive which is always nice. But it was another employee that really caught my attention, Caleb H. Caleb Henry has AMAZING work ethic! He was cleaning tables around ours non stop and never once stopped smiling, he caught our attention by that alone. Once we stopped him to ask for his name we were blown away that he's even friendlier than expected. Caleb is a perfect example of a hard worker that loves their job and IT SHOWS!! I made sure to stop and tell a manager about him as well.   Overall we had an AMAZING experience at GR burger and can't wait to return again.
