2tz75pnxkpC57zsGQYNnMA.text: It was ok, I think the long wait was not worth it. I expected better for waiting in line, but 4 other tables that came after us got a full meal before we did. I think the fish and chips was definitely better and was a shorter wait.

4lDUrdcHyc8hytpuIGBNDg.text: We've enjoyed countless meals at Gordon Ramsay Burger, taken friends and family to eat here and always highly recommended this place but unfortunately after our last experience I don't foresee us ever returning. (My original post is under their "BurGR" Yelp page)   Superbowl 2019:  We decided to make reservations here for a party of 11. Las Vegas offers a never ending list of "BIg Game parties", we could've went anywhere else but what could better than our beloved burger place? We arrived at 2:15pm and were quickly set up in our reserved table. Around 2:45 (before game start) we find out 2 of our friends would not be making it and we immediately asked the waitress if we could reduce our head count to 9total and avoid the charge for the 2 who couldn't join us. (We would've moved and made the 2 seats available of course) The waitress said she would check with her manager and returned to give us the "good news" that they would accommodate us and only charge for the 9 people who were present. She even said "make sure to check the bill that it only shows 9 total headcount". Awesome!! we all thought, now let's enjoy the drinks, food and game. Well, we all know how the game went so let's fast forward to the end.  We are given the bill, and after reviewing we see that we are being charged for 11 total @ $190/person. So we kindly ask the waiter (our original waitress shift was over 1hr before the game ended) to revise the bill to only show 9 total. A "manager" comes over to us and explains that no one in management had approved reducing the headcount. Of course the waitress who had confirmed with us was gone so it was our word against theirs ... guess who won, NO definitely NOT the customer. There was a lot of back and forth and after very condescending rude remarks from the "manager" (I'm guessing assistant mgr) our friend felt the need to step in and defend his wife from the jerk mgr who was being very rude (maybe drunk himself) and raising his voice towards 2 female customers. We explained several times that if the waitress had originally said "no there would be NO accommodation and that we would be charged for 11 total" that would've been the end of it, No questions asked. But instead both managers (yes there was a 2nd manager who stepped in when the first was removed for almost getting into physical altercation with our friend) were adamant that we the customers were bonkers, no one agreed to any arrangement and the "shut up, Pay me" attitude eventually wore us down and drove us out of there with a very BAD taste in our mouth. Sadly to say, we ended up paying for 10 of the 11 seats because god forbid a customer be right. Take that loyal customers!!!   But wait, there's more ...  the following day, my fiance (diamond players card / Caesar's entertainment shareholder) calls the 2nd manager who insisted he spoke with the original waitress and confirmed she never told us of the headcount reduction. My fiance then asks to speak with the waitress direct & luckily she was available and confirmed to my fiance over the phone that she DID in fact tell us we would only be charged for 9 but was advised by her manager to just "say that" and still charge us for 11 people in the end (maybe hoping we'd get s***faced and forget?)  The issue here was never the $$ but the principle, no one likes to be called a LIAR.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 9 people were present but forced to pay for 10.

rFjxJ4UQ3bsAmX045RyZxA.text: Delicious burgers!!!!! We also tried the nachos and they were great. We had a big party and the staff was kind and helpful. The decor is great. Definitely want to go back

FMUag6fazs2n0S4NLna_2A.text: The burger was great but the appetizer of duck poppers left me disappointed due to the taste and quantity. I would be back for a burger but not for an appetizer.

N7LBEOsTScxj0x509IIC_g.text: The Farmhouse burger is amazing!  It is worth the price to eat here. The size of an order of fries is enough for two. The staff was a little difficult to work with at first. They wanted to seat us in the back of the restaurant due to a person in our party having a stroller. The stroller would fit where they wanted us and they said that if they seated in front it would block an isle that was at least six feet wide. When we put the stroller where we wanted it they finally understood that it wouldn't take up space. Felt like I was talking to a wall.

vtRWyFVCpNVsuUQ6phoSyQ.text: The burger taste is really good and unique. Waiting time is not very high . Recommend this place.

4ukgFT-0I-AQbHUV4YYImw.text: Me and my fiance went to go play tourist on the strip and enjoy BURGR  especially after watching all of his television shows we were excited to try a " gourmet " burger.   There was a huge line and we were suprised that we only ended up waiting 7 minutes to be seated.  We walk through the restraunt and get seated at the bar which was cool to be able to see them prep and line up the burgers.  First our water comes.... with 6 ice cubes. Mind you  Its 110 degrees outside.  The cheeseburgers range $16 to 22 dollars this price does not include fries or anything. We ordered the fries, onion rings and 2 burgers.  The onion rings are greasy, the burgers were actually bland. The meat wasnt seasoned, the bread totally over powers the burger & my fiance literally took the duck bacon off his burger because he said it tasted like a doggy treat.  I only ate half of my burger and he left a bunch of scraps. We decided to donote the half a cheeseburger and basket full of fries to a homeless man out front.

AcX8pnG8SDG4BOmnYcolsQ.text: My husband and I really enjoy watching Gordon Ramsay's shows and how dedicated he is to making his food perfect. We decided to dine here for lunch on a Thursday morning. We came a bit after they opened. Surprisingly, there are already a lot of people seated! The seating weren't as comfortable and really close together. We were seated next to another couple and basically watched them eat their burgers.   The menu offers a bunch of different items such as appetizers, soups, salads, and list of burgers to pick from. We ordered   *Farmhouse Burger 15 dublinar cheese, mangalitsa bacon, fried egg - My husband loves fried egg in burgers. This was juicy and really delicious.   *Crown Burger 15 aged mimolette cheese, arugula, fine herb aioli, dried tomatoes - I ordered this as I love arugula and aioli. I cut in half but it was so good that I finished the half in three bites.  True Parmesan Fries 11 - Enough for sharing. I would not order individual fries. We finished about 4/5 of our fries. The aioli sauce that came with it was bomb. Definitely the fries to get if you are dining here.   Overall, the experience was very good. One of the better burgers we've had.

rCaxs1xMK6HkwuC59suz0w.text: I do not even like cheeseburgers and rarely order them. But I'm now a cheeseburger fan because this place has the best cheeseburger in all of my 41 years.

FX-zNHwRAVRgXPOl4O0Y_w.text: I was lucky to try this burger spot the last time I was in Vegas and let me tell you it did not disappoint! I love Gordon Ramsay and I cant wait to try out Hell's Kitchen next time I'm in town!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yVeR2umJj_n7Oa2QccGT9Q.text: Good burgers, not amazing though. Service is dissapointing/slow and the food takes forever to come out.

--FH-hLSdatRN8H_Z6n5YQ.text: I've been dying to come here for 3 years since we moved here. My dad came to visit from New York & we went. Didn't wait long to get in (maybe 10 minutes) the waiters came right away & were super attentive. I ordered the Oreo Creme Brulee shake which was TO DIE FOR I would honestly come back just for that & also the UK burger which was cooked perfectly. I ordered it well done & while it was well done the meat was still nice & juicy. Fries were good. Dad ordered the wings & poutine which win a we're good but he wasn't that impressed with the poutine.   3 years was worth the wait & I can't wait to go back.

PiFGpMjKI0XOBjhfaKYL_w.text: I love Gordon Ramsay, so I just had to eat at one of his restaurants while I was in town! There was a line of people waiting to be seated. NOTE: only parties of 2 or less wait in the line. Parties of 3 or more need to put their name on a list and they will contact you via text when your table is ready.   The wait was estimated to be an hour long. When we were notified that our table was ready, we were about a 7 min walk away (waiting for our drinks lol). We called them to let them know and they held our table for us! I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger and onion rings. Everything was pretty good -- a bit on the pricey side, but that was already expected. I had some of friends' truffle parmesan fries and they were okay. I don't think they were worth $11, and I preferred the onion rings over the fries.   Service was okay. Our waitress was hard to locate at times when we needed something, but it wasn't anything to get upset about. Would I come back? Yeah, but I would consider other options first. Next time, I'm coming for your steakhouse, Gordon Ramsay! ;)

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings

CMW11Ex0rz372bBAzsYOJw.text: I got the veggie patties with the hell's burger & it was amazing. The bread was toasted to perfection and the burger itself was not too juicy. This place has the best truffle fries I have ever tasted.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l69Nvu9etKEcAKPlEsk9Xw.text: Super delicious! But be ready to stay in line to get seated! The line outside is for groups of 2 and groups of 3-4 should register with hostess separately. Definitely a must try'

wPNF-yFU9ymuc24pKzWPQQ.text: I have lived in Vegas my whole life and I don't think I've ever been to a celebrity chef owned restaurant yet. Well, there's a first time for everything.   I'll make this short and sweet: this place is kind of overrated. $15 to eat a burger (price of fries not included) in front of a giant portrait of Gordon Ramsay. I had the Crown Burger which is just a fancier version of the DGB from Red Robin. Tastes exactly the same. We waited an eternity for our burgers to come out: the guys who were seated much after us got their food at the same time we did. Our fries were cold and stale. Only thing I liked about the meal was the dipping sauce for the fries. I was also pretty impressed with presentation, but presentation can't fix mediocre food.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan fries

kigtBw4ATXxMyV4K7JfFsg.text: I would give this place a 4.5 if I could.  The atmosphere was excellent and modern.  The burger was incredible and the fries (truffle oil) were delicious.  My one beef (no pun intended) was the service was a little lacking but nothing too bad. And the food took about 35 mins to come out. We did come right at opening and did not have anywhere to be so no big deal for us.  I would recommend this place as a great burger place.

vIWG7T52sYtW59EnIpROKg.text: I ordered the backyard burger, farmhouse burger, onion rings, and truffle fires. The onion rings were fantastic. The truffle fries were way too salty. The burgers were just average. The beef has a nice strong beefy flavor but there weren't anything about it would make you go wow. Save your money and go to In-N-Out.

lbvUuw8oB7iWqHS5aQsyVg.text: Awesome burger. I got the ultimate cheeseburger and truffle fries and they were delicious. Just wish the burger was hot when it came out but it's was still great.

cxgcwo_CB9tYXbEJ70gUwg.text: Always wanting to try one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurant and having to be in Vegas me and my husband tried this one.   It was a little less than what we expected!!   We ordered hellfire chicken wings, hell's kitchen burger (most popular one as per our server) and truffle fries. Wings were amazing with lot of flavor, great balance of sweet and spicy and juicy. The burger was ok, juicy meat but lacking flavors and the bun/bread was ok too. I have had better burgers than this. The fries were ok.   Also there was waiting of approx 20min which was not too bad and servers were nice.   Overall I liked it and would wanna go to have wings again and may be try other things on menu when in Vegas but not for hells kitchen burger ;)

Go7Rk5mI76DL27axBpQzgQ.text: Excellent burger, wish it would come with fries instead of having to buy them in the side. It's honestly the first place I have ever been to in my life that didn't serve fries with their burgers. Other then that the burger was amazing.

CWVmxxN873ObSjqp3GEBZg.text: I was really excited about trying this place.  The wait was kinda long and after we was seated we had to wait a while for the food.  The burger I had was ok, and the truffle fries was just ok...nothing really spectacular.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V6PZ5OLbwA5jnIR7KwZw5A.text: I took 8 people with me.  Everyone of them stated that it was the best burger they had ever eaten!  Every burger was cooked perfectly and drinks were awesome!   Cheers to Gordon Ramsay!

i-9R0wjxR625Bl307xETiA.text: This was the worst experience I have ever witnessed.  The service was incredibly lacking.  I actually think we were being ignored. It took 15mins for someone to even approach our table and another 15 to just get water.  And we had to wait another 20 just for her to approach us to take our order. When she returned, she wasn't pleasant at all. Food came over cooked. Ordered medium and got well done.  She checked on us once after 30 mins.  The food was just not the same as it was when it was BurGR. Very saddened by this. Looked forward to coming here again.  Going to Hell's Kitchen for the first time today and I hope it's much better experience. Won't be back to Burger.

fLGfKVSMj7SVEDewxfkQsw.text: I'm glad we didn't wait in line for this restaurant. It was a slow Sunday afternoon and we walked right in. The burgers are good but not good enough to wait an hour or more for a seat like I've heard others have done. I had the stout burger which was cooked medium which I learned from our server is their version of medium rare and that's exactly how it was done. The burger was nicely flavorful but the mushrooms on it were chewy and some of the stems I couldn't bite through. I even had a hard time trying to slice it with a knife. The truffle fries were good, although my portion appeared to have come from the bottom of the bowl where all the little broken pieces settle. The server was nice enough to get a fresh batch for me. For dessert I had the sticky toffee pudding and it was very tasty. Not the best one I've ever had, but made for a nice sweet treat. I don't think I'd eat here again. There are so many more restaurants to explore in Vegas that I've not tried yet.

DPTcUuprTQliSt0YfuZnOw.text: Came back a 2nd time and guess what? Still amazing service with great food.  We will be back next year for a burger!

wLQM4kiMExIC4VcDJu5utw.text: First off I love every Gordon Ramsay show. Even reruns.  The burgers here are great, this is my thirteenth visit. So flavorful, juicy and can't get enough. Someone who wants a really really good burger needs to try this place for lunch then try his fish and chips at the linqs it's to die for.

7Ta7ZHEyg3pYgDSx74UNbQ.text: A long line here.  Note that if you're a Total Rewards (the Caesar's Palace gaming club card) Diamond Member, you get to the front of the line.   Had the mediterranean burger and the curry burger.  The curry burger was sweeter than I had expected (due to the chutney), and was very flavorful.  Mediterranean burger is made from lamb and has feta cheese.  It was good.   Overall things are a good value here, and the burgers are beautiful.

KlMifg45pybbzFnZRpA4Zw.text: The fries were really good, especially with the sauces. (9/10) I tried Hog burger and though it was good, it did not impress me. (7.5/10) I also tried the lobster burger but that was just ok. (6/10) Overall, i think it's a little pricey for a good but not impressive burger, I expected more from a restaurant owned by Gordon Ramsay. (7.5/10)

rk_SZWUBbHJHXh3nRJLqZA.text: It was a good burger. I don't know what normal burgers go for, but this one was a bit pricey. My husband and I spent about 80 bucks on two burgers, sweet potatoes to share, and I got a cocktail and he got a beer so it was pretty pricey for what you got, but it's Gordon Ramsey so we weren't surprised. The cocktail I had, pear something, phenomenal.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger

zRtscfOO9Kau3u3-AuVRKg.text: Skip the burger, get the truffle fries DIP!  Have you ever seen that meme where Gordon Ramsay slaps two piece of bread around a persons face and makes them admit they're an idiot sandwich? That's how I felt after I tried two burgers: like an idiot who paid $20 per burger.   We waited for an hour before being seated. The line was frustrating because every time we peeked inside there were available tables that were clean and ready. Not sure what they were waiting for since the cutlery and napkins were already set.  ANYWAYS - we got the burger with goat cheese/arugula and the one with foie gras. Both were (and I hate to say this because I had such high expectations): underwhelming. The burgers were cold and I did not taste the melding nor complimentary nature of ingredients.   The highlight of the dinner was the truffle fries dip. I asked for an extra helping and was pleasantly surprised when there wasn't an extra charge. I used everything (burger, crust, fries) as a vehicle and excuse to enjoy the truffle dip. SO GOD DAMN GOOD that it raised this rating from a 1 to 2*.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nGBiiSYF2Fjf2mdZiivi4g.text: I decided to bring my best friend to Gordon Ramsay Burger for her birthday! We always do the high end steak house type of thing but this time I wanted to switch things up. Gordon Ramsay is one of her favorite chefs and she loves burgers! So this place couldn't have been a better decision. I called in advance to try and make a reservation and was informed that they DO NOT accept reservations and it was a first come first serve type of situation. Yikes! Say what? Yeah I was bit nervous about this because being that we were going on a Saturday night I could only imagine how packed they were going to be!   When we first arrived the line looked like people ready to get on a roller coaster at six flags. I just knew the wait was going to be 2hrs! To my surprise I saw a sign that read "For parties of 3 or more see host" That worked out for us because we had exactly 3 in our party! Score! Gave the hostess my number at was told we would be seated in about 45 minutes! Not bad at ALL! The Miracle Mile Shops are good to wonder around when you have a wait like this but we didn't even have to wait the full 45 minutes I got a text message saying our table was ready in about 30 minutes. Wining points already!  Once we were seated our hostess came right over and gave us a cool little introduction about the place and explained the menu. I appreciated her acknowledging my best friends birthday and made sure that we were brought something out in celebration for that. The cocktail menu is on an iPad which I don't know why I always think this is so cool! No drinks for us though we had plenty before at Fat Tuesdays and at this point starving was an understatement!   Food:  Beer Battered Onion Rings- Parmigiano-reggiano, chipotle ketchup, cheddar ranch dip  Truffle Parmesan Fries  2 Farmhouse Burgers- Dublinar cheese, Mangalitsa bacon, fried egg  Backyard Burger- American cheese, butter lettuce, tomato,pickle, onion  Overall everything was fantastic! We really enjoyed ourselves and most important my best friend said that she was so excited to try this place. The service was top notch and the food came out exactly how we wanted. NO complaints just kudos and handclaps for Mr. Ramsay!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the sign!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday girl
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute menu

cBvL20U79nAmQ9LLkrrlww.text: We eat a lot of burgers. These were the best burgers we have ever eaten. I had the Bleu Burger, my son had the Hog Burger, and my husband had the Forest Burger. We shared the Truffle Parmesan fries. My husband and so enjoyed the larger draft beer menu. I loved the red sangria. I highly recommend Gordon Ramsey Burger. We will definitely be back the next time we're in Las Vegas.

T90ohJSkc1KSVvdXyuLDvQ.text: Staying at PH they gave us $ credit for RGB and everyday there is a line out the door.  So we must!  Our 4YO likes it!    What I ordered, traditional cheeseburger.  Used one of my faves for baseline, Hopdoddys.  It's bigger but probably not double the price better but it's convenient on the strip.  The burger is good but found the bun to be too commercial.  HD makes their in-house so always have a fresh-soft-buttery bun.    Overall a good burger and worth it with the credit!  PS dig the nachos!

YM0yRYMKOPrKXYSBdES6zg.text: Came here with the family a couple months ago and the burgers were amazing. The onion rings and starter soup were delicious. I shared a burger with my love and would suggest getting them separate if you are hungry.

Z5HoagEnQMcXenYxTR69ZA.text: So this week I am in Vegas for 2 days for my daughters roller derby game. My 2nd time in Vegas, my daughters 1st. We arrive at our #Airbnb which is 20 minutes from the strip at 4pm. I've been driving since 10 or 11am and at this point I am #HANGRY. So we start going back and forth about where to eat and not steer away from our #Whole30 ways. All of a sudden it was like a lightbulb went off. Wifey and I were like BUMP THAT!!! Where's Gordon??? "I want a burger"!!!  So we head over to the strip get to the restaurant and of course, there's a line from the door well into the casino. However, because we were only a party of 3 we didn't have to wait in that line. We did have a 45 minute wait time. So we walked around for a bit then came back after 30 minutes and ordered drinks at the bar. I look at the drink menu (which is a tablet) the bartender hands me and like a jerk, I start looking at the list of beers. First off, I hardly ever order a beer in my home state. It's a rule for my family, if you're out of town you do not order something you'd ordinarily get at home; if you do you are a jerk!   Anyway, I ordered the Honey Tennesse Jack Daniels peach cocktail for me and wifey and when I say we were so happy with those drinks I ordered 4 more for myself (in my mind). But I needed to eat and I was conflicted because everything sounded so good. Plus I wanted that seafood burger and the Anniversary burger so I got both and a poutine. I ordered it the way chef recommends and so glad I did. So flavorful and perfect portions. My only critique would be the seating booths are slightly too low, I felt kind of awkward at the table. Other than that the staff was great, warm a personable. We enjoyed every bite and will be back everytime we are in Vegas. #BaptisteClan

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1Zt4IUSV8q00zh7cd15Cfw.text: A staple of my annual trip to Las Vegas. Place is super fun to be in, staff is incredibly professional, and the food is awesome.

iHfQS0z5SkXr2jtrKmk7jw.text: Finally got to try this place after years of hearing about it and wanting too but never wanting to wait in the long line but my friends are diamond rewards members so we didn't have to wait in line last night!!! We started with the burnt ends poutine which was absolutely delicious!! I had the Hell's Kitchen burger which comes with roasted jalapenos, roasted tomatoes, and avocado. I asked for my mine medium and it was perfectly cooked.  My friends both had the forest burger which comes with grilled mushroom and they both loved it.  Also had the truffle fries which were just okay (nothing special)  Our server was very attentive and kept checking on us.  Overall a good experience.

7kWi5c143QTfZgkW36lhXw.text: Excellent burgers and their truffle fries are to die for! Wait time is a bit disappointing even as a perfected member but very good.

eEuOc1Xy2p6UaaYCSDCx6Q.text: What a disappointment... I was so excited for a delicious burger and I got an overcooked, dry, boring sandwich. a QP with cheese at McDonald's would have been juicier and more appreciated. Even the "amazing" truffle fries were lackluster as they tasted stale or reheated several times. And the bartender couldn't have cared less. Two beers a burger and fries were $50 before tip. Boo. GR would have flipped his lid over this.

fnLzFU9VhjTWDzPD5UtIYA.text: Had the U.K. Burger for lunch and it was quite delicious. The bun was grilled and had a crispy bottom which is typical of Gordon.   Also had the sweet potato fries which came out before the burger. Came with powered sugar and an aioli sauce and they were incredible. Paired with a beer will set you back about $35. Sat at the bar - overall a great experience.

gYyxTPd62UHJTbcJnimw7g.text: Ordered the F@&K burger, because it's a limited special and I know I won't be back to Vegas for quite awhile. It had a great flavor, and the meat, which I could taste the higher quality being aged, was cook exactly as I asked. My party of six was extremely satisfied. One of whom refused to finish his burger because he said "I do t want it to end". Top notch burgers!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

upjcxc5qBIH-m4zvw3gZHw.text: This food tastes like a smoker made it. Salty. The staff is friendly but the meal below a standard burger place. The pricing separates even the burger from the fries. I'd pass on this place. The celebrity chef element brought nothing to the proverbial table.

ox0WpY8Mvs7_1SzpcP4D4g.text: Realistically this is 3.5 stars, but that's not an option on yelp. While our waitress was friendly, the food itself was only mediocre/decent. Had the truffle fries and Hell's Kitchen burger and also tried the F Word burger. Everything was decent but not perfect. I've had better truffle fries at other restaurants and my burger was pretty tasty but one large jalapeno pepper was in the middle and burned my mouth because it just came out of nowhere. I personally think that the F Word is much better. Overall, not bad but not amazing. Location is great though.

HVS7GPuu_3-1abER5cBUeA.text: Best.. meal.. of my entire.. LIFE! And I can't wait to try other G.R. Gems! I have spoiled my palate so much with this place that ordinary restaurants just cannot cut it for me. I brag all the time about this place! I don't remember what I had as far as my burger but it was very tasty especially their variety of mushrooms they add to them. The Poutine fries were amazing! What I loved is that usually you taste nothing but a mushroom after-taste with poutine but this flavor was much different! More of a freshly cracked black paper taste. Burnt ends were by far the best part. And cocktails? Definitely worth it! I can't forget the Oreo creme brulee milkshake! I have never had anything like that in my life! By far, best tasting food.

GBvCosAiJJJkUtqRDRwYWQ.text: Great experience at GR Burger- we ordered a lobster and shrimp burger and the hell's kitchen burger - so tasty! Bun was light,  roasted jalapenos and the meat with the asadero cheese and avocado= perfection Oh and the sweet potato fries with the buttery jelly like sauce- yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and Shrimp burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger

uB6qyYW7Q7oPOBza5erXuQ.text: No reservations. There is a line and you give your party size at the front. We waited in line for about 15 minutes and that was ok. I didn't mind waiting and we got in quicker than expected.  Food took a little long to arrive but it was worth every minute. We started with a cheddar ale soup and a Cesar salad. Both were absolutely amazing. Soup was hot, creamy and had perfect texture. I ordered the blue cheese burger and my husband ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger. The blue cheese was of really good quality and the meat cooked exactly how I asked. The Hell's Kitchen burger was off the charts fantastic. Don't be intimidated by the heat! It's perfect. Just the right amount of kick and all the flavor! Finally, we had a chocolate shake. There's pudding on top of the shake! Pudding! Enough said!  I was beyond satisfied at Gordon Ramsay's Burger. I'm a big fan and think he's fantastic. This place lived up to my Ramsay expectations as far as cleanliness, quality and service. Please open one in LA!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar ale soup! Fantastic. A must try!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blue cheese burger

j53vn-9ImKhftrQkjWomGg.text: With the restaurant only 25% full they offered me 2 choices, the bar that is facing the kitchen (loud and hot!) or THE farthest table in a the corner I'm assuming because I came alone. FU hostess. AND the burger was so so... nothing to make a special trip for really

8uC14ssO_k1hgIAMuVklqA.text: Awesome burgers!!! The thing that really amazed me was the pickles! I honestly hate pickles and i asked them to not put any in my burger, they put it on the side, i tried one pickle and it was the best thing ever!!! I highly recommend everyone to try, it has this mango sweet like twist to it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sweet potato fries and the sauce is great!!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog burger! Tasty but be careful its so heavy!!!! The pickles are awesome, ask for some on the side!

GPASiXH8_O7sVL0aNXyWug.text: Really good. Not much on the menu, but it's a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. What did you expect? The ritz treatment?

_O5WsgallteZEqN2Q1nWyg.text: All I have to say, is that this place was not only cool especially with the fire display in the front of the restaurant but omg! The Hell's Kitchen burger was one of the best burgers Ive ever had! The meat was so tender and juicy, overall the burger just melted in your mouth. I couldn't stop eating it, and I normally don't finish a big meal.. but this burger...I made it a mission to eat it.. I made it a goal! And boy, I was sad once I was officially done with it because I knew it will be forever until I get this burger again.:(  It felt like I woke up from a great dream. If you are unsure on what to get from the menu.. GET THE HELLS KITCHEN BURGER!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The one,the only Ramsay!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You won&#39;t regret it! -hells kitchen burger!!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oh yesss!

C2sVkU-yYlWOWiTd59IbEg.text: Ate here a few times and have found the food and the service to be excellent.  The burgers are always fresh and delicious and cooked as I like them, rare.  The burgers can run $15 to $22 but  the mixed drinks and desserts are priced below normal for the Strip.  But price doesn't matter if the food is excellent!  In the world of burgers, this place is a real stand-out. The only downside is you will most likely wait on line for about 20-30 minutes and also wait that long for your food.

T_I1H4DzgL2sIAym4WDYfQ.text: This place lived up to it's name! Everything was amazing, delicious and best burgers we've had. The Ahi Tuna sliders were my favorite, very fresh and flavorful. We also ordered the Hells Kitchen and 2 others (forgot the name) and they were perfect. Got the reg truffle parm fries and sweet potato, but the sweet potatoes were our favorite. Highly recommend the Ahi Tuna sliders, Hell's Kitchen burger and Sweet Potato parmesan fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These Ahi Tuna sliders are delicious...my fav!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu is nice and simple

TgCXTRV4sQREPs049b7Vdw.text: The food is good, yet pricey-but it's in Vegas... Everyone has covered the food angle in their reviews so I am going to skip to the service. It was top notch. We came fairly late after just landing and the wait wasn't terribly long. Our server was on top of everything. A glass was never empty or even close to empty. If you enjoy good service, even at a faster pace, this is the place for you!

eK2dtHJgDASfcE5Jmo1LmQ.text: Stood in line before it opened and asked to be seated at counter by kitchen as I Love watching a kitchen work. They tell you that the burgers take 25 minutes so we ordered the poutine and it was AMAZING. Creamy and rich with the burnt ends, it could almost be a meal itself. My son had the Farmhouse and he loved it. He also had the Creme Brulee shake and all I could think of was the scene from Pulp Fiction where John Travolta asked Uma Thurman about a $5 shake and than said it was pretty good. It's REALLY good. I had the Pork Chop and Applesauce Burger cooked medium and it was super flavorful. My only mistake was ordering a side of fries, not that they weren't good, they were, but I had them w the poutine. I wished our server had suggested something different. Staff was friendly and I noticed that all of them were unusually attractive, so certainly an incentive to wait in line. The only thing missing was the yelling from the kitchen.

haRuN3YWVBQ7OpZrPn73Kg.text: Great burger but fries were meh and def not worth the price. They are also steak fries which is not my thing. Wait wasn't long but you still have to wait if you just want to sit at the bar which doesn't make much sense.

5sn4n4kXTfpUc3YRrA6sNw.text: Nice setting, good service, good presentation. Went for the burger but loved the fries. I definitely recommend the sweet potato fries and the truffle parmesan fries; they are perfection, especially when dipped in their coordinated sauces. That being said, the burger was kind of a flop. I had the Forest Burger which had two of my favorite burger toppings, mushroom and bacon (although in the odd forms of forest mushrooms and duck bacon), but the tremor cheese overwhelmed the taste of everything else on the burger. The burger tasted like a meaty block of tremor cheese, with not even a hint of bacon or mushroom to it. Kind of my mistake though, I ordered the burger despite it being topped with an unfamiliar cheese, and paid the price.

piqZXy1SYdIAZ-FRMjc24Q.text: Long wait to get in and service was really slow. Ordered shrimp/lobster burgers which are $26 each and we're really bland and almost no flavor. Really disappointed experience.

lCVt2jXUUYOTPi4lcTJGkg.text: I had a farm burger with truffle fries. It was great for the price (very affordable burgers). Not incredibly memorable, but would come back over other local burger joints.  The atmosphere felt like a modern retro diner. I really liked the simplicity of the place despite it carrying the Gordon Ramsay name.

s3k4wcMtEYfohsmWpV6k8w.text: Only wish you guys had brought back the jalapeno poppers!!! Gordon, please bring them back!!!

6p5gEJB1DeyN92fYkjN-7A.text: Same location as the previous "BURGR" in Planet Hollywood but changed a little bit and is now "Gordon Ramsay Burger". The menu added/removed some items and the restaurant has a more UK theme now. I tried the Crown Burger which was not on the previous BURGR menu, and it came with aged mimolette cheese, arugula, fine herb aioli, and sun dried tomatoes. The meat was cooked perfectly medium, and it was juicy and seasoned well. The mimolette cheese resembled almost a sharp cheddar to me and added a nice savoriness to the burger, but it wasn't overly salty due to the bitterness of the arugula and sweetness of the sun dried tomatoes. The aioli wasn't overpowering and complimented the other flavors of the burger, I'd order it again! Truffle fries are a must when I come here, and the truffle dipping sauce is soo good. It did take a little while for the food to come out but it's worth the wait. Definitely one of my favorite places to eat in Vegas and it's affordable/not outrageously priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown Burger (aged mimolette cheese, arugula, fine herb aioli, sun dried tomatoes)

1nuJI7zG5rYqTBJKF6qtFw.text: The atmosphere here is nice, with modern decor and a beautiful fire display in the front as you enter. I was surprised by the food here, as my expectations were pretty high for this place given the name, but I was incredibly disappointed. There were 4 in our party and two ordered burgers. One was ordered as medium well, but it was medium (bright pink center throughout) at best. The second was ordered medium and it was closer to medium rare (bright red center).Our server only checked on us once right at the first bite, so we never had a chance to voice our complaint. She was very nice and did a great job otherwise.  The truffle fries were way over cooked.  Check out some of the other burger joints in this area as there are TONS and here you are really only paying for the name.   *Edit: I added a third star to my review as I was contacted by the management team in regards to my review. The individual who reached out has shown genuine concern for my experience and promised follow up will be made with staff to ensure this does not happen in the future.  I personally feel exceptional customer service is essential in this industry, so this was very meaningful to me. Ownership is essential and they seem to want to genuinely provide a great experience to their customers, including recognizing they made a mistake and ensuring they catch any that may occur quickly enough in the future so it can be resolved.

1N9giLsF5fqhwqDZV-ME8w.text: If you like burgers, you might love this place. I thought it was overpriced and not worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gc_F58VLCaUHQ15ZN7G96A.text: Ughh. I really wish I loved this place because of the truffle fries but overall, I'm disappointed at the service it brings. I mean, HAVE YOU EATEN HERE GORDON RAMSEY? The burger tastes plain, your chefs & associates looked more confusing than anything as I sat for awhile to wait for our order to get to the table. How is it that from the moment we ordered that it still takes an hour to be actually served? There was exactly three chefs and maybe 3-4 helpers prepping plates and still it took an hour, on top of waiting in line for an hour already. Not worth the two hour wait when burgers shouldn't take this long to make. Service was even worse, our waiter never came by not even ONCE, in that hour to refill our waters, get another beer, asked if we needed anything else or even a fair warning that the kitchen is backed up. NOPE, none of that happen. Then when the food finally came out, she proceeded with an attitude that our burgers took so long, as I also asked for another refill on waters. Anyway, overall horrible experience. Service was horrible. Food was ehh. Hype about what?!?! LOL

bXP6CauNylzgCHNuVhc1TQ.text: This is one of the most delicious burgers you can taste. I had the anniversary burger (not on the menu) and it is amazing. The service are quick and good. The wait line was not that bad (15 min), but worth the wait. If you in town and craving a burger, this is the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YvfiwiA_6tc_6xGqRSiQZQ.text: Truffle fries are to die for!!! Pre drink with the pear wine sangira and you've reached bliss.

vJZL4NriERq3E6BCLGb8Qg.text: Good burger. Mine was very salty which is why I deduct half a star. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger. However the bun was delicious, the party cooked perfectly to order. I would return to try the other burgers.  The other half star deduction comes from the service. The host staff is chatting on their phones while a long line is waiting to be seated. Every once in a while she looked up to engage the customer who would be instantly seated at one of the many available tables.  Once finally seated it was hard to flag down your server. Burger took over a half hour to prepare after order and it took almost as long to wait to pay the bill.

d7XX5N9z8KoMQSVxzs11ZA.text: Best mushroom burger. Every bite was full of flavor. The cap was grilled to perfection, no watery residue !

iItGwDTGAEH5C6hfEDagPQ.text: Okay, four stars because the food was amazing. Best sliders I've ever had- buns so fresh and soft, light crisp. Chicken cooked so well. Just a medley of flavors. I forget the name but they were the ones with "Parma ham" and an aioli. Will post the name soon.  Tandoori chicken burger - awesome. The texture IS a little drier than I would have liked but it worked really well. I think it's meant to be like this. Definitely not something I could make at home I don't think.  Wouldn't give 5 stars bc the wait honestly was a buzz kill. I would have just liked to hop on the bar and eat there but the line included bar spots too. And no one was taking them regardless.  Plenty of TV's to watch the games that are on.  Order right when you sit down-- take a menu and check it over while waiting. Each burger takes 30 min to make  so be sure to snag a menu in line.  Also didn't like how slow the service was all together. But it was relatively crowded when we were there. I'll keep it at 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These are one of the slider options on the menu. Comes in twos

aeCSmEtvFhkQT3SmKrt3RQ.text: After seeing crazy long lines at Gordon Ramsay Burger year after year, we knew we had to see what the hype was all about.  During my family's most recent trip to Vegas we finally got try their much anticipated burgers.  Overall, the dinner had some hits and misses. Despite the hustle and bustle, all the servers were all friendly, welcoming, and attentive.  We ordered many of the burgers recommended by the staff (i.e., Hell's Kitchen and Forest) as well as some others we thought just sounded delicious (i.e. Ultimate, Hog, Portobello). My favorites were the Ultimate and Portobella.  Both were bursting with flavor and cook to perfection. I would definitely order these two again. The other burgers left me unsatisfied.  The Forest was overall very bland. The duck bacon was flavorless and chewy and meat was unfortunately overcooked (based on how I wanted the burger cooked).  The Hog just had too much going on so it was difficult to appreciate all the ingredients.  Although the burger was definitely huge and filling! Hell's Kitchen tasted good but was under seasoned.  For sides we ordered the fries, sweet potato fries, and onion rings. The onion rings were AMAZING. They were seasoned well and had a perfect crispy batter.  Both fries were pretty average.  They were not very crisp or seasoned.I was not a fan of the homemade sauces. I was in need for good ol fashion Heinz Ketchup. Overall, I had a good experience but I was just hoping for more consistency throughout their menu.

4X1bs9vZ9O4IvNnFm8WkQQ.text: I ordered the short ribs and a glass of wine. The short ribs were very dry. I had to drink a swig of wine for the meat to go down.  Over cooked food with a name.

8YM7b9p38gsFbhFV2ADurg.text: We ordered onion rings to start the meal, which came out cold. I could see them staging the fries and onion rings in the window under a heat lamp. The dipping sauces were good and the presentation was nice! The burgers were fantastic - Hell's Burger and the Blue Cheese Burger. Server was a little over the top with his personality. He thought he was much better than what he was.

glf4CtaOTyBaCB3XhP3L9A.text: Best burger I have ever eaten! Got the Blue Cheeseburger. Made all my foodie dreams come True. Parmesan Truffle fries were great too. Ambiance was great and wait staff were very accommodating. Highly recommend.

3d_rFTswFFjckCqKQ7Ox3w.text: Ooh my goodness...the best burger I've ever had! The bun was soft, fresh and spongy! Th meat was cooked perfectly and seasoned to perfection! The Parmesan fries are excellent!! We also ordered the Oreo custard shake (yummy) which is perfect for sharing! Highly recommend if looking for a delicious burger restaurant!!

emReXk5pwZxQ6tFkFi0U7A.text: horrible. The food is EXTREMELY greasy and buttery, it tasted like I was eating pure butter. There was not much flavor in my burger at all. I eventually just stopped eating it. Secondly, the presentation was so plain. Just the burger on a plate with the logo of the restaurant faded and coming off. Lastly, there was a hair in our truffle mayonnaise. Not coming hear again and don't get why there's so much hype.   Looks like this restaurant needs to be on Kitchen Nightmares

7VAyp4MCJClX0E8fADqdaQ.text: Wanting something different than the usual cheeseburger, I ordered the Ultimate Cheeseburger with aged provolone, dubliner, and boursin topped with lettuce, tomato, raw onion, and pickles.  One of the best burgers I've ever had!  And the price ($15) is reasonable considering the Gordon Ramsay name.  Granted, it was "a la carte" meaning just burger and you had to buy the fries separately, I've had burgers & fries this expensive at nothing-special restaurants in NYC like Pig n Whistle, which actually cost $17!  It was totally worth the 1 hr 45 min process to eat.  Over 1 hour standing on line and about 45 min to get our burgers, fries and onion rings.  I was hoping the fries would be thin fries because they were served in the kind of steel cones that other restaurants use for their thin fries.  The fries and onion rings weren't memorable.  I would have given this place 5 stars if it weren't for the long wait time (no reservations) and the mediocre fries and onion rings.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aNVaFxIqhKr8UHgK_BOczw.text: This was an amazing dining experience from the staff to the burgers.  I went with the farmers burger medium rare and it was done to perfection. Melt in your mouth.  I will definitely return.

pxRRLVsiQfoic6o094fi_Q.text: Burger was good but nothing really special. Took a while for the food to arrive. A bit too long for me. Ordered fries well done and they were not. I was not too happy with the service. Very slow. Also, i was sitting at a counter seat. I don't like employees standing right in front of me, checking their cell phones every time.   At the counter, they are close to you. Shouldn't you be working?  Overall, just ok. Will not go back.

pAZLJgA8VDtdFDxHEhxX3g.text: Drool. I've been somewhat underwhelmed with some of the food we have had while in Vegas. And my hunt for something healthy and tasty has been challenging... This place is in no way healthy, but OMG is it delicious. I got a caramel butter pecan shake with my burger and truffle fries. I literally moaned and talked about the shake the whole time I was drinking it. And it was gone by the time our burgers and fries came out. The burger had 3 cheeses on it and was made perfectly. The truffle fries were the best I've ever had... And this may sound odd, but the chairs were so comfortable. It was a nice place to relax for a few after roaming around the strip. And I like the pyrotechnic decor at the entrance. It's a nice touch.

hLmF25dbsjJiwS3byuFg6A.text: Service was very slow. Order everything at one time to spare the headache. Fries came out after the burger. Bloody Mary mix was finest call, not house made, GAG. I got the lobster shrimp burger. Not good at all. I swear there was a low key Italian sausage taste in it. Hubby got the foie gras. Very good. Tasted like duck of course. I wouldn't come back here until they fix their service. Idc how good the food is, if the service is bad, I'm out

JFzEjQUCDGOjU3zr4hXSjA.text: Wow!! The best burger and fries I ever had I'm sitting here almost a year later reminiscing about my meal from here! Thinking to myself " Gordon Ramsey can be as mean as he wants producing food like that" I got the burger with the duck bacon and egg and it was amazing and the truffle fries are bomb too

8ZVEc2Npbjx-h0_HZktqPQ.text: You cannot make reservations and have to stand in line, but the line moves along pretty well and you can look at the menu too while in line to help you decide what to get.  Service was great!  They were very nice.   1) Tandoori chicken burger - it was a bit dry and the feta is dry too so the tahini sauce could not save it. It was OK.  I would get something else. 2) Lobster-shrimp burger - SOOOO GOOD!  I would definitely get this again.  The pickled vegetables are spicy and tangy and really makes the burger 3) Parmesan fries- they are shaped like chips or wedges rather than thin fries just so you know. Make sure to ask for all their ketchups - chipotle ketchup, curry ketchup and regular as they are all tasty.  The truffle mayo it comes with too is tasty!  Overall great place and our server was really nice. Its a tasty reliable place to eat.

xvE_V82MBUn9hXLP5pph0w.text: Service is just okay, but the burgers are always worth it. There's usually quite a line to get in, but it's Vegas after all, so grab a drink and hang tight, I promise the food is worth the wait!

0us7X3AJyhvmO35HhytPYQ.text: Had an amazing experience here! Started off with a order of Kettle chip nachos! They were  then we ordered a grilled cheese for my son, and my wife and I got the Hells Kitchen burger and the Farmhouse burger! And boy they did not disappoint! We ordered them medium rare and they were cooked to perfection! Definitely would recommend coming here. Wait time to get a table was about 45 min but it's really worth the wait!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle chip nachos!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The amazing Farmhouse Burger!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen burger! Amazing!

iprCGIgaqnVD4ttEwMdhVg.text: I used to make it a point to visit at least once every time may family visited Vegas. My last visit was the worst. Before when I was a platinum status total rewards member the service was outstanding. We would get a nice table and usually had a greeting with the manager about our experience. After becoming a Diamond Member, we were seated by the front end and service was far below anything I had experienced while in Vegas. It took forever to get our drinks. Then the server returned and took appetizer orders (one person was not ready to order)... after about 30 minutes our appetizers arrive. the server exclaims, "I'll be right back!" We literally waited another 30 minutes, nothing... no refills... we were tired of waiting and had to go to the hostess to request our bill. At the same time, our ahi tuna sliders were nasty. No consistency between them... I was so upset that if I had spoken to a manager I would have probably yelled at them, I was so upset. I paid quickly and left. Maybe someday... I will give them another chance...

kDyWVNyBS1k5HEJTUoFbIw.text: The most amazing Lobster burger ever!!! My husband and I ordered the cheddar soup kind of salty but still good.Then sweet potatoe fries that came w powdered sugar and a dip soo good as well.Finally, it came out Lobster burger and the curry shrimp salad.Took a bite of the Lobster all kinds of flavors in my mouth it was fabulous!!!!!! Going back next time and we both are going to get the Lobster burger,can't wait!!!

i6gDTqbMRKTzrqIWsEhO4w.text: 40 minutes wait and then 2 hours to finish eating. Service is very slow. Food is decent. Overhyped in my opinion.

B8jI_W-CG9phAYGcA1TkOQ.text: Solid and creative hamburgers with good service. It is always busy here. I would recommend getting any hamburger and going for lunch!

lwm8SkG0B5s2y-ktm3qP5g.text: Annual run to my favorite burger spot! ($15 burger) Since I've tried 5 years ago, I've been going back here annually to enjoy the burger. The name has changed from "BurGR" to "Gordon Ramsay Burger" located at Paris Casino. All the names on Menu has been updated into new names but seems like the ingredients haven't changed.  I had to go back home right away so we decided to choose TOGO, and it was great experience. The girls at the front helped me with new menu and it was fairly fast. (Explained it's almost the same as other older menu) The food took about 30-40min to come out but looking at the Line, I would rather gamble some $ while waiting for food to come out.  Food came out pretty warm and it was awesome burger!!  We will be back again next year~!

RzfzQbp0kRZjOMsJPEJ5mQ.text: This is my second meal at the burger joint.  Busy and noisy environment. The service is good and the burgers are average.  You have to order the sides separate (fries/onion rings) etc.  I tried both and the y were just ok.  I asked for ketchup and got this concoction of ketchup and Worcestershire sauce which was inedible. The server said we don't have plain ketchup, just our "special" blend.  Yuck....I didn't ask the obvious question....I won't be back....

tVNB8eOCLlUPDSZM845M4g.text: 4.5 stars for this place. Not the best burger I've had but pretty close. The truffle fries were really good.  Had the forest burger which I liked a lot. My friend had the crown burger and liked it a lot. Would come back again.

viEWBPPF5Cs2TqswLBUppA.text: There's always a line but it moves pretty fast. We prefer to sit at the bar because the lighting is better. Very good burgers with a good variety of flavors. Not a big fan of their fries. Reasonably priced. Recommended

durdau8hPPEEBP0HWGEocg.text: I was so excited to come here with my mom and little sister for her birthday. We are all big Gordon Ramsay fans! Sad to say...we were all quite disappointed. The onion rings we had heard about were clearly pre-cooked and served to us super dry and tepid (probably from right under a heat lamp). My ahi tuna sliders were pretty good! But then my little sister, on her birthday, got sick from her cheeseburger :(  Very average, and definitely not up to Gordon's standards!

EMt7S0OwLp4tm7MrfZYueg.text: I ate here when it was still Burgr a few years ago and loved it. Had lunch here with a group of 7 on a Wednesday around 11am and there was no line. Had the Crown Burger, truffle fries, and Creme brulee shake. The burger was somewhat dry and needing more seasoning, the truffle fries were too salty, aioli overpowered with mayo and didn't taste much of garlic/other flavors, and the shake was good despite being too sweet (it's a desert shake so I guess that's not too much of a shocker). The service was great-the server checked in with us a few times and accommodated a request to switch out a burger because it was super dry (switched a Hog Burger to a Farmhouse instead). Restaurant was clean. (They recently switched from Burgr to Gordon Ramsay Burger)

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown Burger (arugula, sun dried tomatoes, opted for medium rare patty)
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme brûlée (oreo) shake

_OxG6nDNQ2-1gOuYpdOH8Q.text: Sunday, March 4, 2018 @ 1:16am Bad experience!    The service was good.  BUT the food (burger, fries) were bland and cold.  Had to ask for salt and pepper to give them flavor.  Not worth the time and money.  Manager was equally cold and rude!

N_3w9xmXEKFCOfLjw5Fr2g.text: The restaurant itself is cool. Lots of things to look at and TVs if there are any sporting events.  The service, especially the waitress was extremely friendly and helpful. We always had full drinks and everything we asked for very promptly.  I unfortunately was not impressed with the burger; which is strange considering this is place is famous for their burgers. My wife however really liked her burger so perhaps it was just bad luck on my part.  Overall; I would recommend this place for a quick and reasonably priced meal.  Reply to Nicole: My burger was just overcooked, twice. I requested medium and it was well done both times.

WijunqpexRk1ZwxMGCQBXg.text: Probably the best burger I've ever had in any restaurant! The Parmesan fries are good too, the hells fire or fire burger, something like that ..was just amazing. Can't remember exact name of burger but it had the Avocado on it.  17 bucks but it was so good I would prob pay it again!

zYX7Y4iIPtH-g3W3m1V9DA.text: We're both huge fans of Ramsay, and we try to go to all his restaurants, burger was one of the few that we were so/so about.  It's great food but giving the name behind it and the cost (cost increase do you being on the strip) it's a tourist restaurant for sure. For those who live here in Vegas there are local places with just as good burgers for a cheaper cost.   I would still recommend going for the experience after all you are here on vacation

IU6r-ApeRNsSatb59M021w.text: In town for Caps and Knights game, ate a late lunch beforehand. Had to wait for a table for 5 people but they texted us when our table was ready and it was worth the wait. Order the burgers as they come, do not add anything!!!! They are awesome just the way they are. You don't need any sauce or any thing extra. I had the backyard burger and my husband had the farmhouse burger. Awesome burgers, awesome fries, awesome atmosphere.

tUVQXFaJtV5LWXM6lj35ow.text: This is my favorite fastfood place..... I've tried White Castle, Shake Shack, In-N-Out but keep going back to Burger when I need a quick burger and fries (about 100 times so far) (yes really). My absolute favorites:  - Farm burger/bacon/egg - Euro burger/truffle/cheese/cheese/cheese - Hog burger - amazing piece of pork + delicious apple butter/sauce - caesar salad; I'm not a salad fan but I love this one - Toffee/ice cream pops (mandatory purchase)  TIP:  If you sit at the bar or request "to go" style, then your time wasted standing line is zero.

ZctOylSzll0blwAfqU4ecA.text: Freaking amazing burger and service! Great recommendation on the wine pairing.  The creme brulee shake was epic!  Nachos were on point and truffle fries were just right. Didn't know how Gorden was going to do a burger joint but this was done with quality and class. As a fan of the culinary arts I must say that the flow of the kitchen was also very well orchestrated!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7UFVoMWwpXbrIqO9I6_psg.text: Highly anticipated...good burgers. But way too pricey, guess you pay for the name! We ordered the famous Hells Kitchen burger and Mediterranean burger, some fries, ice tea n coffee. We were lucky to stand in line outside the restaurant for only 10mins, but had to wait half hr for our fries and burgers! They could have atleast given our hungry souls the fries before the burgers arrived. Other than that, the host n service was good. The burgers were awesome, no doubt on that. But paying $60 for burger&fries!...hmm. maybe I'll do it just once.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Time for some lipsmacking flame grilled burgers

6XP6OBLUKrGtXIi0zt_G2Q.text: Love this place ! We make a point to stop in every time we are in Vegas. Price are very reasonable at at about $15 to $17. They don't take reservations but the longest we have waited was about 35 min for dinner. If you go for an early lunch you can get in quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger

5l1_8r6-L2s24tfSrfXHIA.text: I don't eat hamburgers but if I went off the reservation it would be a beef burger here at Ramsay' s. The wait is always around 11/2 hours but it's worth it. Attentive service,  excellent food and drink make this a "must see" stop if your visiting Vegas. The only negative is it's in the lobby of the Planet Hollywood hotel which is a hotel way past its prime and dirty to boot. If you enjoy watching people of every oriental persuasion who appear underdressed even for a trailer park, then this is your place. Otherwise, put on your blinders and endure the chattel because your most excellent burger is only a relatively short wait away. I always get the Fish and Chips burger, a great nod to Gordon's Great Britain derivation, but the number of creative burgers on the menu is legion. You can even get a Turkey patty in place of beef if so inclined,  which is not on the menu. The restaurant is really a sports bar lounge so be prepared for a noisy meal. The last time I was there the Fish n Chips burger did seem a little under par for Ramsays as little chips were plated and the Fish was kinda greasy but they get a pass since it was Christmas eve.(I doubt it's a trend) All in all if you love timely service and EPIC burgers, you need to put this one on your bucket list.  So, go there. Go there now!

gtX_lLUgmCj9duG500xl6g.text: Very good burger selection and good prices for Las Vegas Strip. Fries were on the cooler side. I like a variety of sauces, but in case you don't, be aware that they only have house made sauces including ketchup.

QqW9PBOGdc7zo-9Pf7N_Dg.text: Very disappointed. We were a party of four. We ordered all appetizers. Our fries were cold and old. I wondered why. I looked in the kitchen there they were making food in advance and leaving it under the glow rays. I would have thought that  Ramsay SOP would have been a better dining experience than that. Get them in and out. All about the money and the use of his name.

-PV-4WUDGZKfvIoYWJLIVw.text: This restaurant was located in the hotel/casino we stayed at so it was an easy pick to go here for lunch. I passed by the restaurant several times during my last visit to vegas and there always seemed to be a line. Thank goodness we had reservations and was seated within 15 minutes of checking in.   Since I don't eat meat I decided to go for the Portobello mushroom burger which was over $20. I shared onion rings, sweet potato fries, and truffle fries with others. The burger itself wasn't that memorable and the fries were not the best. I think the onion rings were good though.   All in all, service was meh maybe because they were busy. I probably will not return though just because it's vegas and there are so many other restaurants that taste better. =/

MNPsE-TzTjM14GIjXDMJ8Q.text: Burger cooked to perfection. We ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger and the Forest Burger and the Truffled Fries... fantastic! There's a 20 min wait for the burgers, but it's done right. First, the truffled fries were so good... gourmet fries so don't wolf it down. Enjoy it. The Hell's Kitchen Burger was spicy but well balanced with avocado for soothing creaminess. The Forest Burger had arugula which toned down the richness. I'm glad I went!

qAXGch4OfeFh4r4lC3Z2lg.text: This is probably my favorite burger place in Las Vegas. First time coming. I ordered the hell's kitchen burger, my husband the Farm House and they were both sooo delicious. We also ordered the kettle chips nachos and wings. I liked the nachos more than the wings. Our server was on point with every recommendation, super friendly and nice. Thank you @ Hilary

kabWgmoQDNHIZM1RI-1ElQ.text: For starters, we went with the Onion Rings. Nice flavors in the sauces that accompany them. The Burgers are all they're hyped up to be with service to match! I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger. (I'd rate the "hot" factor as a 5/6 out of 10 for the jalapeno factor.) The Forest Burger went over just as well. There are quite a few burger spots in Vegas. Make sure you put aside a couple of hours for Gordon Ramsay Burger.

q0VK_H7XUCwFENWmlTAPKA.text: Expectations to high , Thought I was about to eat a burger from the  heavens above but it was more like from the Mall Food Court above , I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger and Fries .. it was good but not OMG good , leave the burger business to someone else Avg 3 stars is right on point

ie6Hsqn03NJ8UXdEXytacA.text: Really, really impressive! We went on a Tuesday evening knowing there would be a wait. For a party of less than 4, you can't write your name down and return, rather you have to stand in a line. We waited about 45 minutes, but the wait was well worth it. The appetizers were amazing, the chicken wings, sweet potato fries, and ahi tuna sliders were all outstanding. I had the hog burger which was fantastic, probably the best hamburger patty I have ever had. Service was pretty good. Not a 5-star experience, but still worth the try.

EhDLQf5qTRYt8fTc3tzBTg.text: BELIEVE THE HYPE!  Amazing burgers, even though it was a little too salty, but management made it right. Just be aware, it takes about 30 mins for the best burger, but just order a cocktail n be happy,,,,you're in Vegas!  Find a VIP, so you don't have to wait in line,,,,like I did lol.   Also amazing service (that always wins my heart).

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SqhoDlvZXVUyWnVYz_fUxQ.text: I loved this place! Definitely will come back again. I chose the famous Hells Kitchen burger and my husband got the lamb burger. We also ordered the Parmesan fries. Everything was so tasty. I want to try the other burgers offered next time. Cooked to perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen Burger yummy

3bEZFAGdYtIykMus4UQvPA.text: This place is all that it's cracked up to be! My mom has been raving about this place so i finally try it for myself and oh my goodness! I got the farmhouse, bacon egg and cheese classic. I also tried the truffle fries which were amazing! Perfectly crisp, not over salted, served with cocktail ketchup of some sort and a "black truffle" sauce which was to die for! My mom had the hog burger, I tried that and oh my, it is HEAVEN! You won't regret coming here. Definitely a must have while in Vegas! Get the hog burger!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oyDvoveYTTEYBz7Tj0ZA6A.text: I had the Hell's Kitchen burger, which was excellent. My friends had the portobello burger and the hog burger. Everyone was satisfied.

2aYeTDIjC9_BHCeByICwxg.text: Best burger on the strip! Every time I come here, I never get disappointing. Considering it's a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, the pricing of their food is super affordable!

Cxf16Veu7M_7ijRd3m1lAQ.text: Where do I start? The dirty knife I had, the view of the servers crowded around a table that left a bunch of change as a tip so they were counting while crouching on a chair! The TV screen running commercials of stinky socks!!! The crispy chicken sandwich with crispy skin that was anything BUT CRISPY!! The crispy skin was very thick and looked to be breaded or had some type of coating that made it thick, chewy and rubbery. The chicken is ground up chicken, not a chicken breast.  The sweet potato fries that were all small bottom of the fry basket! They took the chicken sandwich back and brought me a burger. They served the burger cut, with the cut side down so the bun was super soggy from the juice & fat. The server even commented on how it shouldn't look like that. Needless to say I won't be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon Ramsey

vtm94gwbUTe7v4lsQvmlzA.text: What else can you say but "WOW"? I mean it is Gordon Ramsay after all. All burgers are amazing and the Kettle Chip Nachos are mind blowing good. Foie burger is simply delicious. I was ecstatic after watching him all these years to finally taste his dishes and was not disappointed at all. I got confirmation of how good his dishes are. I know he didn't prepare it but I'm sure he trained who did. I wish he had a restaurant close to me.

VthUYM7gI4aWK4UXtSyqEQ.text: Wow! Best burgers and fries my husband and I have ever had! So deliciously perfect. The truffle fries had so much flavor and the two sauces - homemade and super flavorful. The burgers were the right size, the buns were crispy, the meat was cooked to order - medium well, the bacon super crispy, and just overall great! Definitely will come back!
