ocunE0ZW-IBtAO5XbJ0M2w.text: I'm honestly not happy with any of the service I've received one bit...first of all it started with a friend of mine and I being placed at this wobbly table about the size of a nightstand that was directly next to the excessively loud kitchen(not saying the kitchen should be quiet but why have a table right next to it) but I then requested to be placed at a booth I had seen a pair of people sitting at and soon after left but the waiter said she couldn't sit us there because you need a party of 3 when I just watched a party of 2 eat Nd leave she then began to make the whole experience awkward as can be by literally staring me and my buddy in the face for about 20 seconds after we ordered....nothing said, just a weird blank stare and she continued to do this for the remainder of my stay.... I then requested to have a side of ranch which took 3 reminders to finally get and also never got a refill throughout the whole night I've been here before and spent countless hours and dollars at this establishment but I have yet to be absolutely satisfied with my stay nothing on my table that night was served properly and it's a shame I had to experience this but nobody is perfect even a Gordon Ramsay Restaurant.

T4rG35-vmYOuphFYQl9tIA.text: I binge watched kitchen nightmares for hours last year, this restaurant lives up to my standards and then some. Long wait, pricey food, but amazing food and huge burger. Very fancy Parmesan fries, a must buy. Servers are extremely nice, the menu is pretty good. The highlight was definitely the meat and cheese. The mozarella tasted like heaven and made me regret not getting a double cheese burger. I even got a hat.....I don't know why....

w8TdzihF3IzKmaOboVLHDg.text: Probably the B E S T burger I have ever had that I didn't produce myself. They only serve 100 burgers of this style...when gone, they are gone. Aged NY blended with rib meat, and a True medium rare was spot on!

skFvNgmP5nMF_PmgTv3Cbw.text: The best burger I've ever had. The onion rings and truffle French fries are to die for. And the staff was super friendly.

OYjBd0qtOcphTjKuPnbarg.text: The burger was good, but nothing to write home about. Gourmet burger places are pretty popular now and I don't think this one offered anything outstanding compared to others. Parmesan truffle fries were very good, but we waited 40 minutes (after the fries arrived) for our burgers. They told us shift change was happening - at 7pm on Friday!? Not a good idea. Also, best to come here if you have a group of 4 or less.

VK1PLKD1ecnfhEW-uL1Umg.text: Food was delicious and service was excellent. It can be pricey depending on what you order and it does take time to get food but it is 1000% worth it.  Will definitely return the next time I'm in Vegas

BFDxQ8VdcV5_DdrbSadTpw.text: The first time I went with my group of friends there was no wait, the service was amazing, our server went above and beyond. Literally would have recommended this place to anyone because the food is just delicious! Second time around, today to be more specific, I left completely disappointed. Not disappointed with the food because it was just as delicious as the first time. Disappointed because for some reason the staff kept giving my friends and I unwarranted stares, talking about our group to other staff and looking right at us. Mind you my friends and I are far from being rowdy and obnoxious so I do not see a reason as to why the staff would act this way. We may not dress like the richest people in the world but that does mean it's okay to assume we do not have money. It made the whole second experience very uncomfortable and honestly as much as I love the food I would really think about it long and hard before stepping foot in this establishment again. Food deserves 5 stars.

gY-0T5CyTmo7S6Sbj11HAQ.text: Daniel is awesome and the team is incredible.  Couldn't ask for a better experience!!!  Keep it up!!

MZn-SPIDPCm-pViLRSBfpA.text: Delicious burger! Our waiter Alex was great! I had the Blue burger and it was cook to perfection on a tasty bun. Onion rings and fries are separate but 1 tower is perfect to share. My pick,  onion rings but fries were tasty.  Definitely worth the walk over to relax with a beer and burger!

opAKWSKEOHTQMn3WvLD_Vw.text: This place was good but didn't quite live up to the hype, I was told the high end beef burger they had in this week was one of if not the best burger they ever had. I expected it to be more like a steak burger but it was ground up beef. The fries we got with our order were 100% undercooked, if they were going for potatoes wedges they should have called them that. Worth a lunch but maybe not as hyped as it should be.

e9-5PxJCEutW9jk0NEbUPw.text: The burger was out-of-this-world good! It was very juicy and flavorful. By far the best burger I've ever had. The wait to eat was very short and the wait for food was about 20 minutes. The staff was great and the environment is open and casual.

6TDGZGmKJZhj31S5m40C8Q.text: Many unique burger options. Great service. Unfortunately, our fries were very tough and the beautiful burgers are very salty.

3SYzRN2lIv2X0QIRS45L6Q.text: Best esxperience ever. It started out with amazing host service, continued with an amazing waitress who really stayed on top of things and then the food. Had a burger, medium rare to oerfection! Last but not least the desserts, sticky pudding and chocolate trifle. Didn't think that there would be a restaurant that actually can be that way. Any time again

bxIXFkqikLjcJPXiuxV1wQ.text: This is because of the incompetence of being able to seat us with the most dumb system ever. Waited over an hour and thirty min for a tuesday lunch. Not worth the wait after getting the food. Use your own system of vibrators than a cell phone text. Thought this would have been thought of by now.

KKQ8m5Qo3V84LiC69VXqEg.text: My husband and I really wanted to try Burger and we were not disappointed. We didn't wait but 5 minutes to be seated at the bar. The food was delicious and the staff was very friendly! Highly recommend give truffle fries, they are a large enough portion to share between 2-3 people!

c67_IXLiY-7WRSJGk8afzA.text: We live in Las Vegas and have been going to BurgER for the past couple of years whenever we have company.  I always get the Britannia burger and the truffle fries!  Oh my gosh!   What a delight.  My mouth waters just thinking about the not too sweet burger.  Well, now I want another one!

9sShgT3wEpPbmwLz11_oUw.text: Loved it! Great burgers, great fries, great beer, and great service! Definitely a restaurant I will return to when I visit Vegas again.

PkfjczXoqCRj8Q-3359dzQ.text: Don't waste your time or money. We waited for 40 minutes in line, then waited another 40 minutes for food!The $11 fries were not fresh, dry as if left under a heating lamp. The burgers were cooked unevenly. Three people ordered the same burger medium...one was dry, one was raw, and one was actually medium. Gorden Ramsey where are you?  I'd be ashamed to have my name attached to this place.

Bu16wJNfnE4xM6ZHpEJ0GA.text: We had a large party of 9 people and we were excited to eat at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. We left our name with the hostess and were seated after an hour. Service was decent and friendly, but we did have to ask for water and condiments twice. We ordered a variety of burgers plus some side orders of fries (burgers are a la carte) and we all agreed that they were good, but nothing amazing. It wasn't worth the $24+ price tag. I ordered the Forest Burger which promised duck bacon and seasonal mushrooms and a side of Just Fries.The bun was nice and soft. The meat was cooked perfectly to order, but the it could have had more fat. The "seasonal" mushrooms were just criminis and shimejis which can be bought at many grocery stores. I was expecting something more exotic. The duck "bacon" was just a crispy piece of duck meat with barely any skin or fat. When you think bacon, you think a nice mix of meat and fat. The burger also had unmentioned goat cheese. I am not a big fan of goat cheese, but it worked with the burger because of the aforementioned lack of fat content.  The "fries" are thick cut British chips, not bad, but a little misleading. I can get a better quality and better priced burger back home in the San Francisco Bay Area.

NNnOpzRqXyYRbo8IXtA3Cw.text: The decorations and burgers were amazing, truffle fries were great too, the staff was really nice she introduced us the featured on the menu.

sOYKBNLRblkaGjOF3i4kAg.text: Would skip this place for Fat Burger any day of the week. Our first burger came rare instead of well done. By the time we got our second burger our fries were cold. For a pricey burger you'd expect more! Sorry Gordon you need to step it up!! First and last time we try Gordon's!

LH0286mc2stdVz1VgBIQtw.text: First of all let me say this review is long overdue...Absolutely the best place to grab some delicious food & get amazing service. Shanna happened to help us when we dined here last year and we so so fortunate to have her help us out again this year. She truly makes the experience at your restaurant spectacular. Above and beyond is an understatement. Can't say enough great things!!! Make sure you get the Hells burger and sweet potato fries or the just fries followed by the cranbrulee  Oreo cookie shake- it's the best shake ever!!!  Get an appetizer while u wait such as the wings- absolutely superb!!!  If you are a party of two generally you will wait 20 to be seated and a party of 3 or more is a solid 35 min but definitely worth the wait!! Go and see the hostess and she  will give you a text when your table is ready so you can grab a drink and play slots while u wait rather than wait in a line...  Love this place - can't wait to go back!

ls0syElDhapzugx3p2MVfA.text: Gordon Ramsay Burger is amazing we had the Backyard burger 16,Farmhouse burger 17,Stout burger 16,and Hell's Kitchen burger and all of them were exquisite! We asked the manager if he ever comes and he said yes. Sadly we didn't get to meet him tonight. But we still had an excellent night I hope we can come again! The waiters were so friendly. We had a 2 hour wait! It was worth it though . We had an excellent time the place is so clean and nice! It was magical !

C7v68dFMvcYP_5rrDSrsVg.text: You have to find the right time where you beat the traffic here ! His burger is amazing, french fries are pretty dried ! Overall customer service was ok!

luFZAMYOVQnSmc6QRWTuAw.text: The Hell's Kitchen Burger with onion rings is the way to go!! Best burger restaurant in Vegas with such a friendly staff and amazing environment. Located in Planet Hollywood Casino which means it's a close walk anywhere on the strip. Try to have a party of 3 or more to skip the ridiculously long line that you have to wait through to get into the restaurant!

IvM4_90b6grff7OjsXQNlA.text: First, Wendy was our server and she was great. She was very articulate and answered all our questions. I had a Pepsi and she had a refill on the table before I got down to 1/3 of my existing glass. She checked in regularly to see if we needed anything. If you have the luxury of requesting a server, ask for Wendy.  We ordered onion rings that came with a chipotle catchup and a cheddar ranch. These were not pre-made but were obviously hand dipped and fresh. They were good but a little too greasy and kind of fell apart. Still they were dogone good.  The burgers were the most expensive I've ever had but worth every penny. The meat is ground fresh from chuck, brisket and short rib. Incredibly flavorful and moist but not greasy moist. I had the Farmhouse burger with bacon, cheese and an egg. Absolutely fantastic!! My wife had the ultimate cheeseburger which had three types of cheese and the flavor marries like I would have never imagined. I'm so lucky my wife loves me enough to let me have a couple bites.  If you love hamburgers this place goes to a whole new level. Expensive? Yes. Super busy? Yes, expect to wait. But, it is well worth it.

oHc5zZxG9j5He-DVjilhpw.text: Again, another great restaurant by Gordon Ramsay. We loved the food, drinks, and atmosphere. His fries wit sauce pairings are out of this world.

krFY9n9c8j4a7AnVBZieNQ.text: This place has exceptional service and excellent food quality. Love going here. Next time I will try something new since I always try new things on their menu. Manager even came out to greet us and see how everything was. Good job and see you again!

It located in side of Planet Hollywood.

byfxMCrXojAXeDmIV-ZBDg.text: This is definitely one of those restaurants that you must try!  Be prepared for a long wait, or piggyback onto a Diamond VIP client for speedy service.  Burgers are outstanding!  Perfectly seasoned beef, cooked to your taste.   We ordered the Ultimate Cheeseburger:  aged provolone,!dublinar, boursin cheese over 1/3 ground chuck patty. Hog burger:   Mangalista pork, bacon, BBQ pork, white cheddar, crispy onions. Truffle Parmesan fries: crispy, tasty and excellent dipping sauces. Curried shrimp salad:  curried marinated shrimp, apple cider vinaigrette  Cheddar ale soup with pretzels- tasted like beer, cheese, and soft pretzels

g1TSUXEr_k_XgLJCbSymjA.text: Unreal how good a burger can be, Gordon has totally found the solution to cattle flatulence... just eat them all!

m9eAEL0wsM0QmAHdgFrd7A.text: We made a reservation for 8:30pm, but came at 7:30pm to see if they were able to seat us sooner. Unfortunately, they weren't able to, so we walked around to kill some time. We came back at 8:15pm and got seated right away.   If you order the tasting menu, you get to take home an autographed photo of the one and only Gordon Ramsay. However, we decided to go with the Roasted Beef Wellington, Lobster Wellington, and a side of Mac & Cheese. You get a complimentary plate of 4 different types of bread while you wait for your meal (you can even ask for a second serving).  Even though I had the 6 oz Wellington, the pastry made it very filling. The beef was really soft. The lobster was also good, but not worth the price. The Mac & Cheese was decent, but nothing special.  Btw, there is no complimentary dessert on your birthday. Compared to other three- and four-dollar sign restaurants, they are lacking in this area. The most you would get is a "happy birthday" from the wait staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Wellington, Beef Wellington, and Mac &amp; Cheese

RWIe8ClQ9qKAahb7TB6-Yw.text: The 5 stars are mostly due to the DELICIOUS Truffle Parmesan Fries. We were ready and mentally prepared for the wait, 40 minutes, because we know I was going to be worth it; so I suggest to be conscious of that. We had Sweet Potato Fries and the Truffle Parmesan Fries, they come in really nice shareable portions. And then ordered The Hog Burger and The Stout, don't know which one was better, they were both delicious and juicy.

G0fcc5B7l74BJ0W5QYVntw.text: Wasn't the best burger I've ever had but was a pretty damn good one. Prices are fair for Vegas and the wait goes by fast. I split the hog burger and hell's kitchen burger with a side of fries. The hog burger was sorta one-note and the bacon was a little undercooked. The Hell's Kitchen was an explosion of flavor and was a pretty unique burger overall. Fries were decent, came with a bunch so you can split them with a friend. Asked for a side of ranch since I wasn't really feeling the other sauces.

tgIiZTwpRUa-JAgbksgI3g.text: We were a party of 4 and each of us loved our burgers and sides. I split the jalapeno burger with my friend; it was the best hamburger I have ever eaten! The waiter was great and helpful. The wait as 45 minutes, and worth the wait.

bbiv62q5VhOy2AMfn49lag.text: The fish and chips were delicious, they were light and the fish was tender and delicious. The curry mango dipping sauce was awesome. Didn't care for the southwest ranch and would try something different next time! Fries with sea salt were good too. Reasonably priced for new Vegas!

c8tLQb6O5_hdcynAfQMqDA.text: Not sure what's changed since it was BURGR except the name, color of mats and menus, but still seems to be the same type of place?  This burger spot is a must go to for me and my friend and never disappoints. Service is always spot on, and food is filling and tasty.  My friend and I both ordered a yummy tequila cocktail which was quite strong for me! We also both ordered the Forest Burger and an order of just fries. They both came out pretty quickly, and the burger was amazing! The mushrooms in it was the perfect compliment. The fries are steak fries, which aren't my favorite, but they give you a chipotle and curry ketchup. I don't like ketchup, but the curry one is nice. I also asked for a truffle aioli which was yummmmmmmmmy! Perfect to add to the burger too.  For the price, this place can't get any better! A must try for some good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cross section of forest burger

yKLbTo68wQkhePBx4rXA8Q.text: Mar. 2018- Gotta say, this place lives up to the hype. We had a Farmhouse burger and the Burnt Ends Poutine.  Both selections were masterfully prepared and exceptionally flavorful. I would suggest getting your burger cooked medium to medium rare to ensure the freshly ground beef stays moist. It would be criminal to dry this baby out.  Our server, Adam, was playfully helpful and attentive. He patiently helped me wade through the extensive beer options. The loud and boisterous crowd added to the fun experience. Although the line can look daunting, it moves along rather quickly, so don't let it scare you off. The wait is well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse Burger...my Aunt and Uncle, dairy farmers, would have &#34;had a cow&#34; if you put an egg on a burger in their farmhouse.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gordon waiting to catch a line cutter.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burnt Ends Poutine with pickled onion.

GVttvqo-EkSQKqP3Q_dXbA.text: Meh! Not blown away by anything here. Yawn. Nothing special. The best I can say is that it is edible.

kAZSWaE9ePc3mx7mUrH9NQ.text: We came here for the first time on a Friday afternoon around 2pm, waited in line for about 10 mins (reservation not needed).   SERVICE - As good as it gets! Very friendly staff all around. Our server was great and very accommodating even though we only ordered a burger and a soup for snacks.   AMBIENCE - Very lively and crowded but you don't feel cramped. Great place for lunch or a snack when you need a break from the casino :p  [HELLS' KITCHEN BURGER] - $17 - Perfectly done. The jalapeno (actually spicy) and roasted tomatoes added a very nice kick to the flavor. The patty was super tender and juicy. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.  [CHEDDAR ALE SOUP] - $9 - Overly salty..... How is Gordon Ramsay ok with this?! (our server was kind enough to take this off our bill)

1k5iEWOL6QJz5mXf4thvfw.text: We were pretty impressed with our first visit so we decided to visit again this trip. The wait wasn't too long at 7-8pm on a Thursday night - about a half hour for a party of 2.   Since we weren't too hungry we decided to share the blue burger, chips with curry sauce, and a brown butter caramel pecan shake. Our server came by pretty quickly to ask us if we wanted to order any drinks (they're all listed on an ipad) but we declined seeing as how we already packed in quite a few drinks by that time. From there the service went a bit downhill, our server wasn't very friendly and also got our order wrong (order wasn't written down, just remembered). We ended up with the correct burger and drink but truffle parmesan fries instead - we decided not to send this back since it looked pretty good and the price difference is pretty small anyway. One thing to note, the food took a very long time to come out; we finished pretty much the entire shake before the fries came out.   As for taste, the blue burger is a solid if you like blue cheese, relatively simple but done well. I will say that I enjoyed my forest burger from our last visit a bit more. We loved the fries though, especially the truffle sauce which was extremely decadent. The shake was superb and I like how there were caramel pecans right on top - would definitely recommend trying out their shakes!!   We essentially didn't see our server for the rest of our meal and had to wait quite a while to get the check.   With everything said, I still like Burger- the food is great & well priced, plus the poor service seemed to be a relatively isolated incident. The tables in other sections near us seemed to have pretty attentive servers & our server from our last visit was also extremely friendly and attentive. Overall I'd still recommend stopping by if you're staying at Planet Hollywood or just craving a burger!

gltzHt4-dBH4BhebguZDBg.text: Halfed 2 sandwiches to share:  Hell's Kitchen Burger: I was drawn to the burger for the roasted jalapeno & jalapeno aioli, but I didn't taste much of it. This burger was so-so.  Crispy Cherry Pepper Chicken: I was sold at fried chicken skin - drool! This burger did not disappoint! Crispy, moist, delicious chicken! Small piece of chicken skin though. Will know to order extra chicken skin next time.   Service was slow. This was our first meal just landing in Vegas. We entertained ourselves with some shots and cocktails while we waited well over 20 minutes for our food, even the fries. Asked about our food and I'm not quite sure of the server was being a smart ass or trying to be funny.   Would come back only for that perfectly cooked crispy chicken burger.

QmhmK8HdBvaxYcXuOlgvLQ.text: Second time coming here, and the wife and I were not disappointed.  We waited in line for about 30 minutes. After that, we were seated and our server, Rick, came rather quickly to take our order.  We had the onion rings for an appetizer.   I got the Ultimate Cheeseburger, medium well, and my wife got the Western Burger, well done.  We also got the sweet potato fries to share.   Service was excellent, Rick is very attentive.   The food, both our burgers were a bit dry, and needed some ketchup and ranch to balance out the dry bite.  Sweet potato fries were okay, but the sauce served with them was a bit too sweet for our liking, and we asked for ketchup to balance that out.  Overall good experience and we may come back in the future for more.

nUbdGpLbOdA98LHT92TnQQ.text: Wow. This place was exactly what I expected.   I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay.   I love watching his shows on television.  This is my first time ever trying his food.   The burgers take 30 minutes to cook. But wow it's worth the wait. My burger was so juicy and tasteful.  I also ordered the wings here while we waited for the entree. Wow the wings were better than I expected.   The service was great.  Customer service was on point. The location does get packed, there was a line of people in front of us and still a long line after I left.   I even watched the employees clean the tables and I was amazed.   This is truly a remarkable restaurant that I can definitely see myself coming back to.   Thank you for your excellent service.  You have to try it, you won't be disappointed.

6FrzwJEbXrKO3lA_zP9Zbw.text: Where to start?! I mean, you seriously get so amazed by the fire display in front of the restaurant while waiting in line to get seated. You are greeting by friendly host who take you to your table. The kitchen is open so you can see all your chefs/cooks making everyone's food and drinks. I love open kitchens to the dining rooms. It's more comforting to me at least. The waiters/waitresses and servers are on point here. They are fast and so friendly. I like how they come around to check how everything is and if anything else is needed. The burgers roughly take 20-25 minutes so if you are HANGRY, get an appetizer lol. The burgers are worth the wait because they are made fresh to order. We got the hellfire wings and kettle nachos as an appetizer and man.. it was deliciousness all over your mouth! The wings do get blue cheese crumbles on there so if you're not a fan, let them know to take it out. For me, I loved it. The nachos are interesting and absolutely flavorful. Never thought of having kettle chips instead of tortilla chips. You can definitely taste the freshness! For my burger of choice, I did get their spring Special with had portobello mushrooms, pickled shallots, arugula, cheese and a cheese spread type condiment. OH! I got the Impossible Burger patty with it cooked medium and OH MY TASTEBUDS WERE HAPPY!! Like really, I had to really ask myself if this was really beef. They cook their burgers perfectly. I don't think you'll be disappointed. I mean, come on! Gordon Ramsay here.. I'm sure he'll check his people working if they don't do it right. There is a Scottish Ale on the menu which is suppose to be Gordon's favorite beer.. PLEASE TRY IT!! It's really good. I'm an IPA girl but if it's his favorite, why not try it right? If you're unsatisfied with your burgers here, drink a little more at the casino or a bar then come back hahaha! Jk! (Some of you will get it later) Anyways, happy eating my fellow Yelpers! Cheers!

e86wr7ewAlsNwWW5e-Tlfg.text: I love you Gordon Ramsay! You can cuss at me all you want!  I was super excited to come here when he announced after the season finale of Hell's Kitchen.  The winner, Christina Wilson, is the executive chef here!  I was mind blown on how juicy the burgers were.  I always order the Farmhouse burger and the addition to the fried egg is exquisite.  I love Truffle fries, but I was disappointed the way it was made here. They were cut in wedges so you don't get the crisp crunch and there wasn't enough truffle!  Still a fan of fries though. Fries before guys? For appetizers, we ordered the Pork Belly buns and I was amazed at how soft the buns were. Usually, some places overcook the buns so it ends up dried out.  I'm not sure if they're still serving that, but it's definitely a must have there.  If you're in Vegas, this is your one stop!

l7D8OuzZO-jlaa-yQAG4Hw.text: Expect lines to be seated. It took about an hour on New Year's Day. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger as it was the most popular item and truffle fries. SWNH8s9tUL2meOyeWhw9Yg.text: my second time there. i really like the food at this restaurant and i believe the prices there are very reasonable. i am given 3 stars instead of 5 because i did not like that when me and my wife asked for the table next t the window, we were told that we cannot have it because it is reserved to big group. that same day i saw a couple setting on a table next to the window. if you have a rule, it should apply to all customers.  the soup there is a must, it`s so delicious.

OTAgy9I1gtBaF3HufoYpZA.text: A very good burger although a bit pricey.  I was reading Bourdain's book Nasty Bits and he mentioned that him and friend went to Thomas Keller's restaurant Bouchon. He did not expect much since this was Vegas, but he said he was surprised by the quality of the food. Anyhow, that is honestly, why I gave these guys a go.  The burger was cooked to a perfect medium. First way to kill a burger, at least for me, is to over-cook the thing. I ordered the Farmhouse Burger, which I thought could have had a bit more salt, but the bacon and egg added good flavor. So overall, I was very happy.   Truffle fries were on-point as well, perfectly fried and served with two dipping sauces.   Service was average. We waited in line at 1045am for it to open at 11am. We got our seats and our orders were taken quickly. But, as for refills, I ran out of wine half way through my burger only to be checked on right before I asked for the bill.   Overall, not my favorite burger in the world, but definitely one that I would go back for.

bE5HplWw7YBmcKxgy0UbEQ.text: This was a pretty good hamburger! We came here not knowing what to expect and were pleasantly surprised.  We both had the Hells' kitchen burger cooked medium with fries.  The meat is seasoned well and the roasted jalapeno adds so much flavor!  Service was great for as busy as this place was (we had about a 15 minute wait at 2 in the afternoon).  Come early if you are too hungry to wait!  Our only issue was that the fries were not very good.  When a restaurant can execute a burger so well, it always makes me wonder how they can mess up french fries?? They were not crispy from the moment they hit the table.  We did enjoy the two varieties of ketchup that they were served with.  We would definitely return in the future.

pe9ddmF08rZ6LpMDNLhKGw.text: Food was delicious, highly recommend the farmers burger! Service was excellent. Great energy at this spot

WaVyb_6tVq3Er50SCjIqAA.text: For me this is a hype place. Maybe I'm boring, but I don't care if my burger has all the fancy weird toppings that I don't recognize. Because I hadn't brushed up on my 50 types of cheese I ended up ordering one that had what tasted like a goat cheese on it. Really disappointing since I am not into it at all. I would have asked our waitress what some of the items were but to be honest she seemed less than thrilled to be there and did not make me feel comfortable enough to ask her to explain the items. Not to mention we had to keep asking for our drinks to be refilled, and flag her down to get our bill after we sat there not eating for a good 10-15 minutes. Drink refilling is admittedly one of my nerves because that is serving/waiting 101. I know there are other better waitresses there as one next to us seemed really helpful and eager to assist her table.   We came without a reservation and waited maybe 5 minutes, not bad at all.   This is a wonderful place for someone who is more cultured in their cheeses, odd vegetables, and duck bacon... my boyfriend liked it, me not so much.   Got points for 1. Convenience to the strip 2. Fairly priced for a gourmet burger 3. Awesome truffle fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JDARzgCTAytB9CjYn7_q5g.text: I'm (pretty much) obsessed with Gordon Ramsay so I was ecstatic to be in Vegas with a chance to dine at one of his restaurants. Steak was out of price range (poverty college student) so burgers it was.   Ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger ($15) and truffle fries ($11) to share. The burger was delicious, with a nice kick of heat. Perfectly cooked. The truffle fries were okay - the parmesan was a little overpowering and seemed to absorb much of the truffle oil.   The place is located in Planet Hollywood. It's got a very modern posh look. We came at 11:30am on a Tuesday and had no wait for food...unfortunately after ordering, our food took at least 30 minutes to come out! Luckily I was in good company so there was plenty to talk about but it really was a long time for burgers and fries. Service was just okay, as the server only came by once early on in our wait. The server was knowledgeable about the menu but really didn't display much interest in us after we ordered. The place also doesn't take reservations, so  it can get crowded at peak hours.  Bottom line: It's as tasty as you'd expect from a Gordon Ramsay restaurant. A little pricey but it's Vegas and it does have the Ramsay name. Prepare for a length wait for the food, sadly.  Anecdote: The table of four next to us also had a long wait for their food, so much so that the manager came out to talk to them. They waited for over 25 minutes, which apparently is the policy there. We definitely waited just as long, but no manager came to talk to us - probably because we are potatoes. Sad.

u1g3qwXFVAnW5lX1PSowYA.text: Every year, we travel here (atleast twice/three times a year) for the Gooey Fries  I'm sad and probably not coming back because of the discontinuation of the Gooey Fries.

We can see that dozens of fries have been prepared and gone out..... the waitress says yes, but the fries don't show up. Had to ask again. Burger comes out and it's ok. Not as good as previous times. Pretty disappointed.

ZpjubcRQhosgJ8PF7-65Jw.text: Fans of good food and fast service will have a good time here if my lunch here was a good indication. We were greeted immediately with a smile when we walked in and were seated right away after walking in around 20 minutes after the restaurant opened.  A wall of flames greets guests as they enter the restaurant and the restaurant has a good mix of decor that might interest Gordon Ramsay fans in addition to sports bar appeal.  The onion rings are bomb!  Delicate shavings of cheese topped a large cone of crispy, beer-battered onion rings and the  ranch dressing made the each bite melt into my mouth. My brother and I agreed, these were the star of our lunch. My tandoori chicken burger was good, cooked perfectly with a fresh bun and my tangerine cocktail was so juicy, I wanted more, a great balance between sweetness and alcohol content. The tables have a subtle British theme from the glossy menus with Gordon Ramsay flanked by the British flag to the blue place settings with red cloth napkins, adding a nice touch to the table. One suggestion I'd have is to include plain fries with burgers to provide a more complete meal; it'd allow guests to still choose from their tasty-looking appetizer menu if they wish but would be a more traditional way to enjoy a burger without paying extra. We had a great experience, our waitress was friendly and made sure we were well taken care of.  A fun lunch and an affordable option in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken burger

ZzbtGBG-RCYVZGwb7rULIg.text: Best of the best  Should try if you are in Vegas. Highly recommend the HK burger,it was really good.

FG-VHvjitWZpHJvGuhSfLQ.text: I have never been treated this way by any restaurant. We waited for 2 1/2 hours for them to tell us that we were not "Diamond Club" members (while pointing her manicured nail at the Diamond Club sign) and therefore we weren't guaranteed seating at the time we were promised. The hostess was rude to my husband and was rude to me when all we were asking was if we could get seated. She said that "her friend took our name down" so she was not aware of our situation and couldn't help us.  If they were not able to take our party, then they shouldn't have taken our name down. The hostess said twice that our table was ready and they were just waiting on the party to get up-so what happened????? I'm never EVER going to eat at one of Gordon's restaurants if this is how people are treated by staff.

1w6XfYhZvLv2Fv3-U3E-jA.text: Probably one of the best burger restaurants I have been to in Vegas. Gordon Ramsay does not disappoint. I especially love the huge photo of him in the middle of the restaurant with his arms crossed, staring at all of his customers as if to say "Yeah, you know that burger is delicious"   My favorite here is actually the truffle fries. So so so good. Probably the best truffle fries ever. I have only had truffle fries as good as these in LA at a hot dog joint called Wurstkuchen.   I have ordered the Mushroom Burger here and it was ah-maaazzziiinnggg. The last time I came, I ordered the Ahi Sliders instead and pretty much doubled over, with how delicious it was. I was also a bit drunk too. My boyfriend ordered the burger with the jalapenos and the avocado in it ( can't remember what it was called) and I had a bite of it, we both loved it and didn't want to put it down.   We made some friends in the line waiting for a table and the staff was so accommodating and let us move our table to sit with our new friends.   It was also my birthday and they brought over free dessert, which was so sweet! Delicious. I don't really remember what kind of dessert it was considering how hammered I was, all I remember was that it was yummy.

cmqexNJ043CfFFEkvUaaKg.text: This place is OKAY. Got the crown burger ($15) our waiter asked how I want the meat to be and I wanted it medium well done. Once the burger arrived and I took a bite into it, the meat was soooooo dry. It was so hard for me to swallow it down. Like wtf I can make better burgers that has juice coming out when biting into it. Disappointed. The waiter was meh.. only came to our table 2-4 ish time? Parmesan truffle fries were aight.

txyPGL5Xh1gESlGNC-Ybng.text: I don't understand why the Impossible Burger is $6 extra and takes 30 minutes to prepare when it's not even meat?! Other restaurants that offer the Impossible Burger allow you to order the burgers on the menu and substitute this patty, free of charge. The Impossible burger is better for the planet and people's health so why not make it accessible? Gordon Ramsay, I hope you read this post and consider the experiences of vegan/vegetarians that support your establishments.

BNW0MrruuJaf52rweWJi0w.text: The food was amazing! I'm rating only four stars because of the wait, we waited almost an hour for our food and the appetizers came out with our meals. There was also a pushy photographer who took our picture and tried to sell us the pixilated prints. I felt like that cheapened the experience.   However, the food was excellent. No complaints there!

97Pqk-bdrhw7MYk2hOFkKw.text: We ate here last weekend with a group of 20 people. The service was great. The ambiance was relaxing and comfortable. I loved that they put our name down in the beginning and texted us when our table was ready. So in the meantime we shopped around! Now about the food. Delicious. I was honestly not even that hungry because we had a somewhat late breakfast, but I definitely did not want to miss out, so went ahead and ate anyway. We started off with 3 kinds of fries - sweet potato fries, the just fries, and the truffle parmesan fries. The parmesan fries were hands down the best! And the sauces that came with were so good. Next came our burger. Our entire group was basically divided in half between the Backyard burger and the Hells Kitchen burger. The latter sounded more appealing to me, so I went with that. And It. Was. Good. So Good. We are definitely going back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen Burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Backyard Burger

U-EUSh1c9zgQ3uXxPqhRfA.text: The last time I was in Vegas, there was a HUGE line so we called in ahead of time for reservations. Unfortunately, this place doesn't take reservations.  Luckily, our party of 4 got there pretty early so we were able to get a table almost right away. Our hostess recommended the Hells Kitchen Burger, which I was planning on getting anyway because DUHHH! Gordon Ramsay! My bf got the Forest Burger for the mushrooms. We also ordered the garlic fries and poutine.   The Hells Kitchen Burger was AMAZING! Cooked to a perfect medium and full of flavor! My bf's Forest Burger was really good too, but I still prefer the Hells Kitchen Burger. The fries and poutine were also very good. The burgers were a good size. With the fries, we were too full to finish everything and took half the burgers and fries to go.   I would definitely return here for a casual lunch on my next Vegas trip!

QqU0k6VFuygGUF_LAiuQ1w.text: Awesome food and great prices for being a Gordon Ramsay spot. Will definitely come back here to try something different.

V9FGO3zx8QnXgwbD2tNQQg.text: Ramsay restaurant is worthy of being in kitchen nightmare. to start the staff on Monday night 4/17/17 seemed to hate their job. me and gf order. she orders the ahi sliders  ( she didn't want a regular burger. ) I order the hells kitchen burger. and we share fries.  the water is nasty..  the ahi sliders arrive about 10 minutes before my Burger. I get it's an appetizers but, the server could have realized that was my gf main course. when the burger comes they bring another plate of ahi sliders. I think "oh cool they realized what they did and are giving us another order of sliders" the server realized they already brought them and decided to take them back. I asked if she could just leave them with us since they are already made. she said no. I guess they are selling to let them sit until someone else orders them. 1 stars since the actual burger I got was great.   now the worst of all things. the 8 dollar fries " just fries" they were the most stale fries I've ever paid for. they were cold and hard to bite. I'm not picky at all when it comes to fries and was hungry. but, I just couldn't eat them..i tried..  no one ever asked how was everything so I didn't complain.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. stale fries $8

GEenVQMP_5ZRGjmp6-fuAw.text: Fan-freaking-tastic. One of the best burgers I've ever had, and it was honestly not as pricey as I thought it would be. There's a reason his restaurants have earned him 16 Michelin stars. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger, and if you're into spicy, this one packs some heat behind it's amazing flavor. I also sampled the truffle fries and the sweet potato fries, and it was tough to pick which one I liked more. The service was great, and the staff was amenable. There was a line out the door to get inside, but I think that was to be expected at a place like this.

QEo8HH2oVpdYEWT6rugcQQ.text: So, the reason that this review has 2 stars is because of the price associated with the food. Let me start by saying that the staff is always wonderful at every Gordon Ramsay restaurant I've been to (Street Pizza, Heddon Street, Gordon Ramsay Steak, and Gordon Ramsay Burgers but NOT Bread Street Kitchen). There was nothing different here. Excellent people. This is, however, his worst restaurant I've been to. By far. The burgers are actually fine, but for nearly $20 for just the burger, not at all what I expected. The French fries with truffle oil and Parmesan - completely overbearing. I could only eat 5 of them. Between me and my friend, we ate an appetizer, a burger and fries, and had one drink per person. $102. Absolutely not. Will most likely never go back.

2x8S8GaDcAKllxWFjQC7dA.text: Delicious! The lines can get long, but if you put your name down, they'll text you when your table is almost ready :) I came on a Sunday night around 7:30pm and had to wait for about 45 minutes for a party of 3.   I got the:  -Farmhouse burger  -Hells kitchen burger  -Hells kitchen chicken wings   The farmhouse burger was soooo yummy. It wasn't as dynamic as the Hell's Kitchen burger, but it was simple yet delicious. There was an egg in it, which went perfectly with the bacon and meat. The egg was made perfectly... the runny yolk actually squirted out when I tried to cut the burger.   The Hell's Kitchen burger had spicy jalapeno aoli and really just so much going on. It was delicious!!   I actually didn't like the chicken wings that much. It was pretty juicy, but I'm not a huge fan of tangy flavors so it wasn't my favorite.   The restaurant's front has a huge fire lining the wall and a 'Gordon Ramsay Burgr' sign- super cool! Gordon Ramsay's picture was everywhere hahahah  who is that again?? Some decent chef, right?! ;)

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Page two of menu
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Page 3 of menu

bsLlPHNZn3fgfmdaF6oTSg.text: I went around 3pm on a Wednesday and sat at the bar so the wait was minimal. I had the Stout burger - SO GOOD. The mushrooms were delicious. I liked the iPad they had for beer selection. It's expensive, but it's Vegas.

zttd7djBTAWjNKPDmPFSag.text: So not worth it!!!  Don't come here if you're hungry ... you'll wait an hour (told us 45 minutes), took our order right away, then sat and waited another hour to get fries ... we ate 2 orders of fries (to try the truffle style along with regular) and received burgers 10 minutes after we were already done eating them ... another table seated 5 minutes before us ordered half the food we did and got served fully 15 minutes after us. Cheeseburger was too salty - backyard burger was way too sweet.  And the water tasted terrible. 2 hours and the food was meh. Setting customers' expectations is the name of the game - for success to last, your customers will wait two hours if they are informed and they can, and not bristle with anger when 45 minutes is really two hours.

KhKlc5o6moKFXLiLQL88Ow.text: Dang good burgers and fries but the real winner was the creme brulee Oreo milkshake  wish I had one near me!

eHvrlC25_MWSJKwMA4Dt7w.text: Because I am an avid cheeseburger fanatic and have heard many a good thing about his restaurant, this place was on my list of "burger joints to conquer". Pricey? Yes. But totally worth it for the aficionados.  What I had: the Uber Cheese Burger. Why? Because I love cheese and apparently have no concern over clogged arteries. It was melty, and tangy and loaded with delicious cheesy goodness. The patty was juicy and cooked to perfection. It really needed nothing else and hit the spot. The perfect accompaniment was an order of their crispy Truffle Fries with parmesan cheese sprinkled on top. Because no burger is complete without exquisite fries, am I right? The only caveat is the wait time which is standard here apparently.  Delicious decadence in a fun environment with a great wait staff....can't ask for more than that!

AjjU3Ssax6aNSVI3-iJlAg.text: A 3.5 would probably be a more accurate rating for this place. We were in town for a bachelor party and decided a good burger would hit the spot for lunch.   I am not sure how it worked out but since we had a fairly large party, we didn't have to wait in line. They took down our info and called us when the table was ready. I guess they didn't want is backing up the line too long. This was great as we were able to wander around a little bit and grab some drinks in the casino.   Once seated, our server got our drinks and an appetizer order. She was very pleasant and explained the different burgers in detail for whatever questions we had.   The burger was good, but not great. Cooked to perfection but flavor was lacking a little bit. Let me tell you what you need to order are the truffle fries...AMAZING! I believe it came with a couple of different dipping sauces which was a plus.

oa7Ko10T4TSai5b-k74HSw.text: Honestly this was pretty bad. I had high expectations for a Gordon Ramsay restaurant, but this was disappointing. The burger I ordered was cooked exactly how I wanted it but it has almost no flavor. The truffle fries tasted flavorful but all of the fries that I had were small over cooked pieces. My guest ordered the farmhouse burger and they forgot the duck bacon. When we notified our server Brittany and she said, "oh...I'll get you a side." There was no apology, she didn't offer to remake the food, which is a standard practice in restaurant, and she just set it on the table and said, "here you go." Again no apology or anything. Throughout our entire dining experience Brittany did not check up on us, we were waiting and looking around trying to flag her down to little avail. I had high expectations for a restaurant that is under Gordon Ramsay's name but damn...go save your money and eat at In & Out down the street. I guarantee you will be more satisfied there with the food and service.

QgsvPTz3A1lcTCKywP4AqQ.text: I really thought this place would be all hype. Granted, I went anyway, but I didn't actually expect to get what I paid for.   If you are in Vegas, go to Gordon Ramsay Burger. PLEASE!! My friend and I each got a different burger. I got the bleu cheese burger, she got the Hell's Kitchen burger. Get hers. The Hell's Kitchen burger was so freaking delicious!!! Mine was great, but I really can't get over how good hers was!  The burgers are so juicy. We both ordered ours medium well, hers actually came out over cooked, well done, and was still juicy. We later learned that if you tell them that, they'll get you a new burger within minutes. Our server seemed pretty bummed that we didn't tell her sooner. So please note that. They really care that you enjoy your food.   I also enjoyed that you can keep the menu as a souvenir. I initially thought it was a little cheap for a Ramsay establishment to have laminated paper menus, until she said that, then it all made sense.   If you're hungry, I'd go another day. It takes around 20 minutes for the burgers to come. And they're pretty hearty, so I'm not sure if I'd load up on appetizers. You know what you can eat better than I.   Also, I must stress to get the truffle fries!! It comes with their house ketchup AND a truffle aioli. We actually added the aioli to our burgers and it took them up a million notches! Do it. You won't be sorry!!! This is coming from someone who dislikes mayonnaise, it's so good!!! And you can literally see chunks of truffle inside. Totally worth it.    I will point out that burgers and fries are separate. Entries don't come with sides, but the burgers are so good they really can stand alone! I'll be back the next time I visit to try another sandwich. I know it'll be worth every penny!!

wauaWXZwhjehlQrhP1lM9A.text: Very bad experience! Food terrible, nothing what I expected or the menu made it out to be.  For the price it sucked.  The birthday desert was the best.    You could never pay me enough to go back!

Opa1Fs67cetSNsv3lwVh-g.text: Props to not only our server Nadine, but also her manager who handled this complete jerk like pros. Really? You are going to DEMAND they charge your phone for you? Both were completely respectful and tactful. Now, I'm starving and waiting for my burger. The wait was only about 10 minutes. Not bad at all. My only question.... does anyone sit down here? Everyone here is running in circles. Top notch service. **stuffed, best backyard burger I've had in a very long time.**

qZnK3Wi_Kb3OHQHoQKlcwg.text: Lines are for idiots, especially for a burger restaurant.  Time is all you have in Vegas, and it's costing you $$$ so, why waste it!  Besides there are a million places to get a burger here.   Got to this place, solo, to try and get seat at the counter.  Hostess basically indicated I need to wait in line and it's a 30 min wait.  I thought Ok, and trucked to back of the line, thinking I'm the only or one of few soloists. Waited 15 min, moved up, as people removed themselves from the line.  I thought this is odd. I clearly see people leaving and tables are available.  I went back to hostess stand for an explanation. I noticed a lot of empty spots at the counter and quite a few empty tables.  I inquired as to why this is the case.  Answer: "we can only seat people every 7 min".  I did the math.  What kind of crap is this!  I promptly removed myself from this idiotic line and bid adeu.  Get it together Gordon! This place has your name and it's turned into a "shitshow".

3Ej1Avx4XPAS8ehoZfplSQ.text: This place lives up to the hype and the burgers are amazing! A friend and I stopped by here on a Friday night around 5pm. Although there was already a line, it wasn't too long and we were quickly seated in about 10-15 minutes.  The atmosphere is casual but classy and the waiters and waitresses are wonderful. Since this is called the Gordon Ramsey Burger, we both got burgers and truffle/parmesan fries.  The forest burger is a beef patty topped with tremor cheese, seasonal forest mushrooms, and duck bacon. It was sinfully savory and the buns are crispy and buttery without being overly heavy. The patty was cooked to perfection (caramelized edges with a hint of pink on the inside) and the goat cheese gives an unexpected tang to tickle the taste buds in a delightful way. The mushroom lend the burger an overall mellow earthy tone. Lastly, the duck bacon complements the tangy cheese well with its saltiness. However, I would have preferred the bacon to be thicker since this slice was too thin to bring out the meaty and fattiness of duck meat.  The tomato sauce and truffles aioli sauce for the parmesan fries are really good! The tomato sauce tastes like Italian sweet gravy and the truffles aioli is creamy, earthy, and savory. However, I prefer my fries to be crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The fries I received were dry on the inside and out.  The service was very good, but the burger could have been hotter when it arrived. When we received the burger, it was lukewarm which means that it was sitting out for a while before being brought to our table.  Overall, good meal and very good service. Gordon Ramsey Burger did not disappoint!

4cxI2aQzN8RsBXV6jXkX6g.text: First let me say that the Blue cheese burger did not disappoint. The truffle fries were tasty as well and the pear Sangria was to die for

fJ2_HhbpsswAz2Xu_G82qQ.text: First off, the burgers my husband and I ordered were great, no complaints there. We also ordered fries and 2 milkshakes, which never arrived at our table. Our server never checked in on us, and we we tried to get someone's attention we were completely ignored, when we asked one of the waitresses who was carrying fries confused looking was for us, she was like NO and walked away. We both finished our burgers and had still not been checked up on.  FINALLY we got someone's attention and told them the situation. We told them we didn't even want the fries anymore because we were full off eating the burger (which at this point we had finished 10 or 15 minutes ago). The manager came over and offered us the milkshakes for free. We took it, they were good, and free which is nice. However the waitresses were not taking their job seriously and one girl who didn't look like she worked there sat at a bar and the the staff would just sit and talk to her not doing their job. It was embarrassing for a Gordon Ramsey restaurant...

b7AmWR8664XQK-Ib2MvWBg.text: Wanted to try burger for the longest time, so my husband and I finally did it! Upon entrance  to the restaurant, we were notified that Andre or Endre was going to be our server. Andre ruined our whole experience there at Burger. He was arrogant, and cocky. He seemed like he didn't want to be working, and spoilt the energy/vibe of the night. When he first came to take our order, he straight up told us that there at Gordon Ramsey's burger, the food is ALWAYS late and that we would have to wait for a period of time, so we shouldn't get frustrated.. who does that??? He was just really frustrating. On the other hand of the experience, the food was great.i had the forest burger,  and it was quite delicious. I would definitely give the restaurant a try! Just make sure to avoid Andre!

vpzqP1pHlv1fX8-1MInsGw.text: GR Burger has become my worst dining experience in America so far!   Burger bread was not fully warmed up, beef and veges were pooly done, 32 mins waiting time which is ridiculous, and no apology at all, guys within the bar had no smile ... WhAT A SHAME! HIGHLY NOT RECOMMEND!

oRvwWY19cdzYx9gX1WaB2w.text: Finally got to try Gordon Ramsay's Burger restaurant and it was everything and more. The decor, the menus, the whole ambience was amazing. I was in a group of 7 people and they told us it would be an hour wait which was fine since we were on the casino already so we just gambled until we were notified through text message that our table was ready. We arrived and were told they were clearing off our table, okay cool but it literally took them 15 minutes to clear a table off which I felt like was a little bit long to wait after you told us our table was ready. Anyways, the food was great! I ordered the Hell's Kitchen burger because it had jalapenos which i thought would be spicy but it really wasn't but good none the less. Our table also ordered the sweet potato fries and the truffle Parmesan fries. Both amazing!! The swear potato fries were just so damn good! Can't really figure out way but they were not your ordinary fries! And you can't go wrong with truffle! Those fries were amazing as well! Our experience was overall great! I'm docking a star because of the wait but everything else was top notch!

2q69KrcxqszCZnKSwE694w.text: No exaggerations here. Top 3 burgers I've ever had and I've had quite a few. It was juicy and flavorful like a ribeye almost. I went around 2 so there was no wait and service was wonderful. Our waitress literally gave me a new glass of lemonade half way through my first. They have a weekly special that changes but I didn't try because I wanted a beef burger and it was pork. For my first time in Vegas this was a must have on my list and it didn't disappoint. I had the farm house. House cured bacon, egg, and dublinar cheese. Will definitely be back next time I'm in town. We also tried the truffle fries were excellent as well and big enough to share between 3. Sorry I didn't get a photo my friends attacked before I could act but the photos of my burger are more than you need to decide

9W921PxTk5bwvYcCL2Lbvg.text: I ordered a burger and the chicken wings as an appetizer. Both were soo delicious!! When I came there was no line at all, I guess I was lucky.. I will def.come back.

50eBkALWGSSB_MMQoRrIOw.text: I thought this burger was just ok. They have a variety of burger choices and toppings. I had just a regular bacon burger which was average. I wanted regular ketchup but they only had one that was homemade and in my opinion not good. Parmesan fries was cold and hard.   Save the extra money. This is just a high priced burger served at a celebrity restaurant.

wGNw1WwabqGPtg5yeYZG1Q.text: Worth every penny! Get there early the lines are long because everyone wants a Gordon Ramsey burger!!  Mine was spectacular & I devoured it quickly. With so many choices at such high prices it was nice to see a high end Chef serve up burgers. Just because it Las Vegas doesn't mean you have to have caviar

4mfIPUVctNSnyxLkm3GwuA.text: Hour to get in which is what to be expected.  Table for two is right next to ur neighbor you can literally touch the people sitting next to you. Street corn dip appetizer was delicious but crumbs for chips. Not much to choose from as far as burgers. For $20 burger doesn't even come with fries! Come on Ramsay its potato.  My medium well patty was well done,  no pink at all. Staff were very nice,  they were best part.  For Ramsay restaurant we were expecting something amazing and it was not

oGwJek5S8qOBgRv-UHNyaA.text: I have been waiting a long time to try this place and I was not disappointed. The service was friendly and knew their stuff. After recommendations I decided to try the Hell's Kitchen burger and the Farmhouse burger. Both were delicious and cooked to perfection! The Hell's kitchen burger was not too spicy and the flavor was out of this world. The Farmhouse burger was like a  breakfast explosion in my mouth. The egg was cooked just right and not over done like some places. The onion rings and dipping sauces have changed my whole perspective and expectations when it comes to this side. The prices were reasonable, the staff was friendly, and the food was amazing!

hpiatWBbGPW5NuYF8Ofz5g.text: I'm not usually a fan of burgers but this place was bombbbb. Got the UK burger and it wasn't too big but definitely filling. I'm very critical of the bun in burgers but the bun was nice and soft. Surprisingly, it wasn't $37293739 so I'd say it was well worth the price.   Came on a Monday morning right when it opened so there was no line.

W9Z4eJYoeO9dTwBejBNYFQ.text: I got the UK burger. I asked for medium rare and it came out very medium. I told the waitress and her response was "our grill is finicky, sometimes the burgers aren't heated right" ??? This restaurant is named burger and you can't get a decent grill?

3k9R5brqrvmZ9nY9RcjwaA.text: Went here last week with a party of 5. Our orders came out at separate times, with one person in the party getting their food well after everyone else. In addition to that all of the sides (which come a la carte) that we ordered did not come out. One person had eaten their burger before their fries came out. Waitstaff was very apathetic when we voiced our displeasure with the service. Since Gordon Ramsay is someone who goes out to fix the quality of service at other people's restaurants I expected much better than I received. Charity starts at home, perhaps Mr. Ramsay should fix his restaurant before he helps others

BdqJRBRTkVcAk1J6vFe6IA.text: The food is delicious it was really worth the wait also very good I think it was called the Gordon burger but it was very delicious I enjoyed it while it lasted

Y9UL-8QqBsLyNKT91pTENQ.text: I was extremely hyped and extended my Vegas stay to eat here. Was not what it's made out to be at all. My Boyfriend says it's a baby step above a TGIF / Chili's and I agree!

HJH_L1oVmIt8XHx6CwdOlQ.text: I was not excited when my 11 year old granddaughter asked us to go here... another hamburger place. I was amazingly surprised, the best hamburger I ever had... cooked just right and juicy... we tried the blue cheeseburger... can't wait to go back.   There was a long line of people waiting to get in but we found that parties of 3 or more can walk up and register with the host(es) and then you don't need to stand in line. They tell you to come back in 30 minutes so you don't have to stand in line and they were right on the time, called us up when our time was up and seated us right away.

PgDJ1smC7l1f09wJnTlflQ.text: While this restaurant's burgers are very high quality, the wait times are insane. Expect to stand for at least 30 minutes in line outside the restaurant before getting a table, followed by another half hour to receive your food. Because the quality of the burger is not much higher than that of Planet Hollywood's sports bar burgers, I do not believe it is worth the wait. The inside atmosphere was excellent, and the staff seemed to have their operations under control for the most part. If you're able to go at a time when it's not crowded, then it might be worth it; otherwise, I'd sit this one out. Speed up!

cbq7eGO6NWi7zM4woEflpA.text: On short notice one evening, we found our way to this Ramsay establishment. This is a popular eatery and the line for seating wound beyond the long flaming artwork along front. As an elevated Total Rewards member, we were sat without having to wait in the queue; a nice perk.   My guest and I each had a burger and shared truffle fries. They were very good. I found the shake a bit too creamy for my liking. Service was a bit slower than we like, but was on par with most branded Vegas restaurants that we have visited.

B8BhlVYc26UcjrhF9DgH8A.text: Gordon Ramsay burger is one of those places you just gotta go to at least once to try. I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay so I was really excited to try his burgers. My burger was $21 because I added a fried egg. And the sweet potato fries were around $9. Everything tasted great and I had a great experience overall. I'm taking a star off because my burger came out barely warm. But still it tasted great!

sugffs8I7z7xMGpyILSdyQ.text: The food is great here! The wait looks daunting, but it actually moves pretty quickly. The service was excellent, and the burgers were fantastic. I would highly recommend the Parmesan truffle fries. They come in a silver tin big enough for 2. I would definitely eat here again.

Q2Xb4iugPoEFxLn5ZG4Hlw.text: Amazing is the word!!! An explosion in my mouth!! Every time  I go to Vegas I always have lunch here! It's in Planet Hollywood not one of the fancy hotels, but this is the best burger place!  I love the Backyard Burger and added bacon and goat cheese, it is yummy! Also had the sweet potato fries and onion rings! My husband had the vanilla shake! WOW!! Don't miss out on this place! There might be an intimidating line, but it goes by quick! EXCELLENT!

8y95jUWwzp-DSXyO17A3Uw.text: The service I received was genuine and very personalized, I can't say enough good things about their customer service. The food took some time to prepare but was well worth the wait. The flavors in the burger complimented perfectly and they had a great beer selection to along with it. I ordered the Parmesan fries and the Farmhouse Burger and it was plenty of food, in fact the fries could have been shared with someone else easily. Great atmosphere and great food, I look forward to my next visit.

MrqTZuqvyfF-lZhewDqTcQ.text: Debated on giving this 3 or 4 stars because it is Vegas so some expectations have to be lowered because it is a busy place where higher prices are the norm. My boyfriend loves Gordon Ramsay and we always watch his shows so we knew we had to check out this place! We went around dinner so obviously we knew it'd be a long wait. It was a 90 minute wait and I was totally willing to stand in line but the hostess took our number and told us we could walk around the hotel/casino and they'd text us when a table was ready. I looove that! We ended up going to a cool bar while we waited and then getting a text to come back, so convenient! We were seated immediately and ordered our burgers. They let us know they take a longer time because they hand make them so we were expecting a longer wait than normal but it was sooo long! Maybe it was because we were hungry but it felt about 3x as long as you'd normally wait at a steakhouse. When we got the food it was absolutely delicious!! I got the UK Burger and could only finish half of it because it was so filling and tasty! Still craving it!  I didn't care for the cocktail much but that could have just been my own tastes. It took forever to get our server's attention to ask for the bill, and then for them to finally come back with the bill. When we finally got them to take our card it took a while for them to bring it back again! This was frustrating because the entire process of waiting for food etc had already taken so long, I thought the checkout process would at least have been swifter. When they finally brought the receipts to sign I was excited-- i thought "write a tip, sign, then finally LEAVVVE!! YES!" But nooo... turns out the server charged BOTH bills (we had two groups) on my ONE credit card even though we had given them two cards and explained. Had to wait yet again for them to correct this and I'm still not sure if it was corrected since it was so busy and couldn't hear what was going on much. So the service was definitely not what I expected but the food was good. I think if you go when it's not so busy you would have a 5 star experience but not at prime time.

-5CsxbSkmwQIRwYRqkNgTw.text: I'm not too much on chef named restaurants because everyone I've ever tried including his were not very good but I must say the hamburgers pretty damn good I will return the service from the bartender where I sat was excellent I wish I could remember his name

mZmS49bta0Dsd_36ZB5c3w.text: For 15 bucks just for the burger you can get a much flavorful burger at shake shack for way less   Fries where waaaay over cooked

CeCmz-Du9qpxdxq5H8I4RA.text: If you're going to pay 40 bucks for a   , this is the place. Food was good, service was good. Its a churched up burger joint from a British celebrity chef. It's everything you'd expect, + and -.

UB2k_hUwq5hhRmF1PQdxRQ.text: Yummm yummmm and yummmmmm!!!!! 1 of the best burgers I have ever had!! A super cute little restaurant, right upon entering Planet Hollywood. I am sure there will always be a wait to eat here because of how amazing the burgers are. This was my first time and we waited about 20 minutes to get seated which wasn't too bad. We sat at the bar and the bartender was super attentive and friendly. Greeted us immediately with drinks and gave his recommendations and what the best items on the menu are. We went with what he recommended which was the famous Hell's Kitchen Burger. It took a while for the burger to come out, which he warned us about, so we also ordered the truffle fries to snack on while we waited. The fries were okay, but I may be bias because I am a thin cut fry person and their fries are thick wedge fries. They were good, but would have been AMAZING if they were thin cut. All that matters is the main course, which was out of this world!! It was on the spicy side, but my goodness! The bun was absolutely perfect and the burger literally melts in your mouth. MUST GO TO BURGER JOINT BEFORE LEAVING VEGAS!! YUM!! Pricing wasn't too bad either, well worth it! I wish I had room for dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger

QIc-PfmIH4NMoFA-qt6IfQ.text: We were there when they opened and it took a very long time to be seated. When I asked the hostess to seat us she said that we can't. I asked why and she said that they seat in groups every 6 minutes (the restaurant was empty) because they cook the burgers every 6 minutes.  There was 9-10 wait staff standing around but a line of customers waiting to get seated.  So after we ordered we watched how they handled the food and it was no different then any restaurant.  However the wait staff continued to stand around and not provide service.  All the while with the restaurant manager watching all this go on.  We were then hoping for great food.  Unfortunately, the food was not that good.  The fries were less than average and the hamburgers the same.  One of the two burgers we ordered was not cooked as ordered and we had to ask our waiter 2 times for condiments we had asked for when ordering.  And, on top of all this for what was a very simple order took 40 minutes from sitting down until our food arrived.  Don't bother coming to this place, try another burger joint in Vegas, there are many!

o-hzP3x2M3fREe2Ihldx4Q.text: I figured a burger with Gordon Ramsey's name connected to it would be delicious. I was wrong. The burger had very little flavor and the toppings only seemed to cover half the burger. The truffle fries were awful and after trying a few bites, it wasn't worth it to eat anymore for wasted calories. The fries were thicker spears and were not crisp on the outside and the "truffles" and cheese seemed to be an afterthought. I could have gone to Five Guys and paid a 1/3 of the price and had a delicious burger and fries for takeout. Gordon would be screaming in the kitchen if he knew or cared. Plus it took 50 minutes just to get a burger and fries to go.

06yhdr8kJ-S1Cy0gqYXwcg.text: It truly was as good as it gets. Excellent customer service. Staff made sure to compensate for delay and unavailability of some items on the menu. Place was crowded but I can't complain.

vQGW9g8JckwuIbFyBjsBbQ.text: I honestly do not know how this place has a four star rating. From the moment we walked in. The hostess were uninviting, the waitress was extremely awkward, and it took 45 minuets after we ordered to get our food. I ordered the portobello mushroom burger, which was good. I will give them that. However, it was $17 without a side. It was good, but not $17 good. By the time we finished three burgers, and one fry cost us $75!!! There are several other places in Vegas you can go to get a good burger for half the price. You're just paying for the name here.

17YllxFBjyDRc0ChE_N7tg.text: Food was great, even though we had to wait for 2 hours, but they gave us estimated time so we could come back after a little bit of street sightseeing. We ordered The hell's kitchen, Foie Burger, Blue cheese burger, The hog burger, and truffle parmesan fries. Hells kitchen and foie were really good. And I loved truffle parmesan fries!

X4M-xS0clfNfj7IOq0wIXQ.text: I wish we had this place in Los Angeles! We had the Hell's Kitchen burger and Blue cheese burger, both of us agreed that these were the best burgers we have ever had.  The Hell's kitchen burger jalapeno was perfectly seeded to give it some heat without it being overwhelming. The avocado was fresh and gave a great texture. Overall delicious.The blue cheese burger has a fig jam, this combination makes the burger. Blue cheese is a very salty cheese, delicious but salty; the sweet from the jam mixed with the salt of the blue cheese was heaven. I typically like thin burger patties as the heavy meat flavor can throw off the flavor balance, this was not the case, they are a thicker patty but the flavors are spot on and they were cooked perfectly. The one thing we didn't like is the truffle fries. The flavor was ok (super salty) but even the uncovered ones were lackluster; tasted frozen, not sure if they were. I came for the burger not the fries so I understand why there is a line out the door to this place. Next time I go to Vegas I will be coming back to this restaurant.

M6CJslRfN3_g1J2rOPU0-w.text: Highly recommend Gordon Ramsay's restaurant. The burgers were delicious: perfectly cooked and seasoned. The staff was very friendly and excellent management. Perfect fun atmosphere. We felt the pricing was very fair. We visited quite a few restaurants during our stay and this was our favorite! I would also recommend the truffle fries. They are to die for! When in Vegas-make sure you check it out!

0O4DOdw9EbIYLiWUbcZqyw.text: We dined at Gordon Ramsay Burger on Friday evening. Our service was very good.  Six of us ordered the hamburgers since this is the specialty of this restaurant.  All of us ordered our hamburgers to be prepared medium to medium well.  Three of the six hamburgers were bloody and very undercooked. We had to send them back to be cooked longer.   The French fries were good.  This was my first and probably my last visit to this restaurant.  We were all quite disappointed by the quality of our meal.

qqrzMlPVPpz_lwlEHJ4dRQ.text: It's effing RAW!!! I ordered medium. Friends ordered med rare. Their's were well done and mine was rare. Also I ordered no bun, my burger was brought with a nun and was told the chef doesn't allow modifications...dbags.

HjifyUuVuF9gIKjPcBAz0A.text: One of the best burgers off date. Irrespective of whether I know or not about Gordon Ramsay..we will definitely like the ambience, well managed staff. Would love to go back again. Bit on an expensive side, but worth it.

Q0pIWPuSnMcwp6ieH5ad_g.text: Steak was burned on outside and raw on inside, $68.00 bone in ribeye, told the server I wanted it medium rare, not rare. Complete failure and disappointment. Wanted a tasty crust, not a burned crust sear. Step your game up Gordon, you let use down.

k2UJfQszri6-nw8W-8_NVg.text: Food was amazing! However,  the service was terrible! Waited forever for refills, messed the order up and waitors and waitresses were more interested in chatting amongst each other at the POS machine while on cell phones. After we were done eating, waited 10 minutes for check. Very disappointing... Oh, and red headed waitress was talking very loudly at POS machine dropping F Bombs about EDC event. My 11 year old son found it amusing. Very unprofessional! Not what I expected from a restaurant with Ramsey on it...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Staff more concerned with cell phone then helping customers...

I2imYN92fkhNTYcBvzoz2g.text: One word: over-hyped. We were excited to try this place after passing by it year after year, so we came in for dinner. We got there around 5 and there was a bit of a line, but we were seated within 30 minutes. We ordered the nachos, Hell's Kitchen burgers, and truffle fries.   Within ten minutes we were greeted by a special little guest--a baby cockroach came out to play right by our feet! We were pretty surprised that, what with Gordon Ramsay's habit of battering restaurant owners for their unwelcome pests, he had some in his own restaurant. At least it was only a baby and not that grotesque, but it was still pretty freaky to see at a place where you're about to eat. We told a passing waiter and were moved a couple tables down by the manager, although I'm not sure they ultimately did anything about the cockroach.  On to the food--it was all unimpressive. Everything seemed to be made of good quality ingredients, but lacked flavor overall. The burger seemed to have a good bun, and the meat appeared juicy, but again, no flavor. The nachos were fairly good. The truffle fries were a let-down.   It was just a very "meh" meal. There are many, many better places to get a burger on the Strip.

R93tHMlwh5gFzLALxU9EQA.text: Waited in line 40 mind just to find multiple empty tables inside... service was so slow! Burger was good but not life changing. Was not told about the specials and they were probably better than what I got... what a let down....

g_CjJPKGLYjRxyFtR3I9nA.text: Ordered the backyard burger and a cocktail. Fries were good. I live in Calgary where we have the juiciest beef and a flourishing culinary scene. So it's hard to impress us when it comes to burgers... The vodka cocktail I had was the best drink I had in Vegas though, it was to my taste, and not overly sweet. Trying to find the name of it.... would return to try different items.

uKhx-ymGEH4CjCxbmyHneA.text: The staff bent over backwards to accommodate my party and I. They went above and beyond to provide the best service. The food was super gourmet and interesting. It was definitely different. Loved the truffle fries and the pita with the hummus was so tasty. Loved my burger.

87O71AEOE93sUdGa42wUBw.text: Long line as usual and went with a to-do order since that was only a 25 minute wait.  This time I tried the Foie burger and a side of truffle fries. They did forget to put in the dipping sauce which ticked me off a bit. I was too lazy to walk all the way back to complain.  Have been here before when it under a different name "Gordon Ramsay BurGR (Renovated)" so my reviews are gone with the wind.  The burgers are excellent, the truffle fries are full of flavor. It is a great place to eat but sometimes not worth the huge long line which can take up to 45 minutes to an hour on a slow night.
