7tcDzqPF5XYQtXMQSL6-7A.text: Best burger I have ever had...  Have gone 4 times and always a long wait.  Hostess can be rude because of the long line and if your party is gambling they give you the 3rd degree.  Service and great and burgers are top notch.  Get sweet potato fries and regular fries... 5 different types of Ketchups  Good quality beer collection

_y0M1rF2t6_wosrP0M7LxQ.text: Disclaimer, not a huge burger fan so all in all this place isn't the type of place for someone like me.  Per my burger enthusiast friend, he wanted to eat here during our time in Vegas. I've been hearing loads of people wait in line to dine here so I figured I'd try it.  We got there before it opened and there was ALREADY a line. We were sat not too long after they opened. We ordered truffle fries to share and honestly the highlight of the entire meal for me was the dipping sauces... Cheddar ranch? Hell yes! That sauce changed me. As for burgers, I got the Farmhouse Burger. It was just alright. I gave up halfway and just ate everything but the bread. My friend got this nice apple pie cocktail situation and that was very good.  Would I come back? No. Do I recommend it? No.

8cbq4mVEcFwBV8Ylsl-38A.text: Yum!!!!!   We stop here every time we are in or even just passing by Las Vegas.  There is free parking/ self park at Harmon and audrie miracle mile shops.   We parked and walked through the mall to the casino.   Once at the casino there were signs pointing the way.   We always each order a burger and then share fries and onion rings.   About one order for every 2 people.   Everything we have had here has been beyond belief amazing flavors.   Our favorite burger is the Crown burger and we love the truffle parmesan fries.   The sauces are amazing too from the homemade aiolies to the handmade spicy catsup.   In addition to great food the service had always been superb.   We will be back next time we are anywhere close to Las Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crown burger and truffle parm fries

V_fsqX5CcGbL1KM_MoqjPg.text: I had the hells' kitchen burger, medium rare.  It has a jalapeno,a slice of pepperjack cheese and avocado. For a side dish, we had the sweet potato fries that comes with honey jalapeno Mayo and more vanilla powdered sugar on the side.    Great tasting burger!!  It was quite enjoyable.  I just wish there was a more uniform spiciness to it.  I had three bites where I felt the heat but aside from those bites, it was just not spicy.  I think it would be better distributed if a spicy spread was used.  Also, I usually like some lettuce or cucumber to give a different texture but I know the extra water content can dilute the taste.  If you are gonna call it hells' kitchen, I expect more than 3 fleeting moments of feeling like I'm sitting in a sauna.  I don't need to be crying but up the current level.  The fries are good.  The honey jalapeno Mayo isn't spicy but I don't expect my fries to be spicy which is why I can forgive that here but not the burger.  The fries are plenty sweet by themselves so we didn't even touch the powdered sugar.  My wife got the Wellington burger, medium-rare.  The burger is very tasty. The party that stands out of that croissant.  It's refreshing and different.  If they are still serving it, try it.

5aso2ZjblDg9p-Gf0E3EWA.text: So happy we tried this place. I've been a big Gordon Ramsay fan for over a decade. His Vegas burger joint did not disappoint. The wait was about 35 minutes on a Saturday night, and we were totally okay with that.   Noise level was a bit high, but it was a happy, fast-moving place. Lots of TVs up with sports on. Wait staff in their uniforms looked a bit like English football players for some reason. Cute. All nice people.   I had the Forest Burger. It was FABULOUS, filled with greens, mushrooms, and duck bacon. I ordered it medium rare; it was juicy and just perfect. We ordered a cone of truffle fries which were super fresh and yummy. I can't stop thinking of them.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LlmlwFvyaaUk1z2UV5kk5A.text: Girlfriend and I went on 8/13/2019 and I have to say the burgers were delicious.  We started with the hells kitchen wings, I usually don't like blue cheese but it tasted amazing.  The hells kitchen burger was amazing and the truffle parmasian fries were great.  Will be coming back next trip for sure.

t_lEZpZ3OKgkIxdXyal9hg.text: Alright so first and foremost, shout out to our server, she nailed it!!   Alright so being a big burgee fan this was one of the most important places for me to eat. Watching Gordon on TV is pretty awesome as we all know so the big question has always been upon me, "how good of a burger does Gordon do?"       As the girlfriend and I walked up to the restaurant, we could not help but take in a deep breath and smell the astounding scent of the food on the other side of the hosts booth.    As we sit down, we sink into an really comfortable chair that just invites you to be quiet and take it all in (a lil star struck to try out the food). Looking at the menu my eyes instantly went for the ultimate cheese burger. Basic but always a good safe choice.    Ordered the burger with nothing extra on it AT ALL!! no mustard, no ketchup, no mayo, no tomato, no lettuce, just a naked cheeseburger . Pretty bad choice to do at most places eh? So should be same as this place right? WRONG!!!!!!!!      I fucked up my order and got it well done instead of medium (need to go back and do it properly, sorry Gordon, truly sorry). Still truly one of the best burgers of my god damn life!!! On bested by one other and naturally its Gordon's pub and grill where I did go with it medium (holy god damn!), story for later.     The burger bun can be pocked and it dimples. Pull your finger away and the bun pops right back to perfect shape and texture. Lean in for a smell and I smell cheeses that I have never fucked with before, okay now I am getting excited. Take the first bite of my burger and FUCK ME!!! A bun that starts to melt away in your mouth well the burger slowly followed (again, I fucked up ordering a well done and it was still epic).    The taste that comes from the first bite being mashed together for me was multiple levels of cheese that can be tastes separately and all together maybe that's just me? Or maybe it's the cheeses I don't think I have ever thought of or had on a burger before. Again, no condiments or added veggies, just straight burger bun and cheese.      Any ways enough rambling. Gordon Ramsay's burger. Has to be one of, if not the tastiest burgers to treat yourself to well enjoying an already epic time. Why not make an epic time more epic eh?      Oh! Last comment. Get the onion rings. You will never be able to get onion rings any where else again and be as satisfied. The onion rings they..... I'm not going to expose all the fun. But trust, even if not a burger fan, stop in for the rings     Respect Gordon, your the bees knees.

Fx8t8X46ISpAUdleifC1FQ.text: This review is 2 stars because we made the mistake of assuming that this place would be exceptional. When you walk up to the restaurant there is a line, for burgers.. wow awesome. There are flames. The ambiance was great. Its a perfect fit for Vegas. After waiting a while we were seated. A bit cramped, but I get it. I ordered the farm house burger with truffle parm fries. I ordered the burger medium rare, this burger also comes with a fried egg. As a working executive chef I know this burger is truly a testament to what's going on in there kitchen because they are required to do two semingly  simple things that so many have trouble with on a hot  line. 1) cook a burger to temp 2) cook an egg correctly. I chose this burger because I was really looking forward to crispy mangalista bacon and I adore Dubliner cheese on a burger. They brought the burger to the table. I will get to the fries in a minute. The burger was way overcooked! It wasn't even close. It was medium well at best. And the fried egg was lacking the beautiful yolk explosion that I was hoping for in my first bite. The Dubliner cheese was devine as expected and I was so disappointed with the bacon. Mangalista bacon is really some of the best dry cured bacon that you can aquire. It's signiture buttery smokey flavor was just lost in the flavor of the cheese and egg. It was however cooked correctly. I liked the bun.  It's the classic social dining conundrum; do I send back my food to leave my wife aquardly eating alone or do I just deal with being unsatisfied with my meal for the sake of the date.I sent my burger back.  being that this is  nearly a $20 burger it seemed fair. The manager did right by remaking me a new burger after me showing them the temp and the egg. As expected my wife was nearly finished with her meal when they brought me another burger. It was cooked correctly the second time. I admittedly rushed through it so my wife wouldn't get bored with me. Let's talk about the fries. They were just ok. I don't know for sure but it seemed they used truffle oil as the were a bit saturated. Truffle salt would have been far better as it would have kept the fries lighter. Going back to the burger the flavors were good but it really lacked acidity which you really need with all the fat from the burger, the bacon and the egg. I felt like I had eaten a brick after my meal. I take some responsibility for that as I chose what food I ordered, but dang it was heavy. I will close this review by saying that I think it was somewhat obvious that my wife and I were not happy with our experience. The right thing to do would have been to take my burger off the bill, they didn't. Also when you send out a new burger, send hot fries too, by the time I got my new food my old fries were toast. As always I will leave the door for dialogue open. Please feel free to reach out to me with questions. I will and do update these reviews,if you do choose to have a conversation with me about my experience I will be fair to your establishment and document that. Thanks

pLb0QbokloctQiO7JLL68w.text: Get ready to be longgg wait time for burgers and they're not cheap! Burger from $17 and up fries not included and because the name Gordon Ramsay says it all! Burgers are tasty definitely upscale A very nice decor and people still waiting in line every hour. Just to try it but not coming back next time!

TDaswoqoid4FPl-3bXY5qQ.text: Mr Ramsay if you really care about your restaurant you need to hire new restaurant manager. I visited your burger place because my teenager son likes your tv show. I cannot believe my service here .  1) Waiter gave me my coke I asked for a straw , he replied straw is for kids and for certain people only ? I saw other tables have got it they are white people! So your restaurant does not allow Asian to have straw?  2) Bus boy came in asked me if I want water instead of soda because their soda machine is broken down so the drink are all flat. My waiter never mentioned to me. I said ok , please return my drink .  3) All my neighbor tables came in later than me got their burger. I was seated at 11:05 am and I got my burger at 11:50 am. My waiter replied me my son order pork is going to be longer. 45 mins for a burger to be done , seriously ?  4) I asked for my bill, waiter did not take away the soda charge until I told him to. I still paid him $8 on my $50 burger meal because I know waiter live by tips.   I am a very reasonable person, I have never expect a 5 star service from a burger place but come on , Mr Ramsey your people is going to destroy your goodwill.   Last but not the least, I really cannot believe I got racist demanding a straw.

NFROc206yuuKwZQlZkESiA.text: Having been to the previous iteration of this restaurant (when it was called Gordon Ramsay BURGR)... on a recent trip to Vegas this won our award for most improved. The review would be more of a 3.5/5 if Yelp allowed half stars.  With a minor change to the name and a refreshed menu, we had a much more enjoyable experience than last time. We were at Planet Hollywood for a concert and were hungry after so gave it a shot.   I had the Stout Burger which shared the flavor profile of a French Onion soup. Everything was seasoned beautifully and cooked well, which was a far cry from my last experience here. The fries weren't the best, but when the burger was this tasty it hardly mattered. Decent service too!

JgvgxdNQuOcuM94heDMJdQ.text: Best burger I've had in my life. They move quickly no matter how busy. The onion rings are a great appetizer while waiting on your burger!

Bx--bjpZN6OFgqAsZmEmPw.text: Hands down, best burger I've ever had and that was the reaction across the table. There is something about the meat and how it's cooked -OMG-I can't even describe it. This was my first time eating at a Chef Ramsey's restaurant and I can understand why he is so famous - and this was only a burger place ! The service in this restaurant was top notch, the staff is either well trained or the person doing the hiring knows how to scout good people. They don't take reservations, we went Sunday night and there was a line outside the restaurant. If your party is four or more they will give you a pager.  Don't miss it, you will not regret it !

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AOxadDxHgSevZRDafmGC7Q.text: First dine-in experience in Vegas and I had very big hopes considering how much I love Gordon Ramsay and food in general! We had a short wait in line (5-10mins) before we got seated. The restaurant looks really nice and makes you want to eat! We ordered the stout burger and the farmhouse burger with a side of sweet potato fries and just fries. The food took a very long time to come out ( 50mins) which was a little disappointing. Finally everything came out and looked really good. Unfortunately although there was good flavors, both burgers were dry and overcooked and the fries were stale (did not come from a fresh batch). We ate regardless because we were starving by the time everything came out. We were left feeling disappointed. Considering how high the bill was for the 2 burgers and fries ($65) this was not a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Left: Stout Burger Right: farmhouse burger

fMHQZqG0Re48OjI4pKZZKw.text: My family chose Gordon Ramsay Burger for lunch because it was a short walk from our hotel room and the drooling crowds gathering at the entrance signified it was probably a safe bet. We were seated quickly in the bustling dining room with a front-row view of the fast-paced kitchen. None of us was ravenous enough to go whole-hog with the menu options, so the kids and I ordered appetizers and my husband ordered the burger.   The suspenseful, long wait for our orders to arrive wasn't a surprise, but we're a squirmy bunch, so we had to exercise great patience as each of our neighboring tables received food before us. When our dishes finally arrived, they were every bit as delectable as we'd hoped for; the tomato soup paired nicely with the hummus and root veggies, and the Oreo shake with a the creme brulee topping was ridiculously good. I hear the burger was worth the wait, too. My only real complaint outside of the aforementioned wait is the menu prices - everything is pretty pricey and served a'la carte - not what you'd expect from a burger joint.

Z4l2EMQMFAflfgRTxGFeEQ.text: Hmmmm...trying to think of how to say what hasn't yet been said in the 2,112 prior reviews...let's see!  _________  + Service was very attentive and prompt; our drinks never went unfilled.   + I liked the energetic, buzzy environment. The giant fire sculpture felt both cozy and added to the lively feel of the dining room.  - Because GR Burger doesn't accept reservations, prepare yourself for the possibility of having to wait some time to be seated - especially if you've got a larger party. It took about an hour for our group of about 12 to be seated; I wouldn't recommend hitting this place for dinner if you and your larger group are in a big hurry. If you've got nowhere to be, however...then it's certainly worth the wait.  ________  + I've had Truffle Parmesan Fries more times than I can count, but the order that we received at GR Burger was quite memorable. For one thing, the fries themselves were substantial and tasted freshly-cut - there was a certain "fullness" to each bite that served as a welcome reminder that you were biting into real potato, none of that powder-like artificial BS. The Truffle Aioli was flavorful and earthy, too - I would've considered guzzling down the sauce by the spoonful, had I not been in public.  + I decided to go all-in (excuse the pun!) and ordered up a Foie Burger - after all, how often do you get to say that you're munching on foie gras at a Gordon Ramsay restaurant on the Strip? (Oh my, looks like the tourist in me was in full effect!)   The burger was a welcome balance between bold, aggressive flavor (courtesy of its wood-grilled patty, cooked to an exact medium-rare), and a more subdued counterbalance in the form of creamy, milky chevre cheese. The namesake foie gras added a welcome richness that took the whole burger that much more over the top - decadent enough to hit the spot, yet not so heavy that you find yourself overly stuffed. And yes, it's the type of burger best attacked with a fork & knife.  At $40 after tax/tip, this was certainly one of the more expensive burger & fries combos that I've ordered - but I guess that comes with the territory in terms of paying on-Strip prices!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decadent and delicious!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Foie Burger, juicy and glorious

gsaeThTjAWGuAdtbXEqOsQ.text: First time visiting Gordon Ramsay Burger and it was so good! I got the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was good! Meat was cooked the way I liked it and the roasted jalapenos were delicious! Also had the onion rings with the cheddar cheese ranch as a dipping sauce and it was so good!! Would visit again while in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger

7v1TfDIHCmF6cK28nWYCQw.text: I was really looking forward to trying this place and super excited and soooooo happy it lived up to expectations! The only lacking factor was that our waiter kind of sucked and had a hard time getting a hold of him so we couldn't order anything else...  But the food! We started off with truffle fries and onions rings both were amazing but those onion rings! I've never had such yummy onion rings! Light and crispy made to perfection! It was sooo good I'm dreaming of my next visit already. The truffle fries were really good as well and you can def tell that the cheese they used was also really good quality!   Now the burgers! My and my friend had the stout, loaded with crispy onion and just the perfect amount of mustard. It was delicious and the meat quality superb! My husband had the Hell's Kitchen which was also really good!! I really wanted to try the nachos but unfortunately our waiter never came back to check on us or even when we asked someone to call him never came so we weren't able to order them. Definitely looking forward to our next Vegas trip to come back here again!   FYI - we got here at 1pm and waited an hour. Go early, put your name on the list if you're a party of 3 or more and go hang out till you get a text to get seated.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle fries yum
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GzbBakN1eG9vd93M0xVplg.text: Poor customer service can really make or break a place, and here, it made for an incredibly poor experience.  I stopped by with a simple request: French fries to-go. After much confusion about whether or not to stand in the long line for the hostess stand (read: you don't have to), we placed our order for three fries. We waited for more than 40 minutes, despite being quoted a 15-20 minute wait, but the real bummer? When we got back up to our room at Planet Hollywood, the order was wrong: they'd given us two regular fries and one truffle fries instead of two truffle and one regular. The regular fries were kind of bland and soggy, but the truffle fries ($4 more) were out-of-this-world good! I just wish they'd given us two!   This restaurant can't be reached via phone (per the PH concierge) so I had to walk back in person to let the restaurant know what happened / get my $4 back. That's when things really went south. I got bounced around to three different people who were all SUPER rude. Each person passed me on to another, and I had to re-explain. There was a clear you're-not-worth-our-time vibe. One girl even had the nerve to say "well it's been two hours since you were here so I don't think we can help you." I showed them the photos of the fries labeled and also how they looked inside. How is this not a super simple fix?! Finally after an hour of waiting, a guy came over and handed me four single dollar bills. My friends were texting me asking where I was, and my only response was "that burger place is dead to me."  Yes, this is one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. And yes, the place was slammed. But I can only imagine what Gordon Ramsay would say about messing up a French fry order -- let alone, having such mismanaged, chaotic staff. Even the best truffle fries in the world aren't worth the mess I witnessed here.

B6pL67aOOFpn0op_nQ_dow.text: An absolutely wonderful experience and meals! Worth the money, burgers were cooked perfectly,  service excellent, We will definitely be back!

e2L_ZyTuaKXQqUqvBz5Nfw.text: I might have set expectations too high and got disappointed.  I got tired of the burger pretty quickly, and decided to only eat the beef and left the buns. The onion rings were also too much and too oily.  The shakes were pretty good, but portions were too huge. In fact, ordering the shake was enough to fill you up for the whole dinner.  Line was long, and price was expensive.

zUITMO4VcN4MyW6xC3oRhQ.text: Long line of course for a world known chief's restaurant. We were there on a Tuesday night at 7ish. Waited about 20 mins in line. I didn't mind the wait cause I knew it was going to be long. We ordered the backyard burger and Hell's Kitchen burger with fries. Waited 25 more mins for the food to come out. Kinda starving at this point. The food came out and was on point. The burgers we asked for both medium well and nice and juicy still. They were perfect. Fries were fries nothing special but just good to add it with the burgers. Portion size was good. Just enough. Don't want to over load my self. I would recommend this place.

sN4-3YZef9YqTO13kZNKIA.text: Burger-palooza weekend and this spot was tasty choice.   Wait time was a bit long, but you can find some place in the casino to hang out and grab a drink.  Service was slow but the food was good. We both had a lettuce draped Ultimate Cheeseburger with an egg added. The meat was cooked perfectly, the cheese was salty and gooey and mixed well with the creamy egg yolk.  The vegetarian in the group threw down for the impossible burger and said it was great.

WfUCjmnTBQ47CdJPmk4Bxg.text: I just missed Gordon Ramsey! He came to visit the restaurant, and we just missed him.  Let's start with the food.   Lollipop wings: 5 stars, super flavorful and love the blue cheese crumble compliment. You don't even need dipping sauce to enjoy!  Hot dog: 5 stars love it. I love every component apart of this dish.  Stout Burger: 4 stars I def enjoyed it. I love the crispy onion to give it some texture. My burger was a little over cooked.  Service: 1 star. It took literally 10 minutes to get greeted. We went through 3 servers. No one seemed to be enjoying their job. Dirty plates left in the middle of our table throughout our experience. Service def could've been so much better. I recommend the food, but I really hope the servers here smile a bit more and enjoy working for such a popular restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Literally stacked the dirty plates for service team to remove. Plates stayed there for the rest of our time. Disappointing.

ABfo_oLtbpkTOOS2l2rM7w.text: Over rated, over priced. My cheeze burger was ok but nothing special. My date had the fish sandwich and that was terrible. Total bill for burger and fish sandwich over $42.00.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tjhEMT-Pq9ajEFhjqkItLw.text: Unfortunately you can't make reservations so if you want to try one of these tasty burgers you'll have to be prepared to wait an hour or so to get seated.  The prices are a bit high and I'm sure that's because you're paying for the name "Gordon Ramsay" but at least the food is good. I really enjoyed my burger and the burnt ends poutine was solid.  The truffle fries and onion rings are ok, but it's a beat steep to pay $10-12 for a side in my opinion.  Stick to the burger and a beer and you'll love this place. The food is really good, but just be prepared to wait a bit and overpay a bit as well.

fyVlK-ZmoQGWf8CpZurvIw.text: Solid experience! I was overall very impressed with Ramsay's burger pub. Both the service and food were well done. Loss of a star was because the kitchen was running 30min behind but at least our server warned us (and we were starving) so we had the onion rings come out as an appetizer while we waited for burgers. So the onion rings were pretty damn great! Great amount of breading, crispy, not greasy. All the dipping sauces are obviously made from scratch. One is a ranch and the other a ketchup.   I had the stout burger and my husband had the blue cheese burger. Both are excellent and are truly packed with flavor! The mushrooms on the stout are so delicious! And the blue cheese flavor on the blue cheese burger packs a punch for all cheese lovers.  The fries are steak cut and fresh. If you are a shoe string lover these might not be for you. They also come with homemade sauces, two types of ketchup.   Lunch set us back about $60 Which included 2 draft beers so not exactly a cheap meal but definitely delicious and to be honest you don't eat cheap for GOOD food anywhere in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stout burger: guinness mustard aïoli, gruyère, mushrooms, crispy onions, black n&#39; white sesame seed bun

ipyKNGtLIwFv_TFpgb7IlA.text: This was on my list of places to go to during my trip to Vegas so it was our first stop as soon as we arrived. We went around 9pm and there was still an hour wait. While we could've dined somewhere else, I insisted we wait so I, too, can have bragging rights :)  We were seated at the bar and ordered: - Hell's Kitchen Burger: flavorful w/ a kick of jalapeno. really good if you like avocados!! - Backyard Burger: more of a traditional burger - Truffle fries: so delicious!! this is a must!!  I say it's definitely worth a visit if you have the patience to wait.

aQ8_wsASBC7fKP8jA3vF_w.text: I was seated quickly at the bar since I was alone. Bartender was quick to get my drink order and it was a great mix.  I ordered the Hells Kitchen burger and fries. I ordered it medium and it was spot on. The avocado was fresh and the flavor was perfect. The fries were crispy and perfectly seasoned.  Overall it was a great experience.  4-stars only because I struggle with paying $45 after tip for a burger and fries.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yUMIKdLPVNXy3ncqbXImww.text: Weekday (Monday) lunch was about a 15-20 min wait outside, and 20min wait for the burger, so make sure you budget enough time!  - Truffle Parmesan fries: the truffle dip is amazing, the fries themselves are wedges and bigger than French fries - Pecan shake: its an ice cream treat!  - Hell's Kitchen Burger and Farmhouse Burger: the burger patties are very tasty! I prefer the Hell's Kitchen one since it has a kick to it.  I brought back some leftovers and microwaved it, even my parents liked them (they don't normally like burgers)   It's a heavy high-calorie meal though!

cv-ignvgB_uEii-fd8srnw.text: This will forever be my burger spot when In Vegas! There are no reservations so get in line if you come during dinner hour. We waited maybe 30 minutes not bad for how busy it seemed. Our server was on point and kept my water filled at all times! The burgers were cooked perfectly! I got the blue burger and it was amazing! The bun was soft, meat medium how I liked it, and the topping were in every bite! If you don't want to go to Hell's Kitchen at least come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Right: Blue Burger Left back: farmhouse burger

uXT5Mf5oPpanJ-fVNZXoIg.text: They often have a wait list, and quite a large amount of seating available. When we went we had a group of five at 11p on a Friday but only waited about 20 minutes, not bad at all. When we were seated we were greeted by our waiter who was brilliantly accommodating and super helpful. I ordered poutine, the foie burger, and sticky toffee pudding. The poutine tasted like an upgraded version of authentic poutine. The burger was quite different than any I've had before because of the cheese and the sauce and it was divine, probably the best I've ever had. I ordered the dessert assuming it was going to be a chocolate ice cream sandwich but it was actually toffee flavored, not a big deal tho because it was still bomb and I devoured it.   As for the vibe I'd say it's just above casual and it can get a bit loud. Be kind to your waiters/servers because they go through some chaotic shifts!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;foie&#34; had me dancing in my seat
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Short Rib Poutine (:
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sticky Toffee Ice Cream sandwich

RiVp_xm0zgBaPoR4yBParw.text: Why is every Gordon Ramsay place so good!? I'm actually quite surprised when celebrity chef spots are delicious and Burger is no exception.  It's such a beautiful restaurant with a wall of fire! Hello photo op! Be prepared the wait is usually over an hour. But you can put your name down and walk around the billions of shops in the Miracle Mile Shops. Right next to Burger is a Starbucks if you just want to chill or a super cool Tipsy Robot bar --- you can guess which of the two my friends and I hung at.  We were texted within our quoted time and our table was set and ready for our party of 8. Our server got the job done but I didn't find her anywhere on the friendly or informative level that I encountered at Hell's Kitchen.   We started with a couple orders of the Chips with Curry sauce ($8) and they were tasty fries. Enjoyed the unique dipping sauce.  Now on the drink front, I'm a beer chick and the beer list here is so cool! They have some standard beers but also just enough good, craft selections as well. why i the beer list so cool, you may ask? It was on this scrolling mini ipad with all the info I need when picking my beer. I always use Untappd when selecting my beer to see the percentage, flavors, brewery info and all that good ish. Well their ipad had it all, yay! And I found a good looking Stone Ruination Double IPA 2.0 which they served in a fancy tall glass. All of Ramsay's spots are about the flare....and so I am so I'm completely onboard!  For my meal, I had the Hog Burger for $18. A lot of my friends missed this burger because it was under the specialities section instead of the normal burgers. But it IS special! It's huge with not just the beef but also mangalitsa pork, mangalitsa bacon, bbq pork, white cheddar, pickles, crispy onion, and slaw. Yep, she's a beast. So huge I couldn't come close to finishing it. They didn't ask how I wanted my burger so was happy it didn't come well done. No way, man, I usually like mine medium rare.  This was a fun place to dine with a group while all the Sunday games people wanted to watch played in the background so they could cheer along. It's a lively atmosphere, reasonable prices and tasty food - loved i!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

v7DL0UysnQtmC4UsSzLBrg.text: Food was ok, however they had literally forgotten our order for 2 hours. The manager tried his best to make up for their mistake, however they forgot our meal again...even after the manager got involved.   We had high expectations for trying a Gordon Ramsey restaurant, especially since we're big fans of his shows. Sadly we were let down.... ironically we kept joking Gordon Ramsey would be livid.

Pyg3CGNtAYVz0ra-fy4zEQ.text: Came in at noon on a Thursday and there was no line. The menu has no pictures and for me that's important lol. The drink menu is on a tablet that the server brings to you. Table setting is simple.  I ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger and my husband had the Forest Burger along w the Truffle Parmesan Fries.   You must try the Chamborita!   Husband and I gave our burgers an 8 each. Fries are a 9/10.

oDNGPjAc_dM-Q9ImVY-6ZA.text: We dined here Friday night around 1130 pm. Our server was very attentive and polite. He did a great job and we appreciate that.   We tried the backyard burger, ultimate cheeseburger, and the Hog burger.  The backyard burger had great flavor. A little over done but tasted great The ultimate cheeseburger was a bit of overload. But still tasty. The hog burger was pretty damn good. Lots of pork and the onion straws gave it a nice crunch. No complaints on the burgers. Our only complaint was our fries. They were cold. We were starving so we ate our burgers and left most of our fries. Other than the fries we enjoyed our food.   Tip: do not sit on the wall where the banquette is. It is extremely uncomfortable and not padded well. By the end of the meal my back was sore. As was my daughters.

u1seVyYjLMg1ZQ_C9eXgxw.text: I finally went to GR Burger, and hands down my new favorite place to go to in Vegas! Everything from the food to the service was phenomenal! If I could give it more than five stars I would! The hosts were very cheerful and accommodating. Once we sat down, Justin greeted us and gave us the complete run down of the menu. You can tell he is very passionate about what he does and has a lot of knowledge of everything on the menu. He made everything so personal and reccomended a few things for us to try. I am a total sucker for Buzzfeed Worth It episodes so I HAD to go with The Hog Burger. We also got the Truffle Fries. Everything was absolutely delicious and I cannot wait to go back again and try a new burger. A huge thanks to Justin for making our visit great!

digQhyF12AQ1BhoMBk-yUQ.text: All the burgers here are great!! The onion rings were pretty thick to my liking! However the truffle fries are a must have. If you have a total rewards card and rank in the platinum or higher you do not have to wait in line which rocks because this place can definitely get busy.   Their home made truffle aioli, ranch and chipotle ketchup are all amazing sauces. Definitely check this place out

xVrQLU2PYshccMGh9DdR4Q.text: The best burger ever!!! We also got the fries and ahi tuna sliders. So delicious. Very friendly staff too!

TnF6HVHiDOYsKIHxMn8wGg.text: Always a great experience at Gordon Ramsey's Burger. Every burger was excellent! So many fries we didn't know what to do with them! Well done Ramsey!

NOCjnnpJ9qRh8fpTo91yMg.text: Cons: long line. Don't take reservations.   Pros: accepts credit cards. Easy to find location. kettle chip nachos. Had this great sauce that the kiddos loved. My husband and I shared Some sort of Pork burger w/bacon and pulled pork. Well balanced flavors. Savory and sweet.

LvvgnHJDwJHGpCk-uWAK0A.text: To be clear, I am a fan of Gordon Ramsey. But I am not a fan of this restaurant. We started with onion rings and Parmesan fries. Of everything I ate I enjoyed the rings the most with the ranch sauce. The fries were edible but not terribly tasty. And the truffle dip was disgusting. If I had had a paper napkin I would have spit it out. The ketchup was good but not the chipotle ketchup. These apps were served without plates and the waiter disappeared fast and never came back. Rather than letting them get cold we dove in. Crumbs everywhere.  I ordered the pork burger which was cooked fine but a bit tasteless. It had several toppings measured by teaspoons so there was not much flavor added. My friend ordered the backyard burger with condiments on the side. They )didn't arrive with the burger and after 5-7 minutes I had to chase down a waiter, any waiter, to get them. It took another 10-12 minutes to find someone to pay our bill.    Due to the outrageous prices ($17 for a burger without fries and condiments) and Chef Ramey's reputation I just expected more.

tU58IRjsqqb0AV2nbaeoCA.text: Wait was ridiculous; over 2 hrs for Saturday lunch, but you can skip the line if you are total rewards platinum, diamond or seven star members.  Ordered Hog burger, Hells Kitchen burger, fries and chicken wings. Wings and fries are above average and burgers are so delicious. The burgers are very juicy. Hells kitchen burger is probably the best burger I have ever had in my life.  Price is insanely cheap. $15 for a burger in Vegas is like $5 elsewhere.

m6Rywr5IGj0_ISGqSUe-vA.text: What an opportunity to have to be in one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurants. Coming to Vegas, I have always been looking forward to this restaurant.  Soooooo I ordered the Forest Burger. I chose this because I saw that it has some sort of duck bacon which immediately caught my attention. Tried it and it tasted great and unique. The meat was my favorite part; It was perfectly cooked to medium rare and everything. When it comes to portion, at first I thought it was a bit small. However I realized that it was at a pretty good portion to keep you happy and satisfied without feeling bloated. A side of fries could also fit right in.   Service was awesome. They check up more often than not and they're super friendly and sociable. As for the wait time, it took about 20 minutes. Not ideal but it's fine.  Would come back!

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest Burger! (Halves)

B614xmgy7hbAcftld0LkxA.text: The shrimp & lobster is a must try! The truffle fries and sweet potato fries were delicious and the dipping sauces complimented the fries well. If you want good, quality burgers this is the place :)

oC3fasDL-FFAU3DYiWPEPg.text: Got off to lousy start. When I pulled out my chair, it was covered in filth,. Seriously, a nasty amount of food, like someone had wiped down the table and was trying to sweep it on to the floor but missed. Amazing buffalo wings? Nope... your local pizza joint probably has better. Crisp onion rings, not so much. Who doesn't love French fries with curry catsup? Me, if you buy them here. Beer selection was really good. The "blue burger" was well above average.

y2-yT5PTgGSzqw6N6hQVjQ.text: I'm not usually a huge fan of burger joints but this place was by far the best burgers we've ever had!    We'll be back next time we're in town for sure!

tPhuV4p9l49Oi9OZ7h6pGA.text: We order the Farmhouse burger and the Ale Dawg. The burger had great flavor and was perfectly cooked, not dry and not dripping all over. Ale Dawg was not greasy at all which is tough to do with a beef hotdog wrapped in bacon. The only thing better than the food was our server Hilary.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger

8VDTnkxSKmPjMx7GGZgRJw.text: My family and I Love this restaurant. The milk shake with Creme Brulee was amazing, two of my favorite sweets together. It was perfectly done. The sweet potatoes fries were perfect. Definitely in my to visit list next time I am in Vegas. Kids are so picky with burgers they loved they burgers and fries.

2BHxIyV600mEdxBNxy70DA.text: The glass flame window is hard to miss upon entering Planet Hollywood. The menu design was also an interesting fold, simple and clean.   I had the Hells Kitchen burger, as a spicy lover, it was amaaazing! It is worth the price, the meat was cooked to perfection, medium rare and delicious. You can taste the flavors of all that goes into this particular burger complementing itself, i did add a little of the truffle fries aoili dip and it was goood. The fries are enough to share for two, their drinks looked prety good as well, all 3 of my coworkers got something different and they mentioned it was also amazing. I will definitely be back. Heads up If you will be driving here, probably best to park in the mall.

OYtJahWs150dOddEDE4kIQ.text: I'm giving this restaurant only one star because the expectations were so high for the best gourmet burgers ever.  Coming from the Midwest where we have the best beef in the world, I expected the "gourmet" to build on the perfect juicy, tasty burger (which even I know how to cook.). We were also very excited to see poutine on the menu, as my husband is from the birthplace of poutine (Montreal) and GR could only make it better, right?  Wrong on both accounts.  The patty in our burger, although cooked medium, was dry and tasteless.  Now a medium burger is pretty hard to dry out!  It was as if they took gourmet ideas and plopped them on a little bit bigger (being generous) McD's patty and put GR's name on it to make people think they were getting something g special!  The poutine was equally disappointing.  The gravy was a VERY strong pepper gravy (some people might like... for me a bit too strong.)  But the biggest SIN was to hardly put any curd chees on it at all!  That's the best part of poutine, and we were left fighting over the tiny, tiny morsels of chees sprinkled throughout.  Curd cheese is CURDS of cheese!!  Plus the reservation/call ahead/ you're screwed if your're only a party of 2 check-in system is wonky and ilexplained.    Bottom line... don't go!  GR would be embarrassed by these burgers!!

DmberCp1HMXcrOyYxO_rIQ.text: Skip the burgers, they are so-so. The appetizers and Oreo milkshake is what I find so good about this place!! If you have a sweet tooth, I strongly recommend the Oreo milk!!! It is heaven.

--6FfeTI2ZDKHboIFS4QVA.text: This one was a bit disappointing. Everything was hot and fresh, I think it was just the selection I made. I had the Pork Chop and Applesauce burger. I know what your thinking, but no it didn't have actual apple sauce on it. It was cabbage-apple slaw. The patty just didn't have a lot of flavor to me. Fries were really good and not, but I just wasn't impressed with the burger. Others in my group had some phenomenal looking burgers which is why I still give 4 stars. Don't believe in knocking a decent restaurant just because my taste buds didn't like what my brain wanted to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YPp8NA6f-RIU0e2dneXcBw.text: Had an amazing lunch at Godon Ramsay Burger. The onion rings were cooked perfectly. I had the forest burger and my husband got the Hell's Kitchen burger. We shared and both of the burgers were delicious. Forest mushrooms on the forest burger were amazing. The staff here is great. They're polite and attentive.  Strongly recommend this place.

97W5nBcsC1WOX5FZezvMVA.text: The food was DELICIOUS!!!! My burger was as juicy as ever and full of flavor. And our server, his customer service was 1st class. I am happy to say I look forward to coming to Vegas more often and definitely will be eating here again. @gordonramsay my friend says these burgers were made with a lot of cuss words  YOU'RE THE BEST GORDON RAMSAY!!!

PpMB07HUhfyb9u-3tZuKMg.text: what's not to love here. the food is simply amazing the atmosphere is great and the staff is super friendly. i order the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was super delicious as well as the truffle fries.  the wait time for our food was just a little too long but i don't usually care for that.  great job and will be coming back to this place whenever i'm around Vegas!!

4zpvk80rYrqKK82xvbzrIw.text: The burger was probably the best burger I've ever had. The fries were nicely spiced and perfectly crisp. The desert.... oh the desert....the chocolate caramel tart was so delicious we discussed the desire to lick the plate

eG42dxLGd4IsM8Ui9FvR7g.text: The food itself is 4 stars. Good burger, great onion rings, awesome brown butter shake. But man, I really don't think burgers for 2 should cost over $100. Won't be going back.

ZrgNDjN7rHHunIdXVTSmZw.text: You will never find a better burger. Simply magnificent. But be aware that the wait line can be long even in the middle of the afternoon. If you are alone and the line is long, inquire as to whether they can seat you at the bar.

JNDZUTi56qmbK7riWrqRow.text: My first stop every time my fiance and I go to Vegas. The burgers are outstanding and the truffle fries are delicious. However, I was very upset to find out that they got rid of the jalepeno poppers. I understand menus change and it has been the same for many years but those were some of the best poppers I ever had. We literally crave them all the time and get so excited to come to Vegas to order them as our app! Please bring these back!!!

89hmM-h_LQebteGvHQoKTg.text: The burgers were fine for the money, but not LV special. Price wasn't too bad, but the sales pitches from the staff were annoying. That would all be forgivable except for watching food dying in the window from our seats. Seriously. Fries, rings, and apps sitting in the window for 10 minutes waiting on burgers to sell while a sous chef portioned sauces. Everything went out too. I felt bad for the people eating dead food.

dpOYiqVEX6ASUaDIgiIrNg.text: Great customer service and great food. Truffle fries were sooo good. My wife wanted to come here since she's a fan of Gordon Ramsay. The food didn't disappoint. Medium burgers were great. Very retro yet modern restaurant. The prices are not even that bad. Will come back.

BsOW2iJN6zkZRzRMMXGpNA.text: I ordered a rare burger, thinking that I was at a ramsay restaurant it would be perfect. It took an hour and came out well done. I was very disappointed and my time was wasted.

qUlWmwmRRdqMllYSw1jmTA.text: Medium rare burgers came out well done. Brown in center and no juices. Tasted dry. Manager comped meal though as we had no time to wait for a remake. House made ketchup wasn't that great, watery. Where's the Heinz?

2CrUWSTn6dK0hoYaxRlRsA.text: The hummus and pita here are by far the best I have ever eaten. As a Gordon Ramsay fan, I was stoked to try this place out and it definitely met my expectations. I would definitely go back!

1VyMpqNosLUFj-WAHAKafQ.text: I am not just a fan but a worshipper of Gordon Ramsay and I have learnt to review a restaurant from HIM through each and every show and tweet and youtube video that he does. I am very very disappointed with the restaurant and to some extent the food. The service is very bad and the staff is clearly overworked. I ordered the Hog burger, the Hell's Kitchen Burger and the truffle fries. The Hog burger was welldone and COLD it must have been sitting around for a while. The fried we had to send back because they were stale and dry. The only good thing was the Hell's Kitchen Burger done medium well done to the T. The server was proactive and ready to replace our fried immediately but you should at least get fresh fried after 40 mins of waiting and not much crowd (most of the tables were empty since it was Sunday 10 p.m). No body likes cold fries or cold burgers. :( :(

C9KjXmg9gkg2lfpGat1Zhw.text: We had lunch on Friday. Seated immediately- got there a little before noon, by the time we were done there was a long line. Compliments to our waiter, John. Explained the choices very well and made very good suggestions. Happened to also watch him find a package that another table left, picked it up and ran out the front after them to take to them. I had the Farmhouse burger. Didn't like the duck bacon but just removed it and enjoyed it without. I really liked the Parmesan truffle fries, husband didn't, he thought it tasted garlicky. He had the backyard burger and really liked it. It was more on the medium rare side and we asked for medium but overall good. Prices very reasonable.  The star for us was the dessert orange creamsicle- blood orange and a total surprise. I do get tired of similar desserts and this was a very pleasant ending to lunch. The manager was very present and engaged in what was happening with the patrons. Overall a very good experience

-Mx0x5p39mVpLpocjYxBvg.text: The service was very slow. It toke almost an hour to get our burgers.  Also it wasn't that tasty

wHh-0OXia88x1F5fAaFSJQ.text: Best burger I've had!!! Had the farmhouse burger and is by far the best!! I've been to many good burger in America and nothing comes close to Gordons

uA18HEOryK8JHvNFnuiFbQ.text: Fantastic burgers and wonderful service. Tammy took great care of us. We should definitely visit again.

M4SGEoiT_Nr8bk2heH5QrA.text: I visited here on 7/9/17 during lunch. Our server was friendly and efficient (don't recall her name) and the place is very modern and cool. The flames in the glass wall leading inside were a really nice/different touch. All the food my friends and I ordered tasted great but there was one major snafu! When one of my friends took the first bite of his Portobello mushroom burger, a LONG BLACK FABRIC STRING CAME OUT THAT HAD BEEN COOKED INTO THE BURGER! WTF?!!! We called our server over asap and she apologized profusely stating that the string was probably from the towels used in the kitchen to handle hot plates. But still - gross! If Gordon himself had been there that day to see that, he would have cussed someone out royally! She took the burger away and ordered my friend a fresh one. Then the manager came over and apologized and comped our bill for that order. A new burger came out perfect and we enjoyed the rest of our meal. But that incident definitely tarnished my opinion of this place. It was our first time here and other than that, everything else was on point. There was only about a 5 minute wait time too. My cheeseburger with several different British cheeses was delish as were the onion rings we shared, Cheddar soup, and truffle fries with chipotle ketchup and cheddar ranch. All-in-all and despite the "string incident", I would give it another chance and I plan to soon!

xEYXJkraRDZAziSVMIleBA.text: We were excited to try this place out, we waited for 30 minutes which wasn't bad I guess, I ordered the shrimp and lobster burger, my husband had the blue cheeseburger. For $26 I expected to be wowed but was disappointed. My husband wasn't impressed either, he said he liked super duper burgers way better. We should have eaten at Pink's

oMMH8k3r9tYb6KL4sosSQg.text: We had high hopes for this restaurant as a coworker said it was the best food she had ever had.  We got in line (Thursday night) and after 10 minutes of the line not moving an employee walked down the line to verify everyone in line was group's of 2 or less - asked for an ETA and was told 10-15 minutes.  Shy of 30 minutes later we were seated - it was very nice, but loud, in the restaurant.  Menus were waiting, and within 5 minutes we had water and placed our orders (Tandoori Chicken and the Hells kitchen burger, plus an order of the parmesan fries).  We were told the wait for food would be 25-30 minutes.  The burgers were good, not that much better than a Red Robin burger.  Fries were amazing.  The service was mediocre.

dnnNGrAI0w4fvabovz7UAw.text: Serious the Foie burger is worthy of killing someone for... it's sooooo good I love it. The Oreo shake with creme brulee is also good

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best burger ever... the bun so fluffy it&#39;s like biting into clouds

p6LL8gmcNODwqRt9hDXHcQ.text: The best burger ever! The farmhouse burger was delicious and I couldn't eat dinner after I had that for lunch. I had it 2  days in a row I made a pig of myself. Lol

ZdngBANb9fRSfiJdSFCC2Q.text: Wife ordered the Kale salad and said it was a 5/5. I had the backyard burger. It was maybe a 3 or 4/5. Fairly costly for a burger and salad. Place was packed so obviously Gordon is happy! I asked to speak to him right away to discuss this mediocrity!. Anyway will say not bad!

Y7UoXobAflaZPnyVoiLVgA.text: Not gonna lie, the Hell's Kitchen burger was probably one of the best burgers I've ever had. Considering this is a "Gordon Ramsey" restaurant, the food was delicious at a surprisingly good value. (Paid $16 for the burger, $9 for the Cheddar Ale Soup) Since the restaurant is quite a landmark, the wait time for us was around 1 hour and 45 minutes, but we didn't have to wait in line and just waited for our text notification. Our waiter, Paul, was super warm and friendly. Overall the atmosphere was great, the staff was pleasant, and the food was extremely filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar Ale Soup!

8rW7XdKlMvf4WJS3W183pw.text: Great burgers, friendly atmosphere, hardly no wait to get in. Would definitely go again! It was a very casual experience but also delicious.

rXPNlkvMjWJueENlrcAssw.text: Amazingly satisfying. Never had anything like it! Normally the bun is heavy and soggy but the bun here was so so light and crisp and soft and all the good things. The chicken felt so fresh and different. I had chicken wings also and they were spot on! Went a different route to try the curry burger and my god that was delicious. I guess GR is not all hype.

vgiN_y7WSP0wKYRECXPx2w.text: This place is amazing and the servers are fantastic! The bartenders are so outstanding from being so friendly and super knowledgeable about "Gordon Ramsay's" menu. I give them all a 5 plus ******, Victor, Robert and Robert!!!! He is very lucky to have them on his team and as amazing employees.   Ok now the food! OMG, my husband and I can't get enough and have been here 5 x's in 3 days. If you have not tried it, it's a must come to place and try... you will be hooked.   Thanks to all the amazing people from the cooks, servers and bartenders that make this place happy and be a 5 star!!!

aGkXLABO8ukEP7EMKpmkbQ.text: Yesterday was my bday and we had a show at 9pm to see. We were in line waiting from 7:40pm. We got seated at 8:45pmstill hoping we could eat something. We were informed that the burger will take 25minutes to cookimagine our disappointment. So we sat for a few seconds and stood up and left very hungry and disappointed. There were more seats when we were inside so I didn't understand why it took the 3 lady hostesses so long to seat waiting guests in line. I am a local but we rarely go to the strip because of the traffic and parking but this was a special night so we braved all that. We proceeded to JLo's concert which was incredibly awesome but we were very hungry.  Gordon Ramsay burger was such a tease

yXlpC8Dk6cOYWkFyHoCeCQ.text: No.  Its not all that.  I made the mistake of ordering the pan seared lobster and shrimp burger, which our waitress, who was very attentive by the way, said was a favorite on the menu.  The menu didn't describe it as a patty.  Which is what they made this burger into, and not a good one.  The flavors just really didn't go together.  Lobster meat should never be made into a patty for F@cks sake!  I should have gone with a regular burger:(

EVRHcsjNvNyU47kaYH-1aA.text: Been here too many times and the Hell's Kitchen burger never disappoint! A must try because I feel like there's a lot going on in the burger as compared to his other burgers. My favorite part about the burger is the tomato, definitely not like any other tomatoes you've had! This place is generally a good 30 mins-1 hr wait average , but might be less if you go during an off hour.

lC4nPPivsCSeoOce6_7tug.text: The best place in Vegas for casual dinning! Corn beef sandwich is out of this world!Ask for truffle fries instead of kettle chips! A bit pricy but hey it's Vegas ! $80 for a sandwich a hamburger a beer and a Bloody Mary ! But with it! Enjoy.

1OzMjc1PUYRmQNHN3sI-Rw.text: I'm not into burgers but the alternatives are delicious. I ordered the wheat berry and quinoa salad. It was amazing! For dessert I ordered the chocolate parfait. It was also delicious, creamy and there was a bite of fresh berries in each spoonful.  I don't drink alcohol but husband does and he enjoyed the Squatters IPA. The alcohol is pricey @ 11.00 for an average size beer. The rest of the food was a good price.

PEmdHgADHBzWM7pxu3QsKA.text: Our wait time was acceptable. But we got there before the dinner rush. No issues there. We ordered wings which were exceptional but I had to ask for ranch even though our server offered it to us. My husband's water glass had lipstick on it so we requested a new one. Burgers did take 40 minutes to arrive. Fries were average. Nothing special. I guess my expectations were over the top for a Ramsey restaurant. Burgers were very good though. We had the hells burger and blue cheese burger.

JlAzdy4yJ4SIl7zmC_x9yg.text: Gordon Ramsay needs to go into this kitchen,  his own, and start screaming and cursing out the chefs.   My 3 cheese burger was ordered rare, and came out medium to well.   Overcooked, dry, flavorless.   Cooking hamburger meat is easy, so there's no excuse for this!   Mr B got the Hell's Kitchen burger with jalapeno,  avocado,  dried tomato.   It had a good amount of heat and was pretty tasty.   Way better than that sad excuse for a burger I had.   There's a line to get into the restaurant, but it moved quickly.   The wait for the food was approximately half an hour!   Gordon ramsay should be screaming and cursing about that too!

YAeag5pN7FkLDmcx6cGWtQ.text: Definitely delicious burger but terribly slow service. Wouldn't say that food is amazing bud definitely better than Mc Donald's and shake shack) worth trying it though

dVMpzohgZxRVmsjCdJEk4w.text: Disclaimer: I was not a happy camper (with my spouse) once I walked into this place and looked at the menu prices. I gave her the look.  OK. To start off, my family and another family were on a Spring Break trip in Vegas (don't judge). And my wife was in charge of most of the itinerary and she chose this place I knew nothing about. I guess she seen it on TV or friends or what. Well, once I walked in and glanced at the menu, I was like this place is NOT price friendly for kids and we have 3 kids with us. Ex. The hotdog was $17 (I think). Anyways I just frowned up until the point of the food arrival.  I ended up ordering a Cheeseburger as this is what they are known for. Again, wasn't happy with the price but I went along with it as planned. This place was very elegant and well thought layout. Live fires burning all around. You could see the kitchen in a distance as food was prepared. The wait staff was exceptionally polite and friendly. We actually held a 2-3 minute conversation that was pleasant as well. We ended up changing an order after placing it and the waiter was not upset at all for changing and also offered if we don't like something to let her know and she will exchange it. So I was impressed and feeling a little more at ease about the price issue (above).   The food arrived: I left out the part that my spouse suggested we order 1 french fries for my entire family of 3. Once the waiter placed our fries on the table, I was like wow. I should have listened to her. Ending result, we left several fries uneaten and I hate to waste good french fries.   Now to the burger. The burger size was a decent size. The meat looked hot and juicy. Quality of the remaining of the burger looked great. I was impressed. Once I bit into the burger, all i could say is Hmmmmm. This is pretty good. And it was as juicy and tender as it looked. Those damn fries (sweet potato) were on fire (not literally). They were VERY delicious. I wanted to make sure I ate all of those before helping with the regular fries ordered.   Hotdog: Yes, that $17 hotdog. That thing was huge. I was thinking no way my son will be able to eat half of it. The weenie was wrapped in bacon. With that notion, I really wanted to taste it. And once I did, it was delicious. I could have ordered it for myself and been happy. My son was able to finish half of it and he enjoyed it. We were all stuffed.  I recommend this place for the food mostly, and the amazing ambience they offer. And the cleanliness and wait staff.  All of it was amazing.

F-pqDpMygdjuLXVqGBPfdQ.text: It was a long queue to get in and a long wait to get the food but was very satisfied with the food. We ordered truffle parmesan fries and curry burger. the thick cut fries with the homemade ketchup was soo good. We expected the curry burger to be a little spicy but it was not. It tasted mild but delicious. Overall, enjoyed our visit here.

jOKYpLheIh8NiR-h6aIF6Q.text: I was pleasantly surprised that the burgers were tasty, fresh and original. Service was excellent and the decor was interesting. Great price for a nice Vegas burger!

6Qmg-PEybqDRU30XjDlcBw.text: Outstanding burgers! Gorgeous decor/ambience. Server was great! Want to come back again, and again and.....

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ue_PKXOHp3dYZ_D_BGO5SQ.text: I think Gordon would f*kng appalled and would tear into the staff here, especially the scruffy moist-lipped manager, standing there in his shiny-elbowed jacket with his shirt untucked, while his staff put drinks on our table, right under his nose, then shortly followed up to slide coasters underneath. Similar thing with our shared starters -- side plates for them arrived about 10 minutes later. The burgers were fine, but again, I'm not sure "fine" in that sense it what Gordon is after. I got The Crown Burger which has rocket/arugula and dried tomatoes. Sounds good but here's a thing: more arugula does not a better burger make, especially if you don't offset the dryness with more cheese. I love mimolette, surely everyone loves mimolette. give us more of that! This isn't fine dining, it's just fine. Prices are fine, wait was fine, service was fine, if a little amateur. Food was fine. F*ked off home.

8faZu-8Lu6msC2e-xIh3bA.text: Spectacular... now I know watching Gordon's shows why he get so upset about the taste of other ppl food because there is nothing that compair to the flavor of his food. Like no other

14Gd2c9f28wYCId3tOjL1w.text: Maannnnnnnnn I LOVE EATING HERE!!!! I used to be a dealer at Planet Hollywood so I remember when this place was first constructed. My friend at the time who was food and beverage manager for casino ended up taking over the manager position here. He kept telling me to come and that it was really good. I finally take him up on his offer and bring my friend along. When I tell you that everything we had was delicious......I mean EVERTHING! He decided to pick out all the courses for us from appetizer to the dessert. I can't remember what I had that time because it was many years back, but I do know that it was the most delicious burger I've ever had. I mean the meat was cooked to perfection and just melted in your mouth with every bite! I'm hungry thinking about it now. Been back a few times since then and the only thing that has changed is the five course meal! Everything else is exceptional and service is 5 star. You want a burger, you will not want any others after going here!

Bo-OthPnMdsRflMrf9G7Wg.text: Not worth the hype. Waited over 1/2 hour for 2 burgers and fries. Burger was luke warm and fries were soggy.  Some people who arrived after us were served much sooner. Such a big disappointment, not Gordon worthy.  Won't be back for what what we paid.

BX0jOL25UQfRpFaT1pVmmg.text: We've heard nothing but good things about this spot. We've always wanted to stop in and get a bite but the line is always long. We finally waited in the line and it was worth it. The burgers are really good. The onion rings are the bomb. We started with the ahi sliders and they were awesome. It's definitely worth it to wait in the line.

x9Wu77fliClOlYBIaSlzHQ.text: The patty is made up of riblets or something. The burger was way too salty. They have like a whole wall that is on fire so it was physically hot too. Although their shakes are good. They are made with like a parfait and taste great

TiWTL0s80pzNK7AghITt4w.text: 1. The food was SO salty. There is no way Gordon Ramsey would approve.  We ordered Bluecheese Burger, Crown Burger and Truffle Fries. I asked for a well-done patty, not a jerkey. It was so dry and salty.    2. We had to wait 30 minutes after ordering to get the burgers and the fry. The fry was on the shelf in the kitchen for about good 15 minutes before we got them.  (Because it was an open kitchen, we were able to watch our fry getting dry.) Thanks to the long waiting time, the fry's texture was like a baguette.   3. It took 10 more minutes to get the bill.   4. The server looked really angry. She looked like Gordon Ramsey when he's pissed off.

0KUPry9BuKZXKR4JWYfpNQ.text: Best tasting burger. The meat is so delicious and flavorful. The bun. The truffle fries. The cheese. Omg I just love this place. Had the ultimate cheeseburger, truffle fries, and a sangria. Together on of the best meals I ever had.

XWeKwbhgDIaM_PYzVTPweA.text: I've always wanted to try one of Ramsey's restaurants and I finally had the chance coming to Vegas this week! I was originally going to get a typical beef burger BUT then I saw that there was a shrimp and lobster burger and I had to try it! It was much lighter than a burger and had such a great combination of flavors with the seafood mixed with picked carrots and cauliflowers. It was a bit pricey at $26 but I'd definitely recommend it! The truffle fries were also very delicious. Only complaint would be the service is a bit slow, it took about 30 minutes to get our food after ordering.

ft0wcO3ZKS64P_cNJj4PWQ.text: I came here with my husband for dinner. Totally underwhelmed with the food. The only thing that was really tasty were the fries. The service was excellent. Our waitress was there for us!  If Gordon actually tasted his food there, he would be cursing.

BE0lUhzdDXSztoYuUFTyjA.text: You should try onion rings! Was so yummy. Burger was perfectly done and delicious. Prices are reasonable and worthy.

DX7hPdrQX0MnAx3NyWFY4w.text: I came here last Sunday before driving back home. I was going to eat-in but seeing the long line, I asked the hostess if I could get it to go, and hopefully, I could sit somewhere on the strip and eat it. I ordered the farmhouse burger and truffle fries. I was told that it would take 25min and that I could sit in the adjacent lounge. There was no space there because football games filled it up and I'm sure you have to buy drinks to sit there. I thought that I'd have nowhere to eat, so I asked if I could change my order to eat in and asked if there were seats for one. She said I could sit at the "chef's table"-(stools facing the kitchen). While I waited, I took my Rubiks cube out and started to solve it. I noticed the worker stop doing what she was doing and watch me solve it. Afterwards, she gave me a high 5 and I got a fist bump from the chef. The girl (Lydia) asked where I bought my cube and I told her if I could write it down. I had said that I bought mine from eBay when the first came out with stickerless 7x7 cubes for about $50. Now that more companies have been making them, the price is now $23 from cubicle.us, a company in upstate New York, which is good because you don't have to wait for it to come in the mail from China. She said she wanted to buy one for her sister or was it her daughter. I told her how I learned to solve it by watching how-to videos from a Prof. Arthur Benjamin, the creator of Mathemagic. I told her that I took a month to "master" the 3x3. and that I watched YouTube to learn the 4x4. I told her that you need to learn how to do centers with the 4x4, and if you know the 3x3 and the centers of the 4x4, then you can solve any sized cube. Next, the maitre d and I talked about how to solve it, and I told him that the night before, I went to Wahlburgers and drank to see how much is needed to slow me down. I said its more fun when you are drunk because now I have to think harder instead of solving it on "auto-pilot". I drank 3 drinks and still didn't slow me down much. He told me that I should eat now before my food gets cold. This was the best burger I've eaten yet. It's too bad I was still stuffed from the last night. I'm glad I decided to eat in. I ate half my burger the fries. The fries were great and was probably made with all natural truffle oil. I've bought a Perigord truffle once and I've bought artificial essence of black and white truffle that you mix with olive oil. After being halfway done, I stopped and played with my cube until I was able to eat again. Finally, I chatted with the chef and asked him if he had met the man himself. He told me that he his nothing like the Hell's Kitchen persona and that he is very mellow nowadays. I told him about how I love the UK version of Kitchen Nightmare, where he can curse, but it is more evidence that he cares. Check it out on youtube. I will try other burgers next time and I hope the chef there will go far in his career just like Marcus Wareing. I wish I knew the name of the chef. Lydia had told me, but I didn't hear her clearly. I also wished I learned the name of Maitre D'. I totally recommend this place and recommend sitting at the chef's counter.

lG6Gm76VQpNL8Vv8dpekRA.text: This place is a 2.5... I didn't really care for the burger at all! The only reason you should come here for is for the onion rings! They do have great customer service though..

E7QHqibb0Twu1kWvkE5siA.text: I love coming here, keep in mind they do not take reservations, they will take your name & number once you get there. We waited about 30 min on a Saturday night, not bad. The burgers are excellent along with truffle fries. Yum !

Nd3yzadfKUNWXEvwsaDAAA.text: Best burger ever is all I have to say. You have to get their shakes they are amazing also! The creme brulee oreo is my fave!

85mufMEcI1ewRuYNzG1kNw.text: Being a fan of all things GR I've been here a few times.  It's a great place for Hell's Kitchen fans to reminisce about the episode/competition filmed here.  It is really too pricey for what you get.

5BTIzF-bfa08L3GdBlGOpg.text: Best Onion Rings I have ever had in my life! A perfect mixture if breaded ingredients. While visiting Vegas, we were looking for a good burger joint near Planet Hollywood. This place definitely fit the bill. My burger was great as expected. The wait was a bit long and a lunch for two cost us around 60 bucks with a tip. Another thing worth mentioning, they offer a military discount. I think it was 10 percent off.

5DQ5gQIVRoV-6NdwuDbw0A.text: It's Gordon Ramsey so I figured it would be good, it exceeded my expectations. Truffle fries are a must, you won't regret it! Burger had great flavor, juicy and filling.

GlQgGYZl6E9XiDf85skgGw.text: All I can say is YUMMMM!! The service was beyond great, the food was amazzzzzzing! Im not a fan of sweet potatoes, but the sweet potato fries with powdered sugar is really good! This place is a must go when in vegas. It's kid friendly if you're with kids, which is a huge plus. The decor and atmosphere are also great. We'll definitely be back on our next trip to vegas.

neoM1d9BcKLrazJvjEleIg.text: With the name of the venue and everything I originally came in here with high expectations. While it is indeed pricey however, these expectations were met. I had their signature pork burger and that monster was just oozing with flavor and juice. Delicious! Additionally, my friends and I also ordered the nachos for appetizer and while they did feel to lack some meet the overall dish was still fun to eat and flavorful to the tongue. To me this place was on gourmet burger place that actually feels worth it to come back to. Usually with most places like it, I'd just prefer simply going to in n out or five guys or something else like those. With this establishment however, like stated it is worth coming back to for both the food and the experience. You get to take home a souvenir menu for free, say you ate at a gordon Ramsey restaurant, and feel actually satisfied! Good stuff

RUGC45YuQzHz2VWA4PBgzw.text: If you're a diamond member for total rewards you can skip the long lines. The onion rings were incredible and the burgers were cooked perfectly!

igAIYzShX8WEKHa-vqT_lw.text: I will be coming here again and again! I had to try this place out, because I am a huge Gordon Ramsay fan. This place did not disappoint! AZ5ecCDgPqCI4TytQyVyuA.text: Last time we were in Las Vegas we tried Gordon Ramsey's Fish n' Chips and liked it a lot. This popped up and we decided to give it a try. Together, we shared the ale soup, Hell's Kitchen burger and onion rings. I don't think we can be regulars here, but we wouldn't mind coming back some day. Also, be prepared to wait. We came at the end of the day and there was still a small line; waiting 30-40 minutes. Others that came behind us reported the line was six times as long earlier in the day.

pDJ82lsTVp3T4s1wHAK6mQ.text: I was really surprised how "meh" the food was here. I love burgers and was really looking forward to Burger and after a long wait in line, I found the burger to be nothing special at all. In fact, I would rate several fast food burgers better including Five Guys and Smash Burger...and Gordon Ramsay doesn't even come close to Bachi Burger in town.   The truffle fries were dry and bland. After reading great reviews, I was looking forward to those as well but another let down.  I did have the browned butter caramel shake along with my Innis and Gunn beer. The shake was delicious.   I had the ahi sliders as an appetizer. That was ok but nothing great.  All in all, not impressive. The line is really long and it's a bit pricey which was expected. If you want a great burger in Vegas, Bachi is the best.

rrXuVI5P6I4UhfwuzjEe2Q.text: One word... Orgasmic. Waiter and food were both stellar.  Would defined recommend to anyone who likes a eclectic burgers and beer!

2ajxfxHLyTRBbKFyb4Th_w.text: With a location bearing the famous Gordon Ramsay's name, I expected much more.   SERVICE: The service was the most upsetting as the waitresses were extremely frustrating. I came with a party of 9 with them originally saying 45 minutes. After an hour, I asked of the status and a lady stated that "it'll be 10 more minutes since they are now cashing out." Half an hour later, we, again, asked of the status. Their response: "oh, we gave it to another group. Sorry. It'll be 15 more minutes." Each time we asked of the status, they would change the story of which table was "finishing up" and that it would be "another 15 minutes."  Guess what? 40 minutes later, they still have not gotten us a table and we are the longest waiting group. Total wait time was 2.5 hours when they originally promised 45 minutes.   The service is poor and frustrating for such a famous location. If this location were to improve, improve the waitresses as they are just willing to improvise False stories and wait times.   FOOD: We decided to stay for the food since they made us wait 2.5 hours for a table they kept promising. The food was mediocre at best. The poutine was extremely salty and would bring even the healthiest person into hypertensive crisis. The meat was overcooked despite ordering a medium-- just overpriced for the hype. I am disappointed to give this a poor review especially since I am a big fan of Chef Ramsay.   ADVICE: Avoid this place. Just check out the Bobby Flay burgers near by. They treat you with respect there and the food is superior.

psE5fbNfmD-1m0Lw8JkQhA.text: Delicious!!!! Love the atmosphere I had the patriot burger and it was very filling!! Will definitely visit again when I come to vegas
