CVbcShYKD88NxvkMOMrHww.text: Definitely a great burger experience. I got the farmhouse burger, and my wife guy the forest. We shared fries. The beer selection is good with many choices from IPAs to lagers, and our server, Alex, was a pro.   The burger. I don't know how to explain the bun, but it was awesome. It was light, but kept all the burger ingredients in place. The egg on mine was cooked perfectly, and the beef was seasoned nicely. I didn't think I could eat the whole thing, but I did. Perfection on a bun.   The fries came with two dipping sauces, ketchup and a house made aoli with black truffles and garlic. Super delicious.   We waited in line for about 15 minutes, but the food was served fast after we ordered. Overall a great experience.

7ZeAg4mjFZXZQ1OVFqYY_Q.text: Oh my god! The meat the meat the meat! I got my burger medium and I couldn't have made a better choice! The flavors exploded in my mouth!!!! Who needs anything else on it besides the cheese! The bun was unusual and not like anything I had had before. But it was very good and soft and paired well with the burger. The fries were a cut above and the ketchup was more than I'd expected.  A curry ketchup and a chipotle ketchup. I preferred the curry. Well worth going to.

tIR_imFiuELIuPyZKukBAA.text: You have no idea how much it PAINS me to give a restaurant named after the man himself anything less than a perfect score. Anyone who knows me knows that I have a strange yet justified obsession with all things Gordon Ramsay. That being said, my visit here was just not great. My friend and I sat at the bar because they said it would be a long wait and we just wanted to split a burger and truffle fries. The bartender told us the burger would take roughly 30 mins and I wasn't terribly upset about it because come on... perfection takes time lol in actuality the burger didn't come for an hour. And that was annoying because it was getting late and an hour to make a burger is kinda ridiculous lol  The burger itself was cold, very salty and kind of fell apart as you tried to eat it. The bartender was not attentive to us at all. After she took our order we didn't see her again. She spent most of the time talking to a friend.  In fact, when we finished a separate waiter saw us sitting there waiting and took our plates.  The only saving grace were the truffle fries but they are pricy.   Overall I wouldn't return if I visit Vegas again. Prices were too high for the product and the service during this visit wasn't great.   Still love Gordon though

WSooEKmjKEPFnuNijqbk9Q.text: Great food! !great place !!  I had hell's burger it was amazing with grilled jalapeno and asadero cheese (I added bacon ) fries  and a root beer.. as appetizer had the wings they were so good... .Four stars instead of five because service could have been better . Server seemed to be distracted by the football game playing on tvs. After getting my food realized a lot of tables had the onion rings so  I order them but never got them... but  I was charged for them. Told server and she did fix The bill.  Great place !

EFoP8gsU-SANx7XI9lW6bQ.text: We are fans of Gordon Ramsay and would love to try out his restaurants without breaking our piggy banks, so we decided to try Gordon Ramsay burger next after trying Gordon Ramsay fish and chips!  We started to wait for our turn since 7pm on a Tuesday evening and it took us about an hour to get a table for two. Our nice and friendly server gave us really clear explanations on items on menu and he even gave us a heads-up that our food would take at least 45 minutes to prepare, as the kitchen was busy.  We ordered the following for two of us without any sides, so as to not over feed our tummies: 1) "Foie" burger  The foie gras is just a spread on the bun. We weren't able to taste the foie gras spread as the taste of port wine aioli had overpowered the taste of foie gras spread. We probably won't recommend this burger, as it didn't look as appetizing as other burgers served on other tables. 2) Wheatberry-Quinoa salad The chicken skewer was tender and it went really well with the salad. The salad is slightly on a sour side. If there is some sweet mandarin oranges or sweet peaches added to this salad, this will be perfect! The portion is good to share among 3 or 4 people.   We will still go back to try other burgers.

Q_d8HdC0vx7xtBOUcOBkOA.text: I am such a Gordon Ramsey fan so when I was in Vegas I had to stop here. There was a line with a wait of 30hr around 3pm Tuesday but we opted to sit at the bar which was available immediately.   We ordered the "forest burger" it had duck bacon my boyfriend loved it, it was an acquired taste. I ate the ' kettle chip nachos" it was sooooooooo good. Def the short rib. I could hve just ate that. Ughhh I was mad because we we never preferred the Parmesan fries which surrounded the room. Def would hve to come back to this place just for the truffle parmasean fries.   Finally tasting his food makes me love him even more. Muah to chef Ramsey.

Urw1UdAg-LsU9WuwPEJlDA.text: Nice atmosphere,  the burger taste very good.  The beer batter onion ring taste delious.

ed6ak2OQc2uaul1wXUqRFg.text: We were so disappointed! Terrible service!  Cold fries, no refills and no server for most of the meal! I have watched Gordon Ramsay for years and I went in there expecting top notch service.... not at all what we got! We spent over $100 on a burger and a drink and it was not good.  The service is what really killed it!!!! I know when it's busy you have to juggle your tables... but at least acknowledge us and let us know you will be right with us..... it took 25 minutes just to get waters. Such a disappointment!  Lisa Shaw

T1G25Qdvz7RpxB6KImmlEg.text: Well this was a great experience. We waited 20 mins in line. Server was attentive.  We rocked the nachos which were fantatsic. Corned beef wasnt too salty. Very good. Got the hells kitchen burger.  That bread was so soft. The meat was a perfect medium rare. Tons of flavor. The garlic truffle fries was a generous portion of tasty from start to finish. Great amount of alioli. Id highly recomend coming here. There is an emphasis on quality here we havnt found at other places. Thanks!

K87U3nHexgCfZHxpBf0bVA.text: Wow!! We were a party of 12 gave us a time frame of25 - 30 min wait. After waiting for 45 min still not ready. They were waiting for two party's to get out. After 55 min of waiting we finally got a table. Ramsay say the F all the time well this is one of those moment for us. F F

QaTiIa0lQrKsqe7-53FD4g.text: I came here for the first time with friends. Service was good and it was definitely one of the better burgers I've had. The truffle fries are a must! Only gave 4 instead of 5 stars because my boyfriend's old fashioned was a little off.

gx6cpC9HmAB0jx3QMm5vOg.text: 300th review!  UPDATE: I love how they "renovated" so they could start over on Yelp. {/end sarcasm mode}  TL;DR: Go to Bobby's Burger Palace if you feel you must eat a celebrichef burger while in Vegas. Half the price, better burgers, better service, little to no wait, no tipped employees.  Don't believe everything you see on TV! I'm so disillusioned. Gordon, you were my favorite celebri-chef. I forsook Anthony Bourdain for you! I have been following Gordon religiously and watching every show of his I could get my hands on ever since I discovered F Word and the original Kitchen Nightmares on BBC America 12 years ago. My husband and I have been quoting him for over a decade. I have even made Amy's Baking Co references in a Yelp review. But the food here was NOT "simple, fresh, and vibrant," as Gordon could often be heard barking at hapless failing restaurateurs.  The fries were hard and over-seasoned. The burgers, which we ordered blue rare, came out well done. Sending it back did not fix it (and I fear the saliva added by our disgruntled waiter did not improve the flavor either). They also tasted burnt and oversalted, and both burger and bun were dry and crumbly - the former because it was overcooked, the latter because it was old (tasted even older than the bread we used to throw away for being too stale at the bakery I worked at while putting myself through college). The shakes were too sweet to choke down more than a mouthful or two and had way too much crap going on. Not just the shakes, EVERYTHING down to the sauces was needlessly complicated: some additional flourish for the "coolness factor" or something, not actually contributing anything to the flavor, and often going one step beyond to actually detracting. The food was as gimmicky and smug about its cleverness as the name BURG(ordon)R(amsay). No hint of simplicity, freshness, or vibrance. Just over-complication, massive overcooking, and smugness.  We left 3/4 of our food untouched, which is like a 9th circle-level sin for us. The servers just cleared our plates without caring to ask if there was a reason we didn't eat very much of it.  So not worth the hype, the price, or the long wait.  If I were Gordon I would want to make sure that every restaurant that bore my name and likeness had service and food I was proud to put my name on, but I guess he would rather watch his bank account grow than work to protect the reputation he sweated blood for years to attain.  The only reason why I can't say this was the worst overpriced meal I've ever had is because BEAST exists.

o-t-wndme5ap_sJe8EibYQ.text: What I ordered was only worth 2 stars.. I'm sure the other burgers might be good. The truffle fries was not good, and the lobster & shrimp burger wasn't either. I didn't taste any lobster.. i'm vietnamese and while eating the burger all I could think about is fish cakes my parents make. That's what resemble the patty's taste to me.. 5 of my other family members also got the lobster and shrimp burger. They didn't like it, but I think the other 6 enjoyed their beef patty burgers. Next time I'll know not to get a seafood patty for a burger lol

ugadFl3d5lCdE8Z8AxSaNw.text: I love coming to place when I am in Vegas.  The line is always long but if you have a total rewards card and have platinum status or above, you can get seated right away.  You have to get a shake if you are there, you wont be sorry. They are amazing.  The shake I got had an oreo cookie in it and it was yummy.  I ordered a cheeseburger and it had jalepenos in it and it was awesome. Next time I am there, I will order something knew because I know will taste amazing.

G5xALR0kdL5RIu-YIEk_Eg.text: My wife doesn't like turkey burgers like I do, but she lived this one!  I really was surprised by how big and thick yet juicy and flavorful it was.  The only thing I didn't like was that they charged $12 for a small order of truffle fries.  My burger was only $2 more!

The place wasn't super busy and the staff seemed more interested in flirting with each other than doing their job.

2Z3LtKnw6yblPDjzzAkTKg.text: Completely worth the wait! The poutine fries were to die for and they're burgers are perfect! They also had some great craft beers on tap.  We would absolutely eat here again!

I ordered the farmhouse burger and my son order the shrimp and lobster burger. Both were excellent and the truffle fries with the aioli sauce were absolutely delish! Would definitely recommend.

AOe74FKqv5ygEddgjafa_A.text: This is a go to spot every time I'm in Vegas! Every time we go there is a wait but they text you when your table is ready. Plenty of time to explore the casino while you wait. Every burger I've had here has been amazing and I love the jalapeno popper appetizer! I've never had a shake here but want to try one when I come back in October! See you soon BurGR!

GqZI74-xYl5acK7e0YYd3g.text: What can I say about Gordon Ramsay? I can tell you if you're coming for a burger you will not be disappointed. The options are endless, and if you're willing to wait 30 minutes or so for your meal you'll be very pleased. My burger was outstanding. The set up the delivery of the presentation or on par. Excellent job. I would've given it five stars if it was just a little bit quicker but the food was so good that again as long as you have the time you're gonna be the supportive whatsoever.

_rqM9Yd5DQnUknKbhzu69Q.text: Alright guys! I have some steam to release on this restaurant. The hella kitchen burger More like the stomach flu burger got me so sick and I mean so sick. Both me and my girlfriend got the stomach from eating here. After eating the burger and waking up the next morning, we didn't feel so good. Either the chef didn't wash his hands after using the restroom or the beef had some plain ole E. coli in it. Idk, you tell me Chef Gordon Ramsay. And don't even get me started about the 5 hour drive back home from Vegas with a stomach flu. We will not be returning. Who knows how much longer until we even eat another burger again. We were traumatized.

S6fiefRCs7nJPgLJmutuxQ.text: Get the Poutine Fries - you will not regret it.   Food was great, sadly didn't get yelled at, or see anyone else get yelled at.

4xCgYFCHcZs1TOx67b6ipw.text: This is one of my favorite places to go in Las Vegas!!! The burgers are absolutely phenomenal!!! My favorite is the Hell's Kitchen burger and the backyard burger!!! I always order onion rings as well they are so delicious !!! I highly recommend trying this place out if you haven't yet. There's usually always a line but in my opinion the food is worth the wait. If you have never had poutine you should defiantly try that while your here to. The burgers are huge so my boyfriend and I usually share one so go hungry. We usually make it a point to at least go once or twice a year. In my opinion it's the best burgers I have ever had!

i3TW_r0vk6gNojoLSs2uCg.text: I absolutely love their wings!!!! And the blue cheese it comes with is so good. Boyfriend wasn't amazed by his burger but we both enjoy the sticky toffee bread pudding, it's a must at any Gordon restaurant.

9-US5VB33xNG_QPbl6TOZA.text: I've always wanted to visit a Gordon Ramsay establishment and I must say I wasn't too disappointed. I'll admit I thought this place could be gimmicky but after a 40 minute wait in line plus an additional 30 minute wait for my food I was not disappointed! Got a counter seat looking into the chaotic kitchen. They were very busy (of course) but when I finally got my first item, the Creme Brulee Shake, I happily enjoyed sipping it! It was a very good shake as I could taste the Creme Brulee on the top but to be honest the actual chocolate shake underneath it tasted just like any other chocolate shake anywhere else. Next was the UK Burger which was very juicy. Juicy as in every bite I took of that meat patty was dripping of meat juice, not oil! What made it unique was they had some sort of sweet jam spread on it which balanced out well with the cheese. And finally the winner of the meal was the amazing Parmesan Truffle Fries! Now if you don't order this you'll be missing out, these fries are delicious but it is that truffle sauce that just blows it out of the water! Each time I dipped a frie into that sauce and took a bite I felt like I was melting into a sea of buttery truffle goodness. Overall I enjoyed the experience very much, I only wish the wait times weren't as long but hey it's a popular Gordon Ramsay establishment! Great things are worth waiting for!

mOwUQcUg5goSIuXg45YItQ.text: It's my favorite burger so far, the flavor is very creative and amazing.

lnxm3vVyuD2StixQsfk-mQ.text: Sat at the bar. Draft from the air conditioning was a bit too much, asked to move 2 seats down where it wasn't as bad. Bartender said 'it's going to be bad there too, I don't know why you would bother moving.'  burger came out, mediocre. Grilled Jalapeno/Pepper on it was not deseeded. Mostly inedible after seeds made their way into the rest of the burger/toppings/etc.   Inquired as to  if the burger was usually this bad with the bartender. Was told 'haha yeah this time of year the heat fluctuates'  pretty lame experience overall. i'd stay away

apneZKEW4KkshbbdMN6CcA.text: Super tasty.  Can be busy at times, but what else would be expected? All members of the wait staff I've come into contact with have been friendly and on top of it.

M3WAKbupQL4BQlfLugQwJw.text: Great burger, great appetizers, great desserts, and most importantly great service!  I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger which was very sophisticated in flavor and very well composed.  The pickled  Jalapenos were a bit too spicy for my taste but I enjoyed every bite of it.  Appetizers and fries were very unique and also very rich in flavor.  The fries were soggy and wasnt freshly fried, hence the one star knocked off.  Desserts were a bit overwhelmingly large in amount, simple and nicely done. I had the crem brulee oreo shake which was very well balanced, not too sweet, not too chunky with oreo.  Overall, I would come back to Gordon Ramsay Burger on my next visit to Las Vegas, and I can assure you it is well worth the extra price for a nice burger.

DrXyC69XMzgLUzML5607bg.text: So disappointing. We waited for over an hour in line, but figured it would be worth it because, well, Mr Ramsey. Ordered the fries and they were what I would equate eating cardboard would seem like. They were obviously old, dry, not salted, and chewy like day-old bread. The fish sandwich was bland at best. The batter was over cooked, the fish undercooked. I cannot imagine Mr Ramsey would be proud of the food we were served. I would never go back.

uiWoFeh-RzeoagdWZLDjpA.text: Ok the service of this place is out of this world. I just didn't expect this leaves of service at his burger joint but, I guess that's a testament to Gordon. The food was amazing as well! When I go back to Vegas I want to eat at Hell's Kitchen!

CNhyBWtTnN0ZPqHlyahQeg.text: OMG Soooooo Good! Yes it was Expensive but IT WAS WORTH IT!!! Not to mention Great Food but WOW the Service was Top Notch For it being a Burger Spot!!!!! 100 STARS FOR THE SERVICE AND THATS THE TRUTH!!!!! It was the Best Burger I Have ever eaten, I had the Hells Kitchen Burger and it was Delicious!! My husband had the Hog Burger and he said it was Sooo Good! My mom had the Farmhouse Burger and she Loved it!! I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND GRB SPOT YOU WONT BE DISAPPOINTED!!!!  And I recommend getting the Total Rewards Credit Card! The bill was over $100 and we got All the Food for FREE!!!!!

3v2kHiD0-GRlwFp9EZ744g.text: Next time I'll try Bobby Flay's burger joint.  The service was a bunch of "uninterested" slogs dressed up in pretty outfits.  Unfortunately, my $20+ lamb burger was COLD and almost raw. The fries (all 14 of them) were the best part of the meal.  I wanted to say I ate at Gordon's restaurant, and I did. But the price tag was NOT worth it. I could have gone to In N Out for a REAL burger.  Very disappointing.

gmWLaCym3X9l4kr6P5iVoQ.text: Pricey for a burger joint but you're paying for the name of the restaurant so figures. The buffalo wings are breaded to perfection and the burgers are big and fulfilling. Very well seasoned as well. It doesn't need any tweaking.

ieEYQJL0V_qHypDRQVHCUQ.text: Great service and awesome food. I had the Farmhouse Burger, fries, and onion rings. The ketchup was so good. Everything was delicious. Even the desserts!!!

cs1F04j-JnxBWe-NhRM3eQ.text: I've been a long time fan of Gordon Ramsay from his various tv shows, now I finally get to try one of his restaurants! We had the Onion Rings as a appetizer and they were delicious! I had the backyard burger and the burger was a nice size and very juicy paired with fresh toppings. We left stuffed and satisfied!

wD8QkqCsXeIXoqHH5MaNtQ.text: If you are in the mood for a good burger, you have to try Gordon Ramsay Burger. It is simply delicious. I am in Vegas 3-5 times a year, and I have to come here every time. I have not tried the same burger twice because the menu has so many great options. If you are afraid to try some of the options, the ultimate cheeseburger is one I always suggest to friends trying it for the first time, and they always have rave reviews. If you are looking for a started I would highly recommend the hellfire chicken wings and the kettle chip nachos.

iz6aN1ri6jYk43aqU1upxQ.text: My husband had been wanting to visit this place for a long time but we never got a chance to until this trip. He was so excited since he is a huge fan of Chef Ramsey. This place does not take reservations so it's first come first serve by waiting in line. Ppl were right and you do need to get in early. For parties of 3 or more, depending if there is a wait the hostess will take your name and number to text you when your table is ready. I thought this was nice instead of waiting so we were able to go play some games, plus we were still waiting for the rest of our party to join us.   The service was great, our waitress was real attentive and she kept our drinks refilled at all times. Plus she was good about letting us know how long the food would take to set our expectations which I appreciated. We ordered the kettle chip nachos to munch on while we waited for our burgers. They were pretty good and flavorful and crunchy. For the burgers we got the Hell's Kitchen which I  thought was cooked well and I loved the peppers and aioli. We also got the Parmesan truffle fries on the side. It was enough to feed the 4 of us. All the sauce accompaniments (we also asked for ranch) seemed freshly house made and were delicious!   Overall the meal and experience was great. I would definitely recommend coming back and would probably go again if we come through Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kettle Chip Nachos with short rib meat
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hells Kitchen Burger - good flavors and well cooked!

5kgdwAkaKsIH_SeShsPCkg.text: We went on a Saturday, Labor Day weekend during lunch time. Food was great. Long wait times but I didn't even mind it. What ruined my night was the snobby girls that came with our plates. We were a party of 6, they came out with the plates and just started dropping them off to the wrong person. When we told them they rolled the eyes and put down the plates with attitude. They acted as if they were too good to even talk to us. No smiles just bitches. Sad that Gordon Ramsay hired these kind of snobs. My server on the other hand, he was great. No matter how great the food is, this kind of treatment leaves a bad taste.

KfNfguJYrE_886EbwF4JYQ.text: Burger was delicious. I had the Pork Chop and Applesauce Burger! Truffle fries were on point and waiter made sure everything was perfect! The wait time can be a bit long so get a few drinks and prepare to hang out in the line for a while. Wish you could make reservation priors but it's still worth the wait!

DpxOGjij9in4vcvGuFKifg.text: DELISH!! Definitely worth the wait! I'm a huge Gordan Ramsey fan so I couldn't leave Las Vegas without eating at one of his restaurants. I went with a party of five people and was immediately greeted at the hostess stand. Luckily, we had a Diamond card and got priority seating. I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger (How could I not?!) and after about a 15-minute wait for our orders, everything arrived at our table hot and ready to eat. My burger was cooked perfectly and all the toppings (which sounded a little unusual together on the menu) worked together and tasted fantastic. If I get the chance to revisit, I definitely would!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0LinZ4VJeDkB2tRBX_pmhA.text: Our experience at Hell's Kitchen was truly a success. But how do the famous chef's burgers stack up?   Located in Planet Hollywood on the second floor, you'll find Gordon Ramsay Burgers. At $16+ a burger, you sure as heck get what you pay for. The burger is quite big and filling but doesn't come with any french fries or side dishes.   Pecan Milkshake: 5/5! By far, this was the best milkshake I have ever had. The rich buttery flavor profile of the pecans was out of this world. The caramel drizzle accentuates the butteriness and adds a nice sticky texture. The pecans were candy coated and absolutely delicious. The milkshake is incredibly thick and creamy. I highly recommend trying it. Don't leave this place without trying their milkshakes!  Poutine: 3.5/5 The fries itself were thick cut so you can really appreciate the potato profile. The gravy itself is delicious- savory, peppery, and rich. The short rib pieces were overly salty and unnecessarily fatty. The fries quickly became soggy and unappealing several minutes after it came out. It was nothing special and I definitely wouldn't bother ordering it next time.  Hell's kitchen burger: 3/5 Brioche bun was enjoyable- soft and bouncy. The burger itself was very bland and flavorless. The meat patty was juicy with a nice crunchy sear to the outside. However, the burger could use some special sauce or even just salt and pepper. The spicy aioli definitely went unnoticed and unappreciated.   Service was good. We came around 2:30 pm on a Friday and we waited 15 minutes. The host and servers were both friendly and polite. The burgers took longer than expected to come out (~20 minutes). Sadly the food did not live up to the expectations. At $16+ a burger, I would expect much better quality and more flavor. 2 burgers, 1 milkshake, & 1 appetizer quickly added up to $65 with no outstanding impressions on us.    If you must come here, just come here for the milkshakes. You won't regret it.

9-6Woks0AxRvjHBbSL4AOQ.text: I came here in 2015 and had the best burger meal ever! Came back again last month and it was good, but not amazing :(  I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger and an order of the Street Corn Appetizer. The street corn was super good. Didn't even need the chips it came with. The burger on the other hand, was just ok. I feel like the meat was just not as high quality as I'm used to a my favorite burger joint (Nom Burger in Sunnyvale, CA). I'd definitely come back, but I think here are better burgers out there in Vegas.  Don't come here expecting the best gourmet burger of your life and you'll be fine :)

_BaM6o4Jzv9J3RXD0QV-TQ.text: Another year, more tone-deaf hostesses that don't understand how they turn away return business. Two seats available at the bar which, in years past, have always been available without waiting in the line. Hostess refused that to us, saying we had to wait in line for even that seating, despite everyone in the line wanting a table and not bar seating. When I informed her that this previously wasn't the policy, she had to think for a second before inventing that "it's a new policy." Sure. Sounds more like you didn't want to be caught in your poor training. Whatever - cost you two repeat customers.

0pVvC6l9UN5wvg0VxxkNtw.text: I love to do Reviews because people can use helpful, my limes for the margarita were bad yellow not green and also my fish and chips burger was bland and when is that the flavor became fishy.   Nothing compares like the steak house at Paris hotel .

MI-ex-kokZM_OMUwyxAWkg.text: My favorite spot for burgers in Vegas. Everything tastes good at this spot. If you haven't been it's a must try.

xnNzPpOh3V09K_4C5WpEIg.text: How do you explain a perfect burger? It feels impossible but the Gordon Ramsey burger restaurant accomplished this. Here are a couple highlights from our meal.  U.k. burger Farmhouse burger "Just fries"  - we spent 15minutes raving about the ketchups. Where else have you been so enthralled by a condiment?  - halfway through the burger there was a moment of Bliss. Where you realize this food is making you happy. Rare.  - each of us eating could not stop talking about how good the burger was. For literally hours afterward.  There was a 2 hour wait, and it was worth it.  I have eaten at Bobby's Burger Palace recently. This place absolutely annhililates them! For roughly the same price you get a burger that rocks your socks off and leaves you happy. Higher praise I just can't give.

jF0mr7J5QgXIESJdNCpoLQ.text: Straight FIRE!!!!!!! This was worth the wait in line (about 15-20 minutes on a Friday early evening). I was told that to sit at the bar, you also have to wait in line, which sucks but the line wasn't too bad.   I decided to order the Hell's kitchen burger, Asadero cheese + roasted jalapenos + NO avocado + oven roasted tomatoes + jalapeno pesto aioli, I added onions+ lettuce. I ordered "just fries" as well for an additional $8 I think. The burger was truly cooked medium well. For some reason, people have issues with cooking to proper temps, this place got it right. The burger was hot, moist, tender, so flavorful. I loved it and plan on getting another one before I leave. I took off 1 star for the fries. They were awful to be honest. Even with the curry ketchup and regular ketchup. They were hot but tasted stale if that makes any sense. Which makes me think they were frozen. Fine, but they shouldn't be stale. I would stick with just a burger in the future.

JNUjvS3iQF_lZns7D01thw.text: Allen and I came here on a Friday night around 8 PM. We waited about an hour in line, and another 30 minutes to get our food.   Pro tip 1: I *think* if you say that you want to sit at the bar, you can get seated faster!  -1 Service was mediocre. The lady who was supposed to be serving us was too distracted by her friends or someone who were dining in at the same time as us. She left us hanging for a while, and took forever to get us our checks because she was too busy taking photos with people she knew! Only glimpse of hope in this restaurant was the busboy who did everything. Double thumbs up for you!  We ended up ordering: 1) Truffle parmesan fries ($12): liked the sauces that came on the side! Pretty good portion size, and would recommend.  2) Farmhouse burger ($17): My favorite of the two burgers, just because I am a bacon and egg type of girl. Liked the sesame buns, and medium-well was cooked well! 3) Hell's kitchen burger ($17): This was a bit too much for me, but Allen seemed to enjoy it. A classic, if you don't know what to get here!  Menu: pretty simple, nothing super fancy.  Pricing: might be $1-$3 more than the average burger sit-down.   Was it worth the wait? Not exactly. Worth coming again? Nah. What about first timers? Sure!

VdTrC2sHch3HVXnt0gQB1Q.text: What a special and excellent restaurant! The wide array of options for food, more focused on burgers were spectacular with each unique style.  It's nostalgic of seeing Gordon grow on his TV shows, where he shares his passion for food!.. this restaurant definitely satisfied the fix of trying his restaurant. It is a good sized location and centrally located in the area of Planet Hollywood and the Miracle Mile Shops.   For drinks I opted for Iced Tea as I was just stoked to be able to try the burger. For burgers I tried three in the mix including the hog burger and the Fish & Crisps burger which were delightful, but my main one that I ordered and devoured was: *Farmhouse Burger* with added mushrooms. For french fries I decided to get the best of both worlds: truffle parmesan and the chips with curry sauce. The burger was cooked to perfection and was magnificent and fries were appetizing, loved it all!   I highly recommend Gordon Ramsey Burger as a fantastic option when in Vegas. The service was great, ambiance was wonderful, and very, delicious juicy burgers!

9BtSPbg_xA_CT_FErBbEdg.text: Food and the customer service was amazing. Me and my business partners came here yesterday after a week of meetings we had. Our service was amazing and super kind to us. It was our first time dinning in. We started off with the Duck poppers and the Burnt Ends poutine. Duck poppers was good but thought there would be some duck meat in it but it was still good. Both me and business partners agree that the Burnt Ends poutine was really good with the bacon gravy. It could had maybe use a little more salt for the gravy but it was fine. We all had the Hog burger and I would say it's was soo good. We had a hard time eating it due to it was so y'all but hey that didn't stop us from enjoying it. With the BBQ pork and onions and the pork Patty wrap with bacon really kill it. After our meal we feel like we where going to be in a food coma and that felt so good.  Customer service: 5/5 Cleanness: 5/5 Food: 4.5/5 Atmosphere: 5/5  Thank you again to our server ( forgot her name ) for giving us a amazing time for our first being there. Would be back next year. Hope we have you as our server again if you're still there.

6Fi7h08CCxoPYU-xAXt4pg.text: The only way to truly tell you about my experience here is to do it firsthand. Easily one of the better burgers I've had in my life. The wait is worth it!   We started out with the Burnt Ends Poutine, which was pretty good. We just found it to be a little salt. However, the main course didn't disappoint. I got the Forest Burger and OMG. The duck bacon makes this burger what it is. The meat was cooked and seasoned perfectly. Definitely will be visiting this place in the near future.  P.S: They supposedly use Creek Stone beef, which is halal

42FOCqz-ZzOyKODG-7AFFw.text: Amazing, I wanted to try everything as it was coming by. You can't go wrong with what you get. We ended up ordering two apps. Can't remember what they were but they were amazing and the burgers are really good.

xKvpNC_Gl_kBD1ZOkIE1cg.text: I hate to say it, but GR Burger didn't really live up to the standards that I held it to. It was far from bad, it just didn't blow my mind away like I thought it would. For appetizers, we got the duck poppers and fries. First and foremost, what duck was there? The poppers were definitely 95% fried bread and 5% duck but alas, I didn't expect much of them to begin with. As for the fries, they weren't bad but they're not my style of fries and are obviously more akin to "chips" from the UK than my ideal thin pommes frittes soaked in duck fat.  As for the burgers, my friend ordered the foie gras burger and I ordered the turducken, both medium rare of course. The burgers were great, but I think I liked the foie gras a little more as the turducken was a little sweet and I prefer my burgers to be on the savory side. So why the three stars? In addition to the average apps (though the sauces that accompanied them were great), the bread that came with the burgers was nothing special. And I know the meat matters more, but so do the buns! All in all, GR Burger is a good spot but I feel like there's better options on the Strip.

wrCpeZ43w-XNMCCWLjZdIg.text: What I ate: Hell's Kitchen Burger Visit Date: February 28, 2019 First time? Yes.  Going to Gordon Ramsey Burger Vegas is like going to a club. There's "bouncer" service and they open the rope divider to let you in. This is too fancy, Gordon.  I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger and my friend and I shared the sweet potato fries. The burger is served with asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes, and jalapeno aioli. The spice profile was subtle, but the roasted flavor made the burger. I ordered my burger medium well, but I would recommend going with medium for these burgers. By the time it got to our table it was a little bit dry.   The sweet potato fries were served topped with powdered sugar. It was like eating funnel cake. I'm a fan. It also came with a sweet dipping sauce that was a little much so I didn't use it.  The restaurant is part of the casino floor in Planet Hollywood and is "open air" (indoors but no dividing walls). Surprisingly it did not smell smoky.

ZdjCKatErv0vgwa5J6zxpg.text: This was my second time eating at Burger. Loved it so much the first time that I had to come back and bring friends. I ordered the Hog Burger as the server said it was a menu favorite. I asked for it to be well done and server advised me it would still be a bit pink. The others I was with ordered different beef burgers.  The Hog Burger came out looking great. Cut it in half and it definitely looked pinker than I thought however I am not used to eating pork burgers and I am at a GR restaurant so I thought this was the bit pink the server was talking about. I was only able to eat half the burger as it was HUGE. After eating, I immediately felt VERY FULL borderline sick. The feeling did not subside and Fast forward 2 hours, everything I ate that night ..... came up.  I'm terribly disappointed that eating at a GR restaurant  and the food gave me food poisoning.   The beef burgers, fries and sticky toffee pudding ordered by the others I was with was all delicious and well worth it.   I hope the next time I visit a GR restaurant, I have a better experience.

XqziAMmLVerHbYBYx7KN6A.text: My younger sister wanted to try out the burger so we dropped by this place. I was worried about the line at first, but it wasn't that bad. There is a sign that said for those with party of three or more to check in with the hostess. My younger sister checked us in and the wait was 10-15 minutes only. We were seated at a wobbly table. By the time my older sister joined us, we were ready to order. It was all about timing.  We all ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger with different sides. There were the Kettle Chip Nachos, Just Fries, and Beer Battered Onion Rings.  The Hell's Kitchen Burger is amazingly good! I ordered it cooked medium rare.  The Burger: The buns were soft and have sesame seeds on the top. They will ask you how you want the meat cooked. A tip I learned from the radio is to ask them about the pink level of the meat. (Medium = show pinkness in the meat). The waitress mentioned they grind their own beef.  I liked the jalapeno and avocado in the burger. It is one of the less sodium filled burger I ever had and it was quite enjoyable. Usually I would put a lot of mayo in my burger. Not this one. The flavoring was already delicious. I was full after finishing it.  I'm also a fan of the Kettle Chip Nachos. The chips is crunchy and at the same time soft from the cheese.  I did not enjoy the beer batter onion rings. The first one didn't taste fresh since when I took the first bite, it wasn't burning the top of your roof mouth hot. About half of the onion rings were similar. The second onion ring, has oil saturated towards the part where it probably rested until it got scooped up for this order. I would not order the rings again.  I tried the Just Fries and they tasted fresher than the rings. They aren't as salty as other fries, which is how I like my fries.  Overall, my sisters and I enjoyed the burgers. I would come again, only for the burger. If I could, I would give this place a 3.5 star rating.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer batter Onion Rings

jR3IHpkBWTMNChIw2du7DQ.text: Been to this place a total of three times, I will most likely never go back and I seriously question if I will ever frequent a Ramsay establishment again. Never say never, but right now, I'm not feeling it. The first two times we were say right away because I am a Diamond Total Rewards member(meaning I've wasted a lot of money on gambling with little return, but I'm a Diamond). The third time they seemed perturbed at having to seat anybody let alone me and my guest. Then they say us at a regular table instead of a total rewards table, so that was upsetting but I didn't falter, I kept trying to make it a good dinner. I am not a rich person, I spend my tax return every year on my vacation because otherwise I'd never get one. I understand that most people just go on vacation and spend whatever because they have it to spend, I am not that person. Nor do I drop over $100 on a meal on a whim for just two people. The last two times I went I had the same thing, a Vegetable Hummus started, the Truffle Parmesan Fries and the standard Backyard Burger that ended up being a garden salad on a bun. The fries were good, the food was great the first time around but the last it was just meh. I felt like I was being treated less important because I was clearly a rube tourist that wasn't a VIP. In other words, I was poor and not worth their time. The room is crowded even without people at the tables, so I am unsure who designed it, but it should be noted that they did a poor job. When I go to Vegas every year I always do one place that is a little out of my price range to maybe make me feel like I'm not in the lower class that I am. Now because of financial circumstances I may not make it in 2019, but in 2020 I plan to go and a Ramsay restaurant will not be on my list of places to try. I am giving this a 3-star because the food was ok, I do recommend always trying a place yourself to see if you can get a different experience. You know, just to be sure for yourself. I sent this review to Ramsay inc or whatever it's called, didn't expect a response, and did not get one so they'll never know how they ruined my vacation, but thems the breaks I guess. Here is my full video review: youtu.be/Z02cWmt9WXc

wObK3b7bu6indo1wS4sBhg.text: In the wasteland of tourist traps lining the strip this place is an oasis!!! The burgers and fries are world class. The shakes are even better! There is often a long line (the bar has open seating if there is a seat available you can skip the line and enjoy the full menu without the wait). I promise the wait is worth it!!!

S5meVYoeCl3j0yjGlwqWMg.text: Fantastic atmosphere, drinks and of course burgers. When we arrived the line was rather long but we were seated within 15 minutes so no worries there. I'm kind of boring so I went with the backyard burger which is basically an American style burger but wow was it amazing. The beef was juicy, cooked perfectly and the vegetables were fresh and amazing. We had an order of fries, definitely large enough to share FYI.

A1cqaM61T3_QYUoLmIcsxg.text: Was recommended by a friend and boy was he right. From the moment I stepped in the, the hostess Ms. Zeleida, greeted us, let us know there would be a few minute wait time, however,  got us seated immediately. She was very efficient, proffesional, and had excellent customer service. The server was aswell excellent, the good was amazing. I have to give this place inside the PH 5 stars all the way. Just how a friend refered me her, i will as well try to convince others of how good this place is. The service and the food will make you come again.

GuRNytTv0M9JDQWRmlAylA.text: Favorite burger place ever! The nachos are a must! The Oreo creme brulee shake is fantastic! Each of us had different burgers and they were all excellent.

cOqTZcybgNnAFVgkdS4kLw.text: I normal don't write reviews but this i have to.Service was great 5 stars.the food had flavor BUT was not fresh and I'm sure Mr Ramsay would not be thrilled knowing his name is serving that food. I know I should've said something but when your out on that las vegas strip for a bit and hungry as heck who would you jus want to eat. Burger was barely warm and fries were stale if it wasn't for the chipotle ketchup I probably would've said something it did take a little bit to long also  so. my bill was about $65 for 2 people that's about the norm i guess in vegas but I've could've gone to in and out burger and it be cheaper and fresh.

0S9istAXtP8iJeExOAgsOQ.text: Long wait, mediocre at best food. Overpriced for what you get and restaurant employees indifferent to you. I don't think they're concerned if you're satisfied or not, there's a line at the door waiting for your table.

G4P1bcD9ze6W1no61_mn7A.text: OMG!!!  This place was soooooo good!!!  I'm not a huge fan of burgers, but I am a fan of Gordon Ramsay so I was willing to try with hubby.  We had the Hells Kitchen burger & Fries with Curry Sauce.  Absolutely delicious.  We would go back!  I did see children in this restaurant, but I'm still saying it's not good for children because I'm not a fan of children in Vegas.  Too much for them to be exposed to at such a young age.

3nmHFFz2yN5n6P2HikxcFQ.text: The service was horriblr. 1st they texted me for a table for 5 i checked in and then they forgot about my party and said we did not make it on time. When the hostess told us they were setting up the table. Then we ordered our food and they did noy bring our truffle fries or onion rings until we asked for them because we were almost done with our meal! Although they wete eventually comped it was horrible service and ruined a birthday lunch.

5_1z5URq1-D961BTX3FaOw.text: We recently stayed at the Planet Hollywood, and ended up eating at Gordon Ramsay Burger twice. We all enjoyed our meals, and service was excellent (although it did take a bit longer to get our food on our second visit). The burgers were cooked just right, and the onion rings are so delicious! We will definitely eat here again next time we're in Vegas. A bit pricey, but everything on the Strip is expensive.

6eu7THgOnLcciNGW-ShwtA.text: Great food, any burger can sub with chicken too. Truffle fries great an our waiter was very responsive. A bit of a wait so be prepared.

pOBrY1qKhECTQIo41yRfeg.text: Ordered a farmhouse burger and took an hour and 20 mins to get it to my table. Never coming back

LQly24M-g_oLRLjBoOM8eg.text: Had to see what the hype was about.  It was better than average but nothing mind blowing or life changing.  Presentation wise the burger looked perfect.  It tasted excellent.  Price was expensive but you are paying for the name.  French fries were expensive unless it was all you can eat.  The Big Dawg was huge and very tasty.  Be prepared to wait some time before your food arrives.  It is not McD's.

HUcPpCW8tbG5hwcaqJQp8g.text: Came into this spot with high hope and buy they didn't disappoint. I had the Hells Kitchen Burger and it was by far the best burger I've ever had. I tried the truffle fries as well and they were also amazing! I couldn't be more happy with the service I had either. Our server was amazing and fast. Best bite I had in Vegas!

w0NGO5nZhZyXWL7aV7RqFQ.text: This is my favorite place to get a burger in Vegas. It's relatively cheap and the arrive is friendly. There is usually a wait and you pay for fries separately. However, the presentation, atmosphere and taste is excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tHp3a94UIywEBI-RzpYBUg.text: My favorite restaurant that we went to.  The burgers were excellent, I got the ultimate cheeseburger as I am not really into fancy goods.   The onion rings were pretty good but the truffle parmesan fries were amazing!  Tried to go again on our last day but we ran out of time and the wait was too long.  Looking forward to going back.

ZJwltIfznnagZwZFvcNmBQ.text: In Vegas for a work thing. The wife and I, being fans of the shows, thought we would try it. The burgers were sensational. The service was great(unlike our Gordon Ramsay Steak experience), the truffle fries were good but not what they could have been. Could hardly taste the truffle oil. Definitely will go again.

vRcf-JkNcug-0YI1pkva5g.text: I started off my review w 5 stars until my food took an hr to get to me. Expect long lines & very snail slow service. On the positive side, the chocolate creme brulee shake & Parmesan fries were fantastic. FYI-burger buns hav a lot of seeds on them.

HQRVQldaCMSgXs7vYx8R6Q.text: Thought it was another chef with his name on a regular burger... best burger I've had. Been coming here every time the last few years.

0Chkat0VRhmXx3hHNxTwfQ.text: I can't even begin to rave enough about this burger.  The wait time here was minimal, we stood in line for ten minutes, tops, and spent that time gaping over the menu on the outside wall.  Once we were seated, we were waited upon in short order, by a friendly server named Guy.  I forgot the name of the burger I got, but it was the once with a fried egg on top (farm burger?  barnyard burger?) and it was exquisite.  I like my burger medium rare, and usually I struggle to get a place to cook it for me medium rare, but this one came out right at the perfect temperature.  It was juicy, and flavorful, and all the accoutrements included upon it were scrumptious, also.  The fried egg was perfectly fried (overcooked eggs are a huge no-no for me) and the yolk was velvety, and rich.  Just an all around excellent burger.  The fries were okay, the onion rings were okay.  For those you are provided with a few sauces, one it a curry flavored ketchup, which lo and behold tastes like curry.  There is also a chipotle ketchup, which was tasty, but I didn't get much chipotle out of it.  The third is a cheddar ranch which was mindblowingly out of this world.  I would have ordered more fried to get more of this cheddar ranch.  It tastes like ranch dressing, without the acidic finish, instead replaced with a creamy smooth cheese flavor.  I've never had a ranch quite like this, and I lament that I will probably never find a comparable copycat recipe.  Overall the burger was worth the price, really tasty, cutesy restaurant, good service...a good experience for the low to mid budget gordon ramsay fan.

yE3u97yNQCZ2Yyk_9-xwKg.text: The burgers are worth coming for. The hellfire wings don't taste that great not enough sauce on them tastes pretty bland, the fries ugh biggest disappointment of the night. Super thick starchy and not even crispy literally ended up not eating any of the fries ordered because they were way too thick. Tried telling the waiter, didn't look like he cared said it was something scientific to do with how the fries were made.

qrhqtPRA_-iLBwVdjYcxSA.text: The burgers are over priced and nothing special they lack flavor and small for $16.00 without fries. The shakes are good but wouldn't get a burger from there again. Gordon Biersch has much better burger.

V7mUuMDL4HSlq7FtY90png.text: Great ambiance and fantastic burgers!  The decor and flames are great too!

ZH6Mv-_o3oA87KHA7UGI7A.text: Gordon Ramsay is a chef I enjoy watching. So while in Vegas I made it a must to go to his place. If your in a party of 2 or more the wait was 30 minutes. So that goes to show you how popular his place is. Since I was alone I didnt wait at all and sat at the bar.  Service was fast and efficient.  I ordered his wings , blue cheese burger and truffle fries. Let me start off with the wings. Amazing!!! Hot moist and very flavorful. I could have had move if I didnt order the burger and fries lol. The burger was very good also and the sauce was very good. The only poor side for me was the truffle fries . They came out lukewarm and didnt have a great taste to them. But overall a must visit place. Just make sure you bring some money. Not good for the cheap at heart people.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9ETJvEPgd0Ol0bqmjIV-bA.text: So, as I bit down into my Hell's Kitchen Burger, the first thing I notice was the juiciness of my medium patty. The spices dancing over my tongue, teasing my taste buds. That's when the roasted Jalepeno shows up. Pulling my sense back into another realm, taking me back home. Who is waiting there for me? The avocado, nestled gently between patty and melted cheese. Not to be ignored, the roasted tomatoes waited patiently on the asadero slice, patiently waiting thier turn to remind me what bliss is like. Presented to me, all by itself on a lone plate, top bun slightly upturned to display all the tender and juiciness inside, eagerly waiting to be inside of me.   Just when I thought my culinary trip into ecstasy was complete, my golden fries still steaming. Two sides of ketchup await me, both spicy enough to leave just the faintest impression on my senses. The golden slabs of potatoes, patiently await my choice into thier ketchup, but oh.. what is this? Truffle Parmesan Fries, you saucy little minx. How can these golden delights be topped? Oh, my friends, I will tell you. Large, perfectly crisped onion rings. My only regret with the rings, is that none were presented as a ring, a token of undying and committed love.  At long last, I've reached the conclusion into the love tunnel of my taste buds. Escorted though an cornucopia of delight, I found myself not wanting for dessert, for fear of falling into blissful slumber, filled with winged fries and haloed hamburgers.  Buuuuut.. they didn't have Coke. 3 Stars.

MhTCtcClGYKyC-PFmDYfgA.text: Pretty good solid burgers but not extraordinary. The wings were pretty good to start topped with some blue cheese crumbled. The foie gras burger was disappointing, I adore foie gras and pairing it with goat cheese took a lot of it's taste away. The sweet potatoes Fries were well cooked and crispy. I ordered my burger medium well and it was a mistake I should have ordered it medium to keep a nice moisture to the patty, mine turned out very dry.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Foie gras burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wings
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet potato fries

uAjdFL7-AkwDD_JlG0v5YA.text: I was so excited to come here. High reviews on most sites. First off it took forever to get our food! I ordered the Farmhouse burger no cheese. I didn't like it.  We ordered a total of 8 burgers and not one person was impressed.   And no one liked the fries.  Stale and cold.  I don't know if they didn't get them out to the table in time but they were not good. Although,  the server was friendly, he never came back to our table to refill our drinks.  Granted they were busy but there was a lot of servers hanging out by the bar talking.  For what you pay and being Gordon Ramsay I was disappointed.  Bobby Flay is less expensive and so much better. Gordon you should go undercover here!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZzucXpTVdNTQjrtu6FEYRQ.text: My friend suggested we check this place out and warned us the lines would be crazy. Luckily we got there around 4ish for lunch and were seated right away (by the time we left the line was all the way through the casino).   My friend and I decided to split a burger since we had a 9:30 dinner. We ordered the backyard burger and truffle fries. Not only did a friend tell me this place was good but I'll such a Gordon Ramsey fan!!   Anyways, where they lose stars was our waiting time. For 1 burger and an order of fries we waited over 40 min. Larger parties that sat after us were already eating way before our food came out. By the time we got our food we were pretty hangry and not understanding why 1 burger took so long.   In terms of the actual burger it was good. Nothing mind blowing. I've had better burgers in Chicago so I was not super impressed.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DFSufCifomf3q2PmtcKOjw.text: At Gordon Ramsay Burger I tasted the best burger I've ever had: Hell's Kitchen Burger. The bread reminded me of luscious garlic bread, the Patty wasn't condensed, it was a medium cooked Patty when taking a bite of, had airiness to it. I also ordered a caramel butter pecan milkshake and it was smooth, sweet as home milkshake made like how grandma would make it.  My critique is the service was not present. I waited about 15 min to remind for our milkshake which was to be brought at the end of our meal. And then more time again to wait to ask for the bill.  I'd honestly go back again, the burger and fries are really, really good. And then update my review if it's just an anomaly.

kn4G9362OPyXPZ8v8S-RWw.text: I wasn't in the mood for a burger but a friend recommended this place so I went in anyway. Was so happy to see they had food besides burgers, but still wasn't expecting much out of a salad from a burger place. Ordered the shrimp salad and was blown away--it was huge, filling, and flavourful.  I was alone and sat at the bar, received good service, and was happy with everything!

E-2uvahosPSQ8zPCll3kRg.text: Parties more than two, or maybe three..., sign in and they text you when your table is near ready. Otherwise wait in line, which is long, but moves fairly quickly. Drink orders come out fairly fast, but burgers take a while. We were told up to 45 minutes on the burgers, but they came out in under 30, all perfectly prepared.  Burgers: Universally loved. We tried a few varieties, and all were outstanding. I ordered the hog burger, which I never would have guessed was not beef. It appeared impossibly large, but the airy brioche bun makes it far less filling than you would think. Everyone finished their burgers easily, with room for fries, which were also very good. Cocktails were excellent, even compared to today's omnipresent competition with regards to the new Bohemian mixologist culture.  I gave it four stars, as I told my family it wasn't the best burger I've ever had. When they asked me to name a better burger, I couldn't do it, but was certain I must have had a better one at some point. This is place you would be happy to experience, even if you aren't a celebrity chef nerd like myself.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SPIfp_WLrL6nKLGNNZegHg.text: If you have Diamond status or VIP use it here as it will get you seated in 5-10 minutes instead of waiting for an hour or two. The lines are pretty long on the weekend, but if you're here during the week hit this place up then. It's absolutely delicious and worth it!   Great vibe here with that amazing fire wall! Our waiter Andre was excellent, quick, and very friendly. He was able to help us pick out the burgers we wanted and the beverages that best suited our meals. The onion rings are just fabulous! That batter is light and so crispy plus the dipping sauces are spot on with flavor.   I got the farmhouse burger and added spicy mayo. I ordered mine medium and it came out just perfectly. I was pleasantly surprised at just how well it was cooked and seasoned. This burger was messy but sooooo delicious.   My friend got the forest burger and said the duck bacon was a highlight. Definitely something you don't want to miss I got a lovely blueberry antioxidant cocktail that was so refreshing after a hot Las Vegas day. If you can ask for Andre as your server!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blueberry Antioxidant
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside of the farmhouse burger

urzJNWMcPn_LHJvHyimvWw.text: Stop by bc it's Gordon Ramsay. Monday night at 10pm and there was a line - we waited about 30-40 minutes to be seated - they don't take reservations (I tried). They will seat you faster if you're willing to sit at the bar. Our waiter mumbled and said something while he turned his head and walked away. All night as he refilled our cups and gave us our food as he mumbled something. We really wanted to hear what he was saying. We started with the duck poppers - they don't taste like duck. I couldn't find the duck. Just cheese and bell pepper (not spicy) Not sure what I was expecting but it was just cheese and breaded bell pepper to me. Hell's Kitchen burger was juicy and cooked perfectly- but I thought it was bland and needed more flavors or something (jalapenos are a nice kick) My husband had the hog burger - he said it was okay - the meat is packed in there dense. Onion ring tasted oily to me. We went bc it's GR - and you want to go bc it's his restaurant- but for us it's a one time deal. The food and service was mediocre, but the ambiance is really nice for a date.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen - it&#39;s okay
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duck poppers. Didn&#39;t taste the duck  Not spicy either. Cheesy fried poppers.

mVxXb9-aPvEKDaUH4ekt_g.text: Really excited to try GRB but it came up a bit short in my expectations. I ended up ordering the Farmhouse burger which was a bit too enormous to eat with fitting it in my mouth. See from my photos. If gluttony is your liking you may be in heaven. The burger was on the better side of OK but this place has been so hyped up so I was expecting more. The flavour was OK. You could tell that the meat was fresh not frozen.  Overall is was a 3.5/5 it wasn't bad just it wasn't exceptional. I was actually more impressed with the Parmesan truffle fries. These were damm delicious.   If you come here and have no special status (Caesars cut the line status) expect to wait a long time in line. We were fortunate we didn't have to wait in line but there must have been 25 people in line when we were there.   Service was good. No issues here.   Maybe I need to try a few more items on the menu. I'd say give it a chance but don't come in here with huge expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These burgers ain&#39;t cheap. Food in Vegas you must expect to pay more though!
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Those truffle fries up close
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle parm fries

S90YABx9NBCHN5buMPtffg.text: This is the best and most boojie burger I've had. I don't really have any other upscale burger to compare to but I know my tastebuds were dancing as I took a bite of my burger. I decided to try the pork chop and applesauce burger. It has a pork patty, dubliner cheese, branston pickles, apple braised pork shank, and cabbage apple slaw. It was heavenly! The pork patty and pork shank was cooked perfectly with the right amount of flavor. I'm not a huge fan of cabbage but I loved it with the apple slaw mix.   My friend and I also shared the Parmesan truffle fries and onion rings as appetizer. I highly recommend sharing the fries for sure because it's a huge serving!   We also got drinks. I got the Chombolita and my friend got the New Old Fashion. Their drinks I find more on the sweeter side.   The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the wait. Get there early for dinner! We got there about 7:30pm and waited in line for a good 45 min. The burgers also takes 30 min to make...so don't come here starving.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork chop and applesauce burger
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

1U1HCAxXtomeyV8l9bBJlQ.text: Hands down the best burgers in Vegas ... well worth the long lines the milk shakes And wings are to die for ... unbelievable taste and quality one of the best over all places in Vega s

UXWINEeuxFspFxQbicTWxg.text: I'm never really blown away by burgers. It's certainly not on the top of my list of favorite things.. but it's Gordon Ramsay, so we had to try it while we were in Vegas. & I gotta say, it was probably the best burger I've ever had!  I got the turducken burger and it blew my mind. It's definitely worth the wait in line!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turducken burger!

A-5-cgoQGzb8Zv2UCIWtRA.text: So this is where you get a $20 burger and feel good about it.  First off, don't fear the line waiting outside to get in the place. If you're a party of four or more then make sure you check in before waiting in line.  Excellent beer selection that changes regularly and the serving staff is friendly, professional and knows their product knowledge.  I had the Specialty Hog burger with outstanding onion rings. Sick Japanese boy coworker had Tomato soup with a baby grilled cheese sandwich that actually helped him feel better. Other coworker had Spicy Burger with jalapeno on the side and it looked great.  Cherry Wheat by Sam Adam was chilled to the proper temperature (cold).  It was a good experience and I thought a decent value for the creativity and location.  Definitely try it.

SgHBxPTNFwhHe_6bNNHSwg.text: It was my 3rd time coming here and it's been pretty solid! Good quality burger for a fair price. They have a line on the side for small parties of 1 or 2. We only waited about 10-15 minutes for a table. Larger parties of 3 or more would put their name on a list. We had a group of 3 couples and it was an hour to sit together or 10-15 for separate, so we opted just to eat separated since we were on a time crunch. I got the forest burger and really enjoyed it. It had a great balance of flavors between the mushrooms, cheese, and bacon. It was a good burger, but no the best I've ever had. My husband got the farm burger and it was heavier tasting with the egg and bacon. Definitely has more of a comforting feel to it. The truffle fries were good but a little on the salty side. It was quite a huge serving (makes sense because it was $12) and we couldn't finish it.

NnJL5BMn9bvJptZaleFNlQ.text: Disappointed. I thought it would be amazing but i could have gotten the same quality at a Applebee's or Chili's. The burger came out cold without the sides we ordered. They were good about replacing it however I was not blown away at all. The onion rings were greasy. Not the good greasy but the " I feel sick" greasy.   Take a picture in front of the sign and go somewhere else to eat

ip7n5jPf4qpcKfOWuJPciA.text: Price: way overpriced for burgers. If you take out "Gordon ramsay" from the name then burgers would be average.   Hells kitchen burger: it's great. Meat was juicy and tender. Size was pretty small regardless of the price. I liked the sesame seeds on the bun (added a subtle flavor)   Fries: small portion but tasted very good. Nice crunch but still soft inside.   Their ketchup is organic or handmade or something because it tasted much different than the store ketchup we are used to.

IVuEb7KcNBdUQ0jVhhyESQ.text: I would like to say that I don't ever leave reviews but I'll make an exception in this case. This was our first trip to Las Vegas and being from New York which is another extremely busy city we expected nothing but the best. The food here was simply delicious, but I was truly impressed by the customer service, the ambiance of the restaurant was breathtaking, the presentation of the plates were amazing, but what I was most impressed about was the staff, each member I saw was helpful and polite, I even saw a manager walking around and helping clear tables and he was passing by, but the precision of everything they did, the speed in which they responded to customers was mind blowing. If I could give more that 5 starts to this restaurant I would. I will definitely recommend this place visit here again.

sQy-c7JLS-MJULRTCi4Q1A.text: Sat very quickly and got a great booth. Starter: duck poppers, came at a little colder than I would like in a popper.  They were Very bland and not even remotely spicy. I would not recommend. Mains: blue cheese burger and Hell's Kitchen burger, awesome! Top burger I've ever had. Perfectly cooked! Perfectly delicious! I would highly recommend both!

hwSFdELY-dig2XdpNlkjpw.text: I am still dreaming about the best burger I have ever had!  It's hard to choose from all of the wonderful descriptions on the menu.  I went with the Ultimate Cheeseburger and it did not disappoint! Combined with the Truffle Parmesan Fries, is now on my list of Top 5 meals ever!

e8OOzUjwkTL-33yYgGJHzw.text: As the vegetarian at the table I ordered the poutine and an Oreo Creme brulee milkshake. I liked the milkshake but sent the fries back because they looked and tasted gross. There were no cheese curds, the dish was warm not hot, and the gravy was thick and looked like...unappetizing.   Four stars because this IS a burger place and all the meat eaters at the table loved their burgers!
