hpcKC0eL7UC7mP36ZoWLPg.text: This place keeps up with the hype it has in the vegas. Their vegetarian burger was really delicious and juicy. The ketchup was freshly made. I will go with 5 star and it is worth going.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4lDmlHJzGKE2zX6sa92i7A.text: This was my second visit to this restaurant and let me tell you this place never disappoints. I just love this place and the food here.  Food- Finger licking good Staff- Friendly  Service- Great Prices- Reasonable

gLWChd6RjnmsAg43TfUPqQ.text: - We come here everytime we are in Vegas. Best burgers ever with a reasonable price! - Always a line- come at an off time for ease of waiting, but worth waiting for to even try if you are skeptical  - Better to come with a small group of of 3 or more. The sign tells you to let the hostess know and they will take your phone number and text you when your table is ready. It looks like they do this so because there is always a line if you have 1 or 2 people. Since most customers eat in pairs or alone they just have to wait for a table to open. We get our table within 30 min and the servers are great. -BEST PARMESAN FRIES EVER~ HOUSE MADE KETCHUP IS THE BEST THING EVER MADE. TASTES SOOOOOOOOOO GOOD! YOU HAVE TO GET HIS FRIES!!!!

dpLa7Z_MZC6DExcA-yuziw.text: Got the blue burger at the bar. Ordered it medium (comes out pink but not raw). They brought it out after about 20 minutes. The burger looked great (see photo). As for the taste, I was underwhelmed. Given this burger is about the blue cheese, I was surprised how little blue cheese flavor came through. Certain bites showcased the cheese and figgy jam nicely, but too many did not. Like the cheese, I wanted more jam than what was provided.   The meat itself was okay. If you want a juicer burger, you may want to try it medium rare. For a gourmet burger, I found it fairly generic.   The bun was solid. Not spectacular, but fresh, tasty, and the multicolored sesame seeds were nice.   I paid ~$21 total with tax and tip. My burger was $16.   Takeaways:  -if I could do it again I'd order the forest burger (I'm a fan of mushrooms and bacon on burgers, and the duck bacon sounded good) -worth trying for the experience, and the menu has several burger options, but don't expect to be blown away

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0XHeunvZg6cxFyMMbhKlyQ.text: So lets start with the venue. The restaurant has a clean look and feel that tilts towards a group setting or even a casual date. Service is great, the decor is eye catching, and the music is not in your face.   Now onto the food:  Truffle fries: Straight fire. But ask for extra ketchup.   Sweet potato fries: Yes I know the name says sweet, but I guess personally most of the time I have sweet potato fries they're not really on the sweet side. These ones also had a layer of sugar on top which really gave it that side, so personally I wasn't a fan and would've just struck to the truffle.   Forest Burger: I am a big mushroom person which is why I was leaning towards this one, and I will say that the mushrooms had a TON of flavor. The burger overall was pretty tight. I will say that there was a unanimous decisions that all of the burgers we had were slacking on saucing. So it really tasted like a patty and then your veggies on top. Similarly, i'd recommend asking for an extra sauce.  Finally the milkshakes were very very underwhelming. They only had three flavors and they weren't thick at all. I like True diner style milkshakes and this wasn't that. Of the three flavors I would recommend the butterscotch, even though I typically go for oreo flavored.

qunRgnUjWGIx5Xn1rYaAfw.text: Hands down one of the best burgers I've ever eaten! My boyfriend and I went to Gordon Ramsay's Burger on a Friday night. We waited about 10 minutes in line to be seated. This restaurant pretty much always has a wait so I recommend coming early for lunch if you don't want to wait in line. Service was good and I like that they have a wide variety of burgers to choose from. My boyfriend and I both enjoyed our burgers very much! He ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger with asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, avocado, roasted tomatoes and jalapeno aioli. I ordered the farmhouse burger with dubliner cheese, mangalitsa bacon and fried egg. We also enjoyed the truffle parmesan fries! On our last visit we got to sit at the bar next to the kitchen - if you are a True foodie and want an inside look I would recommend asking to sit there.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Parmesan Fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger

zbUX7uPkzJNSraA3z61juw.text: While all of our burgers were exceptionally delicious, what really stood out on was the parmesan truffle fries. They are exquisite!   It was a lengthy wait to get in, close to an hour, but the food was worth waiting for, the staff were friendly, knowledgeable and knew the menu inside and out.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QoobT9KfajcXUZk5E7SBvQ.text: This is normally my go to restaurant whenever I am Vegas but that has changed after my experience last night. When we first got seated, everything seemed to be going well. However, that soon took a turn for the worst. We had four people in our party and ended up waiting an hour for food! Yes... an hour for burgers! The server and manager both came over and apologized for the inconvenience and comped the meal, however the bad service continued. Once the meals came, we realized that my husband did not receive pickles on his and one of my guests did not receive her meal.  She had to wait a few minutes before she got hers! When we asked the server about it, he replied "Well you are getting it for free." To top it all off, we had to ask for simple things like water and lemonade refills. Its as if the service went down the window bc the server assumed we would not tip. So finally, the server came over to ask us if we wanted dessert. I replied yes and once we received the desserts, we got a bill too! To my surprise, i was under the impression that the entire meal was comped. When I asked the server about it, he replied "i honestly didnt think you would want dessert since you have been here a long time." Are you kidding me? I couldnt even make this up! He stated he should have told us that WE were responsible but did think about it. So i prepared to pay but then he stopped by again and said that it would be comped as well. I have never experienced this sort of service here before and wont again. I refuse to come back.

q3xN-1r-9eq20GEA7Uq5Kw.text: This is our 1st visit to this eatery.  While the food was good (had the stout burger & wife tried the farmhouse with the onion rings side order), disappointed that overall service was sub-par for this pricey eatery by Gordon Ramsey.  First, when we approached the hostess booth, my wife mentioned we had a reservation (likely not needed for lunch or none at all  as many tables were available), one of the hostess named Kat or Kathy not only didn't care to ask for the reserved name or time but also rudely pointed us to a close-by table instead of walking us to a specific table; as there were 2 available next to each other, we guess it was up to us to pick one.  Then, after we sat down for about 10 min without a waiter / waitress, we had to ask a for one.  Dawn, our waitress, shortly came & told us to wait for a little longer; we figured her section was busy, but felt that could have been better to inform us early so we didn't have to ask for 1 or waited a while; after the food came out, however, we liked that Dawn did come to check on us twice to see if all was well.  Any rate, before leaving I decided to inform a manager named Joe that we were not impressed with the overall service, esp. an unfriendly welcome by a hostess; so, likely won't come back again.  Had we known about this lackluster service, would have gone to Mesa Grill to try for another well-known & quality burger there    The Gordon Fish & Chips, on the contrary while not a full-service eatery & less pricey, we were impressed with the attentiveness & friendliness by the staff there & the food, of course, was very good as well.

eXSjOhG4EaVpP9IAu2GkmQ.text: Hells kitchen burger was really flavorful and delicious the spicy wings were also really good and the truffle French fries were great! Definitely worth the wait .

vA7hbau9ATVqOANY78Ihqw.text: When we were in Vegas, we knew we had to try at least one of Gordon Ramsay's restaurant this time around. We are extremely happy we got the chance to try his infamous burger joint. We were worried about the long wait especially since we were going on a Sunday, it was a holiday weekend, and there was a marathon event happening later that day so Vegas was even more crowded than normal. We found a phone number on Google (the Yelp phone number is just to make reservations to OTHER restaurants since this restaurant doesn't take reservations only walk-ins) and they said the wait was only about 20-30 minutes. We hustled our way to PH from Venetian and surprisingly enough we only had to wait 30 minutes in line! When you do come here do expect to spend some time here so make sure you don't have any immediate plans. We waited in line for about 30 minutes, ordered our food fairly quickly upon sitting (I recommend you look up the menu and decide what you want to order while in line), and then wait about 15-20ish minutes for your food to arrive. The food does take some time to prepare, but it is worth the wait! We ordered the farmhouse burger, the hog burger, sweet potato fries, and oreo creme brulee milkshake. Everything about the meal was delicious and very filling. The burgers are HUGE which makes sense for its price point. It is definitely on the higher end for a burger, but it is bigger and has extra flavor profiles that make up for it. We split the burgers so we were able to try both. Both were delicious and super flavorful. We both prefer the farmhouse burger slightly more because it is more of a classic burger that is extremely well done, super juicy, not overly seasoned, plus who doesn't love a fried egg on top! The hog burger was very tasty as well if you are wanting to try something different. This burger is MASSIVE packed with a ton of meat. The patty, pulled pork, and bacon all compliment each other, one was not overpowering the other. If you are a huge meat lover, I would definitely recommend this to you. The patty was not as juicy as the farmhouse, but it didn't have to be since it had the other flavors from the pulled pork and bacon to enhance it. I would definitely recommend the creme brulee milkshake as well, unless you are not a huge sweets fan. It is pretty dense and sweet, but if you love creme brulee and oreos, this is the drink for you.

ypLi7IC7LJH2pOIfX2vz5A.text: Tasty burger - hands down the finest cheeseburger I have ever had the pleasure of eating. Also, the sweet potato fries were so different! They came dusted in powder sugar and with a honey-based dipping sauce, and they were divine! I loved the sweet variation - it was like a perfect dessert to my burger! I'll definitely try to replicate this at home!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zNXtNtVVUOqZwn-eBcKpCg.text: The burgers were really good and cooked like requested. But nothing above average really. We got the regular fries and they were AWFUL, cold and hard. The music was way too loud, you can barely have a conversation. I was really looking forward to eating here and it was nothing but mediocre food.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate cheeseburger

qc_9V-xwReqZbMaSaJcOtQ.text: Gordon really needs to eat the food here.  4/5 felt the burger was dry which we felt was due to the bun being dry and so thick.  Our meat was ordered and delivered medium to medium well.  Fries were dry and barely average.  The onion rings were ok but the batter is so thick it was mostly batter with a sliver of an onion.  My 16 year old loves Gordon and watches his shows so we had to try one of his restaurants.  We are confident we would win a contest if matched up against these burgers.

9ykxHnvlKQQsH0HdTTBLJQ.text: It was a pleasant experience dining here. We got seated right away on a Sunday afternoon, 4:30pm, as there was no line (yet). The food service is a little on the slow side (took 15 min to bring out our appetizer and another 15-20 min to bring out our burgers) but it's due to the fact that the kitchen cooks everything to order and they take their time to ensure high quality. Plus I asked my patties to be cooked well-done which they did perfectly!  Blue burger: 5 stars! Loved the complex flavors! Hells Kitchen burger: also 5 stars, but I prefer the Blue burger more if I had to choose between the two.  Chips and curry dip: 5 stars... super fresh potato wedges, big portion, and delicious yellow curry dipping sauce.  Worth the hype but I probably won't wait in line for this. Come during the downtime!

3v137pyYKUZGh25_rFqq5Q.text: I'm pretty disinclined to trust celebrity chefs, no matter how "good" they are supposed to be; reality television is not my go-to arbiter of taste when it comes to food. But we were hungry & it's Vegas, so we moseyed over to Gordon Ramsay Burger because we heard good things and I was left pleasantly surprised. Although it's open to the walkway / casino nearby, it's not too loud or distracting in there. We saw lots of families while we were there.   The menu is extensive and there are LOTS of options for food. Our burgers both came perfectly medium-rare & very juicy, but not overpacked with toppings so that it dripped or fell apart when you ate it. I didn't have to use my fork once. I'm not picky about my food and feel messiness is part of the burger-eating experience, but it's nice when food feels balanced & thoughtfully arranged. I had the Hell's Kitchen Burger which was a little spicier than I had assumed it would be (because I always assume 'spicy' is really not that spicy, unless it's a Thai restaurant or something) but not overpowering, but a lot of the burger options were interesting & I had a hard time choosing! The truffle parmesan fries were good too, crispy & flavorful with just the right amount of saltiness from the parm. I'm not a huge truffle parmesan fry person (it's like the lowest common denominator of 'fancy' pub food, it's practically ubiquitous for gastropubs) but these were good.  I'd definitely recommend showing up before lunch because as we were eating, the wait became exceptionally long & nobody got time for that. Even after lunch hour, the wait becomes so congested that I'm not sure it significantly lessens up. This is a good option if you're looking for a nice-but-casual lunch or trying to feed a group; or if you're a family with kids.

aXeDOC1AwxSvrQqL_BK5uw.text: This is a mixed review based on two different burgers and the overall experience my wife and I had while in Vegas recently.    Atmosphere 3/5.  The place is clean and well decorated. We were at a high top table next to the glass window and flames and so that was fun.    Service 1/5. Of the many places we ate at in Vegas, the service here was by far the worst. Our drinks were never filled, even when we asked. It took over 45 minutes to get our food once it was ordered and not a single person stopped by to check on us during that time, even to let us know it was taking a little longer.  The server wasn't friendly, energetic, or even seemed to want to be there.  A huge turndown for such a respected place.    Food 2/5. I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger with hopes that it would have some flavor with the roasted tomato, jalapeno, and avocado.  The burger itself was extremely flavorless and the toppings didn't add anything to the burger either including the sauce that was supposed to be good.   The sweet potato fries were fine.  Nothing special.  The dipping sauce was good though.  I would have preferred them a little bit more crispy.  The reason this wasn't a 1 star was because of the Fish and Chips burger my wife got.  It was actually super good.  The fish was cooked perfectly.  The crispy potato straws were great and the lemon aioli that was on the fish was extremely tasteful.    Unfortunately, I will never go back to a GR burger as it was a sad disappointment.

3N1fR3tYlJsbH1gBkIZQgA.text: So many burger places. So little time.. This place has good burgers.  However, the last couple of times , we've has wrong order issue.  Friendly staff, but just burger mixups..

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DCHFFDYvDsJVQtdlkT3Cjw.text: Visited on 1-6-18. We loved it! A bit of a wait to be seated and for your food. Got the cheese burger and we shared fries. Definitely would recommend and go back.

Ajb1Ei9fPv_R42zWUnt67g.text: Over an hour wait but so worth it.  We were so happy to see they had just added the Impossible Burger Patty to any burger for $6. The fries were good. Our waiter highly suggested the onion rings but they were blah. The Pecan Shake we ordered was so delish.

CmxNwMTRuLLvSOMdvjWA_g.text: My first time here was back in February and there have been some changes since I last came. My recent visit was around 10/16/17 and it was still amazing. Just letting you know now that there will be a line and you will have to wait. My Boyfriend and I were a little disappointed with the Menu changes and it looks like Ramsay did a lot of consolidating on his BURGR menu. The favorites were still on there but the appetizer section was lacking and we didn't order any because of that. BUT YOU DON'T NEED IT- trust me. We both got Burger's (can't remember which ones) and a side of Truffle Fries. It's delicious, and when we advise them we want it cooked Medium Rare you best believe it comes out exactly at that temperature!! This place is amazing and you have to try it at least once if you're skeptical!

7M-_c5maPWv6MR0nmaCMMw.text: This place is awesome lol the seats are comfortable and they don't let you finish a soda before you got a fresh one and the food is unbelievable will behave again and try the forest burger with duck bacon it's the greatest...

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Forest burger

QEJdF-pMhQu0IddfIafe_A.text: Visited restaurant expecting a great dining experienced butafter waiting a long time after ordering, my backyard burger needed seasoning ( the burger patty could have used salt and pepper).  Conversely, the french fries were too salty and were too crisp ( on the border of burnt). This "gourmet" burger and fries are over-rated and way overpriced. Plain old ketchup would have been more appropriate and less salty that the curry and chipotle mixed ketchup preparations they served with the french fries. I had to beg the waiter to come and provide a refill of my beverage...The place was a clip joint!  In and Out with its mass produced burgers and fries are much better prepared and their staff are more courteous.  I was very disappointed with the food and the service, the place was also very noisy, you couldn't hear your dining partner across the table.  Nicole O:  Thank you for your note to me regarding the aforementioned review, the staff person was a shaven headed fellow working about 7:30pm - 9:00 pm on January 18th and he had the section near the register/order computer near the flame window and the booths.  He served the two-person tables.  He gestured rudely to me when I signaled that he come to our table for water, it seemed he was overwhelmed serving the two tables on the sides of ours.    Unfortunately, we will not be returning to Las Vegas for a good while. Truly, I appreciate your offer to return to your restaurant and give it a second chance. Thank you very much and best wishes.

0YQfowOJTqCLjrB0GuIw_w.text: Delicious, perfect simple burgers. The bun and the patty are the stars, as they should be. Our server, Alex, really made the meal enjoyable too. Good people, great food, didn't have to wait more than ten minutes for a table because we beat the 1130am lunch rush.

c3JfQ9k1RC5oWelS5dl8fg.text: Service was great, venue was clean and fun. There is definitely a wait if you come at peak hours. A member of our party was able to bypass the line for us, however.   The burgers are delicious. We all thought the the bun to meat ratio was a little off- but that is just personal preference.

WNwgUhs1RhGuXBTWCSghcg.text: Hands down, this place has THE BEST burgers ever! Delicious, fine burgers that are hard to compete with.  Love this place

ysX5MoI9BGzuTD50RtfBMQ.text: We were so excited to try this place out. There was a 30 minute wait so they gave us a beeper and we went to gamble. When it finally beeped we went to check in and were told the table will be ready shortly. Well...shortly meant 20 minutes! Once we were finally seated we ordered promptly just to wait another 40 minutes for our hamburgers. We were starving. The burgers were pretty good just not spectacular. Looking back I would have just found a nice hamburger joint off the beaten path. Would have been cheaper and just as good if not better and wouldn't have had to wait so long!

rS7HmAkAjKvy__QS256itg.text: Everything has been thought through and works like a well oiled machine. Exotic ingredients like duck bacon bring up the price point. All the food was cooked very well but the flavor profiles didn't WOW me. Skip the mushroom poutine and get the chicken saltimbocca sliders.

ea_1cw0dz_a9wbesh2y5HA.text: (A little later review on this one....)  While I had high hopes for this place, I got to say, I was really disappointed.   I strolled up on a Friday afternoon, a little after 12:45pm  to place a take out order, as I was staying at PH and just wanted to grab something and take it up to my room.    The girls up front were friendly and eager to help, but seemed to be having a problem with swiping their cards and being able to log in to take my order.   They went back and forth between 2 different machines and called over like 3 different people to try.   Eventually they got it figured out and took my order.   I ordered onion rings, (asked for an extra cheddar ranch) and a burger cooked medium rare.   She repeated my order, but neglected my request for an extra ranch, so I kindly asked if she got the extra ranch part.   She said "Oh yah, don't worry"  MMMMMMoK.  So I pay for my order and she tells me it'll be 30 minutes.   I was a little surprised, but was fine with that, hoping that since it was just a single burger and a side that it may come closer to the 20 minute mark.    It's now a few minutes before 1:00pm.    I go off and gamble in the casino a bit and come back at 1:30 thinking that the order should be ready.   I go back to the counter and ask the girl if my order was ready.    She tells me to wait on the side and she'll go check.   She goes off in the back and comes back a minute later and is just having a good time with her friends up there.   She's helping other customers and then talking story again with her co-workers, having a great time.   All the while, I'm just standing there.  5 more minutes go by and I go back up there and kindly ask if she found out if my order was ready because she clearly had no intention of letting me know what's going on.   She tells me "oh yah, they're checking on it".   Oooooooooook, well you could've at least told me something.    Another 5 minutes go by and now I'm just starving already.   Finally after 50 MINUTES, the girl comes up with my food like nothing ever happened.   She tells me thank you and is about to walk away.   I ask her is the extra cheddar ranch in there? and she tells me "Oh, did you want an extra one?"   Uhhhhhh yes please, I already had to ask for it twice when ordering, why not one more time right?    I mean is that a difficult request to get correct?    She gladly gets it for me and I'm on my way back up to grind!    I'm all excited when I get back to my room thinking this meal is going to be hot and delicious......NOT!    No joke guys/gals, the burger and onion rings were not even warm.   Seriously, not even warm at all!   Oh and my burger was almost cooked well done.   On the flip side, Gordon's onion rings are BOMB (even when cold)!    The burger though was super disappointing.    Obviously because it was room temperature and over cooked, but it was also under-seasoned too.   Sooooooo disappointing.     I thought about calling down and letting a manager know about it, but was just over it already.  We went through our apps, sides, and steaks in less than 50 minutes at Gordon Ramsay Steak earlier in the week, and it was amazing.   The Burger joint.......not so much.   So many better options in Vegas.

hGSxQhbfkqPAoWLM1uPNbQ.text: My boyfriend and I ate here for the first time today and we both loved it . I had the Hell's Kitchen burger with bacon my boyfriend had the Farmhouse Burger we both really enjoyed our burger . Service was great too and the wait wasn't to bad , we will different be back here again

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fFcK1zJYLFgpkajw11UPMQ.text: The food was prepared well and presented well, but for some reason everything tasted sweet to me. I'm a low sugar consumption person, so I'm very sensitive to anything sweet: even the the truffle fries tasted sweet. I prefer Umami burger.

hwNJH20kRNq9RD41OiapJg.text: Amazing burger, got there 10 mins before opening on a Sunday, waited a few mins.  Ate the recommended Anniversary burger without sides or appetizers, it was so good.  The price was $22, but compare to other places, it was worth it.

xADOkOiuxg-XHhFr-QN3ig.text: I had high hopes for a good burger,  I have been to all the great burger joints in Las Vegas. I ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger, I ordered it medium rare and it seemed raw to me and under cooked. Maybe next time I should say medium. The patty should be bigger also, it got lost in the toppings. Where is the beef?  The truffle fries were over cooked  and all I got was little pieces not full fries.  I can't believe they serve Pepsi, everybody knows burgers are only good with a ice cold Coca Cola?  As Gordon would say that burger and fries was @ "DONKEY" Sorry Gordon not a happy burger consumer at your joint.

6nqoe5WWvL74WqgrwTUx3A.text: Overrated! A tasty burger but I guess you can't expect to get Gordon Ramsay class meal in 30$

W9ehE0mJIKaUnQayMIBasQ.text: Cool atmosphere, but disappointed my burger was overlooked twice! A little on the pricey side, but maybe cheap for Vegas? I got the Gordon Ramsay burger, even over cooked it was still delicious. The sweet potato fries were the same as anywhere else, there's plenty to share in one order! I didn't care for the sauce that comes with it but the ketchup was good.

aCpyVGOSCut3wDT8ebk9Gw.text: It's a busy place, if you are a party of 2 (or less) you can get seated very quickly. Food was good, we got some good burgers, flavors well put together and the parmigiana truffle fries were also very nice. Service was good. Worth a visit for burger fans.

vSA5H2LlJ5Mnac0lUI4fTw.text: Only good thing about this place was the service, and the truffle fries. We had the blue cheese burger. I love blue cheese, but it had way too much. Honestly all that was tasted was the blue cheese. Would not order again. And we also had the burger with duck bacon. Again, way too much of whatever cheese was on there. It was all you could taste and I had to remove the top bun to even enjoy. Also had the wings. They were okay, but came out really cold. Probably would never go back. 3 stars for the truffle fries.

anPF0R5nXnctZEiQ_dmDAg.text: The best burger ever and onion rings with drinks come and get some of this bite you wont regret it

JPpQxMEbDDgKf1wjVHdsuQ.text: Wow. Let's just put it this way...I demolished it before a picture could ever be taken. One of the best burgers I've ever had. Ordered the blue cheese burger just like it was listed on the menu, does. not. disappoint. Seriously top 3 burgers I've ever had. Also ordered the truffle fries, equally as great. For drink choice I had the Sangria. Cinnamon apple goodness. I'm a vegas frequent and this is top 3 vegas restaurant of all time. Damn Ramsey, you do your damn thing ;)

hzD8akrFuH1rZ_S23rR-ew.text: Delicious food, I had blue burger, perfectly cooked. Truffle fries and homemade ketchup are killer. I would give 5 stars, but service a bit slow and not attentive.  Overall worth stopping by!

SjxSaz0Hfos0kkFlidLU1w.text: Delicious! Delicious! Delicious! My husband surprised me with a trip to Las Vegas, and I was most excited about going to Gordon Ramsay burger! It did not disappoint! I got the farmhouse burger, my husband got the crown burger and we got delicious kettle chip nachos as an appetizer! Even though the burgers were delicious, the nachos were hands down one of the best things I've ever eaten. I was literally making questionable noises while eating them because they were that good. We also got truffle fries, which were probably the weakest thing we got, but still good. We got really in to truffle last year when we went to Italy, and when you order truffle anything in the US, they give you a little measly bit of truffle. Not GRB, they loaded it up. It was almost too much truffle. Other than that, I can't wait to go back!! My favorite part of Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos made by angels.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse

Pw_XSf5MTDAVAW3XujOMFQ.text: I was sat at the bar immediately at lunch time on a Wednesday.   I've watched Gordon Ramsey's burger tutorial online a million times, so I had high expectations. I got the Hell's Kitchen Burger medium-rare as recommended. It was perfectly cooked meat, juicy, tender, well seasoned. It's hard to keep that slippery jalapenos pepper in there when you bite into it! Definitely provided a balanced kick without overpowering it, but definitely makes for messy eating and constant burger management. My bun was under-toasted for my taste, very minimal color when I opened it up. My friend's was perfectly toasted. So a bit of bun inconsistency. For a $18.40 + tip burger, I really think just a few fries could be included. Even in Vegas. Or maybe offer a half portion fry volume. It's a large burger so no way I could have finished fries and definitely not at half the price of another burger ($8-12). But I would have liked to try them. I'd still like to try the Farmhouse next time.   The spot at the bar had a/c blowing directly at me. Ok... I put my fleece jacket on. Still fricken freezing. 2 if the 3 men working behind the bar looked really unhappy to be working here. They weren't inhospitable, just appearing uninviting.

907EJ-hG9vc0DEeyBT3X8g.text: Our experience was not great.  We waited for 1 hour, which was OK. However, the food was NOT GREAT, not even that good. None of us really liked our burgers that much (our table ordered three different types). For a $17 hamburger you expect it to be good and it was mediocre at best. The fries were OK, the house made sauces were weird (curry ketchup, chipotle ketchup, etc). We were so disappointed.  Would definitely not eat here again. Does not measure up to the hype.

h1wegK7EJdL1V1O5AivVPw.text: I came here expecting to hear Ramsay dropping 'F bombs' but I settled for the 'F burger' instead. What is the Gordon Ramsay Burger restaurant? It's literally the physical brick and mortar restaurant embodiment of the man himself.  In True Gordon Ramsay fashion, his restaurant takes on the famous chef's personality, with flames engulfing his patrons as they dine. His menu offers a selection of delicious burgers, fries, and beverages in a sit down and flame infused environment. Make sure to come early, and put down your name - the wait time can be excruciating!

Gse-58NWYTQuDX_OaolDQA.text: Friendly staff at the bar! Hugely friendly! Fast service.   To our surprise, the foie burger resulted in my friend taking several trips to the restroom after about an hour and a half of finishing the whole burger. My friend, who spent the first half of his life living in Europe, loves foie and was excited to try it. He couldn't enjoy his evening for the trips to the restroom.  The lobster and shrimp burger I ordered was seasoned in a way that my palette did not enjoy. The flavors did not marry well, but the sandwich was well-portioned. That said, the picked carrots on the burger were delish! Not sure if I would retry this spot.

cch0dgZ68byFiZGZY5B2SQ.text: This place must not pay their help well. Some quit tonight. Waiting forever for a table of three.  If it wasn't for the others I would have abandoned this shit a long time ago.  Tables of two go in regularly and just seated a table of 5 that have not been here as long.  I wish I could scream like Gordon does.

OwEY5Hvgfxd1npTDy0dbBw.text: Best restaurant I've been in a long time from the hostess to our waiter super attentive clean cut well mannered staff I have never experienced such great service my whole family enjoyed their dinner and we were all beyond amazed definitely a second time around kind of restaurant

U_9bI_fXSJynnSfuRcx-8g.text: Best burger, Best wings, Best drinks, a little bit of wait. The food and the drinks all had unique flavors and were worth every penny. Everytime you eat or drink something, it has a few different flavors you experience from the first bite/sip, then while your chewing/drinking and then the aftertaste. I don't know how they do it but it's a spectacular feeling! Kind of like that scene from Ratatouille when he makes his friend eat a mixture of good cheese and nuts. See here - youtube.com/watch?v=6qtE...

TlvGzF-DisOIVX9tooAHKw.text: The burger was good but really not $15 good. They give you ALOT of fries. If its 2 of you, you only need 1 order of fries. It was 5 if us and 3 orders of fries...too many. The ketchup is homemade....doesnt taste like ketchup to me but it was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was basically the regular cheeseburger, I forgot the name.

iYBOw66psXEpKLRy11CN3Q.text: For a 45 minute wait and $20 a burger I was hoping to get more. A party of 6 and one person actually enjoyed their burger. I personally got the blue cheese burger but asked for no arugala with truffle fries. I got my burger with a pile of arugala as thick as the patty. The truffle fries were a 10/10. My burger had dry bread, grease dripping all over my hand and just hardly and bleu cheese.  I'd give two stars but the truffle was so good.

vtIjcxDW7BWd73vtltZtwQ.text: I try to stay away from big names and chains in the food industry. But GR Burger was pretty good! I ordered the Blue Burger with now bun (unsure why since I ended up getting fries anyway) and to my surprise, I didn't feel like I was eating a protein style In and Out burger. The lettuce actually complimented the blue cheese and arugula that the burger comes with. I washed it down with an Old Fashion which was also just as good. My friends, who were on keto ordered the wings and had no complaints about that either. Must try if you're new to LV and the strip

lFp4947OgAbmXZMzHQi_Vw.text: The food was amazing- burgers, onion rings & sweet potato fries were scrumptious! Wanted to eat here everyday.

CDiqIDW6Fy4uH8H9-zgFAA.text: They make everything unique here. The fries were great, however got quite a surprise when they came out, they make their OWN KETCHUP! Not just one choice but two. Pretty amazing. But the best thing was the burger, pure heaven. I do wish they did have more original choices however. Wait can be long but worth it

uVrlWtT2VKYS7_8P8pKO5A.text: Hands down, the best burger I have ever had.   The bun is perfect, the meat is perfect..and OMG how about those sweet potato fries with powdered sugar?!? DELICIOUS!  Probably the best french fry combo ever. I will make burger a stop on every trip to Vegas.

ygskyUTFj04F6shTQ9k20g.text: Hostess staff was very rude after they mixed up our party size. They called our group and then claimed that we "changed" our party size and told us to wait another 45min-1hour. Tried to explain the situation and they were rude and dismissive. We went elsewhere.

SaukYVZvyBgGxBKjM5QxNw.text: Didn't even get to eat here. There was a miscommunication with the number of people in our party and instead of apologizing, we were told we were wrong and that WE said the wrong number of people. Like we didn't know how many people were in our family... We asked for the manager (who took 15 minutes to come over) and he didn't apologize, didn't offer us anything and didn't care. Super bummer because I love Gordon Ramsey and his food. Just couldn't wait for a table after all that bad attitude from management. I'm very upset.

lX1JpyzCkVrY99S1wXaGHg.text: In Vegas decided on Gordon Ramsay's the wait was about 30 min not to bad but we waited longer for burgers our drinks came waiter dropped on table and dashed away  No straws for the kids waiter finally came asked him for straws  Burgers were ok they fell apart trying to eat them Basic fries (not worth $8) I feel for $17 for just a basic burger you should get fries with it Onion rings would have been better without the  seasoning they put on them I would not go back   Would eat 5 guys first

aaxjDA4Rl_wDvDtP4G4Ojg.text: Excellent burger! Ordered the Poppers and they were fantastic. Sweet potato fries were addictive! Worth the one hour wait time. Server was very nice and food came out quickly. Total meal was $45

9dKMUyh9Z_B1qxSYdhFkEA.text: We had Kettle Nachos, Hells kit burger, Farmhouse burger and Truffle fries. Food and service were great. Nice and warm hospitality.

OwMIdxaIj1q3vwBsd6yYaw.text: The line is a real pain, looks tacky for a high end burger place. Feels like a suped up TGIFriday's to me. Burger was mushy, too much bum for the burger. It wasn't bad it just wasn't awesome.

_S9udWNIBJGvEawsR6kD3w.text: You would think that a 5 Star chef such as Gordon Ramsay would give people organic quality food in this day and age, but it appears he is just another sold out PharmaWhore! I guess if you don't sell out then you will never become as famous!  The waiting line is about an hour to be seated and if you are a vegetarian, there is a choice of a portobello sandwich on the menu, but you are gonna pay for it at ($17)!  I have heard rumors that Gordon despises vegetarians, so this just confirms it for me!  He permits you to come to his restaurant but you will pay 2 more dollars for that non-meat sandwich!   It took about 30 minutes for our food to be served.  My partner got the the burger. It was too salty and the tomato had not been cut properly because it had the brown end still on one of the pieces. What Gordon, you allow that?  The plain french fries ($8) were fresh cut and fine, but a bit stale/cold when we got them to our table. They do not come with the burgers, so you would need to order them separately. The positive thing is they are a large portion that can be shared between 2 people.  Overall, it was not a great meal and we will not be back. We were expecting much more from you Gordon.   As Donald would say, "You're fired!!!" Otherwise Gordon, best get your butt back into that kitchen to check!  Update: When I got home I got horribly ill and was up all night. I am allergic to canola oil and cannot stomach GMOS, so I suspect that they are using canola oil and/other GMOs in this restaurant!

T6i-wpLqSN8ILnZ0mavxjA.text: Pricy but different kind of pub fare. The burger is a bit small.  The shake wasn't bad, but the only thing worth ordering is those duck fat fries. Sooooo good.

c7tgMmtDUr2CkztPjsctIA.text: We we're so excited to try Burger. Finally getting the chance, we stopped in Saturday night right before 6. Surprisingly the line was short and we were seated within 5 minutes.   Our server was great, super informative. We ordered the Hells Kitchen Burger, Blue Cheese Burger and Truffle Fries to share. Our waiter told us it'd be about 20-25 minutes for food. I did think that was a little awkward to tell us that, but I appreciated the honesty. We weren't in any rush.   By about 30-35, our food came out. Looked amazing. Cut my burger in half a saw it was definitely well done (we had both ordered ours medium). Not a big deal but when Red Robin can get a burger done-ness right and not Gordon Ramsay, that's a bit of an issue.   The burger was great except the patty. All of the flavors were there. Loved the kick of spice and my boyfriend loved everything about his Blue Cheese burger. Except the party. Not sure why we waited that long to have over cooked burgers.   The truffle fries had the same issue. The flavors were amazing. But the fries tasted like they sat under the heat lamp waaay too long. And no surprise, if you looked over to the kitchen you saw rows of fries sitting under the lamp.   The kitchen was clearly behind which surprised me at 6 on a Saturday, not what I would think would be the dinner rush. There were plenty of empty tables around us.   Seemed like they were waiting for the kitchen to catch up because they stopped seating people for about 15 minutes. By then, the burgers seemed to come out a lot quicker.   I really wanted to like this place, and had our burgers been not been cooked to death and our fries sat out, it would have been 5 stars.   Service 5 stars. Flavors 5 stars but it's the kitchen that brought it down. Work on efficiency and this place would be so great.

TiK6aWlqRBjEDOZBTm0KSA.text: In regards to burgers and appetizers, this is the best I have ever had in my life. We started it off with the chips, the chicken wings, and the ahi sliders. The wings did not have too much flavor, a very basic staple, but were perfectly cooked. The chips had the best cheese with a carrot garnish that totally complimented the starter and wrapped all the flavors together. But the ahi sliders were the best thing I have ever tasted, anywhere. If you eat fish at all, this is a must have. It is truly incredible, so much flavor. For my entree I had the lobster and shrimp burger. This was exactly how I would imagine a seafood burger and so much more. Perfect everything. On top of that, the service was absolutely exceptional, the best I ever experienced, anywhere. Gordon does not mess around. Five stars across the board.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chips
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Ahi Sliders. This is a must have appetizer. The best flavor and punch I have ever tasted in my life.
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The lobster and shrimp burger

Jicoc0--EEA-uSM6DdBgcA.text: I tried the hog burger and the Hell's Kitchen burger as well as the curry fries and the nachos. The nachos I had here were the greatest nachos I have ever had mostly because of the English cheese sauce that they added. The fries were crispy and well done, but the curry was not as rest. Curry was decent but not really my taste. The burgers were extremely juicy and flavorful. I think I finally found a better burger place than. In-N-Out.

IRBukj4480zQrKyLwIrsLg.text: The burger was so delicious! They had unique toppings,  simple but good combinations.  The burger was very flavorful and the service was friendly and fast.   I like the fact that the server let us know that it might take a while for the burger to come so we would be prepared to wait.  It turned out that it didn't take as long so that was a pleasant surprise.  My favorite item on the menu would be the onion rings!!  They tasted amazing and had a good crunchy texture.   They also had a good drink menu with good cocktails.  Overall this is definitely a place I will be back to whenever I am in town.

fIBPjwXBb-Tam8Ai0waChg.text: My farmhouse burger was great. We will be going back before we leave. Also, this was by far the best customer service I have experienced in a long time. The wait staff was an example that there is no "I" in team.

SDDkSO414K11-meUinoKmQ.text: I eat here every time I visit Vegas and it never disappoints. The Hell's Kitchen burger is amazing along with the fries and shakes. The only criticism is that for parties of 3 or more they want you to visit the desk and they will text you. This is great except hardly anyone in line is aware of that, as its not clearly posted and the line is usually long. Another note about the line and that is it's usually hot in Vegas and they have you stand next to a firewall. This is an actual wall of fire, it looks neat but not so neat if you're hot. One you're seated it's great, friendly knowledgeable staff and the food is impeccable.

cB5yrWhgxFUQnTYph-Gc0Q.text: I'm a huge fan of Gordon Ramsay and was excited to discover the restaurant, I got the farm house burger. It was pretty good, maybe my expectations were a little high.  I would give it an 8.8

nOk7GrSyNF0iejqAu7BK5w.text: Great flavored Blue Cheese Burger. Cooked perfectly medium. Fries are good, find fry sauce  okay. It's fresh, but just not my favorite. Would give higher but the list more order. Manager was proactive and comp'd the meal.

LTuaAERNSFp0KBN1DsLwKA.text: I was in a Food coma the food was so rich and good. Line gets crazy long but food is worth the wait. Get there before they open when the line first starts. Anything on the menu is amazing!!!

IToiMLCI8JPHj7okdxOK2w.text: Unreal! Wow! If you are craving a perfect burger unlike any other in texture and flavor, this is the spot. This experience was excellent from beginning to end. Friendly greeting at hostess stand as we awaited our table. Our server was prompt, informative and attentive. Top notch service with much consideration.   Due to the volume of this establishment it takes 25-30 minutes to receive your burger of choice. Server recommended a starter since it is delivered quicker. The corned beef nachos served over hand cut potato chips were incredibly rich and delicious.   Kale/Romaine Caesar salad was amazing! The dressing was the star of this beautiful salad. Let's just say I never felt like one could be addicted to a salad but this one will get ya!!   The burger: OMGoodness! Unlike any other. It looks modest when it arrives but one bite and you know everything about it is special. We ordered the UK Burger, it is topped with Dubliner cheese, chutney and arugula on an absolutely perfect bun. The bun is topped with black and white sesame seeds and is pillowy yet hearty. The meat was so buttery and seasoned to perfection. You savor each and every bite and don't want it to end. It leaves you eager to try every burger on the menu.   There is a wide variety of burger choices and many appetizers to choose from. Fries are a la carte.   Even though the line can get long it is definitely worth the wait. If you are a burger lover or connoisseur  then it's worth the trip.

Ds_M8JzUsRFps1VYwmYLYw.text: Not really a burger burger fan, sorry.  But we absolutely enjoy this restaurant.   We try and visit every time we are in Las Vegas, (the party City). First came here because our fight was delayed and we arrived very, very late and surprisingly the only restaurant we could find open at that hour was Gordon Ramsay Burger. The flame display in the window let us know we were in for something special. Food was excellent that visit and lightly fast service.  The sweet potato fries with powered sugar are the best fries anywhere, love them.  We visited a few times and again over this last weekend and the service was super, super slow because they were so busy that night.  We had seating with a view of the kitchen and we were amazed by the pace that the volume of food was prepared. Waiter was very polite and apologetic about the slow service.  Fortunately we were not that hungry just very tired.  The food finally came; Portobello Mushroom Burger, Salad with Fried Chicken Skin (can't remember the name), Onion Rings and those Sweet Potato Fries again. Everything was just delicious. Now the Onion Rings are also my favorite any where, not over cooked like at so many restaurants and seasoned to perfection. When in Vegas enjoy this gourmet dinner style place for a great meal.

sOMTrpxIh_oP_exTBoExYw.text: I can say Ive "been there and done that" but that's  all. $85 for 2 burgers, 1 order of fries and 2 cocktails were not worth it. Ive had better burgers from "Back Yard Burgers" in Florida

UdI7mvKAje7NMVgbd6L1_A.text: It was a good burger, but it doesn't come with any side or even fries ( everything is extra and overpriced). The water had a strong smell of bleach our group of 6 couldn't even drink it. Overall was good experience after long wait ( waiting period was 3-4 hours for dinner)

RmTzMHGhbmffUcTSRsWvOg.text: Wow, This was an amazing place and an amazing burger.  The wait was about an hour but well worth it.  The price was reasonable for Las Vegas.  The food was to order and the appetizer was good.  Definitely go here for lower priced Gordon Ramsay cuisine.

bOZsVyRbXQ4ebLYlZxsY2Q.text: Ordered the truffle fries and Blue burger. All delicious. Ask to sample their sauces (especially the white cheddar and smoky chipotle) to really experience good flavor.

uSusgicCTg4-eMjkwi_KIA.text: Oh boy the longest wait ever in the world! I guess that's to be expected from a celebrity chef restaurant.  I ordered the Patriot Burger, which was a turkey burger, smoked Gouda, spicy mayo, cherry compote(?) and crispy onions. DANG this burger was so good. I chose the turkey burger simply because it sounded healthier, but when I read all the dressings that came with it, it very quickly made my mouth water. And it did not disappoint. My friends ordered standard burgers like the kinds with eggs, avocado, or bacon. And they were upset. I mean, this is Gordon freaking Ramsay. You have a higher expectation!  But the Patriot Burger was amazingggg!   Because of the celebrity chef owner, the line here is long. You can put your name down and they'll text you when your table is ready. This basically means you have time to gamble in the casino, or shop around in the stores nearby.   Would I come back? Probably not, but if you find yourself dragged here get the Patriot Burger. It's the only one worth it on the menu.

QmgfiLkVqGiNUwTWFdYrRA.text: Wow!! Thats all i can say about the burgers!! Soooooo good!! Service was eh ok i guess but the food was amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ri5uToC0mrc17P38lwpZhQ.text: First of all, I HATE the wait process for this restaurant. If you are a party of three or more, you can submit your name and phone number and be called back. However, if you are only a two top, you have to wait behind some rope and get called in one table at a time. I'm sure this is so a crowd develops and sparks interest but it's really annoying to feel trapped in this line. The wait time we were quoted was way off...and not in our favor. There's nowhere to sit. You can't explore the casino while you're waiting. You have to just stand in the line at their mercy. It would be better if you could at least make an Open Table reservation and the overflow had to wait outside to attract a crowd but this line is your only option. We waited at least 45 minutes at 9:00 on a weeknight!   Anyway...my other con to this restaurant is it kind of smells like a dirty rag at the entry way. Like that dirty bar smell that you sometimes encounter. I was SHOCKED by this two years ago when I first dined here and I was even more shocked that it still had this odor two years later. Very disappointing and it should be taken care of. Not up to Ramsay standards (that he prides himself in on TV) and his name is attached to this place.   It is VERY loud in this establishment. It's totally open to the casino at the front and back of the restaurant so you have restaurant noise, casino noise, bar noise, television noise, music...on this particular day I had a migraine so I was really overstimulated. If you want ambiance and a private conversation...this is not the place for you!   Our server was excellent. He noticed I wasn't feeling well. He sympathized with my migraine and even offered me Advil. He stooped down to our table to talk and take our order and I told him how much I valued his personality after our long day (we just returned from a 12 hour excursion). He was absolutely the star of this visit! He told us the burgers were running long and he would bring us our fries first. He was just so kind, attentive, efficient and great at his job. This establishment is lucky to have him and there should be more servers like him out there!   They don't have Heinz ketchup here. Only homemade ketchup. For me, this was a major flaw. I just don't like the homemade ketchup. It doesn't taste anything like the flavor I enjoy from Heinz. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger. It was ok. It wasn't particularly flavorful which is surprising  considering how much stuff is on it (jalapeno, roasted tomato, avocado...) My mom got the backyard burger which she said was delicious. We split fries. If I was feeling better I would say we definitely could have gotten away with an order of fries per person. I love french fries and the orders aren't THAT big. If you love fries and don't like to share them...go with one order per person.   I wanted to love this place more than I do. My migraine, I'm sure contributed somewhat. They need to figure out that smell...and get some regular ketchup for those of us that prefer it. Stop forcing the homemade stuff on us! And please make Open Table available!

Hj5_wJkZZjSdO_FkO-zIaQ.text: So, I totally love this place. Been here three times and will continue to come back when I'm in Vegas.   I reviewed GR Burgr when it was at the "other location" but it was lost on yelp due to the alleged relocation. However, the restaurant never moved, maybe they redecorated, but it's still at the same spot in the Planet Hollywood resort right off the strip.   Parking is a B! The PH parking is in the back of the resort and the attached miracle mile mall. It's a True workout to walk from the parking garage to the restaurant so you'll be good to chow down when you get there.   We ordered four burgers and three sides and three drinks bill was $126. Well worth the price. The burgers are always juicy and delicious. There are a bunch of different topping combinations on the menu to chose from.   My beef (lol) with them is (1) they exchanged the goat cheese off of the crown burger for a melty cheese which is still good but not the same, and, (2) the chips, or as we call them fries, are dry. Idk if that how they like them in England but I stick with the sweet potato fries and the onion rings for sides because both of them are awesome.  Even with these two beefs, it's still the BEST burger restaurant I've been to. If you're on the fence, just go.

V6_iVux563B5KNI536T2cQ.text: look, I was excited to come because I watch Gordon's shows, but instead, waited 20-30 minutes for seat that was fine but, when we went to order food, it was all fine got our drinks & everything but, wait 30 minutes, we never got the food we were mad we live in California and we had to drive but it was 5:30 or something near there, & we had more people with us, they waited out because they didn't want a burger, they were already confused why, we didn't get our food, we just left because our server didn't know why the food wasn't here & he never told the cooks, another table was there with a family of 4,(we were 3), and they waited over 40 minutes still nothing, we left with no sorry, they asked why we're leaving, we said why, we left still hungry, I still love Gordon and his show, but this experience was horrible and we never come to Vegas maybe next year it will be better.

ds3ojmsbEv-D944nbKYQew.text: Excellent burgers!!!! Even better,  the wait staff was superior and the comfortable decor.  We'll worth the visit.

aXVXKbSA3GLDNHtIMtQ_fg.text: Awesome onions rings and the Hell's Kitchen burger was good and spicy. Bartender was cool, and I shall repeat

AphKHxS-mdfULy28ludgEQ.text: Ordered the farmhouse burger and I do not regret it at all. The Dubliner cheese complimented the burger very well. The egg is made to your liking, it was delicious as well. Sadly I can't remember our servers name but he was very knowledgeable on the menu and drinks, great hospitality overall our party was extremely satisfied.

1L85cfmTuBWI-oNQ8tSO-w.text: Good burgers. Black Forest burger with arugula, duck ham, tremor cheese was delicious. Mushroom poutine was very porcini, I really liked it. We enjoyed our meal. Very popular place that's why we stayed in line for 40min to get seated. It doesn't worth going there again.

pIw4RflXK--cWQWUJ8iuUA.text: Service here was on point! Adam our server was super attentive and that made it worth every penny! I got the blue burger and my husband got The Hog burger, and we also got the onion rings as a starter. The onion rings were awesome, crunchy and delish! The Hog was super flavorful but MESSY and a little on the greasy side.....but delish! The Blue burger was good, I wished it had more arugula and the figgy jam on it, the blue cheese was super overpowering. I gave it 4 stars mostly for the service if it was just for the food I would have done 3.

Kol_mV0mOOkI6m1Mqfe8Iw.text: blue cheese burger was great, I felt the truffle fries lacked flavor, they honestly tasted like thick fries from the freezer section at Safeway, decent draught beer selection, the citrus mistress from hop valley paired well with the burger.

DyKCdNj8xrIOQ4iCj3zCgg.text: Line too long  Burger add-ons way too expensive  Definitely overrated  Not impressed  Only tried because we watch Gordon Ramsay's programs

5qDqcMGImtJpZ96Cv3z8BA.text: Went here in a whim and happy we did. Went on a Friday around 6 and only took 15-20 mins to be seated. Burgers were so darn good. Truffle fries were excellent as well. Just writing this review has me craving another burger. Would definitely recommend it!

lswzcr9mhlvw9RWUYp7E5A.text: If you're a Gordon Ramsay fan and you're in Vegas you need to check out one of his restaurants. We were all craving a burger and went here. The line was around the corner to get in for dinner but we were able to get on a list and they called us. They said 45 min wait but it was much faster. We went and got a drink while we waiting in Planet Hollywood. I liked how they let us bring in our outside drinks to our tables, server even got us a glass to pour our beers into to match the restaurant atmosphere. We had two couples and shared two orders of delicious parmesan truffle fries. I split a 16$ burger with my wife that was really good.  Only unfortunate thing happened was when I got up to leave my pants got stuck to some gum on the chair. No fault to the restaurant but was not fun to try and get off. Server felt bad and hopefully changed the chair for the next guests.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wr98ZEHcBAeq-ICEgmPOaw.text: If you're foodie or just wish to enjoy a simple yet sophisticated burger, this is your place.  We were fortunate to be served by a waitress that worked with their restaurant from the opening. She was very informative and attentive.   Although our party of 8 weren't fortunate enough to see Mr. Gordon , we were still very content....it was all about the food.   Burgers  are simply flavorful!!  Try their truffle fries and Hell's Kitchen burger.  I'll also add, There are very few places that you notice how comfortable your seats are....this place has very comfortable seats.   Highly recommend if you're in Las Vegas.

h2RlRtVzGoaM4l-ZM8DNmg.text: Pros: variety of tasty burgers and sweet potatoes are a must!!  Cons: Long wait, longtime for burgers to come out

kIemsU-huK9VWV1iIpWOtA.text: The restaurant was clean, and the servers were pleasant enough, but just try to get a water refill. I dare you! A weird guy kept hovering, who wasn't our waiter, but rather than fill our drinks, he just gave the awkward look and kept moving. I made my husband stop him, finally because most of our glasses were empty.  I think Gordon forgot to heed his own advice because I ordered Hell's Kitchen burger, because I like spicy. Well, if it says "Hells Kitchen", it  really should be spicy. Nope. The bun to burger ratio is sad. We named the buns Sir Mix A Lot buns, because baby got back. Too big for the tiny patty. Speaking of patty, where was it?!?! I thought it would be handmade and/or big and juicy. No, no and no! Such a disappointment! One and done. I pulled the top of the bun off, for the picture or you wouldn't be able to see anything.

lwVF8qwedeNjs9UNgGLl3Q.text: Takes forever to bring your food, specially if you order after 12:00 am. We have tried hell's kitchen and they were so quick but not here...

XyqQ-tk83bcx6Rbzf6iKFg.text: Ok burger - you can eat similar ones at other places on the strip. The worst part are the two hostesses that don't know how to move customer flow, so you have to wait in line for 45 mins to Pat ridiculous $$ for a burger and fries. Only reason I ate here was due to my friends who wanted to try it. Never coming back.

IxkQ8KjCQluXlJaDG0OgEw.text: Fantastic burgers in Vegas!!  You cannot go wrong with your choices.  Recommend the Oreo shake it is mind blowing good.  Key tip go to the front desk if you have a larger group.

7ejG4STohY07aGyHlzvKWQ.text: I have been a fan of Gordon Ramsay for as long as I've been a foodie. We picked this place over the other GR restaurant because it was within our price range. It's located in Planet Hollywood and you're greeted by a line of fire with the words Gordon Ramsay Burger. The wait wasn't bad, the line moved pretty quickly but please note that if you have a party of more than 3 people, go to the front and tell the wait staff. We had a party of about 15 and we didn't see that sign until we were near the front so it was too late for that. Our wait was about an hour on a Monday night. I think if you have a smaller party, the wait should not be as long as ours. And reservations aren't available. The neat thing is you don't have to be there waiting until the hour is up, I was able to give them my number and they would text me when the table is clearing. We walked around outside and saw the Fountains at the Bellagio.  I ordered the Hell Kitchen's burger with the truffle fries. They warn you ahead of time to share the truffle fries with a couple of people so don't let the price deter you. This was probably the best burger I have ever had in my life. It definitely beats a few of my favorite burger joints in Dallas. It's also big so you'll be super satisfied. I split my burger with my friend who had the Farmhouse burger. The Farmhouse burger was interesting, wasn't my favorite exactly but it was still good. It had interesting toppings. The truffle fries were super flavorful. Every bite you took had good flavor. We were able to dip it in an aioli sauce and ketchup. The ketchup here is SUPER fresh, not packaged in a Hunt's ketchup bottle and you can definitely tell. I'm telling everyone who goes to Vegas to check this place out. Definitely worth your time and money.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen Burger

viM2YLzS9pk34qC_9NtlFg.text: Going to a Gordon Ramsay restaurant was a very good experience. The black and blue burger was good and the fries were great.  The hazelnut, chocolate tart was very good.  The service was friendly and kind. The negatives of the burger were the size and the cheese slightly over powered it. I'm not looking for a super sized burger, but I'm not sold on the value.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate, hazelnut tart
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black and Blue Burger

gZvyi_rz02EV6gfDvDBocQ.text: For someone who's well known for being a great chef, this place really was Kitchen Nightmares. I was really disappointed from this place. For a restaurant with the word "burger" in its name, you would assume that they would have top notch burgers. Even with just "Gordon Ramsey" in the name of the restaurant, it should be top of the line food. But sadly it was all disappointing.   ~PARKING~ The restaurant is located in Planet Hollywood and they have a huge parking structure that is free to park! It is pretty easy to find parking, but the parking structure is at the opposite side of where the restaurant is, so you have to walk through the whole mall.   ~FOOD~ I ordered the truffle fries, which I had high expectations for but they fell short. They were tough and tasted like they've been sitting on the side for hours. They were dried up and just difficult to chew. The dipping sauces that came with it were flavorful and unique, but I was not a huge fan of it. I think normal ketchup would have tasted better.   I also ordered the beer battered onion rings. These seemed more fresh than the fries. They were crunchy and tasted exactly like funions (if you've tried the chips before). It also came with two different dipping sauces and I loved the cheddar aioli sauce.   For my burger, I ordered the Hell's Kitchen Burger with my patty cooked to medium. It was the most average tasting burger in my life. It tasted like a burger I could get at Red Robin's. It was bland and dry and it's supposed to have jalapeno inside, but I didn't get any spice in until my very last few bites of the burger.   ~FINAL CRITIC~ I honestly think that this place is all hype. I would not wait in line for this restaurant. It definitely is just an average tasting over priced burger. We also had to wait almost 40 minutes for our food to come out and they ran out of straws. Just a very disappointing restaurant overall.

I don't think the price for their burgers is overpriced because it IS Vegas and i've paid just the same amount here in LA. Can't wait to come back!

cyCldiq9NAPzyQcjDVKYtA.text: Ok, it's official.  Gordon Ramsay definitely makes a better burger than me, by a lot.  Burger is a homerun on the fundamental level. If you want it cooked more, then you don't deserve to eat here lol.    I got the "Forest Burger".  Get that.  Great way to experience a Gordon Ramsay place without the fine dining expense. vxmUiItsmLLVDI8O9FlLOw.text: 3.5 stars Despite having been a life-long fan of Gordon Ramsay's TV shows like Hell's Kitchen, MasterChef, and the F-Word, I've never actually visited one of his restaurants, so on my recent visit to Las Vegas, Gordon Ramsay Burger was the place to go! Located in Planet Hollywood, the place has a casual "sports-bar" vibe, along with an open kitchen, and there were people of all different ages and group sizes eating at this busy restaurant. We started our meal with the parmesan truffle fries, which came with a spiced ketchup and truffle aioli on the side. I didn't find the fries particularly special (there was a distinct lack of truffle aroma/flavor), but the truffle aioli was chock full of amazing umami unctuousness, though the ketchup was just dominated by sweetness.  And then what we came for--the burgers! The Hell's Kitchen burger was a must-order, and it came with melted asadero cheese, roasted jalapenos, roasted tomatoes, jalapeno aioli, and avocado. Plenty of fire and spiciness indeed (and the burger itself was nice and juicy), but otherwise, the flavors of the burger weren't all that interesting, and the bun turned out to be overly greasy with butter. I much preferred the Forest burger, which came with salty tremor cheese, forest mushrooms, arugula, and duck bacon. The flavors of this burger were very umami (thanks to the mushroom, cheese, and bacon), and the combination with the refreshing arugula worked very nicely! Again, however, the bun was way more greasy than necessary.  The burgers at Gordon Ramsay were good, but I can't say that they were the best I've had or necessarily worth the celebrity-chef price tag. I won't be in a rush to come back, but perhaps some of Gordon Ramsay's other restaurants in Vegas would be worth a try!

6-iVoDEBwD42ljrNROI84g.text: This is my 3rd time coming back to this place ! I come to the conclusion that this place is a "hit or miss" . If you're lucky you will get good food and good service but also is very capable of having the opposite which is sad considering it's Chef Ramsay's restaurant and you go with high expectations.   By now it's pretty obvious we had a bad experience this time. They changed their menu (for the worse). I was pretty sad they took out their delicious jalapeno poppers and other appies from their menu. After ordering we got our food super late and to top that I was served dirty and by dirty I mean filthy cutleries with god knows what was on it. Yikes! After complaining , never got an apology from the manager nor the manager came to our table even. My husband had to call him while he was busy talking to one of the servers then he gave us an employee discount . Ok thank you for that but really ?! Cmon Ramsay , you could do better than this ! If you were in my spot you would cuss and throw those flatware along with the burger at your staff !

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CazTSRpA33NEpc2VNnMkyQ.text: We came in for my daughters sweet 16 lunch in the middle of our cross country move- there were 6 of us including my young son & picky father in law.  Everything we got was amazing! IMHO the highlight of the food we ordered was the Mediterranean Burger and it was maybe the best lamb anything I've ever tasted!  Our waitress was amazing as well, very attentive despite having a decent size section, the attention to detail on everything including by the waitstaff is phenomenal.  When the waitress found out it was my daughter's birthday she got her this great dessert parfait- we're moving to Southern California but plan to make future trips to Vegas & to get another burger here.

CgBtQdxSloW-zJYlRJ_9jQ.text: I'd give this a 4 because a lot of the appetizers were spectacular, but the emphasis of this restaurant is the "Burger" and I wasn't too thrilled with what I had.  Sadly I wasn't able to take a photo of it but I had the Farmhouse burger. Now it didn't taste horrendous (I've had far worse), but this just didn't live up to its expectations. The bun didn't cut it for me. It tasted like it came straight out from a plastic container and they decided to brush some melted butter on it to mask the flavor.  The meat was also really dry. I didn't feel like I got my moneys worth. It was good that I experienced it, but so far all of Ramsays restaurants for me have been a hit or a miss and most of the time his appetizers are always killin it but when it comes down to the main course, it's nothing great.  To end on a brighter note, the nachos were excellent and the service was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

noGqAPixMnJHDo24ZV5IiQ.text: This review is based on my visit to Las Vegas last May.  Why now?  I was a Yelp user back then but not a reviewer.  I was looking back at my pics from the trip and saw that delicious burger so I figured a review was a must.  I always remember a great experience.  We were walking through Planet Hollywood one afternoon and as we were passing by Gordon Ramsay Burger we noticed a bit of a line up to get in.  We decided to wait (it was only for 5 minutes) as the place looked like it was buzzing and had to give it a try.  We ended up getting kitchen seating which was like sitting along a bar with view of the kitchen.  It was cool as you were able too see everything from how all the food was getting prepared, cooked, plated and expedited.  I decided to order the Hog Burger which was made up of pork basted in maple butter, english sharp cheddar, crisp onions and slaw.  It was absolutely fantastic.  What a bad ass burger.  The combinations of flavours were unreal.  Our server was friendly, energetic and very attentive.  The restaurant was buzzing, the view of the kitchen was cool and the burger was fantastic.  Looking forward to my next Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog Burger

kKTP8Kwr_YF_ClGMzIrgcA.text: Once I booked my flight to Vegas I knew I had to make a stop at one of Gordon's restaurants on the Vegas Strip! I'm a huge lover of burgers and Mr. Ramsey so this seemed like the PERFECT restaurant to sink my teeth into on my trip. I'll be honest, because of many of the reviews on Yelp I was skeptical about this restaurant but still wanted to give it a try. Lots of the reviews called this place "overrated" "overpriced" and Yelpers expressed feelings of regret saying things like "Definitely not worth the price", which made me weary but all my worries disappeared once I sunk my teeth into that burger! I thought since I was eating at a Ramsey restaurant I should order something different than the usual burger combinations like a beef patty with tomato, lettuce and pickles or a beef patty with bacon and a fried egg. I ordered the popular specialty  "Hog Burger" after my server, Justin, mentioned it was one of the more noteworthy menu items (along with the "Hell's Kitchen" Burger) and got a taste of pure heaven! The patty itself is made to order (Oh yeah!) out of pork, cooked medium and topped with bacon, fried onion , bbq pork, crispy onion, slaw, white cheddar and pickles - The flavors were out of this world. The patty itself was huge thick, juicy and flavorful, definitely worth the price .  The Parmesan Truffle fries were delicious and so was the truffle aioli they came with. Portions for everything were great for the price. Service and atmosphere were also great!  My server Justin was great, all smiles and he gave awesome recommendations since it was my family and I's first time at the restaurant. Had our drinks filled always and checked up on us throughout the meal.  My experience here was nothing short of amazing and was a huge highlight on my trip to Vegas, the only way it could have been made better is if Gordon Ramsey had handed me my food himself.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hog Burger

d1fTHSBI3tDT0H1Qf3-DDw.text: Good burger but if you want the Hell's Kitchen burger you have to wait 30 mins. Maybe they're making it across the street and shipping it in? Perhaps the avocado took some time to pit and slice.   Rings were on point the beef patty was cooked perfectly.  Whatever the hell the recipe for those sauces are, they need to go bye bye. Chipotle ketchup is fucking horrible and they were out of a beer on tap that my buddy wanted.   Wait in line was only 15 mins. With all the burger places out there they could be doing it better. Love Gordon Ramsay but overall this a bit average.

GQHzQzIW0-Q_-vGZxvxctA.text: Everything was exceptional. As I think about my meal my mouth is starting to water.   RECOMMENDATION: if you're going with a small party or even another guest, I would recommend getting two different burgers and splitting them. There are so many delicious options to pass up on!   Truffle fries: a thicker cut fry sprinkled with parmesan cheese and comes with ketchup and another dipping sauce. (Perfect for sharing) They were perfectly cooked, meaning they weren't soggy or over cooked. The other dipping sauce had a touch of garlic to it which made the French fry experience that much better.   Blue cheeseburger: Holy mother of flavors. Comes with blue cheese and manchego, fig jam, cider vinegar reduction and spicy mayo. From the first bite to the last, there is an explosion of flavor. The sweetness of the fig jam compliments the savory of the two different cheeses while the heat of the mayo gives it that extra kick that you didn't even know you needed. This is by far one of the best burgers I've ever had.   Hell's Kitchen burger: more of a classic style burger with extra heat. We opted out of the roasted jalapenos but the jalapeno aioli was more than enough to bring the burger up a notch.

MtUjA4VdNJkxEBGHR01-1g.text: I can't complain . The burger was amazing . The fries were good and i had a nice cold beer to go with it.   Made my hangover  a little better . Definitely recommend this place . Enjoy friends

BaCrThbFkYJJaIxPWf9GYw.text: Amazing burgers with reasonable prices! Burgers range from $15-$17 and fries are $9. Service was good and the meal itself was amazing.
