LAdqlUTqIM31QN0mBoUU9A.text: I have dined here at least 4 other occasions.  This is the first time that I experienced an issue.  I order the fish and chip sandwich and it arrived at our table with a very fowl odor - almost ammonia like.  I was reluctant to try a small bite.  When I cut into the battered fish, the odor was nauseating.  To the waiter's credit, he also confirmed the strong odor.  He cane back and informed me that the kitchen threw out all the fish.  Good to hear!  I ordered the Stout burger but I was unable to stomach much of it.  The waiter did remove my burger from the bill. I couldn't have ask for more.  Unfortunately, as I walked out of the restaurant with my party, I smelled the same odor as other customers had order the same sandwich.  I'll be back though.  Shit happens.

-0X36qY9oonvxcbbL9vQtA.text: Don't see what all the fuss is about. I ordered my burger medium, came out way overcooked, not even a hint of pink.   The service was slow and the workers working behind the bar spend more time gossiping to each other about their fellow workers then they do on focusing on the customers. Very unprofessional.   Definitely will not be returning. You can get a much better burger with better service somewhere else.

olLRiZG1-6rgBw154afmHQ.text: Burger lovers - get ready to sink your teeth into these gourmet delights. Celebrity chef Gordon Ramsay brings his casual burger concept to Planet Hollywood Las Vegas.  Gordon Ramsay Burger is positioned directly inside a center Strip entrance, making it easy to stop in after browsing Miracle Mile Shops or having fun in the casino. The line can get lengthy, but it's worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2izVpQRQ1mGOc1vHAOwZSw.text: Wow! What an amazing burger. It was a busy early afternoon on a Saturday, so we opted for first available seating, which was at the bar. My husband and I shared the sweet potato fries, and we each got our own burger. What I loved most was the presentation. The UK colors for the plates and napkins along with the colorful menu was a great touch. I can't decide what I liked better: the fries or the burger. The sweet potato fries were covered in sugar. I got my burger medium and it was so juicy and fresh. Our server was really engaging. He asked us where we were from, and we discussed football; go Fighting Irish! We really enjoyed the whole experience, and even though we were only in Las Vegas for the day, it was totally worth stopping there. The burgers are made to perfection, so don't expect fast-food service. Our server suggested having the fries come out first as an appetizer, which was a good idea because we were starving.

_uELxZDPsdqgsXfwLzuwSw.text: Awesome!  We loved it, the food was delicious, from the tomato soup to the burger and fries.  The wait was LONG, but the food and service was worth the wait.

LFttjOmn1tL8DG1QQ_fB3g.text: I tried to eat here but I only eat low carb.  There is no low carb option so I ordered nothing and just sat there watching my companions eat.

My boyfriend was wearing a tank and basketball shorts and they didn't refuse to serve. Off to a good start already! We wanted to try something new and different and what stuck out was the duck poppers.. At first I was  skeptical about trying them but I'm so glad I did because they were bomb! OnaGk5BFy3eEzJCiVlnfrw.text: As a burger addict, I had to try GRB. Busy as heck, but they take your number and txt you when your table is ready, so you can stroll around Planet Hollywood casino until you're turn.   I like the cheese options...the 'basic' cheese on even the most basic burger is a nice Irish cheddar I like, and I had the triple cheeseburger which had a trio of fantastic cheeses. Despite being a tall burger, it did not slide apart, and was both beautiful to look at and delicious.  But the star of the show is the milkshakes. Take a milkshake, top it with a few inches of a flan/creme brulee custard, and then some whipped cream, and you've got a legendary dessert. Really amazing, and yes, very over-the-top.   I'm likely to return, if only for the milkshake. Cheers!

S1N1i5r24BBoza0mkmeBdg.text: I was so excited to try this place, and I'm so disappointed service is bad, you have to wait a long time to get your food served, we wait for almost an hour to get our burgers, the waitress forgot to give us napkins and utensils, I'll will not recommend this place! Food is just ok.

tg8VvEzxY9LL7wdzgLNH3g.text: I loved it because after living in the USA for a bunch of years, I finally found a place that I like and closer to home taste. It was just the right size and I ordered the lamb burger which had some faint Indian spices to it which I liked, not too overpowering. the buns were freshly baked right in front of us and just the  best ones I have had. Asked the server to get me a well cooked patty and got exactly that. I didn't add fries since wanted to try the shake. The brown butter Ice cream shake was very thick and yum but if you don't have a very large appetite , better find someone to share it with! Very heavy .. probably has the calories you need for an entire week. Will definitely be back when in Vegas.

yXWf6c2Y5JTP1brrCuywXA.text: My first time on the Strip. Decided to go get a burger while I was in the Planet Hollywood Mall. Ordered the Blue cheeseburger with the fries. I loved the burger but was not a fan of their special ketchup.

xbg7ssLfFrF1ZyddoKKBlw.text: Wow!!! What a perfect dinner. Everything was so delicious, the service was something else. We were a big party with kids and the server was so helpful, knowledgeable and just made the whole experience so much better. Highly recommended, worth the wait.

0cVSYyZPhigcTJCjdaxsOA.text: So can I just say I love coming here ! Every time I come to Vegas i try to stop here. I will admit that the wait to get in can be pretty long but it's totally worth the wait. The service here is always good regardless of how busy they are. When I went I order the truffle fries which are amazing and because I don't eat meat I had their portobello mushroom burger. They food is always good so I suggest stopping by here when in Vegas. Don't let the long line scare you because it's totally worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portobello burger

6U4bksuJAP_t2vckvbAPMg.text: Normally when hubby & I travel we'll dine at a steakhouse & initially planned on going to Gordon Ramsay Steak at Paris until our son & his girlfriend convinced us otherwise to get burgers. So, why not? Our visit landed us here on a Wednesday evening about 4pm & we waited 5 minutes for a table. Appetizers looked amazing- especially their Cheddar Ale soup (which I really wanted to try $9) but- it didn't offer options for different portions. If there was a cup portion- I'd be all over it. Maybe next time. I really wanted to try Bangers & mash... but, kept scoping the menu til it caught my eye- Foie Burger!! How often do your tastebuds land on this?!  Foie burger: Foie gras spread; Chevre (goat milk cheese); frisee; port wine aioli. I had to cut this burger in half- not that it was some huge gigantic thing... but, I wanted to see how it was layered. I'm neurotic this way, pardon me.  Foie gras spread on both buns- optimum juices flowed beneath burger patty! It took me a quick one to realize what caught my tastebuds attention! It was the Chevre! I really don't like goat milk- but, it wasn't slathered thick at all.... and I was actually dealing with it well enough to eat every single bite of this burger! Super proud of myself.  The order of truffle parmesan fries comes w/ 2 condiments- ketchup w/ Tabasco sauce and truffle aioli (you'll see flakes of truffle). Servers were kind enough to bring the curry AND chipotle ketchup too! That curry ketchup blew my mind! So glad these fries are steak cut!  Since we were told Gordon Ramsay liked the Innes & Gunn oak aged ale- why not?! There are notes of vanilla and toffee! Whoa! This ale was delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Merch
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Table setting
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Options

WpHVpkT-GJItfayRLrgXTg.text: This was our last meal in Vegas and it didn't disappoint. Fabulous fries, omg onion rings, and beautiful burgers...it was a hopping place for lunch on a Wednesday. We we're seated fast and our service was just as quick.

Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parmesan truffle fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beer battered onion rings

8uND70yczxufYDI-aUSkLg.text: My family and I ate at this restaurant on Friday evening. The food was to die for. I must admit we were a bit skeptical at first as we waited almost an hour in line. The hostess seated us and we waited for our food. Once the food arrived we were delighted beyond belief. Every bite was just so good and we left beyond satisfied. We will definitely return. The manager named Angel came to our table several times to check on us and made us feel at home. Funny and very nice young lad. Our server was amazing as well. We will be recommending to all of our family and friends when they travel. Gordon Ramsey lives up to the hype!!

uyHk6WwWUh1GYD2LBG53Dw.text: Top notch experience!  We came by around 8:45 on a Sunday night and ended up waiting around 10 minutes for a table for 2.   I opted for the Hells Kitchen burger and my husband had the Hog burger. When the food came, we got our Parmesan truffle fries (delicious!) and my HK burger, but they brought a Backyard Burger instead of the Hog. We have no idea if they sent it to the wrong table... but expecting no less from a Ramsay restaurant, they had to fire a new one, which finally came when I was almost done with my burger and we had already finished the fries. Our waiter apologized and let us know that they were taking the burger off the bill. The manager then came over to also express his apologies and explained the situation. He also offered us a free drink since our waiter had not offered one during the wait, so we opted for the caramel pecan milkshake (highly recommend). Management handled the situation extremely well and we would definitely come back.  My only improvements would be a greeting once you get to the front of the line..and our server could've been friendlier... but that's it!  *a photographer comes around taking your picture and will try to sell it in a cardboard frame for $10 FYI

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zW_mcA_skroyS5Ek25U_Kg.text: What A Great Tasty Burger !!! Las Vegas has so many good places to eat  But did a search for the best burger in town and Gordon Ramsay Burger was one of the top choices. With the flame burner wall surrounding the restaurant give a modern bbq torch feel.  There was a wait to be seated but not super long for a Saturday night .  We opted for the bar seating to speed up the process because we were starving. *Good Beer Selection *interesting twist on Burger Combinations  Ordered the Ultimate Cheeseburger was juicy excellent taste yummmmm!!!! Had onion rings that were amazing  And French fries came with different types of dipping sauces.  *Customer Service started of weak with the first bartender not having a good knowledge of the menu. Then a seasoned bartender took over and had that playful attitude made a fun experience.  Will be back for sure

_eL1xVbD-186rr3s_95I9w.text: Crazy expensive. - and I don't mind if it's going to be something special, something out of the ordinary but for all the fame & flash my burgers I make at home are better.   Even the kids were not impressed.  We all agreed 5 Guys is better.

wZTzhc7K7RfJIvofmKZrww.text: Very good food and service. Some of the best I've experienced in Vegas. My wife had the Farmhouse burger and I had the Hell's Kitchen and we each had half of each other's to try. The burgers were well seasoned, very flavorful and the meat was perfect. The truffle fries are a definite must and were wonderful. I normally don't give 5 stars to a restaurant, but Gordon Ramsey's was perfect.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

aD6Jep_4vGuFy8PDQtJQsw.text: Not bad for what you're getting. Quite an affordable place with pretty decent food. Expect a bit of a wait as there is a long line. I ordered the portobella burger along with the truffle fries, the fries were alright (however I loved the sauces YUM). My burger was gone within minutes, the sauces on it were amazing and had a perfect balance of vegetables. My brother ordered the creme brulee shake, which was on the pricy side ($10), but it was delicious and I'd say it was worth the try! While I wouldn't say this place was extraordinary, it's definitely worth a try.

nr2jDKEFpyjYaz5zeys-9A.text: We tried to go get burger like around at 7:30 on Wednesday night but there were an hour and half waiting so we came back at 11:30pm and waited about 7mins to get seated. Staffs are nice. A bit pricey  but of course it's on a strip and "GORDON RAMSEY'S" my uncle ordered  their most popular burger "hells kitchen burger" it was a bit spicy because has a jalapenos in it. My bf ordered forest burger which I really didnt like because of the cheese. If you're not like a stinky cheese person DONT ORDER THIS! and yeah he loves those cheese so he said it was good! And me!!!! I ordered HOG BURGER which was little different because it is a pork burger! Had pulled pork+bacon+think pork patty +fried onion +slaw +pickle. Wow. It is like a perfect combination. To be honest I'm not a burger person so I didnt expect any. But it was super duper bomb. If there's no waiting then I can come back for this pork burger!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7MdLfb9QLTJ5x5cqGti6WQ.text: Best burger I've ever had! I got the Crown Burger & my friend got the Hell's Kitchen Burger. Incredible!!! This place has great service, amazing food, is reasonably priced, and is worth the wait. My only complaint is that they don't take reservations for parties with fewer than 14 people. Otherwise this place gets a 10/10 rating. Def worth a visit when you're in Vegas!

VK6HAZIZuwytwyqxhFAU5Q.text: I was honestly underwhelmed by this restaurant.  If Gordon Ramsay had actually been here, I hope he would have sent our food back.  I don't know how a burger with bacon, egg, and cheese on it can be bland, but they managed it.  The patty itself was seriously underseasoned, which makes for a sad burger.  The fries (thick wedge-style) were also completely devoid of any salt - we actually did send these back, because they were not tasty at all.  It wasn't a good burger, and definitely not worth waiting 40 minutes in line for.

NjwB8hGu9K6zwBbev1PNyg.text: My boyfriend and I came here after the Backstreet Boys Show (so we got there around 11:30pm). My boyfriend had been here many times and raved about it. Since I had never been here before I said sure. Wait time was about 20 minutes which wasn't bad but what was bad was the wait time for our burgers. While the place was busy, there were 1-2 tables around us that didn't have anyone so it wasn't that busy. Luckily we started with the sweet potato fries which were decent. We waited about 40 minutes for our burgers. Then on top of that ridiculous wait, the avocado my boyfriend got (we put them on the side for me to be able to put on my burger), was nasty as you can see in the picture. Again if it was super packed/ busy I'd be understanding but like I said tables were empty and putting out avocado like that is nasty. Overall decor was nice, the big fluffy chairs were a plus but this isn't a place I'm going to flock to. If it was like that when it wasn't super busy, I can only imagine when it is busy. A bit disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Farmhouse burger

lQN1BDqbvVOIRYMgSsIS8g.text: First time here, will be back! Started with the burnt ends poutine, I had the brown butter caramel pecan milkshake with my meal, wife had the creme Brule shake for dessert. We both had the Ultimate Cheeseburger, add bacon. I ordered my burger medium well, wife ordered hers well. Mine was delivered well done (no pink) and hers was well over. (- 1/2 star) Still tasted great but given how busy we were and that we had already waited 45 minutes, we didn't send them back. Service was good, just took a while due to them being so busy (as we went on a Saturday night). We had our Diamond Celebration Dinner certificate, which you don't get change for of you don't use it all, so we had the appetizer, one soda, two milkshakes, two burgers (add bacon) and the truffle fries and the bill came to $92 with tax. When I asked if they could put my tip on my Caesars credit card, I was told that once the voucher was used on the bill, they couldn't ring up anything else on the ticket. I asked if they could charge me for a water to go or ring up a misc charge so that I could then give the waiter his tip on top of a separate ticket, he said no, that's against policy and I had to tip in cash. (- 1/2 star)   Also, if you have status with Caesars, the signs say to present your card for priority seating, but the placement of the sign is at the end of the long line of peoplewho have already been standing there for an hour.. You're supposed to go straight to the hostess station, present your Platinum, Diamond or Seven Seas card and they seated us within 3 minutes of us cutting the line ;-) well definitely go back, in spite of the cooking temp issues. I'll ask for medium instead of med-well.

VWEEti1_bz1Ap0WU-Kqe4g.text: Once again, the BEST BURGER IN VEGAS. The line can be long but just wait it out. The staff is great and will seat you asap. We had the new poutine fries-Oh sweet baby Jesus. Gordon loves to surprise me. I was sad that he took my Favorite gooey fries off the menu, but luckily, he left with poutine. It was delicious and we ate it all. We also had the Blue cheese burger and the Farmhouse burger. We also had a brown butter caramel pecan shake. This is one of our all time fav places in Vegas and one of the main reasons we stay at PH. I like having GR near me.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brown butter caramel pecan shake

mhKFEjI6-lez5H0rF8u0pw.text: What a disappointment. Gordon, go over to Fluer Herbert Keller's Burger bar in Mandalay Bay. They will teach you how to make a fantastic burger! Yes, it is more expensive but so worth it. Your burger was average at best, and I know. I live in Ny city surrounded by great food. Folks, trust me,    Gordon Ramsey can't shine Hubert Keller's shoe when it comes to burgers!!!

KF9WdneSto97IzDGIH86zQ.text: I am writing this review as I have been waiting since one hour for my truffle fries. Also the people right next to my table with exact truffle fries order got it after ordering 15 mins after us. No waiter has checked on is since 20 mins or so.  Eventually we got served super cold fries and we weren't able to finish neither the fries nor any of our burgers as they were cold.  Felt really bad as I hear good things.

CNj3vk_OHNLcOBKchjusnA.text: Manager Jonathan Bernal is super condescending, refuse to accommodate disability need. This in itself is a -10,  Will not take another 30 minutes out of my day to stand while suffering extreme back pain, mind you after recent surgery.  Epic fail and 1st impression of this establishment....

4WZNPvdl8RJt5-cWbGaeBw.text: $83 of disappointment. The decor of the restaurant was beautiful. The staff were nice. The food was so bad. The burgers were somehow very dry, the bun was gross. The truffle fries were soggy. I didn't even finish my food.

h_5zrpok67zC7x5PD02ZNg.text: I was disappointed in the flavor of the burgers. We ordered two brugers to spilt. One was the Hell's Kitchen Burger & the other we choose was the Blew Cheese Burger. We went on March 4th. We also got a Pecan Butter Brown Milkshakes that were mainly whip cream. Never burger tasted like the flavors of the ingredients, we ordered. Didn't taste like a spicy jalapeno burger and didn't taste the bleu cheese. The burger did look tasty and were plated nicely but I think that meal including the onion rings costed us about $65. It was not worth the hype.

tsAhmAJ65fgzwYrucewh-g.text: I was expecting much better food from this restaurant. Curry chips are garbage and so is the Mediterranean sandwich, so bland and dry.

JY78Q3siDYXhNeDdqmq-gw.text: Dude! Big fan of Gordon Ramsay so it wasn't hard for my Vegas group to stop by. We were a group of 6 and were seated within 45 minutes. Instead of waiting we went exploring the casino floor and played a bit, they later texted us when our table was ready. It was well worth the wait! The service was excellent! Attentive waiter and servers, very friendly and accommodating. The inside of the restaurant is chill, comfy chairs, big tables, and great decor. The food, well, best burger I've had all year! Juicy, fresh, looking gorgeous, and delicious! I got the Hells Kitchen burger and it was outstanding! Also, they have the best onion rings I've ever had. No competition. Get them and you'll see what I mean. Their fries were ok but their dipping sauces are quite memorable, tasty stuff! Highly recommended and can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy fries
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. These are the best onion rings I have ever had: fluffy, crispy, and delicious! The sauces are also bomb

b0RvCjF01n0-TX3o_YkXaA.text: Gordon Ramsey Burger is like a bad relationship at its end. You wait in line for an hour, with optimism as the only driving force, only to sit down at a table with RGB crayon blue and red decor, with a waiter in a Midas uniform to ask you if you would like to keep their paper menu as a souvenir. The drinks were watered down and the food overhyped. Would refer you to the Taco Bell next door.

gurzpLoPzBZ2NeQ4mwS0Iw.text: The burger was good except for the amount Gordon Ramsey gets mad on his show, I'm surprised his workers don't know what a ripe avacado is. Our burger had a hard avacado on it.

gs2eoVR1bmSFIopSYO7Atg.text: Literally best burger ever! The onion rings are SO good. Would drive 4 hours just to go there. Definitely a must when in Las Vegas!!

jjdvuI56Iqx7m3TDzNe0vA.text: We ate here tonight and was super disappointed. I asked for a burger med/well but more on the well side and it came out bright red. The waiter tried to argue with me that it was med/well when a friend next to me had a med/well with barely any pink. I'm pregnant so it is a big deal. Then it took FOREVER to get my new burger. Two friends finished their food and another waited to eat with me so hers was cold. Worst meal experience in a long time. Only reason I gave two stars instead of one is due to the fact their truffle fries were really good. Ps the burgers themselves aren't even very good.

uJoJrvUXMOuc5_bcMZPr9A.text: I can't speak for the burgers (although the people I was with did like them). I'm allergic to sesame so I figured I'd get the hot dog. I love hot dogs and I knew the burgers had sesame on the buns. However, apparently the hot dog buns did too! (I've never seen a hot dog bun with a sesame seeds). They were very understanding and took the hot dog back; however, they didn't have a seedless hot dog bun option. My two options were either the hot dog wrapped in a flatbread or in lettuce. I chose flatbread. By the time I got my hot dog, though, everyone else had finished eating, and the hot dog was just a normal hot dog. The staff was friendly though, and everyone else seemed to enjoy the burgers. I would just suggest not going there if you have a sesame allergy.

fnKbg7TPkjyLCjlkNCp7Vg.text: I have to say this was the first place where the staff is so friendly, knowledgeable & FUN not only do they have amazing food but to partner it with a great staff it's the perfect combo! We had a farmhouse burger , Parmesan fries and great service.... thank you Guy, Jade & Sioux chef Daniel Nunez for a great evening... this Houston couple will definitely be back !

cIQ7WHkT6SAGPYBcssHiUQ.text: Gordon ramsay is fucking brilliant. Enough said. There was a little bit of a wait when we went, but it was totally worth it. Got the Bleu cheeseburger and my friend got the hells kitchen burger. Along with some parmesan fries. Everything was absolutely delicious! Go if you're in town.

nZWPgU7tQsQh_qgXMLkA4g.text: I was ready to rate this place a 1 until I ate my burger. I have to admit the burgers are good. That said, the weird wait system is ridiculous.  If you are a party of 2 you get to wait in a line and 3 or more you put in a reservation and get a text when your ready. So I waited in line for 30 mins even though they quoted 15 and the line was short. It goes REALLY slow. So I'm watching a bunch of larger parties getting seated before me.  When I complain about this to the overstaffed hostess stand, they explain that they have way more two top tables. This is a flat out LIE because they put many of them together to accommodate larger parties. Then after waiting a half hour, they break down a large table at the front with the sun blaring in to make four 2-top tables and offer it to us, after I complained about the wait and larger parties going before us. The four hostesses that were working didn't have enough sense to skip that question. You would think that between the four of them, that was a bad offer. Then they went down the line to offer that.  So then we order the signature burger, but are told no substitutions. Come on Ramsey, don't be like that. Let us take off the lettuce, especially since they are little pieces.   I will admit tho, the signature burger (once we removed the lettuce ourselves) was delicious. Short ribs with rib eye, and pickled onions were to die for!!!!! The farmhouse burger was also really good.

2iABTD1boNOTpGi1yi4UwQ.text: My husband and I were in Las Vegas the week of May 15th for our 20th Anniversary.  We were hungry for a good burger (we are major foodies), so we wander in to Planet Hollywood and find Gordon Ramsey Burgr.  We cannot even explain how AWESOME our burgers (and the Parmesan fries) were.  We both got the farmhouse burger and we can both say that it was absolutely the BEST burger we have ever had.

w0Fk-jaizq-Sab78zRIVCw.text: By far the most juicy burger I've EVER eaten! Cool restaurant & we were seated quickly for being prime dinner hours! We got the Hells Kitchen burger & the Crown burger, both excellent with awesome flavors & textures. They say their most popular is the Hells Kitchen burger, but I personally liked the crown a little better! I will be going to more of Gordon Ramsey's restaurants in the future!!

M7smURxlobUxzlTtb8vVTA.text: We were seated right away so that was nice. Love the location of it so you don't get lost in the Casino looking for it! My mom and I split the Crown burger, and it was pretty good but not life changing. My Dad however had the Farmhouse burger and said it was the best burger he'd ever had. He's an old man from the South who's had a lot of burgers in his time, so that's saying something. The Truffle Fries were AMAZING. Just wow. It may be an extra add into the price but they are more then worth it. Just get them.

JKWuX9oOfHh27JpPLM14DQ.text: Everything about this place is excellent. The food, the service and the atmosphere are all top notch. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger which was great. I would only recommend if you like hot/spicy things. There is a great drink selection as well. This is probably one of the least expensive meals on the strip with this level of value.

vX9TGdJVfzJa9lALAXMpoQ.text: Had the backyard burger. It was amazing! Loved everything about it--staff was wonderful too. Cassie was our server-very good, and my other favorite was a gentleman server from michigan--sorry your name escapes me, but it was fun ribbing you about our buckeyes!!!

o6kf_rgDsmKwbVYtAg1m3A.text: The burgers were good but I have had better. The fries were stale and weren't as good as we were told. The service was decent, but we received our burgers and then our fries about 5 minutes later. I really believe the rave about this place is just because of Gordon Ramsey's popular name and because it's in The Vegas Strip.

PDZYrJzVdzSeuEmWKHIeTA.text: it sucks the waiter was horrible and mean just kidding I haven't tried it

i7H9P34q_jPUq_6RxAM77A.text: This restaurant ruined my experience in Vegas. My family and I heard of this restaurant and were told it was one of the best. When we went to eat we started off with a 50 minute line. Once we got to the cashier we were told that we would have to wait another hour and a half. After waiting for so long we just wanted some water. There was a bar right next to the cashier with a Gordon Ramsay background so we asked for water. Surprisingly the person who worked there needed an ID to give us water so my aunt showed an ID and she said that she would not give us the water until we back away from the bar, so we did. Once the table was ready we went in and ordered drinks and food. I never knew I would enjoy the drink more than the food. We ordered 3 hamburgers, 2 regular and one with no onions and to add mushrooms. We ended up getting 3 regular ones which one contained a long piece of hair which couldn't have been ours for sure and another with no mushrooms and with onions. We politely told the waitress that the order was wrong and that there are no mushrooms. She then started raising her voice saying she "sees the mushrooms inside" and we opened up the burger showing her there are none. The waitress kept saying we were wrong and wouldn't ask if she could do anything to help. We then asked her so please call the manager so we can figure this out. She started yelling at our table in front of everyone saying "your so rude no costumer ever talked to me Like that" as if we did something wrong. The manager came and heard us out and in the middle she started shaming us on how it's our fault for not being "clear." He then told her not to talk or go near us but that didn't stop her from cussing out every one of us every time she would walk by. We walked out of there not wanting to ever go back even if the meals were free.

afwRbpKfuyv_Pm8WejvEmg.text: We were looking forward to trying this place so I hate giving it two stars but the burger and fries just weren't good. I got the Hell's Kitchen burger and my husband got the Blue Cheeseburger. The patties were cooked well but there was NO flavor. It tasted like an unseasoned mash of beef and avocados. If I didn't know that there were jalapenos in there, I would never have been able to guess. I had to asked for ketchup and slathered mine in it to finish it. My husband tried mine and said his was only slightly better. I didn't try his since I don't like blue cheese so it wouldn't have been a fair assessment. The fries were the same consistency throughout, no texture on the outside. They were just slightly limp cuts of potato. The only saver of the night were the onion rings. Now those were THE BEST onion rings of my life, and I don't typically go for them. The servers were great so with that and the onion rings, I think two stars is fair. WAH, I so wish I would give a better review but that only comes with a better burger.

zrq7jlxdQ24n7vQmEav1Iw.text: We came here for a Sunday dinner, and as it was the week-end, a wait was expected.  The line actually moved fairly quickly, so it wasn't too bad. After being seated, our waitress came, and she was quite friendly.  It took about 30 minutes before we got our food - longer wait than we expected. It seemed there was a hold-up of some sort in the kitchen though because once the food started coming out, a lot of food was coming out. We had onion rings for appetizer, and it was delicious. The batter was light and crispy, and the sauces were very good.   My husband had the Hell's Kitchen Burger, medium rare, and he really enjoyed it.  I was a bit boring and got the ultimate cheeseburger, medium well (since I'm pregnant and shouldn't eat anything too rare). The waitress asked if I wanted any toppings for my burger, and among other things, I requested extra pickles on my burger. When the burgers came out, it was obvious to me that the waitress wrote down that I asked for "extra" pickles because my burger was loaded with pickles - a good sign that she listened, and the chefs made the food as ordered. While I wished I would have ordered my burger medium, it was still quite good. The cheese flavor was quite strong, but overall, a very good burger.  Perhaps it's because I'm pregnant, but the sweet pickles were delicious - I had to ask for an extra side of pickles and actually finished all of that too. The burger was quite large for me, and after eating half of the burger, I took the buns off the other half so I can finish my dinner without overstuffing myself.  Overall, great place.  If I'm in the area, I wouldn't mind coming back.

0LXMMDKFz4u3Eiz-UZ52CA.text: please try their anniversary burger.  it tastes so good.  we go to Vegas every year and it is our tradition to do this restaurant on day one.  we have been doing this 6 years in a row already

WrvA77Jnbm6GP25XPS25Qg.text: Definitely paying for the name here.  Extremely expensive and food was very disappointing.  It wasn't bad, but you have high expectations for Ramsay and the burger and fries were nothing out of the ordinary & not worth the price.  My husband and I both ordered fries because we wanted two different types.  The waitress asked if we wanted two servings, but didn't tell us that she was asking because each serving can probably feed 4 people.  Had we known that, we would have ordered only 1, especially after getting the bill and finding out the the fries were $8 & $11 each.  We had the truffle parmesan fries and regular fries, and there was not much taste difference.  They also come with different sauces, which we really didn't like.  I had the backyard burger.  Good, but not great.  My husband had the farmhouse burger, which was a mess.  It comes with a "fried egg" but it was just oozing egg yolk as he tried to eat it.  The restaurant is actually very small, and is placed at the entrance to a mall area, with two sides of the restaurant open to the shops, making it feel like a fancy food court.  I was really looking forward to this and was let down.

YnCDwX2oGnoXifvyrUUoNw.text: Food was good. More like an American sports bar feel. I'd go back but it's not a convenient location.

siOPjBjb-fQlGKQekz7W2A.text: Hands down the best burger I've ever had (and I live in NYC). I shared the Hell's Kitchen and Blue Burgers with my mom. Both had so many layers of flavor all on a well seasoned burger. We got it well done, yet it wasn't crunchy and burnt! The steak fries weren't my favorite, I prefer slimmer cut fries, but over all they were ok. My sister got a hot dog and it was literally a foot long. She ate half and still had plenty left.

xlVSJEX7ZDstdaJZBRf4bQ.text: This is my hands down favorite burger spot. Every time we make it to Vegas, we make a stop here. Well worth the money spent. The whole time I didn't have to worry about asking the waiter to refill my drink since they always had someone deliver a new Arnold Palmer when it had less than a 1/4 of a glass left. This place is exceptional on service and quality.

H38nHNPn0Tjw4Vebm1LBqw.text: Best burger place I've been too in awhile.  Second time here and it's still as amazing as the first!

jRjsWmIC09zh-GGqlCZeQg.text: For the long wait and slow service, you'd expect something truly magnificent. However I was a bit disappointed to find that this place didn't even crack my list of top burger places in America. I had the Hell's Kitchen burger and it was good, don't get me wrong, but it was just lacking the pizazz or special ingredient that it needed to take it to the next level. It didn't have as much of a kick as I had hoped for and I thought the bun that they used was definitely lacking and could've been upgraded. Then there are the truffle fries. These are the biggest waste of money ever! They are more expensive than the burger and have very little truffle taste if any. They are also cut so thick they are essentially wedges. I prefer my truffle fries thin shoe strings. If anything, I'd recommend saving your money and just going with the burger when you come here unless you have a big group and would like to share the fries otherwise it just isn't worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hell&#39;s Kitchen burger with parmesan truffle fries

LUabpc90YM1PmHh74pb5tQ.text: My sister and I just flew in, she wouldn't stop talking about how much she wanted to try out this place. I ordered the shrimp and lobster burger, my sister ordered the hells burger. The burgers were very delicious, best burger I ever had. We ordered some appetizers, the wings and fries. I would have rated this as a 5 star, but something wasn't just right. Our French fries took awhile to come out (they forgot about it) I then asked our waiter about the fries, he brings them out, took a bite out of it, It was under Fried. Some of them were cold. If I thought mc Donald's fries were better then something is wrong. I should just have ordered onion rings. The wings was good, the only bad experience I had was the fries. Therefore, this place was awesome, however, do not order the FRIES, anything else you can order but not the FRIES.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k7uuRYh1orprJejLu-SxJw.text: While in Vegas I popped into Gordon Ramsey Burger for a quick lunch. I was greeted with a smile and seated at the chef bar so I could watch the show. My waiter greeted me and was so comfortable to talk with. When asked what I was interested in I gave him the ahi tuna sliders the UK burger or chicken saltimbocca sliders. I then asked what he thought was the best burger.  TURDUCKEN BURGER it was.  Watching the kitchen prepare delicious plates was amazing. Everything coming out of that kitchen was picture perfect. Amazing Show. The sous chef ran the pass and was in complete control of everything that was presented.  Now to the burger.  With the first cut the perfectly runny yolk ran down the burger.  The mix of flavors with the turkey chopped burger with duck confit was amazing.  The bun was grilled to perfection. Service was wonderful and I normally do not finish an entire burger.... this one was finished. Gotta love Vegas. Gordon Ramsey did not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heaven
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Presentation awesome

NYMrc8pwLdfLZtOgC2AzDw.text: Well well for the first time in years I had a good f.....ing burger well flavor and cook perfect well season the fries touch my heart too I would recommend anyone if they in Vegas to try this place

rODXFyDYzMu53uaGkZ7vTg.text: I love this place. They have different burgers with separate side dishes. Tasty, juicy and just perfect. The only 2 things was the waiting on line, but then it's because people wait for this perfect burger and they only have 1 type of soup. Cheddar with ham, which was mostly cheddar and bacon with some slices of potatoes. Alittle too heavy. I recommend this place to everyone

V228GgcfbQm72UymoSqd2Q.text: Absolutely delicious! Ramsey Burger is a must stop during our trips to Vegas! They recently updated their menu which was disappointing because I wanted the Yard Burger (chicken), but it's been removed! I tried one of the other burgers which was cooked perfectly. Tons of flavor. I ordered the Parmesan Truffle fries as well and they are addicting! The service was alright. The waitress was familiar with the menu but I had to ask for refills which was frustrating.

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QgnSHeW9pyXtLvS5WCgxgQ.text: Delicious! Truffle fries were so tasty with homemade ketchup. Burger was seasoned perfectly, the pickles on it were the best I've ever had! Atmosphere was cool and clean, and I loved that you could sit at the bar and watch all the action in the kitchen. I gave four stars because our server was curt, and not nearly as attentive as she should have been. There is nothing worse than feeling like you are begging for a refill on your water. I would definitely recommend this place for the best burger I have had in Vegas!

DoG0k1c5zSOkcSzMP12Fow.text: Had the Impossible burger for the first time!  It was amazing!   I wouldn't expect anything less from GR!  I love seeing a vegetarian and vegan option at his place!  Long wait but it was worth it!

nRGL3Q4s5LqaaurzvGCIvg.text: The burger was everything what i imagined and more... I wish i lived in vegas to hace this on the regular and prices were surprisingly very reasonable

CJCtVX8xkppv_r5q-pC_cQ.text: Every time I come to Vegas I make it a point to stop by GRB, ( 5th time) the Hells Kitchen Burger is my fav, and I've never had an issue here.. until..... Monday May 29, 2017 @10pm, Waited 40mins in line, (which was to be expected since it was Memorial Day wknd)... was seated and had to wait another 15 mins to be acknowledge by anyone, or served water, finally was able to place our orders and then proceeded to wait another 38 mins for our food to come out. Burgers were suppose to be Medium rare, and they both came out over done and super dry, we had ordered fries that literally tasted like the bottom scrapped ends of sand paper, I'm giving this review 2 stars because at least the creme brulee shake was amazing. Very disappointing GRB was always one of my go to restaurants in LV. Not anymore.

7C5ElRT7p_R-XiC2Yq27gg.text: Very slow service even when not busy  They have a very large staff but slow in cooking the food. It's only burger and fries. We ordered dessert. A tart. It took 20 min for something that requires no cooking.

ygGjc7nF5kEzYpnHZ1Z37g.text: I was worried that this restaurant being owned by Chef Ramsay would not live up to his standards that I've seen on his shows.  My best friend and I were on a girls trip and I wanted to check it out.  We waited in line for 30min not too bad considering.  We both ordered a burger, with a side order of fries and onion rings.  WOW!  Burger was juicy, had a lot of flavor and cooked the way I asked.  Just observing while I was eating noticed waiters were on it.  Cleaning tables and chairs as soon as people were done eating.  A+.  If you're looking for a great burger this place will not disappoint.

qPRf5UC3TeXwfDWLtTOwrw.text: Just pay for a crappy service.. it's took forever for the food to come in and ruined my friend s birthday ..

GGo2M8kApaSQ4fKBynUq4Q.text: Excellent burgers! I had the portobello mushroom burger, and my husband got the Hell's Kitchen burger in median rare meat. We both loved it. The portobello mushroom burger amazed me again and again, the burger was with lots of layers that I've never thought of a burger can be. The truffle fried was also a great choice, it came with two sauce, one is truffle mustard (maybe, not sure), the other red sauce is made of fresh tomato and some other ingredients that we couldn't figure out. But both sauces and fries itself were delicious!

5c35aDSysbRHYF1lrpNLzA.text: A really long wait about 45-1hr. But worth it!! Burger was so delicious added truffle Fries too. It was cooked to perfection. Best burger I have ever tried coming from an enthusiast. Highly recommended :)

hrItIYNr7iZ9YSN6lpqPhQ.text: Third time dining here.  Gets better every time.  Place was PACKED, but service was quick.  Ordered a kale quinoa salad that was probably one of the best I've ever tasted.  Loved every bite and quite large too!  Will be back again.

p7lqq_Klp2b083d9DbeeAw.text: Delicious burgers and there fries are very good they get served on a metal cone very fancy but you can still walk in there in jeans very cool place and very good.

Kt78tg9vSX09VXNHQvm1Jw.text: The service is beyond amazing !! Not only is thye  service superb but the hamburgers and food quality is up too par!! I highly recommend  this place.

P1FkzIxJS3YGIMp7rTW6Vw.text: The best burger Ever! There was a bit of a lineup, but patience really paid. They were kind enough to offer to text us when our table was ready, so we didn't to have to wait in line when so much can be done around! They have a very decent wine list by the glass. The ingredients are superb, and the taste combination, truly awesome! The Hog burger was absolutely perfect, as were the other burgers chosen by my companions. They also offer a few appetizer options, but you really ought to go there for the burgers!

JLUhRIdVdE3Wkma-p7TFfg.text: This place is legit. Worth the hype, worth the wait.  The burger patty was cooked just right. It has an amazing taste and was juicy. Definitely recommended

ZznivOHVtFOin-WGlBI2Eg.text: Fabulous service, food and atmosphere!   Just might be my favorite burger joint on the LV Strip!  Gordon is a food god!

rzSXNdah5dOLC9BtXyIkLg.text: Huge GR fan , I love that man ! So of course  I had to try this place out . Being my first time here I had to order a little of everything   and it was definitely  worth it . Once seated service was great  and our waiter made awesome recommendations.  Once we got our food .. AMAZING .... jalapeno poppers ...awesome ...gooey fries...delicious!I'm not a big duck fan but it was simply amazing ...we also had the  truffle fries ...which were cooked to perfection with amazing dip...ONLY one thing ...I sent my burger back because I did order my burger medium well and it was a little over well done ..nonetheless they redeemed themselves with a Hell's Kitchen  burger cooked to perfection. Of course I'll be back because I LOVE GR!

Z2DBJgZdnvDX-HmdVpr4Mg.text: You're better off eating at Red Robin (it's cheaper and around the same quality). Poutine is absolute rubbish (it's basically just fries slathered in spicy pepper sauce). I've had better poutine from a Canadian Costco. Burger was majorly over cooked (ordered medium rare, got well done). Cheese looks and tastes like Kraft singles. For a man who has a show called "Hells Kitchen", the food here certainly came directly from hell. And I love Gordon! But the quality of food here is just atrocious. And there was cheese on the bill folder and brown crust on a "fresh" served plate. and it's basically a sports bar atmosphere. Step it up Ramsay!

YyZDUmgHYGVG6KqN7fAt6w.text: To die for! I love their burgers and their sauces. This time around we tried their Creme brulee shake. Oh yeah you better get it! It's delicious! The wait time is very long so don't wait in line hungry because you'll just starve but if your stomach can wait then go for it. This is our go to spot when we are in Vegas.

k6AtkDwqtVSyoB102JtS3A.text: I along with a couple friends thought we would try this restaurant back in March. Fortunately the wait during a busy weekend was not to bad, about fifteen minutes. Once we were seated the waiter approached the table and promptly asked if we wold like to order anything to drink. We chose not to order any alcohol and simply ordered waters and soft drinks. It was very obvious from the waiters demeanor that since we did not order any alcohol this was going a low ticket table and assumed his tip would reflect that. Never assume! The burgers were about average, good but nothing to rave about.   The little things are what made the difference. When our burgers were brought to the table they came in stages, not all together. Once we received the burgers it took about ten additional minutes for the fries to arrive. Why is the table not served together? Toward the end of the meal one of my friends finished his burger before the rest of us. His plate was clear while we were still eating. Is this common practice to start clearing the table before all the patrons are still eating. It made us feel as though they were trying to push us out the door quickly so they can get the next party seated asap. Maybe they were going to order alcohol to jack up the tab.  Overall, our expectations were much higher and under delivered from a Gordon Ramsay establishment. I've eaten at Chef Ramsay's restaurant in London a few times and always received exceptional service. I know you can't really compare fine dinning to burgers but some sort of consistency would be great.

BLxPotT86_DkxsHOggsjGQ.text: Came for lunch on Friday 25 May, and was seated at the bar. We were served by this chap who said he was filling in from another restaurant. When I asked him what's good in the menu, he said he's never eaten the food so he has no clue what to suggest. Service was slow and food came out maybe 30 minutes later. Paying the check also took a long time. Apart from the really bad service - the burger tasted good. But take note that the burger costs around $15-20 and didn't come with any sides, that's an additional $9-12. The truffle fries was pretty ordinary l, but the onion rings were much tastier.

kF1Q7efb-Qefc93ZTceoEA.text: i'm not that much of a burger junkie, but i really enjoyed my farm burger here! the patty was a blend of chuck, brisket and short rib, topped with strips of fatty duck bacon. the fried egg sat on top of a melted slice of sharp cheddar cheese, which somehow helped cut the greasiness of everything that was going on in this burger.  however, it took a freakin' long time for the food to come out. this place will teach you what being hangry is.

aKRcKuOVvHYVayxCu2WKRA.text: Every time I visit Vegas, I come here! Gordon Ramsay really nails the perfect spicy  burger  and Blue Moon combo. Great place, will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Gordon Ramsay Burger - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy  burger

wH2JK2HIAI6gZMr_DnfLqQ.text: It was just foinee. I and my friend went to Gordon Ramsay Burger couple weeks ago. it was around late lunch time and still busy. Food is just ok cuz way toooo salty. I got sandwitch and my friend got a blue cheese burgar. I also ordered sprite and server pour WATER on my sprite glass. Ok I could understand, it could be happened. The worst thing was that our server was not really friendly but only paytime(when they gave us the bill) I could see his smile. Lots of people..good music.. It is fancy casual restaurant you could try for once.

HnpA9xzbyxgapUY5uMSANw.text: The burgers are honestly amazing I've had almost every burger! And there all good. My favorite is the farmer burger. There homemade ketchup is to die for. The price is really good and the staff is really sweet and nice i recommend this place to all friends that come into town.

LezwAFdW17eJFrIovPUoMA.text: Waaayyyyy overpriced! Burger was meh, truffle fries were not real truffle, just over cooked potatoes with nothing special. 2 burgers, 2 beers, 1 fry, 1 salad =$91.  Pro tip - go to a real burger place not a crappy hotel restaurant fancied up with that jerkface dude's name on it....people should be able to yell and fuss at him by this sub par nonsense.  Highly disappointed.   Ask a real local about better burger spots cheaper.

7lm__ekM2tP8UsSeSMBktw.text: So let's see two years ago when we stayed at Planet Hollywood we ate here eight times.  And now we're back!  I love this place. I've gotten a lot of items on the menu but my favorite dishes would have to be the Hell's Kitchen burger and wings.  The burger is cooked perfectly to your specifications and doesn't come soggy like most places. The bun is crisp and goes really well.   I asked for the wings to be cooked extra crispy and naked and they came out perfectly. I recommend doing it this way so the wings aren't soggy because if the sauce is on the wings too long it'll happen.  In conclusion if your staying at Planet Hollywood do yourself a favor and come here. You won't regret it.

qbkElpch7IDdWNYN-69p5A.text: As some one else said, if you only have 2 people in your party be prepared to wait in a long line.  Other than the wait everything else was fine. I had the Hells Kitchen Burger, the meat was very tender and tasty but honestly it wasn't anything special. This place is one of those places you just have to try once. I would come back here but probably not any time soon.

-PWRDBRn0DrDyl_yRONAYA.text: Excellent service and food, well worth the 45 minute wait we had. We ordered truffle fries, hot wings and a burger that had foie gras on it, not sure what hat the name was, and it was all delicious.  Probably the best truffle fries we have ever had and the quality of the burger was top notch. I would definitely recommend this place and will be back next time we are in town.

G38Di2HSocyYxX0w7eWa-Q.text: I had one of their most expensive meal, foie gras and it was my first time trying out. The meal was extremely delicious and their sangria was on point. For those two, I paid $43 including tip/tax. The meal wasn't too fulfilling for how much I paid, but it was somewhat expected. The servers seem to discriminate me a bit early on because I was a young Asian kid, going in by myself at the bar area. They were fine later on though.

Ta2vMKK4f-1pibsB6KBkSA.text: I have had better $20 dollar burgers. I'm not a hater but I felt like every burger looked the same, with different toppings. Same bun, same everything.
